channel.title: Jobs matching “Data Analyst” - Stack Overflow Careers
channel.description: Jobs matching “Data Analyst” - Stack Overflow Careers

item.title: (Big) Data Engineer at KPN (The Hague, Netherlands)
item.description:
(Big) Data Engineer

Are you triggered by the idea of working in a dream team with other data engineers, scientists and architects delivering gamechanging (big) data & analytical solutions in a company which will ask and support you to perform and deliver impact beyond your expectations? Then we encourage you to read further.

Your job as a Data Engineer?
We are looking for an enthusiastic and creative data engineer who will help create a new chapter of Data Engineering within KPN. Together with your team, consisting of complementary skill sets across data science and engineering, you will have the opportunity to work on diverse and high impact business cases across KPN.

KPN is a data driven Telco organisation and has the ambition to lead in analytics. It is one of the most important subjects structurally discussed at Board level. KPN won this year's award for best Big Data vision at the global Information Technology conference in Las Vegas. The foundations have been laid to actively apply big data solutions to the enormous amount of rich data utilizing the tools and applications available today and exploring those of tomorrow. KPN has very highstandards with regards to privacy and security for our data and our customers. You will leverage these policies to safeguards the privacy.

As an experienced Data Engineer you will be responsible for:



  • Establishing a chapter of Data Engineering within KPN

  • ETL for analytics on Hadoop and Teradata Data Warehouse

  • Data handling and discovery for (big) data

  • Creation of analytical records to improve impact of our data scientist

  • Leverage and implement privacy and security policies

  • Create and maintain complex models

  • Give direction to the roadmap data based on value

item.title: Customer QA Test Analyst at Healthx, Inc. (Indianapolis, IN) (allows remote)
item.description:
About Us:

Healthx, headquartered in Indianapolis IN, is the healthcare industry's leading digital engagement platform for connecting payers, providers, consumers, employers and brokers. Founded in 1998, Healthx leverages its industry knowledge, influence, and relationships to deliver customized solutions to payers that are looking for differentiators in the healthcare space. Fueled by innovation, Healthx is one of the first healthcare technology companies to offer a cloud-based platform for member engagement and provider collaboration resulting in 16 million log-ins annually. Today, more than 150 healthcare payers across the United States rely on Healthx Solutions to drive greater ROI for their business. Healthx is powered by healthcare and technology experts that are passionate about member and provider engagement.

What we need:

A Customer QA Test Analyst that will ensure that portal websites developed with Healthx solutions meet both Healthx standards and customer requirements

Outcomes:

  • Understand Healthx portal standards and ensure delivered portal websites meet those standards
  • Understand customer requirements and ensure delivered portal websites meet customer requirements
  • Identify and generate test scenarios and plans from business requirements
  • Maintain high functioning relationships with customer project teams
  • Identify and escalate critical risks to key constituents
  • Create clear documentation for internal and external use, including but not limited to customized test plans, test scenarios, and issues lists for multiple concurrent implementations
  • Maintain an excellent quality standard for solutions delivered to Healthx customers

Requirements:

  • Ability to develop software application system test plans based on customer requirements
  • Ability to execute software application system test plans and assess and report results
  • Ability to effectively interact with both customer and internal project teams
  • Demonstrates knowledge of the healthcare payer industry and associated technology
  • Strong analytical skills; problem solver
  • Persistent, does not accept the status quo

Perks:

  • Excellent benefit package that includes medical, dental, life, disability and 401k benefits as well as paid vacation and holidays
  • Opportunity to work with an excellent technology team

item.title: Senior Software Engineer/Data Scientist at HERE, a Nokia company (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
About the Team


We are looking for a Software Engineer for our agile research and development team. The team is primary researching new ways to leverage insights from our location-aware big data assets into cutting edge enhancements of our existing products. The position is located in our Berlin office.


The tasks of the developer will include the following

  • Data mining, modeling, and research of big-data and map-data assets

  • Development of big-data and map-data driven prototypes and components of new and augmented products

item.title: Watson Data Scientist at AlchemyAPI, an IBM Watson Company (Denver, CO)
item.description:
Is every decision you make data-driven? Are you fueled -- not frightened -- by the advent of how data-laden our world has become? If you're turned on by the idea of harnessing some incredibly rich data assets fueled by AI enrichments, you should consider data science at IBM Watson with AlchemyAPI. We are sifting through some of the world's most interesting and diverse unstructured data sources, trying to tease out insights and trends in a meaningful way for a large cross section of our client base. If you have played with our AlchemyData News API and felt a creative spark around ways to exploit it, then we want to talk to you.


Statistics, machine learning, and data mining at scale are our bread and butter. Come help us figure out what the right questions are to ask -- and help us find the answers!

item.title: Senior/Principal Software Data Engineer at Rally Health (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Be part of a fast growing company whose primary focus is to improve and advance health and health care using modern data technologies and end-user engagement.  Rally Health is a private company of 250 employees with a major financial backing from UnitedHealth Group (with the market cap of $112B and the net income of $10B).  We have partnered with several insurance companies including UHG and other large corporations for user acquisition, clinical data feeds, and monetization.   


In this role you will be enabling analytics, data science, and business intelligence by creating infrastructure and building data services around health risks, clinical and lifestyle recommendations, and population health management and reporting.


Our technologies:  Scala, Play, Hadoop (CDH), Kafka, Spark and Spark Streaming, MongoDB


Responsibilities:



  • Create and enhance data services including recommendations, health risks, and A/B testing

  • Maintain, enhance, and optimize the data pipeline

  • Instrument new data sources

  • Support reporting and business intelligence

item.title: Global Head of Business Intelligence (m/f) - Munich, Germany at Westwing Home & Living (München, Deutschland)
item.description:
Westwing is one of the world’s fastest growing eCommerce companies: Backed by well-known investors with over EUR 179 mn. in funding, we are the leading Home & Living eCommerce company in the 15 countries we serve. Every day, we inspire more than 19 mn. members with stylish furniture and accessories from well-known brands they love. In 2014, we surpassed EUR 183 mn. in annual sales and continue to grow rapidly.


Our international team is the secret to our success. Westwing balances style expertise and creativity with a deeply data-driven business and tech mindset. We are proud to be working with inspiring colleagues who are smart, fun, ambitious and looking for the challenge to transform an industry.


To pursue our ambitious growth strategy, we are looking for a Global Head of Business Intelligence (m/f). In this position, you and your team are collecting, transforming, and analyzing data to drive business decisions across the company.


Your responsibilities will be:



  • Enabling Westwing to become the globally leading Home & Living eCommerce player by delivering the key business insights and driving strategic decisions

  • Building, integrating, and harvesting ‘Big Data’ for our company, thus enabling data-driven decisions across all aspects of our business

  • Working with leading-edge technologies and methodologies to unlock the power of our data on topics like personalization, recommendation engines, and many more

  • Being part of our global executive team, working together with leaders and teams across countries and functions

  • Leading (and growing) a world-class team reporting directly to the CMO

item.title: Software Development Engineer in Test, Data and Analytics at JW Player (New York, NY)
item.description:
Over half a billion videos are watched on a JW Player ever day.  The Data Team at JW Player is responsible for processing all of this data and making it available as meaningful metrics.  


We are looking for an experienced Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET) to join our rapidly growing Data team in our New York City headquarters. The right candidate will relish the opportunity to work with a small focused team to help implement new test processes, automation frameworks, set load/performance benchmarks, and put us on the path to a continuous integration environment.


In this role, you will:



  • Work closely with the Data Product and Engineering teams to define acceptance criteria and build detailed test plans

  • Work towards a goal of designing and implementing complete end-to-end testing of our big data systems including our RESTful Python API

  • Collaborate with the data team to understand how development changes affect ongoing automation efforts

  • Continuously look for areas to introduce and improve automated testing

  • Develop and maintain load and performance test frameworks for massive big data applications

  • Work as part of the data team using agile methodologies to help deliver quality product on schedule.

item.title: Java Developer at Gap Inc. (Erlanger, KY)
item.description:
Position Statement:  Provides the technical delivery role in the Application Delivery lifecycle from inception and solution delivery to production to production support, maintenance, and enhancement. The Software Engineer analyzes project requirements and solution design to assure that Material Handling systems are functionally appropriate, technically sound and well integrated in accordance with business user requirements, methods and standards throughout the project life cycle.



Responsibilities: 



  • Ability to design and review software for large complexity business problems or      interconnected medium complexity business problems within a project framework.

  • Ability to develop software for large complexity business problems within and across projects or within one or more systems. Lead external MHE providers in defining technical specifications and development efforts as  appropriate. Able to advise others on development of features or components.

  • Conducts development & design reviews.

  • Works with project teams, Operations, and Support teams to assure timely resolution to defects identified during the software development lifecycle.

  • Collaborates and partners with architects in recommending emerging technologies and      application solutions.

  • Able to apply best practices in the Material Handling Engineering field and have the ability to train others on these practices and standards.

  • Serves as application expert (SME) for Material Handling systems, and when defining options/alternative for proposals to meet new IT enabling opportunities.

  • Integrating Material Handling solutions in multi-channel fulfillment environments.

item.title: Data Engineer at Namely (New York, NY)
item.description: Are you obsessed with data, tools and metrics? Have you used and can you build tools to perform data extraction, transformation and loading (ETL)? Are you interested in tools that gather, store, and analyze User Metrics and Product usage? Do you love Python? We are looking for a skilled Data Engineer to contribute ideas, innovation, solutions and code to our product.

item.title: Data Engineer at Qadium (San Francisco, CA)
item.description: As a Qadium Data Engineer, you will be responsible for building data processing systems to extract meaning from the global network and machine data we collect. The software you build will scalably, quickly, and reliably extract information, then store it in ways that allow us to explore, enrich, and gain new insights from the data you've processed.  We are looking for independent, imaginative thinkers who can design scalable, reliable solutions to complex problems.

item.title: Data DevOps Engineer at Rally Health (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Be part of a fast growing company whose primary focus is to improve and advance health and health care using modern data technologies and end-user engagement.  Rally Health is a private company of 270 employees with a major financial backing from UnitedHealth Group (with the market cap of $112B and the net income of $10B).  We have partnered with several insurance companies including UHG and other large corporations for user acquisition, clinical data feeds, and monetization.   


In this role you will be enabling analytics, data science, and business intelligence by deploying and maintaining infrastructure and data services around health risks, clinical and lifestyle recommendations, and population health management and reporting.


Our technologies:  AWS, Scala, Play, Hadoop (CDH), Kafka, Spark and Spark Streaming, MongoDB, Vagrant, Jenkins, Chef

item.title: Data Scientist (Palo Alto OR Seattle) at Coupang (Palo Alto, CA)
item.description:
Coupang - Data Scientist - Palo Alto or Seattle



What if you could set the standard of how e-commerce can and should be done around the world?



Now you can at Coupang!



We are Korea’s largest online retailer and our goal is to create the next-generation e-commerce model. According to Nikesh Arora, we are “one of the fastest-growing and most disruptive Internet companies in the world.” In just 4 years, we already have over 25M devoted users and over $2.5B in annual revenue. And we are just getting started!



We just closed a whopping $1 BILLION round of funding, and we are about to undergo hypergrowth! We have offices in Seoul, Shanghai, Palo Alto, Seattle, and Ontario, CA. We are looking to double our amazing team in the U.S.!



If you want to work in a fun, challenging environment while changing how the world thinks about e-commerce, then we want to hear from you!



About the role:



You’ll get to work with the best in the industry, with many of our team members coming from Amazon, eBay, PayPal, Facebookand more! You’ll work in a collaborative and open environment where we consider ourselves a family (Check out our Family Day!). And our agile environment will enable you to rapidly innovate with the most cutting edge technologies.



What you’ll do:


You’ll be faced with unique challenges to scale we aim to grow to more than 55M+ users in Korea alone. You’ll also get to push the envelope of what’s possible with mobile commerce (currently over 75% of our sales are done on mobile)!



Some specific things you’ll work on:



  • Build cutting-edge machine learning models to proactively provide strategic recommendations to business partners that can drive effective impact

  • Conduct in-depth data analyses to drive and deliver insights to help business partners make strategic decision

  • Partner with different functional teams, leveraging various tools to automate models and reports

  • Cares deeply about data quality and demonstrates this commitment by attention to quality of data and code generated

item.title: Software Developer at Caerus Associates (Arlington, VA)
item.description:
Caerus Associates is seeking a software developer to help design, build, test, implement, and monitor real-time data processing pipelines at USG customer sites. You will work with other developers as well as data scientists to scale and refine developed algorithms/data processing methods for speed and accuracy on large amounts of streaming data. Candidates should be able to work effectively independently, in distributed teams, and engage with clients. Our architecture is built around MongoDB, RabbitMQ, Redis, and Spark, with most of our code written in Python.


Qualified candidates must possess an active TS/SCI.


Must be a U.S. citizen.


Illustrative responsibilities



  • Deploy software solutions to end-users

  • Integrate real-time data feeds into processing pipelines

  • Rapid prototyping of user-facing applications

  • Assess and make/implement recommendations to improve existing architecture

  • Provide excellent customer service and client satisfaction

  • Interface directly with clients and coordinate work across company team, including documenting team progress and identifying risks/obstacles

  • Complete other tasks as assigned


Salary Range


$95,000 to $130,000, dependent upon experience

item.title: Senior Security Engineer at Clover Health (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
We are looking for a Senior Security Engineer to join our team. You'll be part of a team building applications and services to support our medical team, with opportunities to touch a wide range of technology. Securing our member data and exceeding industry compliance standards is a high priority, and we’re looking to add a security focus to our engineering team. You’ll work with the rest of the engineering team to establish security policies and best practices for our systems. We value moving fast, but we do so with a pragmatic approach that will allow us to sustain velocity over time.


Healthcare experience not required.

item.title: Sr. Software Engineer, Data at HookLogic, Inc. (New York, NY)
item.description:
HookLogic Engineers develop proprietary software platforms used by the world’s largest e-commerce retailers. Our engineering team consists of talented, team-oriented individuals who are empowered to take advantage of the latest cloud and distributed technologies to deliver reliable, high-throughput applications. Our core languages are Java and C# and we commonly utilize technologies and platforms such as RESTful services, jQuery, SQL Server, Hadoop, Hive, HBase, Storm, Spark, and AWS Services such as Kinesis, DynamoDB, Redshift, Lamda, and SQS. 


As a Data Engineer, you’ll employ your skills on a daily basis to design and build data processing and storage applications to handle millions of transactions per day. You will analyze business requirements and consult with the broader team to ensure successful processing, storage and reporting of our Big Data. You’ll have a wide variety of languages and technologies at your disposal that you can use to solve problems. Your work will directly shape and create our data architecture to ultimately deliver systems that stand up to unpredictable environments at massive scale.

item.title: Software Engineer - Intermediate Level at M3D LLC (Fulton, MD)
item.description:
Job Description





Here at M3D we value the creativity of our employees and promote free-thinking. We provide our programmers with flexible schedules, and have a large diversity of projects. 



Active Projects:



  • Graphics programing (User interface)

  • Data Processing

  • Control Systems

  • Production automation support software

item.title: Software Engineer / UI Developer at TGS Management Company (Irvine, CA)
item.description:
We're searching for a talented programmer with a particular interest in writing software, creating and maintaining user interfaces, and interacting with data. The ability to write production ready code is an important part of the equation, but to be successful in an environment as complex as ours, you'll also have to demonstrate an ability to solve novel problems and learn new things at speed. 


You'll find this opportunity particularly appealing if you enjoy working with smart people in a collaborative environment, have general expertise in software / UI development, and are willing to dive into any kind of programming challenge. Possible areas of focus are likely to include:



  • Design, development, and maintenance of monitoring tools, including user interfaces, to analyze data from all aspects of our existing system(s).

  • Development and maintenance of complex software and systems, including identification of bottlenecks and optimization of performance.

  • Parsing, processing, and analyzing large financial data sets, including writing complex queries.

  • Building, adapting, and maintaining user-friendly interfaces.

item.title: Product Marketing Manager - Platform at New Relic (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
New Relic  



Product Marketing Manager - Platform



San Francisco, CA or Portland, OR  


Want to join a fast-paced, rapidly growing SaaS company that’s disrupting a multi-billion dollar industry? That’s what we’re doing here each day at New Relic. We are the leading software analytics company, delivering out of this world experiences to our customers through our SaaS-delivered Software Analytics Platform.


We thrive on providing products that help software developers, IT Operations, DevOps teams, and application owners drive better software application performance, customer experience and business outcomes.


We are looking for a world class Product Marketing Manager to join our Product Marketing team, leading outbound product marketing activities specifically for our multitenant SaaS platform - Insights, that underpins all our products. Insights includes a highly scalable cloud database, alerting, dashboards, and API gateways, all built on an supercluster capable of ingesting billions of events and querying trillions of events in less than a second. It’s an amazing set of technologies that needs a product marketer to crystallize its positioning and drive its market awareness.


In this role you will own product & competitive positioning, sales enablement, customer development, market analysis, product launches, and more for our New Relic Software Analytics Platform.  


The ideal candidate will have significant experience as a product marketing, product management, sales engineering, customer support and/or training professional at a software analytics, business intelligence, or monitoring company targeting technical and business buyers.  


Key Responsibilities



  • Develop positioning and messaging that resonates with our Software Analytics Platform’s audience: IT Operations, developers, security teams, and product owners

  • Enable the sales force by developing collateral and providing training

  • Develop marketing collateral: datasheets, eBooks, whitepapers, customer success stories, presentations, etc.

  • Perform market and competitive research and analysis

  • Plan and manage product launch activities

  • Work with product management and engineering to define product roadmap

  • Present at tradeshows and conferences


Requirements 



  • 6+ years working in product marketing, product management, sales engineering, customer support and/or training professional at cloud, Big Data, software monitoring and/or security companies

  • Experience positioning technical products to both technical and business buyers

  • Demonstrated ability to distill simple positioning from complex products

  • Technical depth and curiosity balanced with a strong business acumen

  • Familiarity with the Big Data, cloud and security infrastructure market landscapes, including Hadoop, databases, identity management, firewalls, cryptographic software and cloud infrastructure

  • Experience working effectively across marketing and sales organizations

  • Excellent oral and written communication skills


A little about us:


New Relic is a software analytics company that, on behalf of our customers, makes sense of billions of metrics about millions of applications, all in real time. Our comprehensive SaaS-based solution for web and mobile applications consolidates the performance monitoring data into a single, powerful interface. Our customers use New Relic every day to optimize millions of applications.


New Relic is a San Francisco Best Places to Work award winner, an Oregon “Top Workplace” award winner, named a leader in the Gartner’s 2013 & 2014 “Magic Quadrant” for APM companies, a Top 100 OnDemand Company, Best of SaaS (THINKStrategies), Top 100 Coolest Cloud Computing (CRN); 10 Cloud Management Companies to Watch (NetworkWorld) – the list of accolades goes on. More important than all of that: we provide challenging work, opportunities to learn, high quality teammates, a standard-setting product, and a company on the move.


Our office is in the tech-rich urban center of San Francisco, with easy commute access and a plethora of good eats. We provide competitive compensation, equity and big-company benefits (medical, dental, etc) -- all while maintaining the energy, agility, and fun of a start-up. We can help with relocation and are open to H1-B transfers.


New Relic is most decidedly an equal opportunity employer. We eagerly seek applicants of diverse background and hire without regard to race, color, gender, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, individuals with disabilities, age, sexual orientation, protected veterans, or any other characteristic protected by law. Note: Our stewardship of the data of many thousands of customers means that a criminal background check is required to join New Relic.  We will, nonetheless, consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records in accord with applicable law, including the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.


To get started, click on the link below. To fast track your application, let us know in your cover letter why this job, product, and/or company is of particular interest to you. We look forward to talking!



#LI-CV1


Apply Here


PI91802474

item.title: Quality Data Analyst at Wisconsin Hospital Association (Fitchburg, WI)
item.description: This position performs analysis of clinical, quality process and outcome measures associated with healthcare improvement projects.  Works with project staff to design and execute databases to maximize functionality and access to data and reports.  Work with Chief Quality Officer and Quality staff to develop various ad hoc reports.  Assist WHA members with understanding their data.  Develop processes to ensure the integrity of data and accuracy of reports.

item.title: Data Quality Analyst at Sainsbury's (London, UK)
item.description:
Digital & Technology at Sainsbury’s has never been more exciting. Our brand new centre of excellence in Holborn is crafting world-class apps and services to revolutionise retail. Ambition knows no bounds here and we’re recruiting some of the most talented colleagues around to make sure we reach our amazing potential.


Our customer data will be more incisive and more accurate than ever before, thanks to you. As a Data Quality Analyst, you’ll offer real expertise to our Customer Insights and Customer Analytics teams. Not to mention developing the ‘single customer view’ as part of our Helios project.


As a Data Quality Analyst you’ll:



  • Be responsible for the quality of customer data – ensuring everything from accuracy to time management

  • Manage the process that allow us to load and transform third party data as well as other ad-hoc data processing requests

  • Vigilantly investigate poor data quality and anomalies while also resolving customer and product data quality issues

  • Work with Customer Analytics to derive new data for the marketing database using SAS

  • Offer outstanding support to the Customer Data Senior Business Analyst on other projects when needed


You’ll need:



  • SAS or SQL programming experience for data manipulation

  • A background working with large volumes of customer and transactional data

  • In-depth understanding of how the Data Protection Act applies to consumer marketing

  • Excellent MS Office skills, especially in Excel

  • A relentless approach to throwing yourself into your work with little supervision and the networking and communication skills to support it


As a level C4 colleague, you can expect:



  • Car loan up to £10,000 or season ticket loan on public transport

  • 10% discount at all Sainsbury’s stores and online shopping

  • Sainsbury’s 7.5% Retirement Pension Plan

  • Bonus scheme enabling you to earn an extra annual payment of up to 10% of basic salary

item.title: Data Analyst / Report Developer at stratton (Port Melbourne, Australia)
item.description:
Do you live and breathe data, and are you excited about the possibility of using your skills to become a key member of a fast growing Australian company? If this sounds like you, then you want to work for us.


We need a senior data analyst who can help drive the next phase of growth for our business. In this role you will be responsible for planning, implementing and managing all aspects of our data-driven strategy. We have a suite of in-house developed software and access to large volumes of website data collected since the company's inception. You will closely work with all of our departments including software, marketing and sales with the view of upgrading our data reporting and analytic capabilities and advising on strategies for optimising growth within the organisation.


We are a business that defines itself through the smart and efficient use of technology. We may be a finance company, but we’re nothing like other finance companies; no stuffy old bankers, no bean-counters, and no corporate bureaucracy – just a dynamic, fast-growing business with a passion for the cutting edge. We’re successful because we disrupted our industry 12 years ago and continue to do so today - we do things differently, and our information technology team plays a critical role in our success.


Whether you have many years experience and are now looking for a new challenge or an intermediate data analyst ready to take the next step in your career, if you’re smart, driven, enjoy a challenge – and most importantly, love data – then we want to hear from you.

item.title: Data Analyst at MillimanMAX (Cambridge, MA)
item.description:
We are looking for an individual who has the skills and drive to help our data scientists go faster by handling the responsibilities of profiling complex datasets, by identifying inefficiencies and rectifying them, by reconciling and mapping datasets, and by interacting with clients around data related subjects when the need presents itself. You will exist at the intersection of databases, software and modeling – you’re a generalist. You will have the unique opportunity to grow with the company from the ground up in a fun and challenging work environment. This role may also potentially serve as a bridge for candidates seeking training in data science and ultimately desiring a transition to a data science role. The analyst position will be a crash course in anything and everything related to the field.


Candidate profile:



  • This is an entry level role – we are looking for recent BS grads (CS, Math and Stats majors preferred)

  • Prior work with SQL, MATLAB or modeling not necessary but experience is a plus

  • You need to be a good detective, eager and willing to learn about a range of topics -- whatever is thrown your way.

  • ABOVE ALL: You need to be independent, resourceful and creative.

item.title: Data & Reporting Analyst for Non-Profit - Raise the bar of Afterschool Programs at Boys & Girls Harbor (New York, NY)
item.description:
Interested in making a measurable difference in the lives of children?  Join the Boys & Girls Harbor team on its mission to empower children and their families to become full, productive participants in society through education, cultural enrichment, and social services.  Boys and Girls Harbor is a leader in arts-infused education offering programming in early education, afterschool programming and performing arts.


We are seeking a dynamic Data & Reporting Analyst to deliver data driven insights to enhance the quality of our programs and services.  In this role you will serve as a data analytics and business intelligence expert by deploying and maintaining infrastructure and data services around educational program recommendations and reporting. 


What You Will Do



  • Define and implement a new data strategy, data store, and tools to collect data for ongoing analysis

  • Interface with business users and technical teams to bridge the gap in terms of data needs and business logic understanding 

  • Develop internal and external business metrics and reports

  • Develop dashboards, visualizations and manage data requests related to key performance goals

  • Explore data and provide insights, working closely with program teams to identify opportunities to optimize revenue and growth potential

  • Be the champion for sharing data across the organization and actively present findings

item.title: Data Analyst at BAE Systems (Portsmouth, UK)
item.description:
Would you like to be a part of the nation’s most complex and high profile marine projects? We currently have vacancies for Data Analysts to work across a number of Fleet Services projects, where you will be given unique exposure to programmes such as the Type 45 destroyers, the Type 26 frigates, and the Queen Elizabeth aircraft carriers.


As a Data Analyst, you will be analysing business data and investigating interesting insights and correlations. You will work to help us improve our diagnostic and prognostics capability for a range of equipment and services, through analysing this data.


This role will offer excellent opportunities to grow and develop a new team within the business, with the potential for excellent career progression. You will also have the chance to become one of the only defence industry experts, through developing specialist knowledge within a specific area of the business.


Your main responsibilities as a Data Analyst will involve: 


Analysing data from within the business, from vibration sensitivity on ships to HR and finance information


Using data to create predictions and turn this into business insight


Research and implement new tools and new data


Writing reports and presenting information


Creating insights, theoretical testing and metrics

item.title: Senior Data Analyst - Data Conversions Manager at Fidelity (Cary, NC)
item.description:
The Workplace Investing Data conversion and Implementation team is looking for a Data Conversion Analyst in our Stock Plan Services (SPS) organization. SPS provides public companies with the expertise and convenience of a single provider to administer their equity compensation programs across a range of vehicles, including: Employee Stock Purchase Plans, Restricted Stock Awards/Units, Stock Option Plans, and Stock Appreciation Rights.


This position is a data-centric role that is looking for a detail-oriented Analyst to help manage multiple projects within our Data Conversions team. This role will be a client-facing position that interacts with multiple clients outside of the Fidelity organization, so a service-minded individual is a must! if you enjoy working with people and problem-solving this role could be a great fit. The candidate must be highly organized and should be able to move seamlessly between multiple implementations and ever-changing client requirements.


Primary Responsibilities



  • Organize and conduct data conversion project status meetings, including communicating status to internal project management, Fidelity business partners, outside vendors and clients

  • Maintain detailed project plan, issues and action items list throughout the implementation, while documenting requirements and addressing operation process issues to accomplish business objectives; and determining required changes and their impact

  • Provide input and suggestions into process improvements and discretionary projects

  • Build strong partnerships with client and third party vendors

  • Communicate project status and technology issues to sponsors stakeholders and senior management

  • Collaborate with each other WI management teams and business partners to share approaches, develop solutions, and improve capabilities to successfully deliver projects

item.title: Data Engineer at Earnest Research (New York, NY)
item.description:
Passion for data: Data is what drives this group. Our Data Science team works very closely with various data sources. The ideal candidate should have a passion to mine data and derive insights. This position requires a highly motivated problem solver with strong analytical ability and attention to detail to enable the data analysts and data scientists.


Responsibilities


• Analyzing data to identify gaps and inconsistencies in data
• Perform extraction and transformation of unstructured data from various data sources
• Improving our platform with additional innovations and algorithms
• Working with the Data Analysis team to generate reports and analysis
• Ensuring data consistency and integrity within the data warehouse
• Exploring new opportunities to leverage new and existing data sets
• Providing support to our existing processes and tools
• Researching and assesses the viability of new processing and data storage technologies

item.title: Online Forecasting & Optimisation Analyst at Sainsbury's (London, UK)
item.description:
There’s never been a more exciting time for Online at Sainsbury’s. We’re investing heavily in digital innovation, building a centre of excellence here in Holborn to craft industry-leading methodologies that will produce world-class apps and services. The team is growing rapidly and we’re now looking for an Online Forecasting & Optimisation Analyst to join us.


Responsible for using big data to deliver a real step change in how we understand customers and operational metrics across our Online business. It’s about applying statistical methodology expertise to provide insights and forecasts that will enable us to achieve double-digit sales growth. That means developing demand forecasting systems and figuring out how our customers interact with the Online channel.


As an Online Forecasting & Optimisation Analyst, you’ll:
• Build reusable, mathematical models promoting insight and understanding
• Forecast Online growth
• Use your understanding of complex business problems to analyse and combine large datasets
• Advise on just how detailed our data used to inform business decisions should be
• Communicate complex models to a non-technical audience

item.title: TECHNICAL BUSINESS ANALYST at GroupeSTAHL (Sterling Heights, MI)
item.description:
Position Summary



The Technical Business Analyst collects, documents, and maintains the authoritative list of requirements for all development efforts.  The Technical Business Analyst is accountable for the functional design and adherence to corporate software development methodologies, as well as coordination across all technical resources throughout the lifecycle of a software development project.  Secondary responsibilities include creation and maintenance of various types of documents, testing support and assisting in project management/delivery activities. The Technical Business Analyst drives the collaboration with business area(s), IS, and technology to ensure that requirements are gathered and communicated effectively in order to meet the clearly defined system objectives.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities


- Responsible for defining and managing the scope of Business Systems projects.


- Track projects, timelines and ensures execution of the Technology Projects.


- Defines functional, usability, reliability, performance and support QA requirements of a system.


- Creates and performs feature testing and determines environmental needs.


- Provides the link between the technical and business views of the system by ensuring that the technical solutions being developed will satisfy the needs of the business.


- Partners with business, architecture and infrastructure and oversees all service levels to ensure business area satisfaction.


- Defines development strategy, standards and support tools.


- Proactively works with stakeholders to identify future system opportunities and enhancements.

item.title: IT Security Analyst at NTT Com Security (Göteborg, Sverige)
item.description:
Do you have a real passion for IT Security?


When working as an IT Security Analyst you will conduct real-time monitoring and analysis of security threats against our customers IT and information systems. You will work in a Security Operations Centre where you will receive, interpret and analyse alerts from security devices like IDS and IPS, based on network packet captures, firewall logs, application logs, network flow data and other relevant sources.


NTT COM Security offers customers 24/7 real-time security monitoring, and therefore, as a Security Analyst you will be required to work as part of a shift pattern.


NTT Com Security is part of NTT Communications Group – one of the world’s largest ICT companies; We have a growing, global customer base which includes many of the world’s largest companies across all industry sectors. We have 24 offices across 12 countries, enabling us to apply local understanding to global challenges.


As an IT Security Analyst you’ll:


>        In real-time receive and analyses alarms from intrusion detection and other systems


>        Conducting analysis of logs from a wide range of systems, such as firewalls and applications, to detect various types of IT-related threats


>        Alerting and assist customers when incidents occur


>        Follow the changing threat picture


>        Report Writing

item.title: Messaging Migration Engineer at bluesource (Grapevine, TX)
item.description:
The Messaging Migration Engineer develops migration tools and reporting systems for bluesource’s Data Migrations team.  The team takes data from a variety of source email and IM archiving systems, including those developed by Symantec, EMC, HP, Microsoft, and pushes it into an alternative platform that our customers want to move to. Target platforms may include Cloud systems like EV.Cloud and Office 365. Often these systems do not have public APIs, and will require out-of-the-box problem solving and innovation. In this position you will have a critical role in the future of the migration processes, and designing automated toolsets that will enable us to deliver the work for customers more rapidly and accurately, while supporting the expansion and success of a fast growing team.


General Duties and Responsibilities:



  • Develop and maintain a data migration and reporting toolset to migrate data between a variety of data archiving platforms.

  • Gather and document requirements from the Data Migrations Manager and Data Migrations Analysts to extend and improve the data migration toolset.

  • Assist the Data Migrations team with project tasks as required, and to dogfood the toolset.

  • Manage time efficiently, work with minimal supervision

  • Document tools and train analysts to use them

item.title: Business Intelligence Analyst at Sainsbury's (London, UK)
item.description:
Sainsbury’s, one of the UK’s largest retailers is investing heavily in digital innovation - its aim being to build a centre of excellence where digital output is shaped using leading best practice frameworks and methodologies to produce the world class apps and services. The team is growing rapidly and looking for talented colleagues to help deliver ambitious and market leading services that live up to Sainsbury’s industry leading reputation.



We are looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst to work as part of the BI team, transforming our data and analytics capabilities. That means providing our colleagues with as little as three clicks and 30 seconds to access information, three minutes to insight and a real focus on driving actions to deliver value to the business.



As a BI Analyst, you’ll:



  • Assist the business with their questions/ challenges by building custom scripts, analysis, analytics and insight (using tools such as SAS, R, Python, Tableau, MS-SQL, D3)

  • Provide statistical analysis, build analytical models, handle data and reporting and deliver visualizations in the form of interactive dashboards

  • Work on multiple projects relating to BI and Analytics, working both cross functionally and independently

  • Show a genuine interest in new technologies and tools for analytics purposes, trying out new tools and approaches through hackathons, data drives and POCs

item.title: Senior Business Systems Analyst (Must have strong Salesforce.com experience) at CDK Global (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
CDK Global is seeking at Business Operations Analyst


POSITION SUMMARY


The Business Systems Analyst III provides advanced level of expertise in identifying, driving, developing and/or deploying technical systems and/or reporting solutions within the Services group. Associate is responsible for independently conducting the analysis of business issues and requests that require the creation, updating and/or enhancements to Services business systems and/or reporting solutions.


This person will apply their strong knowledge of established Services business processes to recommend appropriate solutions that help solve the identified business need(s). The BSA utilizes advanced knowledge of Salesforce, SQL, Tableau, and/or other applicable tools, technology, and business systems to perform gap analysis, document business requirements, recommend solutions, identify level of effort and deliver on complex business-critical projects. You will work directly with business and technology stakeholders, Services program management and supporting resources to identify and recommend appropriate technical solutions.


The Business Systems Analyst performs configuration and testing of agreed upon solutions as assigned. You will provide expert level of technical and business expertise to other team members including solution analysis, quality review and testing of developed solutions.


The Business Systems Analyst actively participates in business strategy discussions relating to new functionality, system solutions or other broadly scoped initiatives as assigned.


PRINCIPAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Business Analysis: Plans, conducts, and documents analysis efforts associated with assigned business processes and issues or initiatives that require creation of new and/or updating of existing business systems, tools and/or critical business processes. This includes managing business process review (BPR) sessions with stakeholders, documenting business requirements, providing relevant solution options and creation of functional specifications and use-cases to support any associated business system configuration or development efforts.

  • Systems/Application Support and Administration: Provides expert level of systems support, maintenance and administration for assigned systems.This includesadministration and configuration associated with assigned database, CRM, telephony or related applications and tools to ensure alignment with the requirements of the business. Provide subject matter expert to team members and stakeholders on assigned systems and other business-critical applications.

  • Reporting Development and Data Analysis. Develops, executes, and maintains assigned datasets, reports and data mining efforts specific to all core business systems supported by the Services Operations team. This includes performing expert level data and impact analysis on assigned metrics, business processes and systems to ensure accuracy and relevance to Services initiatives and business priorities.


KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES



  • Proven track record of researching and analyzing complex technical issues and then summarizing them via table, graphs, and written analysis

  • Strong verbal and interpersonal skills; exceptional writing skills demonstrated by delivering clear, correct and timely communications and effectively working with others.

  • Ability to analyze complex data or systems issues and to provide actionable recommendations to impacted teams based on the analysis

  • Ability to analyze complex business processes and identify efficiency opportunities and/or solutions to resolve process gaps or related business challenges

  • Identify, develop and document requirements that clearly support and communicate needs to Services stakeholders, IT and supporting teams

  • Ability to effectively present analysis and data findings to wide range of technical and non-technical audiences

  • Detail oriented with excellent time management and organizational skills to meet critical deadline

  • Ability to interface effectively with multiple functions/organizations and all levels of management.

  • Ability to design solutions that anticipate areas of contention and are adaptable to future changes

  • Strong data and problem solving ability

  • Ability to analyze, test and document solutions to ensure business requirements have been satisfied

  • Ability to administer data warehouse systems and other assigned systems/tools

  • Ability to effectively troubleshoot data inaccuracies, identify root causes, and take corrective action

  • Ability to effectively mentor and train associates within job family


PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS & WORK ENVIRONMENT


Duties are performed in an office environment while sitting at a desk or computer table. Duties require the manual ability to utilize a computer keyboard and the ability to read printed material. Duties may require the ability to travel via automobile or airplane. Duties may require being on call periodically and working outside of normal working hours (holidays, evenings and weekends).

item.title: Report Developer/Product Analyst at Spoonflower (Durham, NC)
item.description:
If you haven’t heard yet, Spoonflower is an e-commerce-based business that makes it possible for individuals to design, print and sell their own fabric, wallpaper, or gift wrap.  Printed to order, no quantity is too small or too large. We digitally print all of our fabric at our  facility in Durham, North Carolina.  We love what we do.  Surface design aficionados, fabric lovers, internet geeks, DIYers, designers, sewists, and quilters call it home.



As a Report Developer/Product Analyst within our Product Development department, we will look to you to collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather, analyze and document reporting requirements to meet business needs.  The Report Developer is expected to translate business requirements into specifications that will be used to implement the required reports and dashboards, potentially created from multiple data sources.  Our reporting environment is a custom web application with Ruby on Rails, DataTables.net, Google Visualization, D3, and other components. If you have full stack development experience, but you favor writing complex SQL over all other disciplines in the stack, we are looking for you.


Job Responsibilities:



  • Write and understand complex SQL routines that perform well on large volumes of data

  • Use data mining, segmentation, and other analytical techniques to capture important trends

  • Demonstrate expertise in data extraction, transformation and loading (ETL) between similar and dissimilar systems using SQL Programming

  • Demonstrate expertise of data transformation between flat files, XML and relational system structures

  • Employ analytic skills to create hypotheses and share stories about what the data is telling us

item.title: Quality Assurance Analyst at Investors Economic Assurance, LLC (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Quality Assurance Analyst is responsible for the quality of the CapAssure® platform and delivery of theCapAdministrationSM  service.



  • Develop and maintain subject matter expertise for application and business

  • Work closely with both the business and development team

  • Author system specifications and documentation based on business requirements

  • Develop and document a product test plan strategy based on system requirements

  • Create data and develop test cases to enable end-to-end verification of accounting and financial workflows

  • Record and document results from test cases and compare to expected results

  • Develop tools or prototypes to facilitate and automate software testing from a system’s and data perspective

  • Perform setup and configuration tasks of client dedicated SaaS platform

  • Maintain consistency between multiple environments

  • Document and investigate client reported software defects or issues

  • Conduct root-cause analysis for client operational and transactional data

  • Assist the project management team with software release planning

item.title: Computer Security Engineer / Analyst at Roka Security (Herndon, VA)
item.description:
Roka Security is a growing team of security, Linux, and network engineers, looking for the next member of our team. We work on incredible projects, including; securing complex networks, system and network performance tuning, physical server deployments at data centers around the world, disaster recovery, and working with customer teams to design highly scalable network architectures.


Our customers have the highest security and availability requirements. As a result, Roka Security strives to constantly improve our knowledge, technology and processes. There is always room for improvement, which is why we need you!


Security Engineers and Analysts


Roka Security is seeking Computer Security Engineers and Analysts of all experience levels (including management) to be part of our growing team.  We are looking for out of the box thinkers who will help expand our capabilities and deliver high value solutions to our customers.  The primary areas of focus for this position will be :



  • Incident Response support

  • Log Analysis

  • IDS / IPS - design, deployment, management, and analysis

  • Centralized logging systems - design, deployment, management and client usability

  • Vulnerability Assessments support

  • Penetration Testing support

  • Secure Networks - design, deployment, management, and analysis


Benefits



  • Competitive Compensation

  • Medical and Dental

  • Life Insurance

  • Paid Vacation

  • Relaxed, professional environment

  • Flexible Work Schedule

  • 401k with company matching and vested on 1st day

item.title: Data Associate Refining and Chemicals at Wood Mackenzie (London, UK)
item.description:
Our expertise in the refining and chemicals sectors is driven from our unique databases, economic models and forecasts. We provide comprehensive asset and company valuations, in-depth market analysis and insight into key issues. This objective research helps companies around the world to identify, evaluate and rank growth opportunities.


Role Purpose


This role is in the EMEARC Refining and Chemicals team. The successful candidate will be responsible for the team's data from end to end; assisting Research Analysts with tasks ranging from data sourcing to building VBA/SQL solutions and the population and production of the team's research products, ensuring data integrity at all times and with a view to delivering workflow process efficiencies wherever possible.


Main Responsibilities


• Primary ownership of the team's data
• Collect and compile industry data from both external and internal Wood Mackenzie sources into team spreadsheets and then into the Wood Mackenzie database
• Create and maintain automated processes involving databases, spreadsheets and web sites
• Create and prepare datasets for data visualisation solutions such as Spotfire.
• Maintain data quality and integrity, revising as necessary, and maintaining audit records of base data and subsequent revision for all Refining and Chemicals teams
• Produce reports and data queries as required by the team
• Collect and compile data using feeds from both external and internal Wood Mackenzie sources using Kapow Software
• Contribute to the effort of synchronising all web scraping, forecasting and reporting platforms across Markets teams
• Create and maintain data links to mapping interfaces and implement edits to and maintain the currency of the regional maps where relevant
• Prepare charts and tables for publication/presentation and assist with publishing research to the Wood Mackenzie client website
• Devise and implement data gathering and storage protocols to minimise business risk and maximise operational efficiency
• Support data gathering and processing activities to support consulting engagements as appropriate
• Understand and interact with other Wood Mackenzie teams by developing relationships with wider Data and Operations Analyst community

item.title: Technical Data Analyst at INRIX (Kirkland, WA)
item.description:
INRIX is data driven. We are passionate about using platform data to examine the quality of our product and to continually improve on it. We are seeking a Technical Data Analyst to join our engineering team. This role will be a focused on both internal processes and external output. 


We are seeking a Technical Data Analyst who is passionate about working with and analyzing big data to drive insights across complex questions in order to drive enhanced customer experience with data-driven decisions. Technical aptitude and programming skills are of high value in this role. The role requires testing and interactively improving on system output with the primary goal of providing a world class customer experience.

item.title: Full Stack Lead Developer at CNAG-CRG (El Prat de Llobregat, España)
item.description:
CNAG-CRG is looking for a full-stack developer to lead the design, development and  maintenance of the LIMS. He/she will be expected to develop the database backend and front-end using a mix of languages and  tools to process and display the data.


The developer will report to the Production Bioinformatics Manager and will work closely with other  software engineers at the CNAG and will interact with the laboratory, data analysts and researchers and tools to process and display the data.


Application procedure:
Interested candidates should submit a CV and a brief statement of experience and interests before September 30th 2015 to both an email address below, indicating the offer reference in the message subject: info@cnag.crg.eu and recruitment portal through the following link: http://www.crg.eu/content/jobs/cnag-jobs.

item.title: Devops Engineer at Earnest Research (New York, NY) (allows remote)
item.description:
Passion for data: Data is what drives this company. As a part of the group, you will be immersed in a fast-paced environment, with an infinite amount of opportunity to learn and grow. Within the engineering team, the candidate will be exposed to the technical challenges associated with big data and cloud distributed systems.


Responsibilities


• Manage our cloud infrastructure on AWS
• Implement and enforce security and privacy guidelines
• Design, manage, and maintain tools to automate ETL and Data Transformation processes
• Work closely with the Data Engineering and Data Analyst teams on enhancements to our platform
• Implement alerting tools and metrics to track system performance and availability
• Provide support to our existing processes and tools
• Contribute to the creation of system support documents such as run books
• Contribute in research and evaluation new technologies for use
• Help build out our team through hiring and evaluating candidates

item.title: Senior Front-End Engineer at Looker Data Sciences (Santa Cruz, CA)
item.description:
ABOUT LOOKER ENGINEERING


The engineering team at Looker is a tight-knit group of high-performers. We value simplicity in both our code and our user interfaces. We don’t believe in large teams; we opt for small groups that move fast, communicate clearly and achieve more.  We try to choose the right tool for the job, not one tool to solve all problems. We make a huge impact on product direction, we experiment, and we iterate rapidly. 


SENIOR FRONT END ENGINEER 


Looker is seeking experienced Front End Engineers to build out our data discovery platform. Looker is still a small team, so you’ll have the opportunity to work on many aspects of the product and shape the Front End architecture.  You should have extensive experience and a proven track record solving complex web engineering problems.

item.title: (Clinical) Business Analyst at Lumeris (Austin, TX)
item.description:
Join Our Growing Team!


Lumeris™ provides the information technology, guidance, and operational services necessary for hospitals and health plans to transform their organizations into high-performing accountable delivery systems.


Our revolutionary technology platform for accountable care integrates data from disparate systems across the continuum of care, provides complete visibility into the clinical and financial performance of the enterprise, and delivers applications and information to key stakeholders at the point of thought. Lumeris also provides health care consulting and professional services that help organizations establish the necessary clinical and business processes, methodologies, and operational capacity to create their own successful accountable health care delivery systems.


The depth and breadth of our solutions — combined with the company’s extensive real-world experience in accountable care — make Lumeris the ideal partner for any health care organization seeking the significant benefits of a better connected, aligned, and informed accountable delivery system.


Lumeris is privately owned by Essence Group Holdings Corporation (EGHC) and backed by investors including Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers, Camden Partners, and Sandbox Industries.


Why Join Lumeris?


At Lumeris you will be part of team that is focused on solving a national healthcare problem.  And you will have the ability to contribute while working for a purpose. Our environment is fast-paced and change oriented and is focused on growth and employee engagement.  At Lumeris we believe talent is utilized best when given the opportunity to succeed.  That is why we have removed the boundaries that inhibit success and focus on fostering an environment that allows employees to utilize their talents.


Summary


The Business Analyst will work within our product management organization and will be responsible for gathering requirements and disseminating information across the organization.



  • Gather business requirements and convert these to documents for consumption across the organization

  • Create use cases and user stories

  • Work with product managers to define new product features

  • Define methods and procedures for improving current processes within the product management lifecycle

  • Perform project management responsibilities on an as-needed basis

item.title: Data Engineer - Python, PostgreSQL and Redis at Lyst (London, UK)
item.description:
Lyst are looking for a Data Engineer to join our Analytics team and work on the huge data projects that are integral to Lyst’s day to day operations.


Data lies at the heart of everything we do here at Lyst, from understanding our users better to making mission critical decisions, we always look at the data first.


We record nearly 100 million rows of data a day just from user interactions. To support this volume, we have built our own analytics architecture, predominantly in Python and leveraging the convenience of many cloud services like AWS Redshift, Lambda, CloudFront, S3, etc.


With this sea of data growing everyday, you will work hand in hand with our analysts and data product managers to ensure that our analytics data pipeline is clean, efficient and scalable as the business and traffic increases. From building bespoke BI tools, ensuring analytics engineering requests are responded to in a quick manner to architecting new solutions. You will work on things such as:



  • Improving our analytics data architecture, ensuring scalability and resiliency

  • Streamline the anomaly detection process across all our data, and build tools and processes around it to speed up the required actions to solve any anomaly

  • Improving our internal BI tool, Looker, and tools surrounding it to ensure Analysts are able to provide amazing insight to the business.

  • Understanding the query requirements from our data analysts and optimising our database (table) design to make them faster and more efficient.

  • Fixing the interesting problems we face in the best way possible; we are not constricted to tool sets and languages. If you find a solution to a problem that will work better, we use your idea. Best idea wins.

  • Creating a development platform, tools and pipeline that is effective and easy to iterate with.

  • Building your own brand and skills. Lyst is a company that will encourage and support you to get involved in the wider community. Events like FOSDEM, PyCon, JS London are regular occurrences on our calendar.

  • Creating better solutions for everything we do, from our culture to the code. This is your company, own it.



WHAT WE USE


Python, JavaScript, Django, PostgreSQL, Redis, AWS, Objective-C, Elasticsearch, Docker, Ember.js, RedShift, Pandas, IPython Notebook



As you can see we are really excited about the data we have here hopefully you will be too. We expect you to have already had some exposure to working in a commercial environment as an data Engineer. You will have the ability to not only work as a hands on member of the team but also the


We like to build things that solve problems, you will not be constrained by process - we work in small product teams that take a lean approach to building things. We believe that there is no silver bullet to fix the problems and challenges we face: instead we encourage consistent iteration to ensure we are always solving problems. We care deeply about collaboration, feedback and trust; all of our engineers take ownership of committing their own code and ensuring that everything is bug free and reliable.


If the above resonates and you would like to strongly influence the direction of our products and our culture, work with amazing people and hang out with Albert and Bruce, the office dogs. Artisan beers. Good Coffee. Great people.


If you would like to apply please do so right away, if you would like a bit more info feel free to get in touch with Tris on jobs@lyst.com.

item.title: Sql Programmer at Spatially (Miami, FL)
item.description:
Description



  • Work with Product, Engineering, & Data Scientists to create efficient Sql Queries to build/QA needed Data Sets, and validate/verify/troubleshoot data set integrity & validity

  • Build reusable models and queries that assist in building data set driven projects that provide insights to customers, in form of reports and data visualization

  • Ramp up into Geo-Spatial querying techniques

  • Ability to handle multiple requests project related queries, and help identify common patterns and modularize those into common data queries.


Qualifications



  • Strong communication & Collaboration Skills

  • Experience in Fast Paced Startup environments

  • Positive Attitude with proven delivery experience

  • BS computer science/related subject matter or equivalent experience

  • 2+ years experience with RDBMS systems such-as Sql Server, Oracle, Mysql, Postgres

  • 2+ Years experience with SQL development experiences with solid T-SQL/SQL skills and proven SQL optimization skills.

  • Experience with both OLAP & OLTP workloads a strong plus

  • Experience with NoSql Technologies and Querying methods a Plus

  • Knowledge in One or More languages such-as Java, C#, Scala, GO, Python, Javascript a plus

  • Data Modeling experience a Plus

  • Experience in Financial, Retail, Spatial Analytics, Mapping, Location Based Services & GIS and like data and/or industries a Strong Plus

item.title: Implementation Developer at Stevens Capital Management LP (Wayne, PA)
item.description:
Stevens Capital Management LP (“SCM”) is a registered investment adviser with more than sixty employees that manages a multi-billion dollar hedge fund that has been in business for 20+ years.


SCM specializes in the rigorous development and disciplined implementation of empirically based quantitative trading strategies. Our highly productive team works in a fast-paced collegial environment, utilizing extensive data sets, technology and the scientific method to devise and employ trading strategies throughout the world’s most liquid financial markets.


We’re looking for exceptional candidates for the following position:


Implementation Software Developer


We're seeking highly driven, production-oriented developers who possess strong technical skills and the ability to work in a fast-paced collaborative environment. 


Primary Responsibilities



  • Develop and support multi-threaded applications with a strong emphasis on high performance.

  • Optimize our trading strategy implementation and performance analysis platform using network and systems programming.

  • Create tools to process, store and analyze quote, order and financial data.

  • Work closely with our quantitative research analysts, engineers and other groups to provide software solutions.


Requirements



  • Professional-level C++ programming experience in a Linux environment.

  • A Computer Science or Mathematics degree.

  • Outstanding problem solving skills.

  • Knowledge of shell scripts and other languages including Perl, Bash or CSH is a plus.

  • Experience with relational databases including Sybase, SQL Server and Oracle is a plus.

  • Experience with GUI design is a plus.

item.title: Security Operations Analyst at Lumeris (Maryland Heights, MO)
item.description:
Join Our Growing Team!


Lumeris™ provides the information technology, guidance, and operational services necessary for hospitals and health plans to transform their organizations into high-performing accountable delivery systems.


Our revolutionary technology platform for accountable care integrates data from disparate systems across the continuum of care, provides complete visibility into the clinical and financial performance of the enterprise, and delivers applications and information to key stakeholders at the point of thought. Lumeris also provides health care consulting and professional services that help organizations establish the necessary clinical and business processes, methodologies, and operational capacity to create their own successful accountable health care delivery systems.


The depth and breadth of our solutions — combined with the company’s extensive real-world experience in accountable care — make Lumeris the ideal partner for any health care organization seeking the significant benefits of a better connected, aligned, and informed accountable delivery system.


Lumeris is privately owned by Essence Group Holdings Corporation (EGHC) and backed by investors including Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers, Camden Partners, and Sandbox Industries.


Why Join Lumeris?


At Lumeris you will be part of team that is focused on solving a national healthcare problem.  And you will have the ability to contribute while working for a purpose. Our environment is fast-paced and change oriented and is focused on growth and employee engagement.  At Lumeris we believe talent is utilized best when given the opportunity to succeed.  That is why we have removed the boundaries that inhibit success and focus on fostering an environment that allows employees to utilize their talents.


Summary


The Security Operations Analyst proactively manages security events and activities to reduce the impact of security incidents and system compromises. 


The analyst will provide security monitoring, threat analysis, trend analysis, configuration, and troubleshooting of security device monitoring and incident investigation using infrastructure and applications logs from across the enterprise.  This may include firewalls, servers, applications and data loss prevention systems (DLP).


In addition, the Security Analyst role will also initiate and resolve security operation activities per written procedures and may require coordination with multiple internal and external parties.



  • Shared 24x7x365 On call support in a fast past technical environment with strict regulatory and customer security requirements

  • Configuration of monitoring/alert, DLP, and reporting systems

  • Monitor and analyze security events

  • Coordinate the containment and eradication of malicious activity by internal and external parties

  • Analyze a variety of application, network, and system security logs to determine the correct remediation actions and escalation paths for each incident

  • Review industry and vendor security alerts for vulnerabilities and security issues. Work with Infrastructure and development teams to mitigate solutions based on vendor advisories and best practices.

  • Research and identify key indicators of malicious activities on the network and end user workstations  

  • Own and manage incident tickets from start to resolution

item.title: Business Analyst / Network Security at Lumeris (Maryland Heights, MO)
item.description:
Join Our Growing Team!


Lumeris™ provides the information technology, guidance, and operational services necessary for hospitals and health plans to transform their organizations into high-performing accountable delivery systems.


Our revolutionary technology platform for accountable care integrates data from disparate systems across the continuum of care, provides complete visibility into the clinical and financial performance of the enterprise, and delivers applications and information to key stakeholders at the point of thought. Lumeris also provides health care consulting and professional services that help organizations establish the necessary clinical and business processes, methodologies, and operational capacity to create their own successful accountable health care delivery systems.
