At Lumeris you will be part of team that is focused on solving a national healthcare problem.  And you will have the ability to contribute while working for a purpose. Our environment is fast-paced and change oriented and is focused on growth and employee engagement.  At Lumeris we believe talent is utilized best when given the opportunity to succeed.  That is why we have removed the boundaries that inhibit success and focus on fostering an environment that allows employees to utilize their talents.


Position Overview:


The IT Business Security Analyst performs a variety of activities that support the continuous mission of data protection.  This is a non-technical position with a focus on administrative activities.


You will work with others on your team to ensure compliance with regulatory obligations and general security best practices through risk assessments, analysis and testing of security controls, and policies/procedures.   Much of your time will be spent gathering evidence for periodic audits, either performed internally, or by contracted third party auditors.


Additional duties include risk assessments of potential business partners that may perform services for Lumeris, and periodic assessments of current partners to ensure they continue to perform to contracted standards.



  • Work with external auditors to ensure successful SOC audits

  • Ensure compliance with customer contracts

  • Perform risk analysis of potential vendors and partners

  • Perform annual vendor security reviews

  • Perform annual policy reviews

  • Business continuity/disaster recovery program documentation and maintenance

  • Security awareness training activities

item.title: Senior Data Engineer at Spatially (Seattle, WA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Description



  • Work with Product, Engineering, & Data Scientists to build & manage Data systems used across product & research portfolio

  • Own and manage data systems across multiple projects & platforms

  • Design, Build, and manage multiple Data pipelines and ETLs dealing with various forms of data

  • Work with engineering to build Data services, Sets, and streams

  • Manage On Demand, Scheduled, and private data

  • Design, manage, and enforce Data security & standards across all teams

  • Work with Engineering, Product, and Science to model data across the organization

  • Provide Data validation mechanisms in a decentralized distributed platform for various teams including science & engineering.


Qualifications



  • Strong communication & Collaboration Skills

  • Experience in Fast Paced Startup environments

  • Positive Attitude with proven delivery experience

  • BS computer science/related subject matter or equivalent experience

  • 6+ years experience with RDBMS systems such-as Sql Server, Oracle, Mysql, Postgres

  • 6+ Years experience with SQL development experiences with solid T-SQL/SQL skills and proven SQL optimization skills.

  • Ability to manage, monitor, and troubleshoot production level cloud/on-premise/hybrid deployments of Sql and/or nosql systems

  • Experience with both OLAP & OLTP workloads

  • Experience with designing and implementing ETL workflows

  • Strong passion to learn new technologies & methodologies

  • Experience with NoSql/Big Data Technologies and Querying methods including Hadoop/Mapreduce systems, Apache Stack, Column Family, Key-Value, Document, and Graph data systems

  • Knowledge in One or More languages such-as Java, C#, Scala, GO, Python, Javascript

  • Good Data Modeling experience

  • Experience with Search systems such-as Solr/Elasticsearch a plus

  • Experience in Financial, Retail, Spatial Analytics, Mapping, Location Based Services & GIS and like data and/or industries a Strong Plus



This position will be filled in either Seattle, WA or Miami, FL.

item.title: Data Scientist at Spatially (Seattle, WA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Description & Responsibilities




  • Work with a motivated team in an innovative Spatial Analytics startup to build data Science, Analytics, and Machine Learning practice

  • You will advocate, evangelize and build data-fuelled products that help our customers gain true scientifically driven insights.

  • You’ll dig in and become an expert on our datasets.

  • You will provide insight into leading analytic practices, design and lead iterative learning and development cycles, and ultimately produce new and creative analytic solutions that will become part of our core deliverables.

  • You will work with cross-functional team members to identify and prioritize actionable, high-impact insights across a variety of core business areas.

  • You will lead applied analytics and science initiatives that are leveraged across the breadth of our solutions.. You will research, design, implement and validate cutting-edge algorithms to analyze diverse sources of data to achieve targeted outcomes.

  • As our data scientist, you will provide expertise on science & mathematical concepts for the broader applied analytics team and inspire the adoption of advanced analytics and data science across the entire breadth of our organization.



Qualifications




  • Masters or PhD in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Data Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics or related field.

  • 4+ years relevant experience with a proven track record of leveraging analytics and large amounts of data to drive significant business impact.

  • Expertise in machine learning, predictive analytics, statistical modeling, and data algorithms. Must have knowledge/experience in methodologies and algorithms including: Multivariate Regression, Logistic Regression, Support Vector Machines, Bagging, Boosting, Decision Trees, Lifetime Analysis, Clustering, Mathematical Optimization, Random Forest/Ensemble Learning, Deep Learning Algorithms and Stochastic Processes.

  • Strong algorithmic thinking and independent research ability.

  • Passion for learning and innovating new methodologies at the intersection of applied math/statistics/computer science.

  • Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills, including the ability to describe the logic and implications of a complex model to all types of business partners.

  • High-energy self-starter with a passion for your work, attention to detail, and a positive attitude.

  • Proficiency in at least one statistical analysis tool such as R, SAS, and/or Weka.

  • Strong SQL and deep understanding of Data-at-rest and data-at-transit & other lifecycle points of data

  • Experience with distributed computing, databases and query languages like Hadoop/YARN, Spark, Cassandra/NoSql Databases, Graph Databases, Hive/Pig and/or general map reduce computing.

  • Experience with RDBMS systems such-as Sql Server, Oracle, Postgres, MySql

  • Knowledge of common data structures and ability to write efficient code in at least one language is a plus (preferably Java, Scala, GO, Python).

  • Experience in Financial, Retail, Spatial Analytics, Mapping, Location Based Services & GIS and like data and/or industries a Strong Plus

item.title: Data Architect that loves mobile games? Join us! at Hothead Games (Vancouver, BC, Canada)
item.description:
Hothead Games is a 130-person game development studio focused on free-to-play for iOS and Android devices. Millions of people play our games and this generates large amounts of data. Efficient and effective storage, transformation, analysis and archival are all top priorities. We are seeking an ambitious individual to take a lead role in planning and executing on all aspects of our data-related technologies.

Have extensive experience with multiple databases? Passionate about creating software architectures that are robust and scalable? Want to work on the bleeding edge of Big Data?  Then you need to join our world-leading mobile game studio and help us wrangle hundreds of terabytes of data into understandable, actionable information.

We expect the successful candidate will be an experienced software engineer/architect that will formulate and execute the vision for our proprietary Big Data platform. Are you up for it?


Responsibilities:



  • Define requirements, create technical designs and assist with the implementation of internally-developed analytics systems

  • Oversee the daily operation of analytics data processing, automating the process wherever possible

  • Educate internal stakeholders on best practices for analytics-related processes in the company

  • Assist data analysts, game designers and others with advanced queries, sophisticated A/B tests and other complex data problems

  • Advise game teams on databases and other data-related aspects of game client and server software

  • Perform load and stress tests and analyze performance of running production systems in order to optimize database use and remove bottlenecks

  • Perform tests to sanity check accuracy of internal and 3rd party data

  • Assist the Director of Technology with supervision of the work of programmers on the Analytics Team

item.title: Hacker (Node.js, NOSQL, Data Science) at Mobitrans.com (Dubai, United Arab Emirates)
item.description:
We are looking for exceptional functional developers to join our product research and development team. It's a full stack job that requires more than anything a passion for learning and experimenting with new technologies, creating prototypes and dealing with a few million data points every day. You will be working on any technology between Linux shell scripts, high performance Web servers and beautiful UIs.


We tweak our advertising and targeting algorithms multiple times a day and you should be able to reason about, program, discover and propose new ways of improving our result.


Our backend is supported by Node.js and Mongodb and our front-end is powered by JavaScript, TypeScript, LiveScript, AngularJS and React. You should be able to improve our architecture, bring new ideas and create POCs and lead the development of new projects.


You will be building ad servers for serving interactive mobile ads as well as realtime data analysis of the traffic; you will be tinkering with the algorithms and assisting product designers and data analysts by developing data visualization tools for UX and performance reports.

item.title: Data Warehouse Engineer (junior/senior) at Zalando SE (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
The opportunity


As a Zalando Data Warehouse Engineer you will become a critical part of one of the most innovative teams in ecommerce. You will consult and support different stakeholders across the entire company by providing data-driven solutions to business and technical challenges. You’ll join our accomplished team of experts in integrating data from many sources into our single-point-of-truth data warehouse. And you will have the freedom to launch your own open source projects, contribute to others’ projects, build internal community around your interests, and strengthen your personal brand—while receiving meaningful support at every step.


What we're looking for



  • Demonstrated professional experience programming in Python, Java, or PL/SQL

  • Experience maintaining, refactoring and extending large code bases

  • A preference for agile methodologies

  • A passion for working with relational databases: reading, writing and optimizing complex statements; modelling data structures, and designing ETL processes

  • The ability to communicate effectively with diverse teams

  • English language fluency


Your responsibilities



  • Develop expertise in understanding our business processes and the many related requirements

  • Collaborate with our analysts to create and implement new initiatives based on our stakeholder requirements

  • Act as a liaison between your team and other teams within Zalando Tech

  • Maintain, optimize and extend our data warehouse infrastructure using Oracle, Exasol and PostgreSQL databases


What you can expect from us



  • Internal tech talks, skills-building courses and technical “People Leads” who help you achieve mastery

  • Personal branding support: From preparing conference talks and blog posts to industry networking Community: hack weeks, movie nights, +70 self-organized tech guilds and more

  • Competitive salary

  • 40% Zalando shopping discount and commuter discount

  • Relocation assistance for internationals


About Zalando


Zalando is Europe’s leading online fashion platform, doing business in 15 markets. Delivering first-class shopping experiences to our +15 million customers requires moving fast — with microservices, Agile processes & autonomous teams  —  and using cutting edge, open source technologies. We are passionate about what we do and have fun while doing it. And we are willing to experiment and make mistakes: It’s how we grow.


Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!


If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring processes, please contact recruiter Matthias Rempel at jobs@zalando.de.

item.title: Security Analyst (m/f) at Zalando SE (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR  



  • You are an excellent communicator

  • You have a degree in computer science

  • You have at least 2 years of experience in the security industy, ideally Web or application security related

  • You have a good understanding of both frontend and backend technologies

  • You have preferably experience in HTML5 and its security implications

  • You are fluent in both the German and English language

  • Having certifications like GIAC-GSEC, SSCP, CISSP is a plus


YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES



  • You will be collaborating with other tech and product teams and determine threats to our infrastructure

  • You will construct data flow charts and threat models for systems and application environments

  • You are going to perform penetration tests and code reviews

  • You will be consulting development teams during the patching process

  • You are expected to work independently and bring in ideas to decrease security debt

  • You are also expected to present your results therefore good presentation skills are required


WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM US



  • Through our mentoring program you will be able to work independently very quickly

  • We use Open Source technologies

  • Weekly Tech Talks and regular technical exchange with other Berlin-based startups

  • The ability to choose your OS (Linux, MacOS) and IDE (Eclipse, IntelliJ, NetBeans, ...)

  • Powerful hardware system environment

  • Flat hierarchies -- we live the motto “Wear sneakers, not ties”

  • An international team with top experts who will inspire and support you

  • Complimentary fruit, beverages and table soccer

  • You will never be bored! Zalando offers a very variable working environment


ABOUT ZALANDO


Zalando is Europe’s leading online fashion platform, doing business in 15 markets. Delivering first-class shopping experiences to our +15 million customers requires moving fast — with microservices, Agile processes & autonomous teams  —  and using cutting edge, open source technologies. We are passionate about what we do and have fun while doing it. And we are willing to experiment and make mistakes: It’s how we grow.


WANT TO JOIN US? THEN GO AHEAD AND APPLY!


If you need guidance or have any questions about our recruiting and hiring processes, please contact recruiter Sameer Shaikh at jobs@zalando.de

item.title: Lead Quality / Automation Analyst at Clarus Commerce (Middletown, CT)
item.description:
Clarus Commerce is seeking a Hands-on Lead Quality and Automation Analyst.  The individual will join a highly-skilled IT organization and be responsible for building and leading the Quality practice at Clarus Commerce including but not limited to Software Development Testing, Automation, Metrics and Tracking, Processes and Tools to ensure that our high-traffic websites, web services, mobile applications, and other software products are released with the highest quality.


Responsibilities:



  • Lead and develop Quality Assurance processes, standards and group in line with Clarus’s initiatives and SDLC

  • Oversee and lead the completion of estimation, test design, test cases and planning and test execution based on quality “practice”.

  • Lead and enhance QA automation strategy, implementation and processes.

  • Test products throughout the software development lifecycle and ensure that all product releases function correctly.

  • Coordinate software releases to production environments.

  • Work with product owners and developers to understand requirements, document and resolve issues.

  • Respond to production issues or problems with our existing products.

  • Participate in a small, experienced, energetic team on a rapid, agile development schedule.

  • Maintain and communicate testing timelines, schedules and status reports

item.title: Software Developer: Casual Data-Driven Firm at TFS Capital (West Chester, PA)
item.description:
TFS Capital LLC is a boutique asset management firm in West Chester, PA. We are seeking a well-rounded software developer to join our development team. This developer will help maintain and expand our proprietary automated data-driven trading systems. As a key member of a small development team, you will be an integral part of all aspects of our mission-critical trading infrastructure. In addition to working with existing systems, you will be assisting with making and implementing design decisions for new and improved data and software architecture. The position is full-time in our West Chester, PA office.


Technology is at the heart of our business. At TFS, you and the rest of the technology team will work directly with traders, quants, and portfolio managers to solve interesting and challenging problems using technology. Your actions will directly impact the success of our business.


TFS Capital will not consider applicants who require H1-B Visa sponsorship for this position.


Key responsibilities



  • Work with the rest of the development team to expand and maintain the firm’s proprietary software systems

  • Work directly with the trading desk, analysis team, portfolio managers, and other business groups to support existing systems and implement new ideas

  • Onboard new, diverse, large datasets and create appropriate ETL processes


About the IT Team
We are a small team of developers and operations admins who work together to develop, maintain, and expand our in-house trading software. In addition to our code, we integrate and assist with development of code from other teams, including the traders and analysts. We work directly with traders and analysts daily, and most of the TFS team on a regular basis.


We’re primarily a Windows shop, but use Linux where it fits best. The bulk of our software is written in Java, but we also have a ton of Perl and MATLAB, and some Python and C#. We use Microsoft SQL Server for relational data storage.

item.title: Software Engineer - C#, VB.Net, ASP.Net, Sharepoint at King & Spalding LLP (Atlanta, GA)
item.description:
Responsible for working on complex software engagements and systems integration projects from a development standpoint. Serves as a lead on medium-sized projects dealing with data warehousing, data migration and architecting middleware to facilitate the exchange of data between enterprise applications. This person will help architect technical solutions and then handle the coding and implementation of the software engineering phase of the project. This person will work closely with Project Managers, Analysts, Usability Designers and the rest of the Software Engineering group. They may be called upon periodically to meet with end users to assist in architecting solutions with the Analysts. This position works closely with Usability Designers and other Software Engineers to create web based application interfaces for various firm databases and products.

Qualifications:



  • Extensive knowledge and experience with a wide variety of Microsoft development tools and languages including C# and ASP.Net within the .NET Framework, SQL Server and Active Directory.

  • Extensive experience working with basic web scripting such as HTML, JavaScript, CSS and other interfacing technologies needed to support substantial web-based software applications.

  • Thorough understanding of software development processes and best practices.

  • Ability to handle high-stress situations and deal successfully with conflict.

  • Excellent analytical and communication skills (written and verbal) and the ability to relate technical information to a non-technical audience.

  • Excellent work ethics and the ability to work as a part of a team to accomplish assigned tasks and responsibilities.

  • Ability to manage multiple assignments and varying priorities.

  • Very organized, responsible, goal oriented with attention to detail.

item.title: Data Scientist (The Walking Dead) at Next Games (Helsinki, Finland)
item.description:
If you’re a startup-minded pro with a passion for games and a brain that can tackle any given problem in a unique way, then keep on reading as we’re on the look for our new team member for The Walking Dead game team:


DATA SCIENTIST


As our Data Scientist, you’re responsible for generating insights from large data sets produced by our games and players. Working closely with our EP’s and game teams you’ll get to service and manage our day-to-day data requests and analyses hands-on.


This is what you’ll get to work on:



  • Work with product teams to define data to be collected from our products for analysis

  • Analysis of key performance indicators, such as customer acquisition, retention, lifetime value and virtual economy balance

  • Defining the data acquisition of AB tests and analysis of the gathered AB test data to estimate the effect on key metrics and choose the best features

  • Develop models for predicting player behavior

  • Answer in-depth analytics questions from the team and create reports of the results

  • Identify and report actionable insights to internal stakeholders, suggest recommendations and influence the direction of the business by effectively communicating results


Your experience and skills include:



  • 2+ years experience in a data scientist or analyst role, involving some of the following: data analytics, CRM data analysis, data mining, business intelligence, machine learning, predictive modeling

  • Expert knowledge in SQL-related languages

  • Knowledge in statistical programming languages (R, etc.) and in Big Data technologies (Hadoop, Hive, Pig, NoSQL, etc.)

  • Experience in interpreting data and analytics results to provide actionable insight into user/product behavior and deriving conclusions from those insights

  • Comfortable working in an international, fast-paced, challenging and stimulating organization

  • Excellent written & verbal communication skills in English


Here at Next Games we aim high, and will ask you to do the same. In exchange, you’ll be part of a team that is great to work with, who is dedicated and passionate about what we do – we believe passion is contagious. Giving each Nextgamer the tools and means to succeed in their job is our priority. We believe the fruits of our labor should be shared with everyone at Next Games. We offer the opportunity to work with a great bunch of passionate and dedicated people, a competitive salary and benefits package, and first and foremost a big challenge.



If you believe in the same things, don’t hesitate any longer, apply now!



When you apply, please email your CV, a cover letter along with your salary request to data.scientist@nextgames.com. Please apply soon, as we’ll proceed once we’ve found the right person to join our team!



For further information about the position please contact our CPO, Joakim Achrén at +358-500 625 398 during the following time:



Friday 21.8. between 13.00 – 14.00 (EEST)

item.title: Saas Senior Operations Analyst - $20/hr at Crossover (Istanbul, Turkey) (allows remote)
item.description:
AES SaaS Senior Operations Analyst - $20/hr


Are you a logic-driven IT professional who thrives in operations or customer support roles? Are you team-oriented, self-motivated, and quality-driven? If you are a keen problem solver excited by opportunities to demonstrate and maintain high quality in both communication and ownership of your given area of responsibility, if you possess knowledge of production systems and if you excel at problem analysis and solution recommendation — then this job is for you.


Aurea enables global enterprises to create transformative experiences for their customers across a range of industries including retail, travel & hospitality, insurance, energy, life sciences, and insurance. Aurea’s products enable companies to build, execute, monitor, and optimize the end-to-end customer journey across multiple channels and touch-points to maximize growth through a superior customer experience. Aurea serves over 2,000 customers worldwide.


AES, an Aurea product, is a business process outsourcer for EDI transactions and billing for the retail and wholesale electric and gas utilities markets. Our mission is to provide accurate and transparent transactions and invoices to our customers. We provide a team-oriented environment that supports every employee in solving problems and getting the job done well.


Job Description


The AES SaaS Sr. Operations Analyst is responsible for providing second level support to both internal and external clients for resolving incidents and service requests. You will adhere to ista’s internal processes for incident and service request resolution, and change management through proper execution and documentation — all from the comfort of your own home. This position is 100% remote; you never have to fight traffic to the office again, and you have the freedom to choose where you put in your 40 hours to be most effective each week.


Key Responsibilities


In this role you will:




  • Analyze issues and data anomalies and identifying solutions.




  • Perform level 2 support functions for incidents.




  • Emphasize resolving issues escalated to Operations.




  • Recognize and act on opportunities for efficiency improvements.




  • Review and write SQL queries for analysis and resolution of issues.




  • Navigate a complex database system.




  • Assist in off-hours coverage via escalation of priority incidents (choosing shifts that overlap with the time period of 6am-6pm Central Standard Time)




  • Perform manual tasks/processes in support of business and operational units.




  • Research and resolve alerts and problem accounts in a timely manner.




  • Ensure all tasks are completed correctly, including letter generation and delivery, invoice generation and delivery, and alert management.




  • Work with retail utility providers to identify and resolve operational account anomalies.




  • Compose and produce reports, documents and related material.




  • Maintain Operation procedural documentation in the knowledge base.



  • Perform other operational tasks as assigned.

item.title: ASP.NET Developer (C#, SQL Server) at Aperia Solutions (Dallas, TX)
item.description:
Join Aperia Solutions, a leader in data management and business intelligence processing. Aperia has been providing business intelligence solutions for more than a decade. The company's management has extensive experience in finance, business consulting, rapid growth and governance as well as business intelligence, the company's core function.


We have an immediate need for an ASP.NET with Web Forms and MVC experience to join our team. 


Functional Responsibility:



  • Rapidly prototypes new applications with a combination of HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and ASP.NET MVC

  • Updates existing ASP.NET Web Forms application to MVC 4/5.

  • Maintains existing ASP.NET Web Forms applications.

  • Develops new features for existing ASP.NET Web Forms and MVC applications.

  • Works with Business Analysts to understand client's requirements for each project and presents technical solutions to manager.

  • Updates manager daily with progress of the projects.

  • Supports teams to resolve application production issues.

  • Deploys releases and updates to multiple environments.

item.title: Analyst Programmer: Support at The British Museum (London, UK)
item.description:
Work for the British Museum as an Analyst Programmer: Support to provide support for existing applications and interfaces, improve the development environment to reduce support requests, analyse requirements and develop and deliver new application software, in collaboration with colleagues inside and outside IS.


It is an exciting time to be a developer within Information Services-a new digital strategy has recently been approved and there will shortly be a new Director of the Museum. While the initial primary focus of the role will be to provide 2nd and 3rd line support for existing legacy systems, the technology landscape of the museum will be radically changing in the next 12-36 months to deliver innovative strategic aims and this role will be part of the team implementing new systems and technologies incorporating best practice from ITIL Service Transition.   The aims which technology is expected to enable include an emphasis on mobile (both for staff and visitors), flexible working, data-centric decision-making requiring a consolidation of systems and data, CRM and a new website including new ways of integrating changing data and tracking visitors.


There is never a dull moment at the Museum and interactions will involve functions from across the museum. One minute you could be working on an efficiency project that will save administrative staff considerable time in managing a business process, the next moment you may be helping develop functionality which will allow mobile cataloguing of our collection, or helping build a big data platform. Feedback from staff is that this is an interesting place to work not only because of the amazing objects you pass on your way to meetings, but also because of the variety of systems and technologies in use.  


The role provides a unique opportunity to gain an understanding of how one of the most important museum’s in the world operates, insights into what we hold in our collection and be part of community of people passionate about the values of the Museum and its 255-year legacy of providing free access to the history of the world. This is an excellent opportunity to leverage your career in IS with the most popular tourist attraction in the U.K.

item.title: SQL Server Database Developer at Conclusive Analytics (Charlotte, NC)
item.description:
SQL Server Database Developer


Position Description
Due to exciting growth, we have an immediate need for SQL Server Database Developers to join our team on a cutting edge database projects. As an integral part of this group, you will be responsible for designing and developing databases and complex procedures. Bring your good ideas and appetite to learn new technology and join our team of bright and motivated data experts.


Conclusive Analytics provides Managed Analytics as a Service that enable our customers to grow revenue and increase profitability. Our experts integrate data, deploy the latest in decision science, management science, data science, predictive analytics, and visualization techniques enabling better, faster decisions to achieve improved and sustainable business results.


Responsibilities



  • Design, develop, document, and deploy technical solutions to complex business problems.

  • Build, edit, and review challenging and complex database procedures.

  • Optimize existing import/export processes to increase efficiencies and performance.

  • Analyze OLTP and OLAP databases, interpret results, produce reports, and provide insights and recommendations to our clients.

  • Develop reports in SQL Server Reporting Services.

  • Design, Develop and Deploy SSIS Packages.

  • Assist with database administration tasks.

  • Assist data scientists with data analysis and research.

item.title: Core Financial Applications C++ Developer at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role: 

The Core Financial Applications (CFA) department designs and builds business-critical solutions for a diverse set of customers in the financial industry. Our products include analytical and research applications for equities, fixed income, mortgages, commodities, economics, foreign exchange and financial derivatives. The products we build help traders, investment bankers, corporate treasurers, research analysts and portfolio managers solve complex business problems.

As a software engineer in CFA, you will be responsible for the full development life cycle of key projects. You will learn about finance from our subject matter experts and through Bloomberg University courses. Your ingenuity and enterprise will help improve and progress our products in a highly competitive and challenging marketplace.

Our software engineers are quick, resourceful, flexible and collaborative. They combine their technical skills and product knowledge to craft unsurpassed solutions for our customers.

>> More information on individual groups and their products can be found below. When you apply, you will have the ability to select your preferred group.

Derivatives & Cross Asset

The Derivatives & Cross Asset group is one of the fastest growing in both CFA and Bloomberg. We deal with analytics required by a variety of trading, risk management and regulatory reporting applications. The front, middle and back offices of major financial institutions involved in the USD 700 trillion derivatives industry use our products to make sense of the complexity, risks, pitfalls and regulations surrounding these financial instruments. Our derivatives teams meet these challenges by offering a one-stop solution that brings transparency, efficiency and excellence to market professionals.

Fixed Income Pricing

The Fixed Income (FI) Pricing group builds a product that is the market standard for pricing and provides up to date and accurate information to the global financial community. We are focused on building low latency, high throughput systems that employ advanced statistical techniques for generating real-time and accurate pricing information. FI Pricing also builds analytics products that revolutionize the fixed income market place. Our application suite includes high precision pricing algorithms, accurate end-of-day price generation systems, liquidity hubs for storing and retrieving pricing information, sophisticated user interfaces and big data analytics platforms. These products are extensively used by various market players such as portfolio managers, risk officers, analysts and traders.

Foreign Exchange

The Foreign Exchange (FX) group provides market leading analytic functionality and award-winning currency pricing and data. Because FX trades are over the counter (bank to bank; not traded in exchanges), it is important for traders to have transparency into market prices. Our tools provide this service in real-time and allow users to perform FX forwards analytics on them. We develop high visibility applications for FX valuation, idea generation and price discovery workflows, as well as high volume real-time pricing engines.

Commodities

The Commodities group builds products that offer transparency in supply, demand, and pricing of oil, power, natural gas, metals and agricultural goods. We build systems and functionality to house everything from hourly power transmission rates to 15-minute updates on ship movements. Technical opportunities run the gamut from architecting systems to designing databases to UI development. Another aspect of this group is to track and manage the lifecycle of millions of futures and options securities across 100+ exchanges around the world. Our futures and options product makes discoverability of such securities easy, which proves to be a very important for our clients in a dynamic environment.

Economics

The Economics group puts the fundamentals of our economy in front of hundreds of thousands of clients every day. We develop the tools that manage real-time releases of economic statistics coming from governments around the world. We also develop analytics and visualizations of economic data to help users better understand the underpinnings of our financial system.

Equity

The Equity group's product is used by over 100,000 financial professionals worldwide to make investment decisions aimed at increasing alpha. This functionality is among the most used across the Bloomberg terminal and is invaluable to clients. The product allows for clear understanding of vast global data sets spanning 30+ years, big data analytics, real-time alerting and complex financial data. We build applications for discovering and analyzing market trends, aggregating and evaluating analyst predictions, and screening and back-testing investment ideas. The group is made up of fast-paced teams passionate about time-to-market, performance and visual design.

Fixed Income Core

The Fixed Income Core group develops software to support analytics and data that move global fixed income markets. We cover government, corporate, money market, municipal and preferred instruments. Our clients depend on our pricing algorithms, high performance calculation libraries, trading applications and real-time big data analysis to make informed decisions. Our applications are used a million times a day and our APIs are invoked billions of times a day.

item.title: System Administrator III at Institute for Defense Analyses (Alexandria, VA)
item.description:
Overview


With minimal supervision, this position designs, administers, maintains and provides technical support for IDA’s network and server systems and services. Responsibilities include the coverage and scheduling of Help Desk tickets and Change Requests, taking lead roles on projects for corporate-wide IT initiatives, mentoring members of Enterprise IT Operations on systems integration and operations, ensuring systems compatibility and standards of configuration are maintained on all new and existing systems, promoting IT best practices, and general server maintenance. Due to the nature of this position, and the requirement for extended coverage, this position may be required to work hours outside of a regular schedule.


Responsibilities


1.Takes the primary role as project leader and designer of new IT technology initiatives. Provides formal project management documentation and partners with junior administrators and systems analysts to ensure the successful transition and operation of these new technologies as the junior administrators and systems analysts assume a maintenance role following the implementation. Designs effective processes for the roll-out and continued services of all IT initiatives to include support functions.
2.Develops testing and integration plans for new systems and software in order to ensure compatibility with IDA’s current network IT infrastructure. Builds new physical and virtual systems to design specifications and follows proper disposal procedures for retired systems. Ensures all systems meet or exceed the intended business and security requirements and comply with IDA’s minimum configuration standard and configuration management guidelines. Ensures all systems are properly configured to communicate with the corporate asset management system.
3.Designs, builds and delivers reliable disaster recovery and backup capabilities with local and offsite restoration capabilities.
4.Mentors junior staff and ensures all project and daily task schedules are maintained.
5.Oversees and coordinates the work assignments of junior system administrators.
6.Maintains technical documentation, to include the development and publication of standard operating procedures for systems and processes under their control.
7.Coordinates resources necessary to help resolve network problems or issues that involve other EITO or IT directorate groups.
8.Administers and maintains the systems and services, internal and external, physical and virtual, on IDA’s classified and unclassified networks, to include standalone systems and services, to ensure optimum performance and availability.
9.Conducts regular system maintenance to include monitoring, tuning, capacity planning, and adjusting configurations as necessary to resolve problems, minimize downtime, and to enhance capabilities. Systems can be identified as, but are not limited to, servers, workstations, networks, appliances, remote access systems, NOCs, and SOC systems.
10.Provides system support to minimize downtime, this may include error detection, systems analysis, and timely intervention to prevent or correct system problems.
11.Assists Information Security Analysts collect system security audits and perform Computer Emergency Response Team actions.
12.Ensures the success of patch management, software deployment, and network operations for the systems and services within their area of responsibility.
13.Provides technical support and responds to all assigned Help Desk tickets and Change Requests.Works with fellow senior analysts when necessary to quickly resolve critical system or service outages.
14.Maintains technical proficiency as new IT technologies are implemented at IDA. Keeps abreast of new and developing IT technologies and makes recommendations, as appropriate, to improve or correct IDA’s services and system performance.
15.Responds to critical after hours support issues.
16.Communicates all computer network, system and service problems and outages immediately to the Server Operations Supervisor and/or EITO Manager.
17.Performs other duties as assigned.


Qualifications


1.Bachelor of Science degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience in related field.
2.Seven years minimum experience in system administration and trouble-shooting networked systems. Requires a working knowledge of Ethernet, TCP/IP, UDP, DNS, media converters, network cabling, e-mail and web services, and remote access methodologies.
3.Seven or more years experience with Windows operating systems; experience with Mac, UNIX, Linux and network system administration desired.
4.Experience with data backup systems, asset management tools, SANs, VoIP, and virtual machines desired.
5.Must be self-motivated and able to work with minimal supervision.
6.Ability to communicate effectively in both written and verbal form and with all levels of employees; possess good interpersonal skills.
7.Project management experience a plus
8.Must be willing to work hours outside of a regular schedule.
9.Ability to obtain and maintain appropriate security clearances.


IDA is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing a working environment that is free from discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy and gender identity), sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, status as a protected veteran, marital status, genetic characteristic or any other legally protected condition or characteristic.

item.title: Intermediate/Senior Javascript Developer to build complex applications at Ontario Institute for Cancer Research (Toronto, ON, Canada)
item.description:
Position:  Intermediate/Senior Javascript Developers


Site:   MaRS Centre


Department:  Informatics & Biocomputing  


Reports To:  Associate Director, Bioinformatics and Software development


Salary:  Commensurate with level of experience


Hours: 35 Hrs/week


Status:  Full-time, Permanent



The Ontario Institute for Cancer Research (OICR) is looking for two Javascript Developers to contribute to the technical development of Informatics and Biocomputing platforms. Within the Bioinformatics and software development group, our mission is to create and improve infrastructures and tools used by cancer researchers around the globe to fight cancer.


Open Source applications built by our department are handling vast amounts of data (2+ PB) and run on large compute environments.


Genomic Data Commons (GDC)


The GDC (http://goo.gl/mZ7Z6N) is a project in collaboration with the University of Chicago (UC) and the National Cancer Institute (NCI). Development started 10 months ago with a Data Portal to provide a means for researchers to search through 2+ PB of legacy data. Built using TypeScript and AngularJS the Portal just entered user acceptance testing and development efforts will now be focused on the next phase of the project, a Submission System that will allow researchers to post and validate their data into GDC. Built using cutting edge technologies like ES6 and React (http://facebook.github.io/react/) this application will provide a dashboard-like mechanism to researchers. GDC Restful APIs are built in Python using Flask.


Role: Intermediate Javascript Developer


On GDC we are looking for a talented front-end developer with strong JS skills and professional experience working with JS MVCs (Angular, Ember, React). As part of the development team, you will be working closely with our architect/team lead and Senior Business Analyst and will be actively participating to the creation of the submission system.


Nice to have:



  • Experience with React, Webpack, Flux, ES6, d3.js

  • Interest or experience in functional programming (underscore, lodash, ClojureScript)

  • Interest or experience in reactive programming (Rx.JS, bacon.js)



International Cancer Genome Consortium Data Coordination Centre (ICGC DCC)


ICGC DCC (https://dcc.icgc.org/), is our live, production system currently hosting some 65+ cancer research projects. The ICGC DCC Portal enable researchers to search through clinical, gene and mutation data, as well as downloading raw genomic datasets. Built using AngularJS, the portal uses mostly Highcharts, D3, SVG for visualization. Our mandate is to keep improving the portal by adding more features, one of our recent addition was to allow researchers to launch their own data analyses (https://dcc.icgc.org/analysis). DCC back-end is built in Java.


Role: Senior Javascript Developer


On DCC we are looking for a talented front-end developer with strong JS skills and professional experience working with web-based technologies such as AngularJS, D3, SVG to take an active role in developing new visualizations and features for the portal. Having a passion for interactive data visualizations, you have experience wrangling and making sense of large, multi-dimensional and complex datasets. You will be working closely with our Senior Business Analyst and Product Owner to implement new features into the data portal.


Nice to have:



  • Working knowledge of interaction-design, usability, information visualization principles

  • Knowledge of visual encoding and understanding of their capabilities and limitations

  • Comfortable with mathematics and algorithms (dealing with power sets, recursions, graphs, abstract syntax trees)



Working on cutting edge technologies (BigData, Cloud environments, REST, Microservices, Object Storage ...), using modern programming languages (Java 1.8, Javascript, Python …) and frameworks (AngularJS, Spark, Spring Boot, Hadoop …), our teams strive to use technologies to obtain the best possible outcome.



If you are passionate about software development, are a quick learner, enjoy producing & sharing beautiful code and want to become part of a team building complex environments from the ground up, just get in touch.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer, Query Processing at Tableau Software (Palo Alto, CA)
item.description:
What you’ll be doing…


You’ll be developing cutting-edge software for the best visual data analysis products available. Query processing is one of the most complex technical challenges in Tableau. You will compile, optimize and rewrite queries for all different types of data sources. In addition to traditional relational query optimization, you’ll work on optimizing federated queries across multiple data sources with diverse, often non-relational, data models. You will be expanding the analytical product capabilities and performance of the Tableau products through query optimization and through our custom in-memory columnar storage engine. You will be constantly challenged to leverage your creativity and your technical prowess to improve Tableau.

Some of the things you’ll be doing include…



  • Extend and improve Tableau’s query pipeline that creates analytical queries enabling visualization of data.

  • Improve the performance and scalability of our in-memory data engine and extend it to support ever more diverse kinds of data.

  • Improve query performance through new algorithms, caching, concurrency, and scaling. These queries can operate on dozens of database platforms, enabling individual users and enterprises to rapidly federate and explore their data through insightful visualizations.

  • Create innovative algorithms to provide a better experience with live queries against an ever more diverse set of data sources. These may include API-based web data sources, cubes, graph data, relational and NoSQL systems such as Hadoop.

  • Leverage your creativity and technical prowess to extend our customer’s ability to see, understand, and “reach out and touch” their data; in whatever form that data it happens to be.

item.title: Sr. Software Engineer - Core Systems at Spatially (Seattle, WA) (allows remote)

  • Work as an integral member of highly motivated Product, Engineering, & Data Scientist teams to build plus manage scalable & Performance oriented software systems for an innovative Spatial Analytics Startup

  • Experience in Fast Paced Startup environments

  • Strong knowledge of OOP concepts, Functional & Reactive programming paradigms, design patterns, data structures & Algorithms

  • Strong passion to learn new technologies & methodologies

  • BS or MS computer science/related subject matter preferred or equivalent experience

  • Experience working in Polyglot code bases & systems

item.title: Software Programmer at Data Processors (Southbank, Australia)
item.description:
Due to expansion we are seeking direct applications from talented and passionate software programmers to join our Estimation and Evaluation team. The successful candidate will be joining an existing team of highly qualified and professional developers with a broad and proficient range of skills.

The types of systems that the successful candidate will support and test can broadly be defined within the family of algorithmic trading systems but don't let that scare you! Specific skills in finance and related algorithms are not required and domain specific information will be conveyed as part of on the job learning. Indeed, most of the work does not require specific knowledge but rather the willingness to learn and perseverance to ensure completion. Of key importance is the desire and willingness to solve problems of importance to business outcomes. Working well within a team is essential as is a dedicated and professional outlook on software development processes.

You will mainly be focused on the testing and support of general purpose software and systems to allow expert analysts to process online (live) and offline (historical) data. Online systems perform domain specific data transformations, algorithm application and validation of input and output data along with the hard performance constraint of a real-time system. Offline systems focus on algorithm evaluation (using distributed computation) and associated research and development (performed in collaboration with or by expert analysts).

Candidates with a Bachelor's degree in Software Engineering or Information/Computer Science will need to demonstrate experience in/with:



  • Software development environments using Agile methodologies

  • Unit testing frameworks such as JUnit, DUnit and/or PyUnit.

  • Build systems such as Jenkins and/or Bamboo.

  • One or more programming/scripting languages (Python, C#, C++/C, Java).

  • Defect Tracking and Source Control tools (eg. Jira, Subversion and Git).



You will need the following attributes:



  • Outstanding verbal and written communication skills including the ability to communicate effectively with technical and non-technical colleagues.

  • A strong proven focus on outcomes and deliverables..

  • The ability to think independently, act quickly and refocus following change.

  • A strong and proven desire to learn more effective and efficient ways of working.

  • Commitment to projects including extended post-implementation.

  • Self-motivated, pro-active and strong organisational skills.



The following competencies and experience would be considered valuable:



  • Delphi.

  • 2+ years experience in Quality Assurance/Testing or related experience .

  • Distributed computing/multi-threaded programming.

  • Statistical/numerical analysis.

  • Proficiency with XML/JSON data structures and constructs.

  • Hands-on testing experience with Windows, UNIX and/or Linux operations system.

  • SQL and PL/SQL.

  • TCP/IP and web technologies.


Ideally, we are seeking applications from candidates who are located in Australia and who already have the right to live and work here indefinitely and without any restrictions. However, if you hold the right to work in Australia unrestricted and indefinitely, but are not currently located here, but plan to be within the next month please apply.

Please do not hesitate and apply via the URL below.

Recruitment Process:

Please note due to the volume of applications received in response to our job adverts, applicants who have not applied via the URL will be automatically rejected. Those who have been short listed will be contacted with 72 hours of receipt of their application by a member of our HR team to schedule telephone interviews.

Following the initial telephone interview successful candidates will be required to attend a face to face interview which will include sitting a technical test specifically designed to test candidate ability for this position. The panel will consist of the Team Manager, Direct Manager and a Representative from the HR Team.

http://apply.dataprocessors.com.au

Please note all APPLICANTS MUST APPLY via the URL above and quote job reference PO65. Those who do not will be automatically rejected.

We look forward to receiving your application.

item.title: Principal Software Engineer - Hadoop, Big Data at Fidelity (Durham, NC)
item.description:
Fidelity’s Strategic Investment Products and Data (SIPD) technology organization is seeking a highly technical and passionate Principal Software Big Data Developer. The candidate will be responsible for leading and executing several of our strategic data initiatives for enabling the next generation customer analytical platform using big data technologies. This job also requires strong oral and written communication, relationship management and conflict resolution skills. The ideal candidate will be an energetic and resourceful team-player and leader who can effectively work with our globally distributed technology team. If you are looking for an opportunity to delve into the Big Data world with a leading technology organization, then this role is for you!


SIPD supports Fidelity's Managed Accounts business which delivers advisory solutions for Fidelity clients through the PWIS sales channels and online self-service channels such as Fidelity.com. 


This position is located full time in Durham, NC.


Responsibilities:



  • Work across technology teams to understand and define system and technical requirements for EDW and Big Data

  • Work and transition seamlessly between relational, data warehouse and big data platforms

  • Lead a team in the design/development of data ingestion and data transformation for EDW and big data applications

  • Lead the development of data pipelines using Hadoop, NoSQL, In-Memory and Distributed search platforms

  • Primary point of contact for development team to the project manager, lead systems analyst and QA lead

  • Design and deliver complex architectures for customers

  • Participates in requirements gathering and scope estimation meetings

  • Responsible for Technical Systems Design (TSD) document delivery and reviewing all project artifacts including requirements (SRA) and functional specifications (SDS)

  • Manage development for content pipeline and processing systems for real-time and predictive analytics

  • Capable of advanced performance tuning of hadoop jobs (hive, pig, map reduce, etc.)

  • Rapidly prototype and validate big data applications

  • Mentor software engineers in code design and optimization

  • Perform on-call support responsibilities with rotational schedule

item.title: Information Security Analyst at California State University - Northridge - CSUN (Los Angeles, CA)
item.description:
Job Title: Information Security Analyst
    
Job ID: 4977
    
Full/Part Time: Full-Time
    
Regular/Temporary: Regular
    
Job Code: 0420 Information Technology Consultant -12
    
Job Grade: Expert
    
Department: IT Information Security-8280
    

    
CSUN's Commitment to You
    
CSUN is strongly committed to achieving excellence through teaching, scholarship, active learning and diversity.  Our values include a respect for all people, building alliances with the community and the encouragement of innovation, experimentation and creativity.  CSUN actively encourages qualified candidates to apply who demonstrate a commitment to serving a diverse student population as well as a commitment to maintaining an inclusive work environment.
    
About the University
    
Serving more than 42,000 students each year, CSUN is one of the largest universities in the United States. CSUN ranks 10th in the country in awarding bachelor's degrees to underrepresented minority students, fifth nationally in awarding master's degrees to Hispanic students and enrolls the largest number of deaf and hard-of-hearing students of any U.S. state university. CSUN's 171 academic programs and engaged centers enjoy international recognition for excellence. CSUN currently partners with more than 100 institutions of higher education in 22 countries around the globe and attracts the largest international student population of any U.S. master's level institution. Situated on a 356-acre park-like setting in the heart of Los Angeles' San Fernando Valley, the campus features modern educational buildings and world-class LEED Gold-certified performing arts and recreational facilities recognized as among the best in the country. CSUN is a welcoming university that champions accessibility, academic excellence and student success.
    
Major Duties
    
Under the direction and general supervision of the Information Security Officer (ISO), the Information Security Analyst conducts regular security/risk assessments and internal security audits to identify gaps between campus policy/standards and current practices and procedures. The incumbent generates remediation action plans and manages through to completion with key stakeholders and system owners; conducts university-wide threat assessments, and recommend updates to the annual IS Plan, Policies and Standards; conducts confidential data and protected data system reviews; coordinates with campus procurement, vendors, and campus stakeholders to conduct documented product and service-provider security risk assessments; for on-premise and cloud-hosted solutions; manages the day-to-day operations of the campus-wide Information Security Awareness Training program, including online training management systems, development and distribution of periodic awareness updates via various communication channels, campus events, and targeted training sessions and department/college presentations for specialized risk areas; e.g. PCI, FERPA, HIPAA, Red Flags; generates security reports and key metrics, and produces management-level summaries.  In partnership with network engineering, monitors and tunes the university Intrusion Detection Systems; serves in a secondary capacity for conducting forensic investigations, incident response, security systems/server administration, and responding to reports/inquiries submitted by members of the university community via email, phone, in-person, and the case management system; perform other duties as assigned.
    
Qualifications
    
Equivalent to graduation from an accredited four-year college or university in Information Security, Computer Science or a job-related field.  Equivalent to five years of full-time, senior level experience working as part of an Information Security team in support of a medium-to-large diverse organization.
    
Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities
    
Thorough knowledge of the CISSP Information Security domains, risk assessment methodologies, NIST security standards, and California laws and regulations related to data privacy. General knowledge of LAN/WAN network systems, firewalls, VPNs, VoIP, virtual server platforms, storage area networks, web application development, and other information technology systems. Functional knowledge of: Desktop computers (Windows, XP, 7 and MAC OS X), Governance, Risk, and Compliance Systems (Risk Sharing Asset Management (RSAM)), Vulnerability Assessment Systems (Qualys and Accunetix), Forensics Equipment (Encase, BackTrack, media cloning hardware), Anti-Virus and Anti-Malware (Microsoft Security EndPoint (SCCM), Symantec EndPoint, and other AV/AM hardware and software), Awareness Training Software (SkillPort, LearnerWeb, SANS, etc.), Web Content Management System (Drupal), Intrusion Detection systems (Juniper firewall/IDS).  Ability and specialized skills to: apply and assess user needs; identify, analyze and address user problems; provide ongoing project leadership to technical development staff; analyze problems and propose effective solution; understand functional and procedural requirements and develop alternative solutions; relate system solutions to departmental management and staff; and communicate effectively both orally and in writing; make presentations; conduct meetings; provide user training; and establish and maintain effective working relationships with others. Excellent interpersonal, communication (written/verbal), analytical, organizational, teamwork and time management skills. Ability to build and maintain positive working relationships as part of a team.
    
Pay, Benefits, & Work Schedule
    
The university offers an excellent benefits package.

The salary range for this classification is: $6249 - $10,541
The anticipated hiring range: $6249 - $6667, dependent upon qualifications and experience.

Hours: Full-Time; 40 hrs/wk: Monday - Friday; 8:00am - 5:00pm.
    
General Information
    
This position is a sensitive position as designated by the CSU.

A background check (including a criminal records check) must be completed satisfactorily before any candidate can be offered a position with the CSU. Failure to satisfactorily complete the background check may affect the application status of applicants or continued employment of current CSU employees who apply for the position.

The person holding this position is considered a 'mandated reporter' under the California Child Abuse and Neglect Reporting Act and is required to comply with the requirements set forth in CSU Executive Order 1083 as a condition of employment.
    
How To Apply
    
Please complete the CSUN on-line application/resume upload submission process in order to be considered for any open position within the university and its auxiliaries. The hiring department will contact the best qualified candidates and invite them to participate in the interview process.

Application Screening begins September 9, 2015, and will continue until position is filled.

In order to be considered in the initial review, applications must be submitted prior to the date listed above. Application submissions received after the application screening date will be reviewed at the discretion of the University.

For more detailed information on the application and hiring process, please view the link below:
http://www.csun.edu/careers/
    
Equal Employment Opportunity
    
California State University, Northridge is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer.  We consider qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, gender, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, genetic information, medical condition, marital status, veteran status, or disability. Applicants who wish to request an accommodation for a disability may contact the Office of Equity and Diversity at (818) 677-2077.
    
  


Apply Here


PI91745615
