item.title: Big Data Applications Developer at 1010data (New York, NY)
item.description:
Our Retail Solutions team is seeking a creative, execution focused Developer to architect and build Big Data applications used by thousands of business users at Fortune 500 Retailers. 


With more than 20 trillion rows of data currently under management, 1010data is designed to scale to the largest volumes of granular data, the most disparate and varied data sets, and the biggest user populations. All while delivering lightning-quick system performance.


The 1010data Consumer Insights Platform (CIP) is 1010data’s premier retail data monetization portal which enables retailers to provide valuable and relevant store data to suppliers.


You will build applications that drive significant business value to retail customers by empowering merchants and suppliers to make better decisions through data-driven collaboration based on a single version of the truth. Example applications include analytically identifying the best promotions, forecasting sales, or creating analytic customer segments.  


Ideally you’re comfortable with SQL or a similar database query language, but experience with a specific programming language isnot required.  For us it’s more relevant that you are interested, willing and able to learn new languages quickly and possesses proven experience building (coding) software solutions. 


Using astoundingly powerful proprietary analytic database software, you will construct complex queries to produce actionable information to inform client business decisions.


Our culture of ownership ensure you will truly own the roadmap and architecture of applications you develop.


Big picture, fastidious developers that are able to operate with ambiguity yet always deliver will thrive in our flat organization that rewards results.


If you are passionate about using technology to solve real world business problems and add substantial value to the company—we would be excited to speak with you!


Responsibilities:



  • Develop and release production ready large-scale enterprise applications used by hundreds of customers and thousands of users

  • Build scalable code that can run analyses against billions of rows of transactions in seconds

  • Manage design of technical solutions to specs; Collaborate with key stakeholders (e.g users, analysts, sales) to understand requirements and build valuable applications

item.title: Senior Java Developer at Autodata Solutions (London, ON, Canada)
item.description:
Autodata Solutions is looking for multiple Senior Java Developers for their London, Ontario office.


Position Overview:


As the Senior Developer, your primary role is to design, code, test, debug and analyze software programs and applications. You will be expected to drive and contribute to researching, designing, documenting, and modifying software specifications throughout the production life cycle in areas with broad scope. This position contributes heavily to the guidance and mentoring of other developers.  This role is being offered as a permanent full-time opportunity without the option of working remotely. 


Key Responsibilities:



  • Write software components and applications according to specifications and industry standards with thorough code reviews and mentor others in this effort

  • Occasionally acting as the project Technical Lead, you will work with Business Analysts, Architects & other Programmers in conceptualizing and developing new software programs & applications

  • Guide & assist in the preparation and documentation of program requirements 

  • Run and monitor software performance tests on new and existing programs for the purposes of correcting errors, isolating areas for improvement and general debugging

  • Generate statistics and prepare reports for management and/or team members on the status of the project

  • Liaise with Network Administrators, Systems Analysts, Database Administrators and Software Engineers to assist in resolving problems with client software products or software systems


Apply for this role directly using the following link: Click Here!.  We look forward to hearing from you!  For more information about Autodata Solutions, we invite you to check out our website at www.autodata.net.


We thank all applicants for their interest however only those selected for an interview will be notified.  Autodata Solutions is an equal opportunity employer.  We are compliant with AODA legislation; if you require work related accommodations, please specify.

item.title: Senior Security Researcher at Kaspersky Lab (Woburn, MA) (allows remote)
item.description:
The senior security researcher reports to the head of the Global Research and Analysis Team (GReAT) in the United States. The position will encompass a wide range of activities, including technical anti-malware research, tracking APT campaigns, discovery of new threats, government relations and media activities.


Job Location could be considered. Working from home is an option.


Responsibilities



  • Active technical research on IT security issues and malware threats.

  • Participate in GReAT research activities by assisting with malware sample collection, collaboration with external entities and providing
    guidance and ideas on forensics.

  • Participate in the discovery and investigations into new and ongoing advanced threat actors (global APT research).

  • Create and deliver presentations at internal and external security events.

  • Actively participate in press tours and Security Analyst Summit
    planning.

  • Develop and maintain relationships with top journalists and actively
    participate in social media as part of the company’s expert positioning
    activities.

  • Serve as a company expert on security topics for media, as required by PR teams globally.

  • Participate in government relations activities.

  • Participate in meetings and presentations to government officials to disclose current research and emerging threats.

  • Help support and pre-sales teams with intelligence on malware threat landscape. Assist local sales/marketing/support teams with
    presentations at partner conferences and local events.

  • Engage in operations with respected national and international law enforcement to aggressive fight against cybercrime. Provide
    intelligence for expert positioning and to Anti Malware Research operations.

  • Assist with promotion and correlation of malware threat research with technologies. Assist with reviewing white-papers and videos to
    promote company technology.

  • Content creation; analyse and describe malicious threats and create blog posts for SecureList.com and Threatpost.com. Make short and
    long term predictions on the evolution of threats.

  • Proposes ideas aimed at improving performance of GReAT and assumes responsibility for achieving group goals.

  • Prototype development; imagine and develop prototypes or new technologies.

  • Assist with testing newly released products and technologies from Kaspersky and competitors.

  • Additional activities could be assigned.


The Team


Established in 2008, the Global Research & Analysis Team (GReAT) is an integral part of Kaspersky Lab’s R&D department, and leads the company’s anti-malware research and innovation. The team’s security analysts are based around the world, each contributing a unique set of skills and expertise to the research and design of solutions to combat increasingly complex malware code. Today, GReAT comprises 40 experts working in Europe, Russia, the Americas, Asia, and the Middle East. Costin G. Raiu has led the team since 2010.


GReAT undertakes incident response for the company’s customers during malware-related incidents. Other key departmental responsibilities include thought leadership in threat intelligence, driving and executing initiatives focused on improving malware detection accuracy rates and efficiency, and supporting key customer accounts with malware intelligence expertise.

item.title: Senior Business Analyst at Code42 Software, Inc. (Minneapolis, MN)
item.description:
The Senior Business Analyst is responsible for the planning, delivery, launch, and ongoing optimization of Code42’s business operations by creating & modifying our critical business processes empowered by best in class business application tools, workflow automation & business intelligence. You will develop the strategic vision and roadmap for critical business units you support. You will be responsible for managing the intake of requests, establish working teams to define the requirements, translate them into technical requirements when necessary, prioritize their delivery and manage them through execution. You will provide business process leadership to both our business units, as well as our technical delivery teams. As a key driver in the business you will anticipate bottlenecks, mitigate project risks, quantify the impact of making tradeoffs, and balance business needs against technical constraints. You will work closely with stakeholders across the to identify and drive innovative solutions that achieve business goals and align with long-term vision.

A successful candidate will be well versed in what it takes to ensure business process efficiency and excellence that can scale with us not just this year but in the years to come. Implementing & configuring best in class business systems will be key tools to help deliver positive results. You’ve done this before, and you’re excited to do it again-bigger, faster, better. You will be measured on two major areas: (1) delivering the scalable business processes, controls and tools that allow us to achieve hyper-growth (2) continually driving down cycle times in key transactional areas that allow our existing teams to do more with less. 



YOU’LL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR



  • Identifies project requirements by interviewing customers; analyzing operations; determining project scope; documenting project success metrics

  • Develops problem solutions by describing requirements in a work-flowchart and diagram; studying system capabilities; analyzing alternative solutions; preparing business requirements for delivery by internal development teams, or external 3rd parties

  • Develops project requirements & estimates by identifying phases and elements, personnel requirements, and costs.

  • Determines operational objectives by studying business functions; gathering information; evaluating output requirements and formats.

  • Monitors project progress by tracking activity; resolving problems; publishing progress reports; recommending actions.

  • Helps coordinate user-acceptance testing & sign-off for changes in process & tools

  • Provides training to user groups as needed on process & tool changes

  • Maintains process & system quality by researching and resolving problems; maintaining data integrity and security.

  • Maintains quality service by establishing and enforcing organization standards.

  • Prepares reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information.

  • Maintains professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; benchmarking state-of-the-art practices; participating in professional societies.

  • Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.

item.title: Front End Web & E-Commerce Developer/Digital Applications Analyst at Jarden Consumer Solutions (Boca Raton, FL)
item.description:
Responsibilities



  • You will work as part of a cross functional, IT development team responsible for new application development, integration and/or improving existing applications to meet the changing needs of our business.

  • Hands-on development of web based applications in a public facing, global e-commerce environment (Demandware) including integrations with external systems and third parties such as CMS, CRM, ERP and payment processors. Involvement spans all aspects of front and back end development, from making pixel perfect sites to integrating code with backend systems.

  • Develop reusable UI components that address customer requirements and business needs.

  • Actively participate in all phases of the software development life cycle including analysis, design, development, testing and implementation.

  • Maintain and support existing applications including content updates, functional enhancements and issue resolution.

  • Perform QA and regression testing of web components including but not limited to browser compatibility.

  • Comply with source code and release management processes.

  • Build and maintain good, positive relationships with both internal and external partners.


DESIRED SKILLS AND KNOWLEDGE:



  • Strong client-side web development skills including the ability to take designs from Photoshop and hand-code pixel-perfect, standards-compliant, maintainable, scalable and valid cross-browser XHTML/HTML5, CSS/CSS3 and JavaScript/JQuery.

  • Familiarity with JavaScript beyond jQuery, and knowledge of modern JavaScript patterns such as modules, closures, and callbacks.

  • Must be a well rounded and flexible technology professional with a strong work ethic that is willing and able to learn new things quickly.

  • Familiarity with scrum and working in an agile project environment.

  • Ability to work on multiple projects, reprioritize as needed and consistently deliver on time.

  • Self-motivated problem solver with strong attention to detail, time management and organizational skills.

  • Strong teamwork and interpersonal skills; ability to effectively communicate and thrive in a cross-functional development environment as well as stay on task when working alone.

  • Understanding of complex ecommerce environments, architectures and integrations.

  • Strong working knowledge of object oriented analysis, design and development.

  • A solid understanding of usability, search engine optimization (SEO) and information architecture.

  • Passion for everything web related and knowledge of cloud based technologies.

item.title: Principal Test Analyst at Department for Work and Pensions (Leeds, UK)
item.description:
Here at the Department for Work and Pensions (DWP) we are re-platforming our entire IT onto new hardware, operating systems, application server technologies and application integrations, conducting large scale data migration, introducing new functionality and modernising front end user interfaces and applications. These IT systems underpin the services that support 22m citizens, annual processing of 7.35m benefit claims, payment of £165bn in benefits and pensions, and over 90,000 employees across 950 locations.


Key accountabilities: 


1. Define QA and Testing Processes and Tooling for your team 


Work with all other roles throughout the team to agree assurance and testing processes to assure the quality of their output such that it is unambiguous and consumable by following processes 


Drive ‘Shift Left’: work to define processes that reduce or eliminate defects by engineering in quality from the outset


Define Testing processes to exercise software produced, spanning functional, performance, security, accessibility, and operational testing and utilising appropriate test automation


Work with the team to identify tooling for use throughout the lifecycle, with an emphasis on smooth interfacing to allow process continuity (continuous build/integration/testing/delivery)


Follow continuous delivery principles, for example, regularly reflect on and adjust your approach to be more effective

2. Execution of Testing Activities within your team (during ‘Sprints’ and / or small iterative cycles)
Take responsibility for ensuring the conducting of test activities within your agile team


Integrate within the full Agile lifecycle, attending all regular meetings, identifying work you’ll progress, progress and blockers


Build automated tests utilising your own and departmental frameworks to ensure maintainability (cross-browser and cross-platform)


Conduct performance tests and lead reviews on tuning applications and infrastructure components


Conduct application and infrastructure penetration testing to validate security against the OWASP Testing Guide and in line with CESG (CHECK) and NIST standards


Conduct operational acceptance testing to include monitoring (e.g. protective monitoring and GPG-13), alerting, transactional integrity, failover and recovery (resilience testing), disaster recovery where applicable, and log rotation. Working with WebOps team to define quality operational standards


Conduct automated and manual accessibility testing; WCAG 2.0 AA or AAA conformance with user testing of zoom technology, screen readers, speech technology, plain English, and general understanding of WAI-ARIA (across mobile and desktop devices).


Direct any other Test professionals or team members engaged in testing


Engage specialist support (inside or outside of Testing) in areas such as automation, performance and security


Leading the continuous quality improvement activities through to ‘Live’ and beyond including defect reduction

3. Contribute to the Test Community
Share best practice and actively seek to improve consistency of approach and compliance with GDS (Government Digital Service) standards.


Actively network within DWP and outside to share your approach, take ideas and input from others, and to support others their work delivery


Attend and contribute to Test Community meetings and events


Engage with local Academy programmes to encourage inclusion of Testing content within Academy content and offer a local contact for academy trainers and attendees when Testing questions arise.

item.title: Senior Data Scientist at Clutch Holdings LLC (Ambler, PA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Clutch is looking for an exceptional data scientist to synthesize and leverage our rich dataset of consumer and multi-channel transaction data to help our brands achieve their aggressive marketing goals.


This is a unique opportunity to join a new, multidisciplinary team of creative and passionate individuals determined to change and innovate how data is used to influence customer outcomes. We are focused on the company’s product strategy, and work on high-impact projects, utilizing a mix of open source and in-house tools and techniques to deliver insights.


We’re a lean, flat, and experimental team combining science and engineering to identify and inject high-value insights into our client brands' marketing strategies. The team works in quick iterations, using the techniques and algorithms best suited for solving the challenging problems of industries like high-fashion retail, QSR, Automotive, Pharmaceutical, and many other verticals.


What you’ll be doing:


You will advocate, evangelize, and build data-fueled products that help our brands maximize their customer strategies. You’ll dig in and become an expert on our datasets. You will provide insight into leading analytic practices, design and lead iterative learning and development cycles, and ultimately produce new and creative analytic solutions that will become part of our core deliverables.


You will work with cross-functional team members to identify and prioritize actionable, high-impact insights across a variety of core business areas. You will lead applied analytics initiatives that are leveraged across the breadth of our solutions. You will research, design, implement and validate cutting-edge algorithms to analyze diverse sources of data to achieve targeted outcomes.


As our data scientist, you will provide expertise on mathematical concepts for the broader technical and business team(s), and inspire the adoption of advanced analytics and data science across the entire breadth of our organization.

We are seeking  talented, self-motivated software engineers who have experience with C#, .NET, Object Oriented design and implementation and Web Services.  Working closely with a team of analysts, developers, QA and other business resources you will be continuously improving and enhancing the primary interface for our growing customer base.  We work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment where you will have the opportunity to grow and refine your skills while rotating through research and development, mainline development and sustaining environments.

item.title: Lead QA Analyst at NorthPage (Southbury, CT)
item.description:
We are seeking a Lead QA Analyst to join our team that has direct hands on experience testing software and web based applications. The Lead QA Analyst will be responsible for leading the effort of testing and assuring that each release of our software platform is of the highest quality.


About you



  • You are passionate about software quality and have a strong attention to detail with superior organization skills.

  • You are a self-learner that can quickly gain knowledge and understanding of new technologies, tools and frameworks through research and hands on work.

  • You enjoy learning from and sharing your knowledge with the members on your team through mutual mentoring and collaboration.

  • You are experienced with a variety of different tools and strategies for both automated and manual testing.

  • Ideally, you have experience in testing commercial software, or consumer facing web applications.

  • You are an expert at isolating and documenting the steps necessary to reproduce software defects.


Responsibilities


The Lead QA Analyst will work closely with the NorthPage R&D team to learn and understand the architecture, deployment and features of the NorthPage software platform to develop and maintain a comprehensive set of test plans. A critical function of the Lead QA Analyst role will be to establish testing methodologies for software that is delivered in a continuous deployment model.


The Lead QA Analyst will be responsible for working with team members to make sure that software defects and issues are tracked accurately and subsequently closed in our issue tracking system.

item.title: Linux Engineer; DevOps at 1010data (New York, NY)
item.description:
1010data has created the fastest database in the world via an easy-to-use, spreadsheet-like interface to make big data discovery easy across retail, consumer packaged goods, financial services, healthcare and telecom.


We are Seeking a Dev Ops, Linux Engineer skilled with handling large production environments to expand, automate and maintain our Linux fleet. 


With more than 20 trillion rows of data currently under management, 1010data is designed to scale to the largest volumes of granular data, the most disparate and varied data sets, and the biggest user populations. All while delivering lightning-quick system performance. 


If you have a passion for high performance computing you will be instrumental in building tools to manage a highly scalable, 24/7 available platform for data analysis. 



With a focus on scripting, process re-engineering and continuous integration; you blend the skills of an analyst with the technical chops of an engineer to architect solutions on issues that affect the entire company.


If you value the power of driving strategic vendor decisions and are confident in embracing new technologies to tackle our high volume, scalable problems we would like to speak with you! 


Responsibilities:



  • Scaling, managing and automating our Linux fleet as 1010data grows. 

  • Automate the management of cloud computing infrastructure

  • Build out HA/DR computing solutions

  • Ensure the overall health and performance of production environment

  • Proactively identify trends, determine root causes, and initiate appropriate action to resolve issues. 

  • Investigate and resolve hardware and software issues

  • Responsible for production systems sometimes after hours or weekends.

item.title: PROGRAMMER ANALYST at Western Nevada College (Carson City, NV)

Complete job description and to apply online, https://jobs.wnc.edu/postings/1348

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at SugarCRM (Cupertino, CA)
item.description:
We are looking for a highly skilled Senior Software Engineer to join the Intelligence Services team and revolutionize the CRM industry.  We are acquiring massive data points and applying cutting edge data science techniques to provide insights to our customers that will help facilitate a paradigm shift in how they interact with their CRM system.  You must be an exceptional developer with an entrepreneurial spirit and a get it done attitude to be successful in this role. 2U is a leading provider of software-based education, enabling premier universities to take their Master’s degree programs to the online space. We separate ourselves by offering well-designed and intuitive learning products that deliver the best education possible. If you decide to join us, you will have the opportunity to work with a dynamic group of Engineers, QA Analysts, and other Product Managers building and maintaining these learning products that will be used by faculty and graduate students from some of the top universities in the world.

item.title: Senior Software Development Engineer, AWS Networking at Amazon (Dublin, Ireland)
item.description:
Amazon is looking for Software Development Engineers to build the software that monitors one of the world’s largest and most complex networks. Tens of millions of customers rely on Amazon’s network for using our retail websites, accessing content on their Kindles and building applications and businesses on top of Amazon Web Services (AWS). Our goal is to become The Infrastructure Platform for the world - achieving this goal requires high-leverage, massively scalable software systems. Our success depends on our world-class network infrastructure, and our network depends on our Network Monitoring team.



· You are interested in being part of a high-bar team with global responsibility for the Network Monitoring software used across all of Amazon’s businesses.

· Solving problems at scale excites you.

· You don’t implement specs from analysts and architects - you talk to your customers and design solutions to their problems. You automate and innovate.

· You do not push just one technology agenda - you choose the best tool for the problem at hand.

· You believe that the craft of software engineering is about writing code right the first time. For you, code reviews and automated testing are not chores - they’re a core part of writing great software.

· You don’t throw your code over the wall. You launch it, own it, support it and make it incrementally better for the benefit of your customers.

· You enjoy working in a flexible, fast-paced, collaborative team environment.

· Computer Science degree, or equivalent experience.

· Ability to gather customer requirements and deliver innovative solutions.

· Strong track record of launching projects of significant complexity.

· Ability to mentor other software developers to maintain architectural vision and software quality.

· Experience with software engineering best practices (code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, release and change management).

· Very strong problem solving and coding skills.

· Understanding of data structures, algorithms and their performance.

· Proficient at designing software systems, from high-availability large-scale distributed systems to your application’s object model.

· Understanding of the building blocks of computer systems; comfortable working with bits & bytes.

· Knowledge of at least one scripting language.

· Comfortable with Linux and a good understanding of networking concepts.



· Experience of working in a DevOps team.

· Experience developing robust, highly scalable distributed systems.



aws-sdesdm-ea

item.title: Full Stack Engineer - Budapest at Prezi.com (Budapest, Magyarország)

We're looking for an engineer interested in writing and running the mission-critical backend services of Prezi and building forward thinking web experiences and interactions for our users.  


As a Full Stack Engineer, you’ll have the opportunity to work with a growing start-up, building things millions of people will see everyday. You will experience and experiment with new technologies and work with a group of people whom you can learn and keep pushing things forward. This position is located in our Budapest office.

item.title: Principal UI Developer at ADP (Roseland, NJ) (allows remote)

The Principal Application Developer is responsible for developing the ADP Reporting product for ADP's external clients. The ADP Reporting team is focused on building a cutting edge reporting product with a simple mission -- make it beautiful, performant, simple and useful. The product will include a simple drag and drop interface, report preview, a library of categorized fields/reports and will extend to the manager persona. The reporting solution will be tightly integrated with the Analytics solution to enhance the user reporting experience while also providing insightful information combining transactions data with predictive analytics, benchmarks and mash-up data so users can make intelligent business decisions.

The right candidate will not only have strong technical skills but also possess the leadership skills needed to mentor junior developers (onshore and offshore) while meeting their own deliverables. We seek someone who is continually looking to grow, technically, as our architecture stack continues to evolve to meet the changing demands of our clients and growing user base.



Principal Application Developers work with product managers analysts, architects and engineers to plan, design, develop, test and implement information technology solutions consistent with the business objective.


Principal Application Developers at ADP are expected to be results-oriented, have knowledge of new and legacy technologies, have knowledge of the relevant platforms and environments, and be familiar with business process, functions and data within their domain to provide innovative, insightful, and secure solutions.

item.title: Node.js Developer at ADP (New York, NY)
item.description:
Unlock Your Career Potential: Technology at ADP. Do you enjoy exploring, identifying and inspiring the future of the workplace and the lives of millions of people? At ADP, the world's largest B2B cloud company, our Technology team is comprised of brilliant engineers, architects, data scientists, infrastructure experts, and more. Named one of Forbes' "Most Innovative Companies" and one of Computerworld's "100 Best Places to Work in IT", we are committed to leading the way in product development and research, empowering you to bring to life the latest innovations that will forever change the way businesses manage their most vital asset, employees.



ADP is searching for a successful Senior Application Developer with Node.js to join our high performance team. The successful candidate will have a strong command of software programming, latest web technologies and frameworks. This is a senior position responsible for developing innovative, scalable and highly interactive web applications.
We strive for every interaction to be driven by our CORE values:Insightful Expertise, Integrity is Everything, Service Excellence, Inspiring Innovation, Each Person Counts, Results-Driven, & Social Responsibility.


Responsibilities



  • Collaborate with business analysts to define software requirements for programming effort

  • Design and implement backend application interfaces for data and services

  • Support production software operations, test and debug programs

  • Report progress and status of assigned tasks to project teams and managers

  • Provide technical leadership and motivation to junior developers


 Qualifications



  • Expert in JavaScript development

  • Experience with Node.JS, REST and JSON

  • Strong understanding of object oriented design and MVC patterns

  • Programming skills on other languages i.e. Java, PHP, and Python

  • Experience with SQL and NoSQL data stores, preferably MongoDB

  • Experience with systems across multiple platforms Windows, Linux and UNIX.

  • Experience with open source software

  • Excellent understanding of web security practices

  • Good understanding of agile development and continuous integration

  • Strong written and verbal communication skills

  • Passion for great user experience

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related discipline is desirable

  • 5+ years of hands-on experience developing Web applications

item.title: Senior Big Data Architect at Warner Music Group (New York, NY)
item.description:
This is an exciting opportunity for a self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced environment looking to join the Big Data solutions team at Warner Music Group. 


Are you a passionate Big Data Architect looking for a new challenge? You get excited defining and leading engineering efforts for product vision, requirements and execution of customer driven innovation. You have a passion for coaching and mentoring teams. You take action on creative solutions and ideas. You thrive in a team environment, knowing that the whole is greater than the sum of its parts. You look at problems from different angles and seek out fresh perspectives. Warner Music Group wants to speak with you about how we can transform the music industry together!!!


Your Role and Responsibilities:



  • A self-starter who is a technology as well as a people person. Should be able to work in different abstractions from the lowest i.e. code and to the highest i.e. architecting and designing systems. Also be able to work with different teams and people to understand and facilitate the deliverables in a timely fashion.

  • Design and build scalable infrastructure and platform to collect and process very large amounts of data (structured and unstructured), including streaming real-time data.

  • Architect the data pipeline to meet the needs of a technology centric company.

  • Hands-on development as well as mentoring of a team of Data Platform Engineers.

  • Collaborate with key stakeholders to understand, document and prioritize key technology decisions, processes and business needs for data and intelligence. This will require an extensive technical background and experience with working on big data in a highly distributed environment.

  • Work with business analysts and business stakeholders to help define technology needs for the logging, processing, storage and presentation of data in a manner that delivers business value.

  • Liaise with other development and reporting teams through the implementation process of new reporting systems.

  • Create, define and deliver new processes that will enable better development efficiencies.

  • Own a road map to automate and key reports in a consistent and scalable fashion.

item.title: Analytics Platform Engineer at MuleSoft (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
MuleSoft changes the way the world stays connected through data.  Our award winning engineering team develops integration solutions for fellow engineers around the globe and we’re looking to grow!  Our newest engineers will shape our world-class analytics platform, participate in architectural discussions, and choose development technologies.


MuleSoft has a growing portfolio of highly distributed and reliable connectivity products and our analytics engineers will build a platform which allows end users to analyze and share massive amounts of transactional data. This position also offers daily exposure to influencers within the API, Cloud and Integration markets.

Position details:


Our analytics software engineer will pioneer a big-data analytics platform which provides the back-bone for how we collect, analyze and share transactional data and metrics from tens of thousands of integration and API machines distributed in the cloud. This real-time analytics product will be used for cloud reporting and optimizing the behavior of our customer’s systems at runtime.  You’ll work on a customer facing solution which sits at the center of various distributed architecture stacks across the Fortune 500.The product spans the entire Anypoint platform and your end users will be our customer’s developers, analysts and the C-Suite.


The analytics function of our Anypoint platform is still in architectural phase.  You will participate in architectural discussions, shape the platform, choose technologies, and have a direct impact on the newest part of our product line.

item.title: Platform Analyst at Associated Electric Cooperative, Inc. (Springfield, MO)
item.description:
Come to a place where your talents are appreciated, your voice is heard, and your work has an impact.  Candidates must be passionate, talented people who love solving unique problems, wearing many hats and working with customers.



The Springfield Headquarters is currently seeking applicants to fill a Platforms Analyst position in the Corporate Services Department of the Information Services Division.  The Platforms Analyst role works with business partners and other development members to define and review system specifications. The Platforms Analyst will manage significant projects involving external parties, the technical team and business partners. This will include overall ownership of milestones and deliverables, project proposals, business justification and communication efforts. This position will then oversee the evaluation, acquisition, integration, configuration, design, administration and troubleshooting of the enterprise wide platform systems including but not limited to SharePoint, SiteFinity, and K2 Blackpearl. The Platforms Analyst will be called upon as needed to perform various tasks on projects, including solution design, development, testing, debugging, and deploying. To be successful, this role will require a varied mix of skills including the ability to prioritize, communicate, analyze problems, develop solutions and understand numerous technologies. This position interfaces primarily with other team members, external parties and business partners.

item.title: Technical Implementation Specialist at Rally Health, Inc. (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
The business/systems analyst role will support the Rally Enterprise pillar as a technical resource. This will include a variety of requirements analysis/development tasks, as well as documentation and process improvement. This resource will also engage in and manage external facing conversations with Rally’s Enterprise partners.


Roles & Responsibilities include:


Specific Responsibilities:



  • Provide Post-sales Requirements analysis and development support to multiple Enterprise teams.



  • Help evaluate, define, and improve process around requirements development and handoff in these areas.



  • Help develop Single Sign On (SSO) creation processes and documentation.



  • Configure inbound and outbound SSO using PingFederate and track all relevant details in the SSO inventory document.



  • Provide a technical resource during SSO kickoff conversations and act as a liaison with partner technical teams as needed during development and testing phases.



  • Develop and improve descriptive documentation around new partner onboarding.



  • Provide a technical resource to support conversations around new partner onboarding.



  • Interface with Partner/Client technical teams to help with solution development in cases where these requirements push us into the brave new world of previously undeveloped functionality.



  • Act as an escalation path for certain production support issues.


General Responsibilities:



  • Planning: related to the tasks associated with business analysis and the software development lifecycle (KanBan, Scrum, Agile).



  • Stakeholder Analysis: identify the stakeholders who will be impacted by requested changes and requirements and make sure those dependencies are communicated.



  • Risk assessment: identify risk, probability, impact and mitigation strategy.



  • Relationship Management: assess and grow relationships with external partners and 3rd party vendors. Determine when and how to leverage these relationships as new problems present themselves.   



  • Elicitation: questioning techniques to gather information at the right level of detail and scope to represent all of the stakeholder’s needs, and the ability to ask questions that lead to an understanding of the business need rather than what they want.



  • Manage Requirements: understand the requirements change process, and traceability. (Help to build this out in the current organization.)



  • Interface analysis: the understanding of technology infrastructure and how it interconnects, including sharing data to achieve a business goal.



  • Writing requirements using different approaches such as use cases, activity diagrams, sequence diagrams and state charts, data dictionaries, class or entity relationship diagrams.



  • User experience, knowing how a user interface helps the user to successfully complete a task, also known as usability.


Requirements:



  • Minimum of 5 years experience working in some combination of: business analysis, systems analysis, programming, operations,  or other technical pursuit that relies heavily on problem solving and learning from your mistakes.



  • Must be adaptable, proactive, energetic, and willing to learn and deliver on a variety of tasks and responsibilities



  • Superior verbal and written communications skills



  • Proven ability to work in a fast-paced environment focused on continuous product innovation



  • Background with Agile, Scrum, and other software development methodologies is strongly preferred



  • Familiarity with JIRA is a bonus



  • Must be strong with attention to detail including proven ability to manage simultaneously competing priorities



  • Willingness to roll up your sleeves and do whatever is necessary



  • Ability to think strategically and execute methodically


Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer, Solar Performance Analytics at SolarCity (San Mateo, CA)
item.description:
SolarCity is seeking a talented developer to develop software tools in Python to evaluate photovoltaic system performance. You will work with a team of analysts who are experts in how solar systems function, and need your help to implement smart software algorithms that identify underperforming systems. You will develop both the underlying analysis engine, and the user interface and data visualization tools used by our teams responsible for servicing underperforming photovoltaic systems.


The ideal candidate would have proven results in developing user interfaces and middleware for data analysis. You seek out the simplest solution, but don’t shy away from more complicated algorithms and mathematics when appropriate. You like leading the full software development cycle, from requirements gathering and architecture, through coding, testing, and deployment, and you enjoy working on small teams, where you can make a big individual impact.

item.title: Front End/UI Software Engineer at ObservePoint (Provo, UT)
item.description:
Come help us develop a scalable, distributed platform for ObservePoint's SaaS product!


ObservePoint's engineering team is an agile, value focused team.  We believe first and foremost in getting the right thing done for the right person.  The team is currently developing a state-of-the-art distributed, highly scalable quality management platform to bring unprecedented value to our customers.  To support us in our efforts, we're looking for talented, forward thinking engineers with a passion for delivering amazing products to happy customers.


As a front end/UI software engineer at ObservePoint, you will design, develop, and maintain a scalable SaaS application built on top of a service oriented architecture.  A successful candidate will work together with a talented UX expert, a team of other software engineers (including QA), and a product owner.


Some of the technologies we're using to build our platform are: 



  • AngularJS for the web application (this would be where the front end engineers will work most)

  • Scala and Play for the API

  • Scala and Akka for the backend micro services 

  • Cassandra and MySQL for database solutions

item.title: Senior Front End Developer at Semantico Limited (Brighton, UK)
item.description:
Semantico is an award winning digital publishing solutions company with offices in the UK and USA. We build data driven websites and web applications, delivering innovative publishing solutions for leading publishers, institutions and scholarly societies such as Oxford University Press, Wiley, Bloomsbury and McGraw-Hill Professional.


We have a great opportunity for an experienced Senior Front End Developer to join our highly collaborative, cross functional Design/Production team.


Working with the Head of Design, our User Experience Architect and Business Analysts, you will help create a culture of quality, innovation and excellence. This is an important role within Semantico as you will be responsible for the direction and integration of our front end technologies, and influential in the growth of our front end team.


Your role will involve interaction with developers, UX practitioners and visual designers to produce effective user interfaces, taking part in multiple projects and sharing a team ethos. We build both customised and 'out of the box' solutions, building platforms that enable publishers to distribute their content online: our designs are original and innovative and offer the chance for you to develop your skills in a highly specialised environment.


We are seeking someone who has demonstrable experience in all aspects of digital production processes and possesses excellent communication and time management skills. Our ideal candidate will be pro-active, positive, able to anticipate issues, have a ‘can do’ attitude and be willing to work outside of their comfort zone when necessary.


Experience of javascript and MVC/MVP is vital, as is knowledge of a commercial/agency environment and an interest in emerging technologies.


In return, you will join an ambitious and expanding company who builds strong teams with an emphasis on training, innovation and skill sharing. Our aim is to continue to grow and to nurture from within, creating an organisation made up of committed and innovative staff who are at the core of our projects. Our staff have the opportunity to contribute to and attend key meetings, travelling to clients based in the UK and North America.


We offer a generous salary, benefits including an individual personal training budget as well as internal training programmes, a contributory pension plan, 31 days’ holiday inclusive of public holidays and increasing with service, Cycle to Work scheme, childcare vouchers, fruit delivered to the office and the best coffee in Brighton.


To apply for this position, please read the full job description below before sending in your CV and a cover letter that includes your salary expectations and why you feel you are suitable for the role to HR@semantico.com


The closing date for submissions is mid-day on 23 September 2015.


We will endeavour to reply to all applicants to advise whether or not they have been invited to interview.


Please note:  If it is not obvious from your application that you have the right to work in the UK, please confirm in your covering letter that you have this right and are UK based, or that you are moving to the UK and specify the timescales for your relocation.


Full Job Description


Primary Purpose of the Role:



  • The Senior FED will be an experienced developer who will have control of the use of front-end technologies and processes.

  • The mentoring aspect of the front-end team will include leading front-end team meetings and working with the development team leader group in a continuous improvement program.

  • The Senior FED will be passionate about technology; have exceptional technical and problem solving skills, and a positive, results driven attitude with a personable and approachable character.

  • The Senior FED should anticipate problems before they occur, manage risk and find ways to accomplish project goals regardless of changing circumstances.


Principal Relationships:



  • Head of Design & UX

  • Development team leads

  • User Experience architect

  • Business Analyst

  • Project Managers


Key Responsibilities and Tasks:



  • Lead, inspire and motivate the front-end team

  • Control of front-end technology decisions

  • Ownership over Semantico’s accessibility standards

  • Maintain high quality code output from team members

  • Meet development milestones on time and to a high level of quality

  • Technical leadership of multiple projects, including responsibility for quality of delivered solution

  • Mentor and lead front-end developers and manage freelance resources

  • Interaction with client throughout product life-cycle

  • Assist with the creation and sign off of specifications,wireframes and designs

  • Work closely with the Head of Design and other team leads on continuous improvement

  • Recruitment of front-end development personnel

  • Training of front-end development personnel

  • Experienced in all aspects of digital production processes


The above list of job duties is not exclusive or exhaustive and you will be required to undertake such tasks as may reasonably be expected within the scope of the job.

item.title: MongoDB Engineer at Rally Software (Boulder, CO)
item.description:
Rally is seeking an experienced, self-motivated, and passionate MongoDB Engineer to join our team. As a MongoDB Engineer, you’ll be largely responsible for providing operational database services to the organization. This position includes production as well as development DBA tasks, as such it will require a commitment on your part as well as ours.


About the Team


Here at Rally we try to do things a little differently. Whether it's re-imagining how SaaS is implemented and scaled, blameless postmortems, pushing to production on your very first day, we don't subscribe to the mantra of "Because we've always done it that way".


We believe that small, empowered, self-motivated teams can do big things. We also believe in the right tool for the job, not language-as-religion.


About the Job


As a database and data store administrator, you will be part of a team of highly-skilled engineers that manage all production, test and ancillary data environments.  While there are a number of different systems, Rally is consolidating to MongoDB and Oracle as the primary data systems.  This position will be focused on MongoDB first, and Oracle second, and will be expected to cross-train the other DBAs on MongoDB best practices, management and implementation.  The position requires on-call availability to support our 24x7x365 SaaS operations.  


Responsibilities:




  • Monitoring and administering data systems security in AWS and colo environments.




  • Analyzing data stored in the databases and data stores and making recommendations relating to performance and efficiency of that data storage.




  • Helping application programmers to efficiently utilize the data assets by assisting in database schema design and recommending the best design for scalability and performance.




  • Proactively monitor systems for optimum performance and capacity constraints.




  • Establishing standards and best practices for database backup and recovery.




  • 2+ years of production Oracle DBA experience.




  • 3+ years of production MongoDB management experience.




  • Experience with Oracle RDBMS running on Linux.




  • Experience managing, implementing, monitoring and scaling MongoDB in AWS




  • Strong experience supporting mission critical data infrastructure




  • Some experience and knowledge of an Oracle 11g database for an OLTP application in areas such as best practices, scalability, performance, and reliability.




  • Experience with Oracle and/or MongoDB performance tuning.




  • Experience with Oracle standby databases. Active Data Guard experience a plus.




  • Skilled in scripting and automating repetitive administrative tasks.




  • Experience with backup, recovery, and DR best practices.




About You


You enjoy the challenges and opportunities that come from managing data stores in a large-scale SaaS application environment.  You have a love for automation, predictive analysis, capacity planning and thrive on continuous improvement. You have a strong customer-oriented attitude and collaborate frequently with development teams and the rest of Infrastructure Engineering to solve problems, make recommendations, and help Rally excel.  You’re active in the open source community, understand the power of community and openly share your expertise.  You have experience creating, running and scaling data stores and databases in high-availability environments.


You will be successful in this role if you:




  • Are detail oriented and understand the need for precision working with data infrastructure




  • Have worked extensively with MongoDB and ideally Oracle, or are willing to aggressively ramp up on which of those two you are least familiar with




  • Have strong database and data store administration skills and seek out opportunities to improve and automate everything




  • Enjoy fast-paced, CI/CD environments with lots of collaboration




  • Understand big data at scale




  • Have a passion for learning




  • Understand AWS and deploying data stores to cloud environments as well as Oracle on old skool bare metal




Rally’s global headquarters is in Boulder, Colorado, with 10 additional offices spanning 4 continents. At Rally we believe that we can’t inspire innovation in our customers if we’re not innovative ourselves. We empower our teams by offering them flexibility, autonomy, and a culture founded upon open communication and collaboration. Recently awarded Best for the World: Worker Impact award for the third year in a row by B Labs, Named #8 on the “Best Medium-Sized Workplaces” by Fortune Magazine, a “Best Company to Work For in Colorado” and ranked in the “Top 100 Best Places to Work” in the nation from Outside Magazine, Rally offers a highly collaborative culture and work-life balance that attracts and retains top talent.


Rally is an Equal Opportunity Employer! 


Rally Software Development Corp., a wholly owned subsidiary of CA, Inc.

item.title: Academically Exceptional FinTech Software Developers at G-Research (London, UK)
item.description:
We are looking for software developers with exceptional academic backgrounds to join our teams. The firm views software development as part of its core business strategy and we are looking to grow the team so we can produce more inovative software to put in to produciton. Software is developed primarily in C# & F#.



The key responsibilities of the roles are:


-Improving the core investment platform performance so that it can process large data sets and make better investment decisions.
-Increasing the scale of the system so that our Quantitative Analysts can realise more complex & computationally intensive ideas.
-Designing and implementing high quality code that performs at scale yet is fault tolerant during live execution.


The role is technically challenging, and requires an ability to rapidly adapt to new technologies such that the business’s technology advantage is maintained.

item.title: BlackRock Developer at BlackRock (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
The Aladdin Product Group develops and supports every facet of BlackRock’s information systems needs. Our global teams perform a wide variety of activities from maintaining system stability to growing the features and functionality of our state-of the-art trading and asset management platform, Aladdin. The breath of our responsibilities calls for a diverse range of expertise.


The Client Management Tools "CMT" team creates and drives the vision, strategic development, implementation, and ongoing support of CRM and analytics to manage client relationships and drive sales enablement. This position is for a junior Web/Java developer familiar with software development lifecycle and at least 1 year of experience with any development languages such as JavaScript, Java, SQL query or Web development. The candidate should have strong interpersonal and communication skills, and be a team player. Attention to detail and creativity in problem solving are critical skills. Open to learn a new tools (technologies) that helps to improve existing and develop new Data Visualizations of any analytical information.


Responsibilities:


The Web/Report Developer will have the responsibility to execute projects under the guidance of Senior Developer, working either independently or with a project team, while also working with business clients to design and implement specifications to ensure the successful release of a completed product.



  • Work with project managers, technical leads, business owners and analysts through the whole SDLC, understanding and refining systems requirements, designing and writing code, clearly documenting the development process. 

  • Develop server-based solutions for a wide range of web sites and web applications

  • Work on Web application development using the latest technologies

  • Use SQL skills to write queries and store procedures

  • Build interactive and static reports if needed by using BIRT or SSRS

  • Understand and support existing systems, and resolve operations issues while working with other support team staff located across the globe. 

  • Work with development teams to create the technical architecture around client technology needs. 

  • Solve client problems and communicate resolutions for existing systems

  • Be ready to work in Agile Development model

item.title: SaaSOps Engineer - $50k at Crossover (Cebu City, Philippines) (allows remote)
item.description:
SaaS Ops Engineer - $50k


Are you equally skilled at Elastic Load Balancing and balancing numerous projects across multiple products? Do you enjoy Cloudformation and forming the industry standard? Are you unafraid to take risks and scale ElasticBeanstalk with Jack’s chutzpah? Do you manage people with as much expertise as you manage traffic on Route 53? Are your presentations impeccable? Do you know the trending topics in technology and business processes like the back of your hand? You may be the wizard we’re looking for to transform our Saas optimizations.


Are you what we’re looking for:


Our ideal SaaS Ops Engineer is a highly motivated individual with a broad technical footprint. You get to optimizing SAAS infrastructure, become an expert on the latest SAAS technologies, and invent industry best practises along the way. You will be a principal contributor within our Engineering team, and will own the implementation, support and evolution of our SaaS environments, designing and building a highly scalable, unprecedented, globally deployed infrastructure.


If you are you a strong communicator and razor-sharp analyst and a creative strategist whose solutions that push the envelope, read on to apply!



As a DevFactory SaaSOps Engineer, you will:




  • Architect experience within large environments especially within core technology offerings.




  • Perform a wide variety of technical and administrative duties in overall systems design, development, and delivery.




  • Work in conjunction with IT, Engineering, and business groups to understand functionality, scalability, performance, security, and integration requirements from the database perspective.




  • Develop and maintain an in depth understanding of the application/system/database architecture and the general application functionality used to maintain data integrity.




  • Participate in SaaS infrastructure deployments.




  • Be a cross functional, contributing member of our Change Control Board (CCB) and Production Change Teams (PCT) to deploy changes to production and other environments.




  • Recommend solutions on system/database to meet the technical and business needs for SaaS applications.




  • Oversee data fixes for business issues or to address application issues.



  • Be accountable for proper backup and disaster recovery procedures.

item.title: Scientific Software Lead, Proteomics at Novartis Institutes for BioMedical Research (Cambridge, MA)
item.description:
At Novartis Institutes for BioMedical Research (NIBR), the NIBR Informatics team (NX) serves the global NIBR research community to provide best of breed, bleeding edge informatics platforms as well as in-depth data analysis services. Members of this group have a chance to participate in groundbreaking biomedical research activities to re-define the grammar for medicine in the future in the post-genome era.

NIBR Informatics is looking for a degree-educated scientific software lead with an excellent understanding of proteomics, genomics, and research data, as well as experience in software engineering principles, to join a multi-disciplinary Discovery Biology Informatics Group. Work location will be in Cambridge, MA.


This candidate will work closely with scientists and software engineers to re-define the NIBR-wide informatics systems to meet the challenges from proteomics enabled drug discovery research. This person should have proven record of building effective tools for scientists in a research environment. The candidate will be expected to work as a team member and/or leading a team to deliver solutions to support NIBR’s biology and proteomics research.



Responsibilities:



  • Actively work with scientists in disease areas to communicate with scientists effectively and understand their needs

  • Define proper informatics solution(s) to address the scientific needs

  • Work with internal and/or external software teams to design proper solutions to meet scientists’ needs

  • Serve as a key expert analyst to guide the engineering team to design proper data standards, data models and analysis tools to serve NIBR-wide informatics needs

  • Work effectively with different Informatics and IT groups globally to ensure that solutions are effectively and efficiently implemented

item.title: Sr. Scientific Software Lead (IS Beta) at Novartis Institutes for BioMedical Research (Cambridge, MA)
item.description:
At Novartis Institutes for BioMedical Research (NIBR), the NIBR Informatics (NX) serves the global NIBR research community to provide them with the best of breed, bleeding edge informatics platforms as well as in-depth data analysis services. The members in this group have a chance to participate in the groundbreaking medical research activities to re-define the grammar for medicine in the future in the post-genome era.

The NIBR Informatics is looking for a degree-educated Senior Scientific Software Lead with an excellent understanding of genomics, research data, and lab workflows, as well as experience in software engineering and informatics, to join a multi-disciplinary Discovery Biology Informatics Group. Work location will be in Cambridge, MA.

The successful candidate will work closely with scientists and talented software engineers to re-define the NIBR-wide informatics systems to meet the challenge arising from genomic drug discovery research. The ideal candidate should be a highly motivated team player with a strong understanding of genomics, as well as data management and analysis needs associated with target discovery and screening research. This person should have proven record of building effective tools for scientists in a research environment and be capable of leading a technical team to deliver solutions to support NIBR drug discovery biology research.

Major Accountabilities / Key Performance Indicators



  • Gather user requirements and perform needs assessments to guide development and selection of software systems.

  • Support scientific research with software systems which capture experimental design, enable data analysis and interpretation, and provide for regular communication on genomics projects.

  • Design and/or supervise development and testing of software systems to meet or exceed project objectives.

  • Lead, mentor, and inspire a high-performing team of developers by establishing high technical standards and demonstrating, by way of example, technical excellence in all stages of software development.

  • Manage and motivate high-performing teams of developers by setting clear expectations and delivering effective feedback.

  • Use software version control system, automated build tools, ticket tracking software, architecture documentation, and release engineering processes.

  • Develop and optimize techniques and methods to improve software development processes including test driven development, agile methodology, and pair programming.

  • Work closely with cross-functional groups (engineers and researchers, management, business analysts, and internal customers), in a highly matrixed organization to build constructive and effective relationships throughout the whole organization.

item.title: Devs sought for Health Information Exchange (HIE) platform vendor at CareEvolution (Ann Arbor, MI) (allows remote)
item.description:
Note: this job is open to US Residents only.  Foreign nationals can apply but only if you live within the US.


-


What we do actually matters. CareEvolution's HIEBus platform creates better patient outcomes.


Simply stated, we make web and mobile applications for healthcare. Under the covers, though, a lot more is going on - we have developed a robust software platform that ingresses data, programmatically links that data across institutions on a per-patient basis, and supplies APIs to consume, project, modify, and aggregate that data in all sorts of interesting and useful ways.  Please read our company page for a more detailed explanation of what we do and who we are.


We are looking for software people to help us build out the platform, write data adapters (drivers) to automatically ingress data from hundreds of data sources - in realtime, and to create the next generation of healthcare apps.


At CareEvolution, we don't tell you what to do. Part of the work at CareEvolution is determining what to do. We're designed our organization specifically to promote creativity, innovation, and focus on solving some of the most difficult problems in healthcare.


Visit http://letsfixhealthcare.com to learn more - or contact us (resume@careevolution.com) - and we'll explain what CareEvolution is all about.

item.title: Software Engineer, Product Testing at Tableau Software (Palo Alto, CA)
item.description:
What you’ll be doing…


In this position, you will be a member of a team of dedicated software engineers focused on testing a suite of next-generation Visual Analytics and Collaboration products. You will help define the strategy for testing interfaces in a cross-platform manner. You will leverage open source tools and build new tools to help ship a high quality product that delights customers. In addition, you have a special fondness for things that are simple, elegant and effective.


Some of the things you’ll be doing include…



  • Writing code to create, improve and maintain new and existing frameworks

  • Analyzing source code to understand areas of risk and complexity to provide optimal test coverage

  • Helping Drive a Test Culture across the entire company

  • Other duties as assigned


Within Product Testing, there are different technical groups:



  • Client:  Tableau designs products for people who use software, not necessarily for people who buy software – the Client team in Product Testing is all about ensuring these products we build provide a delightful experience for our customers.  We understand our customers and how they use our products.  We build robust automation systems with Java and Python that precisely mimic product scenarios and validate the look and accuracy of the resulting visualizations.  We also use our in-development products every day to visualize data in the same way our customers do.  Our team is focused on our desktop client application for Windows and Mac, our browser rendered visualizations on all browsers and all platforms (Windows, mac, mobile) and also our native mobile apps on the iPad and Android tablets.

  • Mobile: The shift towards mobile devices and the increasing need to see and understand your data, are two of the hottest trends in the industry today, and the Mobile team at Tableau is at the confluence of the two. The Tableau Mobile team has been tasked with a single mission: to make the mobile experience the most delightful way for our customers to stay on top of their data. We build next-generation apps for iOS and Android for consumers and enterprises alike, and ensure quality through a variety of modern, innovative techniques, including white-box automation, data-driven pair-wise testing, and instrumentation tools.

  • Platform: As a member of one of our platform teams you’ll work on Tableau’s secret sauce. We are about connecting, querying, integrating and preparing data from nearly 50 different data sources. We are about calculations and statistical analytics. We are about first class test frameworks and more. Ideal candidates will be skilled in one or more programming language, for example Python, C++, C# or Java. Working knowledge of one or more database technology like SQL Server, MySQL, Oracle, DB2, Hadoop or Apache Spark is preferred. Our team verifies that Tableau’s platform is functionally correct, reliable, scalable and high performance for our Windows and Mac desktop as well as our server products. We employ modern testing methodologies to tame the permutation explosion beast and we have fun doing it.

  • Server: The Server Testing group at Tableau owns product quality for Corporate Enterprise Server and Cloud Hosted Services (Tableau Online and Tableau Public). We have a group of dedicated software engineers focused on quality covering overall end to end scenarios as well as functional, performance and scale-out testing of Frontend and Backend components. You will help define the strategy and for testing interfaces and implement tests in a cross-platform manner while leveraging open source tools and build new tools to help ship a high quality product that delights customers. We work closely with our developers and do our daily develop in Java.

  • Performance: Tableau is a product where smart meets speed. This means you can use Tableau to make sense of your big data and be creative. The Performance Test Engineer at Tableau measures and verifies the latencies of Tableau functionalities using different data sizes and sources; they also measure the Page Load Time and throughputs of the Tableau servers.  Our Performance Test engineers use cutting edge testing strategies, frameworks and tools to hold the product to a very high performance bar. Candidates for this group need to be familiar with object oriented languages and feel comfortable to use industry standard performance test frameworks such as JMeter.


Who you are…



  • Experienced. 1-5+ years of experience testing and profiling large-scale C++ systems and highly scalable Java and/or Ruby server systems that back dynamic, highly interactive web experiences. Experience testing on Windows platforms, with experience testing on multiple platforms including Linux. Strong knowledge of database concepts is a plus.

  • Highly Technical. You love writing things that “just work” – things that are robust, scalable and that perform well. Excellent understanding of languages such as C++, Java, Ruby, and Python as well as programming experience with Javascript and css/html. Strong knowledge of development and test tools, in particular Selenium, junit and java tools.

  • Passionate about Quality. A love of testing, tuning and analysis through a rigorous scientific approach.

  • Self-Motivated. You do good work and the drive to deliver is just a part of you.

  • Team Player. You enjoy collaborating with, learning from, and teaching others so we all can become better. You assume the good intent in others, and actively do your part to create a positive work environment.

  • Customer Focused. You want to learn about customers, their challenges & scenarios and you find satisfaction in shipping quality products that delight customers.

  • You have high standards, and your personal software practices ensure you deliver high quality no matter what.  You believe in constantly releasable quality, iterations, design for testability, and you build your own tools & techniques to achieve high quality and low cost of support.  You deliver better results through using quality practices every day, and you even have taught or influenced others to improve their practices.

  • Educated. Bachelor of Science in Computer Science or equivalent

item.title: HBO Senior Software Engineer at HBO (New York, NY)
item.description:
OVERALL SUMMARY:


The Business Systems Software Engineering team at HBO enables the business workflows using creative and pragmatic technology solutions. We are a software engineering group that develops and supports applications critical to the creation, marketing, distribution, and reselling of HBO products and are a fundamental part of HBO’s innovation and success, with offices in New York City and Seattle.

Realizing this mission requires a staff of highly motivated and technically flexible software professionals across a variety of disciplines: development, program management, test, and design. We are hiring people to build a team that can create engaging, high-quality solutions, platforms and interactive experiences.

We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer with the knowledge, motivation, and energy to help build robust and flexible custom applications as well as integrate third-party software packages. Our group supports departments such as Business Affairs, Creative Services, Enterprises, and Program Strategy and Planning.

item.title: JavaScript / AngularJS developer at Energy Aspects (London, UK)
item.description:
You will be working with the lead developer on a number of projects that will be used internally by our team of analysts, as well as assisting in the development of new client-facing projects. You will be responsible for quickly prototyping interfaces that are easy to use and can be easily changed to keep up with new feature requests. You will also be reviewing some of our existing systems to offer improvements where necessary. We don't do micro sites, jQuery or Wordpress - if you're looking for genuinely exciting projects, read on!


As a data driven business, we need someone who can develop interfaces to present and handle large datasets without creating a bottleneck. If you decide that is best done by using Angular, then you will know why it is probably not a great idea to use ng-repeat.


We champion the use of new and innovative technologies where they add value, so we will encourage you to use the latest tech where you feel it is best suited to the task at hand.


The role is a full-time, permanent position based in our London office. We offer a competitive salary based on relevant experience, along with a 6% employer pension contribution, 25 days paid holiday (plus bank holidays), private medical cover, bike to work scheme, fresh fruit every day, regular team drinks and lots of cake.

item.title: Front End Developer at Spin Systems, Inc. (Fairfax, VA) (allows remote)
item.description:
In addition to being an extraordinary engineer, we want a team member who is passionate on wearing different hats in a small product team:  designing new features, making good product decisions, writing bullet proof code, programming at all levels of the application stack, and contributing to the design of beautiful user interfaces.  We would like you to have most of the following skills prior to joining our team.  If you think you’re missing one or two skills, you can make up for it with passion, attention to detail, a collaborative attitude, a willingness to learn -- and we’ll teach you the rest when you arrive.


Responsibilities



  • Participate in all phases of the system development lifecycle including creating technical designs, program code, test plans, and verifying test results. Apply reusable code design and design patterns in a test driven development environment

  • Develop technical design documentation based on functional design specifications and implement solutions using object oriented programming techniques

  • Work as part of a team of developers (user-interface, middle tier business logic, data access) and application architects interfacing with business analysts, database developers, infrastructure architects, and quality assurance testers to ensure the successful delivery of an integrated solution meeting the needs of the business.

  • Provide development estimates for implementation and project plans

  • Review applications in all phases of development to ensure adherence to development standards.

  • Research, recommend, and adopt best practices and design patterns for development.


 Qualifications



  • A Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, or a similar science and engineering discipline, and a minimum of 3 years of progressive post-graduate experience. 

  • 3+ years as a professional engineer, building and maintaining web applications from concept to production.

  • Fluent with the core of our current technology: HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, and jQuery.

  • SharePoint 2013 administration and/or development experience using NCSS (No Code Sandbox Solutions) or SharePoint 2013 App Model is a very strong plus but not required.

  • Proven skills developing RESTful and oData services using C#.

  • Experience in writing complex SQL queries and executing SQL, TSQ, PL/SQL scripts using ADO.NET against MS SQL Server and Oracle databases.

  • Strong object oriented design skills and familiarity with n-tier applications and Service Oriented Architecture.

  • Preference given to candidates exposed to test driven development and agile software methodologies such as SCRUM and XP

  • US Citizens only, Secret Clearance required.


 EOE/M/F/D/V.  We participate in E-Verify

item.title: .Net/C# Application Software Developer at SWC Technology Partners (Oak Brook, IL)
item.description:
SWC Technology Partners is searching for full-time .Net/C# Software Developers, who are experienced and passionate technologists, desiring a full time employment role in which they can leave their mark on the business world.  If you desire to work for a company that challenges you as well as provides opportunities for growth, while working with other talented developers – then SWC is where you need to be!


Our software developers can expect to work with cutting edge technology, deliver high quality solutions across various local industries, and collaborate with a team working on holistic web development projects that range in size and scope, as well as receive continuous career development opportunities. This candidate will report to the Director of Software Solutions Group.





Responsibilities:
