  • Software Development: Perform hands-on customized development and unit testing of web based software solutions for our customers primarily based on Microsoft technologies, including but not limited to Microsoft .NET, Microsoft SQL Server and SharePoint

  • Software Design: Produce practical software and database designs that meet both business and technical requirements

  • Consulting: Gain a deep understanding of client needs and play an integral part in defining and proposing practical solutions to meet or exceed client expectations

  • Software Architecture: Participate in defining the software and database architecture for new solutions

  • Business Requirements Consumption: Ability to gain a deep understanding of written and verbal business requirements provided by other business analysts or customers

  • Quality Assurance: Actively participate in quality assurance, including hands-on system and user testing of the software developed when required

  • Business Requirements Gathering: Participate in client requirements gathering sessions and accurately document business requirements

  • Implementation and Support: Software deployments and ongoing software support

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at BBC (London, UK)
item.description:
myBBC is a new and high profile programme designed to make the BBC online experience feel personal and relevant to our audience, encouraging them to view, listen to, or play with our content; be that content they know and love, or content we help them discover. It’s basically about content!


As Tony Hall, Director General of the BBC, said; “it's the start of a real transformation – the myBBC revolution. How to reinvent public service broadcasting through data. But we will always be doing it in a BBC way – not telling you what customers like you bought, but what citizens like you would love to watch and need to know.”


Sounds exciting, eh?


So, what will you do on a daily basis, to help make a difference to the delivery and continuous development of the myBBC product? Glad you asked…


The primary focus of this role is on the creation and maintenance of RESTful web services, written in Java and deployed on AWS. You will be expected to be familiar with technologies such as Spring, Camel, JUnit, Mockito. In addition, experience of Swagger, Apigee-127 and Node.js will be a significant plus. Similarly, knowledge of AWS, including SQS, DynamoDB and Lambda will help to get you started quickly.


Being involved in the full life cycle of the products, you’ll need to be able to adapt quickly to new or changing requirements, produce rapid prototypes and communicate effectively with the team as a whole, not just other engineers.


We’re agile in our development with a multi-disciplinary team working closely with a Product Owner, Business Analyst and Project Manager along with dedicated QA and our colleagues in User Experience & Design.


As we receive high levels of traffic, you will be responsible for ensuring that the performance and scalability of Notifications services meets the demands of our audience.

item.title: Junior to Mid Level Front End Developer - Java, Angular, JSON APIs, and Web Serv at Fidelity (Durham, NC)
item.description:
The Fidelity Institutional Technology group at Fidelity Investments has an exceptional opportunity for a Software Developer / Engineer. This role will participate in the design, development, implementation and support of mission critical trading focused web applications and financial tools. Under moderate supervision, conduct the analysis, design and development of software to support a robust trading and supporting platform, contributing to the overall success of projects as they move through the different phases of the project life cycle. 


Your knowledge will be called upon to meet guidelines and standards that will allow our team to continue to deliver important and vital solutions for our customers.  Our projects involve developing functions and tools used by Registered Investment Advisors (RIAs) and Correspondents.  Our web applications use modular JavaScript frameworks (such as Angular, Backbone, etc.), JSON APIs, Java and Web Services.  You should be able to understand technical designs at the application level, define strategies and work closely with fellow developers.  You must be able to describe problems and recommend solutions to project leaders.  You must have great communication skills, be a team player, and have an aptitude for learning new technologies.


Primary Responsibilities



  • Designing, developing, and implementing web applications in a dynamic financial services environment

  • Contributing effectively at many different points in a project life cycle as an individual contributor

  • Adhering to project timelines, addressing and resolving technical issues

  • Coordinating functional/technical group discussions with analysts and developers under moderate supervision

  • Delivering on both projects and support tasks in a dynamic environment

  • Developing concise and clear technical design documents based on analysis of business requirements

item.title: Senior Software Development Manager at SonoSim, Inc (Santa Monica, CA)
item.description:
Job Description – Senior Software Development Manager


SonoSim, Inc., a start-up company, is seeking a Senior Software Development Manager to lead the technical team in scaling our product suite, company, and team. This candidate should be a self-motivated individual with strong leadership skills seeking to work in a high energy, team-oriented and friendly environment. This position reports directly to the CEO.


Job Description



  • Provide technical project management and leadership in the overall production of a high-quality ultrasound training client-server application using Agile/Scrum methodologies. This software-based product incorporates some hardware elements.

  • Manage a collaborative team of software engineers, QA analysts, and system administrators to deliver a high-quality ultrasound training simulation product.

  • Responsible for the technical production schedule and the implementation of evolving business requirements and feature sets into working product.

  • Produce iterative releases every 2 weeks as part of our Scrum methodology.

  • Liaison between Executive Management and Development Team.

  • Grow and scale technical team as company expands.

  • Collaborate with Director of Operations on Product Fulfillment, including management of Release Versioning Software, Activation Files, Software Updates and Upgrades, Server Management and Data Transfer.

  • Identify opportunities for process improvement and automation.

  • Oversee continual improvement of the code base through targeted refactoring, working unit tests, and any necessary design documentation.

  • Employ Quality Assurance best practices and standards defining, collecting, and interpreting metrics and diagrams.

  • Participate in regular status reviews with all stakeholders

item.title: Android Developer at Actual Experience plc (Bath, UK)
item.description:
We’re looking for an experienced Android Software Developer who can take the lead on the development of our Android software offerings in two significant areas.


A component of our service is a measurement software client that takes network and application level measurements. This is proven on Mac, Windows and Linux platforms and we now want to develop it to run on mobile devices. We are also developing an engaging mobile app for the business leaders of our customers to access the results of the analysis we perform with the measurements.


You will be leading the development of both the measurement software on Android and the mobile app.

item.title: Quantitative Developer at AQR Capital Management (Greenwich, CT)
item.description:
AQR Research and Portfolio Management is seeking quantitative software developers. Our developers are responsible for building the core systems that drive the quantitative strategy research and portfolio implementation that powers AQR. Our development teams are small, motivated, and highly productive. Working side by side with the researchers and portfolio analysts, you will become intimately familiar with the investment philosophy which drives AQR.


We believe that the next innovation to transform our business could come from anyone at AQR. Expect to be recognized not only for your diligence and hard work today, but for your vision for tomorrow. We are mathematicians, computer scientists, and engineers passionate about advancing financial research and pushing the limits of today’s technology.


As a quantitative developer, you will build or extend our:



  • Proprietary portfolio construction and optimization techniques

  • Global asset risk estimation system incorporating millions of data points

  • Intuitive research APIs leveraging cloud computing and cutting-edge visualizations

  • High-performance historical simulation engine

  • Workflow platform using services, messaging, and graph-based dependency awareness

item.title: Backend Software Engineer at Football Radar (London, UK)
item.description: At Football Radar, we analyse and predict football matches. As a backend engineer you’ll have the chance to help build and maintain all the software that makes that possible – everything from modern web applications to statistical models, real time data platforms to cloud infrastructure. Our backend engineers are involved in everything the company does and deal with all kinds of different challenges. A lot of our code is in Scala, which we are using increasingly, but we still have lots of PHP code, and a few odds and ends in other languages. You don’t need to know Scala for this role, however: we’ll help you learn it if you don’t know it, and many of our engineers had no real Scala experience before they started. We are just looking for great programmers who are passionate about their work. If you like a challenge, and want to work with really smart people, we would like to hear from you.

item.title: Senior Software Developer | Build Web-Based .NET Apps at Brio Solutions (Fort Washington, PA)
item.description:
Are you the developer others come to for help when they're blocked? Do you step up and help fixed botched deployments or releases? Do you know the right questions to ask to help solve problems, even if they’re for a project or program you aren’t actively developing in?


We’re looking for you.


Brio has doubled in size in the last year, adding development, consulting, and project management staff. We’re working on more projects than ever before and are searching for a Senior .NET Developer that can help guide and grow our development process, and work with our junior- and mid-level developers as they expand their skill sets. Plus, you’ll still be actively developing on projects and growing your skills, too.


This is a position with room for advancement, and offers the opportunity to join Brio’s 4-person leadership team -- our CEO, President, CIO, and Director of Operations. You’d be welcomed to the team at an exciting time of growth, and would help make decisions along the way.

item.title: Back End PHP Developer at Atypic (Charlotte, NC)
item.description:
Our growing digital marketing and brand development agency in uptown Charlotte is seeking a full time Back End PHP Developer. This talented developer will work collaboratively with our close-knit team of graphic designers, coders, analysts, and clients to define and execute all aspects of interactive development.


As a Back End PHP Developer, you are expected to have expert knowledge of LAMP based development and should be someone who constantly craves seeking out the latest in coding technologies and platforms.


You should be capable of helping other team members with problems that need solutions, and managing both personal and small team projects. You should be an individual with strong communication skills and the have desire to interact with both clients and team members in a consistently positive manner and live by the motto... "anything is possible." You should be driven and detail-oriented with strong leadership qualities.

item.title: PHP Developer at WSM International (Saint Clair Shores, MI) (allows remote)
item.description:
WSM is an established and rapidly growing technical services and solutions company, offering unlimited career potential for talented and motivated developers. We thrive in a casual, open, friendly and collaborative environment. Our work is rewarded with very good pay and an awesome benefits plan including health, term life, short and long term disability, 401k with company match (yeah!), dental, vision and flexible PTO. This is a full-time, 40 hour/week position.


We're looking for a sharp, motivated PHP Developer. You'll create and implement a dynamic range of new web applications, and also maintain and develop a variety of existing applications. 



  • Develop in PHP, JavaScript, MySQL and HTML

  • Collaborate with team members as well as operate individually to develop complex web-based applications

  • Maintain existing codebases, to include troubleshooting bugs and adding new features

  • Gain an in-depth understanding of our customer's business goals and related system interactions

  • Work closely with others to define and clarify project plans, deliverables, expectations, scheduling and of course, functionality of applications

item.title: Java Developer - Publishing/Newsroom at Financial Times (London, UK)
item.description:
Projects you might work on



  • A greenfield development role, working on a team building a new content platform using APIs for content delivery and harnessing triple store capabilities for semantic enrichment in order to offer more flexible ways to ingest FT content that will lay the foundation for building the next generation of FT.com. We actively use BDD, continuous delivery and DevOps within the team as a recipe for success and accelerated agile delivery.



  • A position within our Editorial Technology programme. This exciting new programme means working directly with our Editorial team to support the newsroom's continued digital evolution through the creation and adoption of new tools and improvements to existing tools.  Work will initially include exploring the world of data in the newsroom, and using our Content API to feed into our CMS.


Responsibilities


This role will work within the development team, developing and unit testing solutions to meet business requirements in a timely manner. Development at the FT is done within larger programmes of work using individual agile streams and within that framework this role will be required to implement fully robust software solutions, working closely with the QA team members to develop a repeatable, end-to-end testing process.

item.title: Front End Developer, Insights Applications (Contractor) at Red Bull Media House (Santa Monica, CA)
item.description:
Red Bull Media House is building a program to deliver a new level of actionable insights around online conversations and engagement that can be used to better inform business decisions across marketing, media and digital teams. The development of a proprietary social analytics and insights reporting platform aims to translate and distill large volumes of data into an accessible understanding of target audience whereabouts, affinities, behavior and trends. These insights will be used to influence major innovation initiatives as well as decisions related to athlete sponsorships, music artist partnerships, video and film projects, events, digital product functionality, editorial planning, brand campaigns, media and marketing solutions among many others.


 The Front End Developer within the Red Bull Digital Analytics & Insights group is responsible for working with the UX and design team to transform mock-ups, designs and Photoshop layouts into lean, scalable and non-redundant HTML/CSS for the internal products and tools used to run Red Bull Digital Analytics & Insights platform.

item.title: Web Developer/Senior Web Developer - myBBC Notifications at BBC (London, UK)
item.description:
myBBC is a new and high profile programme designed to make the BBC online experience feel personal and relevant to our audience, encouraging them to view, listen to, or play with our content; be that content they know and love, or content we help them discover. It’s basically about content!


As Tony Hall, Director General of the BBC, said; “it's the start of a real transformation – the myBBC revolution. How to reinvent public service broadcasting through data. But we will always be doing it in a BBC way – not telling you what customers like you bought, but what citizens like you would love to watch and need to know.”


Sounds exciting, eh?


So, what will you do on a daily basis, to help make a difference to the delivery and continuous development of the myBBC product? Glad you asked…


The primary focus of this role is on the creation and maintenance of the Notifications front end platform, written in JavaScript and deployed on AWS. You will be expected to be familiar with technologies such as JavaScript, HTML, CSS, JSON, Ajax. In addition, experience of Node.js, PhantomJS and SASS will be a significant plus. Similarly, knowledge of AWS, including S3 will help to get you started quickly.


Being involved in the full life cycle of the products, you’ll need to be able to adapt quickly to new or changing requirements, produce rapid prototypes and communicate effectively with the team as a whole, not just other engineers.


We’re agile in our development with a multi-disciplinary team working closely with a Product Owner, Business Analyst and Project Manager along with dedicated QA, our colleagues in User Experience & Design and DevOps.


Our audience uses a diverse range of devices and browsers to access BBC services; you will be responsible for ensuring that the performance and reliability of the Notifications UI remains consistent.

item.title: Systems Engineer, AWS Network Monitoring at Amazon (Dublin, Ireland)
item.description:
Amazon is looking for Systems and Software Engineers to build and scale the software that monitors one of the world’s largest and most complex networks. Tens of millions of customers rely on Amazon’s network for using our retail websites, accessing content on their Kindles and building applications and businesses on top of Amazon Web Services (AWS). Our goal is to become The Infrastructure Platform for the world - achieving this goal requires high-leverage, massively scalable software systems. Our success depends on our world-class network infrastructure, and our network depends on our Network Monitoring Scaling team.



- You are interested in being part of a high-bar team with global responsibility for the Network Monitoring software used across all of Amazon’s businesses.

- Solving problems at scale excites you.

- You do not implement specs from analysts and architects - you talk to your customers and design solutions to their problems. You automate and innovate.

- You do not push just one technology agenda - you choose the best tool for the problem at hand.

- You believe that the craft of software engineering is about writing code right the first time. For you, code reviews and automated testing are not chores - they are a core part of writing great software.

- You do not throw your code over the wall. You launch it, own it, support it and make it incrementally better for the benefit of your customers.

- You enjoy working in a flexible, fast-paced, collaborative team environment.

- Very strong problem solving and coding skills.

- Bash experience plus knowledge of at least one scripting language (Python, Perl, Ruby)

- Strong track record of working in areas of significant complexity and 'getting things done'

- Record of mentoring other engineers to maintain architectural vision and software quality.

- Understanding of data structures, algorithms and their performance.

- Proficient at designing software systems - from high-availability large-scale distributed systems to bespoke scripted solutions.

- Advanced UNIX (preferably Linux) systems engineering skills.

- A strong understanding of core internet technologies (e.g. TCP/IP).

- Understanding of the building blocks of computer systems; comfortable working with bits & bytes.



- Computer Science degree, or equivalent experience.

- The desire to work in a fast paced and constantly evolving agile environment

item.title: Projektmanager / Business Analyst "Internet of Things" (m/w) in München at Device Insight GmbH (München, Deutschland)
item.description:
In Ihrer Rolle als Business Analyst bewerten Sie im Umfeld von IoT Kundenanforderungen hinsichtlich der technischen Umsetzbarkeit und erarbeiten softwaretechnische Lösungskonzepte und Spezifikationen. Als Projektmanager koordinieren Sie technisch anspruchsvolle Projekte, steuern diese agil und führen diese zum erfolgreichen Abschluss. Sie sind die Schnittstelle zwischen internen Softwareentwicklern und unseren Kunden.


Lernen Sie unterschiedliche Branchen kennen und erleben Sie, was Sie mit dem faszinierenden Zusammenspiel von Maschine, IT und globaler Vernetzung bewegen können!


Wir bieten Ihnen:



  • Nette Kollegen, ein hochmotiviertes Team, flache Hierarchien, direkte Kommunikation und schnelle Entscheidungen

  • Obst, Getränke und eine lebendige Arbeitsatmosphäre mit Dachterrasse, Grill und Kickertisch

  • Attraktiven Arbeitsplätze in modernen Büroräumen verkehrsgünstig direkt an der neuen Messe München (U-Bahn U2, Autobahn A94) und am Einkaufszentrum Riem Arcaden

  • Arbeitsort: München

item.title: Technical Business Analyst m/w at Innovation Group AG (Stuttgart, Deutschland)
item.description:
ES ERWARTEN SIE SPANNENDE AUFGABENFELDER



  • Erstellung technischer Spezifikationen auf Basis fachlicher Anforderungen

  • Überführung der technischen Spezifikation in User-Stories und Akzeptanzkriterien

  • Hilfe bei der Klärung von Anforderungen in direkter Zusammenarbeit mit den Stakeholdern und internen Abteilungen

  • Erstellung von Anforderungen und User-Story-Workshops für die Kanban-/Scrum-Teams

  • Ansprechpartner für die Kanban-/Scrum-Teams

  • Unterstützung bei der Klärung und Lösung von produktionskritischen Problemen

  • Erstellung und Pflege unterschiedlicher Arten von Dokumentationen (technisch, intern, produktspezifisch)

  • Unterstützung des Product Owner bei technischen Fragen und Machbarkeitsprüfungen

  • Zusammenarbeit in internationalen Teams und Projekten

item.title: Java Software Engineer at BlackRock (Wilmington, DE)
item.description:
The Aladdin Product Group develops and supports every facet of BlackRock’s information systems needs. Our global teams perform a wide variety of activities from maintaining system stability to growing the features and functionality of our state-of the-art trading and asset management platform, Aladdin. The breadth of our responsibilities calls for a diverse range of expertise. 



APG Core Client Processing group (APG-CCP) aims to develop a centralized, controlled platform to support the complete money/flow lifecycle on the systems of Clients, Agents, and BlackRock.The APG-CCP-Global Cash Dev team provides software development and technical services to Fund Investors in BLK-managed Cash Funds and to internal BlackRock staff - mainly the T&LS Global Cash teams located in Philadelphia, New York and London, plus regional offices. The Global Cash business is approximately $500 billion in AUM. The team provides technical sevices to Fund Investors -- (current figures) 24 Order Placement interfaces, 35 Fund information data exchanges, 90 Transfer Agent data exchanges in the US-domiciled and Dublin-domiciled Fund ranges.


This position is for a java software engineer to Build Out Operational, Collateral management Capabilities on Aladdin.


Responsibilities include:




  • 80% development of strategic systems around the reconciliation, accounting  and reporting areas and 20% providing 2nd line of support for technical and/or operational issues encountered

  • Understand and refine business and functional requirements

  • Provide ongoing development maintenance of existing application functionality, working closely with the client support teams to address issues that are escalated for resolution

  • Work with team members in multi-office, multi-country environment

  • Continuous communication of technology decisions, issues and plans to senior team members

  • Deliver high level of client service through responsiveness and accuracy



Specific activities:


 80% Development



  • Developing and maintaining existing reconciliation, Accounting and Reporting systems, tools and processes, including participation in tactical and strategic development projects

  • Working alongside project managers, technical leads and business analysts throughout the SDLC cycle

  • Code new business functionality in the system, specifically in the Reconciliation and Reporting tools, to meet business and customer requirements, working closely with end-users, client operations staff, and other Aladdin development teams


20% Production support



  • Providing 2nd line of support for technical and/or operational issues encountered

  • Help the team conduct end-to-end UAT tests to ensure production operations run successfully during monthly cycles

  • Provide ideas for process enhancements that will result in development projects

item.title: Cloud Integrations Developer at Atlassian (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
If you love solving problems and have a growing appetite for building robust financial systems and integrations in a dynamic environment, Atlassian has a great opportunity for you. The Business Systems team is tasked with optimizing the systems and processes that drive Atlassian from order to cash, purchasing, and people systems. You will be responsible for all aspects of designing and deploying custom interfaces and integrations across various financial modules. Projects will include building customizations and configuring existing systems in order to meet requirements that are unique to Atlassian's business model. While evaluating new technological solutions and making recommendations to enhance existing systems and tools, you will also have the opportunity to partner with Finance and IT teams to support key Business Process Transformation initiatives around Order to Cash and Source to Pay tracks, from systems stand point - this includes developing appropriate documentation for architectural, design, technical, implementation and test activities. Ultimately, it is all about building efficient systems and tools that enable finance teams to make informed, data-driven decisions.


More about You



We love developers/analysts who are self-starters, motivated, data-driven, and carry a relaxed yet enthusiastic attitude. You will need to have a BS/BA/IT Degree or equivalent experience with 2+ years of experience managing and deploying process updates and integration services to/on an ERP platform. Your colleagues describe you as a go-to person for challenges around technical integrations architecture, dealing with complex data structure patterns. If you have hands on experience with REST, Web Services, XML, XSLT and working knowledge of scripting languages (Perl/Python/Php/Unix Shell) and ANSI/SQL, then that's a big plus. You bring with you, a good 3-5 years of experience implementing and supporting ERP applications (NetSuite/Oracle/Workday) and have strong hands-on experience with Integrations like SFDC, AvaTax, 3rd Party Middleware (Boomi, Mulesoft, etc.) and off-the-shelf Billing/Revenue Recognition systems. You must have excellent written, verbal and listening communication skills and be able to prioritize and deliver the most important things first.


You are a good fit if you relish solving challenges, have the ability to see around corners and know whats coming next and your personal mantra is 'bring it on' when faced with a new challenge.

item.title: DevOps Engineer (Python) at Optiver (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Are you the missing link between our IT Operations and Trading departments? Do you get excited about designing, developing and implementing improvements to our monitoring systems? If that sounds like you, then you might be our new DevOps Engineer.


What you will do
As a DevOps Engineer you will be responsible for designing, developing, implementing and maintaining software to monitor our complex trading architecture. You will work in a fast-paced environment where your actions have a direct impact on our P&L and thus on the success of Optiver. You will be working with highly skilled and engaged colleagues in an informal and dynamic setting. On top of that you will be in direct contact with our traders and technical stakeholders.


As a DevOps Engineer you will:



  • Create, develop and maintain software to monitor our complex trading architecture;

  • Join in projects to design and implement new parts of the monitoring system;

  • Deploy and support our monitoring systems and dashboards;

  • Automate the process of getting data from different sources to compare with baselines and automatically act on breaches;

  • Help users (traders and trading application engineers) gain insight in the performance of our trading systems;

  • Pro-actively think of new ways to measure our performance, by interacting with the users of the system, being trading application engineers and traders;

  • Constantly be on top of your game to increase the team- and system performance;

  • Be challenged to handle our complex and large data sets.

item.title: Web Developer - ASP. Net / C# / MVC / JavaScript at Creative Clarity Ltd (Milton Keynes, UK)
item.description:
Salary : £ Dependent on experience
Location : Woburn, Milton Keynes, Buckinghamshire, Bedfordshire


 Are you an experienced Lead Developer looking for a new job? Here’s something to think about…


 Introducing Clarity. You may not know us but ten years in, we’re pretty proud of what we’ve achieved so far.


We’re an integrated, creative marketing and digital agency that likes to keep things simple. Our Clear Thinking (practical rather than academic) approach works for our clients and, as a result, we’re rapidly growing. 


Our home is a funky, countryside barn where our people get the time, space and fresh air they need to do what we do brilliantly! But… while we may be rural, we have international projects and work with a number of leading Global brands. 


Growing the business and doing great work is all down to our most important asset; our People. This is where you come in…


 So what’s the opportunity?


We are looking for a Developer with solid experience in .NET programming. With a host of exciting new projects due to begin this is a fantastic time to join our rapidly growing Agency. You will be working as part of a talented team to deliver new innovative digital solutions across multiple sectors for internationally renowned brands. You will be seen as an experienced developer and it will be your responsibility to share best practice with other team members. You will be expected to set the high standards, continually motivating and improving on personal and team capability whilst working collaboratively to deliver great digital products/solutions.


Clocking on and off…


Your duties day to day:



  • Eperienced at designing cross-platform solution architecture

  • Creating/enhancing/developing in Umbraco CMS and web and mobile applications

  • Understanding customer requirements and creating all associated technical documentation (technical build, information/solution architecture, test plans)



  • Advocating improvements in development practices

  • Enhancing the scalability and performance of systems whilst delivering customer requirements quickly, reliably and efficiently

  • Contributing to continually improving the development framework

  • Ability to liaise when required with product owners, business analysts, developers and QAs to establish and implement requirements and resolve live operational issues for our clients


Left Brain or Right Brain? Which are you?


We think diversity is what makes a team function in the super league so we want to meet you whether you’re creative, pragmatic, logical or even completely off-the-wall at times. What’s important to us is that you’ll feel like an individual here and your voice is heard.


That said there are some traits we will need you to have:



  • Highly motivated and passionate about what you do

  • Can do attitude, not afraid to challenge or push new ideas forward

  • Self motivated and honest in your actions

  • Ability to work independently, as well as part of a team

  • Imaginative, intelligent approach to solving problems

  • Proactivity - finding solutions for the client and Clarity

  • Seeing the big picture

  • High attention to detail and consistent follow-through

  • Work well under pressure

  • Ability to take responsibility and drive concepts forward

  • To act with professionalism at all times

item.title: Quantitative Risk Analyst / Developer-Basel, Switzeland at Bank for International Settlements (Basel, Switzerland)
item.description:
The Bank for International Settlements (BIS) is an international organisation promoting global monetary and financial stability and is a bank for central banks. The BIS’s head office is located in Basel, Switzerland, with representative offices in Hong Kong SAR and Mexico City. We are able to recruit globally, regardless of nationality, and offer competitive employment packages.

We are looking for a Quantitative Risk Analyst / Developer (with the corporate title of Risk Analyst) to join the Risk Methodology team responsible for the development and implementation of models to measure, manage and report financial and operational risks. The ideal candidate has a solid background in financial risk measurement and a strong general interest in risk management. S/he has extensive experience in software development and IT project management, and is a client-oriented, flexible team player, comfortable working in a multi-cultural environment.



Key responsibilities:



  • Contribute to the development of infrastructure and business processes to manage financial and operational risks while promoting a strong risk control culture

  • Design and develop .NET and Business Intelligence (BI) applications, interfaces and services

  • Develop, implement and calibrate quantitative risk models across all risk types

  • Manage projects focusing on the selection, implementation and maintenance of IT risk solutions; Ensure the reliability of Risk Methodology’s systems

  • As a quantitative risk analyst, conduct independent research and contribute to exchanges with senior management

  • Develop and maintain collaborative relationships within the Bank and with external contacts such as peers at central bank, IT service providers and consultants

item.title: Trading, Analytics And Execution Developer (C++) at Bloomberg LP (London, UK)
item.description:
The Role:

The Trading, Analytics, and Execution teams at Bloomberg develop technology that ensures that the global financial markets run smoothly. The applications and infrastructure built by our teams connect supply and demand, across all asset classes, on worldwide exchanges. Trillions of dollars of capital move through our systems daily; and as a result, market leaders rely on us to flawlessly and seamlessly manage their positions and execute their orders.

We help our clients navigate an increasingly complex business with best-in-class tools to manage risk and regulation. Using the latest technology in our enterprise analytic tools, we provide unique insights that enable our clients to make better investment decisions.


Teams in Trading, Analytics and Execution:

Asset and Investment Manager (AIM) Trading Solutions

AIM is a large-scale, high-performance, distributed software system that is fully hosted and managed. AIM delivers unparalleled, multi-asset, hosted solutions for Order Management, Electronic Trading and Execution, Portfolio Management and Back Office activities. Derivatives are a growing area of focus for Bloomberg & the AIM business. The AIM Derivatives team is responsible for the maintenance and development of multiple existing applications covering Foreign Exchange (FX), Credit Default Swaps (CDS) and Interest Rate Swaps (IRS) derivatives trading. Our software is also closely involved with global regulations and our customers rely on AIM to ensure their compliance with the complex and evolving regulatory landscape.

Enterprise Connectivity and Integration

The Enterprise Connectivity and Integration team moves data between Bloomberg's Enterprise products and client systems. Our user interface provides the user with a single place to configure and monitor all of their data traffic across the Bloomberg system. The data we transmit is critical to our clients' operations so our systems must be reliable, resilient and fast.

Equity Trader

The primary focus of the Equity Trader group is to provide real-time analytics based on market and order-related data to clients in the financial industry. We develop highly resilient and efficient applications to monitor, enrich and display market activity as well as order flow. These services are performance sensitive and at peak capacity process hundreds of thousands of orders or trades in a single second. We architect solutions to distribute and integrate our data in several client-facing applications that are part of the Bloomberg Terminal and leverage these services within non-terminal enterprise products. Our role also involves building compelling and interactive user interfaces to expose our data and help build an intuitive workflow. As a result our products are business critical for thousands of clients who access them millions of times a day.

Fixed Income Electronic Trading (FIT)

The FIT team has a strong foothold in the fixed income space with over 90% market share in asset classes such as Credit Default Swaps and Interest Rate Swaps. This is an exciting time to join the team as we look to increase our product offering, while consolidating the considerable gains made in the changing and challenging trading environments. Projects will include building new trading platforms and enhancements to our existing offering. Our team members are involved in all aspects from product design to release, working on a mix of ticketing, server infrastructure and connectivity.

Foreign Exchange Electronic Trading (FXGO)

With over $5 trillion traded every day, the FX market is the world's largest market, and we are building our Bloomberg FXGO Trading Platform to be a premier multi-counterparty platform. You will be part of a rapidly growing team and immediately responsible for key new projects and initiatives. Our team owns various parts of the Bloomberg FX Trading Platform, which includes a 24 hour low latency multi-bank streaming trade application, post trade delivery system, confirmation and settlement centre and integrations with sell-side and buy-side clients.

Institutional Sales

The Institutional Sales Applications group develops multi-asset applications for Sales, Traders and Research Sales professionals. Our goal is to provide tools that empower salespeople and their managers to provide world-class service to their institutional clients. These tools leverage sophisticated algorithms to present simple answers to common questions that a salesperson faces throughout the day. Successful members of the team have a strong interest in finding solutions that manage and distill large volumes of disparate data to produce clear and powerful insights, and they are excited by the prospect of working in this important and rapidly evolving business.

Portfolio and Risk Analytics

The Portfolio and Risk Analytics team develops applications that provide transparency and insight to asset managers and analysts, empowering them to make smart financial decisions. The team develops an integrated access layer to multi-asset risk, return attribution, characteristics, intra-day P&L monitoring and portfolio optimization. Our London team focuses on delivering a comprehensive, high-throughput, distributed access layer that provides complex, multi-dimensional portfolio and risk analytics to various on-screen applications, professional reporting platforms, data visualization workflows, alerts, and others. We offer ample opportunity to contribute towards the design and implementation of core portfolio technologies as well as financial products.

Sell Side Equity Order Management Systems (SSEOMS)

SSEOMS is becoming a global enterprise-wide order management system. We are a fast growing business within Bloomberg, and on our way to becoming the leader in the industry. Developers will gain valuable equity trading and order management expertise in a very fast paced, real-time, mission critical environment. We are developing low-latency, high capacity sub-systems that handle orders, trades, risk, position, commissions, middle office, compliance and connectivity to the major exchanges around the globe.

Trade Order Management (TOMS & ETOMS) Trading Solutions

The TOMS product is used by financial professionals all over the world to support their trading, offering, pricing, risk and portfolio management needs. Our London TOMS team is responsible for the ever-growing Foreign Exchange functionality within the product. This involves connecting to other internal systems as well as building low-latency, high-volume processing systems to manage the large portfolios that our clients maintain. TOMS delivers a global, multi-asset, solution for trade capture, inventory management, and middle office operations. Our team provides powerful tools that allow traders to manage positions, make markets, and manage their risk and P&L, all in a streamlined, customized straight-through-processing workflow.

ETOMS is an industry-leading, multi-asset class electronic workflow solution for the sell-side community. The team develops low-latency connectivity solutions to European exchanges, as well as trading tools and workflows.

Tradebook

Bloomberg Tradebook is a leading agency broker, a US Electronic Communication Network, and a technology provider of a cross-asset electronic trading platform, supporting Equities, Futures, Options and FX trading.
Providing market access to 120+ liquidity venues globally, our focus is on developing low latency & real-time black box trading systems, algorithmic trading systems, connectivity/FIX solutions and providing direct market connectivity solutions.

item.title: QA Lead / Software Engineer in Test at Simply Business (London, UK)
item.description:
Simply Business – We are looking for a QA Lead (this could be a ‘step up’ role for you, or you could already be coming with this experience)


Based onsite in Moorgate, London


The exciting part = It’s totally a blank canvas for someone to come in and set the direction and strategy of our QA and drive that change across the company.


We’re the UK’s leading price comparison site for small businesses and startups looking for insurance. We’ve completed disrupted an ‘old school’ and traditional industry and revolutionized it with our state of the art technology and now we’re looking to grow!


The role



  • You will be our most senior QA person and responsible for taking an excellent Agile QA team to a
    new level

  • Hands-­on whilst leading a team of 6 QA Analysts and setting the direction and strategy for the team
    and the QA function as a whole

  • You will liaise with our Tech Leadership team to continue the strong integration of our QA function in
    the development process

  • As we do Continuous Delivery, your testing focus will be geared heavily to the automation side of
    things, but we do what makes most sense for each situation

  • Work with product owners and track leads to review and set story and feature acceptance criteria

  • Implement business functionality in a testable form

  • Develop appropriate and maintainable test automation functionality at unit, integration and system
    tiers

  • Act as a customer champion within the team, representing risks and needs when implementing
    solutions


Some things we believe in


*Creating an best-in-class technology culture – Agile / Lean / TDD / Continuous Delivery (we release software to production about 14 times a day on average) / pair programming / cross functional teams working together on projects (Dev/QA/UX/product) / Active participation in open source


*Never chaining ourselves to a technology – always experimenting and ‘using the right tool for the job’


*Thought leadership – we host meetup groups and present talks in our office and the community


*Creating a great working environment and culture (modern open plan office, flexible hours, remote working, regular team events, paid company holidays abroad, afterwork clubs – like UX, Robotic, Data science clubs, finish early on fridays, ruby coding challenges over pizza, lunchtime TED talks and lot’s more!)


*Continuous learning – we look to pay for conferences and courses. Recently we have sent some of our team out to Miami, Portugal and Barcelona for tech events and conferences (paid for).


Our tech stack


Cucumber / RSpec / Turnip / Jasmine
Ruby on Rails
MongoDB
RabbitMQ
Puppet/Boxen
AWS
SASS / HAML / HTML5 / CSS3 / JavaScript / CoffeeScript / jQuery


This list is always changing as we do not believe in limiting ourselves with technology, we are always experimenting and using the right tool for the job

item.title: Senior Software Development Engineer at Rhapsody International/Napster (Seattle, WA.) (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
Rhapsody is experiencing significant growth in subscribers, expanding internationally, and is always looking to bring in top talent. We have start-up feel with the security of a strong revenue stream. With more than 3 million paying subscribers and over 32 million songs, Rhapsody is leading the digital music service revolution in the US (and soon globally).  We make it possible for fans to listen to any song, anytime and anywhere.


About The Role:  
In this role you will focus on development of Java-based middle tier and back-end services. The Platform Services team within Rhapsody International is responsible for the creation, delivery and support of back-end systems such as user profile services, ecommerce services and music data services. The team consists of technical architects, developers, test engineers, business & technical analysts, program/project managers, headquartered in Seattle, Washington.


As our new Senior Software Development Engineer you'll be responsible for development of major areas of functionality. You hold yourself to high standards and strive to bring out the best in others .


Perks:


We are very proud of the culture that we have built at Rhapsody.  Below is a snapshot of some of our benefits and perks, but what you will be most blown away by is the amazing talent you will get to work with here.



  • Benefits, including medical, dental, vision, life insurance

  • Free Rhapsody Premium Account (with great music discovery advice from your peers)

  • Brand new state of the art office in downtown Seattle’s Columbia Tower

  • Centrally located near public transportation,  ferries, bike parking, as well as subsidized commuting options.

  • Highly collaborative, hardworking, open environment where you’ll work alongside extremely creative and dedicated people.

  • One of the most generous paid time-off packages in the industry and you are encouraged to use it

  • In-house private music concerts on the incredible Rhapsody Stage

  • Brown bag Lunch & Learn sessions

  • Sponsored off-site company events.




The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification.  They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified.  All personnel may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed.  Rhapsody International Inc. is an equal opportunity employer.

item.title: Salesforce Technical Architect at Open English LLC (Miami, FL)
item.description:
Open English is seeking a new Salesforce Technical Architect to join the Operations team at our headquarters office in Coconut Grove, FL. You will be part of a team responsible for delivering a world-class CRM solution.  In your role, you will ensure that the overall Salesforce solution optimizes our investment in Salesforce, balancing business needs with technical complexity. Your role will span all aspects of the software development life-cycle and include working alongside our business, development and user experience teams in a highly collaborative environment where every individual’s input is valued.





  • Understand and evaluate business requirements in the context of our overall system solutions, including systems outside of Salesforce (five9, Zuora, Exact Target, Spot Fire, Call Miner and proprietary applications).

  • Perform gap analysis between business requirements and Salesforce functionality

  • Develop overall solution design options and recommendations, considering pros and cons (i.e. object structure, development of formulas, integration points, needs for non-native functionality)

  • Conduct design review meetings and lead the evaluation of technical requirements and options

  • Write comprehensive design specifications (functional specifications, solution design document, technical design document)

  • Coordinate and negotiate solutions to complex, cross-functional scenarios with multiple parties and interests

  • Configure, administer and develop within Salesforce, to support prototyping and solution approaches, within a larger team of analysts and developers

  • Help set technical standards and guidelines for Salesforce, and coach developers on best practices

  • Conduct code reviews and provide appropriate feedback

  • Stay abreast of the current and future Salesforce feature set relevant to our organization, in addition to general industry IT trends, and set direction for team to adopt features and technology

  • Experience with Sales, marketing and service business domains

item.title: QA Analyst at Big Viking Games (London, ON, Canada)
item.description:
The Nitty Gritty: 


We are on the hunt for a full-time QA Analyst to help us in our quest of creating the most fun social and mobile games. As QA Analyst, your primary responsibility is to create and execute test cases for assigned features while communicating issues, risks and test statuses in a timely and detailed manner. You are a key player in helping us provide our fans with the best gaming experiences available. This position is available at our London, ON studio. 


The Duties:



  • Upstream testing and analysis to prevent bugs from entering the integrated game code. You're a gatekeeper; no bug is getting past you!

  • Create, maintain and execute test plans that test a product from end-to-end

  • Verifying and broadcasting performance results on multiple environments and platforms. You are a quarterback of communication and ensure that tests and procedures are properly understood, carried out and evaluated.

  • Executing test routines for integration, system, load and performance testing

  • Effectively collaborating with team members to achieve the best results - you play well in the Viking sandbox. 

  • A Titan of triage, you properly catalogue priority and severity of issues found during the QA testing process


The Loot:



  • Competitive salaries with generous time off policies

  • Health, dental, vision, life and disability benefits

  • Employee stock option plan; this way we all get to celebrate in the success

  • We frequently celebrate hitting milestones after work or even in the middle of the afternoon by going to paintball, movies, Canada's Wonderland, and a patio to name a few in addition to various in-studio events.  All work and no play makes for a dull Viking.

  • Stocked kitchen, breakfast & hot catered lunches daily! Viking can't work on an empty stomach.

  • A gaming lounge with competition grade foosball, XBOX 360, PS4 & Wii U. Kick back and relax or dominate your fellow Vikings (in a totally HR friendly way).

  • If you cannot live without caffeine like us, we have an arsenal of freshly roasted coffee beans which can be crafted into great coffees, espressos or lattes just for you!

  • Free in-studio registered massage therapy. Viking muscles need love too.

item.title: Performance Analyst / Senior SW Engineer (m/w) at Harman Becker Automotive Systems GmbH (Filderstadt, Deutschland)
item.description:
Ihre Aufgaben:



  • Performance Analysen von Infotainment Systemen und deren SW-Komponenten mit Hilfe geeigneter Werkzeuge. (SPOT Tools ...)

  • Aufdecken von Schwachstellen im Bereich HW Auslastung, Interface-Design und SW Implementierung

  • Aktive Begleitung von Projekten bei der Umsetzung des Performance Evaluierungsprozesses (PEP), insbesondere Anwendung von Benchmark Tests und Metriken zur Sicherstellung der Kundenspezifischen KPIs

  • Enge Zusammenarbeit mit Kundenprojekte an internationalen Standorten (Indien, Korea, USA, China) durch regelmäßige Kommunikation und gegebenenfalls Unterstützung vor Ort

  • Entwicklung von Software Werkzeugen unter Linux und QNX zur besseren Analyse der Infotainment Systeme, sowohl in der Entwicklungsphase, als auch im Fahrzeug beim Kunden

  • Technischer Ansprechpartner bei Performance relevanten Problemen und Teststrategien für die Abteilungen der Kundenprojekte


Unser Angebot:


Setzen Sie Ihre Karriere bei HARMAN, einem weltweit führenden Unternehmen in den Bereichen Infotainment und Car Audio fort. Wir sind seit vielen Jahren erfolgreich am Markt aktiv und zählen die größten Premium-Automobilhersteller zu unseren Kunden. Als Mitarbeiter bei HARMAN haben Sie die Möglichkeit, sich aktiv einzubringen und tragen damit maßgeblich zum gesamten Unternehmenserfolg bei. Das dynamische Umfeld und die Internationalität unseres Geschäfts bieten Ihnen zahlreiche Optionen, sich weiterzuentwickeln. Selbstverständlich honorieren wir Ihren Einsatz und Sachverstand mit einem attraktiven Gehaltspaket. HARMAN ist ein Arbeitgeber, der Wert auf gleiche Beschäftigungschancen von Frauen und Männern legt. Bewerbungen von qualifizierten Frauen sind daher besonders willkommen.

item.title: Software Engineer - Web App Developer at Rally Software (Boulder, CO)
item.description:
Are you are an experienced senior developer with a broad skill set and a passion for tackling complex and challenging problems? Rally is growing rapidly, so the problems we solve are big and getting bigger. We think about quality, testing, and scaling all the time. We dedicate considerable developer time to making sure we’re doing the right things, the right way.

Rally Engineering is a team of polyglots, and if you explore our repos you will find a variety of languages including: Java, JavaScript, CoffeeScript, Clojure, and Ruby. But we never exclude candidates because of their language of choice. Instead we focus on code quality and design, whether OO or functional. Our largest data store is a relational database however we’ve embraced NoSQL solutions like Cassandra, Datomic, and MongoDB.

Automated testing is a first-class citizen at Rally. We test at every level, from fast running unit tests to full-stack integration tests that drive dozens of concurrent browsers using Selenium. Our test suite is one of the largest and most comprehensive you might ever encounter. Yet our build pipeline from commit, through full test suite execution, and package for production deployment is exceedingly fast.

At Rally we seek people who are passionate about the software industry and want to work with the best and brightest. We value teamwork, the ability to make and meet commitments, dedication to continual improvement, and a proven track record in creating successful, highly usable software.

We strive for a healthy, productive work/life balance, while enjoying the opportunity to substantially contribute to the direction and success of a vibrant software business.

item.title: Business Applications Specialist at The British Museum (London, UK)
item.description:
The British Museum’s Information Services team is seeking a Business Applications Specialist to help deliver ITIL Service Transition but also collaborate on Service Design and contribute to Service Strategy based on the ITIL framework. Feedback from staff is that this is an interesting place to work not only because of what the museum holds, but because of the variety of systems and technologies in use.


This is an exciting time to join Information Services and the Museum. The museum’s first digital strategy has been approved by the Trustees and is in the early stages of implementation which will result in new technologies being introduced and will encourage new ways of working and interacting with our visitors (both virtual and physical). In addition, aging legacy systems are being replaced, often with cloud-based systems, which requires new thinking about how to transition those systems to operational services and how to ensure stakeholder benefits.


There is never a dull moment at the Museum and interactions will involve functions from across the museum. One minute you could be working on an efficiency project that will save administrative staff considerable time in managing a business process, the next moment you may be helping develop functionality which will allow mobile cataloguing of our collection, or helping build a big data platform.


The role provides a unique opportunity to gain an understanding of how one of the most important museum’s in the world operates, insights into what we hold in our collection and be part of community of people passionate about the values of the Museum and its 255-year legacy of providing free access to the history of the world. This is an excellent opportunity to leverage your career in IS with the most popular tourist attraction in the U.K.

item.title: Analytics, Trading, And Execution C++ Developer at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:

Analytics, Trading, and Execution is the largest and fastest growing department in R&D, and we are looking to add skilled software developers to our six core groups. The applications and infrastructure we build connect supply and demand across all asset classes on worldwide exchanges. Trillions of dollars of capital move through our systems daily; as a result, market leaders rely on us to flawlessly and seamlessly manage their positions and execute their orders.

We are looking for bold, energetic, and independent developers to take ownership and responsibility in growing our industry leading applications. The ideal candidates should be able to lead projects, work with the business, meet clients, and understand their workflows to build high performance software. Our engineers are responsible for front-end UI/workflow applications, server-side/back-end development, system design, and high performance transactional database programming.


>> More information on individual groups and their products can be found below. When you apply, you will have the ability to select your preferred group.

Trading Solutions

Trading Solutions is the largest group within Analytics, Trading, and Execution. The group designs and builds Bloomberg's three core order management systems, a fully developed connectivity and integration product and an order execution platform. These mission-critical trading applications are used by broker dealers and investment advisers throughout the world for managing orders, executions, quotes and positions. We are the global leader in building and delivering vital financial trading applications that allow banks and investment managers to manage their order flow, risk, P&L and the entire trade life cycle. Institutions rely on our advanced tools for market compliance, connectivity and algorithmic strategy trading. Collectively, our teams provide a front to back environment to meet our clients' ever changing needs.

Fixed Income, Currencies, and Commodities

The Fixed Income, Currencies, and Commodities (FICC) electronic trading group develops a global product that facilitates dealer to client trading, liquidity, and straight through processing using the Bloomberg terminal. It is the primary mechanism by which our buy-side clients source liquidity. Over the last 20 years, FICC has evolved from selling a simple dealer platform to offering a sophisticated trading platform with an array of trading styles. Responsibilities include infrastructure design and implementation, database management and user interface development.

Equity Trader

The Equity Trader group provides highly resilient, efficient, configurable and distributed real-time trading platforms. We build the analytics used to make trading decisions, the UI used to interact with the market and other traders, tools to automate workflow, and advanced alerting to monitor ongoing activity. The system handles millions of transactions per day and enables traders to send orders to over 5,000 liquidity destinations globally. The transactions are published and mined for real-time analytics and post-trade execution analysis, and are then fed back into the system to shape tomorrow's trading decisions.

Institutional Sales Applications

The Institutional Sales Applications group develops multi-asset applications for sales professionals that empower them to provide world-class service to their institutional clients. Our applications leverage sophisticated algorithms to present easy to understand answers to questions that a salesperson faces throughout the day. Successful developers are interested in finding solutions to manage and distill large volumes of disparate data.

Portfolio and Risk Analytics

The Portfolio and Risk Analytics group develops applications that provide transparency to asset managers and analysts, to help them to make well-informed financial decisions. Our clients use our real-time system for performance analysis and returns attribution, risk analytics, intraday monitoring, optimization and idea generation. Portfolio and Risk Analytics also provides a suite of global, transparent and independent indices to serve the needs of the investment community. Our team applies broad financial and mathematical knowledge across a range of asset types to develop a constantly growing set of analytics. The scale of these calculations offers opportunities for optimizing the system using Hbase, Spark, Redis and Solr. The team is redesigning a large part of our architectural stack to keep pace with the tremendous growth of our product.

Tradebook

Tradebook is building the next generation low latency trading platform, which supports multi-asset trading, exchange routing and order matching. With high capacity and sub-microsecond latency, the new system will be the foundation for Tradebook's future and propel it into more markets. Bloomberg Tradebook is a leading agency broker and technology provider of a cross-asset electronic trading platform, supporting equities, futures, options and FX trading. We focus on developing real-time black box and algorithmic trading systems, connectivity/FIX solutions and providing direct market connectivity solutions to 120+ liquidity venues globally.

item.title: Technical Support Analyst at Feedzai (Lisbon, Portugal)

item.title: Infrastructure Engineer at Rally Software (Boulder, CO)
item.description:
Rally is seeking an experienced, self-motivated, and passionate Infrastructure Engineer to join our team.  Are you someone who loves to solve big problems and who doesn’t settle for the status quo?  We believe in finding the right tool, hardware, or software for the job, we don’t care if it’s open source or proprietary.

If it makes our systems faster, more secure, and scalable we want to hear about it.   Because we are an Agile company you won’t be working in a silo.  We need you to have broad experience in system administration, network operations, some coding experience, build and release engineering, performance engineering and site operations.  We don’t expect anyone to know everything, we just need people who are quick studies that aren’t afraid to jump in with both feet and learn by doing.


An entrepreneurial fast paced mentality is critical for success in this position: a passionate can-do attitude, exceptional communication skills, and the ability to collaborate while acting as a thought leader in your area of expertise will serve you well at Rally Software. Does this sound like a challenge you're ready for?


Once hired, here’s what we’ll need you to do.


Key Responsibilities:




  • Partner with developers, architects and the business to optimize the integration and delivery of existing and new services




  • Support, troubleshoot and maintain the Rally global production infrastructure ecosystem (AWS, data center, and on-premises installations)




  • Build and maintain configuration management recipes in Chef




  • Enable autonomy in development teams through the creation and delivery of valuable self-service and automation capabilities




  • Work with developers and product owners to lead operational readiness throughout the SDLC




  • Pair with other engineers to promote skills enhancement and knowledge sharing




  • Research and share the latest innovations in automation and virtualized infrastructure




Skills Required:




  • BS/MS in Computer Science or 5+ years of relevant industry experience




  • Prior experience supporting large scale, highly available, service-oriented, distributed production systems.




  • Very strong Linux experience in a highly-available production environment




  • Experience building production hosting environments from bare metal up




  • Familiarity with SaaS, PaaS or IaaS




  • Strong understanding of best practices around release engineering




  • Exposure to different types of data storage




  • Strong written & oral communication skills are essential




  • Experience using tools such as Git, Docker, Puppet and/or Chef




  • Advanced scripting skills




You will be successful in this role if you:




  • Believe in Agile principles and iterative development




  • Can be autonomous and self-driven but work across teams to collaborate on common ideas and strategies




  • Are comfortable working with automation and are willing to learn tools you aren’t familiar with




  • Enjoy exploring and experimenting with new ideas and sharing with others




  • Can communicate ideas clearly and effectively




  • Have a positive attitude when engaging with our customers (development teams, the business and occasionally external customers)




Location: Boulder, CO (relocation assistance available)


Rally’s global headquarters is in Boulder, Colorado, with 9 additional offices spanning 4 continents. At Rally we believe that we can’t inspire innovation in our customers if we’re not innovative ourselves. We empower our teams by offering them flexibility, autonomy, and a culture founded upon open communication and collaboration. Recently awarded Best for the World: Worker Impact award for the third year in a row by B Labs, Named #8 on the “Best Medium-Sized Workplaces” by Fortune Magazine, a “Best Company to Work For in Colorado” and ranked in the “Top 100 Best Places to Work” in the nation from Outside Magazine, Rally offers a highly collaborative culture and work-life balance that attracts and retains top talent.


Rally is an Equal Opportunity Employer!

Rally Software Development Corp., a wholly owned subsidiary of CA, Inc.

Occasionally you’ll provide IT infrastructure support, sometimes acting as remote hands for globally-based colleagues.


You’ll be a strong advocate for a satellite office in a global IT team, sharing successes, challenges and ideas for improvement with colleagues across the pond.


If you like the sound of this then we'd love to hear from you! To apply, simply upload your résumé and covering letter to http://www.red-gate.com/our-company/careers/current-opportunities/help-desk-analyst-us.


What's the package?

  • Start as soon as possible

  • A well-stocked feel good fridge

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Priceline.com (Norwalk, CT)
item.description:
Are you a Software Engineer passionate about creating great software?  Is your mantra “Class, Responsibility, Collaboration?”  Do you want to develop products that are very important to the growth and success of the company?  Do you want to work very closely with the business folks?  Are you looking for a company that is not too big, not too small, and has a casual and agile work environment?  If so, then we just might have the perfect job for you!


The Rental Car group at priceline.com is looking for a talented engineer to join our services tier team.  In this software engineering role you will develop services software that supports the searching and booking of rental cars on priceline.com and other company-owned web sites, mobile platforms, as well as through our affiliate API.

We strongly believe that there is real value to the organization in crafting and engineering software beautifully so that it can be easily understood, maintained, and extended. We work directly with the business team and are involved in shaping our product and improving our business.  The Rental Car business is a major contributor to the company’s bottom line and still has significant opportunity for growth.  We work hard at creating software to improve the business and we do so in a casual, fun and flexible work environment.


You will have the opportunity to use your Java skills to craft internal and external Web services; connect to external suppliers via Global Distribution Systems (GDS) and Web services; work with high capacity, multi-threaded systems; create and use various kinds of caches; build interaction points between the Rental Car product and the other Priceline products (e.g. Hotels, Airline); build tools to help manage and control our systems, and much more!

item.title: Software Engineer - Java, Scala at HBC Digital, Saks Fifth Avenue (New York, NY)
item.description:
You will work on a fairly small, cross-functional team. A typical team will consist of about four developers, a dev manager, a project manager, a product manager, one or two QA engineers, one or two front-end engineers, a business analyst, an infrastructure engineer, a data engineer, and a creative — although things can vary depending on the nature of the work at hand. The team sits together, works as a fairly autonomous unit, and owns the accountability for delivering value. Teams don’t operate in a top-down fashion; if you’re on the team, then you’re on the team, and you’re expected to be freely interacting with everyone else on the team.


Projects are run in an Agile fashion, although we do not strictly follow any one flavor. Suffice it to say that you will never have a pile of requirements flung over the wall at you, nor will you in turn fling your work over the wall to another team.  


While we do practice pairing, it’s not dogmatic. What you’ll often see is someone working through a problem for an hour or so, and then turning to the person next to them and walking them through what they’ve just done. There are times when full-on pairing makes sense, and times when it doesn’t make sense at all, but we leave that up to the developers to decide. 


We have a strong belief in the value of automated testing, so writing tests, designing for testability, and selecting good testing tools will be something that you’ll spend a significant amount of time thinking about. 


Most of the work that you’ll do will involve either adding features to one of our commerce sites, or helping to build out the platform on which they’re running. You can expect to be working with a mix of Java and Scala. If you have never worked with Scala, don’t worry, we’re perfectly happy to help you get up to speed. It’s a great language, and we’ve found that people really enjoy working with it. There is also some Clojure in our ecosystem, so you may get the chance to work with that as well. On the Scala side of things, we are heavily leveraging Akka and Play, as well.

item.title: Modeling and Simulation Analyst at Stellar Science (Albuquerque, NM)
item.description:
Stellar Science is a growing Albuquerque-based scientific software development company seeking talented scientists that are interested in helping create and extend exciting scientific and engineering analysis applications. This is a new position at Stellar Science and we are looking for individuals that are interested in helping us define this role and mature our applications. Specifically, we are looking for individuals that are motivated, excited to learn new tools, and willing to help wherever they are needed.

We develop custom software products in domains that include computer vision and image processing, image simulation, high power microwave systems modeling and simulation, laser source generation and effects modeling, computational electromagnetics (CEM), space situational awareness (SSA), high performance computing (HPC), and computer aided design (CAD) tools, among others.

A Stellar Science Modeling and Simulation Analyst will be involved in all aspects of our application software life cycle, from marketing & business development to design, testing, documentation, and the customer interaction along the way. They will be working with management and the development teams to improve our applications and make our customers happy. We are looking for someone that has great verbal and written communication ability and stellar presentation skills. Someone that is eager to learn and excited to explore new domains.

Applicants may range from recent college graduates to experienced software engineers; the main requirements are that candidates be top-notch, responsible, self-motivated, honest, able to work well independently or in small teams, and be able to rapidly learn new tools, and techniques as needed to meet mission requirements.

Minimum Requirements:

B.S. in physics, math, engineering, or a related field
Confident, articulate, and professional speaking abilities
Exceptional computer skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Experience with software testing
Scientific analysis experience in one or more of the following domains:

  • Space Situational Awareness (SSA)
  • Image Simulation and Analysis
  • Computational Electromagnetics (CEM)
  • 3D CAD
  • Image-based Meshing
  • Directed Energy
  • Lasers
  • High Power Microwave (HPM)
  • High Performance Computing (HPC)
  • Modeling & Simulation

U.S. citizen willing to undergo background investigation and perform some work at Kirtland Air Force Base

Desired:

M.S. or Ph.D. in a scientific or engineering field with substantial scientific analysis experience

Stellar Science is a forward-thinking business that allows its employees to work at home on occasion when consistent with job requirements. Standard benefits include ten paid federal holidays (which may be floated as desired), three weeks vacation, a generous fully employer-funded SEP IRA, and fully employer-funded health insurance, as well as dental, disability, and life insurance.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, or national origin, in accordance with CFR 60-1.

item.title: Threat Intelligence Manager at NTT Com Security (Göteborg, Sverige)
item.description:
Are you striving to make advances in the world of IT Security, do you want to put a stop to Security Threats, if so read on, we have the job for you……………


Working as a Threat Intelligence Manager you will be responsible for building and managing the Advanced Services’ Threat Intelligence team to deliver actionable intelligence for direct consumption in the analysis engine and by our Security Analysts.


We are NTT Com Security -part of NTT Communications Group – one of the world’s largest ICT companies, which provides us with scale and funding whilst allowing us remain agile with the flexibility to adapt quickly to changing market requirements.  We have a growing, global customer base which includes many of the world’s largest companies across all industry sectors. We have 24 offices across 12 countries, enabling us to apply local understanding to global challenges. As a global organisation, there are many, great opportunities for our people to travel and work in other regions.


Working as a Threat Intelligence Manager, you will



  • Be responsible for building and managing the Advanced Services’ Threat Intelligence team to deliver actionable intelligence for direct consumption in the analysis engine and by the Security Analysts in GROC L3.

  • Provide research, analysis, and operational support to the other GROC L3 teams

  • Lead the Threat Intelligence team on a daily basis actively prioritize actions and focus of the team.

  • Drive the team to constantly strive for increased knowledge and expertise to be in the forefront in their field.

  • Work closely together with the GROC Managers and their Security Analysts in order for the teams to always provide the best possible protection of our customers.

  • Take an active rule to analyze and provide assessment on larger outbreaks and major incidents that occur and affect the department, the company and their customers.

  • Drive the organization’s direction on research in the Cyber threat field, including areas such as APT, malware, exploit kits etc.

  • Acts as a key stakeholder and collaboration point to the R&D team and to other functional groups on matters pertaining to the threat landscape.

  • Participate in the process of setting future technical strategies and influence strategic direction for the analysis engine and the MSS services
