item.title: Technical Incident Analyst at Zalando SE (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
The opportunity


This is a job where you will be challenged on a daily basis. You are encouraged to bring your own ideas with you and to think outside the box. You will be responsible for the quality of the software and making sure it runs properly. You will be working on the technical analysis, documentation and maintenance of any errors found.


What we are looking for



  • You have a degree/traineeship in IT (e.g. IT specialist in system integration) and at least 2 years experience in a similar Linux-related field

  • Alternatively you have experience in Linux system administration or technical support

  • The quality of your work is important to you and you enjoy using your creativity and analytical skills to make improvements and come up with ideas

  • You work independently and in a structured manner and have no problems settling in

  • You have no problems communicating in either English or German

  • Our Incident Team works in shifts so it is important that you are flexible and can work night shifts on a rotating basis


Your responsibilities



  • You are responsible for the monitoring of our business processes as well as for problem analysis, trouble-shooting and documentation

  • You analyse complex software errors, coming up with solutions and work closely together with the 2nd Level Incident Manager in implementing the solutions/changes

  • You are responsible for monitoring checks, carrying these out on a regular basis

  • Experience with eCommerce software and related business processes is of an advantage


What you can expect from us



  • A highly motivated team of developers, database and system operators, quality managers and product managers

  • Opportunities for development

  • A unique corporate culture where results are what matter

  • Use of open source technology

  • State-of-the-art hardware

  • Internal ‘tech talks' and meetings with other startups

  • Company pension

  • Employee discount

  • Free fruit and drinks, a friendly office with table football in central Berlin


About Zalando


Zalando is Europe’s leading online fashion platform, doing business in 15 markets. Delivering first-class shopping experiences to our +15 million customers requires moving fast — with microservices, Agile processes & autonomous teams  —  and using cutting edge, open source technologies. We are passionate about what we do and have fun while doing it. And we are willing to experiment and make mistakes: It’s how we grow.


Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!


If you need guidance or have any questions about our recruiting and hiring processes, please contact recruiter Sameer Shaikh at jobs@zalando.de

item.title: Big Data Engineer at Hearst Corporation (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Data Services group is a team within the Hearst Corporate Technology organization tasked with developing Hearst’s enterprise­wide data pipeline and promoting next-level business decisions utilizing that Big Data. This involves establishing a company-­wide data resource by collecting Hearst’s diverse data resources at an audience level and making it available to product and business intelligence teams. 

As Big Data Engineer, you will be responsible for building and maintaining our Big Data initiatives for Hearst Data Warehouse platform. The ideal candidate is someone with a mix of Dev-Ops and Big Data skillsets, who offers innovative solutions through a combination of creative thinking and deep understanding of the problem space. He or she will help define and implement new processes on the Hearst Data Warehouse platform and work closely with Data Scientists to transform Big Data into model-­ready forms to support analytic projects. 


Key Responsibilities: 



  • Develop technology platform on AWS cloud that will support Big Data processing and analytics behind Hearst Data Warehouse platform 

  • Create data transformation processes and jobs for Hearst Data Warehouse platform, using most suitable applications and tools on top of Apache Hadoop 

  • Identify, analyze and resolve technical problems with Hearst Data Warehouse platform and related ecosystem

item.title: Senior Information Security Analyst at NASDAQ (Stockholm, Sweden)
item.description:
JOB SUMMARY:


Information Security is responsible for coordinating the protection of the organization’s core business operations and information against real-world cyber threats, by employing technology, policy, processes, education programs, and sound design techniques across the enterprise. To be effective, information security must be a team effort involving the participation and support of every Nasdaq worker who deals with information and information systems.


Where will you be working?


Nasdaq is critically dependent on information and information systems. The good reputation that Nasdaq enjoys is also directly linked with the way that it manages both information and information systems. For example, if private customer information were to be publicly disclosed, the organization’s reputation would be harmed.


Guidance, direction, and authority for information security activities are centralized for all Nasdaq organizational units in the Information Security department. Nasdaq information must be consistently protected in a manner commensurate with its sensitivity, value, and criticality.


What are your daily activities?



  • You will be responsible for performing penetration testing of web applications, code, system architecture, and/or risk assessment reviews on enterprise systems along with providing specific recommendations for addressing identified vulnerabilities and risks.

  • The position requires working  with development teams to review application security findings and to assist with the remediation efforts.

  • This position requires that you have excellent interpersonal and team working skills. You will work in a high pressure, real time operating environment and need to have strong communication skills. The successful candidate is analytical and highly technical and a self-starter.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at SugarCRM (Cupertino, CA)

To be successful in this role, you must be a quick learner, able to adapt and understand various businesses, have stellar software development, and great communication skills. In this role you will be working as a full-stack engineer developing front end and server side components of the product with a strong emphasis on reliable, maintainable, and scalable software that runs in a high volume, high availability environment.

item.title: Data Warehouse Engineer at Supplyframe (Pasadena, CA)
item.description:
At Suppyframe, our mission is to deliver the best information, tool, and technology to electronic industry professionals. Through our network of products, we help passionate engineer research, locate, and innovate products while share their creations with other like-minded engineers around the world.



The data warehouse engineer position supports every business line and functional organization within the company. As we expand our capabilities in the areas of data mining, machine learning, and Big Data analysis, this position will be key to help deliver value to our customers. The data warehouse engineer will have the opportunity to access data from both traditional (RDBMS) and non-traditional (Hadoop, steaming) sources while chartering a path to develop and integrate additional big data concepts. This position offers the opportunity to tackle complex problems while delivering real-world solutions.

item.title: Sr Big Data Engineer at CARD.com (Santa Monica, CA)
item.description:
Data and scientific insights are the basis of growth at CARD.com. To investing further in this core value, our Growth & Data Science team seeks an Experienced Data Engineer who can build and manage our data operations. These operations include developing measurement strategies, architecting our data warehouse, managing & implementing ETL pipelines, and finally building & deploying scalable analytics and machine learning services.


In this role you're expected to:



  • Be the authoritative source of the location and integrity of all the company’s data

  • Architect a fast-growing hybrid data warehouse with relational and distributed data

  • Develop, maintain and optimize ETL processes directly with our data partners

  • Implement cutting-edge data streaming technologies for real-time analytics

  • Provide query performance benchmark and optimization support to the product and technology teams

  • Develop measurement strategy and schema for new product features

  • Create new metrics and metadata to understand customer pain points and improve user experience

  • Maintain documentation, deployment scripts and flow diagrams for all data services in production

  • Assist team members in exploratory data analyses and machine learning

  • Be an integral part of a cross-functional team that includes Data Scientists (PhDs), Web Developers, Engineers and Digital Marketers

item.title: Data Engineer at Komodo Health (New York, NY)
item.description:
Komodo Health is focused on building a leading platform for expertly curated big data and analytics in healthcare and life sciences. Our cloud-based data integration platform brings together disparate data from all over the Healthcare and Life Sciences industry, the public domain, and proprietary sources. Through our real-time analytical applications, Komodo Health helps enterprise customers make better decisions that improve patient outcomes. We value our culture of encouraging growth, collaboration, and constructive debate as well as delivering innovative solutions that wow our customers.

We are looking for a Data Engineer to help build out our data infrastructure using the best tools available so that data can truly flow through scalability, reliability and automatically.

This is an opportunity to join a growing team of folks accomplished in diverse Machine Intelligence and Data Engineering disciplines; focused on using the best of what lies at the forefront of technology and data science to address answer complex, real-world problems in the Healthcare and Life Science space. Some of the tools we use are: AWS, Spark, Scala, Python, Postgres, Git, Airflow and Docker.

Responsibilities


  • Build out a large scale distributed data infrastructure using the latest technologies

  • Create pipelines that collect, connect, centralize, and curate data from various internal and external data sources

  • Implement tools that help extract, analyze, and visualize data faster

  • Develop tools to monitor, debug and analyze data pipelines

  • Evaluate new technologies for continuous improvements in Data Engineering

  • Produce high quality production ready code in an agile environment

  • Collaborate closely with the product team to build new features and infrastructure

  • Work with the data scientists to implement forecasting and prediction algorithms and models in the data infrastructure


Benefits



  • Competitive salary and equity compensation

  • Full Medical, Dental, and Vision benefits

  • 401k plan with employer match

  • Your choice of equipment set-up (computer, monitor, and accessories)

  • Flexible hours and unlimited vacation days policy

  • Opportunities to attend industry conferences and events

  • Awesome team and culture

  • Great office location(s) in SF/SOMA and NY/West SoHo

  • and more...

item.title: CTO - Data Scientist w/ AWS + financial data expertise at Quadrant (New York, NY)
item.description:
Quadrant builds innovative tools to find, visualize, and analyze data. We are looking for an in-house CTO + Data Scientist with strong AWS and financial data experience. You will be a core member of a founding team in a small office. Great communication and adherence to very high standards is essential.


We're building an industry-leading platform for querying, analyzing, scaling and distributing time series data. The CTO must be fluent in large-scale data processing using AWS services. Words that shouldn't scare you include partitioned tables, automated testing, Amazon Aurora, Cloudflare, recommendation engines. You must also like building things that have never been built before.


Our clients include large banks, asset managers, hedge funds.


Qualified candidates will be:



  • Intellectually curious & competent

  • Speed and Security focused

  • Experienced in implementing best practices and techniques

  • Organized

  • Able to design & implement high-performance systems

item.title: Software Engineer (POS_ID: 10014) at Baebies, Inc. (Durham, NC)
item.description:
Baebies, Inc. is an early stage company addressing unmet needs in infant healthcare. We are looking to bring on board people with the following traits: curiosity driven, embraces rapid change, always tinkering to improve status quo, highly innovative, and committed to our mission of improving infant healthcare.


Position Summary


Responsibilities for this position primarily are in hands-on software implementation and verification.  The successful candidate will quickly take responsibility for current product testing, support, and enhancement while simultaneously contributing ideas to new products.  The candidate will also fill the role of software analyst to help determine software requirements across multiple project teams.  This position reports to the Principal Software Engineer.


Roles and Responsibilities



  • Design and implement automated unit and regression tests.

  • Provide documentation and traceability at each phase of the development cycle.

  • Implement new features for flagship product under controlled change management process.

  • Research technology trade-offs and provide inputs to the software roadmap.

  • Infrequent travel for product support and training.

item.title: Sr. Software Engineer - Agile, Electronic Medical Record Project at Integrity Digital Solutions (Temple, TX)
item.description: Integrity is seeking a full time Sr. Software Engineer to join our development team.  We are looking for talented, energetic developers who are interested in changing the lives of patients around the world. This position will include: continuing the development of our EMR platform, mentoring JR developers, and contributing to the long term technical architecture and tools for our system.  This position will require working with Subject Matter Experts, Business Analysts, Quality Assurance and DevOps to continue the successful development of the best electronic medical record on the planet.

item.title: UI Developer at Abcam (Cambridgeshire, UK)
item.description:
Abcam is looking for as software engineer, specialising in front-end application development who can deliver effectively within a multi-disciplinary Agile project team.


Duties



  • Work with other members of the project team to estimate story difficulty.

  • Pair with other developers in a project team to deliver stories.

  • Work closely with Business Analysts and QAs to ensure a quality delivery according to requirements

  • Work with other members of the project team to overcome technical difficulty

  • Be responsible for delivered software refactoring where needed and appropriate

  • Working with the rest of the team to deliver high quality working user interfaces according to templates and themes designed by our UX team.

  • Drive consistent interface and patterns across all applications on the Abcam platform

  • Any other duties as directed by the Head of Software Development


 Summary of Job Requirements:



  • The specific strong UI skills we are looking for are Javascript, CSS3, HTML, JQuery, JQueryUI and MVVM (e.g. Angular JS, Knockout)

  • Experience of most of the following C#, MVC, ASP.NET, TDD, AGILE, SCRUM (WebAPI, Relational DBs ORMs e.g. nHibernate would be a bonus).

  • Experience in working closely with backend technologies and integrating with these

  • You will need to be proficient in techniques used in producing designs of complex IT systems.

  • Experience in unit / integration / regression testing and test driven development.

  • Familiarity with various web architectures, platforms, and frameworks.

  • Familiarity with the continuous integration and continuous deployment of software.

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or numerate field.

  • Experience in e-commerce.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - Data Management at Rise Interactive (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
Rise Interactive | Careers | Senior Software Engineer - Data Management


Rise Interactive (http://www.riseinteractive.com), a rapidly growing full service interactive advertising agency, is looking to hire a Senior Software Engineer, focused on Data Management, into the Innovation team.  We are seeking a detail-oriented, highly motivated individual contributor that is excited about joining a new Innovation department and contributing professionally to an entrepreneurial company with an expanding Fortune 500 client base.


SUMMARY AND SCOPE


We’re looking for a Senior Software Engineer to help us build out our marketing and analytics platforms.  Our platform processes billions of records today – and we’re just getting started.  This role is not a research or analytical role.  Our goal is a developer who is extremely strong in data science rather than a data scientist with limited coding skills.  This is an individual contributor role that is expected to contribute to production solutions.  This position will develop the entire data pipeline from source to cube/data node.


Responsibilities:


We operate a cross-functional team that specializes when needed but aims to have everyone able to contribute.   Duties of the Senior Software Engineer include:



  • Implement and optimize data processing pipeline for terabytes of data

  • Design and build our data warehouse as well as real-time data reporting systems



  • Promote and nurture good team practices such as unit testing, code reviews, build/test automation, etc.

  • Proactively mentor and guide application developers to improve their quality and simplicity in design and code

  • Design, build and use tools to understand our product platform behavior and performance

  • Design and conduct experiments to test concepts, technologies, and algorithms

  • Implement analytics tools to maximize the value of collected data

  • Implement data tests in our data quality framework to ensure data is clean and accurate

  • Adhere to security policies and guidelines to ensure our data is protected and safe

  • Embrace and assist in evolving our Agile (Scrum) team processes and developer role responsibilities

item.title: C# .Net Developer wanted to join an award-winning FinTech business! at Caxton FX (London, UK)
item.description:
Caxton FX is looking for an experienced C# .Net Developer to join the agile development team, and develop customer facing and back office systems to support our innovative trading platform.


This is a great opportunity to join a leading and forward thinking fin-tech company, and make an impact at an exciting period of international growth.


Reporting to the IT Director, and working in a close-knit team of experienced developers, you will be developing using an end-to-end Microsoft stack utilising the latest Microsoft bleeding edge cloud technology, and will directly contribute to the growth of the business.


Key Outcomes




    • Design innovative solutions that reflect Caxton FX’s core values of Simplicity, Service and Security





    • Deliver quality code within the estimated timescales, and actively identify system defects and design and implement solutions





    • Build excellent working relationships within the IT department and the wider business

item.title: Software Architect at Coupa Software (San Mateo, CA)
item.description:
Responsibilities



  • Interact with product management, user interface designer and peers to develop software product functional specifications.

  • Interact with architecture, development leads, and product management to develop technical solution roadmaps and software product architecture.

  • Write software designs, review with peers for Coupa web applications.

  • Provide effort and risk estimates to support planning.

  • Collaborate with software developers to implement new features for Coupa web applications using Object-Oriented Design, Agile/Scrum development and technologies such as CSS, SQL, XML, and Web Standards.

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to incorporate aspects of performance, security, integrations into the design.

  • Share design knowledge and expertise with colleagues.

  • Present product demos to other parts of the organization.

  • Adhere to Coupa's development processes and best practices such as maintaining our code repository in github.com, attending daily standups and managing tasks in JIRA project management tool.


Nice-to-Haves



  • Previous experience in a enterprise application architect role

  • Knowledge of Spend Management or Procurement/Sourcing/Expenses/Invoicing/Payment domains

  • Knowledge of Ruby and Rails

  • Dealt with database performance issues and query optimization

item.title: Senior SharePoint Developer (Interim Top Secret Clearance Required) at MetroStar Systems (Reston, VA)
item.description:
Job Summary:  The SharePoint Developer develops, implements, and supports enterprise level applications that are built using Microsoft .NET, SharePoint 2010 and SQL Server.  The developer will be responsible for building scalable and high performance web based solutions.  The developer will work with a team of requirements analysts, developers and testers to develop solutions in the areas of grants management, and clinical research


Security Clearance:
Must have an Active Interim Top Secret Clearance

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:



  • Develop custom solutions that are scalable and flexible to meet customer requirements

  • Work on custom portal development solutions such as features, solutions, apps, event receivers, timer jobs

  • Develop line of business applications using SharePoint as development platform

  • Provide integration with other web applications

  • Implement and follow industry development and SharePoint best practices

  • Provide development, enhancement and O&M support on SharePoint Portals/sites

  • Analyze, document, develop and maintain custom SharePoint solutions in support of customer's business requirements

  • Performs other duties or special projects as required or as assigned by a supervisor.


Educational/Training Requirement:



  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science Or related field required


Experience:



  • 3 years of SharePoint Development, Administration, SDLC documentation



  • Experience working in an Agile environment preferred


Licenses/Certifications:



  • N/a


Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:



  • Experience using SharePoint 2010/2013 Enterprise, SharePoint Designer 2010/2013, InfoPath 2013, C#, jQuery, JavaScript, XSLT, CSS, Visual Studio 2013, SharePoint 2010/2013  JavaScript Client Side Object Model

  • Strong understanding of basic SharePoint out-of-the-box features and configuration

  • Experience customizing SharePoint pages, forms and Web Parts in SharePoint Designer

  • Experience creating declarative workflows in SharePoint Designer

  • Familiarity with SharePoint Object Model and/or Client Object Model

  • Comfortable interacting with client to gather general requirements and provide demonstrations

  • Experience developing SharePoint workflows and SharePoint application pages in Visual Studio

  • Experience with jQuery library

  • Experience with SharePoint Web Services, SharePoint farm and site-collection administration


Mental Requirements: The work environment is representative and typical of similar jobs in comparable organizations.


Physical Requirements: The physical demands are minimal and typical of similar jobs in comparable organizations.


Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA): Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential job duties of the position.


The statements herein are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees, and are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. Furthermore, they do not establish a contract for employment and are subject to change at the discretion of MetroStar Systems.

item.title: Developer (.Net en/of Java) at Greenwheels (Rotterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Voor onze IT afdeling zoeken wij een creatieve maar praktisch ingestelde:


Developer (Java / .Net)


Functieprofiel


Het concept van autodelen is voor een groot deel gebaseerd op onze IT oplossingen. Greenwheels heeft een eigen CRM platform waarop alle klant- en operationele aspecten (auto’s) opgeslagen en beheerd worden. Dit CRM platform (DotNet) vormt samen met ons reserveringsplatform (Java) het hart van onze automatisering. Onze klanten, intern en extern, zijn afhankelijk van deze systemen.


Als Developer ontwikkel en onderhoud je systemen en applicaties die gebruikt worden voor en door Greenwheels. Nieuwe functionaliteit wordt doorgaans intern aangevraagd. De mogelijke oplossingen worden geanalyseerd, uitgewerkt en beoordeeld. Na aanleiding van prioriteiten die gesteld worden binnen de organisatie wordt een planning opgesteld. Om tot een goed eindresultaat te komen voor onze klanten en eindgebruikers werk je nauw samen met de andere Developers (ook extern) de Test Coördinator en de Business Intelligence Analyst. Door structureel een hoger technisch niveau te ambiëren, staat Greenwheels altijd open voor verbeteringen in haar procedures en methodieken. Je legt verantwoording af aan de IT Manager.

item.title: Software Engineer (Full-stack) at Factual (Los Angeles, CA)
item.description:
Factual is looking for an engineer to build out front-end-heavy applications. You’ll be developing and rolling out reactive front ends, big data backends to support them, and everything in between. We’re doing Rails, Node.js, Angular, Bootstrap, Solr, Postgres on AWS.   This role is specifically for someone who wants to build interactive web apps (vs data science or backend infrastructure) but because of the scale of the data and query volume, absolutely requires serious CS chops. This position is in Factual’s Los Angeles headquarters.
 
Responsibilities



  • Work with product and back end engineering teams to develop tools for exploring and visualizing data for our data, ad tech, and mobile personalization products

  • Develop website demos to help illustrate how our products work

  • Develop internal reporting tools and other API support tools

  • Develop high stakes, high volume API features

item.title: Hadoop Developer, Senior at Booz Allen Hamilton (Chantilly, VA)
item.description: Ingest data from various structured and unstructured data sources into Hadoop and other distributed Big Data systems. Support the sustainment and delivery of an automated ETL pipeline, using a suite of COTS, GOTS, Java, Perl, and other tools. Validate data that is extracted from structured and unstructured data inputs, databases, and other repositories, using scripts and other automated capabilities, logs, and queries. Enrich and otherwise transform the extracted data as required. Produce monitoring and reporting of data flow through the ETL process and perform data extractions, data purges, or data fixes in accordance with current internal procedures and policies. Complete problem tickets containing bug fixes, design modifications, and changes based on customer requirements. Track development and operational support via user stories and decomposed technical tasks in a provided issue tracking software, including GIT, Maven, or JIRA.

item.title: Entry Level Developer at ThoughtWorks (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
ThoughtWorks isn’t your average company, so we don’t hire average people. We hire those who want to address challenging problems and explore new domains alongside equally intelligent and principled people.


We’re a global IT consulting firm with almost 3,000 employees, on six continents, and with no plans of stopping. We’ve made a name for ourselves during our 20 years of business. Our clients know that we’ll deliver amazing custom software and that we’ll never compromise on excellence. As we grow, we take extreme care to preserve our culture and the excitement of being a ThoughtWorker.


We’re more than just a consultancy — we’re a social community in which each individual brings a curiosity and passion for technology. The kind that makes learning 11 technologies in a week or writing an ant file from memory seem more like fun than work.  This community thrives on continual learning, teaching, and knowledge sharing, so we’ve implemented a “no jerks allowed” policy. This is where YOU come in.


Our Associate Consultant Program is a 24-month period of training and staffing out of our North America offices. Associate Consultants have the opportunity to travel all over the country and gain unparalleled experience on client sites.


But, first things first -- The Associate Consultant program begins with new ThoughtWorkers from all over the world gathering in India for “ThoughtWorks University,” a five-week training course. Those five weeks are devoted to a project simulation that prepares you for a delivery role on a real client project. Developers are immersed in an OO programming, Quality Assurance Analysts are trained in Agile testing, and everyone learns how to work collaboratively. Imagine discussing computability theory over fresh samosas then returning to the US as a ThoughtWorks consultant with a new international community.


As an Associate Consultant, you’ll get to:



  • Work alongside incredibly talented developers and analysts

  • Tackle business-critical problems with custom-designed, multi-tier applications using a wide range of the very latest technologies

  • Work in Agile, Lean, and Continuous Development best practices

  • Work in an informal, collaborative, transparent, non-hierarchal, ego-free culture where your talent is valued over a role title

  • Kick-start your career outside of the confinements of a traditional career path – one which focuses on your strengths rather than a predetermined one-size-fits-all plan

  • Shape the future of ThoughtWorks by leading and/or contributing to communities within ThoughtWorks

  • Freely voice your ideas (and listen to your peers) as part of continuous open and passionate debate on every topic from the merits of Coffee Script to Cucumber

  • Be a part of an organization that is as committed to social responsibility as it is to technology and innovation

item.title: Technical Architect at SugarCRM (Cupertino, CA)
item.description:
Description


At Sugar, the Professional Services team is helping Sugar’s rapidly increasing customer base with identifying and organizing their needs and requirements for a great end to end CRM implementation experience. You can be at the heart and soul of Sugar’s Professional Services team. Bring your passion, have a customer focus, take ownership and have fun in the process!

We're looking for a Technical Architect to implement Sugar solution and integrate Sugar with other systems for our enterprise customers. You will work closely with a team of Project Managers, Business Analysts, QA team and Developers to ensure we create, maintain and execute best practices for all projects and always looking for ways to improve how we work.


Responsibilities



  • Representing Sugar PS team as an expert in SugarCRM development, integration and designing solutions, using Sugar API and other tools that extend the product



  • Leading technical requirements gathering sessions and writing technical requirements documents.



  • Leading technical design sessions and writing technical design documents.



  • Managing technical scope and client expectation.



  • Responsible for providing hands on expert level assistance to developers for technical issues.



  • Managing the technical delivery of integrations and custom extensions.



  • Supporting QA team with the execution of test plans and ensuring a quality solution is delivered.



  • Must be able to lead a technical requirements gathering session, write requirements and technical architecture documents and manage the integration.



  • You will be engaged with our Product Management team to explore and elaborate customer-desired functional and non-functional features absent from Sugar products.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer, Data Services at Quantcast (Austin, TX)
item.description:
The Data Services team owns the data backbone of Quantcast’s advertising business. This means that we build systems that ingest, refine, and make available tens to hundreds of terabytes of data on a daily basis and serve up petabyte-scale datasets for use in Quantcast’s industry-leading audience targeting and automation systems.



We’re looking for a Senior/Principal-level Engineer to lead our efforts leveraging data warehousing to provide the company with a clean, consistent and comprehensive view of our business. Quantcast is a fundamentally data-driven company, and we view improved data insight as a critical component of the scaling and direction of the company as a whole.

We use Redshift, MapReduce, QFS, Java, Ruby, Python, and we’re open to new technologies.

Responsibilities:



  • Take ownership of the Data Warehouse function within Data Services team. This includes:

  • <span< span="">Own vision and engineering execution related to the data warehouse (prioritizing, scoping, planning, implementing, operating).

  • Establish and implement a flexible and maintainable data warehousing architecture for future growth.

  • Establish and enforce best practices for extracting, transforming and integrating new data sources (internal ones as well as cloud-hosted) swiftly and reliably.

  • Mentor engineers in improving and extending the data warehouse according to these standards, to support an increasing number of business functions.

item.title: Software Developers for Back- & Frontend at Maritime Data Systems GmbH (Hamburg, Deutschland)
item.description:
We are looking for young, highly motivated, smart developers from different parts of the world to join our team in Hamburg / Germany. You can join us,even if you have just finished university or if you want to do an internship or your master thesis in our company.



At the moment we offering several positions for Backoffice and Frontend developers.


  • Java Backend Developer


  • JS-Angular or Bootstrap Frontend Developer


  • Internship (Software Developer)


  • Master Thesis (Algorithms & Big Data)

item.title: Big Data DevOps Engineer at GoDataDriven (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
You are a engineer at heart with a pragmatic mentality and the responsibility of someone maintaining production systems. You easily switch between scripting and structured programming in typed languages. You understand failures modes in distributed systems. You are passionate about provisioning and automation. You take pride in assisting and educating data scientists and engineers with building data driven systems that don't wake anyone up at 3am on a Sunday (or any other day, for that matter).


As a Big Data Systems Engineer, you are responsible for setup, deployment and productionising of data intensive systems at the software infrastructure level as well as at the data level. You are experienced in engineering systems from the OS level up to distributed database technologies and cluster computing as well as maintaining data pipelines including transformation and pre-processing.

item.title: Market Data C++ Developer at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Market Data department develops high quality software that handles inbound and outbound data for various Bloomberg products. We manage massive volumes of data from major exchanges and contributors around the globe including the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE), the London Stock Exchange (LSE) and the Tokyo Stock Exchange (TSX). We deliver billions of data points a day to customers through our market-leading enterprise reference data product. Our data enables global market makers to make financial decisions and is held to the highest standards. Our developers are involved in all aspects of the software development life cycle including requirements gathering, project management, design, development, testing and release.

There are two main groups in Market Data (Feeds and Data License). More information on individual teams within these groups and their products can be found below. When you apply, you will have the ability to select your preferred team.

>> Feeds

The Feeds group builds low latency systems in a Linux environment. We gather data from financial sources across the globe to deliver quality market data sets. We strive to provide the highest quality of data while maintaining minimal latencies on high throughput real-time market data.

Exchanges

The Feeds Exchanges team develops feed handlers from North and South American exchanges. We provide critical data to our clients for high profile exchanges such as NYSE, NASDAQ, CME, BM&F/Bovespa and TSX. Our initiatives include improving the resiliency of our feed handlers through enhanced data recovery mechanisms while upgrading to our latest infrastructure to improve upon our data model.

Contributions

The Contributions team processes data from central banks, global banks and inter-dealer brokers for non-exchange traded OTC markets using industry standard protocols. We strive to make our system simple, efficient and fault resilient. We build scalable and massive infrastructure used by our business and operations teams to increase data accuracy, deployment and troubleshooting of real-time feeds, reducing time-to-market for our clients. Ongoing projects include the next generation of cloud infrastructure to increase fault tolerance, load distribution and on-demand resource management.

News

The News team provides reports on earnings, interest rates and major economic indicators like unemployment numbers, housing reports and consumer indices. Our systems connect the Bloomberg terminal with information from social media such as Twitter and Weibo. Our automated systems also cater to algorithmic trading.

Tactical

The Tactical team excels at investigating, debugging and fixing mission critical problems as they occur in real time. Our main goal is to provide a timely response to all client-facing issues. We build tools to better debug and enhance the development experience. Tactical developers work closely with feed handler developers to identify gaps in the product and enforce operational and functional standards, upholding quality in the market data product.

>> Data License

Data License is Bloomberg's market leading enterprise reference data product. Our customers are key financial players who use our products to power their trading applications, risk management and corporate action processing, which requires our system to be ultra-reliable and our data to be of the highest quality. Our product lines offer a variety of programmatic interfaces for a wide range of information on nearly all types of financial instruments including fixed income, credit default swap, currencies, equities and futures and options. We work closely with our business and sales teams to develop solutions to satisfy customer demands.

Core

The Financial Data Delivery Core team builds and maintains high performance systems that feed billions of data points per day to Bloomberg's customers through its market leading enterprise reference data product. Our system delivers information on nearly all types of financial instruments to key players in the industry who rely on its accuracy.

Bloomberg Valuations (BVAL)

The BVAL team builds a product that calculates pricing for over two million liquid and illiquid fixed income securities at several snapshots throughout the day. This evaluated pricing data is delivered with related regulatory information to enterprise customers in order to meet requirements such as net asset valuation calculations. Our product calculates, validates and delivers millions of data points. This rapidly growing product requires a highly efficient, scalable and fault-tolerant architecture. We are working on a proof of concept using Hadoop to address scalability needs and new offerings that will allow our clients to evaluate their portfolio risks and help them meet the many new regulatory requirements.

Content

The Content Generation and Distribution team builds systems that deliver a wide range of information on nearly all types of financial instruments including equities, options, derivatives, indices, bonds, commodities and currencies. We work with hundreds of databases and a distributed system that utilizes multiple processes across dozens of machines to generate the needed data. Our data is delivered to clients via various mechanisms such as web services, MQ and SFTP.

Workflows/Analytics

The Workflows and Analytics team designs and implements flexible, usable, and performant systems for ensuring data quality and consistency across our feeds and workflows. Developers in our team use a variety of technologies, including C++, Python, Perl, Java, JavaScript, Comdb2 and Hadoop.

Metering

The Metering team is responsible for building high performance distributed systems for managing large volumes of client data. We work with multiple groups within Bloomberg and develop tools to transform and efficiently store the data for trend analysis, billing and business intelligence. We are leveraging Hadoop to meet the demands of the massive amount of data we collect and analyze, and the complexity of algorithms that operate on the data. Our technology stack for the next generation system will include Webservices, Apache Kafka and Hortonworks Hadoop distribution.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer (any OOD) - Major Google Backed Venture at Flatiron (via Andiamo) (New York, NY)
item.description:
After witnessing several family members and friends battle cancer, Flatiron Health was founded in 2012 by Nat Turner and Zach Weinberg. Headquartered in New York City, our company is building a disruptive software platform that connects cancer centers across the country to help change the face of cancer.


In 2014, we raised $130MM in series B funding from Google Ventures, the second largest investment ever from Google Ventures, behind Uber.  


Our mission is to organize the world’s oncology information and make it useful for patients, physicians, life sciences and researchers. Our team is building a disruptive, oncology-specific software platform that will connect cancer centers across the country on a common technology infrastructure and address key healthcare challenges. Today, our proprietary cloud platform includes the industry-leading electronic medical record for oncology, a first-of-its-kind analytics tool, patient portal, and integrated billing management. Ultimately, our goal is to help cancer centers leverage real-world oncology data, at a scale and clinical depth never before seen, to transform how cancer care is delivered.


Our engineering team


Our engineering team builds and runs data processing pipelines, algorithmic and human-operated data curation tools, and customer-facing data analytics and visualization products. We build systems that clean, structure and understand clinical-level patient data as we build the largest, most comprehensive set of oncology data intelligence. We scale pipelines to handle the world's oncology data with creative engineering solutions to open-ended oncology data problems.


Our data


Our data pipeline takes in full clinical patient records and produces normalized, high-fidelity, queryable data that is ready to be mined for medical and operational insights. We’ve built a unified data set that is unparalleled in its depth and accuracy, and which gives our partners the capability to ask questions about data that weren't answerable until now.


Our culture


We work in a fast-paced, high-information-volume environment with complex domain challenges, which means context is key and there's always more to learn and soak up. We want to know oncology data cold — better than anyone else in the industry — and we believe doing so requires building a culture where we all like coming to work each day. In our culture, decisions are transparent and data-driven, and people are empowered to make waves.


Backend Software Engineer


Are you interested in building elegant and scalable systems to help our customers unleash the power of their data?


As a Backend Software Engineer you will:



  • Design and implement backend components: services, data stores, infrastructure, instrumentation, and deployment

  • Continuously ship new features for our cloud based infrastructure

  • Write simple, elegant, testable code

  • Drive improvements to our backend infrastructures


About you:



  • You hold a BS, MS, or PhD in computer science or related field

  • You have strong backend experience with languages like Python, C++ or Java

  • You have a good understanding of online relational databases like Postgresql, MySQL or MSSQL.

  • You are passionate about performance, reliability, and scalability of systems


Full Stack Software Engineer


Are you interested in using modern web technologies to help our customers unleash the power of their data?


As a Full Stack Software Engineer you will:



  • Design and implement intuitive web interfaces to make complex data accessible and useful

  • Continuously ship new features for our cloud applications, from the backend to the frontend

  • Write simple, elegant, testable code

  • Drive improvements to our backend and frontend infrastructure


About you:



  • You hold a BS or MS in computer science or related field

  • You have strong frontend web experience with JS, HTML, and CSS

  • You have strong backend experience with languages like Python, Ruby or Java, and SQL databases

  • You are passionate about empowering users and our mission to improve healthcare through technology


Bonus points if you…



  • Contribute to open source projects

  • Have developed apps using modern frontend frameworks like AngularJS / Ember.js

  • Have experience in user experience design or user experience research


Data Software Engineer


Do you want to synthesize data into knowledge?


As a Data Software Engineer you will:



  • Write useful and impactful software

  • Design and build our data infrastructure, and use it to develop extensible, robust data pipelines

  • Build tools and infrastructure for easy, accessible and flexible data analysis

  • Iteratively develop, operationalize and monitor machine-assisted and statistical solutions to problems


About you:



  • You hold a BS, MS, or PhD in computer science or engineering

  • You write clean, well-structured, production-quality code in Python, C++ or Java

  • You have built and deployed large-scale data processing pipelines

  • You seek simple approaches to complex problems

  • You are passionate about our mission to improve healthcare through technology


Bonus points if you…



  • Have a strong understanding of statistics

  • Have developed distributed data processing systems against large, heterogeneous data sets

  • Understand experimental design, and can build for collection, measurement and interpretation of results

item.title: Backend Engineer at Enigma (New York, NY)
item.description:
As a Backend Engineer on the Intelligence Team you'll be responsible for crafting part of our service-oriented architecture. You'll be given the opportunity to work with massive amounts of heterogeneous data, helping the design and development of large scale disambiguation, classification and clustering services.


Our ideal candidate is well versed in the landscape of old and new data storage systems as well as a solid understanding of REST/CRUD best practices. He/She should understand the tradeoffs involved in server/database/application decisions and can confidently support claims with sound evidence. He/She can effectively design and implement experiments/benchmarks to inform technical decision making.


On the Intelligence team you'll be interacting with engineers and scientists working on analytical tools and will need to be able to understand machine learning nomenclature on a high level.

item.title: Software Development Engineer in Test at Denplan (Winchester, UK)
item.description:
You will be responsible for creating, maintaining and executing automation test scripts using C#, Specflow, NUnit, Selenium WebDriver and similar technologies with the end goal of reducing effort and time on testing tasks, increasing test coverage and mitigating product risk.


Typically projects will be run using an Agile Methodology, with the SDET working closely within a multi-skilled IT team alongside Product Owners who provide prioritised requirements and help develop user stories with detailed acceptance criteria. Projects may aim to either replace whole systems, create integration code to link to off-the-shelf software or modify, enhance and maintain existing systems.


An SDET may work on projects in collaboration with external resource and may be required on occasion to work abroad for a short period of time, supporting external project teams.

item.title: Lead Java Developer at Rewards Network (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
We have an immediate opening for an experienced Lead Java Developer, reporting directly to the Vice President, Software Delivery.  As a member of the application development team, you will work closely with internal stakeholders, business analysts, developers and other teams to design and develop applications in support of Rewards Network’s key business initiatives. You will have an active role in ensuring that our development team develops solutions in line with our architecture and coding philosophy and security standards. We are looking for that passionate problem solver that is highly focused and agile that can work in a fast-paced collaborative team centric environment.


Major Responsibilities:




  • Work with a team of peers to architect, design and implement products in support of strategic business and IT initiatives

  • Actively participate in all adopted Agile activities such as stand-ups, retrospectives, Continuous Delivery, TDD, ATDD, BDD (Behavior Driven Development) reviews and knowledge sharing across team members

  • Participate in peer review sessions throughout the design and development phases of projects

  • Aggressively and proactively test software throughout development cycles; inclusive of functional/unit-testing, and TDD (Test Driven Development)

  • Ensure quality assurance through code reviews or pair programming and partnering with Quality Assurance Engineers to identify, resolve and prevent issues

  • Work to continuously improve, refine, and refactor software and participate in the resolution of challenging and demanding problems across a number of technical topographies

  • Provide ongoing product support and maintenance and participate in operational support rotation including occasional off hours and weekends

item.title: Principal Software Engineer (Java, J2EE, front end & middle tier development) at Fidelity (Cary, NC)
item.description:
Fidelity Charitable (FC) - http://www.fidelitycharitable.org - is an independent 501(c)(3) public charity that administers a donor-advised fund.  Donors to Fidelity Charitable (FC) benefit from an immediate tax deduction and the ability to support their favorite charities on a flexible timetable.  Since 1991, Fidelity Charitable has introduced tens of thousands of donors to the benefits — and increased charitable impact — of using a donor-advised fund to meet their philanthropic goals.  To date, donors have recommended more than $14 billion in grants to over 160,000 nonprofit organizations, making Fidelity Charitable one of America's leading public charities. Fidelity Charitable Technology team is seeking a Principal Software Engineer to work on new and enhancement software development projects.  The engineer would be expected to act as a Principal Developer and Technology Leader on Agile teams and have experience in developing J2EE applications as well as nightly batch programs.  Their experience should include front end and middle tier development.  The role is based in Cary, North Carolina. The individual should be comfortable working closely with business partners, analysts and quality assurance engineers to design and develop software solutions iteratively. 


Primary Responsibilities



  • Define and implement application level architecture

  • Designs and develops applications on complex major projects and subsystems

  • Act as software developer for new and enhanced products.

  • Perform systems analysis for existing software when needed.

  • Work in Agile team

  • Provide guidance and training to enable other team members to meet / exceed expectations

  • Act as liaison for business unit to resolve various project/technology issues

  • Demonstrates expert understanding of the software development process including analysis, design, coding, system and user testing, problem resolution and planning

  • Provides leadership to teams in broad technical areas and on large, complex projects

  • Advises senior management on technical strategy

  • Researches and recommends new technologies

  • Works across groups to identify opportunities for organization-wide technology initiatives

  • Recommends development testing tools and methodology and reviews and validates test plans.


Why Fidelity?



  • Three consecutive years on CareerBliss’ Top 50 Happiest Companies Employees Survey

  • A company that is committed to innovation and being an industry leader by investing in technology

  • More than 12,000 technology professionals utilizing an Agile methodology enterprise-wide

  • Access to top-tier technology platforms, OS, and frameworks

  • Non-traditional benefits like our Concierge Service, Computer Equipment Purchase Assistance Program and profit sharing eligibility


Company Culture At Fidelity, you can find it all here.  We reward ambitious, passionate individuals with a work environment that fosters diversity, teamwork and collaboration as well as encourages innovative ideas and fresh thinking. We recognize the value that employees’ individual differences can contribute to the bright and strong future of our company.

item.title: Software Engineer (C++) at Granta Design Limited (Cambridge, UK)
item.description:
We are seeking a Software Engineer to join our talented development team working on innovative applications for our flagship GRANTA MI: Materials Gateway product, which links the CAD, CAE & PLM systems used by thousands of designers and analysts to GRANTA MI, the leading system for materials information management.


What you will be doing:



  • Developing clean maintainable software, mainly with C++, but also in a range of other languages, including C#, Java, Python, and others.

  • You will be involved in all stages of the development lifecycle, from design and specification through development and quality.

  • You will be responsible for ensuring that the Gateway platform products are developed and maintained to a high standard, working closely within the team and with the Product Manager.

  • You will be proactive, bringing your ideas and creativity to bear on our product development process.


Some special attractions of the job:



  • The opportunity to work within a talented team using the latest technologies.

  • Developing solutions for world leading companies.

  • The chance to make a real contribution, focus on your areas of interest and broaden your skills.

  • The opportunity to be actively involved in development.

  • May be particularly exciting to those with an interest in science or engineering, especially materials.


Career development


We value our people and work hard to create an environment which rewards positivity and supports personal and professional development. As part of this commitment we provide a tailored induction plan, regular reviews and excellent opportunities for progression.


This role offers excellent development potential, with the opportunity to improve your development skills across a broad range of technologies and practices. You could progress to a technical or team lead role in the future.


What we can offer you:



  • Competitive salary.

  • A 12.5% non-contributory pension scheme.

  • Share Options.

  • Healthcare or gym membership.

  • Flexible working hours.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - Hearst Needs You at Jumpstart Automotive Group (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
You take pride in your work. You see the big picture but understand the details. You like to RTFM, and share your knowledge with others. You love working in teams and collaborating with technologists, designers, analysts, and strategists. You are allergic to dogma, but not averse to partaking in the occasional office happy hour. If this sounds like you, you could be the next engineer at Jumpstart Automotive Group.
 
Jumpstart, the unavoidable leader in the automotive digital advertising space, is a small and nimble company, backed by one of the nation's largest media companies. We foster creative thinking, risk taking, and collaboration, and are looking for a passionate engineer to help us take our business to the next level. The ideal candidate will have a strong development background, including a love for writing clean, modular, maintainable code, a deep understanding of how the web works, and an appreciation for intuitive UI/UX. This is a senior software developer position working out of our San Francisco headquarters in the Financial District (close to BART, Muni, Chinatown, North Beach, and the Embarcadero).
 
Primary Responsibilities:



  • Architect, build, ship, and maintain high quality web applications and services that address the needs of our operations, product development, publisher, analytics, and finance teams.

  • Collaborate with other teams to come up with unique, high-performing, and user-friendly ad products.

  • Devise and contribute to best practices within the team for development, build, release, and monitoring.



Benefits:



  • Competitive salary and bonus structure

  • Health, Dental, and Vision insurance

  • A smart, fun, hard-working team http://www.jumpstartautomotivegroup.com/team

  • Convenient, Financial District location

  • The autonomy and inspiration of a startup with the stability and backing of a large corporation (Hearst Corporation)

  • On-site yoga, stocked kitchen snacks, achievement awards, team sports league



Jumpstart Automotive Group, a division of Hearst Magazines, offers high-impact and performance-driven marketing and advertising solutions that achieve optimum results. Jumpstart is an industry thought leader known for its True Market Impact brand reports and in-depth shopping trend insights. Exclusively representing automotive digital publishers, Jumpstart reaches consumers at all stages of consideration and provides in-market scale. JumpstartAuto.com, @JumpstartAuto
 
Jumpstart is: Car and Driver, U.S. News Best Cars, NADAguides, J.D. Power Autos, Autobytel, CarGurus, Daily News Autos, LeftLane, CarSoup, and CarBuzz

Role

item.title: Softwareentwickler Java/Java EE (m/w) at DST consulting GmbH (Hamburg, Deutschland)
item.description:
DST consulting wächst weiter - wachsen Sie mit uns und verstärken Sie unsere Teams am Standort Hamburg, Düsseldorf oder Stuttgart sowie an unseren projektbezogenen Standorten in Nürnberg oder Gütersloh zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt als



Softwareentwickler Java/Java EE (m/w)



Als Softwareentwickler Java/Java EE (m/w) sind Sie im Bereich "Application Services" der DST consulting tätig und entwerfen und implementieren in unserem Team innovative und individuelle Java EE Softwarelösungen „in Excellence“.



Spannende Aufgaben garantiert


- Sie programmieren objektorientierte Komponenten für Client-Server- oder Webanwendungen auf Basis moderner Technologien und Frameworks


- Sie entwickeln Schnittstellen für innovative Lösungen im Rahmen von serviceorientierten Architekturen (SOA)


- Sie analysieren Kundenanforderungen mit objektorientierten Methoden


- Sie bewerten und schätzen Anforderungen im Rahmen der Projektvorbereitung mit dem Team und setzen Projekte zielgerichtet um


- Sie stellen die Qualität der entwickelten Lösungen sicher



Wissen wird bei uns geteilt! Als Softwareentwickler Java/Java EE (m/w) profitieren Sie von unserem erfahrenen Entwicklerteam und können sich je nach Wissen und Eignung in unterschiedliche Richtungen weiterentwickeln:


Wir bieten Ihnen Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten zum IT-Architekten, Prozess-Analyst oder Requirement-Engineer, Test-Engineer oder auch zum Teamleiter. Wir fördern Sie entsprechend Ihrem Potential und begleiten Sie bei Ihrer persönlichen Entwicklung.



Ihr überzeugender Background


- Sie haben ein (Wirtschafts-)Informatikstudium oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung erfolgreich abgeschlossen


- Sie verfügen über mindestens 2 Jahre Berufserfahrung in der Softwareentwicklung komponentenbasierter Technologien (JEE) für Client-Server- oder Webanwendungen und serviceorientierter Architekturen (Webservices)


- Sie verfügen über gute Kenntnisse in der Entwicklung mit Technologien wie z.B. JSF, Spring, Hibernate, JSP, HTML5 oder JavaScript auf einem Application Server


- Sie haben Erfahrungen mit SQL auf einer relationalen Datenbank


- Sie sind in der Lage, die Qualität Ihrer Lösungen mithilfe von Tests über Frameworks wie z.B. JUnit zu sichern


- Sie überzeugen durch Organisationstalent und Umsetzungsstärke


- Einsatzbereitschaft, Mobilität, Belastbarkeit und Engagement setzen wir voraus



Wer wir sind und was wir machen


DST consulting mit Hauptsitz im Herzen Düsseldorfs ist ein IT-Beratungs- und Systemhaus für konzernweite und mittelständische Unternehmen in Deutschland mit 270 Mitarbeitern. Moderne und innovative Technologien, verknüpft mit effizienten fachlichen Prozessen, sind die Basis für unsere langjährigen und vertrauensvollen Kundenbeziehungen. Wir entwickeln auf Basis von Java/Java EE Softwarelösungen, die unsere Kunden begeistern. Und die auch morgen noch sicher und performant laufen, auch wenn sich die Rahmenbedingungen in unserer schnelllebigen Welt permanent ändern. Und nicht nur das: Wir entwickeln Softwarelösungen und beraten unsere Kunden mit hoher Professionalität und haben auch noch Spaß dabei!                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       



Ein Arbeitgeber mit Werten und Herz


- Ein unbefristetes Arbeitsverhältnis mit einer leistungs- und qualifikationsgerechten Vergütung, denn Leistung muss sich lohnen


- Eine transparente und vertrauensvolle Arbeitsumgebung mit flachen Hierarchien, offenen Türen, klaren Strukturen und hilfsbereiten & engagierten Kollegen


- Ein hochgradiges Rollen- und Karrieremodell mit einem persönlichen Entwicklungsplan


- Kontinuierliche und zielgerichtete Weiterbildung im Bereich Methodenkompetenz, Technik und Soft Skills sowie Ausbau vorhandener Kompetenzen


- Corporate Benefits in Bereichen wie Kultur, Mode, Freizeit, Finanzen, Technik u.v.m.


- Eine gelebte Work-Life-Balance mit zeitgemäßen Arbeitszeitmodellen und attraktiven Urlaubsregelungen


- Mitarbeiter-Events: Sommerfest, Weihnachtsfeier und gemeinsame Sportaktivitäten



Machen Sie sich ein eigenes Bild über die DST consulting als Arbeitgeber unter www.dst-it.de Überzeugt? Dann freuen wir uns auf Ihre Bewerbungsunterlagen (Kontaktdaten, Lebenslauf, Erfahrungen, Zertifikate) als Softwareentwickler Java/Java EE (m/w) z.Hd. Herrn Wolf in elektronischer Form an: karriere@dst-it.de



Für weitere Rückfragen steht Ihnen Herr Wolf (HR Business/Recruiting Manager) unter Tel.: 0711-49097-189 gerne zur Verfügung.



www.dst-it.de

item.title: Scrum Master at Fidelity (Durham, NC)
item.description:
Fidelity Personal Investments (PI) seeks a Senior Scrum Master for the Money Movement/Cash Management team. S/he provides leadership by managing projects that may include managing internal and external teams’ deliverables and applies seasoned technical, people and project management skills to large, complex projects. This person provides technology solutions to daily management issues and manages relationships to provide ongoing customer service. This is a great opportunity for anybody working currently as a systems analyst and intending to grow into a project management/scrum master role.


The Account and Cash Services team supports multiple customer facing web pages and tools for our Retail and Net Benefits customers.  These include the Online Account Opening product, Bill Pay Services, Online Account Servicing, Statements, Stock Plan Services and Money Movement.  This is a fast-paced agile development environment that is using cutting-edge technologies to create powerful tools and best in class user experiences for our customers using Java-based technologies. This group has associates located in Durham and Bangalore.


Primary Responsibilities:



  • Organize and facilitate sprint planning, daily stand up meetings, and release planning, and do so under minimal supervision

  • Track and communicate team status and progress via burn up and burn down charts as well as other information radiators

  • Champion Scrum best practices

  • Facilitate requirements elicitation sessions with business partners

  • Work with internal and external Program/Project Managers to support (sometimes lead) complex systems projects or enhancements to systems, requiring integration across business units or platforms

  • Partner with the business and other technology partners to analyze our domain and propose solutions which will maximize business value

  • Work with the Program Manager to manage or support project budgets, billing, etc.

  • Demonstrate sense of urgency and responsiveness to complete work and solve problems

  • Plan and conduct effective meetings

  • Remove or escalate road blocks to allow team progress

  • Be accountable for project results
