  • Provision of technical documentation.

  • Continuously discover, evaluate, and implement new technologies to maximise development efficiency.

  • Participation and harmony with development groups across Sky Technology departments.

  • Promote Sky practices and behaviours.

item.title: Senior Java Developer - Brand New Publishing Stack at Financial Times (London, UK)
item.description:
This is a greenfield development role, working on a team building a new content platform using APIs for content delivery and harnessing triple store capabilities for semantic enrichment in order to offer more flexible ways to ingest FT content that will lay the foundation for building the next generation of FT.com. We actively use BDD, continuous delivery and DevOps within the team as a recipe for success and accelerated agile delivery.


This role will work within the development team, developing and unit testing solutions to meet business requirements in a timely manner. Development at the FT is done within larger programmes of work using individual agile streams and within that framework this role will be required to implement fully robust software solutions, working closely with the QA team members to develop a repeatable, end-to-end testing process.

a10:author.a10:name: The Henry M. Jackson Foundation for the Advancement of Military Medicine Inc.

item.title: Data Warehouse Developer/Architect (210122) at The Henry M. Jackson Foundation for the Advancement of Military Medicine Inc. (Bethesda, MD)
item.description:
The Henry M. Jackson Foundation, for the Advancement of Military Medicine (HJF) is seeking a Data Warehouse Developer/Architect to support the Surgical Critical Care Initiative (SC2I) located at the Walter Reed National Military Medical Center (WRNMMC) in Bethesda, MD. HJF provides administrative and management support to SC2I.    


The Surgical Critical Care Initiative (SC2I) capitalizes on unprecedented advances in casualty research and clinical care by partnering Department of Defense efforts with civilian academic leaders to introduce paradigm-shifting approaches in care based on biomarker assessment into routine practice.


Responsibilities:



  1. Design/develop data warehouse applications and systems to support SC2i operations by incorporating data from Program data sources including laboratory and clinical applications and legacy data stores.

  2. Design/develop data integration strategies and methods to allow SC2i data warehouse applications and systems to interact (consume and feed as necessary) with external collaborator’s systems.

  3. Provide technical support to scrub, curate, and migrate legacy study data into Program data warehouse applications and systems.

  4. Participate in required program meetings at USUHS, WRNMMC, Naval Medical Research Center, and offsite collaborator locations.

  5. Performs other duties as needed.

item.title: Fashion+Big Data Startup looking for Backend Engineer, Madrid at StyleSage - Fashion meets Big Data (Madrid, Spain)
item.description:
StyleSage is a venture-backed fashion tech startup that creates cutting edge innovation in the data and fashion space. As recent graduates from Techstars, the world's #1 startup accelerator, we are looking for a motivated backend engineer to join our product team in Madrid, Spain.

You will be responsible for the building tools that process, analyze and monitor data -- the most important part of our product! Additionally you will:



  • Build tools that analyze data to make the quality checking process faster and more automated

  • Work with our team of international experts in web data extraction

  • Perform ad-hoc data analysis on existing data in our database

  • Use machine-learning techniques to find insights and data anomalies

  • Our current development team is only 4 people, so you will also get to see all other activities as well


We are looking for a Full-Time candidate to work with us in our Madrid office.


Interested? Apply today!

item.title: Fashion+Big Data Startup looking for Front/Full-Stack Developer, Madrid at StyleSage - Fashion meets Big Data (Madrid, Spain)
item.description:
StyleSage is a venture-backed fashion tech startup that creates cutting edge innovation in the data and fashion space. As recent graduates from Techstars, the world's #1 startup accelerator, we are looking for a Front-End/Full-Stack Developer to join our team in Madrid! As Front-End Developer your main responsibilities would include:



  • Improve the UX of our frontend and develop various frontend features using Django / Python, Javascript, AngularJS, HTML5 and CSS.

  • Develop charts that visualize data from our database using d3.js and other frameworks.

  • Our current development team is only 4 people, so you will also get to see all other activities as well



We are looking for a Full-Time candidate to work with us in our Madrid office.


Interested? Apply today!

item.title: Data Scientist at Evidence for Policy Design (Cambridge, MA)
item.description:
Evidence for Policy Design at the Harvard Kennedy School of Government (EPoD) seeks a qualified data scientist to provide support on data analytics initiatives. The candidate will work with our Data Analytics Lead to perform data cleaning and analysis, manage databases, and produce graphics and basic software applications. In addition, the candidate will be involved with the production of policy-related op-eds and data journalism-style pieces.



The position is part-time with an initial duration of 6 months and may be open to extension based on performance and subsequent demand. The position may involve travel to India.



To apply, please send a CV, cover letter, and link to your GitHub account to Eric Dodge (epod@hks.harvard.edu) with “Data Scientist Application” in the subject line. Applications will be accepted through September 30, 2015.

item.title: Senior or Principal Data Engineer at BandPage (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
BandPage is seeking a senior data engineer who is passionate about music and eager to disrupt the music industry in a positive way.   We are on a mission to empower new and established musicians to build their fan bases, increase their revenue, and make a living at their craft.  BandPage is already used by over half a million musicians, including nearly all of the most popular artists.  Meanwhile, BandPage is integrated with most of the popular consumer music services, including Spotify, Rdio, Rhapsody, XBox Music, Vevo, etc.  Join us and help build the “operating system” for the music industry.


RESPONSIBILITIES


Data Discovery and ETL - Utilize the appropriate frameworks and tools to perform the ETL layer for disparate data sources. Consider proven methods of ETL and propose abstractions of those methods to aid in solving the ETL problems associated with data ingestion.


Data Storage Optimization - Constantly strive to optimize the data storage layer to fit the current and future needs of the applications it supports. This includes being aware of issues and making recommendations about scalability prior to, or in advance, of development of of an algorithmic solution.


Advanced Algorithms - Actively apply your knowledge of advanced algorithms, machine learning, and data models to unique problems in the domain of music. Adapt existing principles of logical inference and computer science to new problems in the company’s vertical.


Team Player - Participate in knowledge sharing activities including giving talks on topics in your area of expertise, contributing to the internal knowledge base via wiki or other, participate in code reviews, and support fellow team members in algorithm development including whiteboard sessions.

item.title: Principal Data Architect at Smartsheet (Bellevue, WA)
item.description:
The Product Intelligence team is looking for a skilled data architect and principal engineer with prior experience designing data warehouse and business intelligence systems integrating transactional, analytical, and big data components. Together with the team, you will drive the data platform architecture to develop customer-facing product features and to meet the data needs of the organization. This is a highly visible senior role in a newly formed group where you will be instrumental in designing and building out the data platform, customer features and the team. The team comprises of data scientists and software engineers focused on enabling customers to perform actions and achieve insights currently not possible through Smartsheet's existing discrete features for tracking, sharing, managing, and automating work. Here are two short videos showing a Smartsheet overview and one of our innovative Product Intelligence features.



  • Smartsheet Overview Video

  • Graphical Exploration of Collaboration Across Your Organization


So if you like big data challenges and getting in on the ground floor of a new strategically important team within a fun and fast growing company, contact us. Responsibilities



  • Serve as technical lead and partner with members of the Product Intelligence team to design and implement a data platform that encompasses innovative intelligent product features and internal business intelligence

  • Develop and maintain technical vision and roadmaps based on the key performance indicators (KPIs)

  • Lead the development of capabilities in all facets from strategic to tactical implementation and from conception to post deployment

  • Help key users across the entire organization to understand and consume the data sets and platform for enhanced decision making and analytics

  • Advance the data architecture and platform and ensure adherence to key architectural tenets and best practices

  • Design and implement relational and dimensional models

  • Maintain master data models

  • Help build out the team and their practices and culture

item.title: Senior Data Scientist at Booz Allen Hamilton (Springfield, VA)
item.description:
Key Role:
Conduct statistical analysis, modeling, and simulation for various federal clients that lead to actionable decisions affecting government operations. Use statistical methods on large data sets to characterize uncertainty through statistical methods. Leverage knowledge of large data analysis and perform research at graduate-level mathematics to ensure study results are properly interpreted and documented. Implement analytical approaches that will require knowledge of statistical programming languages, including SAS and R and traditional programming languages, including Java, C++, and others. Work closely with stakeholders and teammates from non-mathematical disciplines to ensure that operational strategies are considered in the context of applying statistical theory. Use statistical theory through modeling, simulation, and large data analysis to deliver lasting measurable improvements to organizations.

item.title: Data Services Engineer at Discovery Digital Networks (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Discovery Digital Networks, the premier publisher of digital-native programming for the Internet age, is looking for a Data Services Engineer with an affinity for working with data to support, evolve and expand our web and data infrastructure.


The candidate must be willing and able to function on a small team working with designers, front-end engineers and data scientists. This position will require knowledge of Python and PHP, and some familiarity with Javascript and MySQL. Experience with Amazon Web Services, Linux server administration and packages/frameworks like Flask, SQLAlchemy, React and Lumen is a plus. Successful candidates will typically have at least 3 years of experience. Ping pong skills also a plus!


We offer a competitive benefits package including medical, dental, vision, and a 401k matching plan, in addition to other perks.  Join our collaborative, fun, and creative work environment!


Some representative daily tasks include:



  • Maintaining and enhancing the ETL that feeds our data warehouse;

  • Building and supporting new and existing data tools and products;

  • Maintaining and developing both customer facing and internal web services;

  • Helping to improve the performance and reliability of the entire Discovery Digital Networks technology stack.


 Some possibilities for initial projects:



  • Updating data warehouse to include detailed geographic and demographic data;

  • Using machine learning algorithms to create tools to help producers create better content;

  • Creating dashboards to surface warehouse data to users.

item.title: Senior Engineer at HERE-Chicago (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
HERE, a Nokia company, is a leader in navigation, mapping and location experiences. We combine highly accurate and fresh maps with cloud technology to enable rich, real-time location experiences in a broad range of connected devices – from smartphones and tablets to wearables and vehicles. To learn more about HERE, including our work in the areas of connected and autonomous driving, visit http://360.here.com



The Team:



The RCP group designs and builds hardware and software for capturing, processing, and extracting information from street-level imagery, 3D Lidar data, aerial and satellite imagery, as well as dense GPS probe data from smartphones and vehicles. These rich datasets are used to power next-gen 3D consumer maps, navigation and assisted driving systems, and more. HERE Maps, a division of Nokia, provides detailed road and navigation data for nearly 100 countries, and can be found in four out of five vehicle in-dash navigation systems. Licensees of HERE’s platform include Microsoft, Yahoo, Amazon, and Baidu. 



The Position:



Within RCP, the Data Operations Team manages the software processing pipeline for transforming petabytes of raw data into useable information.  The team is also responsible for data quality control, measuring and analyzing pipeline performance and addressing data issues that may be identified.  We are seeking a Senior Engineer to help us build tools to enable, expedite and enhance Data Operations Team’s QA and analytical efforts.  Example work for this team will be building and maintaining tools to improve the efficiency and efficacy of terrestrial and satellite data QA review.

item.title: Data visualization engineer: Javascript at Timetric (London, UK)
item.description:
Timetric is looking for a data visualization engineer to join our small London-based technology team, and help us build great data-visualization products. Our core technology is Javascript, using ReactJS, talking to a Python/Django backend, and we build interfaces for people to visualize and explore rich datasets.


Although the technology team is small, we're part of a growing company, and we're responsible for a suite of established B2B business intelligence products, working closely with a world-class sales team and expert content creators.


We've got ambitious plans to grow and improve all our products, and build first-class interfaces that inform and delight our users. We'd love to hear from data-savvy, design conscious developers who'd could help us!

item.title: ETL / DWH Engineer at Picnic (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
ETL/DWH Engineer


Your challenge



  • Improve the daily lives of hundreds of thousands of grocery shoppers

  • Design, build, scale, and evolve our data warehouse and ETL processes

  • Enforce consistency and availability across operational and analytical data stores

  • Enhance data quality by improving business and technical operations

  • Keep up with the latest technologies and define our future technology stack

  • Be challenged every day by our extremely talented team

item.title: Machine Learning at Hivemapper (Burlingame, CA)
item.description:
Hivemapper maps the Earth for drone fliers. That's a lot of data!  How do we teach our data collection engine to systematically crawl and extract the billions of pieces of data we need to map the earth for drone fliers.  Our earth crawler and extractor has acquired hundreds of millions of interesting objects on the planet, from 'hidden'  to 'hidden' . We have 'hidden' spanning the entire earth. 



At Hivemapper you'll help design and build the machine learning systems to collect the earth's data and instantly deliver the most relevant results to drone pilots. One day you might be figuring out how to process these terabytes of data and those billions of database rows. Another day you might be designing how to send five square miles of detailed 3-D map data to our drone fliers in under 100 milliseconds. And another day you might be out flying a drone with the man who took Hivemapper to Nepal.


We are backed by Spark Capital (Oculus Rift and Twitter), Google Ventures, Homebrew, and Harrison Metal.


[Hivemapper is currently building in stealth mode]

item.title: Senior Python Developer at Applecart (New York, NY)
item.description:
Senior Python Engineer


We are looking for an expert, creative, self-motivated, and problem-solving back-end software engineer to join our company as a Senior Developer and central member of our engineering team. This position will focus on building infrastructure and mechanisms for large-scale online data mining and data collection. A successful candidate should have significant experience with web crawler/spider construction, web etiquette, concurrency, and text-processing.


Responsibilities/Duties



  • Work individually and as a member of technical and non technical teams to scale and expand Applecart’s products and proprietary technology 

  • Collaborate with the Partners and the rest of the development team to conceive of, architect, and develop revolutionary, scalable data collection software that will be deployed nationally for maximum impact on behalf of major political campaigns and national advocacy movements.

  • Construct and manage Applecart’s data collection and data mining infrastructure 

  • Responsibilities include, but are not limited to: 

    • Managing a sophisticated and large-scale data collection and processing infrastructure 

    • Constructing and adapting a robust AWS server infrastructure to process and run large data jobs (billions of records) 

    • Conducting advanced database design for collecting, processing, and storing large volumes of data 

    • Work closely with a team of data scientists to incorporate robust machine learning algorithms into existing application codebase 

    • Parse and standardize large volumes of structured and unstructured data

    • Design and implement infrastructure to integrate new data sources into social graph engine

item.title: Data scientist at Rijksoverheid (The Hague, Netherlands)
item.description:
Data scientist


Ministerie van Veiligheid en Justitie, Nederlands Forensisch Instituut


Functieomschrijving


Je beantwoordt met behulp van data-analyse vragen rond opsporing en bewijswaardering. Dit doe je bij het kennis- en expertisecentrum voor intelligente data-analyse (Kecida), onderdeel van het Nederlands Forensisch Instituut (NFI).


Kecida zet intelligente data-analyse in voor het oplossen van forensische vraagstukken. Ook richten we ons op onderzoek en ontwikkeling in kunstmatige intelligentie en helpen we de openbare orde en veiligheidsector met het inzichtelijk maken van grote hoeveelheden data.


Als big data engineer pas je data-analyse toe, zoals machine learning, tekstanalyse en netwerkanalyse. Je weet data in het juiste formaat te krijgen, zodat je ze snel in kunt zetten. Vervolgens gebruik je statistiek om inzicht in data te krijgen en machine learning voor het benutten van deze inzichten. Daarnaast houd je je bezig met onderzoek en ontwikkeling op het gebied van data-analyse en data science. Tot slot werk je aan consultancyprojecten voor een diverse groep opdrachtgevers binnen de openbare orde en veiligheidsector, zoals projecten over fraudeopsporing.

item.title: Lead Data Architect at Leap (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
We're looking for a Lead Data Architect, ideally with experience working on a SAAS or enterprise product.  You will work closely with the CTO and founders to discuss new schema design and future predictive capabilities for our real-time financial analytics products.  You should have experience with system design that follows best practices and leverage REST API's, as well as the ability to ensure that our entire stack is testable and scaleable. You like solving core problems around scalability and performance, thinking about how to leverage new tools, and optimize systems.


If you have management experience, or looking to grow in that area, this role will evolve into a technical leadership role as we grow.


Responsibilities include:


• Work closely with the CTO and Product team to define, design and prototype new features to our custom analytics and data visualization tools


• Develop highly scalable data ETL, data warehouse, and reporting solutions


• Help mentor the team on data architecture, new tools, and predictive functionality


• Investigate, propose, and/or prototype new tools for added security, storage and scalability

item.title: NoSQL? Great! Come help expand our Big Data solution across our platform! at kCura (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
As an Elasticsearch Engineer at kCura, based in Chicago IL, you will leverage your knowledge in Elasticsearch to build Relativity Data Grid- a NoSQL data store that allows users to horizontally distribute large amounts of text and data. This is your opportunity to work on a next generation data store that will allow Relativity to handle massive amounts of data. If you have the desire to be continually challenged and work where boredom is an anomaly, then join our team and be part of a successful company experiencing rapid growth in the eDiscovery field.



Responsibilities:




  • Design and implementation of APIs and services to expose the data and abstract the tools

  • Experience with relational databases

  • Experience building intensive data driven applications

  • Elasticsearch experience

  • Real time data processing utilizing Elasticsearch technologies

  • Familiarity building Logstash/Elasticsearch/Kibana logging system

  • Scaling distributed data systems

  • Optimizing distributed application systems to maximize performance

  • Configure/optimize Elasticsearch clusters

  • Design, build, and test systems for scalability and stability while processing petabytes of data

  • Integrate Elasticsearch tools into the Relativity architecture

  • Actively participating in our SCRUM process

  • Troubleshooting issues by fixing defects and responding to client specific problems

  • May be required to handle technical support calls after hours about two times a year. If Client Services is working on a ticket and they are not able to solve an urgent issue, they will reach out to the level I developer to assist to get the issue resolved

item.title: Data Scientist for Global Health at Epidemico (Boston, MA)
item.description:
We seek a Data Scientist for our Boston-based public health informatics company. You would join a dynamic team of scientists, developers, and epidemiologists tackling global challenges across a wide range of population health topics, including infectious disease, disease ecology, healthcare, drug safety, and supply chain analysis. The Data Scientist will also contribute to products and research projects involving novel data sources for public health surveillance.


Applicants should have experience with data processing and analysis tools (e.g. Apache Spark or MapReduce) and scripting languages (e.g. Python, R, Scala), as well as machine learning and natural language processing. An ideal candidate would also have knowledge of statistics and some domain experience from a related field such as epidemiology, geography, ecology, medicine, or digital humanities. We seek experience across the software stack including databases, software architecture, web development, and open source collaboration. This position will focus on data engineering for our data science team, developing our distributed data processing stack.


This may be a customer-facing position; ability to work with enterprise clients and strong written and verbal communication are important.


We are a diverse, multi-national, multi-ethnic, gender-balanced, and family-friendly organization. Candidates from historically underrepresented backgrounds are strongly encouraged to apply. We will also consider junior candidates and recent graduates who don’t yet have all listed skills, but who are self-motivated with the ability to learn on the job.

item.title: Core Developer; large-scale analytics solutions at 1010data (New York, NY)
item.description:
We are seeking a Core Developer to design and implement large-scale analytics solutions; including building tools and interfaces used both internally and by customers, high performance data manipulation algorithms, and innovative ways to visualize and deliver result sets to customers.


Our Core team builds portable code that enables our customers to use 1010data’s system in a more autonomous way while maintaining performance when dealing with massive amounts of data.  They work directly with our customers for tangible feedback on products/technology, enabling rapid release cycles.


If you appreciate the end-end ownership of building tools from scratch and are confident embracing new technologies to make a tangible impact come evolve our product as we continue to change the rules of big data discovery.


Responsibilities:



  • Design and implement parallel processing systems that operate on multiple terabytes of data

  • Build, tune and manage cloud based applications

  • Create technology solutions which have critical business impact

item.title: Data Engineer (m/f) at Project A Ventures (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
• You will be reponsible for continuing the development of data driven applications for one of our ventures. This includes a data warehouse (developed in-house, based on open-source technologies), a CRM system and integrations with other 3rd party systems

  • You will integrate, transform and index data from various data sources and develop meaningful data representations and visualisations

  • You will deal with the challenges of growing data amounts (performance, scaling, data quality)

  • You will work in an agile software development process in close collaboration with a product management team

item.title: DevOps Engineer at OnDeck (New York, NY)
item.description:
OnDeck (ONDK) uses data aggregation and electronic payment technology to evaluate the financial health of small and medium sized businesses to efficiently deliver capital to a market underserved by banks. Through the OnDeck platform, millions of small businesses can obtain affordable loans. We are changing the way small businesses borrow money by combining our passion for Main Street with cutting-edge technology. We evaluate businesses based on their actual performance, not personal credit, and that’s enabled us to say “yes” more often and faster than traditional lenders.


What excites us at OnDeck? Technology. Innovation. Small businesses. We believe in our employees and power their growth by challenging them every day and offering careers that inspire. We’re all about teamwork, passion and making an impact.


Department overview:


The Credit and Data Analytics teams at OnDeck are responsible for the models and policies that drive our success in the industry. Through our data-driven approach, our models and tools sift through thousands of data points to (I) target businesses via marketing (ii) evaluate & quantify the financial health of our applicants (iii) enable prudent credit risk management and (iv) provide an industry leading customer experience The team combines model building experience with a strong focus on software engineering best practices to ensure our models can be deployed in production and impact the day to day functioning of our business.


In this role you will:



  • Work with a small, high impact data engineering team to develop a production quality data warehouse with complex, unstructured data in AWS

  • Make subsets of this data available to third party (internal) applications via a set of APIs. Ensure these APIs are production grade in terms of uptime and response time

  • Work with a team of really innovative data scientists as a partner in deploying a set of highly innovative machine learning based data products into a production environment

  • Develop monitoring, audit and logging tools to ensure business critical APIs are performing as expected

item.title: Manager, Data Engineering at Namely (New York, NY)
item.description:
Are you obsessed with data, tools and metrics? Have you used any ETL or data pipeline tools to process data? Do you love to build teams and manage talented engineers?
Are you interested in tools that gather, store, and analyze user metrics and product usage? We are looking for a Manager of Data Engineer to manage a team while contributing ideas, innovation, solutions and code to one of the hottest startups out of NYC!

item.title: Senior Engineering Manager, Inventory Quality at Quantcast (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Quantcast is a large scale, big data driven organization that lives and breathes data, processing well over a million transactions a second and 30+ petabytes a day. The Inventory Quality team ensures that the ads we display are shown on genuine inventory to real people. Quantcast modeling scientists and engineers leverage our large datasets, computational power and analytic tools to build high quality anti-fraud and brand safety products that support Quantcast’s position as a world class leader in online advertising.


We are looking for someone who has managed engineers and data scientists to manage the Inventory Quality team. As the Inventory Quality Manager you will lead Quantcast’s effort to continuously improve and refine our ability to stamp out fraud and meet our clients’ brand safety goals. As you expand the team you will drive the detection of ever changing fraudsters attempting to sell fake inventory.


Responsibilities




  • Manage a team of scientists and engineers to apply advanced data mining to detect and combat fraud




  • Work with several engineering and client facing teams to build comprehensive anti-fraud solutions




  • Maintain a robust brand safety product that ensures ads only appear on inventory with content desirable for each client




  • Recruit and retain excellent machine learning and software engineering talent

item.title: Software Engineer (ETL) at AnswerOn (Longmont, CO)
item.description:
Utilizing your arsenal of skills and talents, you will solve unique problems in the management of client data, by designing, implementing, maintaining and executing ETL processes for the management of client data. You will also provide data support for predictive modeling and statistical analysis of client data. We will expect you to have an enthusiasm for working in small groups in a high-energy bootstrap environment. Right candidate will be trained on all these processes. 
 
Responsibilities:



  • In this position you will be trained and responsible to create, maintain and execute custom data management (ETL) processes using;

  • Business Objects Data Services (BODS) in order to support analytical modeling and statistical analysis of client data.

  • Store and manage client data using SQL Server.

  • Create and manage data warehouses to support analysis of client data.

  • Prepare analytical modeling output for delivery to clients using BODS.

item.title: Data Infrastructure Engineer at Content Square (Paris, France)
item.description:
Content Square is one of the current fastest growing companies, deploying lots of analytics tools through a critical data pipeline. This infrastructure needs to remain strongly reliable and available, with minimum downtimes.


As a Data Infrastructure Enginneer you will



  • Design efficient architectures to store and analyze petabytes of data.

  • Think about clever data models to serve product’s features, while minimizing costs.

  • Develop tools to help data-scientists to work with the available clusters.

  • Document your work, prove it works, make it work better!

item.title: Big Data/Hadoop Developer at Arbisoft (Lahore, Pakistan)
item.description: Experienced Hadoop Developer who loves designing and working with large data sets. The developer is expected to coordinate with developers to build large scale applications that will impact real world problems. As he/she will be called upon to write detailed technical specifications, the senior developer must possess excellent written communication skills.

item.title: Data Architect at Twilio (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
The Twilio Architecture team is responsible for the architecture of Twilio’s platform. The Data Architect will be a core member of the team focusing on designing data topologies and pipelines for handling and storing the immense amount of data we capture every day.


About the job:


As an experienced software engineer, you will be developing the architecture that will be instrumental in operating globally available, resilient and highly performant services used by hundreds of thousands of developers and apps.

Successful candidates will be strong developers with deep experience in data modeling, data storage and Business Intelligence systems.


Responsibilities:



  • Drive the technologies and policies needed to store, manage and interact with Twilio's data.

  • Work with the engineering teams to help choose technologies, design system architecture and model data in a scalable and efficient way.

  • Develop proof of concepts, shared libraries and services that will be used across the product engineering organization.

  • Coordinate with Sales Operations, Marketing and Finance to help understand their data needs and how disparate systems will integrate.

  • Tackle some of the most challenging problems in distributed computing, data persistence, and more.

item.title: HPDC Developer at 1010data (New York, NY)
item.description:
A Developer at 1010data creates large-scale analytics solutions; this includes designing the associated high-performance database structure, data transformations, and workflow processes.


You will be developing adaptive distributed system software and high-speed communication system software to support high-performance distributed computing (HPDC) applications.


The successful candidate will have a passion for writing code and be instrumental in building a highly scalable, 24/7 availability platform for our in-house data center. 


Experience in specific programming languages isnot required; however the right candidate knows how to program and has the interest and ability to learn new languages quickly.


The right person appreciates the end-end ownership of building tools from scratch and is confident embracing new technologies to make a tangible impact and evolve our product as we continue to change the rules of big data discovery.


Responsibilities:



  • Design and implement parallel processing systems that operate on multiple terabytes of data

  • Build, tune and manage cloud based applications

  • Create technology solutions which have critical business impact

item.title: Senior QA Automation Engineer - Big Data at FourV Systems (Baltimore, MD)
item.description:
Are you a quality assurance engineer with big, fast data experience looking to make an impact with a rapidly growing team of talented developers working on delivering a transformative product? Are you highly motivated to make a real impact in the trajectory of our company? FourV Systems is looking for a senior QA engineer like you for a transformative big data analytics platform.


In the Senior QA Engineer – Big Data role, you will be responsible for participating in the design and development efforts of our big data testing infrastructure for functional and performance testing. The testing infrastructure will exercise patented machine learning algorithms for analysis of large amounts of cross-domain data to meet customer needs.


This is a great opportunity to join early and influence the technology selection, design, and have ownership of the infrastructure.


Key Responsibilities



  • Develop and execute maintainable automation tests for acceptance, functional, and regression test cases against cutting edge distributed systems and big data analytics

  • Investigate and debug test failures, updating tests or reporting bugs as necessary and provide test coverage analysis based on automation results

  • Work closely with software engineers on Agile teams to deliver quality features

  • Participate in architecture discussions to address long-term design objectives

item.title: Senior BI Consultant at Infusion (New York, NY)
item.description:
BI Senior Consultant


Role:


We are looking for a Business Intelligence Consultant to join our team in New York. Infusion’s Business Intelligence (BI) practice is a Microsoft Gold Certified BI Partner that was awarded Microsoft Impact Award for BI Partner of the Year. Our team consists of highly skilled individuals that are specialized in business process automation, data management, design, architecture, reporting and analytics. The BI Team takes a business first approach with our clients as we work closely them to understand and analyze their business and operational processes; their data collection mechanisms; their data reporting and decision making processes. This analysis allows us to formulate a vision and plan to work towards streamlining their enterprise wide processes to efficiently collect, manage, report on and analyze the data that is required by decisions makers.


We create a vision that looks beyond the traditional walls of departmental data silos and increases proactive lines of communication across an enterprise to ensure the right people are receiving the right data at the right time (when it is needed). Typically, we utilize the Microsoft Business Intelligence technology stack to build enterprise solutions that complement an organization's BI vision and goals. We provide our clients, across various different industries, with the tools and skills to organically grow and evolve Business Intelligence throughout the organization.


Job Duties:



  • Perform Enterprise wide business process analysis

  • Work closely with our clients to define system requirements

  • Design/implement Databases, Data warehouses and BI solutions around high volume enterprise applications

  • Develop business insight through reporting and dashboarding solutions

  • Provide training for our clients in the BI and data warehousing space

  • Execute rapid prototyping to support presales activities

  • Provide team leadership/co-ordination on projects

  • Provide expertise in cutting edge BI technology

  • Participate in Industry communities

item.title: Lead Quality Assurance Engineer - Big Data at FourV Systems (Baltimore, MD)
item.description:
Are you a quality assurance engineer with big, fast data experience looking to make an impact with a rapidly growing team of talented developers working on delivering a transformative product? In the Lead QA Engineer - Big Data role, you will be responsible for participating in the design and development efforts of our big data testing infrastructure for functional and performance testing. The testing infrastructure will exercise patented machine learning algorithms for analysis of large amounts of cross-domain data to meet customer needs.

We need this platform to capture all of the data PaperG produces and a corresponding data visualization system to help us leverage this data. Needless to say, this platform needs to be running 24/7, scale with increasing load, fault tolerant and easy to monitor and manage.


Are you up to the challenge?

If so, and you enjoy a collaborative open office environment, flexible working hours, participating in hackathons, shipping early and often, and free team lunches, let's talk.

item.title: Sr. DBA at Rewards Network (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
The Senior Data and Database Administrator is a mission critical and highly visible role responsible for the management and operations of all Database environments supporting Rewards Network’s technology platform. This role will partner with the Agile software delivery team, Data Warehouse team and the Business Intelligence team to implement SQL database requirements (e.g. efficient data structures, mission critical performance, high volume scalability and capacity, future flexibility, big data and intelligence) in support of product and business initiatives. This role is architectural and operational in nature and requires a balance of skill and experience in both of these general areas. This senior technology role will set the standard for the overall data management lifecycle for the SQL Database management environment.




Essential Duties and Responsibilities



  • Partner with technology teams to architect, implement and manage the data management lifecycle and database environment

  • Architect, design, implement, administer and operate all SQL databases for the enterprise

  • Identify and resolve technology and operational issues specific to the SQL databases to ensure that all databases are operating at full performance and adhering to internal SLAs

  • Manage the SQL server database specific disaster recovery, archiving, backups and recovery processes

  • Develop and maintain standards, processes and procedures, and guidelines for managing the database environment using appropriate industry practices

  • Analyze and report the performance of database operations against the key database performance metrics established for the technology platform

  • Monitor and operate the database environment using standard monitoring tools/platforms and optimize the environment (e.g. IDERA Diagnostic Manager, IDERA SQL tools)

  • Design, develop and maintain applicable data integrations using the MS SQL integration toolset (SSIS) for exchange of data between databases and other operational/application systems

  • Support database requirements for technology teams comprised of Agile developers, application support staff, BI/ETL developers and AS/400 back-end system developers

  • Manage and operate the database environment for load, performance and capacity requirements

  • Support the Data Warehouse and Business Intelligence teams for their respective database requirements

item.title: Data Scientist Residency at IDEO (New York, NY)
item.description:
Data Scientist Residency (IDEO New York)
 


What’s a Data Scientist Residency?


We’re seeking a Data Scientist to join IDEO New York’s office for a 3 month, full immersion residency starting in October 2015. During your residency, you’ll work closely with both our design teams on client-facing projects and with our internal groups to understand IDEO better. You’ll be helping us push our edges on how we use and interpret data, how we make data visualization interesting and playful, and how we gather and bring data into our design and strategies.


 So who do we think this is? You’re a cross between John Nash and Jackson Pollock, bringing a unique blend of science and artistry to your work. You laugh in the face of messy data sets and can transform them into a usable format without breaking a sweat. You know how to ask the right questions to turn your data into meaning, insight and actions. You not only know how to draw conclusions from data, but can transform  quantitative findings into impactful stories and illustrate ah-ha moments to a variety of audiences.



Once you're here...


Within our client-facing project teams, you will:



  • Work across diverse industries with multidisciplinary teams, including many types of designers whose specialties range from Interaction to Design Research to Environments

  • Advise on structuring and conducting quantitative and qualitative user research and lead teams through analysis of data

  • Coach teams on methods, timing and resource requirements of quantitative studies

  • Translate data into a visual language to make them accessible to designers and our clients

  • Clearly communicate insights to clients using storytelling techniques to generate empathy and instill confidence


Within our internal teams like Global Talent, you will:



  • Help us select data that will have the most value for learning more about ourselves

  • Advise on ways to collect and report on internal data that fits wells within the context of our unique culture

  • Review and analyze our data from many angles and recommends ways to apply the data

  • Sift through our existing data, supporting the discovery of previously hidden insights

item.title: Data Scientist @ Cloud-Based Behavioral Analytics Software Company at RedOwl (Baltimore, MD)
item.description:
RedOwl’s Senior Data Scientists work on a diverse array of statistical challenges, supported by a top-notch engineering team, at a company that places an incredibly high value on analytics. Our current Senior Data Scientists are experts in a wide range of complementary statistical disciplines, including computational biology, natural language processing, machine learning, computational neuroscience, and economics.


RedOwl Senior Data Scientists play a variety of roles within the company. You will develop and implement new analytics within Reveal, assist in shaping the product roadmap, supervise teams of software engineers, and help clients use Reveal to mitigate their most pressing security threats. Senior Data Scientists are given a wide range of autonomy to passionately pursue their approach to problem solving through improving the software product.


Senior Data Scientists are expected to design and implement cutting-edge statistical methods for solving client problems. You will work with clients in order to understand their needs, workflows, and data sources. With this knowledge, Senior Data Scientists are involved in product and team leadership, helping oversee the development of Reveal to better meet both current and anticipated client needs.

item.title: Big Data Architect at Zalando SE (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
The opportunity


As a Big Data Architect at Zalando, you will be in charge of building, scaling and architecting one of the largest big data platforms in ecommerce. You will develop big data solutions, services, and messaging frameworks to help us continuously process our data faster and more effectively. You will challenge our status quo and help us define best practices for how we work. And you will have the freedom to launch your own open source projects, contribute to others’ projects, build internal community around your interests, and strengthen your personal brand—while receiving meaningful support at every step.


What we are looking for



  • A university degree in Computer Science,  Mathematics, Statistics or comparable subject, with an academic record of high achievement

  • Fluency in at least one programming language, such as Python, Java and/or Scala

  • Solid knowledge of data structures and applied machine learning techniques

  • Demonstrated experience working on time-critical, mass data-processing, parallel data-processing and database initiatives

  • Deep knowledge of Hadoop, Cassandra, Spark, MapReduce, Storm, Kafka, and/or other big data technologies and their capabilities

  • A passion for working with relational (e.g. PostgreSQL) and NoSQL (e.g. Cassandra, Redis) databases

  • Enthusiasm for microservices architectures and RESTful APIs

  • Peerless analytical and critical thinking skills

  • Creative thinkers who value accountability, goal-setting and focusing on solutions instead of problems

  • English language fluency


Your responsibilities



  • Prototype, design and build a mass data-processing and log data-processing architecture that will supplement to our existing analysis and DWH architecture

  • Align multiple teams to support new big data solutions

  • Help evaluate and push for the adoption of technologies that are best suited for specific projects

  • Share your knowledge via coaching, code reviews, articles and tech talks

  • Demonstrate excellent communication skills and act as a liaison between your team and others


What you can expect from us



  • Internal tech talks, skills-building courses and technical “People Leads” who help you achieve mastery

  • Personal branding support: From preparing conference talks and blog posts to industry networking Community: hack weeks, movie nights, +70 self-organized tech guilds and more



  • Competitive salary

  • 40% Zalando shopping discount and commuter discount

  • Relocation assistance for internationals


About Zalando


Zalando is Europe’s leading online fashion platform, doing business in 15 markets. Delivering first-class shopping experiences to our +15 million customers requires moving fast — with microservices, Agile processes & autonomous teams  —  and using cutting edge, open source technologies. We are passionate about what we do and have fun while doing it. And we are willing to experiment and make mistakes: It’s how we grow.


Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!


If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring processes, please contact recruiter Matthias Rempel at jobs@zalando.de.

item.title: Data Developer at Muzooka (Calgary, AB, Canada) (allows remote)
item.description:
In this role you will be responsible for modeling complex business problems, discovering insights and identifying opportunities through the use of statistical, algorithmic, mining and visualization techniques. In addition to advanced analytic skills, this role also requires working with development teams to integrate and prepare large, varied external datasets and sources and architecting specialized database and computing environments that aid in Muzooka's strategies. You will leverage developer skills to enhance and expand data sets to be utilized for product and data teams.


You will work closely with team stakeholders to turn data into critical information and knowledge into powerful insights unique to the platform’s value offering. You are a creative thinker and use data mining in innovative ways to solve problems with the information that is available.


You will need a combination of business focus, strong analytical and problem solving skills and programming knowledge to be able to quickly cycle hypothesis through the discovery phase of the project. Excellent written and communications skills to report back the findings in a clear, structured manner are required.    


You will work closely with the data team as well as designers and product managers to coordinate features on a daily basis.


Responsibilities:




  • Design specialized database for storage, retrieval and computation




  • Utilize various APIs to generate new data




  • Creating smart, periodic requests to external data sets to build out data pool




  • Implements enhancements and fixes to systems and data mechanisms as needed




  • Conducts data analysis and moderately complex algorithms




  • Works with Muzooka stakeholders to identify the business requirements and the expected outcome




  • Collaborate with team to select the relevant sources of information.




  • Document results and methodologies in a way that can be easily understood by business stakeholders




  • Presents and depicts the rationale of their findings in easy to understand terms for the business. Presents back results that contradict common belief, if needed.




  • Employs the appropriate algorithm to discover patterns.




  • Create complex queries and structured data sets to be utilized for short term and long term strategies




  • Qualifies where information can be stored or what information, external to the organization, may be used in support of business objectives.




  • Collaborates with management to ensure that the information used follows the compliance, access management, and control policies and that it meets the qualification and assurance requirements of the organization




  • Recommends ongoing improvements to methods and algorithms that lead to findings, including new information.




  • Demonstrates the following scientist qualities: clarity, accuracy, precision, relevance, depth, breadth, logic, significance, and fairness.

This is a great opportunity to manage serious infrastructure that is servicing large amounts of data and traffic, work with a large and outstanding engineering team, and employ state-of-the-art tools and techniques.

item.title: Big Data Engineers at Betsson Group (Ta' Xbiex, Malta)
item.description:
Are you interested in working for the market leader in a fast-growing industry? Betsson Group is now looking for talented Big Data Engineers to join us in our Malta offices to build the next generation in data services.


Who are we?


Betsson Group offers online gaming products to customers and partners all over the world and we aim to deliver the best customer experience in the industry. We are a dynamic and creative company with over 1000 passionate employees and consultants of almost 40 different nationalities. Most of us work in the operational Head Office in Malta but we also have other offices around the world, for example in Stockholm, Kiev, Tallinn and Gibraltar. Betsson Group has its roots in Sweden and Betsson AB (Betsson Group’s holding company) is quoted on the Swedish Stock Exchange. The Mediterranean island of Malta offers a relaxed life-style, with more than 300 sunny days a year and the best diving experience in Europe.


Who are you?



  • You are an exceptional developer with an aptitude for new technologies who loves to push the boundaries to solve real business problems

  • You will have previous Big Data experience using the Hadoop ecosystem to solve large-scale problems.

  • You will have a good understanding of distributed systems and experience in using open source frameworks

  • You have agility to learn new technologies quickly.

  • You have the ability to develop and leverage key partnerships and communicate very effectively.

  • You display initiative, self-motivation, and effective time-management skills.


Description


Our Big Data development team is growing fast and we are looking for software engineers to help us use a variety of Big Data technologies to create exceptional personalised customer experiences and solve difficult business problems based on a robust, low latent platform of structured and semi-structured.

item.title: Engineering Systems Data Engineer at ARM Ltd (Cambridge, UK)
item.description:
The Engineering Systems Analytics group is responsible for ensuring that we have a solid understanding of both our engineering infrastructure, which we refer to as the engineering systems stack, and the engineering processes that run on top of it.


It strives to achieve this goal through a number of parallel activities:



  • By helping to refine our spark-based infrastructure that allows relevant data to be centrally collected, aggregated, and processed

  • By developing dashboards, reports and complex analysis and/or visualisations of the data that satisfy the business needs, both in terms of project reporting to help measure progress of the work, and in terms of infrastructure reporting to help understand the impact of this work on the estate

  • By working with engineering and IT functions to ensure sufficient relevant data is being captured to provide the best information in the above two categories


We are looking to augment the team with broad additional skills across the areas listed above.


You will be a software engineer with experience of Spark and R, or equivalents.


You will be equally at home working on the data processing pipeline, or performing an in depth analysis of the data it contains.


You will consider yourself a data scientist, keen to tackle the problems of extracting knowledge from data, and driven to understand the core ‘stories’ that data can tell, and to help drive efficiency and effectiveness improvements by providing the means to make data driven decisions.


This role be based from ARM's HQ in Cambridge, UK.

Boost Labs is looking for a skilled and passionate Full Stack Developer: so if you can execute on brilliant strategies from a mountain of data and bring insights into code, apply now. This person is a natural leader, definitely a reliable teammate,  knowledgeable in their field, and most importantly, capable of earning the respect and trust of their team.

item.title: MySQL/PHP Software Developer at DC Energy (Vienna, VA)
item.description: You will help acquire and optimize data storage from our many sources across the web. item.title: Stream (Techstars) - Senior Python developer at Stream INC (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
About Stream

Stream (GetStream.io) is building a new kind of data store. A data store to build, scale and personalize feeds. Our users access Stream via a blazing fast, highly available and simple to use API service. We run on a very complex tech stack, highly optimized for performance and availability.


Stream is a well funded startup with offices in Amsterdam and Boulder. We are looking for an experienced Python developer to join our development team in Amsterdam. Your responsibilities include build features for Stream's API service and storage layer as well as contribute to our open-source library (Stream-Framework)


Here are a few of the reasons we think this work is fun and challenging:



  • High performance demands. You will get to choose efficient data structures and algorithms for high performance. This often requires understanding the details of stdlib and how other libraries such as django, gevent, celery work.

  • We run a collection of services, each with different requirements and patterns optimized for efficiency. To name a few: single threaded, multi-threaded, multi-process and event-driven.

  • Complex testing scenarios.

  • Designing a simple, clean, and easily-understandable API is hard.

item.title: Senior Javascript Developer at Massachusetts Institue of Technology, W3C (Cambridge, MA)

and libraries for the Crosscloud ecosystem, an MIT project that aims to

coding with collaborating, making maximal use of available grad students
and volunteers, but ensuring overall milestones are reached on time and
with high quality.

This is a full-time position, funded for 2 years with the possibility of
extension.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at DataRobot (Boston, MA)
item.description:
