This position requires the ability to rapidly develop robust, well-tested, scalable, production quality code in Python and R.

item.title: Platform Engineer at Likelihood (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
The Platform team at Likelihood is responsible for building a massively scalable system that ingests billions of data points, executes experiments and makes predictions, all in real-time. We're seeking talented Java engineers with expertise in data structures, algorithms, and distributed storage and processing frameworks to tackle one of the most challenging problems in ecommerce today. 


To store, analyze and serve user information at scale requires ideas and solutions in every area of computer science, including information retrieval, artificial intelligence, neutral language processing, distributed computing, large-scale system design, programming language design, networking, security, data compression, and machine learning, among others. Our engineers utilized advanced big data frameworks such as Hadoop and HBase, programming languages such as Java and Scala, and expertise in data structures, algorithms and software design, as well as extensive knowledge of Unix/Linux operating systems to engage in platform engineering activities.

item.title: Data Scientist at Aspen Technology (Bedford, MA)
item.description:
Overview:



 “Enabling every process plant to achieve Operations Excellence” is the AspenTech vision. Founded more than 30 years ago by the best and brightest engineers at MIT, we continue to imagine and invent new ways to bring efficiency to the process industry. Today, AspenTech is thriving with our relentless focus on innovation, collaboration, and execution combined with world-class experts who speak more than 10 languages and work in 30 different offices worldwide. This is a place where people are fiercely passionate about technology, a balanced life style and a desire to make a difference in the process industry.



 Our software tackles the most complex  process manufacturing challenges, creating value and improving profitability for our customers.  The industries that drive our economies and touch our lives are optimized by aspenONE software every day.  The world’s leading oil & gas, chemical, engineering & construction, pharmaceutical, food, beverage, and consumer packaged goods companies all rely on AspenTech to run their business (Dow Chemical, ExxonMobil, BASF, Shell, etc.). With integrated aspenONE software, process manufacturers can optimize their engineering, manufacturing, and supply chains.  AspenTech customers are better able to achieve operational excellence —  increasing capacity and improving margins, reducing costs, becoming more energy efficient, while ensuring safety, and shrinking their carbon footprint.



If you want a shot at greatness, as a member of the data science team, you will develop and investigate hypotheses, structure experiments and build mathematical models to understand data patterns and relationships and prescribe actions and options. We are looking for a sharp, disciplined, and highly quantitative individual who has a passion for playing with data, in all its forms including data mining, mathematical modeling and expert systems. We are building a unique technology platform dedicated to the real-time discovery and manipulation of data; this is your chance to be a critical part of that data research team.






Responsibilities:




  • Experience and track record in contributing in core development activities in a data analytics project

  • As a data scientist, you will create the analytics platforms and algorithms in software including warehousing, data engineering and management, statistics and machine learning, advanced computing, probabilistic modeling and visualization. 

  • As a data scientist, you will build and verify mathematical models and automated machine learning tools to analyze and optimize all aspects of our system, providing actionable insights in real time.

  • Thorough knowledge of SDLC and the ability to adhere to software development standards to release products on time; this includes processes such as issue tracking, source code control, coding conventions.

  • Collaborate with data mining engineers and development teams on data selection,preprocessing and formatting for analysis. You will also have the opportunity to help implement product-related tools, features and/or designs; success is measured in monetizing, retention, product usage and adoption.  

  • Help the organization shape new product directions as well as implement product vision within the context of the next generation of product architecture, while keeping the data science/analytics in mind.

item.title: Big Data Architect/Engineer at OpenStax at Rice University (Houston, TX)
item.description:
The Big Data Architect/Engineer will work with the Machine Learning Research Scientist, contractors, and team developers to design and implement the second version of BigLearn, which provides personalization, recommendations, and performance prediction to students using OpenStax Tutor and CourseWare.


The Architect/Engineer will design big data solutions with heavy realtime usage in a secure manner, preserving privacy of student data.


The architect/engineer will design the data architecture and software components and application programming interfaces (APIs) to ingest learner interaction data, run an ever-expanding suite of cognitive science and machine learning algorithms on it in near-realtime and in batch processes, and return the recommendations and analytics produced by those algorithms to client learning platforms.


Apply to this job at Rice University using this link, and provide your application ID, cover letter, and resume here.

item.title: Foundational Applications C++ Developer at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Foundational Applications department builds some of the most innovative and heavily used applications and infrastructure in the financial industry. We work on communication systems, compliance and archiving solutions, charts and visualizations, news, search and recommendation systems and big data infrastructure.

Our developers operate at the intersection of in-depth technical research and an aggressive time-to-market. We not only own the full life cycle for the products we build, but also work closely with our business counterparts and UX design teams to strategize on next generation features and functionality. We are dedicated to using and contributing to open source, have an active presence at industry conferences and collaborate with top universities.

>> More information on individual groups and their products can be found below. When you apply, you will have the ability to select your preferred group.


Instant Messaging

Bloomberg Instant Messaging (Instant Bloomberg, or IB) is used by the Bloomberg community for real-time communication including exchanging quotes, trade ideas, news and other financial information. IB handles close to 250 million post events per day. Our usage has grown considerably over the past few years, requiring that we maintain a sophisticated UI and a state-of-the-art distributed architecture which can scale to the most extreme load without compromising performance. We also build a unified multimedia communications product called BConnect. We work with open source software and encourage interaction with the wider technology community by contributing changes and taking part in related meetups and conferences.

Bloomberg Vault

Bloomberg Vault (BVault) is a startup within Bloomberg developing a cloud-based compliance archiving service, eDiscovery tools and real-time compliance monitoring infrastructure. The explosive growth of social media and web collaboration require businesses to remain compliant with an increasingly regulatory environment. Our software, hosted in Bloomberg's private cloud, archives over 60 billion messages and has gained rapid market adoption with over 700 enterprises. Our infrastructure processes over 200 million messages a day, checking content and interaction patterns, and providing analytics and event-driven reporting.

Mail

The Bloomberg Mail (Message) group builds a cloud-based platform used for Internet email, bond announcements and pricing, financial research distribution and other communication on the Bloomberg terminal. Our network of users, connected through the platform, relies on our real-time performance, ironclad security and tight integration with financial data and Bloomberg applications. Message is built on top of open source, commercial and proprietary technologies. This highly available distributed system includes comprehensive storage, search infrastructures, real-time email transport and delivery pipelines. We build APIs for integration with other applications and systems, and a feature-rich user interface optimized for our customers.

News

The News group develops one of the most heavily used applications on the Bloomberg terminal that provides search, real-time alerts and analysis. We build systems that process over one million news stories a day from over 80,000 sources. We provide scalable products that meet strict indexing latency requirements and synthesize and present an overwhelming amount of unstructured information to our clients. Bloomberg News uses our systems and workflows making them the fastest, most influential news agency in the world.

Government Intelligence

The Government Intelligence group helps investors quantify the impact of government activities such as legislation, regulation and contracting. Our work includes ingesting large unstructured public data sets and discovering actionable data points to alert clients in real-time. We design scalable search and database solutions to aid discoverability and analysis.

Charts and Custom Indices

The Charts and Custom Indices group builds visuals that make it easier to absorb information and identify data trends. In addition to visualizations, we develop analytical platforms that retrieve, aggregate and process large data sets. Our services run on dedicated Linux servers and require stability, scalability and speed.

Search and Discoverability

The Search and Discoverability group builds a federated search and question-answering engine to ensure Bloomberg clients can find the right information as quickly as possible. We use open source search technologies and natural language query understanding to build an intuitive search functionality. Our platform searches millions of data points from dozens of structured and unstructured data stores and natural language question-answering engines.

Financial Data Infrastructure

The Financial Data Infrastructure group builds the next generation of infrastructure to take in large amounts of financial data. We use big data and cluster management technologies to achieve high performance, reliability and transparency. Current initiatives include: price history infrastructure to store and manage billions of historical time series data points; data pipeline to ensure transparent and accurate delivery and governance of data; data snapshot for real time access to thousands of data points about millions of securities; and, Bloomberg Query Language to provide a rich access and calculation layer on top of all Bloomberg data.

item.title: Senior Front-End .NET Developer at New Classrooms (New York, NY)
item.description:
About the Role


Software Developers at New Classrooms work at the intersection of technology and education.  Building and improving on groundbreaking technology, our Software Developers play a critical role supporting the development of new models for personalized education.  We are seeking a Senior .NET Front-end Developer to establish front-end tech designs and coding standards.  This resource will partner with back-end developers, will code, and will lead/review the work of other offshore front-end developers.


What You Would Do



  • Establish preferred front-end coding practices and languages

  • Contribute to the development of project estimates, scheduling and planned deliverables

  • Support Requirements Analysts in establishing business and functional requirements

  • Design and develop new solutions to be added into the product portfolio

  • Design and develop high quality improvements to existing product portfolio

  • Diagnose and fix issues in production including on call assistance during after hour emergencies

  • Contribute creative and innovative ideas to help shape product direction

  • Write technical specifications, participate in design reviews and provide input to design recommendations

  • Participate in code reviews and acceptance process in order to improve methodology and delivery

  • Perform unit testing and identify, troubleshoot and solve code-related issues as needed

  • Partner with back-end developers to achieve excellent overall solutions

  • Direct and review work product from offshore front-end developers

item.title: Software Engineer - Want to help solve the world's Identity Crisis? at Daon (Dublin 2, Ireland)
item.description:
Build world class identity assurance software as an integral part of the Daon Product and Technology Group.


Role Responsibiities:


The Software Engineer will work within our Dublin Product and Technology Group to help deliver our identity solutions products. The individual should be self-motivated and interested in working on multiple projects with quick changing schedules. They will be responsible for, and must be proficient at, working in all phases of the software development lifecycle. The role will be part of our flagship DaonEngine product development team and will be responsible for evolving the product and integrating new biometric technologies as they become available. This is an exciting opportunity to work with skilled team in an interesting and growing technology space.


Core Software Engineer Duties:



  • Work as part of a cross functional project team, in collaboration with Requirements Analyst, Technical Architects, DBAs, Technical Writers and QC Engineers.

  • Responsible for working on all phases of the software development lifecycle, including requirements analysis, system design, development, unit/system testing, documentation and maintenance – with an emphasis on the design, development and testing tasks.

  • Seek to maximize customer satisfaction on all project engagements. Understand the project customers and listen to their needs. Work directly with customers to fulfil their requirements.

  • Ensure that customer commitments are delivered with the required level of quality, on time and to the agreed specifications. Note External Customers include Partners and End Customers. Internal Customers include Professional Services, Customer Support Services and Pre-Sales.

  • Produce software that complies with the company’s product architecture guidelines and coding standards.

  • Follow the agreed Daon development methodology and project management practices (e.g. Scrum, TDD, CI, SCM).

  • Making presentations to customers, partners or fellow Daon employees.

  • Keep core skill set up to date by studying state-of-the-art development tools, programming techniques, participating in educational opportunities, reading professional publications, maintaining personal networks, participating in professional organizations.

  • Be available to travel to customer sites as and when requested. (Less than 10%)

item.title: Senior System Architect with leading BPM Consultancy (Location Flexible) at Rulesware (Schaumburg, IL) (allows remote)
item.description:
Rulesware was named "Great Place To Work 2015"- 2 years in a row!


Rulesware is growing, and if you join our team, you’ll have the chance to grow too. If you love change, travel, and the opportunity to contribute to different projects and be part of different teams, Rulesware is for you. We promise you’ll never be bored, or stuck in a back room coding. Future assignments could be anywhere in the U.S., but wherever you land you’ll see that at Rulesware, our teams live and breathe BPM. This year alone we already have 19 Go-Lives, because we get it done - and we do it right the first time.

One of our team members said it best when he said, “At Rulesware we hire people who love a technical challenge, and who are excited about learning and growing with a very progressive company. Within a year of starting at Rulesware, thanks to training programs and mentorship, I had already completed additional certifications and was given the opportunity to play more senior roles on client projects.“

We are all passionate about delivering world-class strategies, solutions and results to our valued clients. We take pride in our efficient and common-sense approach to all BPM projects and problems, and in our high-performing teams. If you're ambitious and have a proven background using BPM tools, we’re happy to provide the necessary Pega training at our amazing near shore office and training facility in El Salvador. 


Description: As a Senior System Architect with Rulesware, you’ll be responsible for implementing technical solutions on BPM Platforms such as Pega 7. In this leadership role, you will work face-to-face and onsite with clients in a variety of locations, demonstrating strong analytical and communications skills with a focus on agile and scrum methodologies.


Key Job Functions



  • Design, develop and implement exceptional technical solutions

  • Manage technical implementation tasks delegated by your Technical Lead, to ensure work is delivered on-time and on-budget

  • Consistently demonstrate your knowledge of industry standard project delivery frameworks including Agile, Waterfall and Scrum

  • Effectively troubleshoot technical issues as they arise during the project lifecycle

  • Demonstrate technical knowledge by mentoring junior team members on on-going basis

  • Actively participate in internal Rulesware projects to help build the Rulesware brand and expertise

  • Ability to translate complex business requirement into functional technical requirements using PegaSystems SmartBPM methodology and DCO tools.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - Machine Learning at Quantcast (London, UK)
item.description:
Quantcast is an organization that lives and breathes data. Data is used in every aspect of our business, driving everything from our audience measurement service, to our real time bidding and ad personalization, and even corporate operations. We are looking for top-tier talent to design, implement, and operate large scale ML systems in a production environment. You’ll work within a machine learning group that is obsessed with improving the state of the art in performance advertising. You’ll take full ownership of the development and operation of ML systems that span dynamic ad personalization, predictive modeling, recommendations, bid optimization and pacing - all operating on a global scale. You’ll have the opportunity to work with our real-time systems that process over 2 million events per second, a distributed compute cluster that processes 30 petabytes of data per day, and a training pipeline that builds tens of thousands of models daily.


Opportunities



  • Make an impact. Quantcast performs world-class data modeling and engineering of realtime systems with a relatively small engineering team. Data science is the backbone of Quantcast; your impact will be much greater here than at a large company.

  • Thrive in a full Big Data ecosystem. Quantcast has invested heavily in its compute infrastructure and has vast amounts of data to aid in decisioning. Almost the entire platform has been built or extended in-house, to achieve our rigorous computational needs, with many systems returned to the open source community.

  • Make a name for yourself. We publicize our work through open-source projects, blog posts and papers, and we work with amazing advisors, like Trevor Hastie and Jerome Friedman.

  • Great timing. We are a fast growing pre-IPO technocracy.


Responsibilities



  • Design, build and operate large scale machine learning algorithms, systems, and supporting infrastructure

  • Develop techniques to efficiently extract meaning from petabytes of data

  • Improve existing advertising products and introduce new end-to-end products to delight our customers

  • Interface with other teams and leaders in Engineering, Product Management, and Business Operations

item.title: Big Data Developer - Contract at Hotels.com (London, UK)
item.description:
What we're looking for in you:



  •  Passion, creativity, deep expertise, openness, flexibility and drive. Practicality and common sense are important to us.

  •  Focus on moving the business forward. We don't just build software for its own sake (notwithstanding deep appreciation for the craft). We build it to help our customers find the right hotel, every time.

  •  A keen interest in the business, not just a given technical problem. We want you to understand the big picture and how your work fits into it.

  •  Get excited about big, hairy technical problems like we do.

  •  Participate in the Hotels.com technology community, the wider Hotels.com team, and the wider technology community around the world.


We live, eat, and breathe travel powered by technology. We work hard and play hard. We're never satisfied. We celebrate success and learn when we sometimes fall short.


Your job


Helping our business succeed through the power of data is a key priority across our business. In this role you'd be responsible for helping us achieve that by developing software to help us harness the power of the data available to us.



  •  Create and enhance RESTful web services

  •  Implement Hadoop jobs with Cascading, Hive, and raw Map Reduce as appropriate

  •  Read and write streams of messages from/to Kafka

  •  Read and write data from/to Cassandra

  •  Configure Oozie and Falcon jobs

  •  Contribute to open source projects

  •  Write automated tests

  •  Review your team member’s code

  •  Regularly refactor code to adapt to fast moving business requirements and evolving technical landscapes

item.title: Senior Big Data Software Engineer- $90K at Crossover (Lahore, Pakistan) (allows remote)
item.description:
Are you a Senior Software Engineer that has spent several years working with Big Data technologies? Have you created streaming analytics algorithms to process terabytes of real-time data and deployed Hadoop or Cassandra clusters over dozens of VMs? Have you been part of an organization driven by a DevOps culture, where the engineer has end to end responsibility for the product, from development to operating it in production? Are you willing to join a team of elite engineers working on a fast growing analytics business? Then this role is for you!



Job Description



The Software and DevOps engineer will help build the analytics platform for Bazaarvoice data that will power our client-facing reporting, product performance reporting, and financial reporting. You will also help us operationalize our Hadoop clusters, Kafka and Storm services, high volume event collectors, and build out improvements to our custom analytics job portal in support of Map/Reduce and Spark jobs. The Analytics Platform is used to aggregate data sets to build out known new product offerings related to analytics and media as well as a number of pilot initiatives based on this data. You will need to understand the business cases of the various products and build a common platform and set of services that help all of our products move fast and iterate quickly. You will help us pick and choose the right technologies for this platform.



Key Responsibilities



In your first 90 days you can expect the following:




  • An overview of our Big Data platform code base and development model




  • A tour of the products and technologies leveraging the Big Data Analytics Platform




  • 4 days of Cloudera training to provide a quick ramp up of the technologies involved




  • By the end of the 90 days, you will be able to complete basic enhancements to code supporting large-scale analytics using Map/Reduce as well as contribute to the operational maintenance of a high volume event collection pipeline.




Within the first year you will:




  • Own design, implementation, and support of major components of platform development. This includes working with the various stakeholders for the platform team to understand their requirements and delivery high leverage capabilities.



  • Have a complete grasp of the technology stack, and help guide where we go next.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Everbridge (Glendale, CA)
item.description:
Everbridge, Inc. is seeking a talented Senior Software Engineer for its Glendale, CA office to be an integral part of the platform engineering team supporting its flagship notification system. The ideal candidate must be proficient in the development of real-time high performance, concurrent, fault-tolerant parallel processing applications using Java. The position requires excellent problem-solving skills along with strong communication skill.


Specific duties include:



  • Drive the design and implementation of the core infrastructure and software stacks with the initial focus on the notification platform development.

  • Evaluate and select off-the-shelf products or open-source components that can be integrated into the existing system to improve scalability and manageability.

  • Write quality and maintainable code with extensive test coverage in a fast-paced environment.

  • Work directly with product management, QA, and related team leads to ensure the timely completion of projects.

item.title: Senior .Net Engineer - ASOS at ASOS.com (London, UK)
item.description:
At ASOS, technology does not just support our business; it drives it. As the Engineering department, we are at the heart of technology, because it’s us who make it all possible. So as you’d imagine, we take it seriously. We are a passionate, determined and cohesive team that consistently delivers premium business change and innovative solutions. With dedication to recruiting top talent into our growing team, we will make ASOS as well known for our technology as we are for our fashion. 



The Role:


ASOS is a unique and forward thinking organisation which understand how technology drives its business forward. Our technical strategy is to gain competitive advantage through the development of bespoke software solutions and the judicial use of world leading software tools and packages. We passionately believe in building autonomous, agile, cross functional teams who form a community of technical excellence.


The Senior Software Engineer is the powerhouse of software design and delivery at ASOS. Working as part of a strong cross functional Agile team you will drive quality and technology forward bringing your skills and experience to bear across the team.



  • Work in a matrix managed, fast paced Engineering team helping drive the delivery and technical competency of your team and the entire department forward.

  • Responsible for the line management and career development of one or two team members.

  • Work in an agile, cross functional team taking responsibility for the engineering team deliverables and quality.

  • Working closely with team members and business stakeholders to gather and define requirements

  • Involved with the technical design of solutions for your team, working with the appropriate stakeholders including business, architecture and service

  • Working with the Solution Architect to ensure the team delivers to required quality and adheres to best practice.

  • Expected to be proactive, lead by example, be hands on, involved in all tasks and take on sprint backlog items.

  • Guide and mentor within the team and provide feedback to the line manages around performance and reviews.

  • To seek out and actively promote ideas and techniques in the community – both within ASOS and externally

  • Understand the impact of any changes to the bigger ASOS eco-system

  • Take responsibility for the delivery for tasks from initial design to delivery into production

  • Understand the impact changes will have on load and performance



Qualifications & Experience:



  • Proven experience of working in teams in the successful delivery of complex, highly performing and high quality software systems.

  • Experience of Agile and XP practices

  • Proven experience of working with business stakeholders, Product Owners and Business Analysts to analyse requirements, develop ideas and design solutions

  • Understanding of non-functional requirements, quality assurance and continued improvement methods

item.title: Systems Security Engineer at 1010data (New York, NY)
item.description:
1010data has created the fastest database in the world via an easy-to-use, spreadsheet-like interface to make big data discovery easy across retail, consumer packaged goods, financial services, healthcare and telecom.


We are seeking a Security Systems Engineer to establish, lead and implement measures to protect the privacy of our customer data and intellectual property.


With more than 20 trillion rows of data currently under management, 1010data is designed to scale to the largest volumes of granular data, the most disparate and varied data sets, and the biggest user populations. All while delivering lightning-quick system performance.


The right person appreciates the end-end ownership of building tools and is confident in embracing new technologies that come with cutting edge security.


If you are a security authority and hands on engineer excited to employ cutting edge techniques to manage and secure massive amounts of data in dynamic web environments we would like to speak with you!


Responsibilities:



  • Designing and implementing advanced security techniques in parallel and distributed systems environments

  • Mining security data, performing deep analysis to discover unrealized threats, in order to provide better transparency and more accurate metrics.

  • Developing new and innovative methods for automating security log analysis and event processing.

  • Implementing identity and key management infrastructure.

  • Implement HIPAA, SSAE16 compliance initiatives

  • Understand and review technical documents such as operating system and application system logs, code snippets, and information security best practice/regulatory guidelines.

  • Work collaboratively with developers as well as non-technical business units.

item.title: Technology Lead - Big Data at Hotels.com (London, UK)
item.description:
Peoplefluent RMS 5
























The online travel market never stands still. The opportunity is huge and the competition is fierce. At Hotels.com, we're in the thick of it. We live and breathe travel. Our technology team is insanely passionate about using the best technology and processes to give our customers the best possible experience when finding hotels for their business or leisure travel needs. We want them to feel the same passion for travel that we do.


The Hotels.com team at Expedia Inc. is looking for an experienced, highly motivated, self-directed Software Technology Lead to join the Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) team.  In this role you will be responsible for the delivery of solutions on top of the big data platforms such as Hadoop & Teradata and will play a key role in a technology pivot, driving design & architecture solutions. This entails working with the delivery team and business partners to flesh out requirements, complete solution design, development and ultimate delivery to the end consumers.  We are also constantly looking for ways to improve our development methodologies and welcome fresh ideas and approaches.


Why build your career at Hotels.com?



  • You'll get to work with some spectacular people both from the technology team and wider business

  • You will get to work with massive data sets numbering literally billions of items and approaching a petabyte in total size and Opportunities to learn and apply the latest big data technologies on a fast growing Hadoop & Teradata platform.

  • We work hard to create a supportive, collaborative, and fulfilling place where you can progress your career

  • We have many of the best bits of a start-up but with the resources of the world's biggest travel company

  • We love open source and actively participate in the open source community

  • We do hackathons where you can branch out of your usual area to contribute something different and innovative

  • We host and speak at meet ups

  • We want everyone on our team to have the tools and resources to succeed in their career

  • We get to do all of this in a lovely, comfortable office in a nice, central part of London


Role Purpose


Provides technical leadership to our Data Engineering team, including design, development, troubleshooting, and debugging big data solutions & programs for enhancements and new products. 





Job Description


General Responsibilities:



  • Implementing high quality big data solutions, including design, development, and deployment of new business functionality for various facets of Hadoop / Java and wider Enterprise Data Warehouse ecosystem.

  • Drive evolution of standards & design patterns with industry best practices and new technology to enhance productivity, quality, and system performance.

  • Drive program & system architecture discussions to identify a suitable quality solution to the business requirement.

  • Work closely with product management to flesh out business requirements and articulate project technical requirements and deliver on requirements in an agile manner.

  • Deploy and maintain applications in production environments.

  • Communicate and document solutions and design decisions.

  • Ensure that features deployed have technical integrity and stability.

  • Improve platform by leveraging existing technology, building new technology, and/or helping evaluate 3rd party solutions.

item.title: Software Infrastructure Developer (C++) at Bloomberg LP (London, UK)
item.description:
We develop the core foundation on which Bloomberg developers build their applications - libraries that interface with a wide range of technologies, programmable real-time data-processing pipelines, deployment systems and development tools. We are technologists who live and breathe high-performance, well-factored, scalable, testable code which can react quickly to new business initiatives.

Our developers are valued as technical experts and go-to resources throughout the company. Our users, as well as our managers, are highly technical people. Within our group, all developers have responsibility for the full software development lifecycle, from requirements gathering through coding to deployment and maintenance.

More information on individual teams, technologies, and their products can be found below. You will have the ability to select the team you are interested in based on your preference or expertise.

Teams in Software Infrastructure:

Application Frameworks

UI Framework - We build and maintain an in-house real-time data-processing framework, which is used by over 3,000 developers to write high-quality, easy-to-use and efficient applications within the Bloomberg Terminal. We are responsible for extending the core libraries to support more varied, complex and scalable solutions, and enhancing the toolkit for application developers, such as adding tools for performance analysis, debugging, introspection and optimization.

Rapid Infrastructure - We produce the next generation of tools for enhancing developer productivity and the infrastructure behind the Bloomberg Terminal. We are responsible for creating software in C++ in both UNIX and Windows development environments. We work closely with other stakeholders to produce both the frameworks and tools used by all application developers to build and deploy their UI and applications.

Developer Experience

We are a team of technologists, engineers, evangelists and trainers charged with helping our developers deliver their best work. We are not afraid to make large investments to build our own tools when it will make us better able to outpace the competition. At the moment we work with Phabricator, Jenkins, DPKG, GitHub Enterprise, Coverity, Jira and anything that fills gaps and joins them together.

Market Data Distribution

API Technology - We are responsible for Bloomberg's data distribution infrastructure, which is the largest in the world, providing low-latency market-data and value added Bloomberg data via our open API (http://www.bloomberglabs.com/api/). We support scalable, distributed, high-performance software that provides mission-critical data delivery to all Bloomberg desktop customers and a large number of enterprise-level applications.

Market Data Systems - We build backend services and distribution infrastructure for Enterprise Solutions products such as, but not limited to, BPOD/B-PIPE (Bloomberg's consolidated real-time and reference data feed) and the rapidly expanding Event Driven Trading Feed (EDTF) business.

Systems Infrastructure

We build low-level UNIX infrastructure that is critical to Bloomberg's systems. Our areas of responsibility include: high volume, low latency realtime data distribution; enterprise wide software deployment systems; FIX connectivity; and PKI security services. As the rest of Bloomberg R&D fundamentally relies on our products, we have high standards for correctness, performance and scalability. We are a highly collaborative team who are passionate about building reliable systems to solve real world problems.

Ticker Plant

We develop real-time software for our high-profile system which sits at the core of the Bloomberg infrastructure. We process market data from around the world, driving the majority of downstream Bloomberg applications. We address the market demand for low-latency solutions by providing innovative software powered by the most comprehensive, timely and accurate financial data in the world. We work closely with multiple businesses and sales groups to design and develop our applications to satisfy ever-growing customer demands.

item.title: Data Architect at Blackbaud (Emeryville, CA)
item.description:
Build a great career. Help the people that change the world.


Where else can you work alongside talented people, develop a rewarding career and create impactful tools for some of the world’s most successful and socially responsible nonprofits? It's not something you find every day. But we have it all: a growing, fast-paced software business, an environment where you can thrive professionally and the everyday reward of knowing that you’re part of a community that’s enabling meaningful change and we are immensely proud that our expertise is helping our 29,000+ customers accomplish their missions. They serve as a constant source of inspiration to us, and give purpose to our work.


Description:


We’ve got tons of data; you’ve got the skills make it useful. As a Data Architect on our Shared Services team, you will use your experience architecting, designing large-scale systems using Big Data technologies (e.g. BigTable, Hadoop, Cassandra) to help us design and build a highly reliable and highly scalable data platform to help us manage, analyze and productize vast amounts of non-profit data. The new platform will serve as the foundation both for a suite of new data services that enable our clients to deliver on their missions with increased efficiency and effectiveness, as well as for several existing data systems that we will be refactoring.


We work in small, close-knit agile teams. Our goal is to maintain an atmosphere that balances tough projects while still having fun. In this role, you’ll have the opportunity to:



  • Work in a progressive, team-oriented, growth-driven environment where innovation is king

  • Nurture, grow or change the direction of your career map – we see the value in exploratory andconventional goals

  • Solve challenging problems with like minds to make the solutions a reality


Responsibilities:



  • Lead architecture/design, technology selection and implementation of a data platform over Big Data technologies

  • Drive innovation by exploring, investigating, recommending, benchmarking and implementing data-centric technologies for the platform

  • Contribute to the technical design efforts - ensuring the system design meets scalability andperformance requirements

  • Provide technical mentorship for junior engineers on new technologies and development techniques

  • Be the technical architect for our data platform.


About Us:



  • Modern office space with private balcony, comfortable seating and gas grill

  • Beautiful views of the Berkeley Marina and Golden Gate Bridge

  • Easily accessible by BART (via the free Emery-Go-Round shuttle), Amtrak and public transit

  • Stocked kitchen (fresh fruit, cereal, snacks, drinks)

item.title: Cutting Edge Angular and c# Development | Big Data Software. at R6 Web Design (Loganholme, Australia)
item.description:
Along with friday afternoon bevs (coffees, milkshakes, chai lattes... or whatever you like..) we get together on a friday afternoon upstairs and battle out on Halo.  Bring your wits, your stamina, and get your game on.  Seriously though... R6 has a culture of work hard, play hard.  Get satisfaction from your work, and build lifelong friendships.


We build phenomenal websites, cutting edge applications for the self storage industry, and the motorsport industry.  Right from c# big data analysis programs, through to AngularJS Futuristic web applications.  No two days are the same at R6 - if you like to be challenged, and work on leading edge technologies, you'll love working at R6.


You'll be working on Big data desktop apps (c#) that are revolutionising a 100 billion dollar industry.  You'll also headline the development of cutting edge web applications for the motorsport industry.  Hours are flexible, and you'll get to design things how you want.  We'll set the task, and you figure out how to do it.

item.title: Senior C++ Developer at Sisense (Tel Aviv-Yafo, Israel)
item.description:
We are Sisense. We disrupt the Business Intelligence market. Our product allows business users to analyze humongous amounts of data without being experts and without help from IT. How? By building on a set of unique and cutting edge technologies, wrapped up in a killer product. We are looking for talented C/C++ engineer to be part of our core technology team. 


As an engineer in Sisense, you will be part of the team developing the core of our Big Data Analytics Columnar Database, ElastiCube.
ElastiCube is an award winning database with an advanced query execution engine.


You will develop and improve advanced features/technologies including:



  • Big Data transformation engine (TB scale).

  • Multidimensional queries (advanced analytics)

  • Cache-oblivious algorithms.

  • Superscalar decompression.

  • In-chip vectorization.

  • Parallel I/O.

item.title: Data Scientist at Feedzai (Lisbon, Portugal)

We are looking for data scientists with as much skill as passion and large amounts of both! Come and help us disrupt the hot hot market of digital payments and online fraud prevention!


You will be working in a cross-functional team where you will be able to tackle complex fraud detection problems and where your main responsibilities will be:

item.title: Software Engineer, Distributed Data at BuzzFeed (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Company


BuzzFeed is the social news and entertainment company, providing the most shareable breaking news, original reporting, entertainment, and video across the social web to our global audience of more than 200M. BuzzFeed is also redefining online advertising with social, content-driven publishing technology.


BuzzFeed is headquartered in New York City, with additional offices in 16 cities in 10 countries across the world.


The Job


As a software engineer sitting with our Data Tribe, you’ll help build the next generation of data tools. The ideal candidate shares our belief that the right tools and data can empower our editors and producers to do amazing things they didn’t previously think possible. The overall mission of the team is helping the company learn how content works and performs no matter how it lives; you’ll be building flexible systems to support that. Because we produce content for a social web, you’ll build out integrations with external platforms to assist in data collection, build flexible systems to support all the different ways we can categorize/organize content, and develop and maintain tools for unifying and communicating data for audiences across the company.


You



  • have technical proficiency in Python or other high-level OO languages

  • have experience with external platforms APIs (Facebook, Twitter, YouTube)

  • are familiar with various DBs (mySQL, Redis, Mongo)

  • value reliability and simplicity over performance

  • value UX and craft elegant and intuitive interfaces

  • identify opportunities to automate and build tools to make your team’s lives easier


What you get in return



  • A competitive compensation package (including equity) and benefits that start on day one

  • A collaborative & close-knit team: our team is NYC-based and in the office because as great as technology is, there are few substitutes for in-person collaboration

  • Top of the line equipment and an office stocked with plentiful snacks, coffee, drinks and more

  • A company that takes its work seriously, while taking ourselves not-so-seriously

item.title: Big Data Engineer: real-time video sharing at Grabyo (London, UK)

Responsibilities



  • Be social and have fun. Office culture is important to us. We work in small teams to create and develop new products and features continuously.

  • Data Engineer – you love big data and have an in depth knowledge of how to navigate around it.

item.title: Analytics Platform Developer at nModal Solutions Inc. (Toronto, ON, Canada)
item.description:
We are looking for an outstanding Developer to help us build the next phase of our platform- someone who writes great code fast and wants to be involved in creating fantastic software and getting it to market quickly.  There aren't any layers of management here- you will be working directly with the founder and CEO, and will be a core part of the team.


Your mission is to build new connectors to state of art data APIs as well as enhance the nModal cloud data platform.  


You will get a chance to build at scale with the Azure platform, and integrate with technologies such as Tableau Software, Google BigQuery, Amazon Redshift and others. 


We work on a fast release schedule, whether it is to implement incremental enhancements or launching something new by desiging and building a minimum viable product and geting it into the hands of beta testers and customers quickly.


This is a contract position, 5 months to start, with the potential for a permanent position as a core member of the development team.

item.title: Software Engineer - Hotel Data Management at trivago GmbH (Düsseldorf, Deutschland)
item.description:
For our headquarters in Dusseldorf, Germany, we’re looking for an experienced developer to manage and further improve our core hotel data. We want someone to increase the amount and quality of metadata we have by analysing, investigating and interpreting data delivered by our partners and match these to our hotel data. If you have experience with fuzzy string matching, utilizing text retrieval, machine learning and other optimization techniques, and are confident tackling over 700,000 hotels worth of data then we want to hear from you!


Your tasks:



  • Evaluate partners’ datasets for potential inclusion into the trivago hotel search.

  • Develop and optimize intelligent algorithms to determine matching of entities in 31 languages.

  • Leverage big data and machine learning techniques to improve our automated matching process.

  • Improve the overall quality of our hotel information by developing systems that reduce the risk of duplicate data. We encourage thinking outside the box!

  • Experiment with our cutting edge technologies to investigate and correct anomalies within the data.

  • Analyse and improve efficiency, scalability and stability of our current processes by taking them apart and rebuilding them in your own innovative way.

  • Become the technical interface for our content-related development teams and technical account managers and help them decipher all matching related issues.

item.title: Software Engineer and Data Geek at SocialCops (New Delhi, India)
item.description:
We are hiring across our Engineering teams for our office in New Delhi, India, 


Front End Engineer


Our Front End software engineers will responsible for building the features that decision makers will see and interact with to make massive decisions affecting millions of people. As a front end engineer you will be part of an agile team which is iterating on the product on a weekly basis. You will specialize in building responsive and elegant web UI.


We're looking for engineers with a keen eye for design. We use JS frameworks including D3.js, Backbone.js ReactJS & Leaflet apart from HTML5 and CSS. 


Back End Engineer


Our backend engineering team is the backbone of product development at SocialCops. We know that the best backend engineers understand that there are different ways to solve the same problem and each method has it’s own trade offs, thus we’re on the lookout for someone who can think, weigh each trade-off and make the better decision. You are expected to work well in a team, have a passion for performance and optimization and at the same time have great knowledge of building a scalable product. You will be directly responsible for developing and testing APIs. You own the product development at SocialCops and will be required to think on your feet to make quick tweaks to the product that will make the lives of our users incrementally better. You are expected to have extensive knowledge of best engineering practices.



We’re looking for people with a working knowledge of OAuth, Microservices architecture, Version Control Systems, how CDNs work, HTTP request lifecycle across various web frameworks, basic DevOps with experience/expertise in Python, node.js, MVC frameworks, Document, Key-Value, Columnar Stores, Amazon Web Services etc.


Data Engineer


Our data engineering team is the core of the work we do at SocialCops and you’ll be responsible for fuelling its growth. As a data engineer, you will be responsible for building a fast, scalable and reliable architecture for the purpose of gathering, organizing, storing and setting up batch or real-time processing pipelines on top of it thus providing clean and organized information to scientists who analyze it to solve problems. Your work will also involve natural language processing, turning semi-structured, human-readable content into highly structured machine-readable databases and thus make sense out of it. You will be building search algorithms that make our data searchable by data point, indexing millions of data sets in the process. The aim is to build the first search engine for ‘developing world’ data. You are expected to have extensive knowledge of databases and best engineering practices.


We are looking for people with a working knowledge of Distributed file systems, Data Wrangling, Machine Learning, Natural Language Processing, API frameworks like express, hapi, with experience/expertise in Python, Pandas, Elasticsearch, NoSQL databases, node.js etc.


Android


Our Android engineers are building an application which works in the remotest and the most rugged parts of the world - on devices as cheap as USD 30. We build for the next billion - which means our average users can't speak english & have never used a mobile phone before. Just last month, the app was used to collect over 20 Million data points. Enough said =)

item.title: Software Developer at Word Machinery (Fayetteville, AR)
item.description:
A successful and expanding organization seeks an energetic and motivated developer to join our team of skilled technology professionals for a full time permanent position. This is an opportunity for a skilled, growth-focused developer to utilize his or her talents to enhance business efficiency. The position offers the opportunity to work in an always-exciting role rather than suffering through a grueling “sit-at-your-cubicle-and-code all day" environment. The successful candidate will be responsible for database administration, authoring/designing software applications, and supporting existing software.


Duties and Responsibilities include but not limited to:



  • Designing and implementing new data structures, writing stored procedures and functions

  • Identify database performance issues such as deadlocks or connectivity. Tune the database systems and scheduling of jobs for nightly maintenance.

  • Write ad-hoc queries/reports as requested by Management team

  • Participate in technical meetings, answer questions, and troubleshoot day-to-day issues related to data requirements and data quality.

  • Ability to assess business needs and determine appropriate technical solutions.

item.title: Data Scientist at Project Thor (Zürich, Schweiz)
item.description: Wenn nicht du, wer dann: Als Daten-Crack identifizierst du geschäftsrelevante Zusammenhänge, zeigst Trends und Entwicklungen auf und entdeckst Muster im Kundenbestand. Du bist unser/e Spoc, wenn es um die Entwicklung von Prognosemodellen geht und trägst somit zu einem optimalen Wertschöpfungsmodell bei. Du verstehst es, mehrere vollständige und unvollständige Data-Sets und Systeme zu integrieren. Ob dir strukturierte oder unstrukturierte Daten zur Verfügung stehen, ist für dich nicht relevant, um das Beste rauszuholen. Da du von Grund auf alles aufbaust, darfst du ein Team von Data Analysten rekrutieren, welches dazu beiträgt, eine wunderbar userfreundliche eCommerce Plattform zu entwickeln.

item.title: Vice President of Engineering at Umbel (Austin, TX)
item.description:
Summary: 


We are a team of agile, boundary-pushing problem-solvers who love to invent and improve. The VP of Engineering will lead a group of passionate, talented engineers (approximately 15 engineers with plans to grow rapidly) that are building a customer data query and analysis SaaS platform. Our core technology—a distributed, decentralized, bitmap index—is unrivaled and capable of performing complex queries over 200x faster than alternative solutions. You will report directly to our CEO and work very closely with our Chief Data Scientist to build an industry leading SaaS platform capable of delivering insights to our clients. 


What You Must Do To Be Successful In This Position:



  • Manage, coach, and mentor a rapidly growing team of 15+ front end, back end, and integrations engineers

  • Successfully scale our team, which is set to more than double over the next 9 months

  • Lead our Engineering recruiting charge by acting as an evangelist and improving the hiring processes

  • Be a cultural leader for our Engineering team

  • Work with our Chief Data Scientist to achieve groundbreaking R&D and architectural improvements

  • Oversee and execute multiple projects across the entire stack while maintaining stability, quality, and scalability

  • Work closely with our Product team to manage and prioritize requirements, balancing short-term and long-term needs effectively

  • Hone our agile development methodologies and team throughput

  • Drive technical performance improvements

  • Be the voice of Engineering and communicate to the entire company

  • Be a leader in the company and a voice for key executive level decisions on behalf of Engineering

  • Willingness to roll up your sleeves and even commit code when necessary is a plus

item.title: Backend Engineer at Grammarly (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Summary


Grammarly is a bootstrapped, profitable company with millions of registered users. Grammarly’s automated proofreader helps the world’s 2 billion English speakers improve the quality of their writing.


We are looking for talented engineers who will have a big impact on our technical direction. You will join a company where risks and exploration are the norm. You will be part of a team that envisions, collaborates, designs, and develops highly scalable and highly available services to help writers around the world communicate more effectively.


As a Backend Engineer on the Grammarly Data Team, you will work on constructing the Grammarly analytical data pipeline using the coolest building blocks out there and effective creations of your own; build out our code metrics, log collection, and querying stack; and enable other teams building data pipelines for their services. Your ambition and skill will drive and impact our entire platform. If you want a big challenge, this is your next gig!


What You Will Accomplish



  • Build internal real-time analytical data acquire-attribute-aggregate pipeline using:


    • Spark & Spark Streaming, Reactive Streams

    • Cassandra

    • Kafka

    • Scala


  • Build a high-load, big-data, distributed, no-single-point-of-failure, horizontally-scalable, lambda-architecture app

  • Build extensible high-load APIs and client-side instrumentation tooling

  • Build querying and visualization layer on top of Looker, Tableau and custom web-app

  • Perform integration to loop the analytical insights back to Grammarly product

  • Relentlessly work to optimize performance and data processing

  • Help to improve our development cycle, including CI/CD, deployment, documentation, instrumentation, and monitoring processes

item.title: Software Development Engineer - Big Data at Hotels.com (London, UK)
item.description:
Are you an engineer who wants to work for a strong and innovative online travel technology company? Do you have a passion for turning data into meaningful information? Does working on a world-class analytics platform backed by a cutting edge Big Data implementation scaling to hundreds of terabytes any interest? Do you want to work with (and learn how to use) the latest Big Data technologies in the Hadoop ecosystem? 

Expedia Inc. the largest Online Travel Agency is looking for an experienced, highly motivated, self-directed Software Development Engineer to join the Hotels.com technology team.  In this role you will be responsible for the delivery of solutions on top of the Hadoop big data platform and will play a key role in a huge technology pivot. This entails working with the delivery team and business partners to flesh out requirements, complete solution design, development and ultimate delivery to the end consumers.  Our team has experience using a wide range of technologies and many years of Hadoop experience so we guarantee that you won't be bored and will learn a lot. We are also constantly looking for ways to improve our development methodologies and welcome fresh ideas and approaches


Responsibilities



  • Develop various facets of the Hadoop EDW Java/Hadoop ecosystem

  • Write clear, efficient, tested code

  • Develop code as part of a wider team through pair programming and code reviews

  • Evolve development standards and design patterns

  • Work with business stakeholders to flesh out and deliver on requirements in an agile manner

  • Deploy and maintain applications in production environments

  • Communicate and document solutions and design decisions.

item.title: Backend Services Software Engineer at Bedrock Analytics Corporation (Oakland, CA)

You can envision the way a system works end-to-end and how the services that compose it work together, and you enjoy creating new and effective software. You like working in an Agile best-practices environment. You understand the importance of testable, modular, efficient code, so that's what you write. Ideally, you will have been building cloud-based systems with a similar DevOps stack to ours – AWS, Chef, etc.

Factual is looking for a Junior-level Help Desk/Systems Engineer to help handle the management and growth of our cloud and internal computing and network infrastructure.  We're a technical group of people working in a relaxed environment with various demanding infrastructure needs.  There's almost no 24/7 component to this job but there are a lot of machines and systems to keep configured and happy and we have a very high standard of careful, detail-oriented, responsive professionalism.

item.title: Scientific Software Developers at D. E. Shaw Research at D. E. Shaw Research (New York, NY)
item.description:
Extraordinarily gifted software developers are sought to join a New York–based interdisciplinary research group pursuing an ambitious, long-term project aimed in part at fundamentally transforming the process of drug discovery.  Among the group’s current research activities is the development of new algorithms and software for large-scale data analysis and simulation both on commodity clusters and on massively parallel special-purpose supercomputers of our group’s design.

Particularly relevant areas of expertise might include computational biology, Python and C/C++ programming, molecular dynamics, scientific visualization, computer graphics, full-stack web development, scientific workflow management, high performance data-parallel computing on multicore and GPU architectures, and the development of large-scale data management, cheminformatics, and/or analysis frameworks, but specific knowledge of any of these areas is less critical than exceptional intellectual ability and a demonstrated track record of achievement.

If you are interested in being part of a team of the world’s leading biologists, chemists, and computer scientists, please use the link below to submit your application material.  We are prepared to reward exceptionally well-qualified individuals with above-market compensation.

To submit an application, please use the link provided below: 
http://www.deshawresearch.com/recruit/jobs/Ads/StackOverflow/JrSP

D. E. Shaw Research is committed to building a diverse team. We offer an intellectually rigorous and stimulating work environment that is also supportive, flexible, and welcoming. We do not discriminate in employment matters on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, pregnancy, national origin, age, military service eligibility, veteran status, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, or any other protected class.

item.title: Tech Lead - Data Science Team (m/f) at TrustYou GmbH (München, Deutschland)
item.description:
Software engineers at TrustYou constantly have to solve complex and interesting problems. We build products that ultimately benefit the travelers and we use user interface design, big data, machine learning, natural language processing and distributed computing to do so. TrustYou is looking for those rare, talented engineers who are not only excellent at their craft, but can also excite and lead fellow developers, and drive a product from its initial conception to successful completion.


Tech Leads at TrustYou hold full responsibility for an entire product or suite of features. They are expected to gather and prioritize requirements, think up features that are useful and fun to use, and drive the implementation from specification to QA, leading a team of smart engineers.


Our data scientists are expected to have knowledge in machine learning and natural language processing, and, most importantly, know how to apply it to create precise and useful products.


Theoretical knowledge isn’t everything - good skills in visualization and communication are key for data scientists. The most interesting analysis may be useless if you can’t convince anyone of your results!


TrustYou lives and breathes the world wide web, and you should share our passion for it. It shouldn’t be a problem for you to slap together a REST server to feed data into a visualization written in JavaScript.


Responsibilities



  • Ship products that clients love to use!

  • Take responsibility for planning, execution and success of complex projects

  • Manage and develop a team of data and software engineers.

  • Roll up your sleeves and code to get your project done.


Minimum qualifications



  • Degree in Computer Science, or closely related degree.

  • 6 years+ experience.

  • Knowledge of machine learning and/or natural language processing.

  • Experience with distributed systems.

  • Working knowledge of relational databases.

  • Excellent algorithms knowledge.

  • Fluent in English.


Preferred qualifications



  • Experience with Apache Hadoop, and other technologies from Hadoop ecosystem.

  • Experience implementing RESTful servers. We accept your background in a variety of languages (JavaScript, Python, Ruby, Java, etc.), but we only use JavaScript (NodeJS) or Python (Twisted, Tornado) and we will help you learn these technologies.

  • Good HTML, CSS & JavaScript knowledge.

  • NoSQL, especially distributed databases.

  • 2 years+ experience in hands-on technical leadership and people management.


Who we are


TrustYou is the standard for reputation in the travel industry. We search and analyze literally ALL hotel reviews on the web, and generate a summary for each hotel on the planet - what did guests like and dislike about this hotel? Try it out yourself by searching any hotel on our website or our mobile app!


Our data is powering over 100 hotel search engines around the globe. Additionally, we have built a social media monitoring and survey product for hoteliers, TrustYou Reputation Management. What are my guests complaining about? TrustYou is used by more than 10,000 hotels to answer that question and improve their services.


TrustYou is a startup with engineering excellence in its DNA. Our employees are experts in big data, machine learning, natural language processing, interactive JavaScript applications and web technologies. Our tech stack is varied and modern.


We work hard, but value a great working environment just as much. We offer perks and a comfortable office for creative work. Xbox breaks and office beers on Friday nights are part of our culture. Our visits to Oktoberfest and our developer getaway trips are legendary.


Job details


Team or role: Software Engineering


Job type: Full-time


Job location(s): Munich, Germany


How to get this job


We’d love to see a note about yourself along with your resume.


Write us at jobs@trustyou.com

item.title: Principal Software Engineer, Big Data at Avigilon (Somerville, MA)
item.description:
Avigilon’s business intelligence group is seeking an experienced software developer to participate in the development of a platform to process data from thousands of security cameras and devices remotely with technologies relating to data mining and visualization, embedded systems, distributed systems, and integration with mobile applications.



The candidate must have experience in the following areas:



  • Architecture of cutting-edge cloud platform of services and APIs

  • Interfacing third-party services for machine learning, video and data analysis, and data visualization

  • Design of RESTful APIs with low-latency/real-time requirements
