Our office is currently located on Middlesex Turnpike, Billerica but relocating to Assembly Row, Somerville in November.

item.title: Senior Engineering Manager - Machine Learning at Quantcast (London, UK)
item.description:
Quantcast is an organization that lives and breathes data. Data is used in every aspect of our business, driving everything from our audience measurement service, to our real time bidding and ad personalization, and even corporate operations. We are looking for a seasoned hands-on data science manager to join a growing team of scientists and engineers in London, focused on performance targeting and optimization. 

This team is responsible for building the online advertising prediction and control systems that power Quantcast. This means getting up-close and personal with cutting edge statistical models and machine learning techniques, as well as serving as mentor, manager, and joint architect for the systems and processes built by the team.  Not a purely theoretical position, this team is responsible for shipping production code to meet the demands of the business and a solid background in software engineering is desired. You’ll have the opportunity to work with our real-time systems that process over 2 million events per second, a distributed compute cluster that processes 30 petabytes of data per day, and a training pipeline that builds tens of thousands of models daily.

Opportunities



  • Make an impact. Quantcast performs world-class data modelling and engineering of realtime systems with a relatively small engineering team. Data science is the backbone of Quantcast; your impact will be much greater here than at a large company.

  • Thrive in a full Big Data ecosystem. Quantcast has invested heavily in its compute infrastructure and has vast amounts of data to aid in decisioning. Almost the entire platform has been built or extended in-house, to achieve our rigorous computational needs, with many systems returned to the open source community.

  • Make a name for yourself. We publicize our work through open-source projects, blog posts and papers and we work with amazing advisors, like Trevor Hastie, Jerome Friedman, and Michael Jordan.

  • Great timing. We are a fast growing pre-IPO technocracy.


Responsibilities



  • Manage several projects, including prediction and control systems that are designed to efficiently drive sales and engagements for our clients

  • Lead, don’t follow. Drive innovation and contribute to intellectual property. Identify and propose new systems and techniques that bring business value. Everybody codes and participates.

  • Hire and manage a growing team of 5 - 10+ engineers of all seniority levels

  • Advise other data science teams and projects in London and globally

  • Ensure that the team is focused on commercially relevant projects, that the pace of innovation is rigorous, and that we meet stringent design, performance and robustness quality standards

  • Interface with other teams and leaders in Engineering, Product Management, and Business Operations

item.title: Front-End JavaScript Engineer @ high-growth DC startup FiscalNote at FiscalNote, Inc. (Washington, DC) (allows remote)
item.description:
About Engineering at FiscalNote
Our team has a wealth of diverse life and career experiences that allow us to think outside of the box and ahead of the curve. And we laugh – all the time. You'll get the opportunity to work at an institution pushing the boundaries of open data transparency, while collaborating with some of the industry’s brightest engineers and data scientists to devise, nurture, and implement cutting-edge solutions to continuously evolving engineering obstacles.


About the Position
Willy Wonka said “We are the dreamers of dreams.” Well, FiscalNote front-end engineers are the architects that make our open data dreams come true. Wild ambition isn’t lacking at FiscalNote, and only the most talented can visualize open-data products that have never been built before. Our front-end engineers love what they do, and they are on a mission to continuously improve upon and build the most beautiful and useful user interfaces the open data world has ever seen.


About You
Creative. Ambitious. Communicative. Driven.  You yearn to exercise your abilities in a greater capacity than on a tiny feature of a much larger product. Lending your talents across our entire stack, you not only love sharing your savvy with the team, but also crave the opportunity to absorb any and all knowledge from our hyper-collaborative environment. Your appreciation (bordering on obsession) for clean code and attention to detail have helped you shine brightly at previous positions. You’re tickled by the idea of implementing inventive uses of older technologies, but even more revved at the idea of leveraging the most modern front-end tools, frameworks, and languages. Most of all, though, you live to engineer creative interfaces that take the user experience to a whole new level.


You Have
- 2+ years of industry experience programming in JavaScript
- Expertise with HTML5 and CSS3
- Expertise with jQuery
- Knowledge of algorithms, data structures and Object Oriented programming
- Knowledge of and experience with JavaScript MV* frameworks. Ember.js is highly recommended.
- Undergraduate and/or graduate degree in engineering, computer science, or related technical field (<i>Preferred</i>)
- Proficient with Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, or related design software (<i>Preferred</i>)
- UI/UX design experience (<i>Ideal</i>)


In becoming a FiscalNoter, you’ll enjoy a plethora of benefits that you would expect at both an established company and at a startup. More importantly, though, is the opportunity to develop software that impacts real decisions -- decisions that substantially affect governing in the US and abroad. You will hone your engineering skills among peers just as motivated and skilled as you are, and in the process, develop a tight-knit camaraderie that will transcend simple software development.

item.title: Python Developer at Trimble Navigation (Westminster, CO)
item.description:
About Trimble Data


Trimble Data develops scalable, cloud-based geospatial systems. Our goal is to make geospatial processing simpler and faster for consumers by interfacing many varied geospatial applications into a cohesive whole.


Our primary system is the Trimble Data Marketplace, a storefront for geospatial data. The Marketplace enables customers to find, customize, and download data quickly and easily.



Python Developer


We are seeking a self-motivated and enthusiastic software engineer to join the Trimble Data Cloud Processing Development team. Python developers are responsible for developing and maintaining highly scalable geospatial processing systems that will handle petabytes of data.


As a member of the Trimble Data Cloud Processing Development team you will use a wide variety of technologies, such as Python, FME, and AWS to solve problems and have the opportunity to explore and use emerging technologies.


We are looking for intelligent, innovative, and driven developers. We will consider applicants with limited experience in the technologies listed below, however you must have strong Python skills.


Key Responsibilities




  • Software engineering with a healthy dose of performance engineering and DevOps.




  • Use Linux and Windows system administration knowledge to set up and maintain working cloud distributed systems.




  • Use BASH, BATCH, Python, C, C++ and other specialty languages to develop and maintain backend systems for Trimble Data.




  • Use AWS to manage and grow our cloud strategy.




  • Work within your team and with other teams to ensure the overall vision of the project is being fulfilled.

item.title: Senior Front End Developer Pioneering Business Forecasts at Intensity (San Diego, CA)
item.description:
Intensity applies expertise in economics, data science, and machine learning to solve the most complex and challenging issues that organizations face in the competitive marketplace. We are seeking a senior level front-end developer to implement the technical design and development of web-based applications that deliver pioneering business forecasts and data visualizations. This position requires a can-do/will-do attitude, a love of coding, and a passion for solving challenging problems. The position is located in San Diego, California.



RESPONSIBILITIES/DUTIES:


Specific responsibilities and duties for the Senior Front End Developer include:



  • Implement the user interface technical design and development of enterprise-class, cloud-hosted, web applications

  • Write robust front-end code with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript frameworks and libraries

  • Develop rich, interactive data visualizations, including graphs, charts, and other dynamic features

  • Design and implement user authentication and security features

  • Collaborate with product managers, UI designers, and back-end developers to define functional requirements and translate them into technical requirements

  • Rapidly solve problems and fix bugs

  • Work with technology partners and vendors as required



QUALIFICATIONS


Qualifications for the Senior Front End Developer include:



  • Extensive experience building highly interactive web application interfaces

  • Deep expertise in HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript MVC frameworks and libraries

  • Expertise designing and developing rich, interactive data visualizations

  • Strong understanding of web standards, cross-browser compatibility, responsive design, Bootstrap, CSS frameworks (LESS, Sass), and AJAX

  • Excellent understanding of database development, including basic data structures and algorithms

  • Experience with Agile processes, test-driven development, continuous build, and integration tools

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills

  • Ability to work independently and collaboratively

  • Problem solver and technology enthusiast

  • Creativity, innovation, and resourcefulness

  • Bachelors and/or Masters degree from a top university



PREFERRED


Preferred experiences and capabilities for the Senior Front End Developer include:



  • Experience with JavaScript frameworks (AngularJS, ReactJS, KnockoutJS, Backbone, etc.)

  • Experience with data visualization toolsets (D3)

  • Working knowledge of Java or Python, Ruby on Rails and/or PHP

  • Strong object oriented design and programming skills

  • Experience with database development (SQL, MySQL, NoSQL)

  • Familiar with modern Internet/information/data security issues and technologies

  • Familiar with source code management tools (Git, Subversion)

  • Experience with graphic design software (Photoshop, Illustrator)



APPLICATION


To apply for this position, please send a cover letter and resume to Intensity via email at careers.IT@intensity.com.


Additional information is available at www.intensity.com.

item.title: Software Infrastructure C++ Developer at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Software Infrastructure department develops the foundation on which Bloomberg developers build their applications - libraries that interface with a wide range of technologies, programmable real-time data processing pipelines, deployment systems and development tools. We are technologists who live and breathe high performance, well-factored, scalable, testable code that reacts quickly to new business initiatives.

Our developers are valued as technical experts and go-to resources throughout the company. Our users and managers are highly technical people. Within our group, all developers have responsibility for the full software development lifecycle, from requirements gathering and coding to deployment and maintenance.


>> More information on individual groups and their products can be found below. When you apply, you will have the ability to select your preferred group.


Ticker Plant

The Ticker Plant group is at the core of both the Bloomberg Professional Service and Enterprise Solutions products that process market data from around the world and drive the majority of downstream applications. The Ticker Plant system provides low latency processing of market data from around the world while servicing client queries from our cutting edge time series database. Our systems process billions of ticks a day and are highly fault tolerant and scalable. Our group researches and implements industry leading technologies such as high throughput time series database, low latency tick streams, and various efficient, robust and scalable components for Bloomberg's market data storage and distribution system.

Feeds Infrastructure

The Feeds Infrastructure group provides the platform that supports our feed handlers in processing market data from exchanges and contributors around the world. The platform consists of a high performance, reliable and scalable framework used to build and deploy these feed handlers and the host environment in which they run. The team provides solutions that can be reused across feed handlers to meet the market's quickly evolving demands. Our systems run 24/7 and require resiliency and seamless failover.

Feeds Infrastructure Applications

The Feeds Infrastructure Applications group builds an array of services used by feed handlers, Ticker Plant, the Enterprise product and terminal applications. The services facilitate the global distribution and processing of market data, system scalability and operational management of feeds. We solve some of the most critical feed and Ticker Plant software problems and provide the tools to manage these systems.

Data Distribution (API)

The Data Distribution group builds and maintains the largest global network in the world, spanning five continents. The infrastructure is built using state-of-the-art technologies to deliver low latency market data and news throughout the world via OpenAPI (www.openbloomberg.com/open-api). The group uses commodity software/hardware platforms to develop high performance C++ code and multithreading to achieve peak rates and optimize bandwidth and latency.

Application Framework

The Application Framework group builds the infrastructure and libraries used for developing applications at Bloomberg. This includes the application runtime environment, the UI toolkit exposed to developers, the client-side rendering engine and integration with real-time data. We are responsible for advancing the next generation of UI technology and giving our applications the advantages of the latest paradigms and features. Our group builds the tools for profiling and debugging applications and a custom IDE for developing them.

item.title: Software Developer, Geographical Informaiton Systems at OSIsoft (Philadelphia, PA)

item.title: Lead Software Developer - Full Stack at FUJIFILM Medical Systems, Inc. (Morrisville, NC)
item.description:
FUJIFILM Medical Systems U.S.A., Inc. is a leading provider of diagnostic imaging products and medical informatics solutions to meet the needs of healthcare facilities today and well into the future. From an unrivaled selection of digital x-ray systems, to the Synapse® brand of PACS, RIS and cardiovascular products, to advanced women’s health imaging systems, Fujifilm has products that are ideal for any size imaging environment. The Endoscopy Division of FUJIFILM Medical Systems U.S.A., Inc. supplies high quality, technologically advanced FUJINON brand endoscopes to the medical market. FUJIFILM Medical Systems U.S.A., Inc. is headquartered in Stamford, CT with offices in the Raleigh, NC region. For more information please visit www.fujimed.comand www.fujifilmendoscopy.com.


Lead Software Development Engineer – Full Stack


You carry an abiding passion for programming and want the magical work that is hard and requires extended effort to bring to fruition.   You are never satisfied with what you know and are always trying out new technologies and trying your hand at programming in new languages.  You possess supernormal gifts that enable you to do easily what good programmers find difficult and at the same time be a true Leader to the team.


Running Agile/Scrum teams come naturally to you.  And who wouldn’t want someone with an excellent memory, a conspicuously wide knowledge of programming techniques and the judgment to know when to apply which, and a deep ability to relate details to the larger picture.  You are capable of quickly shifting registers from the large picture to small details and back again on an almost automatic basis.


Now let’s talk about your excellent leadership skills!  You know how to build a relationship with the team as well as management.  You have a clear idea of how to gauge their strengths, weaknesses, ambitions and personalities.  We all get motivated by different things and you will discover what each member of your team needs to thrive both technically and professionally.  Especially when everybody understands the big picture!  You are able to garner respect from your team and be willing to get your hands dirty to get the job done.


But don’t worry!  You are still hands on in this team! 


To start we need you to coordinate activities with other team members, communicate status and progress/issues/risks.  You will also Work with Product Line Management and Clinical Analysts to understand the intent of the marketing requirements and use cases and workflow. 


Not challenged yet?  Ok, you are going to function as scrum master and technical lead for projects, review and understand the Market Requirements and Use Case Scenarios, create and review high level and detailed product requirements (PRD)


Still not enough?  How about design and implementation of assigned features for a product release, troubleshooting and maintenance of issues in current and future product release AND Unit testing, Design Review and Code Review of features.  Admit it, it’s getting exciting!


Who we are…


We are a team of highly motivated software developers who have a thirst for creating the most innovate Cardiology PACS product.  Right now we are building the next generation medical imaging application and framework.  Soon we will leverage out platform’s speed and intelligence to display other forms of clinical information.   


Seriously though, it’s hard work but it’s also quite rewarding.  Just like us!!!!  We like to have fun but we also like to work hard because we have a passion for the contribution our products make in the world of healthcare.  If you want to work on something that makes a difference and doesn’t end up in the landfill after six months, FUJIFILM Medical Systems would like to hear from you.

item.title: Desenvolvedor(a) / Developer @ ThoughtWorks Porto Alegre at ThoughtWorks (Porto Alegre, Brazil)
item.description:
A ThoughtWorks é uma comunidade de pessoas apaixonadas com o propósito de revolucionar o design e a criação de software, enquanto defende uma mudança social positiva. Trabalhamos com pessoas e organizações que possuem missões ambiciosas - estejam eles nos setores privado, público ou social e acreditamos que as pessoas são a chave do nosso sucesso. Ser um "ThoughtWorker" significa ter paixão, criatividade, valores e habilidades para resolver problemas em meio a nossa cultura ágil e não-hierárquica.


Nós entendemos que o desenvolvimento de software é uma experiência libertadora, evolutiva e rápida – gerentes de projeto, desenvolvedores, testadores e analistas de negócio trabalhando colaborativamente com os clientes para entregar resultados visiveis e imediatos. Buscamos tanto conhecimento e curiosidade intelectual para resolver problemas. Você será atraído pela idéia de trabalhar lado a lado de pessoas que escreveram livros sobre os assuntos que lhe interessam. E você compartilhará nosso interesse por Padrões de Projeto, refatoração, Integração Contínua, TDD (Test Driven Development) e Ágil. Nós queremos pessoas que consigam traduzir sua paixão por “Great Software” em valores reais para nossos clientes. Se você entende isso, você entenderá nossa forma de trabalho. Mas não é somente desenvolvimento. Nós continuamos a inovar através de processos de entrega. Desde um melhor gerenciamento de carga de trabalho com Kanban até Integração Continua e DevOps. Você talvez já tenha lido algum de nossos livros sobre esses assuntos, ou visto nosso Radar de Tecnologia. Nosso objetivo em Porto Alegre é contratar mais pessoas inovadoras que irão realmente nos ajudar a revolucionar o desenvolvimento de software no Brasil. Aqui você terá a oportunidade de:



  • Fazer parte de uma consultoria global de tecnologia que quer mudar o mundo;

  • Apresentar, utilizar e melhorar práticas de desenvolvimento ágil, incluindo Integração Contínua (Go, Jenkins, etc) e Desenvolvimento Orientado a Testes (TDD - Test Driven Development);

  • Trabalhar em aplicações de negócios em multi-camadas e com design personalizado, que utilizam as mais recentes tecnologias para a construção de sistemas críticos e escaláveis;

  • Contribuir e colaborar com a equipe e clientes durante todo o processo de desenvolvimento de software;

  • Atuar como coach e disseminar o conhecimento das melhores práticas no desenvolvimento de software dentro e fora da ThoughtWorks;

  • Ser parte de um ambiente aberto e não hierárquico onde se espera que todos colaborem dentro do projeto e nas direções da organização.


Esperamos que você:



  • Goste de programar. No seu tempo livre você se diverte programando uma aplicação para web 2.0 ou um framework para facilitar suas atividades diárias;

  • Tenha experiência com desenvolvimento em Java, .NET, Python e/ou Ruby. Você poderá nos mostrar um pouco do seu talento durante nosso processo de seleção;

  • Tenha experiência com análise, design, codificação e implementação de aplicações OO coorporativas personalizadas;

  • Capacidade de trabalhar em equipe, em um ambiente colaborativo;

  • Tenha experiência de trabalho com métodos ágeis - incluindo XP, Scrum e desenvolvimento iterativo - seria fantástico. Se você ainda não teve a oportunidade de trabalhar em um ambiente ágil, você já leu tudo sobre esta metodologia;

  • Capacidade de comunicação, com habilidade de trabalhar e construir um relacionamento com o cliente dentro de um ambiente de consultoria;


Características que serão um diferencial:



  • Bons conhecimentos de padrões de projeto, refatoração e testes unitários;

  • Experiência de trabalho com métodos ágeis, XP, Scrum e / ou Kanban;

  • Experiência na escolha e aplicação de boas práticas de software como Test Driven Development (TDD), integração e entrega continua;

  • Participação ativa dentro da comunidade de TI como um palestrante, autor ou colaborador.


A ThoughtWorks tem orgulho de ser uma empresa que preza pela igualdade de oportunidades. As pessoas serão considerados para todas as posições, sem distinção de raça, cor, religião, gênero e identidade de gênero, nacionalidade, deficiência, orientação sexual, ascendência ou idade. Parece interessante? Então vamos conversar! 

Veja aqui um vídeo sobre como é trabalhar na ThoughtWorks!


Developers ThoughtWorks is a community of passionate people with the goal to revolutionize the design and creation of software, while defending a positive social change. We works with these people and organizations that have ambitions missions – either in private or public sector and we believe people are the key to our business success. Be a ThoughtWorker means have passion, creativity, values and skills to solve problems inside our non-hierarchical and agile culture.   Our approach to software development is a fast, evolutionary, liberating experience – project managers, developers, testers and analysts working collaboratively with clients to deliver immediate and visible results. While we’re looking both for technical knowlege and intellectual curiosity for solving problems. You’ll be drawn by the idea of often working close to people who wrote books on the things that interest you. And you’ll share our fascination with design patterns, refactoring, continuous integration, TDD and Agile. We want people who can translate their passion for great software into concrete value for clients. If you’ve got it, you’ll get the way we work.  It’s not just about development though. We’ve continued to innovate right throughout delivery processes. From better workload management with Kanban all the way to Continuous Delivery and DevOps. You may have already read some of our books on these topics, or checked out our Technology Radar. Our business in Porto Alegre is looking to hire more innovators to truly help us to revolutionize software development in Brazil. Working with us you'll get to:



  • Join a global technology consultancy that wants to change the world;

  • Introduce, use and grow agile development practices on a project, including continuous integration (Go, Jenkins etc) and behavior or test driven development practices (TDD);

  • Work on custom-designed, multi-tier, business applications that use the very latest technologies to build scalable and critical systems;

  • Contribute and collaborate throughout the software development life cycle;

  • Coach, mentor and generally spread the word about best practices in software development inside and outside ThoughtWorks community;

  • Be part of an open and non-hierarchical environment where everyone is expected to speak up and collaborate in project and organizational directions.


To be considered for a role with us, you'll bring the following:



  • Passion about coding. Your idea of fun is probably to write an app in your spare time, be it a web 2.0 app or a shiny new framework to bring more fun to your daily activities;

  • Development and delivery experience with Java, C#, Pyhton and/or Ruby. You'll have the chance to show us what you know in our hiring process;

  • Analysis, design, coding and implementation of large-scale custom-built OO applications

  • Keen to work collaboratively with intelligent people, sharing your ideas to solve real business problems;

  • Experience – or at least latent knowledge – with agile methodologies;

  • Good ommunication and client-facing skills with the ability to work in a consulting environment and build relationships;


And we will really value if you have:



  • Good knowledge of design patterns, refactoring and unit testing;

  • Experience working with Agile methods, including Extreme Programming (XP), Scrum and/or Kanban;

  • Experience with picking and applying good software practices like test driven development (TDD), continuous integration and continuous delivery;

  • Participation in the professional community as a speaker, author or online contributor.


Sounds interesting? We'd love to hear from you.

item.title: Desenvolvedor(a) / Developer @ ThoughtWorks São Paulo at ThoughtWorks (São Paulo, Brazil)
item.description:
A ThoughtWorks é uma comunidade de pessoas apaixonadas com o propósito de revolucionar o design e a criação de software, enquanto defende uma mudança social positiva. Trabalhamos com pessoas e organizações que possuem missões ambiciosas - estejam eles nos setores privado, público ou social e acreditamos que as pessoas são a chave do nosso sucesso. Ser um "ThoughtWorker" significa ter paixão, criatividade, valores e habilidades para resolver problemas em meio a nossa cultura ágil e não-hierárquica. Nós entendemos que o desenvolvimento de software é uma experiência libertadora, evolutiva e rápida – gerentes de projeto, desenvolvedores, testadores e analistas de negócio trabalhando colaborativamente com os clientes para entregar resultados visíveis e imediatos. Buscamos tanto conhecimento e curiosidade intelectual para resolver problemas. Você será atraído pela ideia de trabalhar lado a lado de pessoas que escreveram livros sobre os assuntos que lhe interessam. E você compartilhará nosso interesse por Padrões de Projeto, refatoração, Integração Contínua, TDD (Test Driven Development) e Ágil. Nós queremos pessoas que consigam traduzir sua paixão por “Great Software” em valores reais para nossos clientes. Se você entende isso, você entenderá nossa forma de trabalho. Mas não é somente desenvolvimento. Nós continuamos a inovar através de processos de entrega. Desde um melhor gerenciamento de carga de trabalho com Kanban até Integração Continua e DevOps. Você talvez já tenha lido algum de nossos livros sobre esses assuntos, ou visto nosso Radar de Tecnologia. Nosso objetivo em São Paulo é contratar mais pessoas inovadoras que irão realmente nos ajudar a revolucionar o desenvolvimento de software no Brasil. Aqui você terá a oportunidade de:



  • Fazer parte de uma consultoria global de tecnologia que quer mudar o mundo;

  • Apresentar, utilizar e melhorar práticas de desenvolvimento ágil, incluindo Integração Contínua (Go, Jenkins, etc) e Desenvolvimento Orientado a Testes (TDD - Test Driven Development);

  • Trabalhar em aplicações de negócios em multi-camadas e com design personalizado, que utilizam as mais recentes tecnologias para a construção de sistemas críticos e escaláveis;

  • Contribuir e colaborar com a equipe e clientes durante todo o processo de desenvolvimento de software;

  • Atuar como coach e disseminar o conhecimento das melhores práticas no desenvolvimento de software dentro e fora da ThoughtWorks;

  • Ser parte de um ambiente aberto e não hierárquico onde se espera que todos colaborem dentro do projeto e nas direções da organização.


Esperamos que você:



  • Goste de programar. No seu tempo livre você se diverte programando uma aplicação para web 2.0 ou um framework para facilitar suas atividades diárias;

  • Tenha experiência com desenvolvimento em Java, .NET, Python e/ou Ruby. Você poderá nos mostrar um pouco do seu talento durante nosso processo de seleção;

  • Tenha experiência com análise, design, codificação e implementação de aplicações OO coorporativas personalizadas;

  • Capacidade de trabalhar em equipe, em um ambiente colaborativo;

  • Tenha experiência de trabalho com métodos ágeis - incluindo XP, Scrum e desenvolvimento iterativo - seria fantástico. Se você ainda não teve a oportunidade de trabalhar em um ambiente ágil, você já leu tudo sobre esta metodologia;

  • Capacidade de comunicação, com habilidade de trabalhar e construir um relacionamento com o cliente dentro de um ambiente de consultoria;


Características que serão um diferencial:



  • Bons conhecimentos de padrões de projeto, refatoração e testes unitários;

  • Experiência de trabalho com métodos ágeis, XP, Scrum e / ou Kanban;

  • Experiência na escolha e aplicação de boas práticas de software como Test Driven Development (TDD), integração e entrega continua;

  • Participação ativa dentro da comunidade de TI como um palestrante, autor ou colaborador.

  • Esta posição também está disponível para PCD (Pessoas com Deficiência).


Parece interessante? Então vamos conversar! 

Veja aqui um vídeo sobre como é trabalhar na ThoughtWorks!

item.title: Senior Ruby on Rails Application Developer at Weather Telematics Inc. (Ottawa, ON, Canada)
item.description:
Position Summary


Weather Telematics is pursuing candidates that are looking to get in on the ground floor of a fast paced innovative startup, poised for growth.  The company recently moved into is new open concept R&D headquarters located in the character rich Hintonburg neighbourhood of Ottawa.  The company is currently raising financing and is hiring self motivated individuals that thrive in a flexible and agile corporate culture, where their ideas are heard and aligned with the corporate culture and objectives.


The Senior Application Developer is a critical member of our product infrastructure development team.  They work closely with the COO, CTO, and other developers in a scrum/agile project approach.  They are fully involved in the discovery and development stages of a distributed internet of things (IoT) framework (backend and frontend) based on an AKKA/Scala (backend) and the Ruby on Rails web framework (frontend).  The backend of the platform will involve the development of data aggregation socket services and an extensive API (potentially built on Rails).  Portions of the project will involve engaging with Machine Learning researchers to develop a set of web visualizations based on underlying data analytics developed on a Ruby on Rails platform.


Responsibilities will include maintaining existing projects and developing new applications, managing projects, delegating work, and providing assistance to junior developers.

item.title: Business Intelligence Software Engineer at Best Friends Animal Society (Kanab, UT) (allows remote)
item.description:
Come work in a warm and relaxed environment among the red rocks of Southern Utah!  We are adding to our amazing IT team and have 2 openings for Business Intelligence Software Engineers. 


Position Summary: The Business Intelligence (BI) Software Engineer’s role is to strategically design and implement BI software and systems, including integration with databases and data warehouses. This includes selecting, blueprinting, gathering requirements, designing, and rolling out BI solutions to end users. The Business Intelligence Software Engineer is also responsible for ensuring high levels of BI availability through support functions and in-depth testing.  The BI Software Engineer  will be responsible for setting the technical direction of BI projects within the framework of Enterprise Data Architecture.  The BI Software Engineer will also provide mentoring and guidance in best practices to other members of the Enterprise Data team.


Responsibilities:


Strategy and Planning (10%)



  • Assess and cultivate long-term strategic goals for BI development in conjunction with end users, managers, clients, and other stakeholders.


Acquisition and Deployment (10%)



  • Conduct research and make recommendations on BI products, services, and standards in support of procurement and development efforts. 

  • Evaluate and select database/data warehouse components, including hardware, relational database management systems, ETL software, metadata management tools, and database design solutions.


Operational Leadership (30%) 



  • Direct, organize, and lead projects in the implementation and use of new BI software tools and systems. 

  • Lead the integration efforts for merging BI platforms with enterprise systems and applications. 

  • Work with project managers to ensure that data entry, retrieval, change, and delete functions meet business requirements for project completion. 

  • Conduct job duties and responsibilities according to the organization’s business systems development methodology and/or its Systems Development Life Cycle (SDLC) methodology. 

  • Monitor alerts and troubleshoot BI tools, systems, and software; performance-tune these applications as necessary. 

  • Act as evangelist for BI benefits across the organization; promote BI usage to relevant departments.

  • Mentor and/or provide leadership to junior members of the team.


Engineering (40%) 



  • Design, code, test, and document all new or modified BI systems, applications, and programs. 

  • Develop the semantic layer, metadata, reports, and report definitions.  Develop graphs, dashboards, and portal interfaces.

  • Design databases, data models, data marts, and data warehouses. 

  • Analyze user requirements and, based upon findings, design functional solutions. 

  • Design and deliver end-user training and training materials; provide technical support as necessary.

  • Build specifications for BI front-end applications based upon user requirements. 

  • Produce ETL design guidelines to ensure a manageable ETL infrastructure for the BI system.  


Information Security (10%) 



  • Develop, test, and implement best practices within the BI ecosystem to ensure sensitive information is protected and only available to those with a need and the appropriate approved access to view the information.

item.title: Java Software Engineer at Connexta (Phoenix, AZ)
item.description:
Looking to create and contribute amazing open source software? As a Software Developer you will participate in Open Source Software Development working on the Distributed Data Framework (DDF https://github.com/codice/ddf). Using Scrum and applying Object Oriented concepts and design patterns, you will develop prioritized capability within a continuous integration development environment. Connexta is a software company with the software team as the core of the company.


DDF is open source and utilizes many other open source technologies and open standards. Besides continually building new capability into DDF, we work with customers that have distributed enterprises with many diverse data sources. Using DDF we make the data discoverable and accessible addressing aspects relating to search, geospatial, security, and metadata, among many others. Development is primarily in Java and JavaScript.

item.title: Business Intelligence Developer at TravelBird (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Become part of our team


At TravelBird we believe that every day presents a new chance to grow. We challenge our people in a focussed, creative and pleasant environment. TravelBird believes in a positive and responsible way of working, whereby we strive to improve everyday. Our aim is to bring back the joy to travel. This is clearly reflected in our open, social and entrepreneurial environment. Here, we learn from each other and value trust more than focussing on hierarchy. We create joy for the customers and a joy for employees. It’s not just a job. It’s a working experience you will love to wake up for every day.


Your challenge



  • Model a company federated data warehouse with structured and unstructured elements;

  • Design and implement data models and flows to support reporting and analysis;

  • Develop and maintain ETL processes;

  • Manage data quality and consistency in the company data warehouse.

item.title: Senior Big Data / Cloud Architect - Bloomberg Vault at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:

Bloomberg is looking for a Senior Software Developer for our cloud-based real-time content filtering and monitoring platform for e-mail, instant messaging, voice and social media data. The service is part of Bloomberg Vault.

Bloomberg Vault is a startup in Bloomberg Enterprise group developing a cloud-based compliance archiving service, eDiscovery tools and real-time compliance monitoring infrastructure. Our software, which is hosted in Bloomberg's private cloud, has gained rapid market adoption with over 700 enterprises and archives over 60 billion messages.

With the explosive growth of social media and web collaboration data real-time content filtering and monitoring is a crucial requirement for business of any size to stay compliant with regulations. Our infrastructure process over 200 million messages a day checking content and interaction patterns and providing analytics and event-driven reporting.

We are looking for experienced software developers who are or want to become experts in areas such as geo-distribution, real-time processing, service hosting, message orchestration, high-available, fault-tolerant and low latency computation.

Candidates must be able to work independently to find a path to success by researching and recommending alternatives when faced with challenging situations. Candidates should have a passion for technology and a flexible, creative approach to problem solving. They should be able to take ownership of business requirements and devise and develop solutions that meet customer needs. Time to market is critical.

item.title: GPU Database Developer at MapD (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
• Help design a new distributed database system that optimally scales across multiple GPUs and CPUs
• Work on features such as join support and the ability to create materialized views
• Extend our LLVM compilation engine
• Code optimization - query execution speed must be near hardware limits
• Support early customers

item.title: DevOps Engineer at Treasure Data (Mountain View, CA)
item.description:
If you have implemented and supported a cutting edge public cloud environment, have excellent analytical skills, and a passion for scalable and stable engineering environments, we want to talk with you! Working closely with our engineering team, you will implement and scale our predominantly Ruby and Java-based architecture.


We love the fact that you are a little obsessive about maintaining high availability for all of the services we manage, while also implementing the infrastructure solutions that our teams need to continue building our product. At Treasure Data, you will have opportunities to combine your technical ability, strategic thinking and detail-oriented execution in a fast-paced, dynamic, entrepreneurial environment. Your work will contribute to the design and management of serious infrastructure that is servicing large amounts of data and traffic, while working with a truly world-class engineering team, always employing state-of-the-art tools and techniques.


Things you will do:




    • Manage PostgreSQL/MySQL databases and traditional k-v stores and clusters

    • Manage 100+ cloud servers using automation tools

    • Investigate of system errors and problems

    • Perform bottleneck analysis of the system for scaling

    • Setup monitoring systems and application metrics as well as supervise them for prediction/detection of failures

item.title: Open Source Software Engineer - Pivotal at Pivotal (Palo Alto, CA)
item.description:
Pivotal is looking for a few great engineers to join our GemFire/Apache Geode engineering team. Apache Geode (currently in incubation) is a distributed, in-memory, and transactional datastore designed to provide very high throughput with predictable latency. GemFire is built on Apache Geode and is deployed throughout the world by demanding customers serving mission-critical applications in financial, telecommunications, retail, and transportation industries.


You


You have a passion for large distributed systems to manage data on a massive scale. You love building highly concurrent systems that are also fault tolerant and extremely reliable. You follow current trends in topics such as stream processing and in-memory computing. You’d really like to believe there’s a way to defy the CAP theorem and get consistency, availability, and partition tolerance all in the same system (even if no one else has managed to do that yet). Above all, you love shipping software as a member of a collaborative team.


Us


At Pivotal, our mission is to enable customers to build a new class of applications, leveraging big and fast data, and do all of this with the power of cloud-independence. Pivotal’s offering includes the Big Data Suite, the most complete approach to enterprise data lakes and advanced analytics; Pivotal Cloud Foundry, the industry leading Platform as a Service product; and world leading ultra-agile application development through Pivotal Labs. Open source is an important part of our strategy. Many of our products are already open source; those that are not will be soon. 


The Big Data Suite includes HAWQ, our SQL on Hadoop solution; Greenplum Database (GPDB), our massively parallel data warehouse; GemFire, our distributed in-memory key-value store; and MADlib, our machine learning solution.


The GemFire/Apache Geode engineering team at Pivotal tackles challenges that come with massively parallel distributed systems operating at extreme scale to achieve incredibly low latency transactions. We delve into areas like stream processing, query optimization, parallel function execution, scalable distributed data structures, fault-tolerance paradigms, and peer-to-peer messaging. Here at Pivotal you'll be working on hard problems with a collaborative team, accelerating your growth as an engineer.


Where


GemFire engineering is located in our light-filled spacious office in Beaverton, OR.To make sure you start your day energized, we provide a catered breakfast every weekday morning, and unlimited snacks/drinks are of course available all day. Our collaborative, open-plan office space is filled with talented, like-minded engineers who enjoy taking advantage of our weekly Tech Talks, playing ping pong, and hanging out with their co-workers.

item.title: Lead Software Developer, Red Bull Data Services at Red Bull Media House (Santa Monica, CA)
item.description:
As a global media company, Red Bull Media House produces, publishes, distributes and licenses high-quality programming. Millions of viewers around the globe experience our TV and video products through Red Bull TV, a global digital video service with a growing portfolio of applications on key platforms including Apple TV, Xbox, Chromecast, iOS, Android, Amazon Fire TV as well as select Smart TV devices.


The Lead engineer within the Red Bull TV data services group will be responsible for the creation and maintenance of data collection, collation and analysis services to support the operation of the TV platform. The data will include video reporting, social streams, web content; click stream and application level elements. Outputs from this data will include recommendations, real time dashboards, quality of services insights, event reporting as well as several other business level reporting requirements.

item.title: Sr Big Data Engineer at Time Inc. (New York, NY)
item.description:
The job:


In this role, you will be responsible for the delivery of solutions on top of the Hadoop big data platform implementation and playing a key role in this huge technology pivot. These solutions drive business value from powering the most critical business decisions to powering how the site behaves through various avenues of personalization. This entails working with the technology and business team and  partner to flesh out requirements, complete solution design, development and ultimate delivery to the end consumers.


You will:



  • Develop various facets of the Hadoop EDW ecosystem and Map Reduce jobs

  • Understand customer analytics needs, and translate them into pluggable Hadoop Hive UDFs/UDAFs

  • Evolve development standards and design patterns for overall EDW Hadoop-based Development

  • Prototype creative solutions quickly

  • Help other engineers get the most out of the platform you own

  • Provide timely and appropriate communication to business owners, stakeholders, and users on issue status and resolution

item.title: Ruby Web Developer at Trimble Navigation (Westminster, CO)
item.description:
About Trimble Data


Trimble Data develops scalable, cloud-based geospatial systems. Our goal is to make geospatial processing simpler and faster for consumers by interfacing many varied geospatial applications into a cohesive whole.


Our primary system is the Trimble Data Marketplace, a storefront for geospatial data. The Marketplace enables customers to find, customize, and download data quickly and easily.



Ruby Web Developer


We are seeking a self-motivated, creative, and enthusiastic full stack developer to join the Trimble Data Web Development team. As a full-stack developer, you will maintain and design applications from top to bottom and work with everything from front-end HTML, CSS and JS to server-side databases, search indexes, and web servers as well as AWS cloud operations.


As a member of the Trimble Data Web Development team you will leverage new technologies, services and best practices to build the best solutions. You will have the opportunity to develop innovative solutions to new problems and will work with a wide variety of technologies to assist in the design of our API-driven front end UI as well as the backend API itself, all within scalable cloud infrastructure. Developers deal with a wide variety of tasks. A typical week may include coding, architecting, debugging, working with databases, and learning new technologies.


Key Responsibilities




  • Software engineering with a healthy dose of performance engineering and DevOps.




  • Develop, design, and support web app (SaaS), with focus on performance and scalability.




  • Maintain existing systems, while investigating and prototyping new technologies.




  • Build user interfaces to make large sets of data and processing operations available to end users.




  • Design APIs and work with consumers to support automated processing goals.




Work within your team and with other teams to ensure the overall vision of the project is being fulfilled.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer- Security Platform Owner at Amazon (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
The Security Intelligence team, part of Information Security at Amazon, owns the monitoring of and response to malicious activity on the Amazon network. We collect data from all parts of Amazon's massive, worldwide service-oriented architecture.



We are seeking Software Engineers to join a team in Information Security dedicated to enabling our organization to perform its most critical functions at Amazon’s scale. Our challenges are broad and deep -- we need to build flexible, secure, scalable, high-performance and robust software and services. We have all of the challenges you’d expect such as high scale, big data, and a need to never go down. In addition to these challenges we also have the security aspect. We protect customer data from adversaries that want it.



At Amazon, we obsess over our customers, and ensuring our customers’ trust is our first priority. To earn that trust in an environment as vast and varied as Amazon’s and an online world where threats grow ever more sophisticated requires building a world-class security team to tackle never-before-seen challenges at dizzying scales. You will not just be using cutting-edge technologies here in Amazon; you will be inventing them.

You have strong verbal and written communication skills, are self-driven and deliver high quality results in a fast-paced environment. You have strong computer science credentials, are passionate about Internet technology, are customer-obsessed and have a track record of building quality services. You know how to build and you dive deep into back-end services. You excel when working on complex and diverse systems. You can succinctly and accurately report your findings. Most importantly, you have a passion for learning and continuous improvement.


  • MINIMUM 8 years' Software Development experience

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field

  • Proficiency in at least one modern programming language such as Python, Java, or Scala

  • Experienced in big data technologies and/or distributed computing systems

  • Self-directed, ability to multi-task, sharp analytical abilities, excellent communication skills, capable of working effectively in a dynamic environment

  • Proven design skills and able to find creative scalable solutions to difficult problems

  • Strong knowledge of data structures, algorithms, internet security fundamentals and designing for performance, scalability and availability




  • Masters in Computer Science or Computer Engineering

  • Experience taking a leading role in building complex software systems

  • Knowledge of professional software engineering practices & best practices

  • Experience mentoring junior software engineers to improve their skills

  • Demonstration of project ownership including requirements, design, implementation, testing, and operational support

  • Experience with stream, batch and/or graph processing platform (e.g. Spark)

  • Experience with security technologies or products

  • Experience working in an agile environment

item.title: Senior Backend Engineer at Metrigo Gmbh (Zalando SE) (Hamburg, Germany)
item.description:
• Development of scalable, high performance webservices reacting in real-time.

  • Code optimization and garbage collection tuning.

  • Development of Big-Data, high-volume applications that support multi-millions of users as well as billions of requests on a daily basis.

  • Management of multi-layered webservice products, as well as invention and development of new ones.

  • Communication with different stakeholders from Zalando SE and your team to understand product requirements to carry them out to successul release!

item.title: Java Tech Lead passionné de TDD et clean code (f/h) at AXA Life Invest (Courbevoie, France)
item.description: Imagine une équipe autonome, pluridisciplinaire, et convaincue qu'avec de la bonne data viz, on peut rendre compréhensible et amusant des produits financiers innovants. Imagine qu'en plus, cette équipe reçoive des missions délibérément floues, pour laisser s'exprimer sa créativité collective en conception de produit. Cette équipe existe et elle cherche un coéquipier passionné de TDD/BDD, de clean code et d'applications qui font dire "waouh !" à ses utilisateurs.

item.title: Dev Ops Engineer at Datto Inc (Boston, MA)
item.description:
Datto® is the leading provider of comprehensive data backup, recovery and business continuity solutions with over five million end points protected and approximately 3,500 active revenue generating partners worldwide and growing. With its Total Data Protection Platform Datto’s mission is to protect business data everywhere it resides, whether on premise, in virtualized environments, in the cloud, and software-as-a-service (SaaS) applications including Salesforce, Google Apps, and more. Datto stores in its purpose built cloud over 140 petabytes of data worldwide for businesses ranging from Fortune 500 enterprises to small businesses.


  Datto’s core technologies such as instant virtualization, Screenshot Backup Verification™, Inverse Chain Technology™, Backup Insights™, and end-to-end encryption are the cornerstones of its innovative solutions. Industry firsts also include 24/7/365 in-house tech support, white glove customer success support, and time-based cloud retention, that empowers its partners with predictable cloud billing. The Datto product line consists of the Datto SIRIS Family, Datto ALTO Family, Datto NAS and Datto Backupify.

item.title: Machine Learning Engineer at import.io (London, UK)
item.description:
import.io is one of the leading startups in enabling automated web data extraction. We use advanced Artificial Intelligence, NLP, Deep Learning, and Machine Learning technologies to understand contents on websites and extract entities for our knowledge graph.


import.io comprises of many different and distributed parts, and we are looking for someone who will help our complex and challenging systems evolve and grow! You will be part of the world-leading research and development team that creates our data extraction technologies like Magic.


What you'll do!



  • Research and development of algorithms to automatically extract data from web.

  • Prototyping, scaling, productising, and supporting the end-to-end pipeline of algorithms.

  • Collaborating with other members of the team to come up with innovative and disruptive technologies for understanding web and extracting relevant data.

  • Designing, implementing and testing new patentable algorithms in the field of AI, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, NLP.


What we'd love to see!


Essential:



  • Extensive experience in working with Python.

  • Extensive experience in Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Statistical Modelling, and NLP.

  • Bachelor, Master, or PhD in Computer Science, Physics, Math, Stats.

  • Experience in working with scalable algorithms, data structures, big data technologies (e.g. Spark, Hadoop).

  • Experience with developing on Linux or Mac OS X.

  • Great communication and collaboration skills.

  • To have a great attitude, and be fun to work with.

  • To be proactive, excited by our product, and to be invested in pushing it forward


Desired:



  • Experience with Java, JavaScript, and C++.

  • Experience in data extraction, web crawling, and data indexing.

  • Experience of working with agile methodologies.

  • Open source contributions and projects (bonus point for working on web related projects).

  • Knowledge of full-stack development.

  • Experience working in startups.


What you’ll get!



  • Working for a company that has won loads of international start-up awards! We’ve been named as one of the coolest places to work (twice)! We love what we do, and who we do it with.

  • Great location - With offices in both London and San Francisco, we are in the heart of the technology scene in both the US and Europe.

  • Great people - We’ve assembled an incredibly diverse, talented and spirited team who genuinely enjoy coming to work everyday.

  • Challenges - The freedom to grow and define your own role so you can leave work everyday knowing you’ve made a difference.

  • Learning on the job - Investigating new technologies is always encouraged

  • Healthcare - You get full coverage for medical, dental, and vision insurance.

  • Paid lunches - We have catered lunch everyday and provide plenty of tasty snacks.

  • A share in the company - All employees own a part of the company.

  • Fun & Games - It’s not all work; we have movie nights, lunch activities, happy hours and a bi-annual offsite.

  • Gym membership - 50% off Virgin Active membership

  • Individual training & book budgets

  • Your choice of laptop - Mac or PC

item.title: Lead Architect - Windows/C/Power Industry at LiveData Utilities, Inc. (Cambridge, MA)
item.description:
We have an exciting opportunity to join a spearheading smartgrid IT organization in a project team developing complex event processing products that manage large data streams responsible for monitoring and maintaining the grid.
LiveData Utilities designs solutions to improve grid uptimes, operational efficiency, and customer satisfaction in the energy generation and distribution space. We are the vision leaders in Operations Technology Service Bus space.
LiveData is looking for a Windows C software engineer with complex event processing, web server development, and data exchange experience to develop our next generation OTSB product: an enterprise class software that is ingesting sensor data from numerous external data sources, processing & monitoring those data streams at the rate of tens of thousands of data points per second. Significant experience with real-time systems, asynchronous event processing, network or http processing, large data processing systems.



Key Responsibilities - what you do on a daily basis



  • Lead advocate for architectural, structural, and design decisions for the product

  • Design software application components using C in a Windows environment, Python, and other programming tools that fuel core business applications

  • Develop next generation complex event processing systems & components to replace and extend legacy systems 

  • Find bugs and eliminate them. Cleaning up old and broken code should rank high on your list of therapeutic activities.

  • Knowledge Share. We operate in a fast paced environment, and you will frequently pair with other team members. We want you to share your expertise, making everyone else better and facilitating continuous learning

  • Create reusable processes, components and tools that others can leverage to accelerate progress

  • Stay up to date on the latest technology trends and techniques – and be prepared to propose new ideas when there is strong business value.

item.title: Production Programmer at Wiland, Inc. (Niwot, CO)
item.description:
Wiland is seeking dedicated, high caliber professionals who are smart and energetic, have a positive attitude and take pride in their work. Currently, we have an opening for a Production Programmer. The Production Programmer will focus on customizations needed to process incoming data and produce high quality output files to be sent to our Clients/Customers. This position requires broad knowledge of relational databases, UNIX commands, shell and Perl scripting, and multiple data file formats. Tasks and responsibilities of the Production Programmer position include:



  1. Write high quality SQL statements that will be included in both production and custom jobs.

  2. Use existing software tools and create new tools to produce output files to fulfill custom requests from Clients.

  3. Provide Tier 1 support, as designated, to the rest of Wiland’s organization for all internally developed applications and systems.

  4. Investigate and resolve data or system problems causing unexpected results.

  5. Support the Data Management team in conversions of incoming data files.

  6. Contribute in the specification and development of tools and systems to make jobs easier, less error prone, and more efficient.

  7. Use Wiland’s ticket tracking system (Jira) to maintain a record of all tasks performed and actions taken.

item.title: Senior Systems Engineer at Outbox AXS LLC (Los Angeles, CA)
item.description:
The Sr. Systems Engineer is responsible for helping to develop and support a stable, available and scalable infrastructure that powers AXS.com and a suite of products that include Advantage and Data Platform (Hadoop). The scope of the position is from the system to the application service level. In the spirit of Dev-ops this position requires working closely with the internal development and big data teams. We are looking for System Engineers familiar with large scale, high traffic 24/7 production environments built in data centers and in the cloud. The ideal candidate is someone with a deep understanding of infrastructure, systems and services and how they’re built, deployed, managed and interact at scale. 


Essential Duties



  • Oversees provisioning and configuration of new systems in the cloud or at the data center

  • Work with various internal teams on issue resolution and systems management

  • First-line responsibility for isolating application-level configuration, performance and database problems

  • Performs analysis and tuning of system performance

  • Works closely with internal development and big data teams on stage and production management and deployment

  • Maintain and grow a production environment in a way that makes the system increasingly performant, stable and maintainable

  • Participates in service capacity planning and demand forecasting, software performance analysis and system tuning

  • Responds to and resolves emergent service problems by debugging systems and services

  • Interfaces with development and operations teams to perform software and systems analysis, upgrades and new deployments

  • Management of system monitoring and performance monitoring frameworks, alerting, and security policies

  • Participate in on-call rotation

item.title: Full-stack Software Developer at LiveStories (Seattle, WA) (allows remote)
item.description:
LiveStories is looking for a senior software engineer interested in making a difference. 


Responsibilities:



  • Develop software with Python/Pyramid, JavaScript, MongoDB, and ElasticSearch

  • Follow well-accepted coding and documentation practices

  • Write unit tests

  • Optimize application for scalability

item.title: Ruby on Rails Developer at Altamira (McLean, VA)
item.description: The selected candidate will provide software engineering support on a web-based administrative support portal.  The application consists of a suite of integrated tools that provides support personnel with key data points by reaching out to a variety of enterprise data sources and consolidating the data into a unified view.  Candidate will be responsible for maintaining the current set of tools which will allow for increased familiarity with the application.  Over time, the selected candidate will be responsible for developing new applications, utilizing enterprise web-services, and building new reports.  The successful candidate will be a member of a dynamic team that is responsible for a rich web application.  The selected candidate must have the ability to work in a mixed technical environment and maintain productivity when switching between multiple tools/applications and technologies.  The candidate must work well in a team environment and have the desire to develop software in an agile fashion.

item.title: Client Facing Python Developer at Continuum Analytics (New York, NY)
item.description:
We are looking for accomplished scientists and engineers interested in a customer-facing software consultancy that could lead to full time placement with a customer at the conclusion of a project.  Many of these roles allow for involvement with our core technologies as needed by the customer.  The more experienced candidate will have a strong technical background with 4+ years Python and C/C++ development experience and 2+ years experience with NumPy or the equivalent.


Depending on your skills, you will work on one of our core products or technologies, including our next-generation data management products which will push Python and its vectorized enhancements such as NumPy into general use in big data analytics. For the right person(s) with strong technical and customer-facing skills but less prior exposure to Python, C/C++, NumPy, and related, we may offer concentrated training and mentoring to fully prepare you for this role. 


Bonus skills & experience: Distributed databases, parallel computation, KDB+, GPU, UI, Gemstone, OLAP/MDX, LLVM.

item.title: Software Developer @ Cloud-Based Behavioral Analytics Software Company at RedOwl (Baltimore, MD)
item.description:
Do you love bringing data to life? We do, too. Our platform does statistical analysis on large datasets, and shows our users the results in beautiful, intuitive ways. We're focused on building the best threat detection application on the market. You'll work with a great team of engineers, data scientists, mathematicians, and product folks. We're good people, we love working together, and want you to feel the same way. If the above sounds like your kind of thing, we'd love to talk with you.


You're a RedOwl Developer if you can:



  1. Write exemplary code;

  2. Display an understanding of our system as a whole;

  3. Contribute to the quality of the platform while holding others to a high standard during code reviews, design meetings, and deliverables;

  4. Serve as a mentor to, and learn from, other RedOwl developers; 

  5. Contribute to the broader technical community via open source projects, writing, or presenting; and

  6. Identify and suggest new technologies that may make sense for our platform.

item.title: Platform Engineer at Umbel (Austin, TX)
item.description:
Umbel is a high-energy, high-tech startup in Austin, Texas that is passionate about helping businesses build thriving, sustainable models powered by their ability to deeply understand and demonstrate the value of their audience.


We are seeking a Platform Engineer that loves to build incredible things. This position will work closely with all members of the product, development and engineering teams in a collaborative environment, which is diverse and open-minded. A successful candidate will obsess over high performance web development and database optimization, as well as feel comfortable in the cloud and know the latest techniques for developing and scaling web applications and distributed systems.


Responsibilities:



  • Write fantastic server-side code for web applications and distributed systems

  • Develop prototypes quickly and scale them

  • Live in the cloud and love it

  • Push back, think creatively, and have fun forming products


What you'll get out of it: 



  • 100% employer paid benefits (medical, dental, vision, etc.)

  • A supportive, challenging and fun team environment

  • Awesome office location in downtown Austin

  • The ability to grow your career and skill set

  • Competitive compensation including cash and stock options

  • A company that is young, agile and responsive to great ideas

item.title: AngularJS / UI Developer at ScienceTRAX (Austin, TX)
item.description:
ScienceTRAX is looking for bright, energetic, entrepreneurial minded people who want to make a difference. Yes, we build software, but we build software that helps advance medical science. The challenge of applying technology to medicine is one that drives us and if it drives you, then this might be the right place for you.


We’re building data collection and analysis software to facilitate medical research.  Through the use of our web-based application, our customers collect patient information, send patient surveys, manage clinical trials and much more. Powerful data analytics is then used to find trends and correlations to turn the data into information that can then be used to improve patient care.


StudyTRAX prototyping is done using Balsamiq for Confluence.  As a developer, you will help develop and refine the prototypes and then implement them using AngulerJS. Being a small team, each developer makes a significant contribution to the product.  We are constantly evolving and updating our tools to keep up with the rapidly changing environment.


One big advantage to this job is that you will be working from home.  This allows for an extremely flexible working environment and it makes for a short commute :)

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Windsor Circle, Inc (Durham, NC)
item.description: Responsible for architecting and building the interconnect to many SaaS data stores in the e-commerce marketplace using SOAP and REST based APIs.  Responsible for the primary design and frameworks used for transforming, storing, and extracting data from our centralized database hub for marketing purposes.  Assist in designing and building the Company’s own RESTful API supporting JSON and XML data exchange for integration with our front end UI. Code reviews, guidance to other engineers.

item.title: Spark Developer at Cybraics, Inc. (Reston, VA)
item.description:
Essential Functions:



  • Research and design best fit solutions for environments



  • Write Java and/or Scala code for the Apache Spark framework



  • Write tests to validate and maintain the solutions



  • Evaluate data files and streams for use in the platform



  • Work within a highly technical team – contribute and collaborate

  • 5+ years experience in software development

    • Code samples required

  • Understanding of data science concepts and tools

item.title: Mid-level Developer at Maritime Planning Associates (Newport, RI)
item.description: Maritime Planning Associates, a Veteran Owned Small Business, is seeking a Mid-level Developer to support the development of geospatially enabled decision aids and associated geospatial data and data management systems. This position will support programs either in the Newport, RI or Virginia Beach, VA regions. The successful candidate will be an independent, self-motivated programmer responsible for development and extension of code bases built primarily on Java programming. Successful candidate must have the ability to work efficiently, independently and meet hard deadlines.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Datto Inc (Norwalk, CT)
item.description: Datto is currently looking for passionate engineers to forge software for our internal and distributed systems and eager to implement new solutions.

item.title: Senior Software Development Engineer at AudienceScience (Bellevue, WA)
item.description:
AudienceScience is seeking a Senior Software Development Engineer to join our team. As the Senior Software Development Engineer, you will work on an agile team in the big data arena, building the infrastructure to support AudienceScience® Helios, a global media buying platform using real-time bidding and behavioral targeting technologies. We currently handle upwards of 9 billion requests per day, aggregating all of this data on our Hadoop clusters. Distributed systems experience a big plus and Hadoop experience an even bigger plus.


 RESPONSIBILITIES:



  • Work with Chief Architect to design and build scalable, efficient, distributed systems to meet business objectives following best practices for quality, testability and operability.

  • Perform code reviews.

  • Provide third-tier support for production systems.

  • Work with development leadership and product management to evaluate new product and feature requests and recommend solutions.

  • Provide mentorship to other developers.

  • Stay current on state of the art technologies, and make recommendations for how these may be used to improve our systems.

  • Play key role in recruiting and evaluating candidates for open positions.

item.title: Software Development Engineer at AudienceScience (Bellevue, WA)
item.description:
AudienceScience is seeking a talented Software Development Engineer to join our team. You’ll work on an agile team in the big data arena, building the infrastructure to support AudienceScience® Helios, a global media buying platform using real-time bidding and behavioral targeting technologies. We currently handle upwards of 9 billion requests per day, aggregating all of this data on our Hadoop clusters. Distributed systems experience a big plus and Hadoop experience an even bigger plus.


 RESPONSIBILITIES:


* Work with Chief Architect to design and build scalable, efficient, distributed systems to meet business objectives following best practices for quality, testability and operability.


* Perform code reviews.


* Provide third-tier support for production systems.

item.title: Associate Developer at Finsight (Juneau, AK)
item.description:
This opening is for an associate developer to participate in a range of projects spanning from


enterprise systems for fisheries management to data collection and research software using a wide


variety of technologies. This position requires strong time management skills to be successful on


multiple projects simultaneously. The ideal candidate will have demonstrable experience building


applications in either Java or C#. The successful candidate will report to a technical project manager


and will participate in 2-4 person teams, and be expected to engage on site with clients regularly.


Compensation for this full-time salaried position will depend on experience, and will include health


insurance benefits and paid vacation time. The job must be performed on site in Juneau, AK. Travel,


housing, and/or relocation support are negotiable. We are not able to offer H1 visa sponsorship for


this position.

item.title: Data Engineer at Clover Health (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Clover Health is driving down costs and producing improved health outcomes with a unique health insurance plan. We use sophisticated analytics and custom software to direct our own clinical staff to proactively fill in gaps in the care of our members. We have a proven model we're scaling out.


We're focusing on elderly and low-income patients that stand to benefit from our model the most. This puts us in a position to make a major dent in healthcare expense in the United States and reverse an unsustainable, decades-long spending trend.


We are looking for a Data Engineer that embodies our values to join our team revolutionizing healthcare.

item.title: Entwickler Data Warehouse / Informatica und Oracle PL/SQL (m/w) at DekaBank Deutsche Girozentrale (Frankfurt am Main, Deutschland)
item.description:
Die DekaBank ist das Wertpapierhaus der Sparkassen, gemeinsam mit ihren Tochtergesellschaften bildet sie die Deka-Gruppe. Mit unseren vier Geschäftsfeldern – Wertpapiere, Immobilien, Kapitalmarkt und Finanzierungen – sind wir Partner der Sparkassen in der Vermögensanlage und -verwaltung. Dies umfasst nicht nur Produkte wie Investmentfonds und Zertifikate, sondern auch Asset-Management- und Bank-Dienstleistungen rund ums Wertpapier. Dabei werden die Geschäftsfelder vom Sparkassenvertrieb und insgesamt 13 Zentralbereichen unterstützt.


Entwickler Data Warehouse / Informatica und Oracle PL/SQL (m/w)
Ref.-Nr.: 5003 1530, in Frankfurt, Vollzeit- oder Teilzeittätigkeit möglich


Ihre Aufgaben:



  • Entwickler im Rahmen der Anwendungsbetreuung für Data Warehouse, Schnittstellen und ETL-Workflows

  • Erarbeitung von Lösungen sowie deren Implementierung, Test und Deployment auf Basis von Oracle, Informatica und PL / SQL

  • Durchführung laufender Performance-, Optimierungs- und Pflegemaßnahmen

  • Management von internen und externen Datenschnittstellen und Abstimmung mit Schnittstellenpartnern

  • Beratung und Betreuung interner Kunden


Ihr Profil:



  • Fundierte Kenntnisse im Design und in der Entwicklung von komplexen Datenbanken oder Data-Warehouses

  • Expertenkenntnisse in ETL-Tools, vorzugsweise Informatica PowerCenter sowie in PL / SQL

  • Idealerweise Erfahrungen im KAG- oder Wertpapiergeschäft


Sie arbeiten gerne im Team und zeichnen sich durch eine strukturierte und selbstständige Arbeitsweise aus. Neben einer ausgeprägten Kommunikationsstärke besitzen Sie gute analytische und konzeptionelle Fähigkeiten. Dank Ihrer zielorientierten Arbeitsweise sind Sie in der Lage, in einem komplexen Systemumfeld effizient und reibungsfrei zu agieren. Ein hohes Maß an Verantwortung, Flexibilität und Belastbarkeit setzen wir voraus.


Freuen Sie sich auf ein attraktives Umfeld:
Wir bieten Ihnen einen modernen Arbeitsplatz sowie ein leistungsorientiertes Einkommen mit zahlreichen Nebenleistungen. Dazu gehört auch eine Vielzahl von Angeboten, um den vielfältigen Anforderungen von Beruf und Familie gerecht zu werden – vom Deka Health Center bis zur Kinderbetreuung.

Haben wir Ihr Interesse geweckt? Wir freuen uns auf Ihre Onlinebewerbung! Weitere Infos rund um Ihre Karriere bei der Deka-Gruppe finden Sie auf www.dekabank.de/karriere. Bei Rückfragen steht Ihnen unsere Bewerberbetreuung unter (0 69) 71 47 - 39 99 gerne zur Verfügung.


Die Deka-Gruppe strebt eine Erhöhung des Frauenanteils an. Daher werden Frauen
– bei gleichwertiger Qualifikation – für diese Stelle bevorzugt eingestellt.

item.title: Frontend Developer - Meteor / Javascript - FinTech Startup at Ldger Inc. (New York, NY)
item.description:
We're seeking front-end javascript developers to join our intimate NYC-based team to build our next generation platform for new exiting financial products.


We use - and love - Meteor as App platform, which gives us reactivity and “database everywhere” as well as a unified environment. 


You will help design and develop our financial service platform for AltFi products - allowing customers to model and execute exciting complex financial models. This includes analyzing and modeling financial data, data visualization and exporting results.


Our backend micro services are built in Node.js , integrating nicely with Meteor.

item.title: Developer/Project Manager at Personal BlackBox (New York, NY)
item.description:
Personal BlackBox is looking for a Project Manager who can lead a world-class team in agile development efforts.


A key contributor to our rapidly growing business, the Project Manager will be an integral member of our development team, responsible for full lifecycle execution on products – leading, developing, implementing and supporting enhancements for our applications. The ideal candidate is a results-oriented leader who is data driven, can prioritize well, and can communicate clearly with a talented team.


Key Responsibilities include:



  • Contribute to software design and architecture discussions, product development, and customer proposals
