  • Lead project scoping efforts to perform project-level estimates and priorities, and track project budget, timelines, and resources utilization

  • Work with technology team on the prioritization, solution creation, and achievement of business goals

  • Provide work direction, project status, and feedback to all team members and assist in issue resolution

  • Identify and track risks and opportunities for project deliverables. Escalate risks to plan as required.

  • Ensure high quality deliverables are produced while working within budget and meeting deadlines

  • Demonstrate project deliverables and present to technical and non-technical audiences

  • Champion an enthusiastic, empowered, diverse, rewarding, and synergistic team environment

  • Lead and ensure team compliance of development processes, tools, and controls

item.title: Android Developer at Gravy (Leesburg, VA)
item.description:
Gravy is a four year-old technology company poised to disrupt the world of consumer insights. The company has a unique, proprietary platform that captures and leverages rich data on local events and venues. Through its SDK and API, the company combines this data with mobile consumer behavioral data to drive consumer segmentation and activation. Gravy uses this powerful combination of location and behavioral data to create profiles that our clients use to execute pinpoint targeting of experiences and messaging to drive local store visits and retail sales results. Gravy is currently partnering with leading media, retail, and hospitality companies to increase engagement, activation and sales.







Position Summary






We are seeking a qualified Android developer to join our mobile development team. This developer will work on new features for existing apps as well as entirely new apps as part of a capable and fun team spanning many technologies.


The successful candidate will have a teamwork orientation and commitment to developing high-quality code. You will be a self-starter capable of breaking down complex tasks on your own and asking good questions when you encounter ambiguous requirements.

item.title: Python Software Engineer at CodiLime Sp. z o.o. (Warszawa, Polska)
item.description:
CodiLime realizes projects for clients from all over the world, e.g. California, Japan, Israel, Malta and Scandinavia, rendering services to such companies as NTT, AT&T, Hitachi High Technologies, Juniper Networks, GigaSpaces, Mirantis.We work with cutting edge IT technologies in the following areas: Machine Learning & BigData, Cloud Computing, Software Defined Network. We code in Python, Java, Scala i C++, and use various tools, technologies and frameworks, including Celery, Hadoop, Spark, Flask, AngularJS. We work in accordance with Agile methodologies and Clean Code practices using tools such as JIRA, Jenkins or Gerrit.


Examples of projects under realization:


1. Together with our client’s team we take part in developing an open source system for management of complex cloud applications. Our task is to develop parts of the system responsible for monitoring virtual machines as well as processes taking place there and to produce an appropriate reaction of the system to the noticed problems. Additionally, we also work on integrating the system with other open source systems, such as Docker, SaltStack, JBoss, etc. Technologies: Python, Celery, Riemann, RabbitMQ, Cloud (OpenStack, AWS),Vagrant.


2. We create a system that predicts failures of medical devices. This is a two-phase project. At the first stage an IT system is designed for uploading measurement data from the devices, dividing calculations into a set of tasks, running them in parallel and presenting the results. The second phase includes time series (sensor data) analytics and estimating the risk of failure of given device. Technologies: Python, Celery, RabbitMQ, Azure.

item.title: Senior Java Developer at XSB, Inc. (Setauket- East Setauket, NY)
item.description:
The Senior Java Developer position will be critical to XSB's growth.  We are looking for applicants who have experience with industry best practices in software engineering and who have familiarity with working  through  the  design,  development,  release  cycle,  and  delivering  software  product  to  market.  A strong candidate will have expertise in software design, back-end programming, documentation and testing, and technical management.


Job Duties and Responsibilities:



  • Oversee and participate in the development, release, and maintenance of software applications; ensure that all code is clean, maintainable, extensible and well tested

  • Support continuous improvements to our development processes

  • Evaluate and identify appropriate technology platforms (including web application frameworks and the deployment stack) for delivering the company’s products and services

  • Evolve  existing  software  system  applications  and  architecture  in  various  areas  as  needed; ensure that systems are robust to high usage and resilient to failures

  • Work together with Senior Management to plan and execute projects by establishing realistic estimates for timelines and budgets and ensuring that projects remain on target to meet deadlines

  • Coach and motivate team members to achieve optimum performance levels and career development

  • Teach, learn and innovate

item.title: Senior Web Services Engineer at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:

What does it take to bring up-to-the-minute news and video to 40+ million unique users per month? Bloomberg R&D's Web Shared Services team is responsible for doing that and more by engineering the world-class services infrastructure powering Bloomberg.com, News & Multimedia mobile apps, and other Bloomberg products.

Becoming the world's most influential news organization comes with unique challenges. Our team...
- Operates in a highly transparent ecosystem of advanced technical teams.
- Works in a close partnership with the industry's best product managers.
- Provides Web services which respond to more than a quarter of a billion requests daily.
- Presents product teams with a consistent API spanning numerous internal data sources and organizations.
- Integrates personalization tools to surface the most relevant information at the right time.
- Helps millions of users keep watch over their portfolios on the go.
- Keeps the world informed with smart push notifications and relevant alerts.

We focus specifically on...
- Performance and scalability of services and underlying data stores.
- Proactive, actionable monitoring and automated alerting.
- Service availability during deployments, maintenance and outages.
- Best practices in areas such as API design, data governance and component reusability.

item.title: Software Engineer at Revenue Analytics, Inc. (Atlanta, GA)
item.description:
Revenue Analytics has an immediate need to hire a Software Engineer for our Data Engineering Group.  We offer a competitive base salary, 15%-20% bonus incentive, full benefits, 401(k) + match and a defined career path. 


Revenue Analytics is looking for exceptional, motivated Software Engineers to design and develop large scale innovative solutions with sophisticated optimization models for Fortune 500 companies. Collaborate on cross-functional project teams assembled to address some of today’s most pressing business problems. Own project work streams while managing client expectations and strengthening client relationships. 


As a member of the Revenue Analytics Team, you will be part of a dynamic, growth organization dedicated to helping our clients optimize the price and availability of their products. 


 Responsibilities



  • Work with client and project team to write data and technology requirements in client facing documentation on software functionality.

  • Consult directly with clients and project teams to develop solutions to business problems through the design and development of software and database frameworks for forecasting and optimization solutions.

  • Through client interfacing and consulting, perform data transformation and analysis to assist clients in uncovering revenue opportunities.

  • Produce analysis and designs for the creation of analytical software solutions.

  • Work with clients to integrate our software solutions with their systems including providing full lifecycle application development support and consultancy.


Great Benefits


To attract top talent, we provide highly competitive salaries and benefits and offer substantial incentive compensation in the form of variable compensation and bonuses.



  • 100% paid medical, dental, and vision coverage for our employees and their families

  • Life insurance, long and short term disability coverage

  • 401(k) plan with a generous match and you are vested immediately

  • Company issued cell phone and laptop

  • 3 weeks paid vacation, 6 national holidays, 5 days off for Winter Break, and paid sick time

item.title: Software Engineer, Performance Data Analytics at SolarCity (San Mateo, CA)
item.description: The primary goal of the Software Engineer of Performance Data Analytics will be to use SolarCity’s extensive data resources to develop methods and techniques to better integrate widespread solar deployments with the grid.  SolarCity believes that better predictability and optimization of distributed energy systems will provide significant value to grid operators and energy market participants.  The Data Engineer will be responsible for engineering tools for that prediction and optimization.

item.title: Technical Engineer (Customer Success) at Logi Analytics (McLean, VA)
item.description:
COMPANY OVERVIEW



Logi Analytics enables enterprises to make better use of their data by delivering on the promise of analytics everywhere. By providing both a Web-based data discovery solution and a business information platform that can be embedded within applications, systems and processes, Logi Analytics helps its customers from the corner office to the factory floor to be more informed, make better decisions and improve corporate performance. With more than 1,200 customers worldwide, Logi Analytics meets the needs of organizations ranging from small businesses to Global 2000 enterprises. The company is headquartered in McLean, Virginia and has sales and support offices in the U.K. and Europe. Logi Analytics is a privately held, venture-backed firm with investments from Updata Partners, GroTech Ventures, Summit Partners and LLR Partners. For more information, visit LogiAnalytics.com.



SUMMARY



The Technical Engineer will assist existing customers in all aspects of the implementation, use and functional operation of Logi Analytics products. The incumbent must have a working knowledge of a wide range of technologies and serve as a contributing member of the team in technology discussions and operations. 



Responsibilities:



The range of the technical skills that are required to support the interaction between the Logi platform and client environments includes:



  • Web-based scripting technologies (JavaScript, CSS and/or HTML)

  • Common database systems (SQL Server, Oracle and/or MySQL)

  • SQL query writing

  • Basic networking skills, to include operating systems and OS security interactions

  • ETL processes and data modeling / data warehousing

  • Web Application technologies such as, DHTML and XML

  • Java and VB.NET programming language

  • Web server setup and configuration (IIS, Tomcat, Weblogic, etc.)

  • Data-driven web applications


The Technical Engineer will also:



  • Establish and maintain working relationships with internal teams, including professional services consultants, product management, engineers, and support staff

  • Maintain current functional and technical knowledge of the entire Logi Analytics product line

  • Manage and drive competing requests across simultaneous client engagements

  • Provide clear and constructive product feedback to product management based on customer requirements

  • Help to document best practices in developing and deploying Logi Analytics solutions

item.title: Senior Software Designer-Developer at Wiland, Inc. (Niwot, CO)
item.description:
Wiland is seeking dedicated, high caliber professionals who are smart and energetic, have a positive attitude and take pride in their work. Currently, we have an opening for a Senior Software Designer-Developer. This Designer-Developer will work closely with the Architecture Team, Development Team, and Product Management to design and develop software for Wiland. The Senior Designer-Developer is responsible for performing a variety of technical activities for assigned projects and maintenance requests as dictated by business priorities. The activities include creating design plans, writing detailed design documents, conducting design reviews, communicating specifications to the development team, developing software, preparing integration test plans, and providing technical leadership to the development team. The primary responsibilities of the Senior Software Designer-Developer position include:



  1. Reviewing and contributing to project Requirements Documents as necessary.

  2. Assisting in the conceptualization and development of solutions for approved projects.

  3. Collaborating with the assigned architect(s) to create design plans, data flow and data models.

  4. Independently preparing detail design documents (process flows, process specifications, and pseudo-code) suitable for use by developers.

  5. Conducting review sessions of completed designs, test plans, and release plans.

  6. Providing technical leadership to members of the development team participating in the project; mentor developers, ensure adherence to development standards, conduct code reviews, etc.

item.title: Back-end developer in fast growing Start-up at Energimolnet by Playback Energy AB (Gothenburg, Sweden)
item.description:
Come help us save the environment and disrupt a whole industry while doing it!


Energimolnet is built to boost the energy sector by making it fun, easy and truly scalable to develop energy related services that improve efficiency and save the environment. We manage billions of data points and provide the world’s most comprehensive infrastructure for collecting and distributing energy data. Our users save energy by using services they already love -- while we automatically extract data from energy bills, utility web-sites and smart-meters.


Grow with us


We are now expanding in Europe and looking for a back-end developer to join our growing team in Gothenburg. Your main responsibility will be to improve our data collection capabilities and implement new features that will help us grow globally. Our stack is highly distributed and we focus on what we do best and let Heroku, MongoLab, Iron, Papertrail, Mailgun, AWS, etcetera do the rest.


Your responsibilities



  • Lead the back-end development for data collection and monitoring as we enter new geographical markets

  • Be part of general planning and architecture decisions regarding cloud infrastructure and API-design.

  • Help our customers with support questions about the API and data collection

  • Pet-projects: Play around with the API and IFTTT to demonstrate and inspire how Energimolnet can be connected to smart lights and web services

item.title: Software Engineer, Data at HookLogic, Inc. (New York, NY)
item.description:
Job Description



HookLogic Engineers develop proprietary software platforms used by the world’s largest e-commerce retailers. Our engineering team consists of talented, team-oriented individuals who are empowered to take advantage of the latest cloud and distributed technologies to deliver reliable, high-throughput applications. Our core languages are Java and C# and we commonly utilize technologies and platforms such as RESTful services, jQuery, SQL Server, Hadoop, Hive, HBase, Storm, Spark, and AWS Services such as Kinesis, DynamoDB, Redshift, Lamda, and SQS. 


As a Data Engineer, you’ll employ your skills on a daily basis to design and build data processing and storage applications to handle millions of transactions per day. You will analyze business requirements and consult with the broader team to ensure successful processing, storage and reporting of our Big Data. You’ll have a wide variety of languages and technologies at your disposal that you can use to solve problems. Your work will directly shape and create our data architecture to ultimately deliver systems that stand up to unpredictable environments at massive scale.

item.title: Hadoop System Engineer at Cognitive Medical Systems (San Diego, CA)
item.description:
Position Summary:


We are looking for a Hadoop System Engineer to design, implement and maintain a large data solution for our health care project needs using Amazon’s cloud.


Responsibilities:



  • Work with project team to design Hadoop database to support large health care data sets

  • Develop capacity planning and analysis for Hadoop infrastructures/clusters

  • Implement solution using Amazon’s cloud environment

  • Provide metrics and data modelling support

  • Support an atmosphere of cross-functional teamwork within the organizations agile project lifecycle

  • Participates in product roadmap discussions and identify key areas for improvements in the product, and incorporate these goals into ongoing & future development initiatives

  • Recommends solutions by defining physical structure and functional capabilities, database security, data back-up, and recovery specifications

item.title: Development Data Team Lead at Markit (Boulder, CO)
item.description:
• You will be creating and leading a medium sized, focused team, supporting the data needs of our UI Development team across a variety of clients

  • You have proven success in establishing and growing high performance teams focused on delivering high quality software on time and on budget

  • You have a solid understanding of web development and an in-depth understanding of API development and best practices

  • You fully believe in documentation and building exactly to spec

  • You understand how to build reusable components that have the flexibility to meet multiple clients’ needs


Web Development Culture


We pride ourselves in having a large community of developers who actively support each other through open dialogue and brain storming. We love to solve problems quickly and elegantly while keeping the codebase maintainable and lean. We value a collaborative environment where ideas are valued and exchanged not only through our technology, but together in person, using tools like 50-foot whiteboards, and lots of sticky notes to map out and create sites, apps and tools that help people understand complex information.


What you will do and learn



  • Engineer and maintain high traffic, highly visibility APIs for the world’s largest financial firms and media outlets. (We received 5 billion hits last month).

  • Gain exposure to the stock market and other financial data, while developing APIs that deliver dynamic information from a variety of sources.

  • Use proprietary technologies and standard best practices to build and deliver high performance APIs.

item.title: Java Developer at Altamira Technologies (Chantilly, VA)
item.description:
Altamira is a top open source technology company in the national security space. Headquartered in McLean, Virginia, Altamira serves the defense, intelligence and homeland security communities by focusing on creating innovative solutions leveraging common standards in architecture, data and security.


If you would like to be part of an Agile software development group working on challenging, cutting-edge applications for our customers, send us your resume!  In this position you’ll be able to create software utilizing technologies such as: Hadoop, Accumulo, Apache Storm, RabbitMQ, OpenNLP, OpenCV, jQuery, AngularJS, D3.js, AWS and many more.


Position Description


We are looking for a software engineer to build scalable back-end features for an emerging open source Big Data analysis and visualization platform called Lumify.  This platform offers exciting challenges for processing various types of structured and unstructured data to create a top-notch distributed system.


If you’re a passionate engineer who enjoys working with talented peers in a result-oriented environment, check out the project at http://lumify.io and contact us to join our team!

item.title: Senior Web Application Software Engineer at Datto Inc (Norwalk, CT)
item.description:
Responsibilities:




  • Lead and mentor a talented team of developers to develop, design, and implement scalable and future-proof software solutions.

  • Enhance the company’s internal and client facing web portals.

  • Solve interesting and challenging problems from refactoring to design and testing.

  • Audit, evaluate, and refactor existing legacy code.

  • Participate in a fast-paced agile software development lifecycle.

item.title: Senior Software Developer C++ - Equity Products at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:

The Bloomberg Equity product is used by over 100,000 financial professionals worldwide to make decisions and increase alpha. Our next-generation Equity analytics unlock market data and give our clients unprecedented advantages. Today's Equity product spans a wide gamut of functionality, from fundamentals to estimates, company analysis to peer valuation, idea generation to portfolio construction, and exchange-level tools to macro regional/industrial analysis.

Equity R&D in our New York office is seeking driven and dedicated developers to join our fast-paced team. We develop rich user interfaces as well as powerful backend servers in C++. Developers contribute to all phases of software engineering ranging from requirements through release. Candidates should exhibit strategic thinking, an aggressive drive, and an aptitude for engineering quality software.

item.title: Senior Software Developer - Government Intelligence Team at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
How does government influence finance? What government activities can move financial markets? Which companies benefit from government activities and which are negatively impacted?

The R&D News department is currently working on building brand new products to help financial professionals solve these questions.

The government intelligence team is looking for an enthusiastic, experienced software developer who can start contributing immediately to the success of this exciting new suite of products. A successful candidate should enjoy driving product development by collaborating closely with business stakeholders. The candidate will be tasked to solve a variety of technical problems including ingestion of large unstructured public datasets, discovering actionable data points to alert clients in real time, designing scalable, extensible search and database solutions to aid discoverability and analytics, and designing user interfaces to make sense of confusing government data for the busy financial professionals that make up our target client base.

item.title: Frontend Developer /Visualization Expert at Zalando SE (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
The opportunity


Welcome to Zalando, one of the most exciting places for data science in Europe. At Zalando, love for fashion meets enthusiasm for top-notch data-driven technology. Within six years, we have become Europe’s largest online fashion store and we believe that a deep understanding of customer wishes and fashion trends is key for continuing this success story. To develop and enlarge this understanding, we are building one of the strongest data science teams in the business world. Our current projects include product recommendation, automatic fraud detection, customer segmentation and much more. We harness huge amounts of data from many different sources, create statistical models and develop and apply state-of-the-art algorithms. We are looking for you to join our team – to start immediately, in a permanent role and at our beautiful Berlin location.


What we are looking for



  • You have at least two years of work experience as frontend developer

  • You know JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3/LESS by heart and are able to create interactive prototypes out of thin air

  • You have experience with single page application frameworks like angular, backbone, ember, Meteor or Knockout

  • You are familiar with modern build tools like grunt or gulp

  • You keep up to date with latest developments in web technology

  • Experience with data visualization libraries like D3.js is a plus

  • Our team likes to work hard, but also to nurture a friendly and casual work environment. Joining coffee breaks is highly recommended to get to know your team members and it would also be great if you could help organize team events from time to time

  • It would be great if you want to work fulltime, but if you want only do part time, we will find a solution

  • We don’t need your date of birth or a picture of you in your application


Portfolio


We would like to get to know how you work. Please include an example of a project you are proud of in your application. You can send us a link, screenshots or anything that allows us to get a first idea of your style in a few minutes.


Your responsibilities



  • You will design and implement tools and visualizations that allow users to understand data analyses and interact with them

  • You will collaborate with data scientists, developers and product managers within an agile workflow to produce high quality outcome for challenging tasks

  • You will take responsibility for the whole lifecycle of the visualization projects, from choosing the technical platform, to creating UI designs /mockups and implementing them, right up to presenting results


What you can expect from us



  • A corporate culture where your skills are judged only by your results – our motto: wear sneakers, not ties

  • An international team of colleagues who will both inspire and offer you support

  • Training and further development opportunities to expand your skills and help you on your way

  • Free fruit and drinks, spacious kitchens and areas where you can relax

  • You’ll never get bored, there’s always something going on at Zalando

  • Attractive employee discounts in our online shop

  • Powerful hardware system environment on your desk, in a cluster and in the cloud


About Zalando


Zalando is Europe’s leading online fashion platform, doing business in 15 markets. Delivering first-class shopping experiences to our +15 million customers requires moving fast — with microservices, Agile processes & autonomous teams  —  and using cutting edge, open source technologies. We are passionate about what we do and have fun while doing it. And we are willing to experiment and make mistakes: It’s how we grow.


Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!


If you need guidance or have any questions about our recruiting and hiring processes, please contact recruiter Sameer Shaikh at jobs@zalando.de

item.title: Software Developer - Data and Intelligence at Optiver US LLC (Chicago, IL)
item.description: Our data and intelligence developers create software which drives Optiver's strategic planning. We face a variety of problems with high degrees of difficulty focused primarily on data: processing and storing information coming in at extremely high bandwidth, cleaning and organizing data from vastly disparate sources in a query-able fashion, and building flexible tools which allow employees in every role to make sense of this mountain of information. If you love dealing with massive amounts of data and want to build the software which drives the strategic decisions which have allowed Optiver to be a pillar of the options market for nearly thirty years, we have a spot for you.

item.title: Senior Data Engineer at New Relic (Portland, OR)
item.description:
We are seeking a Senior Software Engineer to help build and maintain the high-performance, high-volume services that receive, process, and store the tidal wave of incoming real-time data from thousands of customers and enables our entire line of products.

Researching storage solutions, developing low-latency fault-tolerant architectures, and implementing state-of-the-art distributed query algorithms is our bread-and-butter. We also dabble in the dark arts of high-throughput data pipelines and streaming data processing.


We’re interested in having a diverse team with a broad set of skills and viewpoints. If this seems like your dream job, but you’re not sure if you qualify, apply anyway!

item.title: Forensisch software engineer big data at Rijksoverheid (The Hague, Netherlands)
item.description:
Forensisch software engineer big data


Nederlands Forensisch Instituut



Functieomschrijving



Ben jij een ervaren Java-ontwikkelaar?



Binnen het Nederlands Forensisch Instituut (NFI) werkt een team gedreven softwareontwikkelaars aan vooruitstrevende forensische software. Je draagt in hoge mate bij aan de doorontwikkeling van het forensisch big data-platform Hansken.



Hansken wordt binnen en buiten het NFI gebruikt voor opsporing en bewijsvoering van ernstige misdrijven als kindermisbruik, moord, grootschalige fraude en andere delicten met grote maatschappelijke impact. Het platform draait op een gedistribueerde omgeving en verwerkt vele terabytes aan data per uur. Het analyseren van deze data kan miljoenen relevante sporen opleveren. Denk aan e-mails, chatberichten, GPS-coördinaten en dergelijke.



Door nieuwe technologische ontwikkelingen blijft het een uitdaging om steeds nieuwe typen forensische sporen doorzoekbaar te maken of slimme analyses toe te voegen, zoals entiteitextractie voor herkenning van kentekens, IBAN-nummers of adressen. Naast het dienen van een belangrijk maatschappelijk belang is Hansken ook een technisch zeer uitdagend project waar je telkens met nieuwe technieken in aanraking komt. Bij dit R&D-project wordt gewerkt volgens een agile ontwikkelproces, met moderne ontwikkeltools die goed op elkaar aansluiten.



Als forensisch software engineer big data ontwikkel je samen met een team van ongeveer 8 collega’s het platform Hansken verder om onder meer de performance, schaalbaarheid en functionaliteit te verbeteren. Aan het systeem worden hoge eisen aan de kwaliteit en betrouwbaarheid gesteld. Daarom ben je kritisch over het functioneren ervan, durf je vragen te stellen en sta je open voor feedback. Naast je werk aan het systeem denk je mee over het continu verbeteren van het ontwikkelproces, waarbij de forensische kennis zo goed mogelijk geborgd wordt.

item.title: Senior tester forensische big data at Rijksoverheid (The Hague, Netherlands)
item.description:
Senior tester forensische big data


Nederlands Forensisch Instituut



Functieomschrijving



Ben jij een ervaren tester met kennis van big dataoplossingen?



Je bewaakt bij de groep Software Engineering van het Nederlands Forensisch Instituut (NFI) de kwaliteit van het forensisch big data platform Hansken. Hiervoor ontwikkel je testen en voert ze uit.



Hansken wordt binnen en buiten het NFI gebruikt voor opsporing en bewijsvoering van ernstige misdrijven als kindermisbruik, moord, grootschalige fraude en andere delicten met grote maatschappelijke impact. Het platform draait op een gedistribueerde omgeving en verwerkt vele terabytes aan data per uur. Het analyseren van deze data kan miljoenen relevante sporen opleveren. Denk aan e-mails, chatberichten, GPS-coördinaten en dergelijke.



Door nieuwe technologische ontwikkelingen blijft het een uitdaging om steeds nieuwe typen forensische sporen doorzoekbaar te maken of slimme analyses toe te voegen, zoals entiteitextractie voor herkenning van kentekens, IBAN-nummers of adressen. Als senior tester forensische big data geef jij invulling aan al het benodigde testwerk, waarbij je de functionaliteit van Hansken en de forensische integriteit van de resultaten waarborgt.



Bij Hansken wordt gewerkt volgens een agile ontwikkelproces, met moderne ontwikkeltools die goed op elkaar aansluiten. Hierbij geef jij op testgebied concrete invulling aan de sprintplanning. Je denkt daarbij fundamenteel na over het testen van deze complexe software en volgt de nieuwste ontwikkelingen op testgebied. Je zoekt de ontwikkelaars op om in een vroeg stadium testplannen te ontwikkelen en verwerkt deze tot uitvoerbare tests. Daarnaast zet jij het proces op voor het uitvoeren van acceptatietests, coördineer je de testactiviteiten en voert deze ook zelf uit. Je rapporteert de testresultaten aan het team en benadrukt pijnpunten.



Om Hansken continu te kunnen blijven verbeteren, zorg jij er met de ontwikkelaars voor dat testplannen worden omgezet in geautomatiseerde tests. Voor het geautomatiseerd testen van onze applicaties gebruiken wij op dit moment het test framework JBehave in combinatie met de Selenium web driver. Deze tests maken onderdeel uit van een continuous delivery proces, waarbij we vanuit onze issue tracker met 1 druk op de knop Hansken kunnen bouwen, testen en uitrollen.

item.title: Web Developer - Full Stack at HERE a Nokia Company (Berkeley, CA)
item.description:
Senior Web Developer/Tools Engineer



HERE Reality Lens Introduction:


Nokia HERE is a global leader in the mapping and location intelligence business. HERE Reality Lens utilizes advanced reality capture technologies to collect, process, and publish petabytes of street-level, aerial, and indoor spatial data to customers in over 72 countries around the world. These software and data services, the sixth largest on AWS, allow users to visualize high-resolution 3D panoramic and oblique imagery while interactively measuring, mapping, and modeling.


We use a lightweight agile process aimed at customer-driven milestones and give our engineers freedom in how they approach technical challenges. Engineering teams are supported with a highly automated continuous integration and deployment infrastructure.


Senior Web Developer / Tools Engineer:


As Senior Web Developer / Tools Engineer, you would help Reality Lens execute on our product vision, create great products, and make a great working environment. Your day will consist of tasks like researching, designing, implementing, and testing software. You should be a quick learner and communicate well. You're a team player who loves to both code and mentor others.


Ideal candidates will have developed and delivered scalable, robust API-driven services and data pipelines.



Responsibilities:



  • Create Canvas/WebGL and DOM-based solutions integrating 2D maps, 3D imagery and point clouds (aka “Smart Cities”).

  • Design and implement web-based tools for managing live operations and other shared platform services using a Node.js technology stack.

  • Integrate software with HERE platforms, processes, pipelines, and products.

  • Choose and implement analysis and design patterns and algorithms that enable systems or features to meet business and technical requirements.

  • Design data models for SQL and NoSQL databases and caches. (MySQL, MongoDB, Redis).

item.title: Senior Developer / Manager with Java and SQL for Telco Big Data Pioneer at mCentric (Las Rozas, Spain) (allows remote)
item.description:
Senior Developer / Manager with Java and SQL for Telco Big Data Pioneer


We are looking for a Senior Developer ready to confidently apply a solid technical and managerial skillset to create new or upgrade current solutions, proposing and defending innovations.


You will be using your experience as a Senior Developer to create and upgrade solutions which interact with the mobile telecommunications core network, familiarising yourself with a multitude of mobile telecommunications protocols, standards and infrastructure variations of those standards. mCentric solutions range from Data Plan Management, xDR Navigation, SIM Registration, Voucher Services, and other basic mobile network solutions which in turn are feeding its data into a dynamic and intelligent promotions platform allowing for precise Microsegmentation applied to intelligent and interactive promotions and reporting. Our solutions are responsible for dealing with billions of events processed per day, millions of concurrent user sessions, and are expected to deliver results in real time. To handle the demand, several of the solutions are built over a Big Data structure. In fact, mCentric solutions are running over the first BDA installed in Africa.

item.title: Software Engineer - Cloud Services at Vena Solutions Inc. (Toronto, ON, Canada)
item.description:
Our engineering culture is incredibly important to us.  We write great software, care deeply about code quality, and expect the people who join us to do the same. We're looking for innovative and detail-oriented engineers to help us create one of the most sophisticated SaaS cloud platforms in Canada.  


Engineering Responsibilities



  • Think in terms of 10x improvements

  • Write clean and elegant code

  • Create robust, speedy production components and develop prototypes quickly

  • Refactor, simplify and optimize code

  • Collaborate with the team on features, design and implementation and work cohesively to find solutions

  • Contribute to building our environment, which embraces continuous integration through the use of automated testing

  • Champion the latest software technologies while developing innovative functionality to improve software performance and usability

  • Tell us what we need to be doing rather than expect to be told what to do

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Appian Corporation (Reston, VA)
item.description:
As a Senior Software Engineer working on the Appian platform, your mission will be to ensure Appian is always fast, scalable and up to whatever tasks our customers configure it to do. You will be solving problems of scale and flexibility that most engineers never see, building a product capable of serving our customers in ways you never imagined. Your scope extends from the high-performance data layer to the cross-platform user interface. This position requires the mental agility to jump from the deep code-level view of Appian, to the designer’s view, to the end user’s view, and back again. Learn how to write software that runs software, and enhance Appian's cross-platform functional programming language.

You will design and develop systems that let our customers build amazing enterprise apps for mobile and the web without writing a line of code. The design decisions and judgement calls you make will impact millions of Appian users worldwide. You will be looked upon as an expert and advocate to fellow engineers on making design and reliability trade-offs in running large-scale services and engineering complex systems that fail gracefully and transparently to users.

As a successful candidate for this role you will have strong analytical and troubleshooting skills, fluency in coding and systems design, solid communication skills and a desire to tackle the complex problems of software design and delivery which are uniquely Appian’s.

item.title: Senior Backend Engineer at Triggr Health (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
You’ll be responsible for defining, building, and supporting a platform that reaches people when they are most at-risk and empowers them through the extraordinarily challenging recovery journey. It is an incredibly exciting role as you will be working with cutting edge technology on a number of products that span: consumer and enterprise, mobile and desktop, external and internal, user-driven and automated, and practical and academic areas. The challenges you will face are new and exciting and will require you to think holistically about how the platform interacts with an incredibly diverse set of stakeholders.


More specifically, we are building apps on both Android and iOS, a customer-facing web application, a robust web services API, machine learning-driven analytics, and large-scale data processing. Although you will be focused on the back end system, you must be hyper-focused on how the product impacts every patient, provider, and team member. You will need to understand when trade-offs are necessary as we are growing very quickly but quality is of critical importance given our mission. You will be crucial to designing and implementing a scalable system from schema through software through operational tools. You will continuously iterate on our products in order to improve the long term outcomes of the patients in our program. You will also be integral to forming and developing our engineering culture in addition to helping hire all-star teammates to make Triggr Health an awesome place to work! Most importantly, you must have a strong desire to be a part of a mission-driven company and believe that with the right team, technology, and values, anything is possible.



This position requires someone who understands and embraces the fact that the “user” is a real person with a severe health condition. The work we are doing is incredibly exciting because the impact we can have is massive, but it also requires extra care and increased responsibility to ensure every decision we make reflects this understanding.

item.title: Senior Machine Learning Scientist, Personalization at Booking.com (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Would you like to translate terabytes of data into unforgettable holidays for millions of people around the globe? Booking.com, the world’s largest accommodation booking website, is looking for rock star Data Scientists to add to join our highly successful Personalization Team within the Front End department.


This team crunches endless amounts of data to provide our customers with the best possible experience. They focus on anything from understanding and predicting market data, to ranking all properties on our website, and providing our customers with the most relevant personalized recommendations.


B.responsible



  • Work in a multi-disciplined team where you’ll take full ownership of turning discoveries and ideas into machine learning models. You’ll use the model’s output to create and improve products for our customers, preferably in short development cycles

  • Research on how to improve customers’ experience, by using our vast amount of data

  • Actively contribute to taking data science at Booking.com to the next level

item.title: Back End Engineer at Skyscanner (Miami, FL)
item.description:
Skyscanner obtains data from multiple web scrapers, API feeds and external data sources to power its front end website, mobile applications and B2B partners. You will work in an energetic and intelligent team of developers to expand our world-class coverage of flight data and prices.


Our Backend Engineers are the backbone of our business. They build the engines that power Skyscanner and platforms that can cope with the millions of user visits every day.


As the primary technical point of contact for an important part of our system, the Partner Engineering team pride themselves on understanding and successfully delivering the business requirements of all departments.


What are some of the core responsibilities?



  • Ensuring that flight prices in Skyscanner products are accurate and up-to-date.

  • Creating seamless redirects to third party websites.

  • Assisting with the maintenance of existing scrapers and data sources

  • Increasing our global coverage of flight and price data, with focus on your local area.

  • Liaising with 3rd parties (travel agents and airlines) over new integrations and maintenance.

  • Working with test team to validate the quality of solutions.

  • Updating existing integrations to expose new data and support new product features.

item.title: Sr. DevOps Engineer - User Data at Twilio (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Twilio operates a cloud communications service that is distributed with points of presence throughout the globe at a scale of thousands of servers. Because we are mission critical infrastructure for our customers, operational excellence is a key objective and that’s where DevOps comes in as a core competency.


About the job:

Twilio engineers own and run their products and services from conception to continuous operation. DevOps engineers play a key role and are embedded within teams to focus on the operational aspects of our services. 

Responsibilities:

Twilio's User Data engineers develop services to implement RESTful data services, MySQL & DynamoDB databases and power ETL through Kinesis-powered data pipelines. Some operational concerns are availability, throughput, latency as well as data consistency guarantees. Our DevOps engineers are focused on 24x7 availability, performance and manageability concerns of these services. 

You will collaborate with Architects and Engineering leaders to define and develop operational features, tools and processes including:



  • Tools and processes for configuration management of large numbers of databases and services. This includes participating in technology selection and architecture review to ensure zero downtime releases and maintenance as well as enable auto-scaling. 

  • Instrumentation for monitoring the health and availability of services including fault detection, alerting, triage and recovery (automated and manual).

  • Performance management, including benchmarking and monitoring of vital metrics, capacity planning, and resolution of performance problems affecting service levels. 

  • Custom diagnostic and troubleshooting tools. 

  • Developer facing support tools made available via our developer portal and to our customer support organization.

item.title: Senior Full Stack Software Engineer, Measure at Quantcast (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Quantcast seeks software engineering generalists that will work up and down the entire technology stack to build new features and products to drive the continued success of our Measure and Advertise businesses.

At Quantcast, these full-stack polyglots work in all aspects of agile application development, from DB schema design through Java business logic to advanced Javascript on the frontend. They also work with QC-specific, and other industry-leading, big data technologies (e.g. Hadoop, QFS) – our products are driven by data after all and we process an average of 30PB every single day!

The right applicant will thrive in an environment where independent decision-making based on product requirements is the norm. Individuals in this role will want to work on our many open-ended problems and will have an opinion when it comes to selecting the right tool/technology for the job (and the ability to explain why!).

As a Full Stack Software Engineer at Quantcast, you will have a major impact on how the world perceives and interacts with our products. We hope that you’ll bring your passion for application development to help us build truly world-class technology and products!

Example full-stack projects:

Advertising Reporting Infrastructure
Creating our client facing reporting infrastructure to provide campaign performance and analysis to internal and external clients

Online Measurement
Building new features for Quantcast Measure that will be viewed and used across the entire Web ecosystem

Mobile
Brand new mobile projects that range from prototyping to designing data schemas for both Android and iOS applications

Scaling Tools
Developing toolsets that support a number of core business operations at Quantcast

Brand Infrastructure
Building front end, data pipeline and server infrastructure to drive Quantcast targeting products for publishers

item.title: Trading Solutions - Enterprise Messaging Software Developer (C#/Java/C++) at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:

The Enterprise Connectivity and Integration team is looking for skilled developers to work on its message processing workflow engine and delivery platform. The system balances numerous requirements while merging ETL design, real-time processing, systems programming, web delivery and human computer interaction for graph-based message transformation.
The team is building new functionality and features as we extend our capability with a generic messaging framework that includes routing and processing heavy traffic loads across an array of circumstances. Developers can expect to contribute immediately and will be working on:
-High performance distributed system to support asynchronous workflows, faster fault-recovery.
-Parallel data processing, message enrichment, data transformation and delivery mechanisms all within a high throughput, low latency, secure server environment.
-Open source technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, Storm and more.
-Streamlined user interface.

item.title: Software Architect - 803 at Cambridge Consultants (Cambridge, UK)
item.description:
Have you delivered Software as a Service that truly scaled and experienced first-hand the challenges of rolling out new services? Would you like to do it again, working with “Big Data” and the “Internet of Things” to shape a new initiative within a true world class leader?


Cambridge Consultants is a fantastic place to work and is home to some of the most talented engineers and scientists active in connected devices and data analytics across a wide range of sectors.


Main purpose of the job


To be the lead software and technical architect for cloud based platforms that connect devices and deliver digital services, with particular focus on secure and scalable systems that deliver flexible Software as a Service business models.


Work within multi-disciplinary teams of highly talented people from around the globe that drive changes in technology to deliver novel solutions to the everyday needs of individuals and corporations alike.


About Digital Services


Digital Services is an exciting area within Cambridge Consultants; one that builds on the extensive range of work by the company in connected devices, data analytics and integrated systems across many sectors and with clients from around the world. Working closely with other groups in Cambridge Consultants we seek to deliver exciting new services in medical, consumer and industrial sectors as well as to drive forward the servitization of the company’s own IP.


We combine excellent technical and commercial skills with robust service design and evaluation methods and a broad base of industry experience to form a powerful development team. Our work ranges from undertaking complete service platform development and operations from concept, pilots and commercial launch, through to providing consulting services for our clients on their technology, product offering and future strategy.


Specific responsibilities


Develop solutions for connected devices where scalable, flexible and secure software platforms, service availability and security of personal data are vital.


Technically guide multi-disciplinary project teams of Engineers, Consultants and Designers to realise your design.


To liaise with clients to understand their technical needs and use your strong technical expertise to prepare proposals which capture and structure these requirements clearly.


Apply your knowledge of the state-of-the-art software tools and techniques to ensure standards-compliant design that takes advantage of the latest thinking in database systems, open innovation and federated identity management.


Use your development experience to drive a robust and agile approach to software development, testing, documentation and deployment of live commercial services.

item.title: Tradebook Low-Latency And Algorithmic Trading - Senior C++ Developer at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:

Bloomberg Tradebook is a leading agency broker, a US ECN, and a technology provider ofcross-asset electronic trading platform, supporting Equities/Futures/Options/FX trading.

Tradebook is building the next generation, ultra-low latency trading platform, which supports multi asset trading, exchange routing and order matching. With high capacity and sub-microsecond latency, the new system will be the foundation for Tradebook's future and propel it into more markets and grab new opportunities.

Our focus is on developing low latency & real-time black box trading systems, algorithmic trading systems, providing connectivity/FIX solutions and providing direct market connectivity solutions.

R&D Tradebook is looking for a motivated and talented C++ developer to join this effort. You will be working a small group of technologists passionate about pushing the boundaries of technology and delivering innovative product solutions. The role involves implementing a high performance technology stack from ground up, designing efficient data structures and services for business functionality, and building a highly available system with throughput of millions of messages per second. Candidates should exhibit an aggressive drive, bias towards action, and a proven aptitude for engineering quality software solutions.

This candidate will also work closely with Sales, Products and Trading Desk from idea generation to implementing and delivering cutting-edge technologies and trading solutions to the market.

Tradebook is seeking developers with project experience in creating systems for:
- Algorithmic Trading
- Black Box Trading
- Market Making
- Risk Management
- Quantitative Analysis
- Event Based Trading
- Solutions for Hedge Funds
- Solutions for Proprietary Trading firms (Prop shops)
- High frequency trading applications
- Low latency trading applications

item.title: JS Engineer, London office based at Monetate, Ltd. (London, UK)
item.description:
We're actively searching for Javascript Engineers to join our growing technical team in London office.This is a full time, permanent position, based in our London office. You will work with Monetate's delivery team side by side to use Javascript to build experiences for on page experiments for our many significant E-commerce clients. Your content will run on high-traffic web pages and test marketers ideas in real time.

We're looking for self-starters with a deep understanding of data structures and algorithms to tackle tough new challenges and to contribute to the growth of our business and our customers' success. Individual contributions are acknowledged during weekly company meetings and recognized throughout the company. If you're a problem-solver who is passionate about rich web applications, scaling Internet applications to billions of page views, and working with big data, then you're a perfect fit for our close-knit and agile team.



We offer full package of benefits, flexible hours, free lunches and monthly socials with the whole team.


Apply today!  


Please note: this is a London, UK office based position- local applicants only.

item.title: Windows Client C++/C# Software Engineer at eFolder (Littleton, CO)
item.description: We are looking for a strong candidate with experience and deep knowledge of windows system development. The right candidate would have a vast level of knowledge and experience working in C++/C# building Windows services in a multi-threaded and safe manner. The candidate should be able to demonstrate a confident ability to not "code by coincidence". They should be comfortable with basic unit testing concepts and be able to program in a OOP paradigm. A strong understanding of design patterns, data structures, and systems architecture is a must.

item.title: Java Developers transforming data into elegant solutions at Landmark Information Group (Exeter, UK)
item.description:
Landmark Solutions developers work on a range of projects, typically for government or public body customers.  Our speciality is transforming data into elegant solutions that deliver insight and value.  We do this mainly by implementing authenticated web services that consume, retrieve, query and modify structured data.  We implement syntactic and semantic validation and business logic and persist the data to relational, data-warehouse and object stores.  Many projects also contain web site user-interfaces.  Our core technology is Java 8 and we utilise many web modern frameworks including Spring 4, Hibernate 4, Google Guice, JDBI, Dropwizard, Jersey and JAX/RS.  We apply an agile development process where possible, centred around Jira, using Bitbucket, git, feature-branches and peer-reviews where possible.



You will be part of a vibrant and ambitious team who are making a real difference to our business by designing and delivering first class software in an environment of dynamic and outcome focused delivery. Our objectives are technically challenging and we deliver products which generate a key part of the business’ revenue. Are you looking for a challenge that will push your boundaries in terms of your personal development, and help contribute to business success through developing innovative solutions for our customers? If so, we’d love to hear from you.


Our developers have an important voice in how our solutions are constructed, so an open and collaborative approach to change is essential. Our teams have great opportunities for personal development and therefore the role would benefit a self-motivated learner.

item.title: Rails Developer at Connexity (Camarillo, CA)
item.description:
Connexity is looking for a talented, highly motivated Rails Web Developer / Software Engineer.  The candidate will be responsible for both minor and major functional enhancements to our UI.  Used by outside customers, our internal business team, and our developer team, the UI is our fastest and cleanest view into highly complex, multidimensional data.  As a core member of our UI team, the candidate will be the cornerstone of making our rich data accessible and visible, and by doing so will provide other groups in the company with the insights necessary to grow revenue.  With close to 200,000 streamed transactions per second and database tables with over a billion rows, we need a creative problem solver to provide windows of insight into our data.
 
We are not a LAMP stack shop, but rather a NoSQL, Big Data, Real-Time stream processing shop. Our architecture is unique and our software stack purposefully diverse. We are searching for an engineer that likes a challenge, wants an opportunity to work with cutting edge technologies, and thrives in small teams. We are looking for a developer that wants to "own" key aspects of the client interface and take pride in its evolution. Your contributions will be immediate and will be felt through out the company. Connexity is fun, fast-paced, and open-ended with a strong entrepreneurial spirit and with emphasis on being innovative.

We also provide ample opportunity for our engineers to grow their skillset beyond web development, offering a chance to design around several NoSQL platforms including Hadoop.

YOU WILL BE ACCOUNTABLE FOR



  • Building Ruby/Rails interfaces that make it easy to understand and control complex, multi-dimensional data

  • Creatively leveraging AJAX to pull from Redis and Hbase in order to provide real-time views of large datasets

  • Identifying reports that can be offloaded to helper applications for faster rendering

  • Helping with the schema design for NoSQL databases

  • Optimizing ORM queries to maintain good performance across large datasets

item.title: Integration Architect - Bloomberg Law at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:

Bloomberg Law continues to expand its presence in the area of legal research by providing high-quality and innovative legal research solutions. The company is committed to bringing innovative changes in the industry to the way lawyers conduct research, keep abreast of current developments, serve their clients and attract new clients. Through BloombergLaw.com, we offer integration of legal research, news, collaboration tools and market information that is unmatched in the industry. Bloomberg Law is a unique opportunity to work for a start-up team and business unit but all the benefits of working within a large, successful and well-established company.

The R&D Bloomberg Law Integrated Solutions team is seeking a self-motivated senior software developer/architect with an interest in designing solutions for complex data problems and implementing scalable architectures to support the legal research platform. In this senior role, you will work with cross-application teams to identify cross-cutting problems and develop robust solutions toward enhancing the product and building scalable applications. The candidate must exhibit excellent problem-solving, architectural and programming skills with passion for solving large-scale data problems, quickly learning emerging technologies. The candidate should also demonstrate the ability to deliver large projects independently, while positively collaborating with different teams.

item.title: Data Engineer at Essence (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Company:

Essence is a global digital agency and the world’s largest independent buyer of digital media. We blend data science, objective media and captivating experiences to build valuable connections between brands and consumers. Clients include Google, HP, Method, and Barclays. The agency is more than 480 people strong, manages over $700MM in media spend and deploys campaigns in 71 markets via offices in London, New York, San Francisco, Seattle, Singapore and Tokyo. Visit essencedigital.com for more information, and follow us on Twitter at @essencedigital.

The Role:

We are looking for a Data Developer who can write clean well designed Python and PL/SQL in a timely and scalable way. You must have strong experience building and optimizing ETL processes in a heterogeneous environment (Oracle 11g, PostgresSQL).


We’d like you to:




  • Troubleshoot, test and maintain large-scale data warehousing systems and ETL processes to ensure strong optimization and functionality

  • Develop new features and tools as needed

item.title: Web Application Developer - modern front-end / finance+trading at Extremely Heavy Industries (Greenwich, CT) (allows remote)
item.description:
Extremely Heavy Industries is searching for an experienced front-end software developer to help build sophisticated, data-rich web and mobile applications using modern web/Javascript frameworks and data visualization libraries.


We create highly polished web apps for private financial clients. We specialize in tools to track and visualize portfolio performance, risk, and trading activity across a wide range of asset classes, countries, and strategies.


This posting includes an extended onsite engagement with one of our clients - a major hedge fund based in Greenwich, CT. This will involve direct collaboration with high-level developers and trading desks to build out an internal UI framework and collection of apps for research and analysis across the firm. Regular (often daily) onsite presence for this project is essential.


-------------------------------------


Location: Greenwich, CT + ongoing options for NYC/Westchester County/remote.


Job Type: Both salaried and independent contractor arrangements can be considered.


Compensation: Highly competitive, commensurate with experience.

item.title: Data Processing Engineer at Criteo (Paris, France)
item.description:
Your Mission:


Build the appropriate infrastructure to store more than tens of TB of additional data every day, and offer both batch and nearline processing capabilities, at a rate of 300,000 messages per second per datacenter, across six datacenters.


Fully automate the administration of thousands of servers with a fully open source approach using Chef.


Datacenter as a computer: efficient usage of all hardware with a common storage and computation platform using Yarn / Mesos.


High stakes, high rewards: 1% increase in performance may yield millions for the company.


Develop open source projects. Because we are working at the forefront of technology, we are dealing with problems that few have faced. We’re big users of open source, and we’d like to give back to the community.

item.title: Senior Software Developer - JavaScript at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:

We are looking for experienced JavaScript developers to join Bloomberg's Execution Management System (EMS) team. You will be a part of a team building the next-generation of world's most popular EMS, which connects traders from around the globe to the most far reaching broker community. Our system provides class leading data visualizations, trading tools, and user interfaces to allow traders to focus on execution quality and market moving events. You'll have the chance to re-imagine, develop, and deploy a product that is relied upon by thousands of traders every single day.

item.title: Database Engineer - PostgreSQL at Amplify Technologies (Atlanta, GA)
item.description:
Amplify are looking for an experienced Database Engineer to ensure the data integrity of our rapidly evolving, open-source, Web-based marketing product.


Our ideal candidate is skilled in logical and physical database design for web-based transactional environments, the creation of SQL and stored procedures and expert in data quality and data cleansing processes.


This role will collaborate directly with the product manager and development team to identify and understand source data systems, as well as provide input for enhancements for standardization and consistency across the application. This position presents an opportunity to test and shape your professional potential - you’ll have significant impact on the products you develop and influence on the direction of the company. At Amplify your technical ability and creativity will be allowed to shine.


Our company culture is entrepreneurial and practical; our working style agile and collaborative. It’s an environment that demands a personality that can take initiative and lead and rewards a good team player. If you’re not afraid to roll up your sleeves and get your hands dirty you’ll fit right in. Code Divas need not apply.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Datto Inc (Boston, MA)
item.description: Overview: Datto is seeking an experienced software engineer with strong leadership and mentoring skills who desires “hands on” development as an ongoing part of their role. The role requires an engineer well-grounded in software-engineering fundamentals, experienced in Agile development, and able to make practical business tradeoffs to deliver maintainable, well-constructed and crazy-useful software for our end-users. About the Company: We are the fastest growing technology company in Connecticut, with an established development office in Boston (formerly Backupify). We specialize in backup and disaster recovery solutions, and we are the leader in our space. Our offerings include backups of cloud applications and this role is focused on continued development of those cloud-to-cloud backup products. Datto is trusted by thousands of organizations and millions of end-users to securely and reliably backup their business data. With over 100 petabytes of data under management and a fast-growing customer base, we continually challenge ourselves and our architecture to reach new levels of scalability. With our agile methodologies, small-team organization, fast-paced development and innovation-focused values we offer the benefits of a startup culture within a profitable company of 400+ employees. About the Role: Day to day work includes coding from the position of team lead, participating and leading design and code reviews, and actively mentoring more junior team members in both software-design and implementation. You’ll participate in architectural direction and have the opportunity to own and lead the design and implementation of new features and improvements. We’re continually re-evaluating our architectural needs, so an experienced engineer is needed to help make informed decisions about new technologies that can scale and how to transition legacy systems.

item.title: Data Warehouse and Database Architects at MillimanMAX (Cambridge, MA)
item.description: We are currently looking for Database Architects and Data Warehouse All Stars. You will be responsible for helping us build from the ground up and a unique opportunity that will allow end to end development and autonomy. The Predictive Analytics Practice at Milliman is an aggressive startup operation within the larger Milliman business and is using the latest tools and technologies in big data, cloud operations, predictive analytics, BI, and scientific visualization. We are looking for highly motivated, startup loving people who want to be involved in building for the future with a bunch of like minded team members. If you enjoy a fast paced and fun environment with the occasional beer thrown in we can help you out!

item.title: Senior Software Developer - Enterprise Evaluated Pricing at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:

Data License (DL) is Bloomberg's market-leading enterprise reference data product. We build and maintain high-performance systems that process & deliver billions of data points per day. Our customers are key financial players that use our products to power their trading applications, settlement, risk management, corporate action processing, and much more. As a result, they require our system to be ultra-reliable and our data to be of the highest quality. Our product lines offer a variety of programmatic interfaces to a wide range of information on nearly all types of financial instruments including fixed income, CDS, currencies, equities, and futures & options. We interact closely with our business and sales teams and have many opportunities to design and develop innovative solutions to satisfy customer demands.

The Bloomberg Valuations (BVAL) product calculates pricing for over 2 million liquid and illiquid fixed income securities at several snapshots throughout the day. DL delivers this premium evaluated pricing data with related regulatory information to enterprise customers in order to meet requirements such as Net Asset Valuation calculations. We build solutions which calculate, validate, QC and deliver millions of data points in very short amount of time to fulfill client needs throughout the day. This rapidly growing product requires a highly efficient, scalable, and fault-tolerant architecture. To address the scalability needs of this product, we are working on a proof of concept using Hadoop. We are looking to dramatically increase our regulatory statistical offering by adding a suite of new products. These new offerings will allow our clients to evaluate their portfolio risks and help them meet the many new regulatory requirements that have been introduced and are currently being legislated.

In order to help us continue expanding our market share & reach, we are looking for a software developer to help us design and implement flexible, usable, and performant systems. We need a candidate who is detail oriented, has strong communication & problem solving skills, and has the desire to work in a close-knit team environment. Our work atmosphere is fast paced, spirited, and friendly. You will have the opportunity to work with a wide variety of different technologies - C++, Python, Perl, Java, Javascript, Hadoop - whatever it takes to get the job done.

item.title: Sr. JavaScript Framework Developer - JS/UI at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:

This is a key position in our UI Infrastructure Core Tech team responsible for driving next-gen Bloomberg development platforms enterprise-wide.

In this role you will be a key member of the team developing the JavaScript platform that provides the building blocks, framework, and infrastructure used by the firm's 3000+ R&D employees to build high-quality, high-performance applications used both internally and externally. The successful candidate will have experience implementing performant JavaScript applications with an emphasis on optimization, API design, and architecture. This is an opportunity to directly affect the daily lives of internal developers using a modern stack of JavaScript technologies to enable highly interactive desktop applications. Emphasis will be placed on developing well-tested and structured code, and the ability to work in a highly collaborative and fast moving environment.

item.title: Senior MAPS Developer at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description: Bloomberg is looking for a senior developer with experience in Web Mapping to play a leading role in the design and implementation of a Web Mapping and Spatial Analytics product. We are looking to combine financial analytics & numerical analysis with Web Mapping to create a unique product.

item.title: Algorithmic Software Engineer (junior/senior) (Berlin, Dublin) at Zalando SE (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
THE OPPORTUNITY



As a Zalando Algorithms Software Engineer, you will design and build the personalization, recommendation and optimization engines driving customer experiences enjoyed by millions of people. Whether junior- or senior-level, you will have the freedom to challenge our status-quo and help us define best practices for how we work. And you will be able to launch your own open source projects, contribute to others’ projects, build internal community around your interests, and strengthen your personal brand - while receiving meaningful support at every step.



WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR  



  • A degree in mathematics, physics, statistics or computer science

  • At least one year of professional experience programming in Java, Scala, or Python

  • Solid knowledge of algorithms and data structures

  • Strong analytical and critical thinking skills and a demonstrated ability to find creative solutions to technical algorithmic problems

  • Enthusiasm for microservices architectures, distributed systems and RESTful APIs

  • Knowledge of current trends in software design, architecture and web services

  • English language fluency


Additional preferred skills



  • Knowledge of applied machine learning / data mining techniques

  • Knowledge of graph theory, combinatorics and optimization methods

  • Experience with building and / or running large-scale applications

  • Experience with building applications using large data sets

  • Knowledge of R or other machine learning tools (Mahout, Spark, etc.)



YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Research, design and implement algorithms to improve our recommendation, personalization and optimization engines

  • Write code that your peers praise for its elegance and readability

  • Communicate effectively with our engineering, data science and algorithmic research teams and use agile processes

  • Be accountable for all aspects of your work, from research and analysis to testing and deployment



WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM US



  • One-month mentoring program

  • Internal tech talks, skills-building courses and technical “People Leads” who help you achieve mastery

  • Personal branding support: From preparing tech talks and blog posts to networking with industry leaders

  • Community: hack week’s, movie nights, coder dojos, +70 self-organized tech guilds and more

  • Competitive salary

  • Zalando shopping discount and commute discount

  • Relocation assistance for internationals



ABOUT ZALANDO


Zalando is Europe’s leading online fashion platform, doing business in 15 markets. Delivering first-class shopping experiences to our +15 million customers requires moving fast — with microservices, Agile processes and autonomous teams  —  and using cutting-edge, open source technologies. We are passionate about what we do and have fun while doing it. And we are willing to experiment and make mistakes: It’s how we grow.



WANT TO JOIN US? THEN GO AHEAD AND APPLY!


If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring processes, please contact recruiter Elena Ognyanova at jobs@zalando.de.

item.title: Full Stack Java Web Developer at iSeeCars.com (Woburn, MA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Join our development team to create a smarter car search engine using big data to help customers find the best car deals around!  iSeeCars is founded by former TripAdvisor and SAP'ers, and we're growing at a tremendous speed.


Crunch through a large volume of data in the Cloud using Hadoop/EMR and make it accessible to millions of users in a friendly and innovative way. Build features that work seamlessly on desktop, mobile web and mobile app. You will work on all areas of the application and touch a wide range of technologies such as jQuery, bootstrap, Java, Hibernate, MySQL, Tomcat , Solr, Hadoop and much more. You will also have the opportunity to play a key role in bringing our rich feature set to an android application.


You’re an awesome full stack Java web developer who is passionate about working on all layers in the stack, everything from the Front End to the Back End. You like working on end user facing websites, mobile websites and the android platform.


You will be spending at least 80% of time in hands-on coding. If you are someone who likes to create a compelling user experience on web and mobile, and wants to work in a fast paced exciting startup trying to make a difference, then this is an ideal job for you.


**Will consider candidates within the US and Canada.

item.title: Full Stack Software Engineer at Syntactx (New York, NY)

Syntactx is seeking a Senior Full Stack Developer in New York City. The individual will be responsible for some or all of the following:

  • Full stack development from back-end modeling to front-end UI design elements.

  • Scoping and estimating projects, assisting with technical documentation and troubleshooting of complex problems.

  • Communicating with management and other departments, reporting of status and risks, and working effectively with internal and external partners.

item.title: Creative developer (frontend, personalization, profit) at Scarab Research (Budapest, Hungary)
item.description:
We need your help in putting a friendly face on our stone-cold machine learning technologies!


Join us in designing and building the next generation of personalized user interfaces. Innovate on how we present personalized content to end-users and how clients interact with a complex machine learning system.


Why Scarab Research?


Scarab is part of the fresh and upcoming technology startup scene and community of Budapest. We can offer you the ideal combination: a startup with traction and a stable financial background.


High impact, high growth – our recommendations reach millions of visitors every day. Our user-base is expanding rapidly internationally.


Great team – work with a small, cross-functional team of highly skilled engineers (ex-Google, ex-Toshiba R&D).


Lean startup – we apply agile principles both in business and in software development.

item.title: Sr Python Developer at EchoStar (Superior, CO)

Dishanywhere, a division of EchoStar Technologies, has an opening for a Sr Python Developer in Superior, CO to maintain, develop and enhance a wide variety of python backend datastore, middleware, and UI throughout the entire SDLC.

item.title: Research Engineer at Ditto Technologies (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
You...



  • Love building cutting-edge technology
