  • Describe yourself as a self-starter, proactive, positive, creative, and flexible

item.title: Software Engineer at Logentries (Dublin, Ireland)
item.description:
We are looking for talented Software Engineers with a deep interest in the analysis of data, highly scalable systems, cloud computing and open source technologies. Ideally you will have some experience with the following technologies or similar : Java, Javascript, PostgreSQL, Cassandra, Python, AWS. As much as the previous is key, a strong mind and work ethic are the most important factors. At Logentries we value intellectual curiosity, a passion for technology, initiative, and a good sense of humor.


Logentries requires a Software Engineer to work on their core platform and satellite projects in Dublin, Ireland. We will provide you with a world-class mentoring program where you will learn from a team of seriously talented software developers. You might not have a Java or Javascript background, but if you’re a disciplined software engineer who is excited to learn and use new technologies and methods then Logentries Software Engineer role is for you.

  • Follow the team’s agile practices to create world-class software





  • Interact with other engineering teams including Product, Support and Architecture

  • Collaborate with other sprinters to plan, deliver and report on your sprint

item.title: Software Engineer - Build To Scale at Reveal Mobile (Raleigh, NC)
item.description:
Reveal Mobile builds cutting-edge mobile analytics products, and we need talented engineers who thrive in a fast-paced startup environment. New hires work alongside our top-notch engineers and product team to design, implement, and deliver our highly ambitious products. We don’t hire using a checklist (5 years of that, 3 years of this, etc.). It’s all about your passion and dedication to the craft of software. 


Your Responsibilities:



  • Build innovative, scalable application systems. Scalable is the keyword in that sentence. Our product touches millions of mobile devices every month.

  • Write maintainable code, working in a professional software engineering environment (source control, shortened release cycles, continuous integration and deployment, etc.).

  • Welcome change and complexity. We are on the leading, sometimes bleeding, edge of mobile development. That requires us to learn quickly and adapt fast. We are looking for folks to lead that charge, not just keep up with it.

item.title: Sr. Software Engineer at Logi Analytics (McLean, VA)
item.description:
Sr. Software Engineer



COMPANY OVERVIEW



Founded in 2000, Logi Analytics provides businesses the fastest and easiest way to deliver business analytics, dashboards, and reports to a broad range of users, as well as to embed them into existing applications – all for a fraction of the cost of other solutions. Unlike traditional Business Intelligence platforms that are complex and costly, Logi Analytics’ agile technology allows organizations to rapidly develop, deploy, and adapt BI applications that serve any number of users on any platform all without extensive development or professional services. Logi Analytics is headquartered in McLean, Virginia, with sales and support offices in the UK and Europe.  Logi Analytics is a privately held, venture-backed firm with investments from Updata Partners, GroTech Ventures, Summit Partners and LLR Partners. For more information, visit LogiAnalytics.com.



SUMMARY



This position will work closely with Development, QA, and Product Management to design and implement features and capabilities for Logi Analytics’ product line.



General:



Logi is looking for a technically proficient software engineer who has collaborated with a team to put enterprise software into production.  While this individual is capable of solving incredibly technical problems, he/she doesn’t need to solve every problem single-handedly, and actually enjoys bringing the best ideas together to design and implement the best possible solution.



ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES



•           Design, develop and maintain a rich data-driven Java application containing HTML5, CSS and JavaScript, Angular, NodeJS components


•           Gain good understanding of our suite of software products.


•           Work within our development team to maintain and enhance the product.


•           Take ownership of product sub-systems.


•           Provide a positive influence that will improve our products for our customers.  Invent new ideas to build new features and products to help grow Logi Analytics.

item.title: Software Engineer (Java) at EMBL-EBI (Hinxton, UK)
item.description:
We are seeking to recruit an experienced Software Engineer to work on the OpenMinTeD H2020 project, to create an e-infrastructure that fosters and facilitates the use of text and data mining technologies in scientific publications. You will join the Cheminformatics and Metabolism team at the European Bioinformatics Institute (EMBL-EBI) located at the Wellcome Genome Campus near Cambridge in the UK.

You will work with the OpenMinTeD consortium on the BioMedical use case for this consortium. You will also develop the curation tool for the ChEBI database at EBI and integrate the solutions produced by the OpenMinTeD consortium. Towards this end, you need to have excellent software engineering capabilities and be able to understand and implement software according to user requirements.

The EBI is part of the European Molecular Biology Laboratory (EMBL) and it is a world-leading bioinformatics centre providing biological data to the scientific community with expertise in data storage, analysis and representation. EMBL-EBI provides freely available data from life science experiments, performs basic research in computational biology and offers an extensive user training programme, supporting researchers in academic and industry.

item.title: Frontend developer at Wiremind (Paris, France)
item.description:
About Us:


We are a young start-up based in Paris and dedicated to the field of Revenue Management for the transportation sector. We believe in tools that mix business intelligence, applied mathematics, ergonomics and software intelligence to make sense of very large amount of data. We aim to remove unnecessary complexity to our users while allowing them to focus on high-value actions to improve the overall margin of their business.


Our main solution is a saas software for transport companies that let them do their yield and pricing just right.


We are looking for a talented frontend engineer who is ready to work in close relation with the CTO to tackle challenges met by a young technological startup. 


Responsibilities:


You will be in charge of developping new features for the front-end part of our solution.


The back-end part is responsible for extracting data from our client's reservation system, transforming it by applying several steps (standardization, forecasting, pricing algorithms...) and loading it in our managed datastores.


The frontend is a single-page application on which clients can freely modify their pricing position according to realtime adjusted metrics like competitor's prices, daily sale's speed, suggest optimal price... 


Our technological stack is as follow:



  • Backend: Python, SQLAlchemy, Scrapy, Celery, Flask

  • Frontend: AngularJS, D3js

  • Data-store: Postgresql, Elasticsearch


Requirements:



  • Strong Knowledge of Javascript, CSS, HTML

  • Rigourous, autonomous and hard-working


Bonus Points:



  • Working experience with AngularJS or D3js

  • Experience in working in a technological start-up


Other details:


This is a fulltime position located in Paris. 
Please include a brief personalized cover letter (in english or french) with your application.
Salary: Negotiable depending on the profile and degree / training / experience.

item.title: Senior Computational Scientist at European Molecular Biology Laboratory (EMBL) (Hamburg, Germany)
item.description:
We are looking for a Senior Computational Scientist to join the BioSAXS group of the EMBL.



The successful applicant will be responsible for the design, coordination, implementation and deployment
of software and method developments, ranging from integration of biophysical devices and methods at
the BioSAXS beamline to data collection strategies and subsequent analysis methods. He/she will also
be involved in the user support at a dedicated biological SAXS beamline P12 on PETRA 3 ring utilized by
over a hundred groups per year. All beamline specific developments are to be coordinated with the MX beamline responsibles, as well as Computer and Instrumentation groups.



Methods development requires collaborative maintenance of the existing code base with the other
members of the group with specific emphasis on the development of novel statistical and machine
learning approaches for data analysis and validation.

item.title: Software Engineer Python/Django at OptimData (Paris, France)
item.description:
Entreprise


OptimData est un centre de R&D en fort développement fondé en 2015 par Laurent Couillard, ex DG d’Exalead, avec un actionnariat composé de Technia et Transcat, leaders internationaux reconnus dans la distribution de solutions IT d’entreprises. Son objectif est de développer, de maintenir et de distribuer des solutions logicielles en mode SaaS afin d’aider les industriels dans leur transformation digitale. OptimData se démarque par une approche innovante basée sur la valorisation des données internes et externes à l’entreprise.


Dans un premier temps, OptimData répond aux besoins non couverts dans le domaine du service après-vente dans les secteurs des biens d’équipement et machines spéciales au moyen de l’application ProductInUse.


L’équipe d’OptimData est composée d’ingénieurs R&D passionnés par les enjeux et problématiques modernes liés aux données: Big Data, Apprentissage automatique & Internet des objets.


Mission


ProductInUse est une application web basée sur une stack web moderne: ReactJs/API Rest Django/PostGreSql/Cassandra. Vous serez en charge du développement de l’API qui est un composant central dans l’architecture car il est “responsable” du modèle de données. Ce composant est basé sur le Django Rest Framework et la librairie d'analyse de données pandas.


Les objectifs du poste sont:



  • Mise à jour du modèle de données

  • Développement des nouvelles API

  • Contribution à l’amélioration de la partie devops (déploiement, monitoring …)


Étant donné la position centrale du poste, les interactions avec les équipe connectivité, data science, infrastructure & front seront nombreuses. L’équipe travaille en “sprint” hebdomadai


Environnement



  • Infra: Cloud IBM sur debian

  • Versionning: git/github

  • Devops: ansible

Provide domain knowledge of performance test tools and techniques in a development organization.  To provide ownership for both generic and release-specific performance test strategy.

WORK EXPERIENCE

  • 5+ years in software development/scripting

item.title: Java Devops Engineer at Spinn3r (San Francisco, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Ideal Candidate


We are looking for candidates outside of the U.S. and Canada to maximize our time zone distribution. Ideally there should be least a 4 hour overlap with the Pacific Standard Time Zone (PST / UTC-8). We're based out of San Francisco but are migrating to the international level. If you don't have a natural time overlap with UTC-8 you should be willing to work evenings to be able to communicate easily with the rest of the team.


We're interested in someone comfortable with a generalist and devops role. You should be knowledgeable of standard system administration tasks and have a firm understanding of the role of load balancers and cluster architecture. It's 100x harder to write code if you don't know how the underlying operating system works.


We are also looking for someone with a legitimate passion for technology, big data, and analyzing vast amounts of content.


Culturally, we're a remote company and want to embrace it as a way to reward our employees. We are fine with you working in remote locations as long as you're generally available for communication and are productive.


We want someone to come in full time as a contractor role. I suspect we will need about 40 hours from you per week.  


Job Responsibilities:



  • Understanding our crawler infrastructure and ensuring top quality metadata for our customers. There's a significant batch job component to analyze the output from the crawl to ensure top quality data.

  • Making sure our infrastructure is fast, reliable, fault tolerant, etc. At times this may involve diving into the source of tools like ActiveMQ, Cassandra and understand how the internals work. We contribute a LOT to Open Source development if our changes need to be given back to the community.

  • Building out new products and technology that will directly interface with customers. This includes cool features like full text search, analytics, etc. It's extremely rewarding to build something from ground up and push it to customers directly. 


Architecture:


Our infrastructure consists of Java on Linux (Debian/Ubuntu) with the stack running on ActiveMQ, Cassandra, Zookeeper, and Jetty. We use Ansible to manage our boxes. We have a full-text search engine based on Elasticsearch and store our firehose API data within Cassandra.


We have a totally new stack and infrastructure at this point. We recently did a full-stack rewrite and moved all the old code to our new infrastructure. This means we have very little legacy cruft to deal with.


Here's all the cool stuff you get to play with:



  • Large Linux / Ubuntu cluster running with the OS versioned using both Ansible and our own debian packages for software distribution.

  • Massive amount of data indexed from the web and social media.  We index from 5-20TB of data per month and want to expand to 100TB of data per month.

  • Large Cassandra install on SSD.  

  • SOLR / Elastic Search migration / install.  We’re experimenting with bringing this up now so it would be valuable to get your feedback.


Compensation:



  • Salary based on experience. We're willing to be competitive and a great company to work for.

  • Ability to work remotely at home. Live work balance is a must.

item.title: SQL DBA - use your SQL expertise to help us keep London moving! at Transport for London (London, UK)
item.description:
There’s big data and there’s TfL data.


In London, people make 7 million bus journeys and 4 million London Underground journeys every weekday. Innovations like our Oyster card and our ground-breaking contactless payment system are revolutionising the experience of travel in London. The data gathered from millions of journeys underpins a host of vital business decisions.


In Analytics, we take this vast data source and put it to work for the benefit of TfL. Our enables TfL to provide a better network and improve the travel experience for millions of Londoners. We work in an agile, fast-paced environment. There’s a real buzz about the team. We’re constantly innovating our processes and technologies to deliver fresh solutions. And as we’re using one of the only data stores of its kind in the country – a 150-terabyte data warehouse on the Microsoft Analytics Platform – we’re always learning new ways we can push it.

item.title: Communication, News, And Realtime Applications And Services Developer (C++) at Bloomberg LP (London, UK)
item.description:
We develop key applications that the financial community relies on to interact with one another and to keep abreast of key news and market moving information. Our responsibilities include communication tools such as Bloomberg's proprietary Email and Instant Message products, Notes and Contact Management systems, News, Market Alerts and Monitoring applications. These are delivered across both desktop and mobile platforms. Our products are built to handle high volume, low latency and high availability. In addition, we build the core systems that form the foundation of applications built by other software groups within Bloomberg.

We have a deep understanding of our product areas and work closely with our business counterparts and UX design teams to deliver the experience desired by our customers. As the speed of change is rapid we need people who are agile and eager to learn and develop new skills. The ability to collaborate across multiple teams and learn a depth and breadth of technical and domain knowledge is critical.

We frequently work with open source software and encourage interaction with the wider technology community by contributing changes and taking part in related meet-ups and conferences.

Teams in Communication, News, and Realtime Applications and Services:

Bloomberg Chat

Bloomberg Chat is Bloomberg's instant messaging system. It is used by the entire Bloomberg community for real-time communication to exchange quotes, trade ideas, news and other financial information. The Bloomberg Chat team in London is responsible for ensuring the fast and efficient distribution of content through our data centers to the client application running on our customers' desktops.

Message and Collaboration

Internet Message - The Bloomberg Message system delivers over 300 million messages every day. The Internet Message system converts messages between email and Bloomberg's proprietary Message format. Software written by the team must be scalable, fault tolerant and secure. Our work also includes evolving and extending our solutions for detecting spam, malware and phishing.

Contact Management - Bloomberg's most popular functions are its communication tools (Message and Chat). Users of these systems need a fast, secure and reliable way to store their contact information. The Bloomberg contact management system contains data on over 50 million contacts, all of which can be queried in under a millisecond. In the last 12 months, we developed a brand new interface, which we continue to evolve. Our focus this year is our backend systems as we work on improving performance and scalability.

Notes - Notes is an exciting new product being developed to further improve the collaboration capabilities of the Bloomberg system. It will enable users to annotate and curate Bloomberg content for quick retrieval and organization, providing insightful ways to analyze user-generated content.

Mobile

The Mobile team has the charge to take Bloomberg's key financial and foundational applications and deliver them to all major mobile platforms. We are a mix of both client side iOS and Android specialists, and other backend developers focused on infrastructure who use their platform native skills mixed with C++ to deliver an immersive mobile experience. Developers are involved in full end to end development of native UI components and the required client and server infrastructure that connects devices to Bloomberg data services. Security and usability concerns are also a major focus for our team.

News Editing & Workflow

The News Editing and Workflow team is responsible for the tools used by the Bloomberg News organization for the timely release of accurate, market moving news. The team also develops the Bloomberg News Automation suite, which generates thousands of news stories per day with minimal latency, which is triggered by realtime Bloomberg market data and events.

News Search

The News Search team owns the search and alerting backend behind the news functionality across Bloomberg. This is one of the most widely used functions on the Bloomberg Terminal. It serves timely, accurate and market moving news to our customers by sifting through hundreds of millions of news stories. Our customers can search, analyze and set alerts for the news that matters to them in milliseconds. Developers work on scalable, low-latency solutions by making use of search and information retrieval technologies, and working with distributed systems running on dedicated farms of machines.

Realtime Applications

Alerts - The Alert product lets market participants monitor the markets. It exposes nearly every tick in the world, along with a broad range of non-pricing data from corporate actions to social media sentiment and even power station outages. The system is available 24/7 and is used by tens of thousands of traders and investors helping them respond quickly to changing market conditions. Alerts are a major strategic focus for the company and we are scaling our infrastructure and extending our feature set significantly.

Monitors - The Monitors team is responsible for providing industry-leading, comprehensive, fully custom cross-asset quote sheet applications. 200,000 of our clients rely on these applications every day. The team deploys Bloomberg's latest proprietary technologies and UI framework by making further UX improvements, while maintaining a strong focus on performance and reliability.

Trade Ideas - The Trade Ideas application allows users to exchange investment research and recommendations in order to demonstrate their skills. The Trade Ideas Platform comprises high-performance distributed multi-threaded services, real-time publishing, both SQL and NoSQL databases, with desktop, web and mobile clients.

item.title: Software Engineer Team Lead - Hadoop at trivago GmbH (Düsseldorf, Deutschland)
item.description:
Join our team and actively shape the technical future of the world’s largest online hotel search. Work with top-notch technologies in a unique work environment with exciting career perspectives. Enjoy the freedom to question established processes, broaden your horizon and develop new things to impress our 80 million users per month!

Due to trivago’s rapid international growth we are now creating an exciting new position for a skilled developer and expert on systems level to lead, inspire and grow our Hadoop development team. In this role you’ll have the overview of our big data architecture and implement your own ideas to strategically drive our Hadoop cluster to the next level. We want someone not only to use but to build a complex Hadoop cluster and data pipeline infrastructure. If you are passionate about using technology in creative ways and enjoy playing with big data then we want to hear from you!


Your tasks:



  • As an expert in your field, you will design, implement and maintain data integration and data warehouse based solutions using Hadoop.

  • Translate business requirements into technical implementations based on systems‘ capabilities.

  • Ensure the solutions being defined are reusable and follow standard design patterns and architecture principles of Hadoop.

  • Coach and mentor a growing team in an Apache Hadoop environment. On this note you will support the recruitment process of further team members and liaise with HR to devise innovative approaches to finding the next Hadoop prodigy.

  • Collaborate with and provide technical consultation to other Software Development, Operations, Product and Business Intelligence teams to define deliverables and plans.

  • We promote thinking outside the box so we encourage you to initiate, promote and allocate the resources for technological innovations.

item.title: Senior Full Stack Engineer- Building a new cutting edge platform!!!!! at Zipcar (Boston, MA)
item.description:
Zipcar, the world’s largest car-sharing company, is looking to add new senior talent to our Engineering team.


Today, Zipcar provides hundreds of thousands of people with a viable alternative to traditional car ownership, saving them money, time and headaches. Around the world—from coast to coast, across Canada, the UK, and college campuses in between—people are making the decision to live car free and enjoying the convenience and environmental benefits of having “wheels when you want them”.



We’re working to transform Zipcar from its ‘startup roots’ into ‘a world-class engineering organization’. The new platform we’re building is going to take Zipcar all over the world. We’re building a global platform to take car-sharing everywhere.


From an organizational standpoint, we’re going ‘deep into Agile’. We’ve launched a bunch of Agile teams and they are essentially self-directed. We’re pushing technical decision making and freedom to choose approaches down to the team level. We’re empowering engineers and teams to make decisions. Even our Leadership Team (including the President) does a ‘daily standup’.


The technology choices we’re standardizing on are:



  • Native Mobile applications on Android and iOS. Our goal is to launch new functionality on ‘mobile first’ wherever it makes sense.

  • Big Data technologies like Hadoop, Cassandra, Apache Spark, Clojure, Haskel, machine learning, etc are going to be core to what we do.

  • All back-end services are going to be written in Ruby, Scala or Java. Mobile apps are all native.



Responsibilities:



  • Senior member of an agile team focused on delivering components of the next generation Zipcar technology platform.

  • Work to achieve engineering quality standards that our members will love and that you and your team will be proud of.

  • Responsible for the delivery a series of small, discrete applications leveraging Ruby, Java and/or Scala in a fast-paced, team-focused environment

  • Lead the development of applications leveraging traditional and non-traditional data stores, such as Hadoop, Cassandra and others.


Requirements:



  • The desire to work as part of an agile team

  • 5+ years of experience in Scala/Play, Java, or Ruby development for the web

  • Must have experience using non-traditional data stores such as Hadoop, Cassandra or MongoDB.

  • The skill and desire to create well-tested software using current tools.

  • Experience with SOA, microservice and/or RESTful design patterns

  • Experience with applications having 100s to 1000s or more concurrent users.

  • Experience building web applications using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript


The Ideal Candidate Has:



  • A solid understanding of Kanban, Scrum and other agile concepts

  • Experience with multiple programming languages, with at least one being JVM-based, such as Java, JRuby or Scala.

  • An understanding of Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery

  • Experience in deploying applications using tools such as AWS, Docker, or Cloud Foundry

  • Experience using JavaScript frameworks such as Backbone, Ember or Angular

  • Experience using data with predictive and other analytic approaches

  • Experience deploying and tuning large-scale applications built on top of the JVM

  • Exposure to mobile development on iOS or Android

  • Experience interfacing with telematics infrastructure and geospatial data

  • A commitment to Zipcar’s ideals of sustainable resource sharing and urban mobility


As a member of the Zipcar Team you will receive:



  • Competitive Compensation

  • Competitive Benefits Package

  • Free Membership

  • Discounts on services, products and much more


While we appreciate every applicant’s interest, only those under consideration will be contacted. We regret that phone calls will not be accepted.


Zipcar is an EEO Employer - Minorities / Females / Protected Veterans / Disabled


To all recruitment agencies: Zipcar does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Zipcar employees or any other company location. Zipcar is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

item.title: Information Security Engineer at Gap Inc. (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
The Information Security Engineer works as a member of the Threat & Incident Management team (TIM team). The TIM team is part of Gap’s Information Security organization (InfoSec), working closely with infrastructure, application, and managed service provider teams to ensure the security posture of Gap’s global enterprise is maintained, including endpoint, network, server and border security.



The IT Security engineers serve as Subject Matter Experts (SME) for InfoSec’s portfolio of monitoring and logging tools, providing research, expert advice, and direction on configuration and management of the tools.



The Security Engineer has direct responsibility for working with all GapTech teams in delivering subject matter expertise for cybersecurity incident response and computer forensics services for suspected or confirmed cybersecurity breaches, emerging threats assessment, and supporting legal e-Discovery requests.


Responsibilities



  • Identify security issues and risks associated with security events reported by L1 or L2 InfoSec teams, or via alerts from various security tools, and develop remediation and/or risk mitigation plans

  • Leverage a wide range of security technologies including, but not limited to: SIEM/syslog, IDS/IPS, malware analysis and protection, content filtering, logical access controls, identity and access management, data loss prevention, content filtering technologies, application firewalls, vulnerability scanners, LDAP, security incident response and Identity Management software

  • Participate in incident response and investigations of suspected information technology security misuse or compliance reviews as requested by Gap’s Security Council, InfoSec management, or as required when alerts are received from InfoSec threat monitoring tools and threat intelligence sources

  • Work with InfoSec product vendors and service providers, to evaluate potential security offerings, including product evaluations, pilots and proof of concept installations

  • Assist in responses to internal and external compliance audits, e-Discovery data collection, penetration tests and vulnerability assessments

  • Coordinate maintenance of security-related systems (Anti-Virus, Patching, Intrusion Detection, Logging, Anti-spam, etc.)

  • Monitor current and proposed laws, regulations, industry standards, and ethical requirements related to information security and privacy

  • Conduct research on emerging products, services, protocols, and standards relative to the information security arena

  • Other duties as assigned

item.title: Web Developer at Merck & Company Inc. (Branchburg, NJ)
item.description:
Merck is a global health care leader with a diversified portfolio of prescription medicines, vaccines and consumer health products, as well as animal health products. Today, we are building a new kind of healthcare company - one that is ready to help create a healthier future for all of us.

Our ability to excel depends on the integrity, knowledge, imagination, skill, diversity and teamwork of people like you. To this end, we strive to create an environment of mutual respect, encouragement and teamwork. As part of our global team, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate with talented and dedicated colleagues while developing and expanding your career.

Applied Technology is working to better understand new and emerging technologies, particularly those concerned with data discovery, natural language processing, search, and data provenance. As the research and understanding of the tools and techniques becomes wider, Merck can leverage them to bring efficiencies into its operations, deliver better education to patients, and make data more easily accessible.


This position will require the candidate to write code, model and experiment with new technologies in the realm of search, natural language processing, and machine learning. The team will provide specific recommendations on an approach to move forward with a more robust "search by example" pilot.


The candidate will gain exposure to bleeding edge technologies and focus areas such as data provenance, inference, recommendation, index, and visualization. The candidate will also work closely with industry leading technologists and think tanks. Some of the technologies the candidate will work on include:



  • MEAN Stack - MongoDB, Express, Angular, NodeJS

  • Graph databases (NEO4J, Google Cayley)

  • Data visualization tools (D3.js)

With this high quality data, professionals from sales, marketing, service, recruiting, etc, can use it and be more productive and effective in their business. Data.com includes over 30 million accurate community sourced business contacts and over 200 million accurate company profiles from Dun & Bradstreet. item.title: System Engineer, Platform & Big Data Services at Peak Games (Istanbul, Turkey)

Peak Games' Technical Operations team (TechOps) is responsible for building, scaling and maintaining highly available systems, and is also the first line of defense against all outages. Because of being a service department, TechOps engineers have limitless exposure to all technologies used in the infrastructure of all games, including numerous bleeding edge technologies. Major Responsibilities/Activities

item.title: Software Engineer at MillimanMAX (Cambridge, MA)
item.description:
The Milliman predictive analytics group in Cambridge, MA is looking for software engineers to help bridge research and practice, towards changing the way the insurance industry does business. Yeah, we really do think we’re going to change the way this whole industry works. Although Milliman is primarily an Actuarial Science firm, that is not what we do. We’re a small team of motivated experts building a new product-oriented practice for tackling statistical problems in the insurance sector. We work with large, real-world datasets and advanced techniques spanning optimization, statistics, and machine learning. We are looking for exceptional and innovative individuals to help in building out tools/automation to support Milliman's Predictive Modeling Practice. This is a unique opportunity to take on a role that will allow end to end development and autonomy. You will be working closely with a strong team of researchers and engineers; your work will have immediate and tangible impact both internally, and within our clients’ operations. 


Responsibilities


Your primary function is to have your work support end-to-end work flow for high-volume customer data through the predictive modeling engines and back to the customer with full service BI/analytics using event-driven automation as well as designing and coding tools utilized in the extraction, refining, and data presentation arenas.



  • Implement, optimize, generalize and productionalize models and research emerging from the research team

  • Integrate predictive models into database-backed environments, real-time query APIs, and existing modeling pipelines

  • Think about high-level architecture, scalability, abstraction, modularity, and generalizability across clients and use-cases

  • Lead significant strategic projects focused on enhancements to core tooling and automation.

  • Design and develop custom exploratory tools for strange new data worlds.

  • Design and develop automation to harden the end-to-end data handling.

  • Help design and develop data analytics platforms for supporting customer access through interactive visualization

  • Design and develop tools for processing and correlating seemingly disjoint customer data

  • Design and develop tools for multiple database engines: both extraction and posting

  • Gently chastise the data-scientists for not writing better code - then show them how

item.title: Software Developer (All Levels) at INRIX (Kirkland, WA)
item.description:
INRIX is on a path of unprecedented growth. The development team is aggressively driving innovation, design, implementation and deployment of large scale distributed applications and web services. Our core mission is to solve complex problems around big data and analytics. To develop and modify software to drive (pun intended!) the accuracy of predicting traffic flow and deliver the most valuable and accurate results to our customers!

The INRIX development team is a great place to grow your career and skillset. Our roadmap is bursting with opportunity for engineers to bring their best (and then some), solving intriguing challenges, and tangibly impacting the customer experience.

What you’re looking for:



  • A cutting-edge stack that combines open source and custom code to create a high-end traffic data and services platform serving millions of customers

  • Practical experience in working in a fast paced “start-up like” environment with high performing teams

  • Be part of a team where fun, smart, passionate, ambitious engineers are focused on delivering complex data and services that must be delivered with extremely low latency

  • A fast–growing global company where you’ll be challenged (required) to think about things that no one has thought of yet

  • A position where you’re an important voice in development, not one of many

  • Design, implement, and deploy large scale distributed applications and web services

  • Solve complex problems to develop software to drive the most valuable and accurate results to our customers


What we’re looking for:



  • Senior, Mid-Level, and Junior Software Developers -- experience with software development, architecture and deign, enjoys creating exciting products through hands-on coding

  • Experience in designing, implementing and deploying large-scale distributed applications and web services

  • Experience maintaining and extending applications and services through their lifetime

  • Experience in developing in Java on enterprise platforms (C# equivalent experience accepted)

  • Solid understand of graph algorithms

  • Demonstrated strong technical judgment in conjunction with passionate customer-focus

  • Be collaborative, have a strong work ethic, be reliable and a self-starter

  • Bachelor’s or advanced degree in computer science, mathematics, or related discipline


 What’s so exciting about our platform?

We’re working on a cutting-edge stack that combines open source and custom code to create a high-end traffic data and services platform serving millions of customers.  You’ll be joining a team focused on delivering engineering solutions to support complex services that must be delivered with extremely low latency.  You will have a strategic role driving decisions that will shape INRIX's capabilities and the future technical direction of our products.
Ideal Candidates have:



  • Strong experience in open source stacks and some experience in MSFT stack

  • Working knowledge in probability, statistics and analytics,  GIS/LBS concepts highly desired

  • Experience delivering and operating SaaS product offerings in an iterative, agile software lifecycle in AWS or Azure

  • Experience in Big Data architectures, NoSQL DB’s, Hadoop/HDFS/map/reduce, real time streaming analytics, visualization, or other technologies in the Big Data Analytics stack


Why make the move:



  • INRIX motorboat – Get your boat license and we’ll pay for the gas. You can walk from your office to the dock in 15 minutes. Take your family and friends skiing or tubing.  Yes, it’s big and it’s fast!

  • Free car – Well…. not really free.  But we have test cars with the latest traffic technology that you can take home.  We pay for the gas. 

  • Great Benefits – We’re as good as or better than most companies our size.

  • Free onsite snacks and drinks; Free Friday lunches – The food comes to you so that you write lots and lots of good code (at least we’re honest).

  • Bonuses 2x per year and Stock Options – Because you like to be rewarded and recognized for your hard work.

  • No Vacation Policy – You’re an adult and can manage your own vacation time.  Work hard; play hard.  Why does your company still have a vacation policy?

  • Family – We don’t believe that you should miss your child’s play because you have to attend a meeting. 

  • Are you ready to join a different kind of company?


INRIX is a leading provider of real-time traffic information, connected car services and analytics worldwide. The company leverages big data analytics to reduce the individual, economic and environmental toll of traffic congestion. Through cutting-edge data intelligence and predictive traffic technologies, INRIX helps leading automakers, fleets, governments and news organizations make it easier for drivers to navigate their world. 

Our vision is simple – to solve traffic, empower drivers, inform planning and enhance commerce.  INRIX is at the forefront of connecting cars to smarter cities and serves more than 350 blue-chip customers in more than 40 countries around the world.


Exciting things are happening all the time. Come join us!

item.title: Java Backend Developer (m/f) at Visual Meta GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
We are Visual Meta - an innovative, Berlin based internet company which has grown to over 200 employees since its foundation in 2009, and we're still growing at a relentless pace. We run shopping sites in 19 countries across three continents LadenZeile.de, ShopAlike.com.br, Shoppala.com, and ShopAlike.in. Despite our great success we have managed to retain a very friendly and open working environment. Since 2011 we have belonged to the Axel Springer Group and have benefited from its great network of online businesses. 


We are looking for “Java Backend Developer (m/f)” on a full-time basis to help us inventing, extending and scaling our backend services for leading shopping comparison platforms worldwide like LadenZeile and ShopAlike.


We deal a lot with data mining and analysis, large databases, images, search technologies, machine learning and web technologies. We code stuff that matters and reaches millions of people. Our technology stack is plain Java, MySQL, Hadoop, Spring, Eclipse and Tomcat.


Your responsibilities:



  • Managing the data warehousing, reporting and visualization

  • Improving our online marketing applications and our data processing / bidding systems

  • Developing back office applications / content management systems

  • Scaling databases for MySQL and Hadoop

  • Controlling the service integration and operating with administration tools


What we offer:



  • A committed, successful and international engineering team in one of the best tech companies in Berlin

  • Continuous training possibilities and room for further personal development

  • Large impact due to small, excellent development teams and professional data center environments

  • Leading-edge technology to solve challenging problems and to build great software

  • Healthy snacks (fruits, cereals), water and hot drinks

  • Flexible working hours, team events, corporate events and leisure activities to support your work-life balance


If you are interested in an exciting position within a friendly team, please submit your application in English to the attention of Johannes Schaback, including cover letter, CV, your earliest starting date, salary expectations as well as relevant references, by using the following Link: https://hire.jobvite.com/j?aj=orjlZfwO&s=stackoverflow


We are looking forward to receiving your application!


Visual Meta GmbH | Schützenstraße 25 | 10117 Berlin


www.ladenzeile.de | www.visual-meta.com

item.title: Senior DevOps Engineer at LiveRamp (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
ABOUT LIVERAMP


LiveRamp is the leading data onboarder, enabling marketers to unify their customer database across disparate online marketing applications and leverage it for analytics, targeting, measurement, content optimization, and more.


ABOUT THIS JOB


Join our team and help us operate and optimize an environment with hundreds of machines and a four petabyte (and growing) Hadoop cluster. We write code to make administering that hardware a breeze, and work on projects alongside the rest of the LiveRamp engineering team. Your responsibility will be to do whatever it takes to get the job done -- one day it could be installing racks of hardware, the next day it could be scripting the deployment of a heterogenous environment of dozens of virtual machines.


We run a hybrid colo/EC2 environment with over 400 physical servers and at least as many virtual servers. We are responsible for ensuring high availability and low latency for the billions of HTTP requests we receive every day.


RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Maintain and grow our existing hardware/software infrastructure. Create tools for managing our massive hardware resources; fight to make our server:sysadmin ratio ridiculously high.

  • Optimize like crazy; squeeze every bit of performance out of our servers.

  • Work closely with developers to solve systems problems. Blur the line between ops and dev.

  • Code, script, and change hardware (disks, laptops, servers, etc.); support network, desktop, and security.

  • Help build a great company.

  • Automate everything! Especially in Amazon where instances appear and disappear constantly.


QUALIFICATIONS



  • B.S. degree in C.S, I.S., Mathematics, or comparable.

  • 3+ years of work experience in DevOps in Linux SysAdmin role, preferably in a fast-paced web application environment.

  • Smart, friendly, gets stuff done.

  • Loves hardware. Probably owns a soldering iron.

  • Lives at the command line.

  • Likes to code. Our ops team is unique; we are part of the development team. Seeking someone with at least two languages, such as Ruby, Bash, Java, Python, Perl.

  • Experience and interest in hardware and systems; you like the nitty-gritty of Linux.

  • Working knowledge of TCP/IP, ICMP, SSH, LDAP, DNS, and other low-level network things.

  • Working knowledge of storage, NAS, clustered file systems, RAID.

  • Virtualization experience (Xen, KVM, VMware or OpenVZ).

  • AWS or other Cloud management experience.

  • Intensely driven and proactive.

  • Ability to learn quickly.

  • Great team and business communication skills; project management communication ability.


Desired Additional skills:



    Puppet or other configuration management system experience highly desired, such as Ansible, CFEngine, or Chef. 
    Hadoop, MapReduce.
    Experience with petabytes of data

EMPLOYEE BENEFITS:



  • Stock. Every employee is a stakeholder in our future. 

  • Food. Enjoy catered meals, boundless snacks, and the occasional food truck.

  • Fun. We host events such as game nights, happy hours, camping trips, and sports leagues. 

  • People. Work with talented, collaborative, and friendly people who love what they do.

  • Health and Saving. Receive the benefits of comprehensive health, dental, vision and disability insurance along with a 401k matching plan.

  • Location. Work in the heart of San Francisco – the best city in the world, and take advantage of our commuter benefits.

item.title: VP of Engineering at Crisis Text Line (New York, NY)
item.description:
Overview: Crisis Text Line is a data and tech driven not-for-profit. We've built our own online platform for engaging with people in crisis (think: suicide, self-harm, domestic violence, etc) over SMS using standard, open web technologies.


How we work:



  • Fail intelligently. We're always do our absolute best work, but we're ready to fail at any moment so we build with redundancy and fault-tolerance.

  • Pick the right tool. Technology is a means, not an end. We try to see where the bleeding edge is, but live in the realm of reality and practicality.

  • Hack this site. Seriously. We're the type of people who think hackthissite.org is one of the coolest places on the internet, so everything we build has an eye to keeping things safe.

  • Access control. Alice and Bob are our best friends, but we know that Alice and Bob are inherently untrustworthy. We write your code to make sure Alice and Bob can’t conspire against us or our users.

  • Speed. People expect a response to a text message in under 14 minutes. We’re shooting for no more than 5. That means the platform needs to run fast, and crisis counselors need to be able to use it efficiently and effectively.

  • Testing. Testing isn’t just clicking buttons. Testing means optimizing user experience and listening to your users rather than your gut. And of course, running automated tests too. You would never deploy untested code into production. Duh.

  • Cloud. We think scale. The cloud isn’t a solution, it’s an assumption.


Our team:



  • Custom, home-grown Symfony2 app for SMS-web interaction

  • Drupal 7 installation for managing remote volunteers

  • Slack chat bots because `@robot animate me <kittens>` is important

  • 1 CTO, 3 engineers, and we're hiring at least 3 more engineers in the coming months

item.title: Experienced Front-End Engineer at Geckoboard (London, UK)
item.description:
Geckoboard is a successful and growing 25-person B2B SaaS startup based in East London. Our elegant, real-time dashboards solve a difficult but valuable problem for thousands of paying subscribers, by taking the complexity out of connecting to their data and making that data simple for anyone to interpret at a glance. As a result, our customers unlock data they didn't know they had, connect people and join up projects, and make better decisions faster.


We are looking for a full-time senior front-end engineer who has built rich JavaScript clients. You’ll be opinionated, but contemplative. You won’t immediately reach for your favourite framework or library when approaching a problem. You'll be comfortable liaising with our product designer on design and implementation. You’ll relish the opportunity to continually improve an existing product through refactoring and the removal/addition of features.


Displaying complicated data to our customers so they can easily understand what’s going on and make actionable decisions is a big challenge. We're constantly tweaking and improving how we visualise data on Geckoboard, whether through adding more visualizations or updating what we have.


At Geckoboard you will:



  • Write clean, modular, test driven code

  • Implement visual design from prototypes

  • Test compatibility with various browsers

  • Pick the best library for the job

  • Care about web performance 


More than anything, we value candidates who are excited about picking up new skills and sharing what they’ve learned with the rest of the team - for example, none of us knew Go or React a short time ago, but now both are key parts of our stack. We love people with a keen attention to detail and the willingness to apply it in shaping all aspects of our product.

item.title: Software Developer - Front-end, Data Visualization at Exaptive (Oklahoma City, OK)
item.description:
Exaptive, Inc is an MIT affiliated, fast-growing software startup that has offices in Oklahoma City, Boston and Vancouver, Canada. We are now expanding our Oklahoma City team. 

We are looking for entry-level programmers that have some formal computer science training, but are just starting their careers. You should know javascript and some javascript libraries like jQuery, D3, etc, and have an interest in data visualization, data science, and internet technologies. Most importantly, you should be hungry to build big, important applications that matter, and looking for projects to flex your newly developed coding muscles on. 

Experience with a variety of different internet technologies would be a bonus, but not necessary - we view this very much as a learn-on-the-job type position and as a result are valuing smarts, motivation and desire-to-learn over experience. These positions will be based in downtown OKC, but with the opportunity for travel to Exaptive's Boston and Vancouver locations. The position will have the opportunity to evolve into a role in which the person has an equity-stake in the company. The right person will be excited about the dynamic and fast-paced (aka stressful) environment of a startup and view that as a benefit, not a drawback. The startup environment is not for everyone, but for the person who is looking for that sort of life experience, the opportunity to help build something from the ground up where individual contributions make immediate and substantial impacts on the company as a whole can be extremely rewarding. 

Those interested can find out more about the company, and view some demo videos of our software in actionon our website: www.exaptive.com. We were featured on the front page of the Business Innovation section of The Boston Globe (http://www.boston.com/business/technology/innoeco/2013/12/cambridge-based_exaptive_wants.html) and in Oklahoma City's The Journal Record (http://www.i2e.org/news/innovators-exaptive-inc/). Our Founder and CEO, Dave King, has been invited internationally to present our work. You can see a video of a presentation he recently gave to the Oklahoma Venture Forum about Exaptive's big-picture vision on our website. 

If you don't currently live in Oklahoma City, you should check out what this up-and-coming city has to offer: a burgeoning tech startup and creative sector, the largest food truck event in the nation, olympic rowing facilities, and a cost of living that can't be beat. For the right candidate we'll pay relocation expenses.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - Bloomberg Mail Infrastructure at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
Bloomberg Mail is a cloud-based platform used for Internet email, bond announcements and pricing, financial research distribution and many other types of communication on the Bloomberg Terminal. Our users rely on Bloomberg Mail because of its real-time performance, massive scale, ironclad security, tight integration with financial data and applications on the Bloomberg Terminal, unique features like message retraction and "your message was read!" notification, machine learning-based message classification and, most importantly, singular access to the Bloomberg network of 350,000 financial professionals. We are looking for exceptional Senior Software Engineers who are interested in designing and building the next generation of this unparalleled product.

Our system is built on top of Open Source, commercial and proprietary technologies. This highly available, large-scale distributed system includes a comprehensive storage and search infrastructure, real-time email transport and delivery pipeline, real-time classification engine for user-based and machine learning-based tagging, APIs for integration with other applications and systems, as well as a feature-rich and powerful user-interface optimized for our specialized customers.

The Mail team is looking for C/C++ experts who are interested in working on high-performance infrastructure. A developer in this role will work in a highly distributed, multi-threaded environment on problems including indexing and retrieval of mail and files for both core databases and Search, APIs to that data for internal clients, and ensuring stability and scalability of a system that has increased its traffic 20% year over year for the last five years.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer (Palo Alto OR Seattle) at Coupang (Palo Alto, CA)
item.description:
Coupang - Sr. Software Engineer - Palo Alto or Seattle


What if you could set the standard of how e-commerce can and should be done around the world?


Now you can at Coupang!



We are Korea’s largest online retailer and our goal is to create the next-generation e-commerce model. According to Nikesh Arora, we are “one of the fastest-growing and most disruptive Internet companies in the world.” In just 4 years, we already have over 25M devoted users and over $2.5B in annual revenue. And we are just getting started!



We just closed a whopping $1 BILLION round of funding, and we are about to undergo hypergrowth! We have offices in Seoul, Shanghai, Palo Alto, Seattle, and Ontario, CA. We are looking to double our amazing team in the U.S.!



If you want to work in a fun, challenging environment while changing how the world thinks about e-commerce, then we want to hear from you!



About the role:



You’ll get to work with the best in the industry, with many of our team members coming from Amazon, eBay, PayPal, Facebookand more! You’ll work in a collaborative and open environment where we consider ourselves a family (Check out our Family Day!). And our agile environment will enable you to rapidly innovate with the most cutting edge technologies.



What you’ll do:


You’ll be faced with unique challenges to scale we aim to grow to more than 55M+ users in Korea alone. You’ll also get to push the envelope of what’s possible with mobile commerce (currently over 75% of our sales are done on mobile)!



Some specific things you’ll work on:



  • Highly Scalable and Reliable services oriented architecture

  • Big Data Analytics supporting data collection, modeling, and optimization

  • Strategic domains such as mobile payments, pricing, search, personalization, and supply chain management.

  • Consumer driven web and native mobile interfaces and APIs.



(We are only able to consider candidates local to the U.S. at this time. Thank you for your interest!)

item.title: Senior Scala Software Engineer at Weight Watchers (New York, NY)
item.description:
Weight Watchers uses modern Lean and Agile practices as well as best of breed Engineering practices to deliver leading consumer focused products. Weight Watchers places a major emphasis on mobile and digital solutions to help our members reach their goals. This includes integrating with technologies such as Fitbit & iOS Health, as well as building custom, intuitive products to serve our millions of members.As we rebuild many of our core experiences, we are seeking talented people who are excited to join our team. This is a rare opportunity to join a company embracing a modern Technology culture, where you will have the ability to improve peoples lives in a very meaningful way and have a major impact on Weight Watchers offerings to our members. As reliance on health and wellness awareness increases, you can be be part of the team that is leading the way.

Senior Scala Software Engineer

We’re hiring a core team that will build a new product technology platform from the ground up. The new platform will be a vital part of the company’s transformation and its reimagined product offering. From technology selection and architecture to team structure and processes, the core team will take on the challenge of building a new Micro Service Architecture that will power Weight Watchers over the coming years.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - Machine Learning, Performance Targeting at Quantcast (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
The Performance Targeting & Optimization team’s mission is to help our customers understand their audience better and to deliver relevant advertising across all mediums on the Internet. The team builds and operates realtime prediction and control systems that power all our advertising products at scale. This means getting up-close and personal with cutting edge statistical models and machine learning techniques. You’ll have the opportunity to leverage Quantcast’s massive computing power to build tens of thousands of machine learned models, and to use these models to make over 2 million advertising decisions per second.


We are looking for top-tier senior talent to lead our efforts in designing, implementing and operating large scale ML systems in a production environment. The successful applicant will have industry experience applying techniques like classification, clustering and control optimization to solve big data problems. You’ll work within a machine learning group that is obsessed with improving the state of the art in performance advertising. You’ll take full ownership of the development and operation of ML systems to run advertising campaigns at a global scale. You’ll also introduce new products aimed at providing a complete targeting solution for our advertisers.


The team also works closely with our scientific advisors, Stanford professors Jerome Friedman and Trevor Hastie. As leaders in the fields of data mining and statistics, both professors take an active interest in Quantcast and our ongoing work.


Responsibilities



  • Design, build and operate large scale machine learning systems and supporting infrastructure.

  • Develop techniques to efficiently extract meaning from petabytes of data.

  • Improve existing ad targeting products and introduce new end-to-end products to delight our customers.

  • Interface with Product & Business Operations teams to translate business requirements into robust and scalable solutions.

item.title: Lead/Senior Software Engineer - Data Infrastructure Engineering at Udemy (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Lets Go.

Lets go inspire 100 million people learn anything they can imagine. Lets go inspire 100,000 instructors to share their knowledge with the world. Lets go help 10,000 businesses to change the way their employees learn.

Learn. Empathize. Take Ownership. nnovate. Show Passion.

Get Stuff Done. Open Up.

ABOUT UDEMY

Udemy is an online marketplace where anyone in the world can take or teach a course on virtually anything, whenever and wherever they want. Our mission is to empower on-demand learning thats accessible to all by offering instruction in a way thats affordable, simple, and flexible, so individuals can fulfill their limitless potential on their own terms.

Our more than 7 million students can gain skills to launch a new career, advance in their current field, or try something new for their own personal development by choosing from more than 30,000 courses in 80+ languages. Our instructors are passionate experts who want to share their knowledge with a broad audience. Udemy also works with companies to help them develop more effective and engaging skills-based training for their employees.

Founded in 2010, Udemy is privately owned and funded by Stripes Group, Norwest Venture Partners, Insight Venture Partners, Lightbank, MHS Capital, Learn Capital, and 500 Startups, among others. Udemy is headquartered in San Franciscos SOMA neighborhood and has offices in Dublin, Ireland, and Ankara, Turkey. Compensation includes full time salary, equity compensation plan, and competitive benefits (including healthcare, commuter benefits and an unlimited vacation policy).  

Job Description:

  • Build robust and scalable data infrastructure (both offline and real-time) to support needs from different teams around the company.

  • Manage the data infrastructure and do necessary capacity planning.

  • May get involved in various projects/tasks as needed. This may involve some project planning, resource planning, and deployment planning in additional to his/her current software engineering responsibilities

  • May require mentoring  junior engineers to become proficient developers using best software development practices and processes

  • Lead by example and contribute to a team culture that values quality, robustness, and scalability while fostering initiatives and innovation.

  • Continue to research and evaluate new technologies (such as Spark) that may improve performance and elegance of our data infrastructure.

  • We practice agile development methodologies with two week sprints.

Technologies currently in use or will be in use:

  • Hadoop, Hive, Pig

  • AWS, Elastic MapReduce, Redshift, Kinesis, S3

  • Cassandra, HBase

  • Spark

  • Kafka, Storm

  • Python, Django (experience with Python/Django a big plus)

  • Github

  • MySQL, PostgreSQL

Qualifications:

  • Shown success as an individual contributor. Have consistently demonstrated ability and commitment to deliver major initiatives from beginning to full deployment in a timely manner.

  • Embrace good development practices including design specification, coding standards, unit testing, and code reviews.

  • Exhibited passion for delivering high quality products that meet business requirements

  • Demonstrated knowledge of well known software technologies and services and curiosity to continue to evaluate new technologies to strengthen our platform.

  • Demonstrated ability to work effectively within a team and with cross-functional technical and business teams.

  • Demonstrated ability to solve time-critical problems

  • Have contributed to the development of others through code reviews, tech talks, or personal coaching.

  • Willingness to "go the extra mile" when needed.

Udemy in the News:

TechCrunch: Udemy Raises Another $65 Million To Help Anyone Learn Anything

Wall Street Journal: Udemy Raises $65 Million to Become Netflix for Education

Bloomberg: Why LinkedIn Is Tapping Into Online Education

Forbes: Closing The Skills Gap: How Udemy Is Helping Anyone Learn Anything

SFGate: Company culture, collaboration is focus at Udemy

item.title: Data Scientist at Triggr Health (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
You’ll be responsible for defining, building, and supporting a platform that reaches people when they are most at-risk and empowers them through the extraordinarily challenging recovery journey. It is an incredibly exciting role as you will be working with cutting-edge technology on a number of products that span: consumer and enterprise; mobile and desktop; external and internal; user-driven and automated; and practical and academic areas. The challenges you will face are new and exciting and will require you to think holistically about how the platform interacts with an incredibly diverse set of stakeholders.


We are looking for a Data Scientist with a machine learning background who is excited about the thought of working with big data to solve a complex, challenging problem. You must be able to architect and build a scalable system to process, analyze and validate models in real time.


You need to be entrepreneurial, have a desire to be part of a small team of highly motivated, mission-driven people, and have the appropriate experience to have significant input into all parts of the product and company.  You have to be a hands-on coder who enjoys not just implementing algorithms, but designing them from scratch.


Everything we do is hyper-focused on how the product impacts every patient, provider, and team member. You will need to understand when trade-offs are necessary: we are growing very quickly, but quality is of critical importance given our mission. You will continuously iterate on our products in order to improve the long-term outcomes of the patients in our program. You will also be integral to forming and developing our culture in addition to helping hire all-star teammates to make Triggr Health an awesome place to work! Most importantly, you must have a strong desire to be a part of a mission-driven company and believe that with the right team, technology, and values, anything is possible.


This position requires someone who understands and embraces the fact that the “user” is a real person with a severe health condition. The work we are doing is incredibly exciting because the impact we can have is massive, but it also requires extra care and increased responsibility to ensure every decision we make reflects this understanding.

item.title: Senior Level Back-End Web Developer at Moore & Scarry Advertising (Fort Myers, FL)
item.description:
Job Title:       Senior Level Back-End Web Developer


Job Status:     Full-time, On-site


Department:   Technology


Reports To:    General Manager of Digital Video


Job Description


Develop interactive web sites utilizing a strong fundamental knowledge of writing semantic, modular back end code using JavaScript, Python, and other data oriented programming languages or APIs.  Must understand and demonstrate the concepts of progressive enhancement, data analytics and future friendly code.   Must be familiar with application testing and debugging, have ample experience navigating MVC frameworks such as Angular, Django, Node, etc. Must have an understanding of data intensive applications, APIs, and utilize progressive iteration strategy as the fundamental work flow approach. A good understanding of responsive design/development.   Ability to work with front-end languages such as HTML (including HTML5), CSS3 are a major bonus. 


Required:


- Mastery of JavaScript, Python, and/or Javacscript with proven hands on experience


- Deep understanding and data intensive applications and their associated languages


- Experience with Node, Angular, Django, Ember, Backbone


- Expertise across multiple modern build systems with expertise spanning several systems of relevance


Experience defining technical project requirements


Experience designing/architecting complex, cross-functional solutions


- Skilled at bringing engaging user analytics to life using CSS transitions/animations, WebGL, Canvas, and JavaScript-driven animation


- Strong familiarity with CSS preprocessors (Sass, Less, Stylus, etc) and understands their benefits and limitations in producing efficient, maintainable code.


- Expert understanding of high-throughput back-end performance and creating data elements that make efficient use of resources for a large number of users


- Experience using Git


- Experience with back-end testing


Preferred:


- Experience defining, building and maintaining RESTful APIs (huge plus)


- Strong understanding of clean design and UX


- Familiarity with web analytic systems and concepts


Educational Requirements & Qualifications:


Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related degree, certification, or equivalent work experience. 


A minimum of 5-7 years of demonstrable experience with an active portfolio is required.  Advanced skill sets, and the ability to work independently with minimal oversight on complex technical project are a must.  The successful candidate will be well versed with standard terms and web protocols used in the domain. He/she must be able to design highly reliable back-end systems that span multiple technologies, and has used more than one web framework in a professional capacity and is well-versed with the idioms of those frameworks.


 Must have the ability to work well under pressure and thrive in a fast paced deadline driven environment.  Employee must be willing to increase skill set by utilizing employer paid training opportunities.

item.title: Platform Engineer at Keen IO (San Francisco, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Keen IO is seeking engineers to join our Platform team. We build and nurture an Analytics API that processes user data and queries around the clock, across diverse industries. Whether it’s gaming, e-commerce, advertising, publishing, or IoT, our platform aims to make Analytics so easy for developers that they can focus entirely on their product. Every day, every week, every month our challenge is to scale with a constantly growing data deluge and evolve along with our user’s needs.


About the Platform Team


We work together in a pretty novel fashion - servant leaders are elected from the team, by the team. Responsibilities normally held by a single manager are separated across multiple roles. We have very open discussions about our shared priorities.


We’re always iterating on how we work and what we build. We’re growing fast and we know that what worked a year ago won’t necessarily work a year from now. This applies both to the technology and the organizations of our teams. We want to provide the best analytics experience for developers and co-create the best work environment for each other - willingness to evolve is essential.


About the Job


By centralizing a data pipeline for hundreds of companies, we operate at a scale that none of them have to worry about. Looking to the horizon, we need to look at every piece of our infrastructure with a critical eye. We need to stay ahead of the curve. You will help us be thoughtful and deliberate about tackling the right bottlenecks at the right time. You’ll help make working on the platform easier and easier. You’ll have the opportunity to gain deep understanding of distributed systems and teach others! Most importantly, you’ll collaborate with some pretty amazing humans.

item.title: Senior Full Stack Developer - $50/hr at Crossover (Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam) (allows remote)
item.description:
Senior Full Stack Developer - $50/hr



We are mobi. And we’re looking for some more awesome senior developers to help us grow our team. Here’s a little about our team, if you think you’d be a good fit, apply using the link below!



The Company:


mobi is not only headquartered in the fastest growing technology center in the United States, but also literally at the center of it all in Austin, Texas at 7th and Congress.



We code systems that crunch large streams of real-time GPS data by wielding complex geo-location algorithms. Some call it big data, we call it Monday. Our front-end code serves up this data in an easy-as-pie, business-friendly view. We crunch it, and we serve it. mobi provides an end-to-end solution that helps companies plan work, optimize routes, visualize GPS data and analyze the results. We’re innovating here – but we can’t tell you about it, until at least our second date.



The Role:


Our team is all about getting s#!t done. We are pragmatic problem solvers who pull from a diverse technology tool set.




  • Write killer code in many languages – solid and robust




  • Test before, during, and after – TDD on steroids




  • Core tech stack is JVM/Java/Groovy, JS/AngularJS and SQL




  • Thirst and passion for raising the bar and making it better than it is now




  • Social team players in a real open space environment with music and significant shenanigans






  • Have a large tool box: Clojure (functional paradigms), Ruby/Chef/DevOps, Sinatra/Rails, hardcore shell scripting, high performance C++ engines, SQL datamarts, sproc-ing and data pumping; you must have enough tools to use the right one for the job




  • We are real-deal Agile: good design, heavy testing, continuous delivery, pair programming in an open space environment, and lots of communication




  • Have an optimization platform that uses genetic algorithms and economic modeling to create optimal solutions to the ‘Traveling Salesman’ problem




  • Embrace the inner, twisted technologist – hackathons, side projects, open source




  • Enjoy ping pong, nerf bullets, and long walks on the beach ;)

item.title: Linux Operations Engineer at Spinn3r (San Francisco, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Job Responsibilities



  • Make sure our infrastructure stays up and running 24/7.

  • Repair nodes as they fail and deploy new hardware as we scale our infrastructure.

  • Perform task related to deploying new software, managing DNS, maintaining OS security patches, etc.

  • We have an existing infrastructure that you will be managing for the next 90 days as we transition to our new stack.  

  • Deploy new systems and scale our infrastructure as we expand our capacity for more content and customers.


Ideal Candidate


We are looking for people outside of the U.S. and Canada to maximize our time zone distribution. Ideally there should be least a 4 hour overlap with the Pacific Standard Time Zone (PST / UTC-8). We're based out of San Francisco but are migrating to the international level. If you don't have a natural time overlap with UTC-8 you should be willing to work evenings to be able to communicate easily with the rest of the team.


Culturally, we’re a remote company and want to embrace it as a way to reward our employees. We are fine with you working in remote locations as long as you’re generally available for communication and are productive.


The plan is to transfer all operations management to you, including being on call for outages, and knowing our operations tasks including bringing up new machines, dealing with failures, etc.


We want someone to come in full time as a contractor role. I suspect we will need about 40 hours from you per week.  


Architecture:


Our infrastructure consists of Java on Linux (Debian/Ubuntu) with the stack running on ActiveMQ, Cassandra, Zookeeper, and Jetty. We use Ansible to manage our boxes. We have a full-text search engine based on Elasticsearch and store our firehose API data within Cassandra.


We have a totally new stack and infrastructure at this point. We recently did a full-stack rewrite and moved all the old code to our new infrastructure. This means we have very little legacy cruft to deal with.


Here's all the cool stuff you get to play with:



  • Large Linux / Ubuntu cluster running with the OS versioned using both Ansible and our own debian packages for software distribution.

  • Massive amount of data indexed from the web and social media.  We index from 5-20TB of data per month and want to expand to 100TB of data per month.

  • Large Cassandra install on SSD.  

  • SOLR / Elastic Search migration / install.  We’re experimenting with bringing this up now so it would be valuable to get your feedback.


Compensation:



  • Salary based on experience. We're willing to be competitive and a great company to work for.

  • Ability to work remotely at home. Live work balance is a must.

item.title: Newsroom Developer (Front-end Interactive) at Financial Times (London, UK)
item.description:
The Financial Times technology department is hiring a developer to join Interactive News, a joint Technology & Editorial team, working in the newsroom.


We are a cross-functional team of data- visual- and coder-journalists. We work with other reporters and editors from across the FT to develop engaging forms of digital journalism. This includes data visualisation, infographics, maps, multimedia long form articles, microsites, news apps, video graphics and experimentation with audio. We also create tools for the newsroom.


Much of our code is public on Github. Take a look:



  • github.com/financial-times

  • github.com/ft-interactive

item.title: Database Programmer and Developer at University of Oxford (UK)
item.description:
NUFFIELD DEPARTMENT OF ORTHOPAEDICS, RHEUMATOLOGY AND MUSCULOSKELETAL SCIENCES


Database Programmer and Developer (119821)


Grade 7: Salary in the range of £30,434 to £31,342 per annum


We are seeking a Database Programmer and Developer within the Nuffield Department of Orthopaedics, Rheumatology and Musculoskeletal Sciences (NDORMS) located at the Botnar Research Centre, Oxford.


You will be responsible for maintaining, expanding and developing complex software used to support several research projects run by the Epidemiology Unit as well as assessing and improving the quality of the software through appropriate testing during the development process. Duties will also include writing readable code with good documentation and developing and maintaining the Epidemiology Unit website. You will also advise other members of the group on IT methodologies and procedures.


You will have a degree in computer science or equivalent technical qualification and will be proficient in developing and maintaining web applications for data capture written in PHP using HTML5/CSS/Javascript. You will also have expertise in developing and maintaining console and web applications as well as skills in testing both console and web applications. Sound knowledge of the relational database model, SQL, data management and MySQL is essential. Knowledge of working in a mixed computing environment involving Windows and Linux servers and experience of working with confidential data and related software (e.g. TrueCrypt) would be desirable.


This is a full-time fixed term appointment for one year.
