The closing date for this position is 12 noon on Wednesday 30 September 2015. You will be required to upload a supporting statement and CV as part of your online application. Interviews will be held on 7 October 2015.


To apply for this role and for further details, including the job description and selection criteria, please click on the link below: 


https://www.recruit.ox.ac.uk/pls/hrisliverecruit/erq_jobspec_version_4.jobspec?p_id=119821

item.title: Principal Platform Architect at Coupang (Palo Alto, CA)
item.description:
The Principal Platform Architect is responsible for the design and implementation of Coupang’s backend platform.  Successful candidate will work in a collaborative environment with Coupang’s architecture committee to recommend improvements to our platform.  The candidate will also work closely with strategic agile teams developing new components to enhance the services provided to Coupang’s customers.


Joining the Coupang USA team will give you an opportunity to work with a world-class development team on disruptive technologies and applications including:



  • Highly Scalable and Reliable services oriented architecture

  • Big Data Analytics supporting data collection, modeling, and optimization

  • Strategic domains such as mobile payments, pricing, search, personalization, and supply chain management

  • Consumer driven web and native mobile interfaces and APIs

item.title: Senior C++ Software Engineer at Bloomberg LP (London, UK)
item.description:
The nX Systems R&D team, based in Lugano - Switzerland, is seeking an experienced software engineer with an in-depth knowledge of C++.

You will build resilient, scalable, high-performance back-ends for critical client-facing financial applications.

You will be responsible for the full process of software delivery, starting from feature definition through scoping, implementation, debugging, rollout, monitoring, and maintenance. This includes software development and engineering tasks, as well as coordination and communication.

item.title: Web Software Engineer - Equities Technology at BATS Chi-X Europe (London, UK)
item.description:
You will be a highly motivated developer who will build and maintain a broad range of web applications that perform a critical role in allowing our team to control, monitor and analyse our cutting-edge trading platform. Some of our web applications process millions of requests a day and are used by our members and the investing public for presenting high quality market data.


You will be responsible for designing, developing and testing these high-performance, scalable, data-driven web applications with professional browser-based interfaces using Javascript, CSS, SQL and Python.


You will be involved in all aspects of the software development lifecycle and thrive in an environment where you deliver quality code into production on a frequent basis. We are aggressive and agile. We care about code quality. We care about testing. We care about automation. We care about the user experience.

item.title: Web Stack Software Engineer (PHP/Symfony2) at Captiveyes (Tallahassee, FL)
item.description:
Captiveyes is a location-based media company, focusing on indoor digital billboards, Wi-Fi hotspots, and mobile application advertising. Captiveyes is currently seeking a full-time (40hr/week) software engineer.


The candidate must be proficient in PHP5 and relational databases such as MySQL. The ideal candidate will have experience working with the Symfony2 framework and a Linux environment. We are also interested in applicants with skill sets in data mining or system administration. 


Candidates must be willing to relocate to either Tallahassee or Tampa, Florida.

item.title: Data Scientist (HF) - CDI/Paris at Mosaïc Finance (Paris, France)
item.description:
Nous recherchons un(e) Data Scientist pour travailler au sein de l’équipe de recherche quantitative, en collaboration avec nos équipes informatique (notamment BigData) et de trading. Votre mission principale sera l’exploration des données de marchés et de nos données propriétaires afin de mener des analyses permettant de répondre à nos problématiques fonctionnelles.

Vous participerez entre autres à nos projets de modélisation de la liquidité de marché et de son impact sur le P&L, ou encore à l’optimisation dynamique de nos limites de risque.


Pour cela, vous aurez à :



  • Construire et produire des indicateurs liés à nos activités,

  • Utiliser notre cluster Hadoop afin d’explorer les données stockées en base,

  • Réaliser des analyses pertinentes (de risques, de liquidité, du P&L, de latence…),

  • Créer des modèles de nos données à partir de vos analyses,

  • Intégrer ces modèles/produits dans nos process internes à l’aide de visualisations et d’interfaces utilisateurs.

item.title: Senior Full Stack Engineer - .net and AngularJS at comScore (Reston, VA)
item.description:
The comScore Survey Tech team is looking for a full stack Senior .NET Software Engineer who is familiar with all layers in software development. You will design and build high-scale applications that process large datasets and develop web applications for internal/external users. You will be working in a fast-paced environment, where we iterate quickly and work with cutting edge technologies. This is an exciting opportunity for developers with strong analytical and system design skills.



Essential Duties:



  • Participate in the requirements gathering, design and development of new systems to be incorporated into and improve the existing processing environment

  • Design and build scalable, high availability web services and portals

  • Work in a fast paced and agile development environment.

  • Manage multiple assignments and balance workload according to priorities

  • Collaborate and mentor team members to identify and implement project solutions

item.title: GO Software Engineer - Machine Learning Startup at Voleon Capital Management (Berkeley, CA)
item.description:
You will architect and implement new production trading systems, machine learning infrastructure, data integration pipelines, and large-scale storage systems. The firm researches and deploys systematic trading strategies designed to generate attractive returns without being dependent on the performance of the overall market.


We seek candidates with a proven track record of writing correct, well-designed software, solving hard problems, and delivering complex projects on time. You should preferably have experience designing and implementing fault-tolerant distributed systems. Experience with building large-scale data infrastructure, stream processing systems, or latency-sensitive programs is a bonus.



The above job description is just a starting point in terms of possible duties and seniority. We can be very flexible for the right person.

item.title: Application Developer For IB - Instant Messaging Product at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:

Instant Bloomberg (IB) is Bloomberg's instant messaging system, which is used by the Bloomberg community for real-time communication including exchanging quotes, trade ideas, news and other financial information. We have a user-base unlike any other in the company and handle close to 250 million post events per day. This usage is expected to grow even more in the future.

The IB Application team is responsible for developing/maintaining new client facing features to keep our product competitive and also cater to the growing demands of our clients. We work very closely with our clients and business representatives to seek requirements and implement creative solutions. This position also requires collaborating closely with our core infrastructure teams for UI development thereby providing great opportunities for learning and networking.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer, Platform at Flixster (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
For this position, we’re looking for a senior software engineer who excels at understanding big systems and how different types of client and third-party integrations interact with said system. Your work will involve integrating the services provided by our backend with our web and mobile clients, but also across middleware layers internally, and with external services. It takes a steady approach, a high standard for quality and reliability, and the willingness and ability to own many small and large parts of a high volume, high visibility workflow.


Responsibilities



  • You will own a set of small to large integrations across different internal and external services. Scalability and reliability is a key factor. Movie-goers around the country are depending on you!

  • You work closely with consumers and producers of the data, be it mobile client teams, our backend team, or an external service provider. Coordination and planning improvements and new features across these constituents will be key.

  • You build it, you run it. You design and implement robust software and the operational capabilities to keep things humming (trending, alerting, etc.)

  • You champion high quality and best engineering practices

item.title: Senior Front-End Developer at Luminus Networks (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
You are an expert front-end developer with at least 6 years of experience and you are deeply familiar with Javascript, HTML and CSS. You live and breathe responsive, API-driven web development and have experience with one or more Javascript MVC frameworks. You have used created striking data visualizations using the D3 framework or similar. You love working with visual designers and realizing their cutting-edge UI/UX in a modern browser environment.


Responsibilities:


-          Develop new user-facing features


-          Invent ways to present very large amounts of data in a concise manner


-          Build reusable code and libraries for future use


-          Ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs


-          Optimize application for maximum speed and scalability


-          Assure that all user input is validated before submitting to back-end


-          Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders

item.title: Web Crawling Frontend Developer at Bloomberg LP (Princeton, NJ)
item.description:
The Role:

Data Technologies R&D in our Princeton, NJ office is seeking a talented, motivated UI programmer to assist in re-imagining and development of our Web Crawler creation application suite. Bloomberg's web crawling technologies are some of the most advanced web scraping capabilities in the world. Candidate must be experienced in designing and coding applications, possess strong object-oriented analysis and design skills, and have experience with web technologies (html, xml, xslt, http). Candidate should have significant experience in the areas of multi-threading and design patterns.

item.title: Systems Engineer at Qadium (San Francisco, CA)
item.description: Qadium is looking for a full-stack Software Engineer with a systems background.  We're looking for people driven to intimately understand the software they create and work with. Do you enjoy building complex systems? Are you always thinking about what would happen if your software had to handle 10X more data? Do you want to work in an environment where you will be able to make an immediate impact writing software that scales? We are looking for an independent, imaginative thinker who can design scalable, reliable solutions to complex problems.

item.title: Team Lead Platform at Watty AB (Stockholm, Sweden)
item.description:
Watty is connecting and making sense of the world's energy data in order to help consumers and companies use energy in smarter way. Our platform already handles 20 million data points per day - and it will be your your job to continue improving our platform to handle a 1000 times more. You will be involved in the whole development cycle from planning to coding and testing to deployment. You would make sure that the development processes flows smoothly to ensure our continuous deployment. You will lead the backend team that currently has two developers and you will report to Watty’s CTO.


Without a strong passion for what we do, and for developing your own skills, you'll find the work here too difficult.


The role offers a unique opportunity to take ownership over Watty's entire platform that may well handle a significant portion of the world's energy data within the next 10 years. You'll work alongside a passionate team that has built the market leading technology in the field of disaggregation. As the Platform Team Lead you will not only be part of the team but also of the company through equity compensation. Read more on watty.io.

item.title: iOS Developer at Toptal (San Francisco, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
We are looking for a Swift and/or Objective-C developer responsible for the development and maintenance of applications aimed at iPhone, iPad, and Apple Watch. Your primary focus will be the development of iOS applications and their integration with back-end services, although some projects may require you to handle all technical aspects, including leveraging BaaS solutions such as Parse. You will be working alongside other engineers and developers working on different layers of the infrastructure. Therefore, a commitment to collaborative problem solving, sophisticated design, and the creation of quality products is essential.


By joining the Toptal network, you’ll have the opportunity to work on many client projects ranging from start-ups to Fortune 500s with teams of highly skilled experts from around the world.


This is a remote position that can be done from anywhere.


Responsibilities



  • Design and build applications for the iOS platform.

  • Ensure the best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications.

  • Collaborate with a team to define, design, and ship new features.

  • Identify bottlenecks and bugs, and devise solutions to these problems.

  • Help maintain code quality, organization, and automation.

  • Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders.

  • Take smart risks and champion new ideas.

item.title: Software Engineer at imo.im (Palo Alto, CA)
item.description:
We are currently seeking experienced software engineering generalists to work on our messaging platform. We are growing quickly and are looking for developers who have experience with highly-scalable distributed systems. We have 4 main teams here: Backend, Android, iOS, and Audio/Video.

Our ideal candidate has a strong background in data structures, algorithms, design, and coding. This is a great opportunity to be an early employee at a fast growing company.


Requirements:



  • BS/MS/PhD in computer science (or the equivalent)

  • Strong grasp of data structures and algorithms

  • 1+ years of experience at a company that went through a significant growth stage


Extra credit:



  • Experience building and designing scalable distributed systems

  • Ability to design and implement systems in Python

  • Extensive experience writing networking code in C/C++

  • Thorough understanding of TCP/IP and network programming

  • Adept at hacking open source software


Compensation & Perks:



  • Competitive salary plus $30K starting bonus and stock options

  • $500/month housing stipend for living within a five-mile radius of the office

  • Four weeks of paid vacation per year (plus paid holidays and sick days)

  • 401(k), medical, dental and vision benefits

  • Access to a concierge medical group

  • Catered lunch or dinner daily and a fully-stocked kitchen

  • Data plan reimbursement

  • Gym membership at Equinox

  • Yearly conference stipend

  • Custom imo shoes on each of your imo anniversaries

  • imo-sponsored team events and outings

item.title: iOS Developer at Fling (London, UK)
item.description:
We’re looking for a product-focused iOS Developer who feels just as comfortable thinking through how a feature feels to a user as they do thinking about the most efficient ways to store and present information. Fling is a quick paced environment where we are always looking to push ourselves to deliver the best experience possible for our end users. This means that anyone who joins our team will have the opportunity to have real impact, where your voice and opinions really count and you're not just building someone else's ideas.


As an iOS developer you will:



  • Have a voice in the way we structure our team and what processes we follow.

  • Work closely with our Design team to help to produce a cutting edge, engaging experience for our users.

  • Participate in tight, collaborative conversations with our Backend team on how to structure our RESTful API endpoints to ensure that the app can get the data it needs in the most efficient manner.


What we need from you:



  • Team player.

  • A passion for iOS, having built and maintained multiple substantial apps from end to end.

  • Experience building consumer products with a wide install base and keeping that base happy through regular updates.

  • Extreme comfort with everything from Core Data and keeping this in sync with the data on the server to building a beautiful interface.

  • A real desire to improve the team by sharing your knowledge through whiteboard sessions, share meetings and everyday interactions.

  • A pragmatic approach to investigating any new tools that could be useful to the team.


Interesting technologies coming up in the pipeline:



  • Unit testing because we need to move quickly and maintain a quality product.

  • AVFoundation because we are really pushing the limits of the camera.

  • OpenGL because the little touches count.

  • XMPP because allowing people to interact is what drives us.

  • Swift because Apple said.

item.title: Senior Software Development Engineer at Apptio (Bellevue, WA)
item.description:
The Position:


Help us create our market-defining SaaS enterprise applications! In this role, you will be responsible for designing and delivering a variety of exciting and challenging user-facing functionality. For example, our work includes interactive modeling, business intelligence and creating an extensible applications framework. The right candidate will be a solid JavaScript developer, collaborate exceptionally, have a knack for delivering appealing UI and demand a high-performance environment.


Job Responsibilities:



  • Thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative, cross-functional, agile environment.

  • Team with product management to define desired capabilities.

  • Design and deliver those capabilities with state-of-the art rich interfaces in JavaScript.

  • Contribute procedures, tools and practices to optimize team productivity.

  • Analyze problems from internal and external customers, debug and provide fixes.

  • Deliver initial quality, design for automated test-ability, and write unit tests.

  • Essential Qualifications and Experience:

  • Passion, energy and the desire to work very hard to deliver cool software.

  • Object-oriented software engineering with Java and JavaScript.

  • Complex object (data) models and business rules.

  • Large scale, data-driven web business applications, preferably SaaS.

  • Rich user interfaces with web 2.0 technology such as BI, graphical manipulation or complex tabular UIs.

  • Collaborative work style; effective communication; cross-functional teamwork.

  • Able to work with product management, field staff and customers to clarify requirements.

  • Experience delivering commercial software; familiarity with common roles and responsibilities, product and release life cycle, source code and change management, etc.

  • B.S. in Computer Science or equivalent experience.

item.title: Senior PHP Backend Developer to work with Real-Time Sports Data at Visca Web (Barcelona, Spain)
item.description:
As we continue our efforts to build and improve the best multi-provider sports database which serves millions of sports fans around the world every year, we are looking for talented and passionate developers who share our objective of producing clean and quality code to join us in this ambitious and challenging project.


Your role: As Senior Backend Developer in Visca Web, you will be part of the team responsible for the core system of the project. You will read, analyze and match voluminous amounts of sports data (match, competitions, teams and players statistics) from several providers, process them and ensure real-time delivery to our users thanks to the latest technologies available.


Beyond programming, you will be expected to solve a variety of technical and logical challenges in a creative and efficient way.

item.title: Senior Developer, API/Backend (Python) at National Geographic Society (Washington, DC)
item.description: The National Geographic Society is seeking a Senior API/Services Developer to lead the development of our APIs and web services that power thought-provoking content experiences and communities that inspire people to care about the planet.  Responsibilities include growing the Python expertise on the team as we build our next generation of APIs and web services, ensuring the success of these applications, and working with the rest of the team on the continued development of our technical landscape.  Scalability, availability, code quality, and accelerated delivery should be part of the daily process, in a highly collaborative agile project environment. No supervision  exercised.

item.title: Senior back end developer at well funded startup at Arivale (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
Arivale is launching an entirely new sector based on scientific wellness with a goal to maximize wellness and minimize disease. Our scientific co-founder, Lee Hood, is a pioneer in the study of human genetics and helped invent 5 instruments at the heart of modern genetics. Dr. Hood has co-founded over a dozen biotech companies, including Amgen, Applied Biosystems, Systemix, Darwin, and Rosetta.  

We joined Arivale because we are highly optimistic about the potential to make a positive difference in the lives of millions of people. We hold each other accountable to achieve ambitious goals in a high trust environment. Additionally, we take employee wellness just as seriously as client wellness with benefits such as flexible time off and sick time policies, healthy snacks in the office, and Fitbits.

If you joined us tomorrow, you could find yourself working on any of the following projects:
- Client portals that present an ever growing set of personalized data and individualized recommendations in a delightful and intuitive way
- Mobile applications that enhance the Arivale experience and help clients make meaningful life changes
- Tools that make our coaches productive and enhance the client/coach relationship Analytics platforms that can drive scientific discoveries over insane amounts of personalized data
- Client communication platforms that automate our interactions with customers

We're looking for back end engineers that thrive on owning end-to-end solutions. As an early member of the team, you will have an opportunity to help us build the technical culture. We believe in well-crafted software, end-to-end ownership of projects, strong opinions loosely held, and rapid iteration. Our (current) stack is Python, AngularJS, Postgres, Docker, and AWS.

If you are interested, please send us your resume, LinkedIn profile, or Github repo.


Required qualifications
-Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field
-5+ years experience designing, developing, testing, and releasing high quality, consumer facing software products
-Expertise in at least one software layer (front end, back end, apps) and proficiency in one or more others (front end, back end, mobile apps, SQL and data modeling, DevOps, test automation)


Preferred qualifications
-A passion for the health and wellness space
-Previous experience and expertise using our existing stack (Python, Javscript, AngularJS, Postgres, Ionic, Docker, AWS)
-Proven success in delivering products and services in a high growth, startup environment
-Ability to exercise high judgment and work autonomously to deliver solutions to actual business problems
-A relentless drive to improve the status quo
-High standards for yourself and your team

item.title: Senior Front-End Engineer at Synthace Ltd. (London, UK)
item.description:
Synthace Ltd. are looking for a talented and experienced front end engineer to spearhead development of the AnthaOS user interface.


Antha is a high level language transforming biological engineering by turning laboratory protocols into executable code defining physical operations such as liquid handling alongside logical operations and data processing. AnthaOS defines the execution environment for Antha processes and defines a number of front-end components for users to manage jobs, track stocks and examine data in addition to custom interfaces for more specialised purposes.


Day-to-day, you’ll be working with a tight-knit, multidisciplinary development team on an exciting project with plenty of technical challenge to get your teeth into. Technically, you’ll be delivering a web-based front end in Google Polymer across both mobile and desktop platforms, handling backend communications via SocketIO and RESTful services. Personally, you will be as meticulous in your attention to detail as you are uncompromising in your commitment to maintaining first class development practices and making user experience the first priority, values you will actively encourage in others.

item.title: Senior Java Developer at Eyefreight - Utrecht Area (Bunnik, Netherlands)
item.description:
Working in one of the SCRUM based product teams (10 developers, two architects, three testers, two product owners and a product manager), the Senior Java Developer will be responsible for maintaining, designing and developing the core product’s new functionality, as well as for extending existing functionality - maintaining Eyefreight’s quality and robustness.

In collaboration with the client team, the Senior Java Developer will also extend standard functionality to suit customer needs. Typically, this results in a product configuration containing a bundle of customized screens, actions and system interfaces.

Upcoming projects:



  • Merging the current JSF UI framework to a JavaScript client-side UI framework;

  • B2B integration of customer data concerning sales and transport order data and shipment information, using web services (SOAP and REST) with JAXB and batch processing;

  • Integration of a search engine for efficient querying of data, reducing database load;

  • Dependency injection within the OSGi context using OSGi Blueprint Service specification.

item.title: Solution Architect to Design Global Retail Technology at Footlocker.com / Eastbay (Wausau, WI)
item.description:
Footlocker.com / Eastbay is on the cutting edge of on-line retail technology. Our evolution has led us to improve our systems and strengthen our teams. We are searching for an ambitious, tech-savvy and forward thinking Solution Architect to drive the Strategic Solution roadmap. This is a rare opportunity to serve on a digital systems team of architects and high-level developers to design our future ecommerce platform. In this highly burstable environment, you will be challenged to integrate systems to create a single solution.


Footlocker.com / Eastbay operates the direct to consumer business for Foot Locker, Inc. - the world's leading retailer of athletically inspired footwear and apparel. Our brands include Footlocker, Eastbay, Champs Sports, Footaction, Kids Footlocker, Lady Footlocker and SIX:02. In fact we manage 16 of the largest sport inspired web and mobile sites on the net, which enjoy over 250 million visits per year.


At Footlocker.com / Eastbay, the Solution Architect is a key role in our ability to exceed customer expectations in an efficient manner. You will design and develop effective solutions that continue to keep our teams and organization moving forward through:



  • Satisfying our customers, product owners and stakeholders through technical excellence and unsurpassed service.

  • Capitalizing on the elastic environment

  • Delivering innovative solutions that increase customer value and embrace simplicity, speed, adaptability and sustainability.

  • Identifying when to use an existing pattern or differentiate for efficiency and competitive advantage.

  • Designing solutions that empower our team and our next generation to succeed.

  • Acting as a subject matter expert across one or more core solutions.

  • Facilitating solution reviews.

  • Serving as a mentor to other team members.

  • Acting as a key participant in high-level estimation for prioritization.

  • Leading a delivery team in a way that aligns with the expectations of a scrum master.

item.title: Awesome Senior Devops Engineer needed at Taxibeat Ltd (, ) (allows remote)
item.description:
We are looking for an awesome DevOps Engineer to join our highly skilled development team, to help manage and drive operational systems, requirements and tool sets.  Taxibeat has numerous custom, complex systems running in our data centers to provide traffic and routing information. We are looking for someone who can take full control of our existing systems and infrastructure while helping us make decisions about new infrastructure and technologies to make it better.


The successful candidate will be a team player, capable of collaborating in a fast paced, devops oriented environment as well capable of working very independently with a high level of self-motivation.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - Front End at Appian Corporation (Reston, VA)
item.description:
At Appian, you will help us build our award-winning PaaS product that enables business people to build cloud and mobile enterprise applications with flexible, visual models instead of custom code. Appian discovers and unites enterprise data, connects users through social and collaborative engagement in the context of business data, and provides the leading suite of business process technology to enable rapid application development and optimization in every industry.


As a member of the Interface Designer team, you will help build a tool for creating dynamic, interactive interfaces.  Your goal is to enable designers to build complex interfaces using an intuitive, easy-to-use tool that provides live feedback at design time, allowing them to test the interface immediately as they build it.

item.title: Partner and Software Engineer - High Frequency Trading Hedge Fund in Boston at Domeyard LP (Boston, MA)
item.description:
Domeyard is a hedge fund focused on high frequency trading. We are backed by the founders of one of the largest hedge funds in the world ($55 billion in AUM) and pioneers behind one of the largest public internet companies in Asia. 


We are a flat organization, in which the founders sit next to the interns, and traditional titles don't exist. Our flexible work hours, casual dress code, startup environment (open office with a gaming room, snack pantry, catered food) and generous employee perks (insurance, transportation, phone, health and dental coverage) ensure that you can commit fully to your intellectual interests. We welcome cultural diversity and are able to sponsor H1-B visas. 



Our vision is to set new thresholds for modern computing.
We take pride in possessing some of the fastest trading technologies in the world. Our software engineers build the latest technologies to manage petabytes of data and generate fast, data-driven insights. Every day is a learning exercise: you will explore the frontiers of computer science, in areas such as distributed systems, concurrency, operating systems, networks, computer architecture, data analysis and UI design. We develop and iterate quickly; you will have access to every line of code and can switch between many projects.

Apply to join us! (Takes ~5 min.) 
We are looking for people who share our passion for technology, add a fun-loving character to our team, and inspire each other's growth. We also seek potential candidates that we can help nurture, which is why no financial experience is expected. You will be joining as an early team member and influencing the firm's direction, and have the opportunity to lead a team of software engineers within a few years. Feel free to show us any work that demonstrates your interests, e.g. code samples, academic publications, GitHub projects.

item.title: Discovery Software Engineer (m/f) at Rocket Internet SE (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
About the Role


Rocket Internet’s discovery team is a fast-growing interdisciplinary team of engineers that design, build and maintain a real-time data platform that is at the heart of the search and recommendation experience of our e-commerce and marketplace ventures. We are looking for engineers who don’t like to be pigeon-holed into one role, but look beyond the platform’s current direction and are able to anticipate what needs to be in place in six months to support future platform development and growth. The day-to-day tasks of the infrastructure and relevance engineers on the team range from building a global infrastructure that handles millions of requests per second to development of powerful ranking algorithms based on statistical models derived from large data sets as much as intuition.

item.title: Software Engineer (learning golang!) at Permission Data (New York, NY)
item.description:
@Permission Data we are in the process of completely overhauling our tech stack. We've chosen Go as our primary implementation language, and are creating a scale-able microservice architecture.


Have you heard all about go but not had a chance to try it out? Have you played around with it on side projects but not been able to use it at your work?

This is your opportunity. We are a small team who is using go for our next generation platform and we are looking for interested, talented developers from mid to senior level.


Work will encompass the full stack. For the front end we are using aurelia.io. On the database side we use what is most appropriate for the service. Currently that means we have postgres, mysql, and redis, with cassandra soon to follow.

We are automating our pipeline with saltstack, DCOS, Marathon, and Drone.


The team is small (9 people), so you have the ability to make a big impact. We do a lunch and learn every other Wednesday, but are constantly pushing each other to learn more in our slack channels. 

We believe in a healthy work-life balance, and use agile practices to facilitate that.


We believe in contributing to open source.


We are unable to sponsor any visas at this time.

item.title: Full Stack Web Developer at Sensoria Inc. (Redmond, WA)
item.description:
We are looking for a passionate, hard-working, talented, and experienced full-stack web developer, who has a strong interest in building innovative products.


You are a smart developer, and a great team player. You write elegant code in a variety of languages. You thrive designing for scalability, You like to learn new frameworks and languages.


You will be part of a small, highly skilled development team, to extend our platform and services to support Sensoria ecosystem, including client apps, web UX, API, data storage and data crunching (Azure Storage, SQL Server, ElasticSearch, ApacheSpark, etc.).


We have big dreams and need you now!

item.title: Mobile iOS Developer (f/m) at UBIMET GmbH (Wien, Österreich)
item.description:
UBIMET has its headquarters in Vienna, Austria and ranks among the leading weather service providers in Europe. International experts in the fields of meteorology, physics, biology and geography issue customized, individual and precise weather forecasts for several millions private and industrial customers in many countries. The company founders and the shareholder (Red Bull) pursue the goal to be the weather service with the world's best quality forecasts. In order to deal with a rapidly growing number of potential clients, we are looking for highly skilled, exceptional people to reinforce our team in the position of


Mobile iOS Developer (f/m)


(iOS, Full-time)


As part of the Mobile Development team you will develop the latest and greatest mobile weather apps. This is an amazing opportunity to be involved in every step of the development process, from brainstorming product ideas, to pushing apps outside the door.


Key Responsibilities



  • Development of intricate and innovative native weather apps

  • Participation and contribution in all phases of the product development lifecycle, including requirements definition, specifications, development, testing, product release and maintenance

  • Contribution to the existing mobile app portfolio for B2C markets

  • Maintainance and development of new features for existing apps

  • Implementation of Proof of Concepts for internal projects

  • Close intra-departmental collaboration with User Experience Designers and the Meteorological Development team

  • Evaluation of new technologies


We offer



  • International working environment

  • Excellent career opportunities

  • Workplace with a focus on Free / Open Source Software

  • Comprehensive training within a friendly atmosphere

  • Incentive pay

item.title: VP Software Development at CoheroHealth (New York, NY)
item.description: We are seeking an organized, hard-working individual to lead our software development team to build products across Android, iOS and our back end server.  You will help architect design of our software, lead an agile release process, drive product and feature prioritization, and oversee development.  You will manage our external team of software engineers to set the technical vision, guide code architecture, ensure quality of work and make sure deadlines are met.  The applicant must have strong technical abilities to be able to evaluate code, along with project management skills to develop and stick to development timelines.

item.title: Sr. Engineer- UI at AudienceScience (Bellevue, WA)
item.description:
AudienceScience is seeking a talented Senior Software Development Engineer with focus on UI to join our team.  You’ll work on an agile team in the SAAS arena, building the JavaScript infrastructure to support AudienceScience Gateway, a global media buying platform using real-time bidding and behavioral targeting technologies. We currently handle upwards of 9 billion requests per day, aggregating all of this data on our Hadoop clusters. Experience in Objected Oriented JavaScript is required and Ampersand/Backbone experience a big plus.


Essential functions:



  • Design and implement pages for Buyer UI using HTML, CSS, jQuery/Backbone/Ampersand JavaScript frameworks, working closely with back-end Java developers to integrate with Spring MVC web application.

item.title: Front End JavaScript Engineer for Connected Buildings Movement at Lucid (Oakland, CA)
item.description:
As part of the JavaScript engineering team you will work on our core platform, BuildingOS. You will write software that changes how people interact with commercial buildings, brings legacy building technology online, and enables the deployment of the next generation of building IoT devices. You will work closely with a world-class Product Design team to solve hard user interface problems, and you will contribute to the open source libraries and tools that we are using to solve those problems.


We are looking for an experienced engineer who writes simple, composable, and reusable UI code. You'll work on the new UI that we're building in React and Flux, and you'll help migrate our legacy Backbone and jQuery apps to the new framework. We love clear, elegant code, and we value tooling and testing that helps us to move fast and experiment with new ideas.


This position is full-time and based in our office in downtown Oakland, CA.


Responsibilities



  • Work with Product Designers to build analytics, data visualization, and mapping applications

  • Build efficient and reusable front-end components

  • Identify and address performance bottlenecks

  • Participate in design and code reviews

  • Communicate and advocate for best practices for front-end engineering

item.title: DevOps Engineer at Lasso Data Systems Inc. (Richmond, BC, Canada) (allows remote)
item.description:
Position: DevOps Engineer


Day to Day


We work in a Kanban-Scrum hybrid environment. A typical day starts off with a daily developer update posted to Slack, the rest is spent on the software. Weekly, we have a team retrospective, and a meeting with business to discuss direction (not everyone need attend).


Work Environment


We take our software very seriously while fostering a relaxed, fun(ny), and supportive environment. Here is a list of things we like about Lasso:



  • Monday Lunch and Learns and free lunch on Thursdays

  • Excellent coffee, free pop, and fresh fruit

  • Gym and a napping couch

  • Our work stations (typically: four monitors, mechanical keyboards, and 32GB of RAM)

  • Run whatever OS, we really don’t care

  • No code in production without a review (GitHub pull-requests)

  • Work from home day once a week

  • Internal reading group because we care about training

  • The developers got to write this posting

item.title: Principal Engineer at First. (Durham, NC) (allows remote)
item.description:
About First.


First is a venture-funded startup at the intersection of predictive analytics and real estate tech. We identify when and why people will move, and build products to change the game for real estate professionals and consumers.


Our team is focused on shipping great products and driving innovation in a massive industry (2014 realtor commissions were >$69B). We believe in continuous improvement and sharing knowledge - whether through pair programming, speaking at meetups, and eventually open-sourcing parts of our system.


We’re moving fast and ready for a technical leader to join our CTO in building initial product offerings and automating our data platform.


Engineering


As one of our first engineers, you'll be a senior leader helping guide key architecture and technology decisions. You will reliably scale our data platform to support products and the needs of our data science team. This includes choosing and deploying our server and compute infrastructure (e.g., Ansible, Hadoop, Spark, etc) and building frameworks to support the development of our predictive models.

item.title: Java / Python Integration Developer - Multiple roles at different levels at BAE Systems Applied Intelligence (Guildford, UK)
item.description:
You will join a vibrant and experienced team of software engineers. You will focus on the implementation/integration of cutting edge technologies with the aim of improving end user experience and information exchange capabilities within a heterogeneous data landscape.


Working within a dedicated team, you will be responsible for integration and configuration of technical solutions with support from some of the best innovators in the business as well as maintaining up-to-date technical design documents and test plans. You will be instrumental in helping to maintain the technical superiority of the Managed Security Service as well as contributing towards the technological and business goals of the Cyber Security business unit.


You will work across a diverse range of tools, technologies and infrastructure which includes Hadoop (HortonWorks), ElasticSearch, Accumulo, HP ArcSight, CA Service Desk, LifeRay and CA Site Minder in terms of configuration and integration to achieve greater automation and efficiency.


You will be driven by getting the best out of tools and technology and wish to improve integration and interoperability between toolsets favouring configuration and integration over new product development. You will have a sound knowledge of software engineering practices and the development lifecycle.

item.title: Software Engineer at Hachi Labs (Bangalore, India)
item.description:
Come help us create the future of Hachi!


WE:
- at http://gohachi.com - are solving the problem of how people find and reach out to each other - a google map for people and relationships.
- Use PHP, MySQL, Neo4j, Sphinx, AWS, Git
- Are seeing excellent user-traction
- Have 41M+ people on Hachi. And their Billion+ relationships.
- Featured by MIT Tech Review, Techcrunch, Business Insider, and others
- Recipient of California Excellence Award 2013 (for software), Nominee World Technology Award 2012 (presented in association w/ TIME, CNN, Fortune, Technology Review, Science & Kurzweil AI; co nominees - Instagram, Pinterest)
- Have tons of data-engineering and data-science problems for you to solve.


WHAT WE ARE LOOKING TO DO -
- We have some technical debt that we accumulated - blame it on inexperience, hurry to keep up with user-growth, adding more features, etc. Now we want to fix things and put a rock solid platform for future growth.
- Oh, and we cannot stop scaling, so we need to re-architect things while meeting demand-growth.
- And we also need to add new features, to keep our competitive edge.


YOU:
- Cringe when you look at bad code and bad practices. But instead of complaining, you set things right, even educate others
- Are a really strong developer, with 4-6 years of experience (2-3 years of PHP experience highly preferred)
- Have experience with database / query tuning and performance.
- Polyglots get bonus points. Experience across different types of languages gets mega-bonus points. Open source contributors get a red-carpet welcome to the interview.
- Have experience working with a legacy system and then incrementally re-architecting things, adding tests, etc.
- Are disciplined about unit testing, continuous-integration and other good habits (honestly, we are not yet there and we'd like your help)
- Are a good communicator.
- Believe in data-driven decisions.


IF INTERESTED:
Check out the product and give us your critical analysis. Share your Github profile along with resume. Email at: careers@gohachi.com.

item.title: User Interface Designer (Bootstrap, CSS3, HTML5) at DataFinch Technologies (Atlanta, GA)
item.description:
DataFinch Technologies is looking for a hands-on UI/UX developer to design and improve the user interface of our rapidly evolving, data collection platform for Autism. This designer will work with both mobile and web based designs for iOS, Android and desktop environments.

DataFinch has developed a web and mobile data collection system that is used by more than 20,000 kids with Autism in 14+ countries.

In this role the Front-end Developer will maintain and improve the platforms existing user interface as well as collaborate directly with the product manager, operations team and developers to design and implement UI for new features being added to the application (design, test, prototype, implement).

The product is a web-based business application and the interface must balance aesthetics, simplicity and functionality. There is room for innovative design, but with a bias towards efficiency and fundamental usability.

Our company culture is entrepreneurial and practical; our working style is agile and collaborative. Its an environment that demands a personality that can take initiative and lead and rewards a good team player. If you're not afraid to roll up your sleeves and get your hands dirty you'll fit right in.


Benefits



  • Health, Vision, Dental, 401(k)

  • Catered Lunch every Friday

  • One click build & deployments

  • Flex hours

  • Conference reimbursement

  • Choice of hardware & software tools

  • 25 days PTO

  • Laid back, enjoyable environment

  • Soft drinks & snacks

  • Video games/Cable TV and other Toys

  • Bean bags

item.title: Software Development Engineer - Machine Learning at Workday (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Please Note: 
- This position requires existing work-authorization in the United States.
- If you don't already have U.S. work authorization, please don't submit your resume.


About the Team:
SYMAN is the agile data-engineering team within Workday. We build predictive analytics into Workday’s applications to help the world’s largest companies make strategic decisions about their people and finances. We are the former Identified team recently acquired by Workday.


This is an opportunity to contribute to the technology behind data normalization, search relevance, recommendation systems, and machine learning. And you’ll need to accomplish all this while achieving horizontal scalability and high availability.


We have retained our startup culture and are continuing to apply our agile principles within the larger organization. We don’t believe in QA for the kind of work we do, so the burden of quality falls on the developers. We practice scrum, pair programming, extensive automated testing, and continuous deployment. We expect that you have 3-5 years’ experience and a CS related degree.


Does this describe you working on a new generation data development team in a fast pace environment? If yes, please apply!

item.title: SAP HANA Test Cloud (Senior) Developer Job at SAP SE (Walldorf, Deutschland)
item.description:
COMPANY DESCRIPTION

SAP is the global market leader for business software and thus contributes a considerable part of the world's economic power grid. At SAP you get your chance to put your ideas into action with maximum impact.As a member of the SAP HANA Infrastructure team you are equally in charge for preparing the playgrounds for new innovative development tasks as well as for constructing and operating a stable productive environment to support our fully automated development process. Backed by a data center full of high end servers we do more than just Continuous Integration. We do state-of-the-art C++ development based on Open Source components like Linux, Jenkins, Bugzilla, Gerrit, Git, CMake and Python that have proven to be a solid base for large scale development. Be excited about all the impressive things we do in addition to produce great software.

EXPECTATIONS AND TASKS

As a (Senior) Developer in the SAP HANA Database team you will be working with a group of exceptionally talented and motivated colleagues. You will need to:
- Develop and improve the HANA build- & test infrastructure
- Debug complex SAP HANA infrastructure issues
- Administrate, monitor and maintain SAP HANA infrastructure components and test servers Your tasks will also include:
- Close cooperation with the SAP HANA Database development, enabling core developers to provide new coding in quality as fast as possible
- Continuously improve the quality of the SAP HANA Database by implementing new quality measures

WORK EXPERIENCE

- 3+ years of relevant work experience

EDUCATION AND QUALIFICATION / SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES

Required skills We require that you meet the core competencies and skills listed below:
- Advanced skills & experience with Linux/ Unix, network & storage system
- Very good analytical skills, familiarity with root cause analysis, debugging and analyzing complex problems
- Knowledge of cutting-edge approaches in software quality assurance
- Basic knowledge of data base architectures
- Ability to work well in close teamwork in an distributed team over several international locations
- German and English both spoken and written Programming knowledge:
- Good knowledge of software architecture and object-oriented design
- Python and Shell-Scripting Preferred skills A plus will be skills in:
- Using Git, Gerrit, Jenkins & Bugzilla APIs
- Perl & C++
- Parallel programming/distribution strategies for data or tasks
- Code profilers & code checkers like CPP checker or address sanitizer
- GNU Make, CMake, Ninja
- Cluster file systems (GPFS, OCFS)101014132

item.title: Senior Software Engineer-Java/Scala at HERE, a Nokia company (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
Do you wish to work on technologies like Java, Scala, Git, Linux, Bash, Splunk, AWS EC2?


If yes, keep reading…


We are hiring a Senior Software Engineer-Java/Scala for our HERE Places team.



About the Team


The HERE Places API team is a part of the HERE Search and Places group. We work with an agile process and every team member gets the opportunity to analyse, develop and test software. The team supports the analysis of usage data, monitoring of production systems as well as supporting clients of the API.


The API layer is implemented in Scala and we are committed to test-driven development and pervasive automation of everyday tasks. 


We run extensive functional and performance test suites upon every commit. We also make extensive use of Java in the search backend as well as JavaScript for our playground and demo UIs.



Key Responsibilities



  • End-to-end delivery of new features of the HERE Places API  


         -Work with Product Management to analyse requirements


         -Plan and implement new features in cooperation with other teams


         -Ensure quality of software and documentation


         -Click the Release Button



  • Evolve the existing automated testing and deployment architecture as needed to fulfill new requirements

item.title: Software Engineer, Compute Infrastructure at Salesforce (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Salesforce.com hosts web services and applications written by thousands of internal developers and tens of thousands of customers to provide the largest business automation cloud on the planet.  The compute infrastructure that enables this innovation and value is evolving to fully embrace lights-out operations, single-click deploy to tens of thousands of nodes, and services that self-heal and self-optimize.


Salesforce is building out our compute infrastructure team to reinvigorate the way we deliver, deploy, operate, secure, monitor, and repair our data centers and the code that runs across them - at consumer web scale.  We are looking to add experienced distributed systems engineers who can step up and own big chunks of that vision.


What’s In It For You




  • Eat, sleep, and breathe services.  You have experience balancing live-site management, feature delivery, and retirement of technical debt,




  • Have strong, heartfelt opinions on CAP theorem, can sketch out four different consistency models on a single napkin and defend each of them, and understand Paxos and Zookeeper at an implementation level.




  • Familiarity with crash-only and recovery-oriented software design.




  • Excited by building reliable, self-healing services on unreliable hardware.




  • Experience designing, developing, debugging, and operating resilient distributed systems that run across thousands of compute nodes in multiple datacenters.




  • Agilista capable of delivering thin slices of end-to-end functionality on a regular cadence

item.title: Senior Java Developer at Infusion (Toronto, ON, Canada)
item.description:
The Opportunity:



  • Working with one of our capital markets clients on a large scale, complex, highly visible project to understand their product vision and requirements.

  • Providing technical consulting to clients while recommending technologies and solution options that provide critical business operations such as processing multi-billion dollar transactions quickly and error free.

  • Working with cross functional teams to build, engineer, architect and design an electronic trading and risk management solutions

  • Using your Java background in development to work collaboratively with capital markets Traders and IT professionals to brainstorm use cases and problem solve issues.


  WHY INFUSION: 



  • You’ll build your portfolio by working alongside various capital markets leaders on a variety of large, complex, multi-million dollar projects.

  • We’re about transformation. You’ll be challenged to come up with creative solutions working on new technologies.

  • We invest in you. We host programming contest, hackathons and fun training sessions to keep you on top of your game.

  • You’re supported. Whether it’s a training, mentorship, breakfast basket, pizza, spa services, or Infusion’s monthly social events, Infusion takes care of you. 

  • Career progression is real. You will move up if you have the drive.

  • Our Infusion Air program gives you the opportunity to work on projects out of our global offices in North America and Europe.

item.title: Senior full stack developer at well funded startup at Arivale (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
Arivale is launching an entirely new sector based on scientific wellness with a goal to maximize wellness and minimize disease. Our scientific co-founder, Lee Hood, is a pioneer in the study of human genetics and helped invent 5 instruments at the heart of modern genetics. Dr. Hood has co-founded over a dozen biotech companies, including Amgen, Applied Biosystems, Systemix, Darwin, and Rosetta.  

We joined Arivale because we are highly optimistic about the potential to make a positive difference in the lives of millions of people. We hold each other accountable to achieve ambitious goals in a high trust environment. Additionally, we take employee wellness just as seriously as client wellness with benefits such as flexible time off and sick time policies, healthy snacks in the office, and Fitbits.

If you joined us tomorrow, you could find yourself working on any of the following projects:
- Client portals that present an ever growing set of personalized data and individualized recommendations in a delightful and intuitive way
- Mobile applications that enhance the Arivale experience and help clients make meaningful life changes
- Tools that make our coaches productive and enhance the client/coach relationship Analytics platforms that can drive scientific discoveries over insane amounts of personalized data
- Client communication platforms that automate our interactions with customers

We're looking for full stack engineers that thrive on owning end-to-end solutions. As an early member of the team, you will have an opportunity to help us build the technical culture. We believe in well-crafted software, end-to-end ownership of projects, strong opinions loosely held, and rapid iteration. Our (current) stack is Python, AngularJS, Postgres, Docker, and AWS.

If you are interested, please forward your resume, LinkedIn profile, or Github repo.


Required qualifications
-Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field
-5+ years experience designing, developing, testing, and releasing high quality, consumer facing software products
-Expertise in at least one software layer (front end, back end, apps) and proficiency in one or more others (front end, back end, mobile apps, SQL and data modeling, DevOps, test automation)


Preferred qualifications
-A passion for the health and wellness space
-Previous experience and expertise using our existing stack (Python, Javscript, AngularJS, Postgres, Ionic, Docker, AWS)
-Proven success in delivering products and services in a high growth, startup environment
-Ability to exercise high judgment and work autonomously to deliver solutions to actual business problems
-A relentless drive to improve the status quo
-High standards for yourself and your team

item.title: Write Code, Learn from the Best, Change the World! at Literacy Bridge (Seattle, WA) (allows remote)
item.description:
If you want to learn and apply a broad range of technologies while helping the world’s poorest people avoid hunger and deadly diseases, then this unique opportunity may be for you. Through partnerships with organizations like UNICEF, Literacy Bridge uses technology to help people in some of the world’s most remote villages, often without electricity, learn to grow more food and stay healthy.  We do this today for 175,000 people; with your help, we will reach millions more.


You will be Literacy Bridge’s first full-time software engineer, working in a startup-like environment with the mentorship of volunteer senior engineers from places like Twitter, BMW, Zillow, Groupon, Tableau Software, and the Apache Software Foundation. You will work on a broad range of projects such as our:



  • Java-based audio content management system to allow people around the world to contribute local-language audio recordings of health and agriculture knowledge


  • Java-based usage statistics data gathering system integrated with visual data analysis and reporting


  • C-based firmware of our Talking Book audio computer, a battery-operated device with an innovative audio-based interface and the ability to conduct and track quizzes on knowledge retention


Note about working remotely: To work remotely, we would require an initial 3-6 months in Seattle, U.S., and ongoing semi-annual visits for one or two weeks.


You would also have the opportunity to travel to Ghana to meet with our users, partners, and local staff.

item.title: Senior Backend Engineer at Falcon Social (Copenhagen, Denmark)
item.description:
Falcon Social is a Software-as-a-Service provider in the Social Media Management space. We provide a unified approach for marketers, customer service specialists and hr personnel of big international brands to manage their social media presence. That means plenty of challenging engineering tasks, complex UIs to simplify and data, loads of data.


We are looking for senior members for our engineering team. You are joining an ambitious team of experts who keep pushing the limit in product delivery and experiment furiously while striving for technical excellence.


We are agile, organized ourselves into cross-functional, autonomous teams, focusing on one product with a clear mission. We intend to be flat, with everyone equal and with each member's role respected. Day-to-day you will work together with people of different trades: frontend, backend engineers, ui/ux designers, cloud operation engineers, and product owners.


We are a maturing startup with an engineering headcount of 20. We are not small anymore, and still growing rapidly. Working at a startup is the most rewarding choice that one can make, but it requires a certain personality as well. That being said, we value open people who take initiative more than lone rockstars.


Falcon Social’s frontend is a single page web application built with AngularJs, Bower, Grunt, D3.js on top of a REST flavored HTTP+JSON api served by a lightweight Java8 backend running on DropWizard, PostgreSQL, ElasticSearch, AWS, Apache Spark and Python.


This job requires extensive Java programming language experience and also the knowledge of how modern Java is done. We favor lightweight frameworks like DropWizard, we value a good domain model (DDD), we think in single responsibility (micro)services, we prefer good refactoring skills, pragmatism and craftsmanship.

item.title: Security Architect at Exaptive (Oklahoma City, OK)
item.description:
Exaptive, Inc is an MIT affiliated, fast-growing software startup that has offices in Oklahoma City, Boston and Vancouver, Canada. We are now expanding our Oklahoma City team. 

We are looking for an experience security architect that has designed scaleable and secure web application, and is also comfortable performing penetration testing and security analysis of systems. 

Some of the challenges of designing the Exaptive platform is that its goal is to be extended by third-party components, and those components will be bought and sold in a component store much like the Apple app store. This opens up opportunities for malicious code as well as introducing the complexity of financial transaction processing. On top of that, Exaptive frequently gets used for data science in fields that have confidential and proprietary data. So we're looking for someone with experience designing architectures that can deal with these things - someone with experience designing sandbox systems for large-scale multi-user environments, with financial transaction processsing applications, and with designing systems with secure data handling. 

This position will be based in downtown OKC, but with the opportunity for travel to Exaptive's Boston and Vancouver locations. The position will have the opportunity to evolve into a role in which the person has an equity-stake in the company. The right person will be excited about the dynamic and fast-paced (aka stressful) environment of a startup and view that as a benefit, not a drawback. The startup environment is not for everyone, but for the person who is looking for that sort of life experience, the opportunity to help build something from the ground up where individual contributions make immediate and substantial impacts on the company as a whole can be extremely rewarding. 

Those interested can find out more about the company, and view some demo videos of our software in actionon our website: www.exaptive.com. We were featured on the front page of the Business Innovation section of The Boston Globe (http://www.boston.com/business/technology/innoeco/2013/12/cambridge-based_exaptive_wants.html) and in Oklahoma City's The Journal Record (http://www.i2e.org/news/innovators-exaptive-inc/). Our Founder and CEO, Dave King, has been invited internationally to present our work. You can see a video of a presentation he recently gave to the Oklahoma Venture Forum about Exaptive's big-picture vision on our website. 


If you don't currently live in Oklahoma City, you should check out what this up-and-coming city has to offer: a burgeoning tech startup and creative sector, the largest food truck event in the nation, olympic rowing facilities, and a cost of living that can't be beat. For the right candidate we'll pay relocation costs.

item.title: Manager, Software Engineering at Rubicon Project (Los Angeles, CA)
item.description:
Do you live to solve problems, technical and otherwise?  Do you take responsibility where others fear to tread? Are you passionate, fast and detail-oriented in your work?  Can you communicate as readily with executives as with developers?  Do you want to manage people while staying technically hands-on?


If your answers to these questions are “yes”, great!  The Rubicon Project is growing, and we need development managers who are thorough and agile, capable of breaking down and solving complex problems, and have a strong will to get things done.  In the Data Pipeline team you will work on real-world problems working on big data sets where accuracy and speed are paramount, take responsibility for your systems end-to-end and influence the direction of our technology that impacts customers around the world.


Primary Responsibilities:



  • Be an end-to-end owner of software services spanning technology boundaries

  • Translate business requirements into technical designs and project plans

  • Write production-ready code and unit tests that meet both system and business requirements

  • Respond to feature requests, bug reports, performance issues and ad-hoc questions

  • Work collaboratively with multiple teams to deliver quality software

  • Support operation of services in production

  • Line manager of other developers

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Advidi (Amsterdam, Nederland)
item.description:
If you would like to be involved in shaping the future of internet advertising (innovation), develop features which will be exposed to hundreds of millions of users every day (big data), go off the beaten path to design and develop high performance and high availability web applications (challenges), then you will be pleased with what Advidi has to offer. The Advidi SOA is composed of multiple critical components which are handling large amounts of live traffic and is the backbone of our business workflow. Thus, high availability, zero-downtime and minimum response times are critical.


We like to organize ourselves in small, focused, autonomous teams (4 or 5 developers and a product owner). You will have a say in architecture, planning, and how new product features are designed. During the trimester planning, you’ll also have the opportunity to bring your ideas to the table and take part in planning new features and initiatives.


As a Senior Software Engineer you will be responsible for the development of exciting new features for the company’s core software products and for extending and maintaining our SOA. We are looking for people who love clean code, work in a test-driven manner, would like to work on projects that add value to business and would enjoy working within an inspirational environment.

item.title: Database Administrator at Cognitive Medical Systems (San Diego, CA)
item.description: We are looking for a SQL Server DBA with ability to help architect and maintain multiple databases for development and production environments. This person should also have familiarity with data access techniques across multiple platforms and have the flexibility to support non-Microsoft operating systems and tools.

item.title: Senior Automation And Monitoring Middleware Developer at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:

The UI Infrastructure team provides the building blocks used by the firm's 3000+ R&D employees to deliver high-quality, high-performance functionality to our customers in a timely manner. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to work across a number of development scrum teams to support an agile continuous development and deployment environment. Strong technical and programming skills, excellent problem solving skills required. Day to day tasks involve development and integration of the Bloomberg Terminal's back-end infrastructure and the CI and monitoring framework needed for deployment and troubleshooting. The candidate will be responsible for ensuring the reliability, scalability and performance of the applications that are running on this infrastructure, as well as the long term evolution of the deployment monitoring infrastructure. The candidate will have experience with automation and monitoring using tools and technologies such as Jenkins, JIRA, Chef, Python, web and cloud services across a range of platforms including Windows, Linux, Solaris, and AIX.

item.title: Back-end Web Developer at Sorenson Media (Draper, UT)
item.description:
The Backend web developer will design, implement, and oversee the operations of systems to manage a high volume, commercially valuable, and technically challenging data stream. The project involves several aspects typical of current data-science: near real time, large volumes, transformations, escrow into reportable forms, analysis for patterns, long term storage, and global scope. The system is being built inside Amazon’s AWS cloud using state of the art technologies.


Duties & Responsibilities:



  • Responsible for designing an overall solution to the problem: proper subsystem selection, partitioning of the processing problems, operations, and analysis of the business problems must be considered.

  • Responsible for scaling and availability of the designed system.

  • Defines appropriate data archival strategy appropriate to working with massive scale, exponentially increasing datasets

  • Responsible for scaling backend data storage platforms spanning to a multi petabyte storage environment

  • Manages Amazon Web Services (AWS) footprint including costs, evolution, privacy, security, etc.

  • Must be able to integrate the new system with existing products and infrastructure.

  • Configures virtualized environments within AWS to support organizational goals (to include VPN, gateways, routing, security groups, IAM policy, and virtual hosts)

  • Leads the effort surrounding traditional Extract, Transform, and Load capabilities with the ability to crossover to modern message bus technology such as Apache Storm, RabbitMQ, and/or AWS Kinesis

  • Shows a strong ability to see below the superficial first layers of complex problem spaces—efficiently employs the tools appropriate to solve the problem at hand

item.title: Server-Side Software Engineer at Retroficiency, Inc. (Boston, MA)
item.description:
As a Server-Side Software Engineer at Retroficiency, you will specialize in developing back-end systems and APIs that support our front-end developers. You will play a key role in helping us design and deploy SaaS cloud-based products that are innovative and unique in our industry.


We are looking for a talented, experienced software engineer comfortable with modern libraries, build tools, workflow, and object-oriented design patterns. This role requires strong analytical skills, commitment to quality, collaborative work ethic, and cutting-edge coding skills. You should be rooted in object-oriented design and development and be comfortable with an Agile development approach.


Role Summary



  • Write server-side code for web-based, SaaS applications; develop prototypes quickly and create robust production SaaS services

  • Work closely with Building Energy domain experts to devise and develop product requirements, features, and algorithms

  • Work closely with Front-end engineers to develop and implement robust API services

  • Utilize object-orient design patterns in the implementation of reusable, performant, and secure components

  • Write subsystems that communicate in real time to external services using Web Services and/or APIs

  • Possess a strong understanding of relational (MySQL) database design concepts

  • Manage your own time and work well both independently and as part of a team

  • Translate agile software development stories into reusable units of functionality. Ability to estimate level of effort and prototype as necessary

item.title: Senior Software Engineer Java/Big Data at Criteo (Grenoble, France)
item.description:
CRITEO is looking to recruit senior software developers who turn it up to eleven for its R&D Center in Grenoble (South-East from France). Your main missions will be to :


- Build systems that make the best decision in 50ms, half a million times per second. Across three continents and six datacenters, 24/7.


- Find the signal hidden in tens of TB of data, in one hour, using over a thousand nodes on our Hadoop cluster. And constantly keep getting better at it while measuring the impact on our business.


- Get stuff done. A problem partially solved today is better than a perfect solution next year. Have an idea during the night ? Code it in the morning, push it at noon, test it in the afternoon and deploy it the next morning.


- High stakes, high rewards: 1% increase in performance may yield millions for the company. But if a single bug goes through, the Internet goes down (we’re only half joking).


- Develop open source projects. Because we are working at the forefront of technology, we are dealing with problems that few have faced. We’re big users of open source, and we’d like to give back to the community.

item.title: Lead Engineer, Metrics Aggregation Pipeline at New Relic (Portland, OR)
item.description:
At New Relic, we build amazing tools that provide deep insight into web apps and services. We make sense of billions of metrics about millions of applications, all in real time. Our comprehensive SaaS-based solution for web and mobile applications consolidates performance-monitoring data into a single, powerful interface.


We’re looking for an extraordinary engineer to play a key role in designing and implementing the backend server systems that power the New Relic platform. In this role, you’ll work with a wickedly smart team to create the next generation of our data pipeline that receives, aggregates, stores and queries more bytes per second than Twitter.

item.title: Senior Application Developer at Contentive (London, UK)
item.description:
You might not have heard of Contentive yet. But we are about to make a lot of noise.


We're not one of those big, slow moving companies that are suffocating under its own weight. Instead, we're working to build a world-class platform with a great team in a high performing environment.


Our focus is firmly on developing our own products. Already we’ve deployed a mature stack that reaches a global audience. But we want to build more and continually evolve what we already have.


This includes content management systems, user insight tools, data harvesting, powerful reporting and analysis, marketing automation and dynamic content delivery – and that’s just the beginning.  The landscape we work in is always evolving and we evolve with it. Marrying one piece of tech when there are new offerings arriving every day, well, we don’t want to get left behind and our Developers love that. 


To be the best we need the best People and Products


This is a crucial hire for Contentive and one that is key to ensuring our products evolve and drive our company into a market leading position.


To achieve this you will work within our hive of discovery, learning and mastery that leverages a variety of technologies. For example: we might look at Python/Django for one project, maybe Python/Pyramid for another, how about MongoDB, ElasticSearch or Cassandra for something else, even PHP/Postgres for the odd job and for the front-end... SASS!


You will take ownership of the development process, ensure product iterations are successfully delivered, provide input to product design and technology decisions and help other developers improve and learn.


Reporting into our Head of Technology, you will work in agile/scrum team among other developers, data architects, testers, creatives, and product managers.

item.title: Android Developer at Autoloop (Clearwater, FL) (allows remote)
item.description:
AutoLoop is seeking experienced Android developers to help us bring several native mobile apps to market. 


Our office is located in Clearwater, FL. We are open to telecommuters for this position. Remote candidates need a dedicated office at home, a fast, reliable internet connection, and a good setup for Skype chats. We use Skype during interviews, and good video/audio quality is absolutely necessary.

item.title: (Associate) Developer for SAP HANA Database Development Infrastructure Job at SAP SE (Walldorf, Deutschland)
item.description:
COMPANY DESCRIPTION

SAP is the global market leader for business software and thus contributes a considerable part of the world's economic power grid. At SAP you get your chance to put your ideas into action with maximum impact.The SAP HANA Database is the basis for new, ground-breaking SAP applications and is widely agreed to be a highly valuable asset in the SAP software portfolio. In-memory computing is made possible through recent technology advances in main memory, multi-core processing, and data management. It leverages technology innovation to establish real-time analysis of business data and combines both transactions and analytics to improve existing business processes with a dramatic increase in performance. The SAP HANA Database as basis for the in-memory computing shows enormous promise as a key driver for the SAP market of the future. The SAP HANA Database Infrastructure team develops the infrastructure for the SAP HANA Database developers. It supports continuous integration of C++ coding into the SAP HANA Database core engine, featuring state-of-the-art bug & patch tracking, code review, sophisticated automated testing facilities and advanced release management systems.
