Major components are Git, Gerrit, Jenkins and Bugzilla with custom-tailored extensions in conjunction with in-house developed software. We seek graduates to extend our SAP HANA Infrastructure team.

EXPECTATIONS AND TASKS

As an (Associate) Developer in the SAP HANA Database team you will be working with a group of exceptionally talented and motivated colleagues. You will need to:
- Develop and improve the HANA build- & test infrastructure
- Debug complex SAP HANA infrastructure issues
- Administrate, monitor and maintain SAP HANA infrastructure components and test servers Your tasks will also include:
- Close cooperation with the SAP HANA Database development, enabling core developers to provide new coding in quality as fast as possible
- Continuously improve the quality of the SAP HANA Database by implementing new quality measures
- Work closely together with the SAP HANA Build team and the SAP HANA Delivery team

WORK EXPERIENCE

We seek an (Associate) Developer (0-2 years work experience). We are looking for candidates who are committed to a technology career path. Your set of application documents should contain a cover letter and tabular CV, copies of the obtained degrees and references (if available).

EDUCATION AND QUALIFICATION / SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES

We require that you meet the core competencies and skills listed below:
- Programming knowledge: - Good knowledge of software architecture and object-oriented design - Python and Shell-Scripting
- Advanced skills & experience with Linux/ Unix, network & storage system
- Very good analytical skills, familiarity with root cause analysis, debugging and analyzing complex problems
- Knowledge of cutting-edge approaches in software quality assurance
- Eagerness to improve quality of the continuous integration process for software written in C++
- Basic knowledge of data base architectures
- Ability to work well in close teamwork in an distributed team over several international locations
- German and English both spoken and written A plus will be skills in:
- Using Git, Gerrit, Jenkins & Bugzilla APIs
- Perl & C++
- Parallel programming/distribution strategies for data or tasks
- Code profilers & code checkers like CPP checker or address sanitizer
- GNU Make, CMake, Ninja
- Cluster file systems (GPFS, OCFS)101014132

item.title: Senior Backend Developer / Sys Admin at Greenhouse Innovation (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Greenhouse Innovation is looking for an ambitious, entrepreneurial back-end developer with System & Database Administrator experience, that helps us pave the way forward. You've been around the block in Back-end Land, but good is not yet good enough for you. Your view is broad: you don't hesitate to show your skills in other disciplines and enjoy bringing a team to a higher level.

We're proud of all our products, but in particular:



  • Selly: Our online retail platform featuring apps, backend & sites for shopping centres, shop keepers and consumers (sellyshopping.com)

  • Snipperwall: Leading the social conversation platform (snipperwall.com)

  • Snipper: The one-minute social video app (getsnipper.com)


This job posting allows you to work in these projects (and others on the horizon)


About the job
You'll help us extend & harden our Java-based backend infrastructure, help us make the jump to scaling it architecturally, server-wise, database-wise, storage-wise and code-wise.

You can help us streamline our database storage and retrieval for working on a globally scalable level, and maintain and improve our servers and toolsets both for internal and external use through the application of good tools and smart technologies.

Buzzwords to help you decide
MySQL meets NoSQL, Java, Tomcat, XML, JSON, HTTP, REST, Jersey, Jenkins, OAuth, async programming, map/reduce, scalability, security, Apple PNS/Google Cloud messaging, Cloud providers (Amazon AWS in particular), scripting (bash, python etc) and Linux/Unix knowledge is a must!


Note: You need an EU work permit for this job

item.title: User Interface Developer at Tenable Network Security (Columbia, MD) (allows remote)
item.description:
Tenable Network Security, founded in 2002, provides continuous network monitoring to identify vulnerabilities, reduce risk and ensure compliance.  Our products are relied upon by more than 20,000 organizations, including the entire U.S. Department of Defense and many of the world’s largest companies and governments --- -- we call this a start!

Our global expansion is creating job opportunities for creative thinkers who are wired for action and delivering big results. We’re also stacked with industry rock stars who are just as comfortable keynoting a conference or delivering a podcast as they are mentoring up-and-coming colleagues. But what our employees are most excited about is our products. Our market-defining technology provides continuous network monitoring to identify vulnerabilities, reduce risk and ensure compliance.



Tenable Network Security is looking for a self-motivated front-end web developer to assist in the design and implementation of a next-generation enterprise web application. 


Key Responsibilities:


As a key member of a small and versatile team, you will:



  • Design, prototype, and develop compelling user experiences

  • Research user needs and requirements and identify areas where changes can make maximum impact

  • Build dashboards and data models based on the Nessus product roadmap.

  • Work in a dynamic team oriented environment using agile methodologies

item.title: Distributed Systems Engineer (Spark/Scala) at Sharethrough (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Sharethrough is looking for engineers interested in tackling the problems of building large-scale, distributed- and stream-based processing systems.  As a Distributed Systems Engineer, you’ll work on:




  • Building fault-tolerant micro-services




  • Enhancing a low-latency decisioning engine responsible for complex predictive behaviour (at thousands of requests per second)




  • A streaming data pipeline supervising millions of daily events




Let’s talk if..




  • You have experience with delivering multithreaded and/or distributed JVM-based systems.  No experience with Scala?  Come learn!




  • You have experience with Spark and/or Spark Streaming or similar stream-based processing systems.  Experience with Hadoop-based pipelines, maybe a bit of Cascading or Scalding?  That works too, come give Spark a shot.



  • What you're building is as important to you as why you're building it.

item.title: Web Applications Engineer (Rails+) at Sharethrough (Austin, TX)
item.description:
As a full-stack engineer here you’ll contribute to everything from our 3rd-Party CoffeeScript deployed across hundreds of publishers like Time Inc. and Forbes, to our self-serve native content exchange with significant growth opportunities - from jumping into our Scala-based data pipeline and microservices to provisioning AWS resources with Chef.


Let’s talk if…




  • You speak (or are interested in speaking!) our stack: Rails, RSpec, CoffeeScript, Backbone.js, HAML, LESS, etc.




  • You take pride in treating software development as a craft and delivering SOLID well-tested code.




  • You derive deep satisfaction from participating in the problem definition and solution process with a diverse group from around the company.

item.title: Software Engineer .Net at Canada's Motorcycle (Montréal, QC, Canada)
item.description:
Canada's Motorcycle is looking for an experienced software developer to join our team. In this position, you will be responsible for building applications that will have a major impact on the operations of the company.


The applications you develop will automate processes across every department including:



  • order management (payment processing, fraud detection, purchasing)

  • warehouse management (logistics, pick & pack tools)

  • marketing (who knows what these guys really do...)

  • data management (we have LOTS of data)

  • reporting (are we making money??? ;)


You will work on everything from architecting the application, to creating the frontend and developing the backend (basically the full stack). 


So, if you enjoy working on a wide set of problems, having a big influence on the direction of the product you are building, working with a group of smart people (it's hard to be modest :), and are obsessed with writing clean/scalable/maintainable code, then we totally want you.

item.title: Chief Technology Officer at First Help Financial (Newton, MA)
item.description:
In order to continue rapid growth, First Help Financial ("FHF") is looking for a highly motivated Chief Technology Officer with leadership and hands-on experience in programming, database, and team management. As FHF is scaling its software system to meet growth, the CTO will be given great autonomy in the architecture and design of the stack.



Interested parties can send a cover letter, CV, & a link to an open source profile to parker@firsthelp.com

item.title: Principal Software Architect at Network of One (Santa Monica, CA)
item.description: We’re looking for a passionate, experienced software architect to help us design and build web applications and services that drive and support our Company’s online video content development efforts. As a team lead, you will be working with application groups, business groups, and internal/external technology partners to gather requirements, diagram proposed implementations, design new database schemae, determine data movement strategy, and work with operations staff to ensure data availability and recoverability. This position is full time and based in Santa Monica, CA.

item.title: Frontend Developer (m/f) at Celonis GmbH (München, Deutschland)
item.description:
What’s it like working at Celonis?



  • Rewarding work, knowing you’re working on something that adds real value to companies and to the people who love to use it.

  • Get it done. Zero bureaucracy. Make a direct impact.

  • Work together with passionate people who put team before ego. People who can turn on a dime and embrace rapid changes.

  • Work at the forefront of Process Mining and join us to create disruptive and world class data analytics solutions that will revolutionize how businesses see at their processes.

  • Work on a widely used standard software product with the highest standards and requirements.


What we give you in return



  • Top notch salary

  • Hardware of your choice

  • Develop with the latest tools, libraries, frameworks, and workflows with a high qualified team

  • No IE8 support

item.title: Sr ETL Developer at Integrity Digital Solutions (Temple, TX)
item.description: Integrity is seeking a full time ETL (Extract Transform Load) Developer to join our development team. This position will require working with the development, implementation, and operations teams to continue the development of the best electronic medical record on the planet.

item.title: Junior to Mid Level iOS Developer at lettrs at lettrs (New York, NY)
item.description:
We are looking for an iOS Developer who possesses a passion for pushing
mobile technologies to the limits and will work well with a startup team as well as in-house and third party developers to design and build the next generation of lettrs applications.


Responsibilities include:


Design and build advanced applications for the iOS platform.
Collaborate with in-house and out-house teams to define, design, and ship new features.
Work with outside data sources and API's.
Able to take on a large code base and take over as own responsibility.
Work on bug fixing and improving application performance.
Continuously discover, evaluate, and implement new technologies to maximize development efficiency.

item.title: Senior Back-End Engineer at LiveRamp (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
ABOUT LIVERAMP


LiveRamp is the leading data onboarder, enabling marketers to unify their customer database across disparate online marketing applications and leverage it for analytics, targeting, measurement, content optimization, and more.


ABOUT THIS JOB


Do you thirst to design, build, operate, debug, and optimize sophisticated distributed systems? Are you thrilled to creatively discover new ways to leverage 5 petabytes of data and 100 billion requests per month at lightning fast speeds? Do you love working collaboratively with intelligent, energetic, no-nonsense colleagues? Are you as nice as you are brilliant? Consider joining us.


RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Build, operate, and optimize large distributed systems.

  • Design and implement algorithms to efficiently process, analyze, and serve massive datasets on a 300+ node Hadoop cluster.

  • Be at the forefront of technology innovation. Keep LiveRamp on the cutting edge of industry tools and best practices.

  • Push your teammates to become stronger engineers. They will do the same for you.

  • Work on your own great ideas during Hackweeks (5 times per year!).

  • Contribute towards building a great company.


QUALIFICATIONS



  • 3+ years experience building scalabe and reliable products.

  • Comfort writing large-scale, high performance object-oriented code (bonus points for functional programming experience).

  • MapReduce or Java/C++ expertise or the brains and brawn to become an expert.

  • Good diagnostic and debugging sense, the ability to find a needle in a haystack or a bug in a program stack.

  • Type S(tartup) personality: smart, ethical, friendly, hard-working and proactive (no exceptions).

  • Desire to work in San Francisco. We will relocate you if necessary


EMPLOYEE BENEFITS



  • Work with talented, collaborative, and friendly people who love what they do.

  • Participate in a thriving culture. We host events such as weekly yoga, game nights, happy hour, and a two night camping trip.

  • Leverage our health insurance, dental insurance, vision insurance, 401K, and pre-tax commuter benefit.

  • Work in the heart of San Francisco - the best city in the world.

item.title: Consultants / Developer (m/w), deutschlandweit at codecentric AG (Düsseldorf, Germany)
item.description:
Deine Leidenschaft sind:


Agile, Agile Testing, Continuous Delivery, Software Architecture, DevOps, Cloud, Atlassian, Scala, Application Performance Management, Big Data, NoSQL, Data Analytics oder Search Technologies


Du hast den Anspruch, die aktuellen Trends zu kennen und Dich stetig weiterzuentwickeln? Du bist ideengetrieben und technologiebegeistert? Du wünscht Dir Extrazeit für Weiterbildung? Du findest flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle gut? Ein kreatives und abwechslungsreiches Arbeitsumfeld spricht Dich an?


Dann bist du bei codecentric richtig!


Als Consultant und Developer bei codecentric erhebst Du professionell den Kundenbedarf und führst anschließend als Spezialist unsere technologischen Themen beim Kunden vor Ort ein. Als Developer realisierst du in agilen Teams intern oder beim Kunden moderne Software Systeme. Bei uns musst du dich nicht zwischen Consulting und Development entscheiden, sondern erlebst beide Welten und lernst ständig dazu.

item.title: Systems Engineer & Devops at TAPTAP Networks S.L. (Madrid, Spain)
item.description:
• AWS experienced System administrator will participate in the daily monitoring, management, troubleshooting and issue resolution, as assigned, including but not limited to: OS, network, hardware, access and security, application Servers and log management.

  • Act as subject matter expert on Amazon Web Services Platform (AWS) 

  • Will support Servers hosted by Amazon 

  • Provide cross training and/or knowledge transfer to colleagues as necessary, particularly on the AWS platform

item.title: Sr Mobile Engineer at mappable (Berkeley, CA)
item.description:

This is a full time, onsite, staff position. We will not respond to individuals or companies offering off-site or consulting services.

item.title: Director of Engineering at Sonian, Inc. (Dedham, MA)
item.description:
Sonian is looking to hire an experienced cloud technologist as the Director of Engineering. In this role you will lead a team of experienced developers to deliver exciting new capabilities to our customers. Sonian is introducing 2 new products and launching a new brand this year. If you are an innovative and driven software professional passionate about shipping cloud technology – join our team!


What You’ll Do



  • Lead a team of developers in delivering new products and technology

  • Run at scale, deploying core technologies and new products for thousands of customers

  • Drive continuous and rapid delivery of software

  • Liaise with senior management and internal teams to ensure requirements are realized and delivered in a timely fashion

item.title: Want to Work with Satellites? at Orbit Logic Incorporated (Greenbelt, MD)
item.description: Do you love to solve problems & puzzles and be challenged? If Yes, then read more.  We are looking for software developers to work on one/all of desktop, web, mobile, on-board satellite applications. You need to have a fundamental understanding of object oriented methodology and data structures (at a minimum).  Orbit Logic is  an software engineering company that creates applications related to satellites/space/aircraft in the world of desktop/web/mobile/flight (satellites),  So the love of problem solving is a big requirement - candidates should love to solve problems & puzzles.  If you want to know more about Orbit Logic, take your first challenge and check us out : http://www.orbitlogic.com

item.title: UI/UX Developer at Qadium (San Francisco, CA)
item.description: Qadium is looking for a UI/UX Developer with an unrelenting focus on delivering polished and delightful user experiences.  We're looking for someone who can't help but obsess over each and every user flow and believes that intuitive and beautiful software solves as many problems in the enterprise space as it does in the consumer space.  We want someone with a keen appreciation for the power of visually displaying quantitative information.

item.title: Mobile Engineer at Appboy (New York, NY)
item.description: Appboy is looking for mobile engineers (iOS and Android) to help us expand and enhance our client SDKs. You’ll work with a team of committed developers on software that is running on hundreds of millions of devices around the world. Every member of our team is critical to success in an environment where interface design and usability are as essential as performance and footprint. Our ideal candidate is very interested in mobile development and has had some experience in coding (not necessarily in mobile).

item.title: Back End Software Engineer at McLaren Applied Technologies (Woking, UK)
item.description:
Software engineers at McLaren Applied Technologies create innovative solutions using the latest open source technologies. We need smart engineers who are passionate about technology to join our team and help us provide timely insight into data for our customers. Your technical expertise will help us design, develop, test, deploy, and enhance software solutions that move, store and analyze data quickly and efficiently. Responsibilities:



  • Create robust and scalable software that runs in the cloud.

  • Develop small prototypes and spikes that reduce risk.

item.title: Android Engineer at iCitizen (Nashville, TN)
item.description:
iCitizen, the leading civic engagement platform developed to revolutionize the way citizens identify and engage on issues they care about most, is seeking top talent with the right "will and skill" to join our team.


This business requires innovative thinking, balanced with a strong focus on quality and execution. Get ready to roll up your sleeves and solve some of the most complex big-data problems that will create efficiency in a large market and improve people's lives.


We are seeking a highly skilled Android engineer to develop our next generation of mobile apps. The ideal candidate will have a passion for clean code and the data driven design process. You'll work closely with the UI/UX team and product management to ensure our mobile apps are truly exceptional and delightful.

item.title: Backend developer at Benchmarking Alliance Nordic AB (Stockholm, Sweden)
item.description:
Benchmarking Alliance is the leading provider of web based tools for gathering, crunching and distribution of hospitality market statistics in the Nordic and Baltic countries. We are now looking for a talented and passionate developer to help us exploit the full potential of our business and at the same time meet the challenges of a growing IT startup. You will be working on and learning about all parts of our systems; frontend, backend, database and system architecture.


Formal education is not a requirement, most importantly we value your programming skills and passion for solving advanced technical problems. We offer a permanent contract with a competitive salary and benefits.


Why work at Benchmarking Alliance?


Benchmarking Alliance offers an exciting and fun work environment with challenging technical problems related to quantitative data ("big data"). We work according to a lean model where your code changes almost immediately will be used by thousands of customers. Since Benchmarking Alliance is a young and small company you also have a great opportunity to grow in the organisation. Even though we are small we have very close collaborations with a number of tech teams of the highest calibre, and you will have plenty of opportunities to discuss programming challenges.

item.title: C# Software Engineer Contractors needed at Abide Financial Ltd (Bristol, UK)
item.description:
We’re looking for excellent C# contractors!


Over the next six months we have a number of key deadlines to hit and are looking for contractors to work within our agile teams to help us build out new functionality and features, whilst maintaining our current production systems.


Our system will be cloud based (AWS) and will use SQL Server and non-relational databases to process, store, report and display large volumes of data.


We will require you to work within our Bristol office, functioning as a normal team member for a period of 3 to 6 months.

item.title: Java Programmer at RavenPack (Marbella, Spain)
item.description:
Position immediately available for an experienced software professional. You will work within an international team of developers skilled in Java, SQL, Python and Common Lisp.


The ideal candidate will have excellent skills as a software engineer and professional experience delivering backend applications developed and deployed on Linux.  You should be fluent in current Java technologies and tools.  Experience in the following technologies and procedures is a plus:



  • Continuous integration and test driven development practices

  • Project management and build automation tools: Maven, Sonatype Nexus and Jenkins

  • Knowledge and experience with J2EE frameworks

  • SQL and JPA

item.title: Software Engineer (Java) at R2integrated (Baltimore, MD)
item.description:
POSITION SUMMARY


Work with engineering team to develop web based applications.  Document, track and provide updates on project status.  Participate in code reviews and knowledge transfer sessions.


ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS OF THE JOB



  • Provide progress updates to team lead/project manager

  • Create/maintain data integration efforts within a Java Content Repository (JCR)

  • Work with and extend existing components to implement client requirements.

  • Design/Develop custom components.

  • Assist with creation of interfaces to external data sources


OTHER RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Assist in training of new staff

  • Provide technical support for clients.

  • Performs other related duties as required and assigned by management.

item.title: Senior Web Developer at Manalto Inc (Reston, VA)

item.title: Algorithm and Software Developers for Computational Biochemistry at D. E. Shaw Research (New York, NY)
item.description:
Extraordinarily gifted computational scientists and engineers are sought to join a New York–based interdisciplinary research group pursuing an ambitious, long-term project aimed at achieving major scientific advances in the field of biochemistry and fundamentally transforming the process of drug discovery. 


Candidates should have a demonstrated track record of academic, industrial, and/or open-source accomplishments.  Relevant areas of expertise might include parallel computing on high performance computing systems employing multi-core, GPU, or special-purpose architectures, numerical analysis, C/C++, or Python programming, data-intensive computing, compilers, operating systems, or distributed systems, but specific knowledge of and level of experience in any of these areas is less critical than exceptional intellectual ability.  We are prepared to reward exceptionally well-qualified individuals with above-market compensation. 


Among the group’s current research activities is the development of new algorithms and software for molecular dynamics simulation and data analysis both on commodity clusters and on Anton, a massively parallel special-purpose supercomputer of our group’s design.  Successful candidates will have the opportunity to work closely with a number of the world’s leading computational chemists and biologists, and to make fundamental contributions within the fields of biology, chemistry, and medicine.


To submit an application, please use the link provided below:
http://www.deshawresearch.com/recruit/jobs/Ads/StackOverflow/CS


D. E. Shaw Research does not discriminate in employment matters on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, pregnancy, national origin, age, military service eligibility, veteran status, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, or any other protected class.

item.title: Full Stack (Python) Developer at Hearst Corporation (New York, NY)
item.description:
We’re creating a game-changing modern content technology stack - built from the ground up to give our users, editors, and advertisers tools that enable them to tell these amazing stories. We’re using modern web technologies to do this, like Python, PHP and memcached. We’re building an open, service-oriented platform driven by APIs, and believe passionately in crafting simple, elegant solutions to complex technological and product problems. We are working with Big Data scientists to build a modern information pipeline for building intelligent and optimized media applications.

We’re hiring talented and passionate Software Engineers to solve problems as we build out our new platform. The ideal candidate has extensive experience working with distributed, service oriented architecture (SOA) systems, writing clean object-oriented code, building and working with RESTful APIs and has worked in cloud based environments like AWS.

item.title: Senior DevOps Engineer at ICFLIX (Dubai, United Arab Emirates)

Do you crave the adrenaline rush of supporting the production infrastructure that powers MENA’s first online streaming platforms offering thousands of hours of Arabic, Hollywood, Bollywood content to over 400 million people?  Are you a fanatic when it comes to quashing operational inefficiencies in web infrastructure?  Do you get a kick out of automating routine tasks with a few lines of code? Do you exemplify the ethic of, “If you have to do something more than once, automate it”?

item.title: R&D Team Leader Network Design And Security at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)

Will be involved in the full life cycle from requirements generation, development planning, development, implementation, feature and bug fix.

item.title: C / C++ Software Engineer at Tenable Network Security (Columbia, MD) (allows remote)
item.description:
Tenable Network Security, founded in 2002, provides continuous network monitoring to identify vulnerabilities, reduce risk and ensure compliance.  Our products are relied upon by more than 20,000 organizations, including the entire U.S. Department of Defense and many of the world’s largest companies and governments --- -- we call this a start!


Tenable Network Security, founded in 2002, provides continuous network monitoring to identify vulnerabilities, reduce risk and ensure compliance.  Our products are relied upon by more than 20,000 organizations, including the entire U.S. Department of Defense and many of the world’s largest companies and government.  

Our global expansion is creating job opportunities for creative thinkers who are wired for action and delivering big results. We’re also stacked with industry rock stars who are just as comfortable keynoting a conference or delivering a podcast as they are mentoring up-and-coming colleagues. But what our employees are most excited about is our products. Our market-defining technology provides continuous network monitoring to identify vulnerabilities, reduce risk, and ensure compliance.


Tenable is looking for a highly motivated C/C++ Software Engineer to join the Development team for the Log Correlation Engine (LCE) product. The Log Correlation Engine processes, classifies, stores, and correlates log data for customers to identify and eliminate network threats. 


Primary Responsibilities:



  • Plan, design, implement, and test features and improvements to the core of the Log Correlation Engine.

  • Collaborate with the technical lead, Research, and QA teams to produce coherent and comprehensive software solutions.

  • Work with log data, vulnerability data, and security logs to improve and expand existing capabilities.

  • Develop innovative object-oriented, reusable, and stable code, and deliver solutions on schedule in an Agile environment.

item.title: Developer Advocate (Evangelist)- Hot Open Source Software Company at Elasticsearch (Mountain View, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Want to work for one of the Coolest and Hottest Open Source Software Companies In The World


The Developer Relations program at Elastic focuses on increasing adoption of our technology and ensuring user success. In this role, you will serve as an advocate for Elastic's product line to Developer and Operations Professionals. Your primary role will be to engage with our user community through creating ops-oriented technical artifacts for our product stack, participating in user groups, representing the company at developer events and giving presentations on our technology.


Previous experience as a developer advocate or community manager very much preferred, but not required. Hands-on systems administration or DevOps experience strongly preferred. Excellent presentation skills required. Fluent business English is required, familiarity with other languages is a plus.


This role requires extensive travel; you should be comfortable with 50% time on the road, with peaks and troughs dependent upon the technical conference season.


Job Duties



  • Present about the Elastic product line and related topics at conferences (e.g. DevOps Days, Monitorama, and OSCON) and meetups, including technical demos

  • Keep finger on the pulse of tech trends, particularly in the DevOps world, and report back to the organization

  • Work with community to create configuration management artifacts (e.g. Ansible playbooks, Chef cookbooks, and Puppet modules) for our product stack as well as logstash plugins

  • Create programs to share the Elastic product story with our community, such as podcasts, community hangouts and/or office hours

  • Author content on our technology and ecosystem products for our blog and technical media outlets

  • Interact and build relationships with community members virtually and in person

  • Recruit user group organizers and speakers

  • Identify and amplify user success stories

  • Bring these stories to our community through technical editing, etc.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Code42 Software, Inc. (Minneapolis, MN)
item.description:
As a Senior Software Engineer on the Business Enablement team, you will help design, develop, and maintain the processes and tools that enable Code42 to achieve its objectives and better serve our users, both internal and external. You will make a difference throughout the company by making others more efficient and providing new capabilities. You will help other developers design effective solutions and lend the benefits of your experience to new challenges. You will provide insight into application architecture and help evaluate 3rd party solutions for business needs. You will integrate, innovate, and have a good time while doing so. 


WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING



  • Designing and implementing software solutions for assigned projects, both independently and with teammates.

  • Writing unit and integration tests.

  • Testing, debugging, and troubleshooting data and software issues.

  • Documenting code and design, and reviewing code and design docs from others.

  • Estimating tasks and providing status updates when needed

  • Synthesizing requirements into cohesive designs while identifying gaps and contradictions.

  • Identifying improvements in our current systems and processes.

  • Collaborating with teammates and end users to deliver the right solution.

  • Participating in design discussions and code reviews.

  • Getting to know our systems and processes.

  • Helping to mentor and guide more junior developers.

item.title: Software Architect - Web Application at Advertising Specialty Institute (ASI) (Feasterville-Trevose, PA)
item.description:
Advertising Specialty Institute (ASI) is seeking a talented architect to join our enterprise architecture team. A software architect at ASI will define, develop, and support the core services that help move our vision forward. The team works on critical backend components like messaging, search, and security that require maximum scalability, low-latency, and high availability.


Our product development team is composed of full-stack engineers with expertise in technologies like Microsoft.Net, AngularJS, Java, PHP, and Ruby. You will work directly with product development on multiple projects to provide technical leadership and guidance. Strong candidates will have development and operational experience at large scale, and bring both deep technical understanding and sound judgment to the role.


Responsibilities



  • Act as principal designer of critical systems including application, data, and technology infrastructure architectures

  • Identify scaling bottlenecks and propose solutions

  • Research, test, benchmark and evaluate new technology

  • Solve the types of mysteries which only occur at high scale

  • Drive best practices for web application architecture and implementation

  • Work with project teams to guide the implementation and delivery of solutions both in customer-facing and internal deployment environments

item.title: Forensisch software architect at Rijksoverheid (The Hague, Netherlands)
item.description:
Forensisch software architect


Nederlands Forensisch Instituut



Functieomschrijving



Word jij enthousiast van cutting edge frameworks en nieuwe technologieën?



Je vertaalt bij het Nederlands Forensisch Instituut (NFI) de wensen van stakeholders naar concrete oplossingen. Dit doe je bij de groep Software Engineering, in het bijzonder voor het forensisch big data-platform Hansken.



Hansken wordt binnen en buiten het NFI gebruikt voor opsporing en bewijsvoering van ernstige misdrijven als kindermisbruik, moord, grootschalige fraude en andere delicten met grote maatschappelijke impact. Hansken draait op een gedistribueerde omgeving en verwerkt vele terabytes aan data per uur. Het analyseren van deze data kan miljoenen relevante sporen opleveren, denk  aan e-mails, chatberichten en GPS-coördinaten. Door nieuwe technologische ontwikkelingen blijft het een uitdaging om steeds nieuwe typen forensische sporen doorzoekbaar te maken of slimme analyses toe te voegen, zoals entiteitextractie voor herkenning van kentekens, IBAN-nummers of adressen. Naast het dienen van een belangrijk maatschappelijk belang is Hansken ook een technisch zeer uitdagend project waar je telkens met nieuwe technieken in aanraking komt.



Als forensisch software architect ben jij voor Hansken de persoon die de wensen van stakeholders vertaalt naar concrete oplossingen. Je bent communicatief sterk en kunt Hansken uiteenzetten aan klanten en het management. Samen met ontwikkelaars beoordeel je nieuwe technologieën en frameworks op toepasbaarheid in de huidige architectuur. Vervolgens zorg je dat deze gebruikt worden. Je trekt de kar bij het besluitvormingsproces over gebruikte technologie en (technische) ontwerpbeslissingen op abstract niveau. Hierbij neem je onderbouwd besluiten en verdedig je deze. Bovendien leg je de architectuur vast en bewaak je deze.



Daarnaast ben je verantwoordelijk voor de kwaliteit van Hansken. Je bewaakt de afgesproken principes en kwaliteitsrichtlijnen. Tot slot zul je zelf weinig ontwikkelen, maar beoordeel je wel kritisch de ontwikkelde code en zorg je dat deze voldoet aan de afgesproken architectuur.

item.title: Engineering Manager - Billing & Payments Infrastructure at Twilio (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Twilio is seeking an Engineering Manager for our Billing & Payments Infrastructure team. This is a leadership role, reporting to the Sr. Engineering Manager of Billing & User Data, focused on nurturing and expanding a team of engineers, providing people management, and driving projects to successful, on-time delivery through our agile process.


About the job:


Twilio is a company built by developers for developers. You must not only have the professional expertise to understand your team’s engineering and business challenges, but also the technical acumen to build great software.


Responsibilities:



  • Partner with the Technical Lead to make long-term architectural decisions about Twilio's micro-transaction platform.

  • Take personal responsibility as the delivery manager and set clear expectations for Finance and R&D billing integrations.

  • Work directly with Technical Lead and Product Manager to track velocity and plan sprints for the engineering team.

  • Manage & grow a world-class team of engineers that think about the customer experience.

  • Own quarterly deliverables with highly-visible and effective communications with Senior Management in R&D and Finance departments.

  • Manage your direct reports in an empathetic, high-touch way, including weekly/bi-weekly 1:1s. Coach and unblock them on a daily basis. Encourage and teach them to drive to complete key objectives. Assist in their longer term career and skills development. Excite them with new challenges and opportunities.

item.title: Professional Services Engineer at The Intellisis Corporation (San Diego, CA)

Professional Services Engineer Positions in San Diego, CA and Austin, TX


Our Services Team is responsible for delivering real-time process-transformation consulting expertise to our customers as well as ensuring the successful implementation of Hermosa solutions. Each member of the team is armed with the field experience to deliver real world, real-time solutions.

It’s important to be a careful listener, with the ability to demonstrate knowledge and professionalism throughout customer engagements. Successful candidates will have a Computer Science/Engineering degree and a minimum of 5 years relevant experience. This position reports to the Sr. Director of Professional Services.

item.title: APPLICATION DEVELOPER JR/SR at Wharton School (Philadelphia, PA)
item.description:
Design, develop, maintain, and document programs to populate research databases from a variety of data sources, and manage / query those databases. Learn, understand, and support a set of diverse financial databases. Devise ways to improve workflows to support an ever increasing number of databases and data update frequency. Work with WRDS research and web teams to develop analytics and extract files for statistical analysis. Determine functional requirements for client business processes and may organize, plan and manage projects. Perform technical and functional analysis of information, processing and management systems. Ensure adherence to departmental technical, quality assurance and security standards. Provide first/second tier data and technical support to external WRDS users.

Senior Application Developer’s responsibilities will also include:

Develop or modify procedures to solve complex problems, taking into consideration computer equipment capacity and limitations. Review the work of colleagues and provide feedback on efficiency, security, and other best practices. Oversee project goals, timelines, and create specifications to assure that projects are completed on time and within budget. Coordinate multiple projects while meeting deadlines.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - (Full Stack .NET and AngularJS) at comScore, Inc. (Reston, VA)
item.description:
The comScore Survey Tech team is looking for a full stack Senior .NET Software Engineer who is familiar with all layers in software development. You will design and build high-scale applications that process large datasets and develop web applications for internal/external users. You will be working in a fast-paced environment, where we iterate quickly and work with cutting edge technologies. This is an exciting opportunity for developers with strong analytical and system design skills.



Essential Duties:



  • Participate in the requirements gathering, design and development of new systems to be incorporated into and improve the existing processing environment

  • Design and build scalable, high availability web services and portals

  • Work in a fast paced and agile development environment.

  • Manage multiple assignments and balance workload according to priorities

  • Collaborate and mentor team members to identify and implement project solutions



comScore, Inc. (NASDAQ: SCOR) is a global leader in digital measurement and analytics, delivering insights on web, mobile and TV consumer behavior that enable clients to maximize the value of their digital investments.



Through its Audience Analytics, Advertising Analytics, and Enterprise Analytics product suites, comScore provides its clients with a variety of on-demand software, real-time analytics and custom solutions to succeed in a multi-platform world. The proprietary comScore Census Network™ (CCN) leverages a world-class technology infrastructure to capture trillions of digital interactions a month and power big data analytics on a global scale for its more than 2,000 clients, which include leading companies such as AOL, Baidu, BBC, Best Buy, Carat, Deutsche Bank, ESPN, France Telecom, Financial Times, Fox, LinkedIn, Microsoft, MediaCorp, Nestle, Starcom, Terra Networks, Universal McCann, Verizon, ViaMichelin and Yahoo!.



We are an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

item.title: Senior Symfony2 Developer at LeaseWeb Technologies (Amsterdam Zuid-Oost, Netherlands)
item.description:
As a PHP developer you design, construct and support our systems written in PHP. Your responsibilities can vary from simple maintenance to very complex tasks in one of our innovative (Research and Implementation) projects. Automation and software development is an integral part of our business, we expect you to be able to give assistance to non-technical colleagues and collaborate with other departments as well.


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dr2xso8CUTQ


Work for LeaseWeb and help make the internet’s heart beat. The LeaseWeb Network is one of the largest networks in the world, moving data around at colossal speeds. It connects the state-of-the-art data centers in Europe, North America and Asia which are operated by various international LeaseWeb companies. Innovation is in our DNA. Our ground-breaking new products help all kinds of business get the most from the internet. And their success is our success which drives growth.


Come and be part of it. The future’s in your hands.

item.title: Web Application / Software Engineer at TrustYou GmbH (München, Deutschland)
item.description:
Software engineers at TrustYou constantly have to solve complex and interesting problems. We build products that ultimately benefit the travelers and we use user interface design, big data, machine learning, natural language processing and distributed computing to do so. TrustYou is looking for those rare, talented engineers who are comfortable getting out of their comfort zone, who never stop learning, who love responsibilities and want to drive a product from its initial conception to successful completion.


Software Engineers at TrustYou work in a team with other smart engineers and are responsible for an entire product or suite of features. They are expected to understand customer requirements, think up features that are useful and fun to use, and help to drive the implementation from specification to QA.


Our web applications are built with a modern stack of technologies and tools. Our Engineers are expected to to build large, modular and fast cross-browser JavaScript applications.


Responsibilities



  • Ship products that clients love to use!

  • Take responsibility for planning, execution and success of complex projects.

  • Team play together with other smart data and software engineers.

  • Roll up your sleeves and code to get your project done.


Minimum qualifications



  • Degree in Computer Science, or closely related degree

  • 2 years+ experience implementing beautiful and scalable web applications

  • Expert HTML, CSS & JavaScript knowledge

  • Experience implementing RESTful servers. We accept your background in a variety of languages (JavaScript, Python, Ruby, Java, etc.), but we only use JavaScript (NodeJS) or Python (Twisted, Tornado) and we will help you learn these technologies.

  • Working knowledge of relational databases

  • Good algorithms knowledge

  • Comfortable working in Linux

  • Fluent in English


Preferred qualifications



  • NoSQL, especially distributed databases

  • RequireJS or single page application frameworks (e.g. AngularJS, Ember.js)


Who we are


TrustYou is the standard for reputation in the travel industry. We search and analyze literally ALL hotel reviews on the web, and generate a summary for each hotel on the planet - what did guests like and dislike about this hotel? Try it out yourself by searching any hotel on our website or our mobile app!


Our data is powering over 100 hotel search engines around the globe. Additionally, we have built a social media monitoring and survey product for hoteliers, TrustYou Reputation Management. What are my guests complaining about? TrustYou is used by more than 10,000 hotels to answer that question and improve their services.


TrustYou is a startup with engineering excellence in its DNA. Our employees are experts in big data, machine learning, natural language processing, interactive JavaScript applications and web technologies. Our tech stack is varied and modern.


We work hard, but value a great working environment just as much. We offer perks and a comfortable office for creative work. Xbox breaks and office beers on Friday nights are part of our culture. Our visits to Oktoberfest and our developer getaway trips are legendary.


Job details


Team or role: Software Engineering


Job type: Full-time


Job location(s): Munich, Germany; Cluj-Napoca, Romania


How to get this job


We’d love to see a note about yourself along with your resume.


Write us at jobs@trustyou.com

item.title: Sr Software Developer - Changing the Way the World Learns! at D2L (Kitchener, ON, Canada)
item.description:
Every day, our software is used by millions of people around the world, and we are looking for individuals who share in our excitement and passion for transforming the way the world learns. At D2L, we believe that learning should be accessible and engaging. Our goal is to create easy, flexible, and smart software that ignites the desire to learn in everyone. To do this, we need to give talented, enthusiastic, and passionate people opportunities to create, develop, and collaborate on projects that revolutionize the learning environment.


You will be helping learners achieve their full potential. Think about the good you will do for the world!


At D2L, we are looking for developers that will help us advance our goal of using technology to transform teaching and learning around the world. Our software is used daily by millions of people around the world and we need developers who are up to the challenge that this presents. As a developer, you will help make dreams a reality.


We are looking for seasoned software developers who are passionate about developing software using engineering best practices. Senior software developers use past experiences & know-how to enable teams to be more productive & effective through the code they write, the decisions they make and knowledge they share. Your ideas and perspectives are essential to making sure we are investing in the right technology and effectively advancing our goal.


HOW WILL I MAKE AN IMPACT?


We need experienced software developers to join a tight-knit team of passionate developers using the latest technology and open-source software to deliver innovative solutions to new markets. You will build web apps that are beautiful, accessible, and usable across all mediums. Senior software developers are accountable for the design and implementation of fault-tolerant and highly scalable distributed systems and APIs.

item.title: Mobile & Front End UI Engineer / Inventor at Iodine (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Iodine is changing the way people find the right medical treatments. Our product is our voice, and we want you to shape it with us.


You work where design meets code. You know mobile UI patterns, HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript like the back of your hand. You're passionate about experimentation, innovation, and playing around with the latest front-end technologies. You write clean, compatible, powerful user interfaces with speed. Bonus: You're passionate about understanding your audience, and dreaming up ways to build great technological futures for them.


As a mobile & front-end engineer, you’ll work closely with the rest of our design, engineering, product, and clinical team to turn ideas into tangible user experiences. You'll combine your keen design sense, stellar front-end chops, and the right technologies, to realize these ideas and validate them with users. Your wizardry will translate design concepts into living, breathing prototypes and finished products—all to help people make sense of health decisions.


You will co-own and shape the future of health & medical apps—both online, and in people’s pockets.


We are a JavaScript shop—you’ll be working in React Native, React.js and LESS, with designers who can code.


Responsibilities



  • Work with our product team to design and implement rapid prototypes, by whatever means necessary.

  • Write clean, compatible, automated-testable React JSX and LESS to realize our ideas as a cross-platform, responsive front-end.

  • Build our reusable UI framework to help us create rich applications to interact with our data—code, widgets, and all—and help us identify and document its emergent rules.

  • Serve as a mentor for engineers, designers, and other peers at Iodine.

item.title: Full Stack Engineer at CrowdFlower (San Francisco, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
About Us:


CrowdFlower is changing the way work gets done, and we want you to help us make it happen.


We’re building a platform that makes it easy for data scientists to enrich their data by distributing work to an on-demand workforce located around the world. In addition to being an integral player in the red hot data science, machine learning and big data fields, we also provide critically needed work and income to millions of micro-tasking workers around the world. Everything our engineers do has real and tangible impact, everyday.


We need smart, innovative people to help us build scalable, resilient and responsive systems, working with our exceptional team in San Francisco’s Mission District. You can look forward to working with a dynamic, growing company in a casual and fun environment with an opportunity to make an impact at all levels of the business.


Learn more about our engineering culture at http://www.crowdflower.com/careers/engineering.


The Job:


When we say Full Stack Engineer, we're looking for someone that is comfortable building custom UI/UX as well as defining API endpoints for the UI to communicate with. In terms of MVC, the position looks like: 5% M, 75% V, and 20% C. The primary tools you'll employ are Rails and jQuery. You like to work with different technologies and are passionate about constantly learning new things. You take pride in designing elegant, simple solutions to challenging problems, creating quality software components and promoting best practices for agile software development. You will help us ensure we continue to evolve and keep our edge as a world­-class development team. 


Responsibilities:



  • Distilling complex requirements into simple interfaces.

  • Defining the future of CrowdFlower's platform.

  • Building new products that use the core CrowdFlower platform.

  • Improve the interface that tens of thousands of CrowdFlower contributors and clients use everyday.

  • Take pride and ownership in your work and encourage others to do the same

  • Promote best practices for writing maintainable, well­-tested code


Must Haves:



  • 3+ yrs experience on at least one significant production-level web app in Rails.

  • Experience in multiple programming languages (we primarily use Ruby and JavaScript).

  • A solid command of JavaScript. When something breaks, you either know exactly why it broke, or can find out easily.

  • The ability to design new interfaces - thinking up a creative solution and being able to implement it effectively.


Experience with these would be definite assets:



  • Client-side MVC - React and/or Backbone

  • Jasmine/TDD experience

  • An opinion about Web Components/ES6

  • Git skills and GitHub repos full of cool stuff you've hacked on

  • A great design aesthetic

  • PostgreSql, JQuery, Redis

  • AWS, Jira, Confluence.

item.title: Software Engineer II at Mishimoto Automotive (New Castle, DE)

  • Maintains current systems by ensuring that all software and hardware is up to date, as well as backs-up all systems to ensure that data is never lost.

  • Researches and recommends software tools to management.

  • Protects operations by keeping information confidential.

item.title: Software Engineer - Medical Mobile Apps at InSpark Technologies Inc. (San Francisco, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
We seek a mobile engineer with a love of Android and iOS mobile development. Yours will be a pivotal role at the company with a high degree of influence over architectural and design decisions as well as responsibility for delivering high-quality, production-ready code within our regulatory and quality framework.


As a foundational member of the engineering team you will be primarily responsible for developing:


1.     The front-end for our iOS, Android and web applications for patients and their health care providers;

As a lean start-up, our work environment emphasizes collaboration over supervision: We all know what we need to achieve and expect employees to work towards that end, individually and as a team. This role therefore has a high degree of individual responsibility attached to it. You will be expected to be self-motivated and have the confidence to share and pursue your ideas for how to achieve high-quality results in an efficient manner with limited direct supervision.

item.title: Senior Rapid Prototyping Software Engineer at New Relic (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
New Relic
Senior Rapid Prototyping Software Engineer
San Francisco, CA


New Relic is software analytics. Fueled by real-time data from production software, we provide clear, actionable intelligence about high-velocity web and mobile applications and their end-users. Our team builds prototypes to validate new ideas, which have a direct impact on the future of our products. 


The right person for this job delights in building solutions, has a talent for executing quickly, and has “agile” in their DNA. You can confidently build any type of software component and if you don’t know something, you’ll learn and adapt very quickly. You probably have 5+ years of software development experience with a couple of those years working in Java, JavaScript, or Python. And you undoubtedly have open source contributions with a GitHub repository, personal project page, or blog.


Your ideal environment is motivated by rapid prototyping concepts and you have a demonstrated record of using creativity and innovation to go beyond current tools to deliver the best solution to complex problems.


This is an opportunity to innovate and have an impact on our future product line. It is a high-visibility role in an environment where the Founder/CEO actively participates in the creation and development of our product suite.


To complement the existing skill set of our team, you have passion and expertise in one (or both) of the following areas:



  • User Experience / Front-End Development

  • Data / Statistics


Skills and experience needed for the job:



  • Real tech fluency - Significant experience with multiple backend language(s) such as Java, Ruby, Python, or Node.js

  • Has consistent track record of building working prototypes

  • Worked in a highly interactive, team-oriented environment

  • Broad understanding of SaaS and technology trends


We’re hiring at all experience levels, and we’re particularly interested in having a diverse team with a broad set of skills and viewpoints. If this seems like your perfect job, but not sure if you qualify, apply anyway! We carefully consider every applicant that takes the time to apply. 


A little about us:


New Relic is a software analytics company that, on behalf of our customers, makes sense of billions of metrics about millions of applications, all in real time. Our comprehensive SaaS-based solution for web and mobile applications consolidates the performance monitoring data into a single, powerful interface. Our 90,000+ customers use New Relic every day to optimize more than three million applications.


New Relic is a San Francisco Best Places to Work award winner, an Oregon “Top Workplace” award winner, named a leader in the Gartner’s 2013 “Magic Quadrant” for APM companies, a Top 100 OnDemand Company, Best of SaaS (THINKStrategies), Top 100 Coolest Cloud Computing (CRN); 10 Cloud Management Companies to Watch (NetworkWorld) – the list of accolades goes on. More important than all of that: we provide challenging work, opportunities to learn, high quality teammates, a standard-setting product, and a company on the move.


Our office is in the tech-rich urban center of San Francisco, with easy commute access and a plethora of good eats. We provide competitive compensation, stock options, and big-company benefits (medical, dental, etc.) -- all while maintaining the energy, agility, and fun of a start-up. We can help with relocation and are open to H1-B transfers.


New Relic is most decidedly an equal opportunity employer. We eagerly seek applicants of diverse background and hire without regard to race, color, gender, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, individuals with disabilities, age, sexual orientation, protected veterans, or any other characteristic protected by law. Note: Our stewardship of the data of many thousands of customers’ means that a criminal background check is required to join New Relic. We will, nonetheless, consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records in accord with applicable law, including the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.


To get started, click on the link below. To fast track your application, let us know in your cover letter why this job, product, and/or company is of particular interest to you.



#LI-CV1



Apply Here
PI91800506

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Avalon Healthcare Solutions (Tampa, FL)
item.description:
Avalon’s Software Engineers supports projects through the use of software development tools under limited supervision using prescribed methodologies. Software Engineers work collaboratively with other technical and business resources. You will analyze, design, develop, document and support various custom applications, portals, data exchanges, services and integration with other applications and systems to support the evolving needs of the company.


Job Requirements



  • Develops complex, modular and reusable application code which utilizes SQL data sources.  Able to performance tune applications.  Develops multiple, modular objects and the messaging interface between objects to create a complex software package.  Reuses objects and can create object inventories.

  • Can create a detail design document through the assessment of business requirements.  Can work in a team to assess alternatives to different designs and choose best solution to fit business needs.

  • Demonstrates an ability to read, interpret, create and maintain complex Conceptual, Logical and Physical models to include context diagrams, data flow diagrams, process flow diagrams, data dictionaries and logical flow charts, under limited supervision.

  • Able to develop unit test plans which include regression testing and the packaging of tests into consecutive steps based on logical dependencies to ensure quality delivery. Assists in the development of functional test plans used to verify that a specific system functions according to actual requirements and established guidelines.

  • Able to perform moderate to complex application administration & support. Ability to triage and resolve application and integration issues. Document and track product defects.  Demonstrates the ability to develop and implement solutions for the causes identified.

  • Able to evaluate, recommend and exploit evolving technologies in the design and implementation of application infrastructure for scalability, reliability, availability and serviceability and identify the trade-offs and risks associated with each.

  • Adheres to and contributes to definition of good database design practices.  Conceptual understanding of referential integrity, locking and transaction processing.  Understands impact of data modeling decisions on system performance and resource usage.  Able to do complex queries and updates of tables. 

  • Software Developers will contribute to, and follow the defined Avalon Agile SDLC / Change Management process for developing, testing, maintaining and deploying code.  Contributes to and follows established coding standards.  Able to perform code reviews and assess the work of other team members to ensure quality delivery and compliance with procedures.

  • Has an understanding of the strategic alignment of IT solutions with business objectives.  Demonstrates a working knowledge of specific components of health plan operations and associated technical dependencies.

item.title: Senior Java and C Developer/Architect for Telco Big Data Pioneer at mCentric (Las Rozas, Spain) (allows remote)
item.description: In your day to day at mCentric you can expect to encounter a buzzing environment of professionals dedicated to creating and enhancing services in several mobile operators worldwide. You will be using your experience as a Senior Developer and Architect to create and upgrade solutions which interact with the mobile telecommunications core network, familiarising yourself with a multitude of mobile telecommunications protocols, standards and infrastructure variations of those standards. mCentric solutions range from Data Plan Management, xDR Navigation, SIM Registration, Voucher Services, and other basic mobile network solutions which in turn are feeding its data into a dynamic and intelligent promotions platform allowing for precise Microsegmentation applied to intelligent and interactive promotions and reporting. Our solutions are responsible for dealing with billions of events processed per day, millions of concurrent user sessions, and are expected to deliver results in real time. To handle the demand, several of the solutions are built over a Big Data structure. In fact, mCentric solutions are running over the first BDA installed in Africa.

What you tell your friends you do

Team
You'll team up with some of the smartest, most motivated guys and girls you have ever worked with. Some of them are pretty junior, so they will need some coaching and guidance in real production software development. Next to that, you will work with your manager to create the ultimate partnership to ensure Business Intelligence becomes the indispensable core of Coolblue, providing insights and support for the business and customers.

item.title: Generalist Software Engineer (New Grad/Junior Role) at LiveRamp (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
ABOUT LIVERAMP


LiveRamp is the leading data onboarder, enabling marketers to unify their customer database across disparate online marketing applications and leverage it for analytics, targeting, measurement, content optimization, and more.


ABOUT THIS JOB


Can't be tied down to a single specialty? This is the job for you. It's hard to say what tomorrow's challenge will be, but you'll be happy to hack away at it, whether it's a Ruby on Rails web UI, a distributed analysis Hadoop application in Java, or something completely new.


RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Design and build sophisticated systems to process and visualize massive amounts of data.

  • Make mistakes. Fix them; learn from them; make different ones next time.

  • Be at the forefront of technology innovation. Keep LiveRamp on the cutting edge of industry tools and best practices.

  • Push your teammates to become better engineers. They will do the same for you.

  • Work on your own great ideas for our company during Hackweeks.

  • Contribute towards building a great company


QUALIFICATIONS



  • Excited by the idea of building scalable and reliable products.

  • Comfort in multiple languages, frameworks, and environments.

  • Type S(tartup) personality: smart, ethical, friendly, hard-working and proactive (no exceptions).

  • Desire to work in San Francisco. We will relocate you if necessary.


EMPLOYEE BENEFITS



  • Own equity in the company. Every employee is a stakeholder in our future.

  • Work with talented, collaborative, and friendly people who love what they do.

  • Participate in a thriving culture. We host events such as weekly yoga, game nights, happy hour, and a two night camping trip.

  • Leverage our health insurance, dental insurance, vision insurance, 401K, and pre-tax commuter benefit.

  • Work in the heart of San Francisco - the best city in the world.

The stuff that would be nice to have (but not a deal breaker)

item.title: Cloud Services System Engineer at MongoDB, Inc. (New York, NY)
item.description:
Join the fastest growing engineering team at MongoDB! We are looking for a systems engineer to join us in building the best database management system for the leading document database server. The MongoDB management service, Cloud Manager, is a cloud-based web application for deploying, monitoring, and backing up MongoDB deployments of any size and configuration.


Cloud Manager currently monitors tens of thousands of MongoDB nodes and backs up multiple petabytes of data. On a typical day, Cloud Manager processes over a billion metrics and replicates tens of billions of backup operations.


Tools we use include: MongoDB (of course!), AWS, CentOS, Chef, Nagios, Graphite, Load Balancers.


Responsibilities


You will design, implement, operate, and troubleshoot systems, services, and tools primarily in cloud-based environments. You will additionally participate in a weekly on-call rotation, and make occasional trips to our data centers.  Your responsibilities include resolving and escalating issues while advocating best practices to development teams.

item.title: VP of Software Engineer, Data at Centro (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
ABOUT THE PRODUCT AND ENGINEERING TEAM


At Centro, we’ve always been about making people’s lives better—from our employees to our clients. Today, we’re building a unified platform to execute every digital media advertising transaction, thus providing a new level of automation and intelligence in ad tech. This is an enormous task that will disrupt an industry and improve the lives of those who work within it.

To do this, we’re aggressively growing our team of engineers, product developers and designers. We are imaginative, passionate, determined and relentless in our efforts. Of course, we are fascinated by the complexity of engineering problems at this scale—it’s what brings bright minds together. But what keeps us coming back (and why we love coming to work everyday) is the chance to improve how work gets done: freeing up people’s time so that they can dream bigger and make life better.

Come build something amazing with us.


ABOUT THE ROLE


The ideal candidate will have experience in deploying, designing, and implementing big-data solutions using a diverse set of technologies and solutions. This leader will head a team that builds the powerful data discovery and analytical capabilities that provide the insight that drives strategic decisions for the enterprise, our customers, and optimizes business performance. The position will support each business unit with their data discovery and analytics. The ideal candidate will possess the thought-leadership skills to drive our big-data agenda and the interpersonal and networking skills to develop critical relationships across the organization.
