item.title: Director of Quality Assurance at Lumeris (Maryland Heights, MO)
item.description:
Join Our Growing Team!


Lumeris™ provides the information technology, guidance, and operational services necessary for hospitals and health plans to transform their organizations into high-performing accountable delivery systems.


Our revolutionary technology platform for accountable care integrates data from disparate systems across the continuum of care, provides complete visibility into the clinical and financial performance of the enterprise, and delivers applications and information to key stakeholders at the point of thought. Lumeris also provides health care consulting and professional services that help organizations establish the necessary clinical and business processes, methodologies, and operational capacity to create their own successful accountable health care delivery systems.


The depth and breadth of our solutions — combined with the company’s extensive real-world experience in accountable care — make Lumeris the ideal partner for any health care organization seeking the significant benefits of a better connected, aligned, and informed accountable delivery system.


Lumeris is privately owned by Essence Group Holdings Corporation (EGHC) and backed by investors including Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers, Camden Partners, and Sandbox Industries.


Why Join Lumeris?


At Lumeris you will be part of team that is focused on solving a national healthcare problem.  And you will have the ability to contribute while working for a purpose. Our environment is fast-paced and change oriented and is focused on growth and employee engagement.  At Lumeris we believe talent is utilized best when given the opportunity to succeed.  That is why we have removed the boundaries that inhibit success and focus on fostering an environment that allows employees to utilize their talents.



  • Implement consistent global Quality Assurance metrics and processes for activities to include visual inspection, test automation, and performance characterization to ensure organizational product quality is realized while improving release velocity.

  • Facilitates, prioritize, and communicates functional, non-functional, integration, end-to-end, and scheduling requirements for QA efforts associated with multiple intake paths within the product development lifecycle.

  • Manage employee staff and outsourced resources in transaction application and data analytics quality testing efforts as well as performance and stress testing management. Mentor and support colleagues to assure they continually build their skills while delivering QA on products that meet requirements and exceed expectations

  • Design, create, and implement testing strategies for complex lifecycle, high volume, multi-channel transactional healthcare SAAS applications systems and associated data applications including business intelligence and data analytics applications

  • Drive quality metrics and review performance levels against those metrics for transactional systems and data products

  • Drive continual performance efficiencies by way of best practices leadership and best practices adoption

  • Drive increased efficiencies and testing cost reductions by way of best increased and comprehensive automation practices

  • Develop the long term team strategy for QA testing, automation testing, load testing, QA best practices, and team talent development

  • Optimize and implement creative QA sourcing engagement processes, ensuring all capital and maintenance projects are delivered on schedule and to our quality standards

  • Contribute to the definition and compliance of standard quality processes, best practices, and lead changes where improvements must be made

  • Recommend and assist in the implementation of standardized tools for operational processes and liaise with vendors and internal customers to identify and implement value-added, industry standard best practices to achieve QA operational efficiency

  • Lead the QA team in a manner that delivers results as experts, but approaches software testing with the eye of novices Measure success by what you finish and deliver

item.title: Lead Software Engineer at MediaRadar (New York, NY)
item.description:
You are a passionate software engineer looking to help lead a strong development team. Youre a proud problem solver with a strong technical gut feel with hunches more often right than wrong about where problems lie. A constant learner, youre a continuous contributor to the team IQ level. Youve got the ability to take on and lead individual assignments and complete them soup to nuts. As much as you love the elegance and power of good architecture, your number one focus is delivering software to do the job and you pride yourself on doing that well.


What youll be doing:


Our Lead Software Engineer will be responsible for the following software feature activities:


  • Shared responsibility in the Design and Architecture of a feature

  • Ensure that the proper plumbing is in place for the given feature

  • Analyze complexity

  • Implementation (i.e coding) of the feature in a mostly vertical fashion (i.e UI, Business Layer, Database Access and Schema Design, External Interfaces)

  • Fully understands and follows the companys Software Development Processes (i.e SCRUM)

  • Ensures quality of implementation and support the feature during testing/bug fixing phase

  • Authors required documentation (in code or WIKI)

  • Keeps all assigned cases up to date and updates statuses as required

  • Perform code reviews

  • Mentor and assist other developers

Lead Software Engineers:


  • Tackle hard engineering problems with many unknowns, fail fast, find how to get the job done

  • Are self-sufficient and expected to tackle an entire feature. Ability to overcome difficulties with little or no help is required

  • Must be able to identify any gaps in application platform, propose and implement solutions

  • Are key contributors to feature scoping and development estimates. Their projections have a high (90%+) degree of accuracy. They rarely, if ever, miss the due date

  • Are proactive about developer testing. They frequently utilize unit tests to ensure long term health of their code

  • Are able to code across all levels with ease. Their code is well structured and displays best practices in software development

  • Have drastically less bugs in their code. They are quick to fix issues that come up

  • Ensure overall quality of the software (quality of code, performance, security, extensibility, etc.)

  • Use engineering know-how and common sense to assess impact of their work on the platform

  • Are able to interface and communicate effectively with people in other departments

The Ideal candidate is:


  • Motivated, works extra without being asked

  • Technically strong, has deep understanding of current and future technology

  • Must be a great team member

  • Passionate about the team, project and work

  • Hardworking and fully dedicated to the success of the project

  • Obtains 100% trust and confidence of manager

  • Pushing innovation and emerging technologies forward


Whats in it for you:

We value our employees time and efforts. Our commitment to your success is enhanced by our competitive salary, first-rate health insurance, including vision and dental, 401K with match and transit discounts and a comfortable, informal office with a friendly atmosphere. Plus, we work to maintain the best possible environment for our employees where people can learn and grow with the company. We strive to provide a collaborative, creative environment where each person feels encouraged to contribute to our processes, decisions, planning and culture. We are located just a few blocks from Penn Station and Herald Square.



Benefits


Check out what it's like to work with our awesome team here: http://muse.cm/1Mt0NCg

We value our employees time and efforts. Our commitment to your success is enhanced by our competitive salary, first-rate health insurance, including vision and dental, 401K with match and transit discounts and a comfortable, informal office with a friendly atmosphere. Plus, we work to maintain the best possible environment for our employees where people can learn and grow with the company. We strive to provide a collaborative, creative environment where each person feels encouraged to contribute to our processes, decisions, planning and culture. We are located just a few blocks from Penn Station and Herald Square.


To apply:

If you meet the above criteria and want to be part of a collaborative, creative environment, please APPLY NOW.

item.title: Database Specialist Programmer at 21st Century Oncology (Fort Myers, FL)
item.description:
21st Century Oncology is a leading developer and operator of radiation therapy centers, medical oncology, and multi-specialty practices throughout the US.  Our centers, which are freestanding and hospital based, provide a full spectrum of radiation therapy services and medical oncology treatment to cancer patients, and multi specialty care to patients in the areas of Urology, Gynecology and medical specialties.  We are growing and need highly qualified candidates to join our team.



We are seeking a Database Specialist Programmer to support our growing Clinical IT Team in Fort Myers, FL.  He/she will perform a variety of programming assignments requiring knowledge of established programming procedures and data processing requirements.


Responsibilities will include developing, maintaining and troubleshooting application using .Net Windows C#, .Net Web C# application, Java and Javascript; also backend tier developing, maintaining and troubleshooting application using MS PL/SQL and Stored Procedures.


ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:



  1. Code, test and troubleshoot programs utilizing the appropriate hardware, database, and programming technology.

  2. Learn all databases running in the company environment and develop queries to retrieve data and to store data to produce custom reports with valuable medical and business information.

  3. Maintain and modify programs new and existing applications; make approved changes by amending flow charts and documentation, develop detailed programming logic, and coding changes.

  4. Evaluate interrelationships between programs such as whether a contemplated change in one part of a program would cause unwanted results in a related part.

  5. Analyze performance of programs and take action to correct deficiencies based on consultation with users and approval of supervisor.

  6. Confer with users to gain understanding of needed changes or modifications of existing programs. Resolve questions of program intent, data input, output requirements, and inclusion of internal checks and controls.

  7. Write and maintain programming documentation.

  8. Analyze client/server and micro-computer based software solutions compatibility with company requirements.

  9. Maintain confidentiality with regard to the information being processed, stored or accessed.

  10. Document programming problems and resolutions for future support reference.

  11. Design, develop and maintain database applications.

  12. Write SQL statements and stored procedures

  13. Learn and maintain interfaces with vendor  representatives to resolve problems.

  14. Design, develop and maintain interfaces using HL7 protocol (Mirth Corp appliance)

  15. Assist other team members doing support work to new/existing application.

  16. Other duties as assigned.

item.title: Principal Architect - Java at Automatic Data Processing (Roseland, NJ)
item.description:
The Principal Application Architect is responsible for the software architecture, design, development, and maintenance of software services and web based application software products, mobile, internal and 3rd party integrations for our ADP Reporting product. The ADP Reporting team is focused on building a cutting edge reporting product with a simple mission -- make it beautiful, performant, simple and useful. The product will include a simple drag and drop interface, report preview, a library of categorized fields/reports and will extend to the manager persona. The reporting solution will be tightly integrated with the Analytics solution to enhance the user reporting experience while also providing insightful information combining transactions data with predictive analytics, benchmarks and mash-up data so users can make intelligent business decisions.



We are seeking candidates with a desire to get involved with a product through its infancy and help contribute to its success. The right candidate will not only have strong technical skills but also possess the leadership skills needed to mentor junior developers (onshore and offshore) while meeting their own deliverables. We seek someone who is continually looking to grow, technically, as our architecture stack continues to evolve to meet the changing demands of our clients and growing user base.


The successful candidate must have at least 10+ years of hands-on experience in distributed Object Oriented programming skills. The ability to take charge of defining and implementing practical software solutions that can adjust to rapid changing business needs is a must. Strong written and oral communication skills coupled with the ability to work with all levels of IT management are required. You will also be called upon frequently to be a contributing member of an agile development team or to lead a specific project. The candidate must have a natural bias toward test-driven software development in a rapid software release cycle.


The ability to provide technical strategic thinking along with day-to-day hands-on software implementation in project work represents the challenges of this position.


Main Duties & Responsibilities:



  • Deliver quality software releases on schedule in an Agile environment

  • Develop new customizations and enhancements

  • Support and maintain existing functionality

  • Be the escalation point for production software issues for technical guidance

  • Develop Technical Designs

  • Oversee Unit Testing, test automation, and Source Control

  • Self --Starter, able to work independently or within a multi-faceted team

  • Participate in Requirements definition

  • May lead other developers

  • Demonstrate prototypes and/or released application software to an audience

  • Successfully navigate both the business and developer audience in solution development

  • Highly skilled communicator across multiple disciplines and with Internal and External customers.

  • A natural bias for action.

  • Team player and influencing skills

item.title: Director of Business Operations, Product at New Relic (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
New Relic


Director of Business Operations, Product


Portland, OR


New Relic is a fast growing all SaaS software analytics company.  As we continue to diversify across new products and customer segments we are looking to bring on a skilled, passionate, and collaborative Product Operations Leader with a strong execution track record.  


This leader will be a key player of the Product/CTO’s leadership team who will actively collaborate with a broad set of leaders across the company.  This person will also play a critical role in the broader Business Operations community at New Relic working to define the common core of what business operations means across the company.


Initially the Product Operations lead will be responsible creating the vision and roadmap of what is required to support the organization longer term while also driving the tactical execution of key product operations needs.  Over time this role will be responsible for recruiting and leading the broader product operations team required to scale the engineering and product management functions effectively as we grow.


Success in this role includes:



  • A well balanced product/investment portfolio that is aligned across engineering/product marketing needs and with external market opportunities

  • Strong leverage of data and business insights incorporate into the decision making of the engineering and product management teams

  • Increased effectiveness in how the team engaged across the company and in the support the team gets from critical company functions such as HR, Finance, etc.

  • Increased leverage and job satisfaction for the Engineering and Product Management leadership whom can move from “doing” the operations work themselves to being a partner of the new product operations capability


Required skills/experience:



  • 12-15 years of experience leading operations team for in a major business function (Product, Marketing, or Sales)

  • Strong operational skills and execution oriented

  • Skilled at executive communication and driving cross function collaboration

  • Understands the full cycle of product development

  • BS/BA – MBA desired but not required


A little about us:


New Relic is a software analytics company that, on behalf of our customers, makes sense of billions of metrics about millions of applications, all in real time. Our comprehensive SaaS-based solution for web and mobile applications consolidates the performance monitoring data into a single, powerful interface. Our customers use New Relic every day to optimize millions of applications. 


New Relic is a San Francisco Best Places to Work award winner, an Oregon “Top Workplace” award winner, named a leader in the Gartner’s 2013 & 2014 “Magic Quadrant” for APM companies, a Top 100 OnDemand Company, Best of SaaS (THINKStrategies), Top 100 Coolest Cloud Computing (CRN); 10 Cloud Management Companies to Watch (NetworkWorld) – the list of accolades goes on. More important than all of that: we provide challenging work, opportunities to learn, high quality teammates, a standard-setting product, and a company on the move.


Our office is in the tech mecca of Portland, with easy commute access and a plethora of good eats and great coffee. We provide competitive compensation including equity and big-company benefits (medical, dental, etc.)—all while maintaining the energy, agility and fun of a start-up. We can help with relocation and are open to H1-B transfers.


New Relic is most decidedly an equal opportunity employer. We seek applicants of diverse background and hire without regard to race, color, gender, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, disability, age, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by law. Note: Our stewardship of the data of thousands of customers’ means that a criminal background check is required to join New Relic.


To get started, click on the link below. To fast track your application, let us know in your cover letter why this job, product, and/or company is of particular interest to you. We look forward to talking!




#LI-SD1


Apply Here

item.title: Research Scientist - Text-to-Speech at Amazon (Gdask, Polska)
item.description:
Amazon TTS team researches, develops and delivers cutting edge multi-language Text to Speech technology, leading in voice quality, accuracy and ease of use.

As part of our development team you will work within the Amazon Digital Products department. This department has developed significant digital businesses including Amazon MP3, Amazon Video on Demand, IMDB, Amazon Fire TV, the Kindle Fire and our recently released Amazon Echo.



We are a team of creative people who successfully combine passion and ambition in creating one of the best speech synthesizers in the world, and now are one of the most visible teams within Amazon where you will get the chance to have a huge influence on making a positive impact on customers all over the globe.

At Amazon, we take pride in building complete end-to-end solutions, staring from researching a problem, implementing the solution, building a scalable and reliable service and ensuring the service is there when you need it.

Our goal is to build a next generation Text-to-Speech (TTS) system that takes the user experience to the next level and speaks a large variety of voices in the world’s most spoken languages. The challenges we face is handling whole variety of data which need to be pronounced correctly (such as names, surnames, proper names, foreign words), as well as finding correlation of end-user ratings and internal TTS quality metrics. This requires an engineer approach to improve the basis of huge amount of synthesized texts and semantic knowledge of the text to improve pronunciation of context specific words.



This position is based in Amazon Development Center in Gdansk, Poland.



As part of our development team you will be responsible for research in speech synthesis, providing analysis using mathematical modeling tools to answer important questions, designing system architectures, utilizing code (C/C++, Perl or Java) and existing tools for modeling or prototyping, effective communication with management as well as with colleagues from computer science and business backgrounds. You will be involved in projects from concept to deployment, working closely with our core technology team, taking part in the complete project lifecycle.


  • MSc. or PhD degree in Computer Sciences, Machine Learning, or related technical field.

  • Proven track record of achievements in language research and development for Text-To-Speech, Automatic Speech Recognition or Natural Language processing

  • Professional experience in software development.

  • Knowledge of C/C++

  • Proficiency in at least one scripting languages (Perl, Python, Hadoop, Hive, etc)

  • Strong fundamentals in problem solving, algorithm design and complexity analysis.

  • Fundamentals in object-oriented design and data structures.

  • Strong personal interest in learning, researching, and creating new technologies with high commercial impact.




  • Knowledge of parametric and/or unit selection TTS technology.

  • Knowledge of software engineering practices & best practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations.

  • Clear, professional communication skills able to contribute to team discussions.


When applying, please enclose the following statement:

„I hereby give consent for my personal data included in my offer to be processed for the purposes of recruitment, in accordance with the Personal Data Protection Act dated 29.08.1997 (uniform text: Journal of Laws of the Republic of Poland 2002 No 101, item 926 with further amendments.

item.title: Perl Software Engineer - Las Vegas, NV at SUPERNAP (Las Vegas, NV)
item.description:
Join SUPERNAP - A Switch Company
Switch, the developer of SUPERNAP data centers, is the revolutionary technology solutions company led by inventor and solutionist Rob Roy. As Founder and CEO he holds 218 patents and patents pending that have produced an essential and future-forward transformation in data center architecture, engineering, technology and operations. His vision also resulted in the creation of the SUPERNAP CORE Cooperative. It is the world’s only $3 trillion independent purchasing and collaboration ecosystem, guided by the company’s unique operating ideology called Truth in Technology.

Designed by Rob Roy, the Switch award-winning Tier IV Gold SUPERNAP data centers are certified as the highest-ranking colocation data centers in the world and are maintained by the highest-rated mission critical operations teams. With more on-net, independent cloud providers than any other physical cloud gateway, SUPERNAP connects thousands of clients and providers from within the facility. SUPERNAP is the recognized world leader in colocation design, development and mission critical operations.

SUPERNAP, with clients ranging from sophisticated startups to Fortune 100 powerhouses, enables unparalleled mission critical solutions that make a difference in innovation, ROI and communities as a whole.

Perl Software Engineer - Las Vegas, NV

The purpose of this position is to design, architect, develop and test new web-based software applications and address issues with production systems, while also providing technical research, support and training as necessary. The ideal candidate will have a hard time placing a title on their skill set because besides being a Perl rockstar, they are also revered as a Linux Engineer, have a very respectable amount of network knowledge, and are just as good at "putting out fires" as they are with developing new code.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:



  • Responsible for architecting, developing, and testing new web-based applications in Object Oriented Perl.

  • Improve, fix, and test production web-based applications in Object Oriented Perl.

  • Utilize MySQL and DBI for data storage and retrieval within Perl applications.

  • Make technical recommendations based upon the current production applications and future applications.

  • Discuss and clearly articulate complex technical topics with technical and non-technical staff, and occasionally customers.

  • Eager to interact with other teams and departments, as well as customer facing and commercial teams.

  • Perform other duties and special projects as needed and directed.



    • Required Job Skills:



  • Expert Perl programming experience.

  • Experience with relational databases and SQL.

  • Knowledge of HTML, JavaScript and CSS.

  • Systems/software development experience in a Linux and/or *nix environment.

  • Advanced Perl Scripting, threading, forking and object oriented concepts experience.

  • Source control (GIT, SVN, CVS, etc.) experience.

  • Knowledge of PC LOAD LETTER.

  • Good sense of humor.



    • Computer Equipment and Software:



  • Comprehensive technical knowledge of software, servers, workstations, and the internet in general is expected.



    • Education and Experience:



  • BS degree in Computer Science or equivalent technical schooling and/or work experience.

  • 5-10 years experience (additional certifications preferred).




    • Physical Demands:
    The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

    While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit, stand, walk, bend, use hands, operate a computer, and have specific vision abilities to include close and distance vision, and ability to adjust focus working with computer and business equipment.

    The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to 10 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move up to 100 pounds.
    ____________________________________________________


    A STRICT BACKGROUND INVESTIGATION AND DRUG TEST WILL BE REQUIRED OF ALL CANDIDATES IN ALL DEPARTMENTS.

    Competitive salary commensurate with experience.

    Benefits include a group health, dental and vision plan, long term disability and life insurance, 401(k) Plan, FSA, paid vacations and paid holidays.

item.title: Software Engineer at Entrepreneurial Finance Lab (Cambridge, MA)
item.description:
About the Position:


EFL is seeking a technology guru to work directly on the intersection of software engineering and data science. As the primary lead on critical system operations and quality, you’ll have the opportunity to interact directly with clients all around the world and play a critical role in the smooth functioning of our critical modelling, data science, and software engineering processes.



You will work closely with EFL developers, statisticians, Account Managers, and customers. With responsibility for the end-to-end dataflow, you’ll ensure that our mobile platforms are working well in the field, our systems are running, and our data is being scored correctly. With responsibility for monitoring and client escalation issues, as well as critical roles during the new client launch phase, you’ll see an incredibly detailed view of how EFL works in 20 different countries around the world.



Primary Responsibilities:



  • Successfully manage and execute customer-facing Level 2 escalation issues

  • Develop hotfixes and upgrades to support a highly available cloud based platform

  • Participate in release deployment validation and processes

  • Develop automated testing frameworks and regression processes for a highly efficient quality system

  • Contribute and drive major development initiatives with codebases in Python/Django, R, MySQL, JQuery and React


Location: This position will be based either in our Boston office (in Cambridge) or Lima, Peru. At a minimum, this position will require an initial period of 2-3 months of up-front time spent in Lima followed by periodic trips back to Lima.

item.title: Senior SQL Database Administrator (SQL DBA) at CoStar Group (Los Angeles, CA)
item.description:
CoStar Group serves up over sixty terabytes of data from more than +330 SQL Servers that span four data centers, two continents and six time zones.  Our highly motivated, extremely talented DBA group is looking for an exceptionally bright Senior SQL DBA that will help the company continue to grow.  Our goal is to provide an exceptional experience for our customers by continued development, refinement and improvement of our industry leading applications.


We are a data-centric; Microsoft focused shop that uses the latest SQL Server and .NET technologies.  As a member of the team you will be relied on for your problem solving, communication, collaboration, project management, process adherence, and financial analysis skills.


CoStar Group is the leading data provider of Apartments and Commercial Real Estate Data in an industry valued at over 13 trillion dollars.  If you are seeking a challenge that pushes your limits, have a strong desire to delight your customers, want  to work with the latest technologies and are looking for responsibility beyond that of a typical DBA, come to work for us today.


Duties and Responsibilities:


·         Demonstrate extensive knowledge of all aspects Microsoft SQL Server including administration, replication, backup/restore procedures and related components such as Reporting Services, Analysis Services and Integration Services. 


·         Install, configure, monitor and maintain databases in the production, development, and quality assurance environments.


·         Recommend and implement solutions for SQL performance monitoring and tuning.


·         Assist with Windows Server configuration and management as it relates to MS SQL Server installation and performance.


·         Understand SAN based storage and related technologies, specifically as applicable and useful to MS SQL Server installations.


·         Process database change requests, including the creation and modification of databases, tables, views, stored procedures, triggers, jobs, etc. in accordance with change control policies.


·         Analyze problems, anticipate future problem areas and implement solutions.


·         Provide support and technical expertise to development, QA and other teams.


·         Work outside of normal business hours as required for completing projects, working on deployments and resolving system outages.

item.title: DevOps Engineer at INRIX (Kirkland, WA)
item.description:
INRIX (based in Kirkland, WA) is seeking a DevOps Engineer within our development team to help manage and drive operational systems, requirements and tool sets.  INRIX has numerous custom, complex systems running in our data centers to provide traffic and routing information. We are looking for someone who can take better control of our existing systems and infrastructure while helping to make decisions about new infrastructure and technologies to make it better.


The successful candidate will be a team player, capable of collaborating in a fast paced, devops oriented environment as well capable of working very independently with a high level of self-motivation.


Responsibilities:



  • Develop automation and processes to enable teams to deploy, manage, configure, scale and monitor their applications in data centers and in cloud

  • Actively participate in high level team activities such as suggesting architecture improvements, recommending process improvements and conducting tool evaluations

  • Help solve business needs with technology by evaluating different technology options and vendor products

  • System troubleshooting and problem solving across platform and application domains - will be expected to participate in on-call escalations to troubleshoot customer facing issues

  • Takes ownership of end-to-end solutions provided by teams across the organization

item.title: Sr SQL Server Developer at EchoStar (Superior, CO)
item.description:
Summary:          


Troppus Software, a wholly owned subsidiary of EchoStar in Superior, CO, is looking for a SQL Server Developer – a t-sql development and schema design expert, eager to support software development teams in an Agile development environment.


Responsibilities:



  • Taking ownership of the development side of working with SQL Server 2012, and working with the Senior Database Administrator - the SQL Developer’s operations counterpart. 

  • Take ownership of existing database code and schema, as well as trouble shooting and improving the logic, I/O and performance of existing code.

  • All aspects of database design, development and deployment.

  • Assess and advise on best practices for enhancing data integrity and availability.
