item.title: Security Engineer at Hotels.com (London, UK)
item.description:
The online travel market never stands still. The opportunity is huge and the competition is fierce. At Hotels.com, we're in the thick of it. We live and breathe travel. Our technology team is insanely passionate about using the best technology and processes to give our customers the best possible experience finding hotels for their business or leisure travel needs. We want them to feel the same passion for travel that we do.


Why build your career at Hotels.com?


 * You'll get to work with some spectacular people both from the technology team and wider business


 * We work hard to create a supportive, collaborative, and fulfilling place where you can progress your career


 * We have many of the best bits of a start-up but with the resources of the world's biggest travel company


 * We love open source and actively participate in the open source community


 * We win prizes (Netflix Cloud Prize for one)


 * We do hackathons where you can branch out of your usual area to contribute something different and innovative


 * We host and speak at meet ups


 * We want everyone on our team to have the tools and resources to succeed in their career


 * We get to do all of this in a lovely, comfortable office in a nice, central part of London


What we're looking for in you


 * We want you to come with passion, creativity, deep expertise, openness, flexibility and drive. Practicality and common sense are important to us.


 * We want you to be focused on moving the business forward. We don't just talk about security for the fun of it. We focus on how it matters to our customers and our business.


 * We want you to have a keen interest in the business, not just a given security topic. We want you to understand the big picture and how your work fits into it.


 * We want you to be excited the field of internet security like we are.


 * We want you to participate in the Hotels.com technology community, the wider Hotels.com team, and the wider security community around the world.


We live, eat, and breathe travel powered by technology. We work hard and play hard. We're never satisfied. We celebrate success and learn when we sometimes fall short.


Your job


Helping our business succeed through the power of data is a key priority across our business. In this role you'd be responsible for helping us achieve that by developing software to help us harness the power of the data available to us.


* Establish, maintain, and communicate Hotels.com security strategy.


* Establish and promote security best practices for developers, testers, and system administrators.


* Analyse security threats and propose strategic and tactical mitigation.


* Work with teams across Expedia, Inc. technology organisations on security related topics.


* Serve as primary owner for ongoing security audits.


* Manage vulnerability testing done on behalf of Hotels.com.


* Perform vulnerability testing when required.


* Manage and drive work related to obtaining and maintaining various security related certifications (i.e. PCI).


* Participate in architecture reviews to represent security concerns.



Your background


 * University degree or equivalent in computer science


 * Proven experience in security-related roles


 * Demonstrable knowledge of web technology


 * Prefer knowledge of Java development


 * Excellent verbal and written communication skills


 * Proven influencing and partnering skills


 * Proven organisational skills to manage security related remediation across functional teams


 * Excellent familiarity with common web security exploits and defences


 * Good system and network level knowledge


 * Knowledge of the Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI-DSS), TÜV SÜD s@fer-shopping, and SOX


 * Experience with enterprise level Security strategies


 * Experience with industry standard security tools from vendors like Fortify and Acunetix


 * Awareness of current and emerging industry best practices related to security


 * Familiarity with native mobile application security concerns

item.title: Product Designer - UX and Visual at Pivotal Labs (Dublin, Ireland)
item.description:
Pivotal is a recognized leader in lean and agile software design and development practices. We build consumer and enterprise web and mobile applications for global clients, and a cloud platform for applications and data.  


Our mission as Product Designers at Pivotal is to define and deliver the experience of the products we build to be simple, powerful, and delightful to use. We work directly with developers, product managers, users, customers, and stakeholders to define, design, and ship. Pivotal’s renowned agile approach ensures our pace is fast yet sustainable. Our commitment to quick feedback loops keeps us lean and focused. We have openings for designers with a variety of backgrounds, including: Design Research, User Experience, Interaction Design, and Visual Design.


We are currently looking for experienced designers in all areas of the business including:


Pivotal Labs



  • Transformational lean and agile consulting with startup to enterprise clients.


Pivotal Cloud Foundry



  • Improving the lives of the people who deploy and manage <emcloud based applications.


Pivotal Big Data Suite



  • Delivering data processing, advanced analytics, and data driven applications at scale.


Internal Applications Group 



  • Bringing our own in-house tools to market to support a better workplace.


Why we love what we do (and so could you)



  • Design pairing and cross-functional pairing

  • Seriously collaborative, even with people not on our teams

  • Work alongside and learn from lean and agile leaders

  • Daily product decision making and real product delivery with product managers and developers

  • Freedom to try out new design processes; in the spirit of agile, do what works, try new things, stop doing things that don’t work

  • You are always shipping!

  • Immerse yourself in one project at a time

  • Environment that encourages learning and growing as a professional and individual and infrastructure to support and motivate those goals

  • Community oriented design team

  • All the designers have different skillsets: you’re not expected to be an expert in everything but having access to someone who probably is means we all get smarter by teaching and learning


What we do as Product Designers for web and mobile applications



  • Maintain a user-centered approach in design perspective and practice

  • Work as a collaborative team member with developers, PMs, and fellow designers

  • Lead products from discovery and framework through iterative development and delivery

  • Help product managers assess and prioritize opportunities and constraints

  • Guide product decisions through user research, customer development, and iterative feedback loops

  • Determine best practice approaches and lead others through our process

  • Rapidly iterate on design prototypes and working applications

  • Conduct frequent user research, testing, and analysis

  • Develop visual identity systems, data visualizations, visual design, illustrations, etc.

  • Produce materials for clients and developers, including user flows, wireframes, mockups, live style guides, and assets

item.title: SQL Developer - DBA at Wisconsin Foundation & Alumni Association (Madison, WI)
item.description:
Note – when submitting application materials, cover letter and resume must be combined into a single attachment


The Wisconsin Foundation and Alumni Association (WFAA)*, the private fundraising entity for the UW-Madison, is recruiting for a SQL Developer to join our Information Technology Department. The focus for this position will be on database and data warehouse development, query development, management reporting and database maintenance and optimization.


This position represents an exciting opportunity to blend SQL Developer with DBA duties, with a 70% to 30% ratio between SQL Developer and DBA activities. Some training (formal and on the job) will be provided, dependent on candidate’s skill level.


*The Wisconsin Foundation and Alumni Association is the “doing business as” name of the merged organization comprising the University of Wisconsin Foundation (www.supportuw.org) and the Wisconsin Alumni Association (www.uwalumni.com), whose legal corporate name is registered as the University of Wisconsin Foundation.



Essential Functions


Key Functions/Responsibilities



  • Develop, maintain and enhance reports, queries and data exports

  • Develop and test stored procedures, views and functions

  • Perform quality checks on reports and exports to ensure exceptional quality

  • Provide business users the data required for metrics and analysis

  • Develop new SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) packages to meet business needs

  • Design and develop SQL databases and write applications to interface with SQL databases

  • Identify WFAA specific needs regarding database configuration and monitoring and work with third party DBAs from planning through implementation

  • Determine and implement effective ways to improve performance including index and/or query changes, database and/or server configuration changes, hardware purchases

  • Review, audit and maintain permissions and security settings on WFAA databases



Support a service-oriented atmosphere in accordance with WFAA mission, values and philosophy



  • The transforming impact of the UW Madison;

  • The treatment of all with high ethical and behavioral standards including honesty, integrity, respect, courtesy, and dignity;

  • The spirit, involvement, participation, engagement, and impact of alumni and friends with the UW-Madison and with each other;

  • The joy of giving and the power of philanthropy;

  • The interdependent nature of all aspects of the Parties’ collective relationships in fulfilling their missions; and

  • The highest level of stewardship of the investment of donors’ philanthropy in support of the UW-Madison and the relationships and trust accrued through alumni development and engagement activities.



Other


This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer: Web UI Applications at Exosite (Minneapolis, MN)
item.description:
OVERVIEW:


At Exosite, you will be working with a top-tier team to build web-based front end applications for Exosite products.  At Exosite we love building highly responsive, engaging user experiences for this data driven world in which we live, work, learn and play.


As part of the Exosite Product Team you will have the opportunity to give input into the entire design, development and deployment life cycle of the applications you are building.  Your primary objective will be to architect and implement web-based client side application code and user interfaces within a fast paced environment that is building the next generation of products for connected devices and applications.


WHO YOU ARE:


You are primarily a software engineer that shines at programming web-based user interfaces.  You have an exceptional ability to create well-designed software that meets the marketing and user experience requirements gathered from key stakeholders.  You are satisfied with nothing less than the best, yet know how to deliver to business needs.


You have experience mentoring junior level developers and are an excellent oral and written communicator, comfortable with engaging both internal and external stakeholders.  You proactively and positively engage within a team environment to deliver software of the highest quality.


You know that documenting and testing your code is an essential part of development.  You write tests that validate the implementation of your documented design and that ensure regressions do not occur.

item.title: Senior Developer- Core Java at Infusion (New York, NY)
item.description:
Senior Java Developer


New York City


Are you a Java development superstar with strong consulting capability and proven record of designing and delivering innovative enterprise solutions?  Would you like to have an opportunity to build your own team and to positively impact our business?  If yes, read on!


Infusion is a global innovation, technology, and design firm.  We are seeking a Senior Developer to join our New York team. Our project teams build software from the ground up, using the best technologies and frameworks for the job.  You will help us create environments that maximize developer productivity, and help set our strategy for delivering major projects to our clients.


The Role:


You will be joining our Capital Markets team to build large scale business solutions and work directly with are clients - who are some of the world’s leading investment banks!  You will be responsible for developing new components for saving, calculating, and aggregating massive amounts of real time data for a massive overhaul of a global risk system. This ongoing program that will help transform the business and will allow the production of aggregated risk services, enable the allocation of capital, improve decisions for trading, and assess risk and overall accountability of across the Bank. 


H1 transfer and relocation expenses will be offered to qualified candidates.

item.title: Senior Java Back-End Software Engineer at VMware Bulgaria (Sofia, Bulgaria)
item.description:
VMware is the leader in cloud infrastructure, business mobility and virtualization software. A pioneer in the use of virtualization and policy-driven automation technologies, VMware simplifies IT complexity across the entire data center to the virtual workplace, empowering customers with solutions in the software-defined data center to hybrid cloud computing and the mobile workspace.

With 2014 revenues of $6.04 billion, VMware has more than 500,000 customers, 75,000 partners, and 18,000+ employees in 120+ locations around the world. At the core of what we do are our employees who deeply value execution, passion, integrity, customers, and community. Want to be part of a compassionate community that thrives on architecting what's next in IT?

Responsibilities:
- Design and implement the next generation architecture of VMware's virtualization products
- Be part of a software development team working in collaboration with management, quality assurance, user experience and technical publications teams
- You will define/analyze the product requirements, write/read functional and design specifications, write/support the code
- You will perform code reviews to the rest of the team members and will receive code reviews of your code as well
- You will have to adhere to VMware internal processes during the whole development cycle – idea, patent, requirements, specifications, designs, implementation, bug fixing, QA, support, etc.

Required:
- Experience with product development or strong willingness to switch from outsourcing to product development
- General programming knowledge - object oriented principles, data structures, algorithms, design patterns, memory management, etc.
- Solid background in fundamentals of computer science and development process
- Willingness to innovate, learn and share knowledge, invent and patent new algorithms and technologies
- Professional programming experience in Java and related technologies
- Experience with distributed systems
- Experience with enterprise architectures – remote method invocations, extensive XML usage, stateless designs, load balancing, SSL security, etc.
- Experience with web services (REST, SOAP, WSDL etc.)
- Experience with multi-tiered architectures (Service-Application-Presentation)
- Experience in developing UI application in Java and Flex is a big plus
- Willingness to develop both front and back end applications
- Willingness to use different programming languages to address the specific product needs (Python, Batch Scripting, etc.)
- Excellent analytical and problem solving skills
- Willingness to work without close supervision and with proactive goal-oriented attitude
- Willing to practice into other roles like code review, pair programming, QE automation
- Excellent communication skills and fluent English (speaking/reading/writing)

Desired:
- Hands-on experience in utilizing Spring Framework
- Experience with Python
- Experience working in an agile environment is a plus

VMware offers:
- Attractive compensation package - competitive salary, flexible bonus scheme, company sponsored mobile phone plan and additional long term incentives
- Individual career path - management and technical career growth, enhanced by learning and development program, regular performance assessment, teams of world-wide IT professionals
- Healthy work environment - company sponsored medical program, food and beverage program, sport activities, open communication
- Work-life balance – 25 days paid vacation, team buildings and celebrations All applications will be treated with strict confidentiality.

As part of the VMware global standards for integrity you will be required to go through a pre-employment screening process before you join.

All applications will be treated with strict confidentiality.


No visa or work permit requirements for EU citizens or EU work permit holders

item.title: Sr. Software Engineer (Middleware) at SolarCity (San Mateo, CA)
item.description:
SolarCity is seeking a highly talented and versatile Software Engineer with a strong understanding of object oriented programming and SaaS systems.  In this role, you will transform terabytes of real-time data into practical and action-able information for our customers as well as our technicians.  That data comes from our tens of thousands of customers with solar electric systems, energy meters, and grid connected batteries.  We have a lot data and even more on the way - you will be crunching, transforming, graphing, caching, and archiving a growing stream of information.


Your work will accelerate the adoption of clean energy, and improve the lives of hundreds of thousands of users.  You will get to work with a small, fast-paced, and dedicated software team to design and develop cutting edge products.

item.title: Software Engineer, Recommender Systems (Junior, Senior) at Zalando SE (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
THE OPPORTUNITY


As a software engineer you will focus on developing Zalando’s in-house recommender system into a state of the art microservice. Your main task will be to position this technology as a “software as a service” component which can be fully leveraged within the Zalando platform. You will be part of a small, autonomous, and highly ambitious team consisting of experienced Java developers and expert data scientists. 


WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR  



  • You have at least 2 years of experience, working as a Java Software Developer

  • You write well-structured and tested code in the spirit of Effective Java and Clean Code that easily scales to Enterprise level

  • You know the most common design patterns and you know in which context to apply them

  • You have a solid background in applied machine learning and you can implement algorithms in a parallel fashion

  • You love to optimize processes and code, and to use new technologies

  • You are experienced in building, evaluating, maintaining and improving data-driven products at scale, which are real-time oriented

  • You are familiar with the Map-Reduce paradigm and the main aspects of functional programming

  • Knowing near-realtime stream processing and/or message-driven architectures (e.g. Spark, Storm, Aerospike, Kafka) is a plus 


YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES



  • You will be part of an agile and very experienced team that will further develop our recommendation and personalization engine in short release cycles

  • You will implement highly scalable solutions with state-of-the-art-technologies together with your team

  • You will transfer algorithmic prototypes to enterprise level, highly scalable and fault-tolerant solutions using the right technology for the job

  • You are collaborating with our data scientists to improve and extend our recommendation engine and other analytical customer experience solutions

  • You will be part of a multi-cultural team with different native languages, skills and backgrounds 


WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM US


Our recipe to success: Think big and act fast. Your contribution today will influence millions of customers tomorrow. At Zalando you have the opportunity to work for a fast growing international company that wants to offer the world’s best fashion experience. Obviously we offer you much more:



  • An exceptional opportunity to develop your skill set while learning from a team of top experts who will inspire and support you

  • Use of cutting-edge open source technologies and cloud services

  • Learning and growth opportunities: weekly tech talks, company-hosted tech meetups, rich team library (which you can expand with your book requests), possibility of visiting conferences

  • Complimentary fruit, beverages, table soccer, ping pong and band room

  • Employee discount for all Zalando shop products

  • Powerful hardware system environment

  • Through our mentoring program you will get up to speed and become productive very quickly

  • You will never be bored! Zalando offers a very exciting and fun working environment 


ABOUT ZALANDO


Zalando is Europe’s leading online fashion platform, doing business in 15 markets. Delivering first-class shopping experiences to our +15 million customers requires moving fast — with microservices, Agile processes and autonomous teams  —  and using cutting-edge, open source technologies. We are passionate about what we do and have fun while doing it. And we are willing to experiment and make mistakes: It’s how we grow.


WANT TO JOIN US? THEN GO AHEAD AND APPLY!


If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring processes, please contact recruiter Lyudmila Barabash at jobs@zalando.de.

item.title: wanted: Android Engineer hacker / bandmate at The Hackerati (New York, NY)
item.description:
What We Do


Technology Consultancy


The Hackerati is a high-end, boutique consulting firm delivering Engineering as a Service to diverse clients, from Fortune 250s to startups.


Why You Should Join Us


We're not afraid to be our wild selves.


We’re different. With mottos like be fearless and weird is good, our unique perspectives on life and technology make us great people to learn from and work/party with. We sponsor lunches and happy hours, band practice, electronics like Glass/Oculus/Myo, and we’ve presented at the UN—twice. We rock that familial vibe, and you should join us if you enjoy a blurred line between work and play.


What To Expect


Deliver the industry's most challenging projects.


Hackerati consultants are like The Wolf from Pulp Fiction: we solve problems. Hard ones. To do so, we deploy teams of Hackerati to work onsite with clients around NYC, and also build products in-house, both for ourselves and clients. A typical project lasts between 6 and 9 months—Thus there is constant diversity of work.

item.title: Systems Administrator at Synthetic Genomics, Inc. (San Diego, CA)
item.description: At Synthetic Genomics, Inc., we are dedicated to developing and commercializing genomic-driven solutions to address global challenges. We are currently seeking a Systems Administrator to join our fast-growing, dynamic and collaborative team in La Jolla, CA.

item.title: Frontend Web Developer - Application User Interface at CensorNet Ltd (Emersons Green, UK)
item.description:
This role is ideally suited to someone with a passion for application dashboards & user interfaces and for someone that strives for pixel perfection across modern web browsers running on desktop and mobile devices. Our view is that less is more, and the challenge is to present a lot of data in an easy to understand way, that makes it quick and simple to process and take action against.  As we unify all our cloud products into one dashboard, the candidate must have knowledge of developing and using API’s (e.g. PHP, Ruby, JSON) and presenting that data to the user in a visually appealing way (using frameworks such as Sencha ExtJS, D3.js, JQuery and charting libraries). The role is varied, covering all aspects from user authentication, backend integration, visual look and feel, widgets, charting and data visualisation.


The role expects the candidate to have demonstrable experience developing application dashboards and experience managing junior developers as well. Initially, the role will be split between assisting with the completion of a SaaS dashboard that is already in progress and also creating a new user interface for our Enterprise web security product, which will be a distributed product designed to scale for use in the largest of organisations. There is an overriding requirement to take ownership of the user interface across all our products to ensure consistency. Knowledge and experience of mobile, tablet and responsive design and the ability to influence this in the user interface is essential as we strive to make the products as easy as possible for our customers to use.

item.title: Full Stack Software Engineer, Synthetics at New Relic (Portland, OR)
item.description:
New Relic is software analytics. Fueled by real-time data from production software, we provide clear, actionable intelligence about high-velocity web and mobile applications and their end-users. Our first, and very successful, SaaS tool for such analytics monitors real-time traffic from real users. The Next New Thing for New Relic is monitoring real-time traffic from synthetic users.


As one of the engineers building this product, you'll be designing the architecture, writing the code, and, of course, monitoring it all by automating browsers with New Relic Synthetics.


Some of the things we work on:



  • How to make the process of scripting a browser more fun and less pain

  • How to present large amounts of browser metrics to customers in a simple but meaningful way

  • How to orchestrate hundreds of browsers running synthetic transactions across the globe and ensure that all transactions are both reliable and properly sandboxed

  • How to ensure that we’re capturing all possible transaction metrics even if they appear not meaningful at first

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at CrowdTwist (New York, NY)
item.description:
About Us and the Role:


CrowdTwist is seeking a Senior Software Engineer for our growing team based in New York City.  In this role, you will work directly with all areas of our platform while adding new features and new products to the CrowdTwist platform. You will be involved in many different projects as we continue to grow and enhance our platform.  Your work will be in front of millions of people and will directly influence the loyalty program offerings for many of our clients, such as Pepsi, Nestlé, Lancome, Ubisoft and Zumiez.


We are a venture-backed NYC based company that provides the most comprehensive omni-channel loyalty & analytics solutions for industry leading brands. We're relaxed, experienced, hard driving and are changing our industry.


Your work will span many areas of the CrowdTwist platform, including but not limited to:



  • The consumer-facing loyalty program experience

  • Our RESTful APIs

  • Our scalable microservices architecture

  • Our client-facing content management applications

  • Integrations with social networks (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Foursquare, etc) and vendors (PoS, ESP, CRM, Bazaarvoice, OrderGroove, etc)

  • Our data-driven, client-customizable JavaScript SDK


This role is for an engineer who loves to roll up their sleeves, dive in, and tackle any problem with speed and precision.  You will be utilizing your experience with object-oriented software design and implementation, data modeling, and building high-performance, highly scalable web and data processing applications.  We operate in an agile manner, so you must thrive in a fast-paced environment and enjoy shipping product.


In this role, you will work with a broad backend tech stack, including but not limited to:



  • PHP

  • Java

  • Oracle

  • Redis

  • MongoDB

  • RabbitMQ

  • Docker

  • Amazon Web Services (EC2, VPC, ELB, S3, RedShift, CloudFront etc.)

  • Various third-party services (Twilio, SendGrid, EdgeCast, etc.)

item.title: Senior Front-End Developer at Rapid7 (Austin, TX)
item.description:
Job Overview


Be part of the security software revolution with Rapid7. Join the Threat Exposure Management team in Austin, Texas and work on strategic, highly-visible products and features utilizing cutting edge technologies. We seek self-organized, highly motivated team members whose focus is to "make it happen." 


The ideal candidate is a passionate problem solver who is willing to learn new skills and new technologies. Experience with front end development, agile development, and the security industry are strong pluses. This is an exciting opportunity to be part of the next generation of security solutions and is open to enthusiastic and talented front end developers.


Job Responsibilities



  • Incrementally deliver features taking them from user requirements to product release with feedback from Product Owners, Architects, Quality Engineering and Release Engineering.

  • Contribute as a team member on a cross-functional scrum team in charge of delivering new features on a bi-weekly basis.

  • Participate with scrum team to plan and commit to iterations of feature development.

  • Drive towards delivery of those commitments throughout the iteration and raise risks early.

  • Actively engage in overall quality engineering through the implementation of tests at the unit (TDD) and feature (BDD) levels.

  • Demonstrate eagerness to learn new technologies and explore new problem domains.

item.title: Support and Integrations Engineer at Myriad Group (Mexico City, Mexico)
item.description:
Our Sub Data Division is extending his precense in LATAM in order to deliver enhanced support to our key LATAM customers.


As part of this strategy, we are looking after support and operation engineering in order to provide Daily Support as well as helping deliver our new solution within this region.


The mission will cover various activities like :



  • Support our USSD customers (Selfcare services) and our VAS service (Facebook, twitter over USSD and SMS).

  • Deliver new services (installation of patch, new version).

  • Developing new USSD services.


Those missions will be in direct contact with the Key Operators within the LATAM area and other regions when required.


The key responsibilities will include:



  • Being fully committed to provide the relevant SLA service to our customers.

  • Working independently to trouble shoot system issues and defects.

  • Improving the process and enhanced efficiency of the team.

  • Managing patches and getting releases into production (including rollbacks, etc).

  • Assisting in on-going load and performance testing activities.

  • Working with the R&D team on defect prioritisation and resolution.

  • Reporting to the manager on progress and areas of technical responsibility.

  • Preparing relevant maintenance and documentation.

item.title: Watson Software Engineer, Search at AlchemyAPI, an IBM Watson Company (Denver, CO)
item.description:
AlchemyAPI, an IBM company, is used by customers across dozens of countries, including some of the largest companies in the world. We're solving real-world problems affecting billion-dollar industries. Come help us build amazing technology and do it at scale.


We are looking for a talented search engineer to join our growing team. In this role, you will play a critical part in building a scalable data analytics and search platform that powers our next generation of products. Successful candidates will have an extensive background in Lucene-based distributed search systems such as ElasticSearch (preferred) or Solr with a solid understanding of Lucene internals.

item.title: Full Stack LAMP Developer at Vital Storm (Dallas, TX)
item.description:
Software Engineer - PHP Developer


The person that accepts this position will be responsible for developing the internet marketing platform that drives VitalStorm forward. This technology is the centerpiece of what we provide our clients. The person will not only be responsible for the development of the platform but also have input on the direction we move our technology and company in the future.


About VitalStorm


VitalStorm is a growing team of creative thinkers who are passionate about driving leads through local search. Whether it is through PPC, SEO, Social Media, or Web Design, we convert Internet traffic into qualified leads via a unique process of creative design and campaign management that is tailored toward and perfectly suited for the Home Services Industry. 


Vital Storm provides a fun, high-energy, cutting-edge environment. Work environment and company culture are very important. We work hard but also want to make sure everyone enjoys their time at work as much as possible and feels like they are part of a close and engaging team.


Job Summary


The VitalStorm Metrics (Metrics) platform is a state-of-the-art marketing management and reporting system. Metrics has multiple audiences and is used by both Clients and internal Account Managers. Our clients use Metrics on a daily basis to track and manage their internet marketing campaigns.


Clients can log in to the Metrics platform and review information and reports associated with their account. The analytics reports include a merger of data from Google AdWords, Microsoft AdCenter, Marchex Call Analytics, plus additional client data.


Clients have multiple types of users that have access to different levels of information.  For example, VitalStorm Feedback is a training platform that is supported by Metrics. Client Users who are part of the training program do not necessarily have access to additional information available via Metrics.


They can only access the information that is relevant to them. In addition, Metrics is used internally by VitalStorm Account Managers to gather and merge data to aid in the account management process. In summary, VitalStorm Metrics is the focal point for our company going forward and a competitive advantage in the world of digital marketing. 


The developer that fills this position would be required to maintain the existing platform and also complete additions in the functionality of the overall system. The programming task associated with Metrics will be approximately 30% maintenance and 70% new development.


Other tasks could include:



  • Monitor changing API specifications

  • Maintain a complex application hosting environment

  • Work with and manage third party companies and may augment development

  • System testing, fault finding, and bug fixes

  • System documentation and reporting

  • Research new information and technology


This position includes competitive pay, paid time off, standard holidays, and medical benefits.  Additional perks will include new work station with multiple monitors, updated development environment, and the opportunity for continuing education.


Growth Potential


Initially this position is focused on the development of the Metric platform as described above.  However, the person that accepts this position will have the opportunity to work on and manage additional high profile client projects.  This responsibility could include leading a development/technical team.  More information concerning future growth and additional projects can be discussed during the interview process.

item.title: Systems Administrator at Outbox AXS LLC (Los Angeles, CA)
item.description:
The Systems Administrator is responsible for helping to manage an office IT infrastructure including network switches, firewalls, wireless access points, telephone systems and end user workstations. Working as part of a team with infrastructure and dev-ops engineers, the Systems Administrator will help with monitoring, troubleshooting and issue response.  Ideally, the Systems Administrator is interested in working towards a Systems Engineering or dev-ops role.



Essential Duties



  • Management of Office IT infrastructure and workstation environment

  • Oversee provisioning and configuration of new user systems and account creation

  • Work with Infrastructure and dev-ops teams on issue resolution and systems management

  • First-line responsibility for new system, end user and application issues

  • Management of local IT systems including directory services, NFS, NAS and XenServers

  • Provide desktop support and end user system and application management 

  • Participate in on-call rotation and 24x7x365 NOC

item.title: Senior Website Operations Engineer, Web Core at Quantcast (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
The Web Core team owns quantcast.com and keeps it running smoothly for the 1M+ visitors it gets every month.  We also develop and maintain the shared application infrastructure used by other teams within the organization to develop externally facing applications. Some of these tools include authentication, authorization, navigation panels, load balancing, A/B infrastructure, deployment services as well as supporting our Wordpress marketing site.

As a senior operations engineer, you will have an opportunity to drive architectural decisions and develop our A/B infrastructure, deployment systems, load-testing infrastructure, monitoring and performance. The team includes both operations and software engineers and you will be expected to code review and develop cross-functionally, expect to see Java, Python, Go and Javascript on a regular basis. Working in a team with several internal customers will give you the opportunity to have a major impact on the success of our large-scale web applications and their development.

As our ideal candidate for this role, you will have significant experience testing and maintaining mission-critical web applications. You will be adept at finding bottlenecks, analyzing performance, tuning alerts, identifying single points of failure and deploying software in a zero downtime manner. You will know how to achieve 5 nines and will be pushing the team to design to get there.

Our toolchain involves Java Play Framework applications, HAProxy, NGINX, Jenkins, Puppet, Consul.io, Terraform and Fabric. We are moving our infrastructure from physical hardware to EC2 over the coming months and intend to move toward a continuous deployment system as well.


Responsibilities



  • Deploy, monitor, and administer a high profile website and its underlying critical services

  • Develop innovative solutions to large-scale data transfer challenges

  • Improve the performance of our web applications and solve scaling issues

  • Develop automation and improvements to our deployment, monitoring, and testing processes

  • Serve on our on-call rotation with other engineers on the team

item.title: Database Administrator at EMBL-EBI (Hinxton, UK)
item.description:
We are seeking a highly proficient and motivated Database Administrator to join the Database Administration Team (DBA Team), part of the Systems Applications team. Located in Hinxton, near Cambridge, the European Bioinformatics Institute (EMBL-EBI) offers a unique opportunity to acquire professional experience in an international scientific environment.

The Systems Applications team consists of 15 System Administrators responsible for our virtual infrastructure, database administration and desktop user support.

The DBA Team is responsible for the database administration of the large central database infrastructure that is deployed over a Virtual Infrastructure based on VMWare. This infrastructure serves most Services and Research groups at EMBL-EBI and incorporates databases across geographically distributed production, public facing and disaster recovery datacentres.

The job consists of providing day-to-day Database Administration activities for the Production, Development and Test database environments across the supported database technologies MySQL, Oracle, PostgreSQL, Vertica, MongoDB and MS SQL Server.

The activities of the Team include (but are not limited to):



  • Database software installation and configuration;

  • Back-up and recovery;

  • Dataguard and replication solutions;

  • Scripting;

  • Performance tuning;

  • Database virtualisation and databases in virtualised environments;

  • Exploring innovation;

  • Monitoring, reporting and keeping online documentation up-to-date; and

  • Interacting with database developers and application developers from the EMBL-EBI service groups.


The EBI is part of the European Molecular Biology Laboratory (EMBL) and it is a world-leading bioinformatics centre providing biological data to the scientific community with expertise in data storage, analysis and representation. EMBL-EBI provides freely available data from life science experiments, performs basic research in computational biology and offers an extensive user training programme, supporting researchers in academic and industry.

item.title: Software Testers - Manual and Automated - Central Edinburgh at Axios Systems (Edinburgh, UK)
item.description:
To be considered you must have the right to live and work in the UK. We cannot offer sponsorship.


Ideal Candidate


The ideal candidate for this role will have worked in an agile environment within an enterprise software organisation. They will have been responsible for all aspects of the testing discipline for agile projects e.g. elaboration of requirements, testing of stories, maintenance of regression test suites, defect tracking & progression, automated testing discipline for a large and complex system etc.


Job Description


Test Engineers are responsible for the quality of released software and documentation. The specific responsibilities include:



  • Elaborate software requirements, in conjunction with the team, to produce detailed Acceptance Criteria.

  • Provide technical expertise to influence the direction of test automation

  • Execution of both manual & automated tests to verify the quality of the software.

  • Maintenance of complex test data

  • Maintenance & execution of regression test suites.

  • Select and develop appropriate test automation tools, applying the latest techniques in test automation e.g. Behaviour Driven Development, Continuous integration

  • Analyse, plan and write generic reusable test scripts that verify the evolving business logic and user interface software continues to satisfy requirements

  • Reporting effectively on all test activities; test results, defects, test progress.

  • Tracking and managing the status of defects through to successful closure.

  • Review customer facing documentation to ensure that it correctly & concisely describes the released software.

item.title: Director, Solutions Architect-Java, Agile, Product Delivery at Fidelity (Durham, NC)
item.description:
Fidelity Strategic Investment Products and Data (SIPD) is seeking Director, Solutions Architect to lead project delivery for our Retail Managed Account Product Line.  The Solution Architect will create and maintain architecture plans and specifications for related applications.  He/she also guides project and program level decisions to ensure alignment with the Fidelity Enterprise Technology architecture strategy. Strategic Investment Products and Data (SIPD) is a shared technology services organization within Enterprise Technology.  SIPD manages and supports Guidance and Planning tools, Managed Accounts offerings, and Integrated Data Solutions across multiple Fidelity companies. The Director of Architecture will be located in Durham, NC; Smithfield, RI; or Merrimack, NH with periodic travel to Boston and North Carolina depending on location. 


Primary Responsibilities



  • Provide architecture leadership for Managed Accounts product delivery

  • Participate in all aspects of Manage Accounts product innovation

  • Develop and assess technical solutions for the Managed Account product line

  • Identify approaches, tools, techniques, and technologies to meet business requirements

  • Recommend solutions that address functional and quality goals of systems

  • Establish, implement, and enforce appropriate architecture standards in the creation and implementation of the technical solution

  • Ensure delivery teams are following engineering best practices

  • Responsible for technical implementation of architectural components when needed

  • Assess and explain the present and future rationale of architecture decisions

  • Mediate opposing viewpoints and negotiate equitable solutions to ensure successful and stable outcomes for the Managed Accounts product space

  • Contribute to multi-year technical roadmap, blueprints and reference architecture plans for the Managed Account product line

  • Provide strategic architecture guidance in support of project delivery estimates

a10:author.a10:name: The Parliamentary Information and Communications Technology Department (PICT)

item.title: VM Ware Specialist at The Parliamentary Information and Communications Technology Department (PICT) (London, UK)
item.description:
The Parliamentary Digital Services forms part of the Parliamentary Administration. The Parliamentary Digital Service works closely with both the House of Commons and House of Lords to deliver new technologies and technology enabled change both through 3rd party contracts/procurements and in-house bespoke development. We are responsible for all operational


ICT support for Parliament including a complex business applications portfolio and a secure and efficient network / desktop environment for MPs, Lords and Parliamentary staff.


We currently have a role for an Enterprise VMWare Specialist; in this role you will provide technical expertise to support the virtual platform and focus on continuous improvement initiatives to enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of the Parliamentary systems. The successful candidate must have proven experience in the use of VMWare’s virtualisation and ideally some exposure to NetApp storage technologies.


You will have a technical understanding of a wide range of systems including VMWare, Windows operating systems, NetApp Data Storage, Active Directory and Infrastructure systems administration. You will have proven ability to form effective working relationships across directorates; excellent oral and interpersonal skills are essential and the ability to explain technical issues to non-technical people. You must be able to demonstrate good planning and organisational skills, coping well with fluctuations in workload.


SALARY AND BENEFITS


We offer a comprehensive benefits package including:



  • excellent learning and development opportunities

  • generous annual leave

  • contributory pension scheme

  • childcare voucher scheme, on site nursery

  • season ticket/bicycle loans

  • in house gym

item.title: Principal Software Engineer at clypd (Somerville, MA)
item.description:
You will be learning all aspects of the system and contributing to them. You will work with the rest of the engineering and product teams to deliver quickly and fluidly using Agile methodologies. You will use Continuous Integration and Test Driven Development techniques to build rock-solid code.
 

Skills and experience:

  • Achieved at least a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering
  • 10+ years of experience
  • Willingness to learn and improve your web stack skills: front end, back end or both
  • For front end: experience or interest in building interactive user experiences with modern HTML5 and JavaScript, and comfortable working with the services that drive them
  • Previous use of MV* frameworks on the client (AngularJS, Ember, ...) and/or server side (Rails, Django, Grails, ...) a huge plus
  • For back end: experience in working with large data sets, database performance, REST APIs, and Go a plus
  • Excitement about startups and working with a small (but quickly expanding) Agile team
  • Communication is key; our work is heavily team-oriented, and we are looking for someone who is comfortable participating and contributing to the team
  • Passion for delivering quality code and products. Code reviews and automated tests are an integral part of our development process. We are always looking for new ways to improve.

Our stack:

  • Ruby on Rails, React, JQuery, RSpec/Capybara
  • Go
  • Docker
  • PostgreSQL/RDS, Redis
  • AWS

Perks and benefits:

  • Competitive compensation and stock options
  • Comprehensive benefits package (Health, Dental, Vision, Long-term and Short-term disability, 401(k), cell phone subsidy, commuter safety subsidy)
  • Unlimited paid time off  - take the time you need to operate at peak performance
  • Learning culture that includes weekly Lunch and Learns and a formal mentor program
  • Amazing office space in Davis Square, one of the hottest neighborhoods in Somerville
  • Open and relaxed office layout, including standing desks, walking desks, and a choice of comfortable seating
  • Macbook and Thunderbolt display
  • Three rotating beer taps, iced tea and iced coffee on tap, wine bar, tea bar, and more
  • Game room with darts, foosball, Xbox One, PS4, and more
  • Fun team outings and celebrations, an annual company outing and holiday party

Who we are:

clypd is a leading player in one of the hottest emerging markets of programmatic TV, disrupting the $74 billion television industry. We are on a mission to change television advertising, to make it more efficient and effective for TV media companies, consumers, and advertisers. We've built an advertising technology platform to empower media companies with programmatic strategies. Our sales platform delivers workflow automation, data-enhanced decisioning and provides media partners with tools to manage their sales efforts.

We are looking for awesome people to join a growing and fun team. We aim to create an environment that is open and transparent, collaborative, supportive, and diverse. We are looking for engineers who want to learn about the latest technologies to craft scalable and maintainable code. The problems we are solving are challenging and interesting and we want your help.

item.title: Infrastructure Platform Engineer (Chef) at Bloomberg LP (Washington, DC)
item.description:
Bloomberg Careers - Infrastructure Platform Engineer (Chef) 


The Role:


Bloomberg's Infrastructure Platform group in R&D delivers services which support the fast-paced Bloomberg environment. This includes key infrastructure capabilities used across all of Bloomberg's products and services.


As a Infrastructure Platform Engineer, you will be primarily responsible for the design, maintenance and administration of the system and services built to automate our compute environment. Our enterprise uses Chef for this function and we are deploying Chef across all of Bloomberg's unique large-scale systems. Not only will your work be used by thousands of technologists at Bloomberg, but as an active open-source contributor, Bloomberg encourages you to work on projects and commit code that raises the bar for the community as a whole.


Talk to us about how you can become part of one of the newest, most technical diverse Chef installations in the industry; we have problems to challenge even the best engineers!

item.title: Front-end Developer at EcoHealth Alliance (New York, NY)
item.description:
Are you interested in applying your design skills to help researchers identify the next global infectious disease threat?


EcoHealth Alliance is seeking a Web Designer for our tech team. As part of a small team of developers, data scientists, infectious disease scientists, you’ll develop tools to support EcoHealth Alliance’s mission in conservation and global public health.


Description and Responsibilities:



  • Help design and enhance the UI/UX of our data-driven web applications

  • Create wireframes, mockups, and prototypes of applications and their components that effectively communicate interaction and design ideas to developers

  • Help with the implementation of designs using HTML, CSS and JavaScript (Jade, Stylus and CoffeeScript)

  • Conduct user research and evaluate user feedback

  • Assist with the visual branding of the tech team’s projects

  • Help establish and promote design guidelines, best practices and standards

  • Content management of EHA website


EcoHealth Alliance is an equal opportunity employer offering competitive salary and a comprehensive benefits package that covers 100% of the monthly health care premium costs for the employee and their family when applicable (including dental and vision coverage), a 403(b) pension plan, flexible work schedules, a minimum of 10 days paid vacation annually, paid holidays, work from home days, and a pre-tax transportation withholding for commuters in New York City. EcoHealth Alliance may encourage employees to attend conferences when appropriate, and enroll in courses for the joint purposes of professional development and promoting the EcoHealth Alliance mission.


The position is based at EHA headquarters in New York City (Manhattan). Local candidates are preferred, with possible relocation assistance available.


How to Apply:


To apply, you must send your resume and a personalized cover letter as one document to dev-jobs@ecohealthalliance.org with the subject of "Designer 2015". Applications without cover letters will not be evaluated. This cover letter will help us assess your ability to communicate effectively and will be used as the primary mechanism to determine whether a candidate is asked to interview for the vacant position. The cover letter is the most important part of your application. In your cover letter, please briefly describe your background and any experience you may have with designing or developing web applications and public health. Be sure to mention why you are interested in working on a research-and-development oriented team at a health and conservation focused non-profit.


Applicants are encouraged to to include a link to their portfolio or sample work.


Thank you for your interest in EcoHealth Alliance!

item.title: Rails Developer at Stratum Security (Herndon, VA)
item.description:
Please note that this position is open to US candidates only. This is a direct, full-time position. If you are a placement agency or a recruiter please do not apply.


At this time we are only interested in candidates that either live in the Washington D.C. metro area or are willing to relocate.


Hi. We’re looking for an awesome Rails Developer to join our growing team. If you’ve ever wanted to work for a interesting security startup with great people this is your chance. We’re a little different than your average startup so we put together this FAQ.


Q: Ok who are you guys?


A: Stratum is comprised of some really smart security hackers who were tired of working for large companies. There are people here from MITRE, HP, Fortify, RSA, Verizon Business, Cybertrust, and others. We wanted to do the small company thing and it’s worked well for us.  This is our second new product launch.  Our first was ThreatSim, which was very successful and taught us many lessons.


Q: What would I be working on?


A: You’d be working on our data exfiltration testing platform, XFIL, which simulates data exfiltration techniques often used by hackers and helps customers identify areas for improvement in their egress controls.  Let me translate that for non-security people --- remember the Target hack?  They lost 70-90M credit card numbers -- hackers were able to get on Target’s network and transmit the data off for several months without getting noticed.  The part where they transmit the data is referred to as “exfiltration”.  Our service enables organizations’ to test their ability to identify a data breach in motion.  As you can imagine it’s a capability every organization needs these days.


Essentially we get to think like bad guys and help our customers improve their security. It’s an interesting space to say the least. If you ever wanted to learn more about security and cutting-edge attacks, this is the place. We simulate evil AND give our customers data that they can use to protect their organization. You will spend a lot of time thinking “if I was a bad guy I’d…” then have to pivot and think “if I was a security engineer I’d…”


Q: Where is this position located?


A:  Ideally we would love this position to be based out of our office in Herndon, VA.  This is a key role contributing to a new product offering.  The opportunity to interact with our team will be valuable.  However, we are still open to non-local candidates.  We’ve had great experience with remote developers over the years.  While not required -- please let us know if you are open to relocation at some point.


Q: What will my day to day be like as a developer?


A: This depends on whether you are based out of our office or remote.  In either scenario, you work on new features, enhancements, and issues to ensure that XFIL continues to be awesome. You keep in touch with the team using Slack, Skype, Join.me, Google Hangout, and even an ol’ IP phone. Using your company provided Macbook you write code, commit to Github, and listen to your friends complain about traffic on Facebook. From time to time you may respond to a customer support ticket.  


We do not require employees to be at their desk 9-5.  We expect employees to be professional and get their job done -- and to be available when the job requires it.  XFIL is a new project, so expect a great deal of collaboration.  If you work better at night, then communicate when you’ll be available, and figure out when people need you.  In the end - it’s all about results.


Q: Who will I be working with?


A: Other developers, devops, sales, and maybe even customers. We’re a 20 person company so needless to say you’ll know everyone on a first name basis.


Q: What hours do you work?


A: We generally work “normal” office hours but are flexible. Most of us are on the east coast (DC area) but as long as you are in the lower 48 we’re good. We’re a startup, so sometimes there are long hours. But we all have families so we aim for a good work-life balance.


Q: What technology do you use?


A: XFIL is built entirely within Amazon Web Services. Linux, load balancers, auto-scaling, sidekiq, redis, ansible, git, Splunk, HIDS, two-factor auth, disk encryption, and a lot of cool security stuff that you probably aren’t used to seeing in a startup.


Q: What skills and qualities are you looking for in a candidate?


A: Here’s a bullet list:


– Ruby on Rails 3.0+


– Relational and non-relational databases: MySQL, Redis


– Background job processors (e.g. Sidekiq)


– Javascript frameworks (e.g. jQuery, pure JS)


– Frontend frameworks (e.g. Bootstrap)


– Client-side and server side MVC


– Comfortable with git for version control


– Continuous integration


– MS Office (hah right, could you imagine?)


The ideal candidate will be comfortable working remote and managing themselves.  We’re not looking for regular employees -- only apply if you have a need & desire to be involved, voice opinions, build the team/company, etc… this is start-up mode and not a 9-5 job. You will be an integral part of the team with a huge impact on the future of our product. We’re passionate about what we do and you should be too.


Q: How often do we get together in person?


A: For people local to DC we try to get together for lunch every few weeks. For those that are remote we have a few events every year (company picnic, go-kart racing, paintball, holiday party, etc.) Some of the folks here brew beer so I suspect that they hang out more often.


Q: What benefits do you offer?


A: The salary is competitive and depends on your experience. We offer the following:


– Medical, dental, and vision insurance


– SIMPLE IRA with company match


– PTO - We use the Netflix model and do not track PTO.  Use what you need and be responsible are the guidelines.  For those that need numbers -- we tell people to work under the notion that you get 3 weeks PTO for new employees, 4 weeks for employees with us longer than a year.


– 8 federal holidays


– Choose your own laptop (hint: we like Apple products)


Apply for this position


If you are interested in helping evolve information security, tell us about yourself at careers@stratumsecurity.com. Send us your LinkedIn profile, Github repo, or anything else you feel would help us get to know you.

item.title: Front-End Engineer at Body Labs (New York, NY)
item.description:
Body Labs is looking for a highly-skilled and driven Front-End Engineer to help us design and build great products that provide amazing experiences, with an emphasis on web application development. We need someone who has the experience and skill to make the right design and development choices, and write awesome code. You’ll be part of our internal product/engineering team, requiring teamwork, focus, and drive.


More than anything, we are looking for someone who will be passionate about what we are doing, and who is genuinely excited to come into the office and work hard to tackle tough problems. We are a small company and put a premium on esprit de corps. You must be a team player who can interact with others and be able to separate the wheat from the chaff. We want to work with someone who is energized and motivated, who thrives in a fast-paced, high growth environment, and who enjoys working closely with a small team. You will have to understand Body Labs’ high level goals and be able to connect your daily activities with the company’s long-term aspirations.


Responsibilities include:  



  • Design and implement new and existing software and web products

  • Build distributed, large scale data processing pipelines

  • Develop internal tools and architectural code standards

  • Debug and optimize existing and new code

  • Work independently and as a team, participating in code reviews and weekly product meetings

  • Pick up new technologies and learn on the go

  • Write awesome code that you can be proud of!

item.title: Senior Software Engineer: Web Services at Exosite (Minneapolis, MN)
item.description:
OVERVIEW:


At Exosite, you will be working with a top-tier team to build web services for Exosite products. At Exosite we are focused on building massively scalable systems that run this data driven world in which we live, work, learn and play. As part of the Exosite Product Team you will have the opportunity to give input into the entire design, development and deployment life cycle of the web services you are building. Your primary objective will be to architect and implement web service code and APIs within a fast paced environment that is building the next generation of products for connected devices and applications.


WHO YOU ARE:


You are primarily a software engineer that shines at programming web services. You have an exceptional ability to create well-designed software that meets the marketing and user experience requirements gathered from key stakeholders. You are satisfied with nothing less than the best, yet know how to deliver to business needs. You have experience mentoring junior level developers and are an excellent oral and written communicator, comfortable with engaging both internal and external stakeholders. You proactively and positively engage within a team environment to deliver software of the highest quality. You know that documenting and testing your code is an essential part of development. You write tests that validate the implementation of your documented design and that ensure regressions do not occur.

item.title: Sr. Quality Engineer, Machine Learning Team at TubeMogul (Emeryville, CA)
item.description:
We are searching for a senior-level engineer to be a part of our overall quality assurance and software testing efforts.  You will be responsible for verifying different aspects of our ad platform, with a primary focus on automated test development.  This includes building test harnesses, as well as writing test scripts in Java.  You will work side-by-side with our development team in an Agile environment.

Candidates should have a passion for quality and an interest in testing on high-performance, "Big Data" systems. In this role, you will be working with a Java application stack that leverages open-source tools like Zookeeper, Hadoop, HBase, Hive, and Couchbase.  Candidates will at least be familiar with the technologies we are using but may not have had the opportunity to acquire deep experience in previous job settings. However, you should have a true passion for test automation that is apparent in your past work.


Responsibilities:



  • Build and extend custom test harnesses to validate proper behavior of our Real-Time-Bidding engine

  • Develop automated scripts to simulate and validate 3rd party integrations

  • Work with application engineers to ensure monitors provide visibility and feedback on Key Performance parameters in production environment

  • Design creative approaches to solving technical challenges dealing with high volume, low latency data workflows

  • Be the gatekeeper for production releases and point person for investigating any related issues

  • Organize and conduct test planning meetings with engineers and product managers

  • Establishing performance benchmarks and automating the verification of this benchmark as part of the continuous delivery system

item.title: Senior Software Developer - Reboot the classroom at Sparx (Exeter, UK)
item.description:
As a Senior Software Developer at Sparx, you’ll be integral to the team from day one, helping to make the big decisions, shaping team objectives and driving our technical expertise and potential.


You’ll be leading the development of the core technical framework of the tablet-based Sparx system and driving its evolution. You’ll work with all members of the team – from data scientists to content developers – to find solutions to the most challenging problems we face when building a system of this scale.


You’ll be responsible for designing and implementing components for the Sparx system, writing high quality, reusable code that focuses on usability, scalability and innovation. Program it how you want it, see how it works in a full classroom the next day and then dive straight back in to making it better and trying out the next idea. We’re pretty flexible at Sparx and you’ll have the freedom to do whatever it takes to get from A to B. We have one shared ambition: to improve educational outcomes for all.

item.title: Senior Frontend Engineer at Falcon Social (Copenhagen, Denmark)
item.description:
Falcon Social is a Software-as-a-Service provider in the Social Media Management space. We provide a unified approach for marketers, customer service specialists and hr personnel of big international brands to manage their social media presence. That means plenty of challenging engineering tasks, complex UIs to simplify and data, loads of data.


We are looking for senior members for our engineering team. You are joining an ambitious team of experts who keep pushing the limit in product delivery and experiment furiously, while striving for technical excellence.


We are agile, organized ourselves into cross-functional, autonomous teams, focusing on one product with a clear mission. We intend to be flat, with everyone equal and with each member's role respected. Day-to-day you will work together with people of different trades: frontend, backend engineers, ui/ux designers, cloud operation engineers, and product owners.


We are a maturing startup with an engineering headcount of 20. We are not small anymore, and still growing rapidly. Working at a startup is the most rewarding choice what one can make, but it requires a certain personality as well. That being said, we value open people who take initiative more than lone rockstars.


Falcon Social’s frontend is a single page web application built with AngularJs, Require.js, Bower, Grunt, D3.js on top of a REST flavored HTTP+JSON api served by a lighthweight Java8 backend running on DropWizzard, PostgreSQL, ElasticSearch, AWS, Apache Spark and Python.


Extensive experience with a modern MVC Javascript framework (Ember, Angular, Knockout) is a must for this position.

item.title: Senior Front End Developer Javascript and AngularJS at RealMassive (Austin, TX)
item.description:
RealMassive is looking for an über-talented & energetic front end web developer to help build and deploy our game-changing marketing platform. Creativity, personality, tats & piercings encouraged.


About You...


You are an experienced software engineer who is passionate about building quality software that delights customers and meets our organizational needs. You are a leader: others hold you in high regard and look up to you as a specialist in software development. When you promulgate opinions on software, others listen. For years, you worked diligently to establish a rock solid foundation in computer science. You continuously learn new technologies and stay apprised of current trends. When you create, it’s fast, clean, and elegant. Junior engineers are constantly learning from you and your work. You are on a path of continuous improvement. You can deliver under pressure and on strict timelines. You’re comfortable leading a team in agile practices and getting the most out of them. You can manage and code on multiple projects. You have an entrepreneurial spirit and strong will to jump in, produce, and lead. You’ve worked hard to get where you are, and you’re not done yet. Your next steps are Technical Director or VP of Engineering.


This senior level role reports directly to the CTO and includes coding and leadership.


Requirements



  • Expert foundation on the principles of computer science. A degree in computer science or related field; Masters or PhD preferred.

  • Expert in Javascript, AngularJS, and other front end frameworks and technologies.

  • Experience all across the stack.

  • 2+ years managing multiple projects.

  • 2+ years experience managing scrum teams.


Benefits



  • Competitive compensation (salary and stock options)

  • Medical & dental insurance

  • Relocation assistance available

  • Work with a close-knit, passionate team providing key innovations to an industry controlling an $15 trillion asset base.

  • Offices centrally located downtown with beautiful views of Austin

  • Weekly happy hours and other fun team building events


If you think you would be a good candidate, e-mail us a resume and cover letter to jobs@realmassive.com. No recruiters please.

item.title: Senior iOS and Android Developers at Infusion (Toronto, ON, Canada)

Infusion builds touch solutions on all platforms executing tablet, touch, and gesture based solutions for many of the world's largest organizations in the retail, financial services, hospitality and tourism, and government sectors.

item.title: Front end engineer at Gridium (Menlo Park, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Gridium is looking for a front-end web developer to help us build the next generation of energy management and operational tools for big buildings.


At Gridium we take in data -- lots of data -- and turn it into insights that help property managers save electricity and money. Our users are busy so we provide them with intuitive tools and beautiful visualizations that help them get the information they need as quickly as possible.


We also work with utilities to design programs that scale to hundreds of thousands of businesses. Our software results in demonstrated savings, which means cleaner air and a more reliable grid.


We are a small, focused team who believes everyone deserves to use great software. Gridium is a highly collaborative work environment where you will have significant ownership from your first day on the job.


We are also a distributed team, so you should be comfortable and excited about working remotely. Of course, face time is important, so once a quarter we pick a city and meet up for several days of highly productive and highly fun planning and doing (and eating and socializing).


Please note: distributed team means no central office. We would love to talk to you, but only if you are comfortable working remotely!

item.title: Cloud Architect m/f at Cloudreach GmbH (München, Germany)
item.description:

You might work on a major eCommerce platform, a MySQL database migration, a Big Data project, or building a scalable mobile backend

item.title: C# Developers building geospatial data and visualisation software at Landmark Information Group (Exeter, UK)
