item.title: Senior Software Engineer - Android at HERE, a Nokia company (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
We need a Senior Mobile App Developer with in-depth knowledge in Java and Android. This is an experienced position that requires fluency in the latest Java capabilities and Android SDK. As an Android developer you will be a key member of our growing mobile engineering team, developing industry-leading mobile applications and SDKs. The ideal candidate is a quick learner who is not afraid of digging deep into new technical challenges, loves to work with Kanban in small teams, and has experience shipping one or more Android apps that are currently available on Google Play Store. Backend experience in node.js and JSON REST API design is a plus. 


What we offer...


At HERE, we strive to deliver memorable moments and unforgettable experiences for our employees. You'll have the opportunity to work with highly respected industry professionals from around the world, and learn from their experiences every day. In return, we will prepare you for future opportunities to progress within the business and drive your own career; acquiring new skills and expertise along the way.

item.title: Full Stack Developer at Essence (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Company:



Essence is a global digital agency and the world’s largest independent buyer of digital media. We blend data science, objective media and captivating experiences to build valuable connections between brands and consumers. Clients include Google, HP, eBay, and Expedia. The agency is more than 450 people strong, manages over $700MM in media spend and deploys campaigns in 71 markets via offices in London, New York, San Francisco, Seattle, Singapore and Tokyo. Visit essencedigital.com for more information, and follow us on Twitter at @essencedigital.



The Role:



Essence is looking for a web developer experienced with Python and Javascript to work on a client-facing applications used to track and optimize our biddable media purchasing. You would be joining a tight knit development team and will be working alongside other developers and product managers to solve complex technical problems while building and maintaining software applications.



Some of the things we'd like you to do:




  • Write clean, well-designed and reusable code

  • Write code that scales well and is easily maintainable by other developers

  • Lead efforts to optimize app performance and remove bottlenecks

item.title: C/C++ Software Engineer at Intel Corporation (Shannon, Ireland)
item.description:
As a Senior Software Engineer / Technical Lead, you will work with Intel Shannon DCG/NPG Software development team to deliver leading edge enterprise and communications platforms that will enable tomorrow’s Data Centre infrastructure and accelerate cloud computing adoption from high-end co-processors for supercomputers to low-energy systems, as well as solutions for big data and intelligent devices.


You will be based in Shannon, Co. Clare as a member of a talented team of software engineers with a broad range of experience. You will have the opportunity to collaborate with multi-site projects working on cutting edge hardware. You will enjoy a world class work environment and you will be empowered to full fill your greatest ambitions.

item.title: Sr. Software Engineer, Internal Tools at TubeMogul (Emeryville, CA)
item.description:
We are seeking a Sr. Software Engineer to help build tools for monitoring and tracking the performance of various aspects of our distributed platform.  This role will exercise your creativity and ability as an engineer to design and create tools to work against various big-data systems, such as Couchbase, Apache Kafka, and Vertica.  You will work as a full-stack engineer, developing in the database access layer, service layer, UI layer, and everything in between.

Candidate should be familiar with the different parts of the Java application stack as well as Python, but may not have had the opportunity to acquire deep experience in previous job settings.  However, you should have a true passion for technology that is apparent in your work and/or personal projects. You will work in an agile, high-pace environment with other talented engineers to build mission-critical tools with high-visibility.


Responsibilities:



  • Design and build tools for the QA team to properly test and monitor their respective systems.

  • Work with different platform developers to expose any vulnerabilities in their respective systems.

  • Build SLA reporting tools for managers to determine the health of the overall system and uptime metrics.

  • Improve and maintain the different internal tools written in Java and Python.

  • Mentor junior developers (i.e. demonstrate good coding practices and help them architect code intelligently).

  • Contribute to and promote good software engineering practices across the team.

item.title: Lead Software Engineer at Zeta Interactive (San Mateo, CA)
item.description:
Innovation, collaboration, excellence and fun are at the core of everything we strive for at Zeta Interactive. We want to speak with you if you are passionate about elevating your career to the next level while making a tremendous impact at Zeta!


You will work with some of the best and brightest talent in the industry, challenging you to think out of the box and simplify and solve complex  problems in creative ways.


As a Lead Software Engineer, you will work (and own) challenging software engineering problems that can help revolutionize the digital marketing landscape. You will own  a problem from the beginning, partner with different functional groups and peers to define and understand it in a fast paced and iterative environment, and then lead execution on its solution. You will inspire others in the team with your work and creativity.

item.title: Sr. Rails/Javascript Application Engineer - Internal Tools at New Relic (Portland, OR)
item.description:
We are looking for talented web developers who are excited to work with Rails and emergent Javascript frameworks to build great products for our internal tools.


At New Relic, we define the space for Application Performance Monitoring with compelling web experiences for visualizing and analyzing data to help small, medium, and enterprise customers make their business better. As a software engineer on the internal tooling team, you’ll be working on the tools that help New Relic to analyze and make better our own business. The best part is that your users are your co-workers, so not only do you get access directly to your users, you get feedback faster, and you get to see the glory that is your hard work making others’ lives and jobs easier/better.


We’re hiring at all experience levels, and we’re particularly interested in having a diverse team with a broad set of skills and viewpoints. If this seems like your perfect job, but not sure if you qualify, apply anyway! We carefully consider every applicant that takes the time to apply.

item.title: Full-stack developer at Gridium (Menlo Park, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Gridium is looking for a full-stack web developer to help us build the next generation of energy management tools for big buildings.


At Gridium we take in data -- lots of data -- and turn it into insights that help our customers save electricity and money. Our users are busy so we provide them with cutting-edge tools and beautiful visualizations that help them get the information they need as quickly as possible.


We also work with utilities to design programs that scale to hundreds of thousands of businesses. Our software works at scale to reduce energy use, resulting in cleaner air and a more reliable grid.


We are a small, focused team who believes everyone deserves to use great software. At Gridium you will work on a  highly collaborative team where you will have significant ownership from your first day on the job.


We are also a distributed company, so you should be comfortable and excited about working remotely. Of course, face time is important, so once a quarter we pick a city and meet up for several days of highly productive and highly fun planning and doing (and eating and socializing).


Please note: distributed company means no central office. We would love to talk to you, but only if you are comfortable working remotely!

item.title: Senior Product Manager for Music Business Startup at bookya.com (Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia)
item.description:
Join Bookya in Amsterdam & Kuala Lumpur and be part of the most exciting music business startup



The Senior Product Manager at Bookya.com will drive product development of the Bookya mobile-apps and website while being also responsible for conceptualization throughout the launch.

He/she is the primary liaison between the organization and our other globally distributed teams.

Working closely with our CEO, CFO and CGO to evolve high-level strategic vision into actionable tactics that provide Bookya users with a delightful experience. He/she is responsible for addressing incoming inquiries and issues raised by other terms in a timely fashion and communicating larger issues. He/sher provides visibility of efforts to others at Bookya and recognizes contributions.


What you do?


  • Defines and manages product roadmap, setting expectations with all relevant stakeholders including senior leadership team.

  • Be the subject matter expert for bookya's internal tools, mobile apps, and overall website.

  • Works with broad cross-section of internal teams including engineering, design, marketing, finance, culinary, and operations to define requirements, plan delivery, design solutions, and manage products through launch.

  • Proactively identifies and resolves strategic issues that may impair the organizations ability to meet is strategic, financial, and technical goals.

  • In partnership with design (UX and visual) and other product managers, the Senior Product Manager defines scope, requirements, use cases/user scenarios, test case documents and design specifications.

  • Synthesizes business requirements, identifies areas of uncertainty, recommends solutions, gathers buy-in from stakeholders, rolls solution out to team, shepherds feature through development and reviews the product before rollout.

  • Develops metrics to measure success of program features, analyzes results, and partners across the organization to develop action plans and enhancement recommendations.

  • Anticipates bottlenecks, provides escalation to management, anticipants and makes tradeoffs, and balances the business needs versus technical and operational constraints.

  • Leverages consumer insights and competitive intelligence to inform product decisions.

  • Balances and allocates team resources to achieve broader objectives while handling smaller requests.


Benefits



  • Enjoy working in a creative startup environment.

  • Equity, Share-of-Profit and Bonus Payments.

  • ... contact us to learn about all amazing benefits.

item.title: Software Engineer - All Levels at clypd (Somerville, MA)
item.description:
You will be learning all aspects of the system and contributing to them. You will work with the rest of the engineering and product teams to deliver quickly and fluidly using Agile methodologies. You will use Continuous Integration and Test Driven Development techniques to build rock-solid code.

Skills and experience:

  • Achieved at least a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering
  • Willingness to learn and improve your web stack skills: front end, back end or both
  • For front end: experience or interest in building interactive user experiences with modern HTML5 and JavaScript, and comfortable working with the services that drive them
  • Previous use of MV* frameworks on the client (AngularJS, Ember, ...) and/or server side (Rails, Django, Grails, ...) a huge plus
  • For back end: experience in working with large data sets, database performance, REST APIs, and Go a plus
  • Excitement about startups and working with a small (but quickly expanding) Agile team
  • Communication is key; our work is heavily team-oriented, and we are looking for someone who is comfortable participating and contributing to the team
  • Passion for delivering quality code and products. Code reviews and automated tests are an integral part of our development process. We are always looking for new ways to improve.

Our stack:

  • Ruby on Rails, React, JQuery, RSpec/Capybara
  • Go
  • Docker
  • PostgreSQL/RDS, Redis
  • AWS

Perks and benefits:

  • Competitive compensation and stock options
  • Comprehensive benefits package (Health, Dental, Vision, Long-term and Short-term disability, 401(k), cell phone subsidy, commuter safety subsidy)
  • Unlimited paid time off  - take the time you need to operate at peak performance
  • Learning culture that includes weekly Lunch and Learns and a formal mentor program
  • Amazing office space in Davis Square, one of the hottest neighborhoods in Somerville
  • Open and relaxed office layout, including standing desks, walking desks, and a choice of comfortable seating
  • Macbook and Thunderbolt display
  • Three rotating beer taps, iced tea and iced coffee on tap, wine bar, tea bar, and more
  • Game room with darts, foosball, Xbox One, PS4, and more
  • Fun team outings and celebrations, an annual company outing and holiday party

Who we are:

clypd is a leading player in one of the hottest emerging markets of programmatic TV, disrupting the $74 billion television industry. We are on a mission to change television advertising, to make it more efficient and effective for TV media companies, consumers, and advertisers. We've built an advertising technology platform to empower media companies with programmatic strategies. Our sales platform delivers workflow automation, data-enhanced decisioning and provides media partners with tools to manage their sales efforts.

We are looking for awesome people to join a growing and fun team. We aim to create an environment that is open and transparent, collaborative, supportive, and diverse. We are looking for engineers who want to learn about the latest technologies to craft scalable and maintainable code. The problems we are solving are challenging and interesting and we want your help.

item.title: Full Stack Software Engineer, Synthetics at New Relic (Phoenix, AZ)
item.description:
New Relic is software analytics. Fueled by real-time data from production software, we provide clear, actionable intelligence about high-velocity web and mobile applications and their end-users. Our first, and very successful, SaaS tool for such analytics monitors real-time traffic from real users. The Next New Thing for New Relic is monitoring real-time traffic from synthetic users.


As one of the engineers building this product, you'll be designing the architecture, writing the code, and, of course, monitoring it all by automating browsers with New Relic Synthetics.


Some of the things we work on:



  • How to make the process of scripting a browser more fun and less pain

  • How to present large amounts of browser metrics to customers in a simple but meaningful way

  • How to orchestrate hundreds of browsers running synthetic transactions across the globe and ensure that all transactions are both reliable and properly sandboxed

  • How to ensure that we’re capturing all possible transaction metrics even if they appear not meaningful at first

item.title: Lead/Senior Full Stack Developer at Scarlet (New York, NY)
item.description:
About Scarlet:


Scarlet is a new kind of a voice based information service that delivers personalized content at the right time.  We believe that there is a tremendous opportunity to create an effective and human solution to deal with the ever growing stream of information pouring out of our devices. 


 While exploring new opportunities for voice interfaces, we are first creating a consumer mobile application that helps people better start their day.  We are a small but fast growing early stage startup that is funded by the Samsung Accelerator.


Position Description:


Scarlet is looking for a founding engineer who can take a lead role in solving complex engineering problems to deliver highly relevant information to users in a natural, helpful and charming way.  Ideal candidates are individuals who are strong individual contributors, but also enjoy mentoring and working with other engineers. 


You will be our founding engineer to build and lead a high performing team that explores new applications of natural language processing, intelligent content aggregation, and voice-driven user interfaces.  Deep experience with agile product development, a love for human centered design, expertise in JavaScript development with focus on Node.js, and a passion to solve hard problems with creative solutions are all required to thrive in our fast-paced startup environment.



You will:




  • Build and deploy a scalable backend to support end user experience

  • Advance our web based tools and enhance our ability to deliver unique and personalized end user experiences

  • Integrate new sources of data into the system

  • Design and implement machine-based solutions to select and present data for end users

  • Analyze system performance and identify areas for improvement

  • Play a key role in building a top notch engineering team around you

  • Work closely with product, design and client teams to define, iterate and implement new features

item.title: Full Stack Web Developer / Architect (Python) at Vision Fleet (Marina del Rey, CA)
item.description:
We are looking for a dynamic full stack software engineer to lead the development of our technology and analytics platform, iQ.


What You’ll Do
Located in LA or SF, you will work closely with our product, analytics, and ops teams, external consultants and vendors. Specifically, we’re looking for you to do the following:



  • Deliver complete, high performance web applications for desktop and mobile devices

  • Automate and support the data value chain (vehicle to backend, to front-end), including migration of prototype algorithms into production intent server-based scripts

  • Integrate and develop REST APIs

  • Build client-side user authentication and authorization between multiple applications

  • Implement user security and data protection

  • Write end-to-end (unit/integration) automated test suites for all components

  • Create configuration, build, and test scripts for Continuous Integration environments


Personality Types We Like



  • You are high energy (this is a startup, with an all-hands-on-deck approach).

  • You are responsible, responsive, and good at managing expectations

  • You appreciate the value of feedback: you’ll be collecting extensive customer feedback and helping us learn

  • You are a big-picture thinker: We are aiming to accomplish something big

  • You love backend development, new technology, and operations


Perks



  • You get in on the ground floor with a company that has initial validation and lots of growth opportunities

  • You’ll also work closely with high-level contacts in key energy, automotive, and government sectors

  • You get to work with cool technology in a collaborative culture, making a difference in the world


Compensation



  • Competitive salary

  • Equity

  • Health, dental, vision

  • 401k

  • Unlimited vacation policy

item.title: Database Developer at Best Lawyers (New York, NY)
item.description:
Best Lawyers is seeking a Database Developer for a new interactive legal platform, built on the foundation of our 35 years as the most respected legal peer review network. The primary role will be to develop and support the databases running this new platform, ensuring maximum up-time, speed, and scalability, in a Windows Azure SQL environment.


The developer will be challenged to maintain, improve, and create new features in an ever-changing environment while ensuring stability and site performance. Applicants should love challenging the status quo and strive to make everything easier, faster, and more robust.

item.title: Developer at Typeform (El Prat de Llobregat, Spain)
item.description:
Typeform did to web forms what Tesla has done to cars: completely reimagined online forms from the ground up. Typeform is growing at a tremendous pace because of its heavy emphasis on amazing UX, strong product/market fit, and future products that will blow you away. This is a ground-floor opportunity for you to be a part of something fun, exciting, and supremely rewarding.


As an engineer at Typeform, you should have a solid understanding of software architecture and design patterns. You should be able to knowledgeably talk about OOP/DDD/SOLID and it would be great if you have a strong desire to innovate, learn about new technologies and be ready to take a part in the building of the product.


We're currently hiring for:



  • Front End: As a front-end engineer at Typeform, you would be responsible for creating and innovating on every corner of the front-end platform at Typeform.



  • Back End: As a back-end engineer, you will need to be able to build and design large scale applications for our platform to support millions of form responses and provide realtime data analysis.



  • API Integration: The API integration team is focussed on seamlessly integrating the Typeform platform with other 3rd party services such as Salesforce, Wordpress, Google spreadsheet and Mailchimp.

  • Full-Stack: We have need of full stack developers in a number of areas of our business to work simultaneously on the front and back end.


Benefits



  • Flexible working hours

  • Half day Fridays

  • Amazing office space (including terrace and BBQ)

  • 24 days of holiday (you can take your birthday off)

  • Private health insurance

  • Nice equipment

  • Yoga classes

  • Free team lunches

  • Fresh organic fruit

  • Wear your slippers within the office

item.title: Senior Software Engineer (Elevated Careers) at eHarmony (Los Angeles, CA)
item.description:
As a founding member of our new Job Compatibility Engineering Team, we are looking for a Senior Software Engineer. You will work our product to develop the next generation of matching technologies to power eHarmony’s new Job Compatibility product for job seekers and recruiters. Our mission is to provide candidate users with an entirely new way to find jobs that fit their skills at companies with which they are profoundly compatible, and recruiters to find talent that will truly thrive in their new positions. You will work on the technology that will bring this mission to life.


As the Senior Software Engineer you will:


Drive the development of an entirely new enterprise website



  • Work with internal and external resources to implement and integrate new and existing systems

  • Create modules to extract features and signals from diverse data collections

  • Process large data logs to detect patterns and insights

  • Build tools to improve the targeting and relevance of eHarmony’s job matching platform

  • Work with Machine Learning specialists, Product Management and QA Teams to deliver reliable, high-performance systems

item.title: Database Administrator at EMBL-EBI (Hinxton, UK)
item.description:
We are seeking a highly proficient and motivated Database Administrator to join the Database Administration Team (DBA Team), part of the Systems Applications team. Located in Hinxton, near Cambridge, the European Bioinformatics Institute (EMBL-EBI) offers a unique opportunity to acquire professional experience in an international scientific environment.

The Systems Applications team consists of 15 System Administrators responsible for our virtual infrastructure, database administration and desktop user support.

The DBA Team is responsible for the database administration of the large central database infrastructure that is deployed over a Virtual Infrastructure based on VMWare. This infrastructure serves most Services and Research groups at EMBL-EBI and incorporates databases across geographically distributed production, public facing and disaster recovery datacentres.

The job consists of providing day-to-day Database Administration activities for the Production, Development and Test database environments across the supported database technologies MySQL, Oracle, PostgreSQL, Vertica, MongoDB and MS SQL Server.

The activities of the Team include (but are not limited to):



  • Database software installation and configuration;

  • Back-up and recovery;

  • Dataguard and replication solutions;

  • Scripting;

  • Performance tuning;

  • Database virtualisation and databases in virtualised environments;

  • Exploring innovation;

  • Monitoring, reporting and keeping online documentation up-to-date; and

  • Interacting with database developers and application developers from the EMBL-EBI service groups.


The EBI is part of the European Molecular Biology Laboratory (EMBL) and it is a world-leading bioinformatics centre providing biological data to the scientific community with expertise in data storage, analysis and representation. EMBL-EBI provides freely available data from life science experiments, performs basic research in computational biology and offers an extensive user training programme, supporting researchers in academic and industry.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer (Scala / Functional Language Developer) at Citadel Technology Solutions Pte. Ltd. (Singapore)
item.description:
This role is also available in Kuala Lumpur and Jakarta with appropriate cost of living adjustments.


Citadel Technology Solutions Pte. Ltd. is a fully-funded and well-connected start-up providing cutting edge software development and hardware solutions for the next era in information technology.  


The company is looking to bring together an international team of world-class developers to deliver a highly confidential, critical IT service for a long-term, major government contract in Southeast Asia. This project will ultimately provide a high-profile system to be used by millions of users in the specified country.


Role


As a Senior Software Engineer, you will be building a large scale, data intensive Web application using the latest technologies in an Agile environment. Your primary responsibilities will include:



  • Application design, engineering and development

  • Follow Agile practices, such as TDD, BDD, pair programming etc.

  • Own a set of stories and manage their end-to-end implementation

  • Work with distributed team to deliver end-to-end solution

  • Present and conduct demo for users, stakeholders, and technology groups as and when required

  • Using industry best practices to deliver quality deliverables


What We Offer



  • World-class software development facilities

  • Startup environment with minimal bureaucracy

  • Learning opportunities to acquire the latest and most advanced development skills (we invest heavily in our employee training and development)

  • Agile work culture, focused on innovation, team work, and open collaboration

  • Flexibility of job location (Singapore, Kuala Lumpur, Jakarta)

  • Greenfield development with opportunity to be involved in full Dev lifecycle

  • Health/relocation benefits available

item.title: Passionate Java Software Engineer at Capgemini (Machelen, België)
item.description:
Capgemini is looking for Java Software Engineers with experience in developing business-critical applications.


You will support our customers in analyzing, designing, implementing and testing Java solutions in national and international organizations.


In collaboration with your Project Manager, you will be responsible for the quality of the solution you develop.


As a Java consultant, you will manage the scope and quality of your own development activity on challenging missions.

We offer

  • Joining an international organization that enables you to grow within your domain of expertise and share knowledge of experts worldwide

item.title: Ruby Engineer at Yello (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
What you’ll bring to us:

item.title: Operations Engineer | DevOps at Wikimedia Foundation (San Francisco, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Summary


Wikimedia is seeking a DevOps engineer to work on the Analytics team to help maintain and build infrastructure used to measure Wikipedia’s reach and impact.  DevOps engineers work with software engineers, technical operations, product managers and researchers to ensure they have the Big Data tools they need to improve Wikipedia for hundred of millions of people around the world.


Description



  • Perform day-to-day operational tasks (deployment, maintenance, configuration, troubleshooting) on many aspects of Wikimedia’s analytics infrastructure

  • Assist in the research, design, and implementation of Wikimedia analytics infrastructure and services

  • Implement and utilize configuration management and deployment tools (specifically puppet, salt)

  • Coordinate and communicate with other members of the Wikimedia engineering teams

  • Incident response and diagnosis of system outages or alerts

  • Write and update internal documentation of systems and processes

item.title: Software Engineer at MoveOn.org (Washington, DC) (allows remote)
item.description: In preparing for the opportunities and challenges ahead of us — through the 2016 election and beyond — MoveOn is investing even more deeply in technology that can help amplify ordinary people’s voices in our democracy, and we are hiring passionate problem solvers who will take our technology platform to the next level. Do you have great ideas and the enthusiasm to build them? Join our team! Together we will brainstorm, collaborate, design, build, and ship code that handles massive scale. Work alongside MoveOn’s core team of organizers, campaigners, data scientists, and operations and media professionals, on projects that make the world a more progressive place!

item.title: JavaScript UI Developer at LogRhythm (Boulder, CO)
item.description:
LogRhythm is a software company focused on security intelligence analytics. We are looking to add a JavaScript UI Developer to our team to support ongoing development of our dashboard which allows our customers deep visibility across their entire IT environment. If you dig networks being violated you should stop reading right now. Or find your moral compass and keep reading. 



  • The application consists of an AngularJS web user interface (UI) and is powered by JavaScript (Node.js) and Java in the middle tier. The stack includes: Node.js, AngularJS, D3.js.

  • Our UI has an impressive amount of polish. Building a portal to client data to help them track down ever-changing threats is critical work. We take UX serious so a complicated task like protecting your network is made easy and engaging.

  • Our browser support matrix includes “evergreen browsers” (IE10+, Chrome, Firefox, mobile). We have given our web team the latitude to utilize the modern technologies needed in order to scale.


Within this domain we are the fastest growing private company in the world and we are headquartered in Boulder. This is one of the true success stories within the Boulder/Denver tech community. You’ll get a chance to join a local company that’s gone from startup to an established company who's out innovating the largest security companies in the world.

item.title: Senior Solutions Architect (Eastern/Northeast US) at Hazelcast (Boston, MA) (allows remote)

In addition to supporting a Regional Sales Manager in the Eastern or Northeastern territory, the Senior Solutions Architect is a Hazelcast advocate who loves to conduct training sessions, presenting at conferences, being active in the community and consulting on distributed computing problems.

item.title: Production Database Administrator at HealthMEDX, LLC (Ozark, MO)
item.description:
Under minimal supervision, a Production DBA monitors production databases for opportunities to improve the performance and efficiency of queries, views, stored procedures, and schema including index management. You would work with data center personnel to install and monitor SQL Server instances and database management. Additionally you would work with Development DBAs to provide suggested improvements to specific queries, views, stored procedures and schema as well as overall processes.


The Production DBA works with Development DBAs to establish standards and ensure adherence to standards and requirements.  You would also work with Development DBAs to provide necessary training and documentation as well as recommends improvements to cross-functional processes.


You can work out of either our Ozark, MO or Louisville, CO location for this position.

item.title: Back-End Developer at V12 Group (Red Bank, NJ)
item.description:
V12 Group has been providing customers, clients, and users of Launchpad, our marketing cloud, with leading technology, quality data, and an unparalleled customer experience.


The Software Engineer (Back-End) will be accountable for developing and maintaining key modules of the V12 Group's suite of SaaS applications. You will be working on a next generation product.

Location: Red Bank, NJ


Responsibilities



  • Design, develop and modify modules based on functional and system requirements

  • Work closely with Product Owner for understanding the functional and system requirements

  • Work closely with Software Engineers to ensure architectural integrity and product quality

  • Participate in testing process through unit testing and bug fixes

  • All other duties as assigned

item.title: Dashboard Developers at NuData Security (Vancouver, BC, Canada)
item.description:
NuData Security is looking for talented Dashboard Developers to join our team and help us further develop our customer-facing web application.   


NuData Security is a leader in web and mobile risk-based behavioral analytics. We are headquartered in downtown Vancouver, British Columbia, and our client base includes Fortune 50 companies, giving us a global footprint. 


You hold elegant design and contextual information in equal regard. You’ve bookmarked the website Information is Beautiful because it is, but know that beauty still needs to serve a purpose. Take part in the design and creation of intuitive visualizations, making sophisticated data and results easy to understand and use. Join our team and build out and refine our toolset across the full range of functionality, including how the dashboard displays collected data and analysis, improving search functionality, charting, and configuration support. 


This is a permanent, full-time, in-office position. 


Qualification and Experience 



  • Minimum 2 years software development experience in a professional development setting;

  • Expert level knowledge and experience with developing in PHP;

  • Strong understanding of object-oriented development concepts;

  • Expert experience with at least one of the following programming languages: Java, C#, C++, Python, Objective-C;

  • PHP Web Development Framework experience with one of: CodeIgniter, Laravel, Symfony;

  • Source Control experience with one of: Perforce, Subversion, Git;

  • Expert knowledge of HTTP/HTTPS, RESTful services, Javascript, JSON, HTML/CSS, Web Application Development, AJAX, User Interface or User Experience Design (UI/UX Design);

  • Experience designing and developing customer-facing web applications and user interfaces;

  • Bachelors of Computer Science or equivalent degree; 


What we offer in return includes a beautiful view of the North Shore mountains, coffee that doesn’t suck, and colleagues that are as brilliant as they are likeable. We do cool things as a company. You know, like sword fighting, pinball playing, craft beer tastings. Plus all that normal stuff like a competitive salary, extended health benefits, flex-time schedules, and a work environment that encourages and supports professional development.  


If this sounds like you, apply and tell us why you’re the best candidate for the job.  


(Our focus currently on candidates that are either already in or willing to relocate to the Vancouver area, and who are already eligible to work in Canada.)

item.title: Sr. Engineer (Dev Tools) at AudienceScience (Bellevue, WA)
item.description:
AudienceScience is seeking a talented Senior Software Development Engineer with experience creating and deploying software tools to enhance the productivity of our entire Development team. As the Sr. SDE on our Dev Tools team, you’ll be responsible for leading the group in the delivery of tools and added features/functionality to help make life easier for your fellow Developers and DevOps teammates. You will already have proven ability to write code and automation scripts working with large scale internet technologies. Experience in a continuous deployment environment is a definite plus.



  • Work with development leadership to evaluate, propose and design new tools

  • Design, develop, and deploy development tool features from front-end to back-end

  • Collaborate with other project teams to incorporate their innovations and vice versa

  • Analyze and improve efficiency, scalability, and stability of development tools and systems to help scale the product

  • Create and adapt automated processes that improve the efficiency of our software development, delivery, and deployment

  • Provide mentorship to other Dev Tools engineers

  • Stay current on state of the art technologies.

item.title: Java Software Engineer at HERE a Nokia Company (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Sr. Engineer – Java


The HERE Reality Capture & Processing (RCP) Platform team is expanding!


The RCP Platform team builds services designed to efficiently deliver our immense collection of 3D street-level and aerial content to product teams to power the next-generation of 3D consumer maps, enhanced navigation systems and more. We are looking for experienced candidates who will be able to work effectively in a multidisciplinary team environment focused on innovation and be able to learn and integrate complementary technologies inside and outside their specific area of expertise to deliver highly scalable and fault tolerant systems to optimize the way content feeds in to all of our products in the automotive, enterprise, and consumer spaces.



Responsibilities:



With a global fleet of vehicles collecting petabytes of 3D street-level and aerial data per year, you will be:
• Contributing to an engineering team charged with designing, architecting and building a platform to transform these massive data sets into building blocks for content creation.
• Building out services and APIs providing direct access to these rich 3D datasets.
• Work with Amazon Web Services as a storage and computing platform, especially with S3 and EC2.

item.title: Sr. Software Engineer - Messaging at Twilio (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
The Twilio platform enables companies to integrate communications directly into their applications via simple cloud APIs and with on-demand global reach.  Twilio is therefore challenged with abstracting away a world of complexity so that our customers can go global without concern for managing a global communications network, carrier integrations and relationships throughout the world.


About the job:


As a member of the messaging team at Twilio, you will enhance and scale the SMS and MMS platform that touches millions of people every day. To take it to scale, you will be developing a complex distributed platform in Scala and Java and will be concerned with availability, throughput, latency, and data integrity. There will be a significant data component so you will be working with distributed SQL and NoSQL databases and caches.  At the core are cloud technologies that enable deployment and management of computing resources globally.  


Responsibilities:



  • Collaborate with Product Managers, Architects and Engineering leaders to define, architect and build new customer-facing features.

  • Own, operate, and maintain your team’s services in a distributed production environment. Employ Agile methodologies to continuously deliver value to customers.

  • Drive quality by writing unit, functional, load and performance tests.

  • Release, monitor, and maintain features in a responsible, reliable way as part of our integrated DevOps practices.

item.title: Principal UI Engineer at Attivio, Inc (Newton, MA)
item.description:
Job Description


If you are passionate about creating impactful and intuitive UIs, consider yourself a trend-setter and creator of innovative solutions, have strong requirements gathering, design, coding and troubleshooting skills, and are relentless in your pursuit of developing well-architected software and delivering high-quality work, you will find the Principal GUI Engineer role in the Engineering Group satisfying and challenging.  You will be responsible for designing, developing, and supporting Attivio's new end-user, developer, and administrator GUI initiatives for Enterprise Search and Big Data markets.

Responsibilities also include –
•    Designing and developing the user experience for GUI initiatives, including creating and developing wireframes, storyboards and use cases.  
•    Creating and preparing recommendations on feature sets and technical infrastructure for assigned projects and new system modules.
•    Consulting with partners, customers, and end users to receive feedback regarding the design and maintenance of Attivio's technology and GUIs.
•    Researching and finding opportunities to take advantage of existing platforms and communities to improve user experience through GUIs.
•    Implementing GUI projects using Agile methodologies.

item.title: Technical Product Manager - Tools and Infrastructure at Workday (Pleasanton, CA)
item.description:
Please Note: 
- This position requires existing work-authorization in the United States.
- If you don't already have U.S. work authorization, please don't submit your resume.


About the Team:
The Technology Product Management team at Workday drives the product and strategy for Workday’s secret sauce - our technology platform that was designed from scratch for the cloud. We are growing at a fast pace, and we're looking for folks with a strategic vision and a proven track record for successfully getting sought-after products to market.


About the Role
Design the infrastructure required for scaling and storing massive amounts of data in the era for millions of users.


In this role, you would:



  • Collaborate with Workday's customers, development, services, and sales teams to understand their requirements

  • Work with the 3rd party vendors, technical architects, development, operations, and infrastructure organizations through design, testing, product release, and maintenance

  • Write detailed feature specifications based on requirements

  • Manage uptake of new enhancements by coordinating with internal development

  • Define a product roadmap and determine requirements for each release

  • Participate in customer facing situations and user conferences as a product expert

  • Demonstrate flexibility and the ability to adapt to change

item.title: Senior Python Engineer at Clover Health (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Clover Health is driving down costs and producing improved health outcomes with a unique health insurance plan. We use sophisticated analytics and custom software to direct our own clinical staff to proactively fill in gaps in the care of our members. We have a proven model we're scaling out.


We're focusing on elderly and low-income patients that stand to benefit from our model the most. This puts us in a position to make a major dent in healthcare expense in the United States and reverse an unsustainable, decades-long spending trend.


We are looking for Senior Python Engineers to join our team. You'll be part of a team building applications and services to support our medical team, with opportunities to touch a wide range of technology. Python is the primary language of our tech stack, and we’re looking to add more python expertise to our team. You’ll work with the rest of the engineering team to set direction in building applications and data pipelines in python. We value moving fast, but we do so with a pragmatic approach that will allow us to sustain velocity over time.


Healthcare experience not required.

item.title: Software Engineer at Click Therapeutics, Inc. (New York, NY)
item.description:
About the Role:


We are looking for a Ruby on Rails engineer to be responsible for implementing both a user facing web application as well as APIs to support our mobile applications. In relation to the latter, this developer must be very confident in his/her ability to employ proper design patterns so that we may have a consistent, easily consumable API. Experience with designing and maintaining server infrastructure and configuration is a plus but not required. This is a highly visible, creative, and agile role within a rapidly growing pre-IPO company in a nascent and fast-growing space.  The role will be located in our trendy SoHo HQ and is a tremendous wealth-building/equity opportunity for the right individual. We also provide comprehensive, platinum-level healthcare and benefits.

item.title: Platform Engineer at Exosite (Minneapolis, MN)
item.description:
We're looking for somebody who's equally at home writing a script to replace EC2 instances, troubleshooting Linux TCP/IP latency, and building out a continuous-delivery pipeline for software in half a dozen different languages. Monitoring, capacity planning, and on-call emergency response also fall within the domain of this position.


You'll be working closely with a tight-knit team of software developers, project managers, and other platform engineers to guide the evolution of an ensemble of SaaS products supporting the Internet of Things. This means that in addition to the technical responsibilities already laid out, you'll need the confidence and passion to share ideas, deliberate, and execute decisively with other experienced engineers.

a10:author.a10:name: The Electronics Online Group / redcoon GmbH (member of Media-Saturn Group)

item.title: Technical eCommerce Search Guru / Elasticsearch Expert (m/f) at The Electronics Online Group / redcoon GmbH (member of Media-Saturn Group) (München, Deutschland)
item.description:
We are The Electronics Online Group, a business division of Media-Saturn Holding GmbH, managing a portfolio of diversified online commerce brands. The core of the EOG is the redcoon GmbH, a leading online provider of high quality electronics brand products. Represented in 8 European countries, we today employ more than 700 employees.


Besides merger & acquisition of interesting new businesses as well as accelerating new online commerce talents out there, we are creating our own new startups. Therefore we are building a sophisticated, state-of-the-art component platform which we will use in our startup cases as base for the best possible TCO and time to market. Among other key components,  Elasticsearch will be one of the search engines in our platform strategy. Therefore we have following job opening in Munich (sometimes Ingolstadt):


Technical eCommerce Search Guru / Elasticsearch Expert (m/f)


Responsibilities:



  • You know the last line of code and behaviour of Elasticsearch and other search engines?

  • Implementing the Elasticsearch standard in a shop is boring for you as your real thrill is to perfect the search results coming back?

  • In your world search behaviour and categorization of information is totally old school and you are looking to work on the next intelligent search?

  • Therefore you just sit down and develop mock ups and proof of concepts because the code is already in your head?


->Then you are the one we are looking for!

item.title: Full-Stack Software Developers at Groupon International (Dublin, Ireland)
item.description:
Groupon has opening for experienced full stack developers to help design and build high-scale, web and mobile e-commerce applications that run non-stop around the globe.  We work in small, independent and collaborative teams to architect massively scalable and reliable systems.  As part of our Dublin technology team, you'll use a variety of technologies and development practices to build pioneering local commerce applications used by hundreds of millions of people.

You'd be a great fit for this position if you're comfortable working with a small team, rapidly iterating a multi-component software stack and taking the initiative to add great new features that we haven't even dreamed up yet. Come help us build and power our rapidly growing international e-commerce platform!

Core Responsibilities 



  • Design high-performance RESTful web services serving billions of requests a week

  • Personalize content and promotions based on user interests

  • Deliver billions of e-mail messages efficiently

  • Unravel the myriad of payment technologies available globally

  • Optimize placement of inventory across fulfilment centers

  • Build large-scale infrastructural data systems using open-source technologies

item.title: Senior System Engineer at comScore (Amsterdam Zuid-Oost, Netherlands)
item.description:
comScore Inc. is looking for a highly motivated all-round (DEVOPS) Engineer to join the Digital Analytix Operations team. The perfect candidate excels in bash scripting, Linux operating systems, automating standard procedures etc. You are familiar with technologies as data collection, Ruby, Perl, Nagios monitoring, MySQL, DNS or SSL certificates.


            Some interesting facts:



  • We're at 1500+ servers, and growing

  • More than 12.000 calculation cores

  • over 2.5 billion page views a day

  • over 4PB of Network attached high performance storage

  • 4 Datacenters (2 in EU en 2 in US)


 Duties and responsibilities:



  • Perform day-to-day application administration and system administration duties on Linux servers across comScore's business-critical Digital Analytix platform

  • Maintain all the DAx  (Digital Analytix) platforms

  • Respond to and resolve incident tickets and monitoring alerts

  • Automate common procedures used to resolve Incidents and monitoring alerts

  • Standardize and document common procedures that can’t be easily automated for hand-off to other resources or teams for execution

  • Participate in 24x7 on call schedule of production systems

  • Work on interesting projects with the latest technologies and hardware

item.title: Software Developer Consultant - Singapore at ThoughtWorks (Singapore)
item.description:
ThoughtWorks welcomes talented developers who are passionate with creating great code, to join our Singapore office!. 


Being a consultancy, our teams work on a huge variety of projects. You could be part of a delivery project set up for a large hotel, building a new mobile platform for a bank, support some of our training or enablement teams or join some of our teams getting involved on inceptions with new clients and getting hands on the project from scratch.  All of this whilst building quadcopters or robotic arms in your spare time! 


Examples of some of our current and past projects:



  • Mobile applications including responsive web, native Android and iOS for telcos, retailers, banks as well as local Singapore organisations 

  • HTML5 rich web applications using frameworks such as AngularJS and Amber

  • Integrated enterprise solutions on RoR covering front end to back end

  • Large scale distributed systems with big data using technologies like Storm, Hadoop

  • Continuous delivery, Infrastructure as code and one-click deployment on cloud

  • Functional programming languages like Scala and Clojure for heavy data processing projects


We don't do bureaucracy, or hierarchy and you do get lots of autonomy so we actively encourage you to experiment with new technologies without limitation.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at TheLadders (New York, NY)
item.description:
Based in SoHo, TheLadders is an engineering-team-driven organization. We empower our software engineers to not just build great products, but to have a real say in the ‘how’ and ‘why’ the products are being built. We practice continuous integration, test-driven development, peer code reviews, pair programming and collaborative design studios. You’ll be on the cutting edge of current software development best practices and in the position to assist in the introduction of new ones.


TheLadders is looking for Senior Software Engineers, either Frontend, Backend or Full Stack, who want to mentor, code and help build a team. Work within a small, agile team of smart people while solving problems from beginning to end -- from product conceptualizations to engineering implementations. We use Scala, Java, Git, ElasticSearch, and Storm on the backend and Backbone, Javascript, Html and CSS for the front end.  We're proud of our engineers. Come be one of them!


 Responsibilities of the Senior Software Engineer:



  • First and foremost, developing software our users need

  • Mentoring junior and mid-level engineers and help drive the release of new updates

  • Collaborating with your team to brainstorm and create new products

  • Growing our engineering teams by interviewing, recruiting and hiring

item.title: Frontend Entwickler (m/w) at Key-Work Consulting GmbH (Karlsruhe, Deutschland)
item.description:
Ihre Aufgaben



  • Entwicklung von Anwendungen im J2EE-Umfeld mit HTML5, CSS und JavaScript / jQuery (Frontend-Programmierung, Anbindung bestehender Back­end-Prozesse)

  • Gestaltung von Benutzeroberflächen mit beson­derem Augenmerk auf Usability und UX

  • Mitwirkung bei der Anforderungserhebung im Projektteam

  • Entwicklung der Lösungsidee von visueller Seite (Scribbles / Mockups)

  • Qualitätssicherung, Wartung, technische Doku­mentation und Second-Level-Support für die entwickelten Anwendungen

item.title: Full Stack Engineer at OnDeck (New York, NY)
item.description:
OnDeck (ONDK) uses data aggregation and electronic payment technology to evaluate the financial health of small and medium sized businesses to efficiently deliver capital to a market underserved by banks. Through the OnDeck platform, millions of small businesses can obtain affordable loans. We are changing the way small businesses borrow money by combining our passion for Main Street with cutting-edge technology. We evaluate businesses based on their actual performance, not personal credit, and that’s enabled us to say “yes” more often and faster than traditional lenders.


What excites us at OnDeck? Technology. Innovation. Small businesses. We believe in our employees and power their growth through being challenged every day and offering careers that inspire. We’re all about teamwork, passion and making an impact. Oh and having fun – Whether it’s a game of Ping-Pong, team get-togethers or weekly happy hours in the office.


Department summary:


Technology at OnDeck is a mix of building cutting edge systems to provide a world-class user experience to our customers and partners, aggregate mountains of data to make real-time lending decisions, and of course move lots of money every day.  We have an emphasis on scalability, reliability and accuracy.


As a Software Engineer, you will: 



  • You will investigate, prototype, build and transition tools, frameworks, and products to other internal teams

  • Participate with Technology management in the development of technology products and services.

  • Build a team of diverse professionals to drive ideas from concept to implementation.

  • Speak and author papers to showcase the company as a technology innovation leader in the commercial lending space.

  • Transition successful implementations to engineering for full support and build out.

  • Drive organizational change around key innovation products.

  • Provide insight, feedback and assistance to other technology teams as needed.

item.title: PHP Developer at Jon-Don Inc. (Roselle, IL)
item.description: Jon-Don has an immediate need for a PHP Developer to join their team full-time. The ideal candidate will have work experience in development and implementation of a wide variety of Web-based products primarily using PHP, JavaScript, SQL and AJAX.  Developers work as part of a team and independently on enhancements and new development of the company's software. In addition to developing in-house applications, developers code and implement integrations with various cloud applications.

item.title: Forensisch software engineer at Rijksoverheid (The Hague, Netherlands)
item.description:
Forensisch software engineer


Nederlands Forensisch Instituut



Functieomschrijving


Ben jij een ervaren software-engineer met interesse in low-level datastructuren?


Je werkt bij de groep Software Engineering van het Nederlands Forensisch Instituut (NFI) aan onze data-analyseapplicaties en libraries.


Als forensisch software-engineer duik je diep in de low-level datastructuren en algoritmiek. Je gaat werken aan complexe applicaties die binnen en buiten het NFI worden gebruikt voor opsporing en bewijsvoering. Denk hierbij aan het reverse-engineeren van onbekende bestandsformaten of bestandssystemen, om zo forensische sporen zichtbaar te maken. Ook draag je bij aan de verbetering van het vakgebied software-engineering en denk je mee over een efficiënte inrichting van het ontwikkelproces. Hierbij zorg je dat de forensische kennis zo goed mogelijk wordt geborgd.

item.title: MySQL DBA at Quotient, Inc. (Washington, DC)
item.description:
Why this job?


Quotient's IT Solutions and Services help clients use technology to enhance their service delivery and business processes. Quotient has a proven track record with Federal Agency customers. These roles will contribute to our nation's knowledge base and will be seen by millions of visitors seeking answers to a myriad of real life issues. 



• Optimizing DB configurations for performance and stability


• Monitoring DB performance and health


• SQL Query development/tuning


• Creating table structure creation and optimization


• Storing procedure and user defined function development


• Data modeling and design


• Backup / restore planning, testing, execution


• Disaster recovery planning and execution


• Managing project responsibilities and deliverables as part of an agile development process


• Providing technical design recommendations for solutions


• New DB installation and configuration


• DB replication set up and tuning


• Database security analysis, implementation, and maintenance


• Requirements analysis 


• Support white box testing of software applications


• Participates in agile development processes and practices


• DB Clustering techniques

item.title: Software Engineer, Mobile at MoLabs (New York, NY)
item.description: MoLabs is focused on building the next great mobile-first platform. To get there, we are assembling a world-class product and engineering team. MoLabs' software engineers develop the scalable, mobile-first technologies that change how users consume, explore and interact with information and the world. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing and UI design. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to tackle new problems across the full-stack. With your technical expertise you manage individual projects priorities, deadlines and deliverables. You design, develop, test, deploy, maintain, and enhance software solutions. Software Engineers have a penchant for solving complex and interesting problems. Pushing the boundaries of current mobile platforms, you will perform technological feats under constrained environments and will be presented with exciting challenges in native mobile application development. Our Software Engineers in Mobile Applications work on many projects that carry varying responsibilities. You will build MoLabs products for either Android or iOS. If you are an Android Developer, you will develop applications primarily in Java and using the Android SDK. If you are an iOS Developer, you will develop applications and SDKs primarily in Swift or Objective-C and using the iOS SDK.

item.title: Junior Java/JavaScript Developer at Palantir Solutions (London, UK)
item.description:
This role will suit someone with a foundation in Java or JavaScript development, who is looking for a business focused role with scope for future growth and career development. The position involves managing the integration and customization of our NetSuite CRM/ERP application internally; you will then carry out the implementation, configuring the application to the business needs and managing any integration and data migration activities. Post implementation you will also lend your skills to user training, ensuring that the delivered system meets needs requirements and contributing towards the future product development roadmap. Other responsibilities will include:



  • Helping to define and possibly implement data migration strategies

  • Creating new entities, reports and customized forms

  • Customizing system behaviour with JavaScript based scripts

  • Documenting requirements and produce project plans

  • Providing post implementation user training and advice

  • Implementing/customising the ERP and CRM workflow elements within NetSuite

  • Developing custom reports as needed for the business

item.title: Full-stack JavaScript hacker @ fast growing VC backed start-up at Ice.com (Palo Alto, CA)
item.description:
About us:

Our mission is to use software and analytics to bring transparency to the opaque world of jewelry. We are backed by leading VCs including Khosla Ventures, Maveron, and Crosslink. 

Note: we acquired the domain name (Ice.com) a year ago (it is unrelated to the previous company). 

A few reasons why you should be interested in this opportunity:

  • The jewelry industry is a fragmented, $80B market (in the US alone), growing at 5%+ annually, that software has yet to disrupt. 
  • You will be joining an awesome team led by Brandon Proctor (founding CMO of one of the largest e-commerce retailers, Build.com) and Justin Yoshimura (3x exits). 
  • We are extremely data driven and technology/software is in our DNA. You won't be a second class citizen here, guaranteed. 
  • We don't have time for assholes or politics. 
  • Competitive compensation package including stock options. 
  • Small (17 person) and agile team. 

What we'd like to see:

  • True, full-stack engineers with 2+ years of production experience in Python/Django or Node.js strongly preferred.
  • Strong foundation in computer science, with competencies in data structures, algorithms, databases, software design and dev ops.
  • Work experience with relational databases and SQL.
  • Experience with agile development process in collaborative environment.
  • BS in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or Physics OR 4 years of relevant work experience.
  • Good understanding of performance tradeoffs.

Bonus Points:

  • We are currently using Magento, an open source e-commerce platform built in Zend PHP - yuck), but we are building a new, badass e-commerce platform in Django, Angular.js, Node.js and integrating it with Netsuite's order management tools (no need to re-invent the entire wheel, after all). Related experience is a plus.
  • if you have an awesome Github repo, open source contributions, or a cool project you can demo, please cut to the front of the line...

Responsibilities:

As a member of our small but seriously talented engineering team, you will play a key role in both shaping and building our technologies. Your scope will be broad, ranging from user-facing features to server-side components and libraries. We are looking for a generalist who enjoys learning and working with different technologies. And of course you will be expected to commit code on your first day. 

*This job description is not meant to be an all-inclusive list of duties and responsibilities, but constitutes a general definition of the position's scope and function in the company.

item.title: Web/Mobile Developer - Techie at Scholarships.com (Highland Park, IL)
item.description:
Grow your tech skills with Scholarships.com!  If you love tech, have a desire to improve your skills and want to shape the future of a top ranked website, come join our tech team.


Don't worry, you don't need to be a guru with all technologies, just possess a strong foundation with some real world development experience.  We'll teach you the rest or give you the opportunity to learn as you help us build the next version of our main website, mobile apps or one of our sister websites.  


We are transitioning from traditional ASP.Net Web Forms to a C#, MVC environment and primarily use Microsoft SQL Server, C#, MVC, VB.Net, CSS, HTML, JQuery, JavaScript.  We also have Android and iPhone mobile apps that we are constantly improving, so, experience with Android Studio or Xcode is a plus.  


In addition to exposure to a wide range of technologies, we have a very relaxed work environment and tremendous flexibility when it comes to solutions development.

item.title: Lead Android Engineer at iCitizen (Nashville, TN)
item.description:
iCitizen, the leading civic engagement platform developed to revolutionize the way citizens identify and engage on issues they care about most, is seeking top talent with the right "will and skill" to join our team.


This business requires innovative thinking, balanced with a strong focus on quality and execution. Get ready to roll up your sleeves and solve some of the most complex big-data problems that will create efficiency in a large market and improve people's lives.


We are seeking a highly skilled Lead Android engineer to develop our next generation of mobile apps. The ideal candidate will have a passion for clean code and the data driven design process. You'll work closely with the UI/UX team and product management to ensure our mobile apps are truly exceptional and delightful. We are looking for a proactive thought leader who is willing to challenge themselves and others, is ready to learn and embrace new ways of thinking, and has an innate sense of curiosity.

a10:author.a10:name: Interhack Corp. and Secure Discovery LLC

item.title: Python/Django Engineer at Interhack Corp. and Secure Discovery LLC (Columbus, OH) (allows remote)
item.description:
A computer expert and electronic discovery firm is looking for an experienced Python and Django engineer to focus on an application that is currently being used to process evidence in legal proceeding across the United States. This candidate will work collaboratively to lead development of a web frontend for this existing data center application. Successful candidates are passionate about the art of problem solving through programming and will understand how to balance the tradeoffs of code that is simple, clever, secure, and of high quality.


The job is a contract position for a period of three to six months. Opportunities for full-time employment exist at the end of the contract period. Our offices are located in Columbus, OH but telecommuting may be possible for the right candidate.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer, Gateway at Avigilon (Somerville, MA)
item.description:
Avigilon is seeking an experienced C++ engineer to redesign the gateway enterprise application. The focus of this role is on building a public communication layer between enterprise servers and web, mobile and third party clients.


The candidate must have experience in the following areas:



  • Architecture of cutting-edge object oriented C++ application for video, networking, communication and storage

  • Design of RESTful APIs with low-latency/real-time requirements

  • Ingestion, processing and handling of large, remote, real-time telemetry and video data sets

  • Collaboration with other product teams to define, design and implement new features


Our office is currently located on Middlesex Turnpike, Billerica but relocating to Assembly Row, Somerville in November.

item.title: Softwareentwickler (JAVA / RUBY) in Vollzeit (M/W) at Bayard Consulting GmbH (Köln, Deutschland)
item.description:
Ihre Aufgaben bei uns


Sie möchten an Enterprise-SaaS Lösungen für unsere internationalen Kunden mitarbeiten? Sie möchten bei der Entwicklung eines neuen Produktes von Anfang an dabei sein, modernste Softwareentwicklungsmethoden (SCRUM) nutzen und mit State-of-the-Art Softwareentwicklungswerkzeugen arbeiten (Java, Ruby, PaaS)? Sie kennen sich bereits mit der aktiven Gestaltung des Internet sehr gut aus und implementieren sicher Anforderungen nach Architektur- und Designspezifikation. Sie entwickeln im gesamten Lebenszyklus von der Weiterentwicklung bestehender Systeme bis zur kompletten Neuentwicklung. Sie erarbeiten Konzepte und setzen diese in enger Zusammenarbeit mit den angrenzenden Abteilungen um. Ebenso sind Sie in der Lage, Softwaretests zu konzipieren und durchzuführen.

item.title: Electrical Engineer at Sensoria Inc. (Redmond, WA)
item.description:
As an Electrical Engineer, you are a key participant in the design of Sensoria’s groundbreaking product offering, successfully engaging with an experienced multi-disciplinary team and global partners. You are responsive, flexible and able to succeed within an open collaborative peer environment. 


In this role, your responsibilities include:



  • Contribute in hardware development of consumer products from concept through prototyping, short run and manufacturing.

  • Perform hands-on system bring-up and validation.

  • Create detailed test plans.

  • Implement automated testing infrastructure.

item.title: Java Scala Developer (M/F) at Transpaygo GmbH (Wien, Österreich)
item.description:
Fonmoney is a young and dynamic Start-Up based in Vienna, Austria. Created in late 2011 we are providing a service for our clients to send money around the world as a top-up or a bank-transfer. Our goal is to change “The act of sending money home”.


Fonmoney is developing a cutting edge Anti-Fraud and Anti Money Laundering Engine. We are working on the distributed machine-learning platform based on Apache Spark. In order to achieve this, we are currently looking for a passionate a Java engineer (M/F) for our office in Vienna. If you have a good knowledge and experience with Unix/Linux and you are also a little bit familiar with Windows environment, then feel free and apply for this position.

item.title: Application Developer at Onsharp (Fargo, ND)
item.description:
At Onsharp, we thrive on having fun at work while putting our passion for mobile and web development to good use. We work together to find ways to use technology to solve our client’s unique needs. As an application developer at Onsharp, you’ll work with an experienced dev team to implement dynamic data driven designs for new and existing client websites and develop and implement proprietary content and data driven management systems.


If you’re ready to put your experience to work in a fast-pace environment where input and innovation are always valued, then #TeamOnsharp is for you!


Tools we use at Onsharp



  • Development IDEs: Visual Studio, Xamarin Studio

  • Database Technologies: Microsoft SQL Server, MySQL, PostgreSQL (T-SQL)

  • Development Technologies: HTML, CSS, JavaScript (Including jQuery & AJAX), ASP.NET (C#), MVC, XSLT, XML, Xamarin, Java, Objective-C

item.title: Front End Engineer - Consultant at OnDeck (New York, NY)
item.description:
Technology at OnDeck is a mix of building cutting edge systems to provide a world-class user experience to our customers and partners, aggregate mountains of data to make real-time lending decisions, and of course move lots of money every day.  We have an emphasis on scalability, reliability and accuracy.


What we're building:



  • "OnDeck as a Service" - direct business web and mobile applications.

  • Merchant loan origination and account API, used by the web applications and the sales CRM platform. 

  • User tracking and feature testing infrastructure, as well as internationalizing our web offerings.

  • We have exciting plans to build out mobile experience, SMS notifications, and voice-based account information system.

item.title: Full Stack Developer at Bidalgo (Ramat Gan, Israel)
item.description: Bidalgo is looking for an outstanding Full Stack Developer to work on our next generation web platform and take part in the company's most important and exciting projects. Here at Bidalgo we work in a small and empowered team that utilizes bleeding edge technologies to rapidly deliver features to customers, measure results and iterate, while using continuous methodologies. Bidalgo's development team is responsible for building and developing smart big data algorithms to analyze user interactions with social media and mobile apps. We offer an industry leading SaaS solution. As a part of the engineering team, this role includes designing & developing production quality code. You will be working with the latest JS frameworks (Angular.js), Java, PHP and Node-JS, MySQL, RedShift and MongoDB. We believe in creative people, that are not afraid of new ideas and new ways of doing things. If you want the chance to make a difference and you're committed to quality - your place is us!

item.title: Talented, Experienced and Good-natured Full Stack Developer at Rewardable, Inc. (New York, NY) (allows remote)
item.description:
You are a versatile US-based developer who enjoys working across all layers of the tech stack. You're smart, creative, and passionate about what you do. You enjoy solving business and technical problems alike.


This is a full-time position with salary, equity and other benefits.  Freelancers and dev shops need not apply

item.title: Sr. Cloud Engineer (DevTools) at Medidata Solutions (New York, NY)
item.description:
What we do: 

The DevTools group within Medidata is responsible for the following:



  • Building and maintaining deployment and infrastructure automation tools

  • Handling the ongoing operations of our production systems.

  • Configure and build monitoring and logging tools to monitor our applications and servers.
