  • Ensuring that our applications and services are horizontally scalable, highly available and are deployable with our existing tools.

item.title: Database Administrator for RockStar Self-Publishing Company at Blurb (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Database Administrator Job Duties:



  • Identifies database requirements; analyzing department applications, programming, and operations; evaluating existing systems and designing proposed systems.

  • Recommends solutions by defining database physical structure and functional capabilities, database security, data back-up, and recovery specifications.

  • Installs revised or new systems by proposing specifications and flowcharts; recommending optimum access techniques; coordinating installation requirements.

  • Maintains database performance by calculating optimum values for database parameters; implementing new releases; completing maintenance requirements; evaluating computer operating systems and hardware products.

  • Provides information by answering questions and requests.

  • Supports database functions by designing and coding utilities.

  • Maintains quality service by establishing and enforcing organization standards.

  • Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.

item.title: Product Manager at Vena Solutions Inc. (Toronto, ON, Canada)
item.description:
About the Role


We’re looking for a detail-oriented Product Manager to work closely with our software engineers and product teams to build new and exciting projects. These projects will help revolutionize how companies work with their data and files through utilizing Vena’s software. At Vena, we believe that product releases should be fast and they should be often. To make this happen, our belief is that teams should be split by function and have end-to-end responsibility for what they build all the way into production.



As a Product Manager, your goal is to help us build an experiment-friendly culture that encourages failure and empowers teams to build great products and own their code all the way into production. Your role will be imperative in building autonomous team through alignment, transparency, and collaboration. You will be on the ground floor as we scale our teams and push ourselves to become the next great Canadian software company.



Responsibilities:



  • Drive Vena’s transition to Agile/Scrum software development in the role of Product Owner

  • Assist in establishing new and workable processes to make the development cycles increasingly effective each sprint.

  • Serve as the conduit between the user community (internal consultants and external customers) and the software engineering team through which requirements flow

  • Establish a shared vision across stakeholders by building consensus on priorities

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - Autonomous Driving at HERE-Chicago (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
Senior Java Software Engineer



The HERE Reality Capture & Processing (RCP) Platform team is expanding!



The RCP Platform team builds services designed to efficiently deliver our immense collection of 3D street-level and aerial content to product teams to power the next-generation of 3D consumer maps, enhanced navigation systems and more. We are looking for experienced candidates who will be able to work effectively in a multidisciplinary team environment focused on innovation and be able to learn and integrate complementary technologies inside and outside their specific area of expertise to deliver highly scalable and fault tolerant systems to optimize the way content feeds in to all of our products in the automotive, enterprise, and consumer spaces.



Responsibilities:
With a global fleet of vehicles collecting petabytes of 3D street-level and aerial data per year, you will be:
• Contributing to a engineering team charged with designing, architecting and building a platform to transform these massive data sets into building blocks for content creation.
• Building out services and APIs providing direct access to these rich 3D datasets.
• Work with Amazon Web Services as a storage and computing platform, especially with S3 and EC2.

item.title: Sr. Software Engineer at Viv Labs (San Jose, CA)
item.description:
Viv is a next-generation virtual personal assistant, brought to you by the team that developed Siri. In addition to being far more capable and intelligent, Viv will provide a truly open platform and marketplace that lets any developer extend Viv's capabilities for new domains and services.

We are looking for versatile, talented full-stack engineers who can create commercial-quality software with ease. As a Sr. Software Engineer, you will use our advanced AI tools to add new capabilities to Viv, teaching it about new domains and services.

You like working individually and in small teams and you are constantly learning from and teaching those around you and in online coding communities. You have a broad experience with server-side Javascript, integrating with third party web services, and are experienced at data and object modeling.


Benefits


Very competitive salary and equity packages. Other benefits include health, dental, vision, life/disability insurances, vacation/PTO, $100/month for phone or Internet service, access to the buildings gym & pool facilities, etc. Height-adjustable standing/sitting desks. Proven team, fun environment, huge upside, well-funded runway, cutting-edge AI technology. Work at home Thursdays for those with a longer commute.

item.title: Entry/Junior-level C#/ASP.NET Developer - Onsite in New York at Advise Technologies (New York, NY)
item.description:
We’re looking for a sharp developer with one solid enterprise experience (1-2 years), or a recent CS graduate with a great project/intern record, to join our seasoned dev team here in NYC. The ideal candidate will have a skill for tough puzzles, a talent for communicating complex ideas simply, and a drive to meet high expectations with great software. If you’re interested in working on a large-scale n-tier application, but need a bigger challenge than the average enterprise experience can offer, we’d like to talk to you.


Advise Technologies is a successful and fast-growing vendor to the private fund industry. Our flagship regulatory application is a complex n-tier platform built on the Microsoft stack: .NET 4.0/4.5, C#, WCF, SQL Server 2012, WinForms, WPF, ASP.NET MVC. The platform is metadata-driven, so the problem solving is intense, and our fierce attention to both tech- and product-side details means a fantastic opportunity for developers to grow.


Responsibilities



  • Collaborate on development of new data-driven application features and behaviors

  • Integrate with and maintain existing code base using industry and firm best practices, including source control (Mercurial/Kiln)

  • Participate directly in the complete SDLC, working closely with our product, QA, and legal teams

  • Build smart internal tools to streamline platform development

  • Learn and work with independence, merge with an established dev team with decades of collective experience building best-in-class enterprise software

  • Deliver under pressure

item.title: Senior Fullstack Engineer NYC at Curalate (New York, NY)
item.description:
Curalate is looking for talented senior software engineers to join our team.  Our engineering team today is deep in the trenches -- tackling some of the gnarliest problems out there at the intersection of computer vision and big data -- and we're looking for a few great coders to join us.


Although experience with our existing technology stack is great, we're much more interested in hiring developers with exceptional problem solving skills, creative out-of-the-box thinking, and comfort evaluating and deploying new technologies.


For this position, we're looking for accomplished engineers with at least three years of experience at a high-functioning technology company; you should know exactly what it takes to ship high quality software on-time.  And while this is an IC role, we will lean on you to help mentor the more junior members of our team.


We're not hiring code monkeys; you'll be given substantial feature ownership, and we'll expect you to contribute product ideas as well as code. Above all else, we're looking for others who are as excited above the potential in this space as we are, and who will be willing to join us in moving fast and breaking things as we execute against that vision.

item.title: Senior Cloud Developer at INRIX (Kirkland, WA)
item.description:
INRIX is looking for a Senior Cloud Developer to join our team. We are building a comprehensive new mobile SDK, innovative services, new branded INRIX experiences, and helping our partners leverage our SDK into their experiences.  We have a great team in place, and are looking for a senior developer take things even further.


 On the Mobile team at INRIX, we value open discussion, pushback, and management by objective and prioritization.  You will be working closely with our Android, iOS, and QA teams.


How do we plan and build software on the Mobile Team?


It’s full Scrum and Agile.  That means weekly sprint planning, poker planning, retrospectives, backlogs, stories -- the full solution.  We work together as a small team, 100% scrum based, and as little process as possible. 


If you love fast paced development or planning, or you want to learn this skill, the INRIX Mobile team is the place to be.  If you want to ship real experiences, you want to point at something and say “I did that”, and you want to work with customers at scale, INRIX is the place for you.


Must Haves:



  • Customer focus — Our job at the end of the day is to delight customers through technology, you need to be 100% customer focused.

  • Experience —  At least 4 years as a backend developer showing experience in software development, architecture and design, passion for shipping services, and planning.

  • Cloud Technologies — Experience pushing AWS technologies to the limit and a passion to be keep on top of the latest innovations in the cloud is a must.

  • Scalability - Everything you do must work with customers at scale.

  • Passion for detail - TDD, Unit Testing, Automation, Black Box, White Box, etc.  If you have an obsession with producing high quality code, you’ve come to right place.

  • Computer Science - You should know the fundamentals of algorithm and data structure design/selection and be able to defend your choices.  


Why Develop with INRIX? The INRIX development team is a great place to grow your career and skillset.  Our roadmap is bursting with opportunity for engineers to bring their best (and then some), solving intriguing challenges, and tangibly impacting the customer experience. 


Our space is dynamic, it changes all the time, and we are 100% focused on solving for our customers.  Today we might be building the next great mobile app; tomorrow it might be a new traffic app in the new hot car.  Our customers are literally building everything you can imagine, and lots you can't.  Our data, SDK, apps, and cloud are used across a breadth of experiences and device types. 


We take career development very seriously on the mobile development team.  Part of our goal is to invest in you. We will support you and help you get better in your craft. We also expect you to teach us a few things along the way. 



Why make the move:



  • INRIX motorboat – Get your boat license and we’ll pay for the gas. You can walk from your office to the dock in 15 minutes. Take your family and friends skiing or tubing.  Yes, it’s big and it’s fast!

  • Free car – Well…. not really free.  But we have test cars with the latest traffic technology that you can take home.  We pay for the gas. 

  • Great Benefits – We’re as good as or better than most companies our size.

  • Free onsite snacks and drinks; Free Friday lunches – The food comes to you so that you write lots and lots of good code (at least we’re honest).

  • Bonuses 2x per year and Stock Options – Because you like to be rewarded and recognized for your hard work.

  • No Vacation Policy – You’re an adult and can manage your own vacation time.  Work hard; play hard.  Why does your company still have a vacation policy?

  • Family – We don’t believe that you should miss your child’s play because you have to attend a meeting. 

  • Are you ready to join a different kind of company?


INRIX is a leading provider of real-time traffic information, connected car services and analytics worldwide. The company leverages big data analytics to reduce the individual, economic and environmental toll of traffic congestion. Through cutting-edge data intelligence and predictive traffic technologies, INRIX helps leading automakers, fleets, governments and news organizations make it easier for drivers to navigate their world. 

Our vision is simple – to solve traffic, empower drivers, inform planning and enhance commerce.  INRIX is at the forefront of connecting cars to smarter cities and serves more than 350 blue-chip customers in more than 40 countries around the world.


Exciting things are happening all the time. Come join us!

item.title: Software Engineer, Backend at Cisco Meraki (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Meraki’s customer base has grown by a factor of 2-3 every year since we started, leading to a current request rate of over 200 million page views per day, and the Meraki backend team keeps our cloud management infrastructure scaling in the face of that growth.


Examples of the systems we've built/worked on include:



  • A secure, resilient overlay network that allows our backend to deliver configurations and gather statistics from our devices despite Internet routing anomalies and middleboxes.

  • A highly concurrent daemon that gathers updated statistics from every Meraki wireless access point, switch, and firewall every 45 seconds.

  • A custom database, written from scratch in C++, that processes over 1 million writes/second and intelligently partitions statistics data on disk for fast retrieval and efficient in-memory caching.


The backend team uses a number of different programming languages and systems, deliberately choosing the right tools for each particular application. We write code in C++, Ruby, and Scala. We use Linux, PostgreSQL, Rails, Jetty, Click, nginx, and memcached. We contribute to several open source projects.

item.title: Senior Mobile Software Engineer at comScore (Amsterdam Zuid-Oost, Nederland)
item.description:
As a mobile developer, you'll be responsible for creating and expanding our native and JavaScript SDKs and libraries for application and streaming analytics.


You will be working with algorithms on multiple platforms, including phones, tablets and other internet-connected devices, as well as upcoming hardware (Apple Watch, Google Glass, etc)


You should be experienced in mobile app development, coupled with in-depth knowledge of JavaScript and other web-technologies. Close collaboration with the local and American reporting team and QA engineers will also be an essential part of your work.


We're a close knit international team of experienced Engineers who are passionate about web and application analytics and finding innovative ways to provide analytics data on the latest technology to solve the needs of our clients.  We’re looking for like-minded developers who are keen to solve interesting problems.

item.title: Backend Web Developer JAVA (m/w) ( Munich, Germany) at mylivn (Munich, Germany)
item.description:
Applicants must be eligible to work in the specified location


We are looking for a talented Backend web developer who will be responsible for building our back-end system and providing other teams and mobile apps with a great RESTful API of our backend services.

item.title: Platform Engineer (Python) at Apervita, Inc. (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
The Platform Engineer at Apervita is responsible for the architecture and development of the back-end functions that drive the Apervita platform. Development is all in Python interacting with MongoDB as our data store to build a leading edge platform to revolutionize the healthcare industry in Clinical Decision Support and Quality of Care operations.


The Platform Engineer will design and build new reusable components and frameworks, optimize and refactor existing components, and design scalable and resilient solutions as the foundation for the platform. The Platform Engineer will also partner with the Front-End Engineering team to produce various features for our customers, enhance existing features, and ensure overall security, stability, and usability of the platform.


Apervita uses an Agile methodology and uses extensive unit testing and peer review as part of the development process.


The Apervita platform is a multi-tier application built on Python and MongoDB and extensively uses cloud computing principles.


Apervita strives to enable developers to spend as much time as possible on design collaboration and development, running a low-overhead methodology based on Agile and Continuous Integration principles. We want developers to do what they do best, rising to meet technology challenges and working together as a team to build a world class platform.

item.title: Sr. .Net Software Engineer at CDK Global (Hoffman Estates, IL)
item.description:
ADP Dealer Services is now CDK Global.

Stability meets Agility.  CDK is one of the largest technology providers to the automotive industry, with more than 26,000 dealer sites in over 100 countries and nearly 9,000 employees worldwide. From data scientists to sales and operations experts, we’re hiring to support your growth and ours. GreenLight Your Career

CDK Global is looking for passionate, skilled software engineers to join a great team building a new product suite to change the car buying process for both dealers and consumers. Work on an advanced distributed system leveraging technologies such as AngularJS, .NET WebAPI, NServiceBus, RabbitMQ, RavenDB, and SQLFire. Our newly renovated workplace is a creative and collaborative environment supporting an agile methodology.  The CDK Global Engineering team is a group of fun, pragmatic, full stack engineers with multi-language coding skills focused on engineering excellence and continuous improvement.  As a software engineer with CDK Global you will:



  • Performs a developer role in building enterprise software solutions encompassing: services and service layer, service integration to UI and data, UI components;

  • Delivers world class, high quality design and code using MS .NET including MVC, Entity framework. Uses agile methodologies including TDD, CI, Refactoring and Code Reviews;

  • Works with the Product Owners and other team members to complement and complete the development process.

item.title: Quality Assurance Engineer at Emerlyn Technology, LLC (Conway, NH)
item.description:
Develops quality assurance standards, publishes and implements test plans. Writes and maintains test automation. Defines and tracks quality assurance metrics such as defect densities and open defect counts. Must have a working knowledge of quality assurance methodologies.


Responsibilities
As a Quality Assurance Engineer you will be responsible for working with development and account support teams in developing test workflow, including functional, integration, regression, UAT, and performance/stress testing.
In addition:



  • Evaluate and recommend testing tools and environment.

  • Participate in installation and maintenance of testing tools and environment.

  • Analyze system requirements to develop and maintain test plans and data.

  • Document test plans and environments to be run by self and others.

  • Document, prioritize and monitor issues.

  • Streamline processes for efficiency.

item.title: Senior Front End Engineer, Ad Reporting at Quantcast (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
The Advertising Reporting Team is responsible for building industry-leading reporting solutions for Quantcast’s advertising clients, providing rich insights into their advertising campaigns and audience.


We are looking for a senior/principal front-end engineer who has deep familiarity and experience with front-end technologies. He/she will be leading the development of brand new, innovative reporting features to deliver a rich and intuitive user experience for our large and rapidly growing advertising client base.


As a senior engineer, he/she will also set the technical direction and extend best practices within the team. We currently use Java, Play framework, JavaScript, AngularJS, d3, and are open to new technologies.


Responsibilities



  • Define, code, test, and deploy new features to our reporting suite with an emphasis on extensibility and performance.

  • Utilize latest HTML5, CSS, and JS techniques to produce highly-performant, informative, and beautiful user experiences for clients.

  • Work cross-functionally with UX, Product, and other Engineering teams. Contribute to the product definition, UI, and system design processes.

  • Evaluate feasibilities and effectively manage project scope and time.

  • Continually evaluate and instill best practices into the development process, including automated testing, code organization and style, and front-end application architecture.

item.title: QA Engineer at Adbrain (London, UK)
item.description:
ABOUT YOU



  • You have a deep understanding of the difference between programming and software engineering.

  • Agile principles and a balanced appreciation of the lean mindset - with a view to iterate and test rapidly where possible and sensible, and design and implement to ship a version of a solution sooner rather than later. (We aim to follow the spirit of the law, and not its letter.)

  • You care about Software, appreciating pragmatism, accountability, and quality of the software as a measure of company success rather than an abstract principle.

  • You have strong opinions, loosely held. You know how to argue your point passionately, but are the first to change your mind if proven wrong.


ABOUT THE ROLE



  • Work with product owners and developers to create specifications for new software

  • Plan the testing of new products and features

  • Help developers create test-friendly components

  • Write automated tests using C# and SpecFlow, and Selenium for some products

  • Perform exploratory testing

  • Investigate, log, and track issues

  • Contribute to the development of quality assurance across the company

item.title: Software Engineers at Overpass (Newark, NJ)
item.description: Our available positions include Full Stack, Front-end and Backend developer roles. As a developer you will be part of our core development team. You will take part in building a complex platform from the ground up.

item.title: Technical Lead for the next great mobile-first platform at MoLabs (New York, NY)
item.description: MoLabs is focused on building the next great mobile-first platform. To get there, we are assembling a world-class product and engineering team. MoLabs' software engineers develop the scalable, mobile-first technologies that change how users consume, explore and interact with information and the world. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing and UI design. You have deep expertise in building performant, scalable systems in C++, Java, Go or Python. Your design intuition should lean towards elegance and simplicity, and you should have experience with highly-scaled serving systems.

item.title: LAMP Developer at Zeta Interactive (New York, NY)
item.description:
The LAMP Developer will play a fundamental role in supporting Zeta Interactive’s rapid growth and market expansion world-class code, client-facing web properties in the digital media space.


You’ll be working closely with our product team to extend our platform, build new features, and solve problems / opportunities. You'll be tackling problems big and small from HTML formatting to application design to database optimization.


The ideal candidate will have exceptional verbal and written communication skills, will be self­-motivated, detail­-oriented and highly organized. You will possess a passion for well­-structured, well­-commented code and be a creative thinker. Your ability to multitask and prioritize work in our fast paced environment will be key to your success.

item.title: SQL Server DBA at JustEnough (Irvine, CA)
item.description:
The position will involve new development and maintenance of existing code.



  • Administration and management of SQL databases in  development, QA and production environments

  • Troubleshoot and handle database related issues through to resolution

  • Proactive monitoring of databases both from a performance and capacity management perspective

  • Perform database maintenance activities such as backup/recovery and rebuilding/reorganizing indexes

  • Ensure that all database releases are properly assessed and measured from a functionality and    performance perspective

  • Provide technical subject matter expertise on all database design and development projects

  • Hands on SQL programing skills

  • Experience in configuring SQL Server failover clusters and high availability groups

item.title: Senior Devs for High-Growth Computer Vision Startup (Seattle) at Curalate (Seattle, WA)
item.description: Curalate is looking for talented software developers to join our team.  Our engineering team today is deep in the trenches -- tackling some of the gnarliest problems out there at the intersection of computer vision and big data -- and we're looking for a few good coders to join us.

item.title: Software Developer in Test - Drivers at DataStax (Santa Clara, CA)
item.description:
DataStax delivers Apache Cassandra™ in a database platform purpose built for the performance and availability demands of IOT, web, and mobile applications, giving enterprises a secure always on database that remains operationally simple when scaled in a single datacenter or across multiple data centers and clouds. We are looking for a Software Engineer in Test, focusing on the drivers and tools used to develop applications against Apache Cassandra. Can be located anywhere in the United States. 



Essential Job Functions:



  • Conceptualize, develop, and execute driver and tool code tests (coverage, duration, and stress) against local and distributed Cassandra/DataStax Enterprise (DSE) clusters running on a variety of platforms.

  • Dive deep into the code base to analyze features and bug-fixes while using debugging and profiling tools. You will work hand-in-hand with development teams to define functionality and resolve issues.

  • Have the opportunity to learn new languages, tools, and processes in a dynamic, fast-paced, small team environment.

  • Set up automated build and testing tasks across varied platforms and create analysis/tracking reports.

  • Write user-facing blog posts, driver software demos, how-to tutorials, as well as debug customer issues.



Job Requirements:



  • 2+ years in a production software development role.

  • Motivated self-starter who has experience working in a distributed team that exchanges ideas via IRC and HipChat. Must possess the discipline and focus to work independently at a remote location.

  • Understand the complexities of testing in a distributed, big data environment, and place a strong emphasis on performance tuning.

  • Strong development background using C#.

  • Comfortable with code development and scripting in a Linux environment.

  • Comfortable interfacing with the open source community and having your code reviewed via github pull requests.

  • Passion for making great software in a small company setting.

  • History of learning new technologies on the fly.

  • Possess an assertive communication style.

item.title: MySQL DBA at MLB Advanced Media (New York, NY)
item.description:
MLB Advanced Media (MLBAM), the interactive and mobile company of Major League Baseball, is the developer of several award-winning products, apps and services. Some of these include: MLB Gameday, MLB.TV, Fantasy Baseball, Beat the Streak, and the #1 sports app and a Hall of Fame inductee for iPhone, iPad and Macworld – MLB At Bat! We are also an industry leader in the development and distribution of live streaming video events over multiple platforms.


We are seeking a MySQL DBA (Mid-Senior Level) in our New York City office.


At MLBAM, you will get to have your hands on the pulse of a platform that is providing the best live streaming experience in the world. You will be able to work with a large environment where ideas are always welcome and will have the opportunity to work where the future of media delivery is being forged.


Responsibilities:



  • Perform on-site, day-to-day production MySQL database administration tasks in a Linux environment, including maintenance, troubleshooting, tuning, optimization, installation, upgrades, backup/recovery, and data migration across multiple data centers and multiple database server architectures/systems.

  • Troubleshoot and resolve production database issues

  • Maintain database design/release documentation

  • Work closely with Engineering and DBA Team to design and implement optimal solutions.

  • Consistently meet deadlines and schedules by working closely with Engineering/Infrastructure team

item.title: JAVA Developer Building Baseball Analytics Applications at LBi Software (Woodbury, NY)
item.description:
LBi Software is looking for candidates with experience in full stack Java-based web application development.


We are seeking a Software Engineer to work as part of a team to design and develop custom enterprise web applications. Candidates must be self-starters and able to follow written and verbal direction working with a technical team leader. They must be able to produce well-documented and efficient code and possess the communication skills necessary to explain complex technical information. A four-year degree in Computer Science or equivalent is required. The position requires strong knowledge of software architecture, development, data modeling, database design, unit testing, continuous integration, continuous delivery, and QA processes.

item.title: Front-End Software Engineer at V12 Group (Red Bank, NJ)
item.description:
V12 Group has been providing customers, clients, and users of Launchpad, our marketing cloud, with leading technology, quality data, and an unparalleled customer experience. 


The Software Engineer (Front-End) will be accountable for developing and maintaining key modules of the V12 Group's suite of SaaS applications. The Developer/Engineer will be working on a next generation product.

Responsibilities

• Design, develop and modify modules based on functional and system requirements
• Work closely with Product Owner for understanding the functional and system requirements
• Work closely with Software Engineers to ensure architectural integrity and product quality
• Participate in testing process through unit testing and bug fixes
• All other duties as assigned

item.title: Technical Manager at V12 Group (Red Bank, NJ)
item.description:
The role of the Technical Manager is to plan, execute, and finalize projects according to timelines and within budget. This includes using current resources and coordinating the efforts of team members and third-party contractors or consultants in order to deliver projects. The Technical Manager will also define the project's objectives and oversee quality control throughout its life cycle. The Technical Manager will report to SVP Engineering.

Responsibilities



  • Manage application development

  • Identify and manage project dependencies

  • Estimate the resources and identify team members needed to achieve project goals.

  • Plan and schedule project timelines and milestones

  • Effectively communicate project status and issues to team members and stakeholders

  • Coach, mentor, motivate and supervise project team members

  • Review and approve development teams technical approaches

  • Confer with other managers on integration and infrastructure requirements

  • Lead in the creation of life cycle documents – requirements, use cases, and technical designs

item.title: Innovation Developer at Connolly iHealth Technologies (Atlanta, GA) (allows remote)
item.description: Senior Technical Consultant / Developer on the Innovation Dev team are responsible for working with a global team of Product Owners and fellow developers to create world class solutions for incredibly difficult problems using cutting edge technologies, development processes, and conceptual frameworks. Our solutions are scalable, elastic, concurrent, parallel, and deliver results to our clients in real-time with support from our DevOps team members.

item.title: Cloud Operations Engineer at StorageCraft Technology Corporation (Draper, UT)
item.description:
Role and Responsibilities


The Cloud Operations Engineer will be responsible for running, maintaining and operating our cloud hardware and services; using the software deployed by our development team.  In this role, you will work on a range of in-house projects.  This job provides a degree of freedom that you will not find in larger companies.  If you are looking for a job that makes use of your critical thinking and creativity, then this is it. 


You will work within a small, friendly software engineering team and work on a number of critical products and projects.  Ideally you are detail-oriented, self-motivated, a problem solver and work well in a fast moving, dynamic work environment. 


Qualifications Requirements



  • Proven experience with processes related to Linux in a cloud environment

  • Solid understanding of programming with Python, Bash, Perl or other languages

  • Solid understanding of CEPH, OpenStack, and SaltStack

  • Good working knowledge with writing scripts in any language

  • Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple deadlines and priorities

  • Excellent written and oral communication skills, particularly in documenting and teaching operational cloud processes

  • Ability to work on critical and abstract tasks with minimal supervision

  • Comfortable using and learning new technologies and products.    


Knowledge of any of the following is an advantage:



  • Apache

  • CEPH

  • OpenStack

  • Networking experience

  • Python

  • Nagios

  • System Administration

  • Rabbit MQ experience or equivalent distributed message queue

  • Amazon Web Services


Education



  • B.S. Degree:  Information Systems or related field and/or 5+ years' experience as a Systems Administrator.


Additional Notes


This is a FT, long-term position reporting to the Engineering Director. Hours of work will be primarily 8:30am to 5:00pm during the week, but able to be on call 24/7. 


EOE/Minorities/Females/Vet/Disability

item.title: UX Designer at CDK Global (Hoffman Estates, IL)
item.description:
ADP Dealer Services is now CDK Global.


Stability meets Agility. CDK is one of the largest technology providers to the automotive industry, with more than 26,000 dealer sites in over 100 countries and nearly 9,000 employees worldwide. From data scientists to sales and operations experts, we're hiring to support your growth and ours. GreenLight Your Career.


CDK Global is transforming the car buying process for both automotive dealers and car buyers. To achieve this lofty goal, we are deeply engaging with the our users to ensure that our products ignite efficiency and productivity while being delightfully easy to use. The User Experience engineering group at CDK is focused on the quality of the interactions people have with our technology and is looking for professionals that employ the principles and techniques of User Centered Design to join us. UX @ CDK follows a multi-disciplinary approach that focuses on all the users' emotions, beliefs, preferences, perceptions, and behaviors through an iterative research and design process. As a UX designer you will...



  • Transform the end user experience for CDK's automotive dealership solutions

  • Work closely with product development teams to follow user-centered design principles

  • Provide interaction and visual design

  • Drive the design vision, processes, and execution

  • Collaborate closely with UX researchers to ensure designs meets the needs of the user

  • Present and evangelize your work and the concept of usability across the organization

  • Operate with lean, agile frameworks and methodologies to improve the ability to respond to change

item.title: Web / ASP.NET-MVC Developer at SCLogic, LLC (Annapolis, MD)
item.description:
Job & Company Description:
SCLogic develops, markets, sells, and supports its flagship product, Intra. Intra is a vertical Business Process Management (BPM) solution. In campus logistics applications, Intra uses mobile computers and barcodes to monitor and control the flow of tangible objects — mail, parcels, property, files or people — as they enter, move through, and exit a facility. Intra features intuitive user interfaces, rugged hand-held data collection devices, intelligent routing and sorting logic, text and email notification, signature capture and in-depth reporting. It allows any user to track any object, and monitor distribution, anywhere within the campus. The target market for our product is essentially any organization that needs to provide accountability/proof of delivery for any tangible item. Some of our primary markets include financial institutions, pharmaceutical companies, college and university campuses, and the hospitality industry. SCLogic needs additional development staff to complete new and continuing development initiatives.

Responsibilities:
Responsibilities will include all phases of software development for a database driven web application. Duties will include creating new functionality as well as maintenance and support of existing products.

item.title: Lead MySQL DBA at TubeMogul (Emeryville, CA)
item.description:
We are seeking a Lead Database Administrator with good system and database administration skills. As a Lead DBA you will managing a team of DBA’s who are responsible for the performance, integrity and security of our databases which is about 50 MySQL servers and dozen of Vertica Servers. The operations team leverages some of the most cutting edge technology to simplify an otherwise complex system.

Candidates should have a passion for building infrastructure for high-performance, "Big Data" systems. In this role, you will leverage open-source tools like MySQL, Hadoop, HBase, Hive, and Couchbase.  Candidates will at least be familiar with the technologies we are using but may not have had the opportunity to acquire deep experience in previous job settings. However, you should have a true passion for systems engineering that is apparent in your past work.

item.title: Left handed (or right handed) quick thinking, problem solving Software Engineer at Shareaholic Inc (Boston, MA)
item.description: Shareaholic is looking for amazing, problem solving, and hard working software engineers who WANT to work on a variety of problems and products. You must enjoy working on solving shared engineering problems and improving all of our products.  Our products deliver correctness, efficiency, and availability.  You will help make that happen. We measure and monitor everything, and have a culture of continuous reflection and improvement.  If you love delivering product driven software, we want to hear from you!

item.title: Solution Architect (US Based Candidates only ) at RBM Technologies (Boston, MA)
item.description:
Responsibilities:



  • Define business and technical requirements for future engineering efforts

  • Architect solutions, data models and technical approaches to future engineering efforts

  • Explore new technologies, create prototypes and determine applicability to the company’s product strategy

  • Ability to understand software at a code level when required

  • Be familiar with new technologies, processes and techniques and be prepared to guide their introduction into the engineering team.

  • Be a leader in defining the architectural direction of the company's products.

  • Become a subject matter expert on RBM’s application software


Offering Visa Transfer Sponsorship, but all candidates MUST be within the US. Candidates outside the US will NOT be considered. Thank you.

item.title: Java Software Engineer at Practichem (Morrisville, NC)
item.description:
Practichem is growing and needs to add an experienced full stack Java developer. You'll create full stack web applications using Java, AngularJS, CoffeeScript, Less, Jade, NodeJS, and related technologies.


You'll control real world equipment directly from a single-page browser application. Recent tasks we completed:



  • Display of huge data sets on a multi-tabbed interface within the browser

  • Pattern recognition and identification within large data sets

  • Multi-instrument integration with a coordination site

  • Creation of simulated instruments into Docker containers for load testing


You'll integrate browser controlled Arista™ into a whole browser based lab concept. Along with a great team of software and hardware engineers, you'll be bringing amazing products to the world. 


What makes this position stand out?



  • Control real hardware using web applications you develop.

  • Work in the highly technical domain of scientific instruments.

  • Choose your daily OS. Many of us prefer Linux.

  • You get a great computer (Lenovo or Mac) with plenty of RAM and huge monitors.

  • Count on professional User Interaction designers on our team.

  • Create new software using the latest frameworks and tools.

  • At Practichem, we make our own real, physical stuff.

item.title: Full-stack web engineer for leading SaaS product at FreeAgent (Edinburgh, UK) (allows remote)
item.description:
We're looking for an full-stack software engineers to come and work on our flagship web-based product FreeAgent. We're a growing team of over 85 people, based in Edinburgh but with remote staff around the UK (7 engineers are fully remote).


We have a lot of happy customers (42,000+, NPS=75!), a lot of traffic (13 million+ page views/mo), and some lovely staff to work alongside, learn from and have fun with. We invest a lot of time in our platform (code health, scalability, security) as well as working on new features, which is nice.


Our engineers tend to be full stack, but we’re seeing people move towards more specialist work these days, such as front-end programming (we're doing a lot of React.js, primarily on our iOS app), our real-time accounting engine, data science. People play to their strengths really. Our stack is intentionally straightforward. It's sensible and sustainable. Javascript aside, we mainly write Ruby alongside MySQL, RabbitMQ, Elasticsearch, Puppet. Prior Ruby knowledge is not a requirement!


Please note we are looking for UK-based full-time staff right now.

item.title: Web Applications Developer at Yield Book (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Yield Book development team is building the next generation fixed-income analytics interface using cutting edge web technologies in a fast moving agile development environment. We are looking for a highly-skilled front-end developer to join our team to be an integral member in helping to design and build the next fixed income analytics platform.


We are looking for candidates with creative ideas and strong personal initiative to solve a variety of programming problems using the latest and the greatest front-end technologies such as AngularJS, jQuery, D3 charting library, RequireJS and others.

item.title: Software Developer Java at Tracsis plc (Manchester, UK)
item.description:
An experienced and talented Java software developer is sought to join our fast growing, successful software company which specialises in business and data management applications for the public transport industry.



The role will see the successful candidate taking responsibility for the development of new features across our suite of products. The candidate will be expected to analyse requirements, provide suitable designs and take part in the development, testing and future maintenance of the systems. Successful candidates will join a small software team working across our suite of products using a wide variety of technologies. We strongly encourage proactive learning, and personal development. We emphasise good technical practices and value long-term quality and continuous improvement.


Candidates must hold a 2.1 or higher degree in Computing, Science, Engineering or Mathematics or a related discipline.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at LifeLink (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
LifeLink, a VC backed startup currently in stealth mode, connects patients and healthcare systems around the globe through an open, collaborative platform built on structured data.


LifeLink is the brainchild of successful entrepreneurs and early stage investors with expertise in healthcare and building ecosystem businesses.


Join a small, smart, fast, experienced, communicative and creative team. Apply your technical skills and creativity to change the world by revolutionizing the delivery of global healthcare!


About the position:


The Senior Software Engineer will



  • help build LifeLink’s global applications for patients and medical providers

  • help create effective agile processes and team culture

  • efficiently deliver customer value through high quality, reliable code


Specific responsibilities include:



  • Communicate constructively with team members to cooperatively build a product suite that delights customers.

  • Write extensible code with high automated test coverage.

  • Contribute to team decisions about system architecture and the selection of technical tools.

  • Build attractive and intuitive user experiences.

  • Build scalable, auditable, and reliable integrations with external partner and customer systems including electronic health record (EHR) systems.

  • Troubleshoot issues as they arise and resolve technical challenges. Understand business concerns and contribute to brainstorming pragmatic options to address them.

item.title: We Would Love to Find a Great QA (Quality Assurance) Tester! at SocialFlow Inc. (New York, NY)
item.description:
Test dynamic and compelling tools and visual dashboards so the most recognized news, media, retail, and publisher brands in the world can get the most from their social media efforts.


We are a tech-focussed and led company. As a member of that team your job will be to assure quality for the interface components that our clients rely on daily.


We utilize lean methods for quality software development and testing.


SocialFlow is a great place to work where you can feel proud knowing many of the most recognized brand names in the world are using the products you have helped to create.

item.title: (Senior) PHP / Symfony2 Developer (m/w) at Exozet Berlin GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Symfony2 is your most favourite framework and you have already used it in several projects. You know the bundles and how to apply them. For example Sonata (Admin, User, Media…) or Elastica. You know how to manage test suites with Jenkins – just because Continuous Integration should be part of every project. You love to design and develop complex web portals. Troubleshooter is your second name. For you large quantities of data are easy to handle and a bugfix triggers a dance of joy in you. You don’t hesitate to try out new tools and you are always open for new ideas. You love to share your knowledge with your colleagues and also project managers whom you advise in terms of best solutions, priorities and planning.



This is what you can expect


You develop individual solutions for our clients based on Symfony2 and PHP as part of our teams. You design databases with Doctrine and improve data base accesses. You fix bugs, write documentation and discuss possible solutions – with your team, the project managers, designers and QA. And sometimes even with our clients. You can expect exciting projects, nice colleagues, a family-friendly atmosphere and a wonderful view over the Tempelhof Airport Field.

item.title: Web Application Developer - PHP - Leatherhead at DutySheet Ltd (Leatherhead, UK)
item.description:
We are looking for a developer to join our development team during this exciting period for DutySheet.


DutySheet are in the early stages of developing an entirely new platform for the volunteering sector and this is your opportunity to get involved at a critical time. You will have the chance to influence design and development that will make a difference to charities and other voluntary organisations across the country.


DutySheet currently scores 9 on the Joel Test and with your help, we aim to get that to a full 12.

item.title: .NET Web API and Backend Developer at Florence Healthcare (Atlanta, GA)
item.description:
We are seeking talented ASP.NET MVC developers to work our Florence Clinical suite of Web based applications. You will be responsible for all aspects of the software life cycle, from requirements to testing, deployment, and support.   Your responsibility will be to build an enterprise-grade backend for our CloudBinder® solution. Here you will:



  • Develop web APIs that to be consumed by front-end and mobile applications 

  • Implement a Mongo database and a .NET data access layer using the MongoDB C# driver.

  • Manage the application release cycle using Amazon Web Services or Microsoft Azure.

  • Design and implement new modules and need to be able to solve difficult problems through technology. 

  • Kick ass and take names for the sake of cures.

item.title: Software Engineer (C++), Traffic Team at HERE, a Nokia company (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
Do you want to work on projects with an amazing scale and develop solutions for millions of users? Keep reading!!




HERE Berlin is an innovative branch where an international team of 50+ nationalities creates location-based services at the highest level.


Join our fast growing, highly motivated Traffic team as an experienced Software Engineer specializing in C++ backend development. The Traffic team offers a unique chance of developing innovative features for visualizing traffic conditions used on automotive products, smartphones, mobile devices and web services.


Our Offerings



  • To join our highly motivated team in Berlin

  • To work with evolving and challenging technologies

  • To work together with specialists in an international team

  • To invent next-generation mobile services for users world-wide

item.title: Software Development Engineer, AWS Benchmarking team at Amazon (Cape Town, South Africa)
item.description:
Are you the sort of person who enjoys building software in the cloud? Can you automate processes so that they run continuously without manual intervention? Do you get excited by the performance aspects of complex architectures and like diving deep to find answers to hard performance questions? Do you want to make an impact on millions of developers and IT professionals? If so, we would like to talk to you.



The Amazon Web Services Benchmarking team is seeking a mid- to senior-level Software Development Engineer to join us in beautiful Cape Town. Our team focuses on understanding and improving the performance and usability of AWS and ultimately the end-to-end customer experience.



Responsibilities of the role include:

  • Designing and implementing cloud-based software solutions to automatically execute performance benchmarks

  • Analysing performance metrics and reporting to business stakeholders

  • Exploring and building new ways to make performance data accessible to internal users

  • Working closely with product teams and owners to understand the performance aspects of their services

  • Identifying performance and usability issues of cloud services and driving improvements




  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience

  • 3+ years software development experience

  • Fluency in one or more mainstream programming languages

  • Working knowledge of relational databases (MySQL, Oracle, or SQL Server)

  • Great communication skills, attention to detail, and sharp analytical abilities




  • Master’s Degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience

  • Experience developing distributed systems

  • Experience with developing and deploying applications on Amazon Web Services or other providers

  • Experience with industry-standard performance tests

  • Experience analyzing large data sets to identify trends and outliers

item.title: Mobile Application Developer at BrainCheck (Houston, TX)
item.description:
BrainCheck is a funded Digital Health startup developing an innovative platform for tracking cognitive fitness and assessing conditions such as concussion and memory impairment. We sell to schools and athletic teams, industries where it is critical to be alert (e.g. oil & gas, trucking), as well as directly to individuals (especially athletes, parents, and those concerned about aging family members). Our state-of-the art technology is mobile-first (iPad & Android), gamified to appeal to a wide variety of test-takers, and HIPAA compliant.


If you have a passion for neuroscience, big data, big ideas, and building technologies that can make a real difference in people’s lives, this position is for you.


You'll:




  • Add new features to the existing app/backend in an elegant and maintainable manner




  • Think through technical challenges and build clean solutions




  • Maintain the existing application and consult with the team about possible technical issues down the road






  • Deploy on a regular basis (daily/weekly) and iterate quickly






  • Help maintain foundational open source projects

item.title: (Associate) Developer for Healthcare at SAP SE (Potsdam, Germany)
item.description: In this role you will work on various development projects in the healthcare area at the SAP Innovation Center. You will implement features for both the backend and frontend independently, producing high-quality code with good test coverage and documentation. Co-Innovation and user-centered design are among the core development principles at the SAP Innovation Center, so you will work with expert designers to provide a great user experience and interact directly with users and other stakeholders to iterate on your solutions.

item.title: Sr. Software Engineer - Web at Twilio (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Full stack engineers at Twilio are responsible for creating compelling web experiences for all Twilio product-lines, from SMS to IP Communications. The unified Account Portal we’re responsible for supports 500,000+ developers building communications apps on Twilio.


About the job: 


Full stack web developers own everything from the “first run” experience of customers just starting with Twilio to powerful debugging and monitoring tools critical to our largest customers operating at scale. Developers love Twilio because our “developer experience” makes it incredibly easy to build and scale on the most powerful communications API on the planet - full stack web engineering at Twilio is all about building that developer experience.


Responsibilities:



  • Develop and maintain the backbone of our web framework to support all product lines across Twilio.

  • Own your production infrastructure end-to-end. You’ll deploy your own code multiple times a week.

  • Work directly with product management to define, architect, and build new customer-facing features. At Twilio, product roadmaps are a team sport.

  • Write quality, maintainable code with extensive test coverage in a fast-paced professional software engineering environment.

  • Influence cross team initiatives and mentor junior engineers.

item.title: Senior Software Development Eng- Consumer Shopping Engagement at Amazon (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
The Community Shopping team is looking for a creative, deeply technical and hands-on candidate to take community shopping experiences and the underlying technology to the next level. This is a strategic role in an organization and includes ownership of iconic Amazon products including customer reviews and Wish List. As a senior technical individual contributor you will join the ranks of Amazon’s most senior Technical Community You’ll help establish technical standards and drive Community Shopping’s overall technical architecture and engineering practices. You’ll work on our hardest problems, building high quality, architecturally sound systems that are aligned with our business needs. You will help us apply machine learning to many aspects of our business. You will help our teams develop a data services so that many internal technology teams can utilize the treasure trove of information provided by customers in reviews etc.



The ideal candidate is a pragmatic visionary who can translate business needs into workable technology solutions. You will drive decisions on which technologies teams should adopt and when/how to build architectural frameworks leveraged by multiple teams.

 

Basic Qualifications

• Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related technical field

• MINIMUM 8+ years of relevant, broad engineering experience

• Experience leading the delivery of customer facing services and large-scale distributed systems

• Experience leading the delivery of APIs and SDKs



Preferred Qualifications

· Master’s degree or PhD in computer science or related technical field

· Experience leading development life cycle process and best practices

· Experience mentoring/training the engineering community on complex technical issues





Professional traits that are not unique to this position, but are necessary for Amazon impact include:

Obsessed about doing the right thing for the customer

Analytical thinking and ability to translate data into business ideas

Ownership, drive, and bias for action

Using good judgment, has had to make strategic decisions with limited information.

Relentless pursuit of elevating progress

Strong written and oral communication skills

Ability to dive deep, peeling back the onion to understand root cause and implications

item.title: DevOps Engineer at import.io (London, UK)
item.description:
import.io is a young start-up of just over 30 people, looking to shake-up the world of data. From our homebase in London, we’re working hard to give people a totally new way to access the web.


import.io comprises of many different and distributed parts, and we’re looking for someone who will help our complex and challenging systems evolve and grow!



You will be responsible for the overall health and well-being of our mission critical infrastructure. Things that may affect this include:



  • Increases and spike in load due to increase in query numbers, or increases in query complexity.

  • Ever-increasing numbers of pages that are crawled and structured by us for our enterprise data products.

  • Malicious attacks on our infrastructure, or AWS outages.

  • Suitability for architecture and components for scale, e.g. MySQL vs HBase.

  • Ability for systems to survive single or multiple points of failure.

  • Awareness of problems before, or as, they arise by monitoring and alerting of key metrics.

  • Bugs in our software or third party software that manifest as operational issues



Responsibilities would include:



  • Designing and improving distributed self-healing fault-tolerant distributed systems

  • Architecting and implementing changes to better respond to dynamic or projected increases in load or scale, changes of desired latency, or other changing parameters; including designing models, evaluating and choosing new components.

  • Automation and optimization of processes to build, test and roll out system updates, and to advance software through development, testing, staging and production.

  • Designing and implementing safeguards against malicious attacks on our infrastructure.

  • Designing and implementing monitoring, metrics and logging to identify any issues or performance improvements within systems, analysing information and presenting findings along with recommendations; including garbage collection, heap usage, log file analysis, latency, response times, load balancer statistics, database statistics, etc.

  • Blogging about our engineering, as well as communication of operational issues.

  • Emergency out-of-hours operational support

item.title: QA Automation Engineer - Consultant at OnDeck (New York, NY)
item.description:
As a QA automation engineer, you’ll work with development teams to code, test, and deploy quality features for our customers and internal users. Every day you’ll use our extensive end-to-end test automation framework and hands-on testing to support exciting new projects. We also put a heavy emphasis in the QA team on test automation – everything from web automation (using Selenium) to REST API automation to data persistence & validity (in SQL, MongoDB, and Salesforce) to model testing.


When you’re testing a feature for the first time, are you dreaming on how you could automate the process? Are you always looking for a way to use technology to finish a job better and faster? This position will give you challenging opportunities to grow professionally as a QA automation engineer.


As a QA Automation Engineer at OnDeck, you will:



  • Work with development teams on end-to-end testing.

  • Proactively write test automation for new features and existing use cases.

  • Develop and maintain test documentation.

  • Monitor production issue backlog.

  • Work with QA team and development team to maintain and monitor execution of automation testing in development, QA, and staging environments.

item.title: Senior Dev Ops Engineer at Genomics England (London, UK)
item.description: This role is for a senior dev ops engineer, with considerable experience of automating Linux systems. The main responsibilities, of the post holder, will be to aid Genomics England in automating its infrastructure delivery through the use of Salt Stack and other relating tools.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at CreativeLive, Inc. (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
CreativeLive is looking for talented senior engineers to join our growing technical team in our San Francisco or Seattle office. You will be forging a new frontier in learning applications, leveraging and contributing to open source technology.


Our platform is built on Node.js and Angular.js, and the ideal candidate will be excited about applying their strong coding and architecture skills to an end-to-end JavaScript stack. 


Along with your fellow engineers, you'll be working with design and product to continuously improve the CreativeLive site and internal tools by:



  • iterating on prototypes

  • architecting modules and applications

  • refactoring existing parts of the site

  • extending our content management system

  • implementing data visualization dashboards

  • interfacing with (and creating) web services 

  • improving the scalability and fault tolerance of our distributed systems

  • actively contributing to refining our Agile development processes

item.title: Software Engineer at ADP Innovation Lab (New York, NY)
item.description:
We are seeking talented Software Developers with diverse backgrounds, creative expertise, and technical acumen who will offer new perspectives and challenge conventions.


RESPONSIBILITIES




  • Deliver highly automated, intelligent, and predictive solutions for our client offerings

  • Responsible for building out the Core frameworks of the Meta Data Driven Platform being developed in house, including building out the Source Control Management piece that will allow application developers to have their own isolated development environment

  • Deliver innovative solutions to drive next generation user experiences, designs, and technologies

  • Responsible for ensuring the successful transition to a Service Oriented Architecture framework with the help of containers

    • Spearhead POC’s on the latest technologies and help ADP choose the right tool for the right job

item.title: Sr. Web/Mobile Developer; Angular (MD/Remote) at Primotus Division CargoTel, Inc. (Baltimore, MD) (allows remote)
item.description:
Primotus is developing a unique Enterprise scale user-configurable hybrid mobile workflow platform. We’re looking for an experienced JavaScript developer having strong UI architectural skills and expertise in data-driven web and applications. Mobile and Angular experience a plus, but we're happy to get an otherwise qualified candidate up to speed in these two areas. Candidate is expected to have expertise in man of the following areas:


- JavaScript, Angular and/or other JavaScript platforms,


- Bootstrap, HTML5, CSS, Jade, LESS, SASS


- Git (Github), Grunt, Node JS, Websockets


- RESTful and JSON services, 

- JSON document store or NoSQl


If you think you’re a good fit and are interested in building something highly configurable and really innovative, please shoot us an email.

item.title: Dev for Philly! *no remote work!* at Curalate (Philadelphia, PA)
item.description:
Curalate is looking for talented software developers to join our team.  Our engineering team today is deep in the trenches -- tackling some of the gnarliest problems out there at the intersection of computer vision and big data -- and we're looking for a few good coders to join us.


Although experience with our existing technology stack is great, we're much more interested in hiring developers with exceptional problem solving skills, creative out-of-the-box thinking, and comfort with quickly learning, evaluating, and deploying new technologies. While we're not looking for any specific industry experience (we'll hire recent grads), you should come prepared to join a fast-moving team. You'll be expected to dive into our stack and toolkit, and start shipping code on day one. We're not hiring code monkeys; you'll be given substantial feature ownership, and we'll expect you to contribute product ideas as well as code. Above all else, we're looking for others who are as excited above the potential in this space as we are, and who will be willing to join us in moving fast and breaking things as we execute against that vision.

item.title: Software Engineer, Generalist at Connectifier, Inc. (Costa Mesa, CA)
item.description:
Build the next generation employment platforms, and help great companies find great people.


Connectifier is changing the way recruiting is done today. Our engineering team from Google, Microsoft Research, Berkeley National Lab, Carnegie Mellon, and Stanford is building large scale data analysis software that processes professional profiles from all around the web. By analyzing code repos, blogs, and social profiles we're helping recruiters and hiring managers connect more efficiently with the candidates best for their openings.


We are deployed at 25% of the Fortune-100, and our revenue is growing extremely fast. At Connectifier you'll get to work with top growing companies and fantastic brand names and deliver a best in class product.


Example projects


Build a predictive AI model of employee success based on a dataset of millions of people


Build infrastructure for running distributed, restartable tasks on a cluster of machines


Requirements


Bachelors Degree in Computer Science or commensurate work experience


Software engineering work or internship experience


Preferred experience


Application of algorithmic knowledge and intuition to solve complex problems


Experience building software with a statically-typed backend language (Java preferred. C, C++, Scala, etc. are all sufficient)


Knowledge of machine learning, aritifcial intelligence, big data and web technologies are a plus


How to apply and what to expect


Click the apply button below.


Be prepared to answer technical questions and write code to solve very challenging problems during the initial phone interview, a 5 hour on-site (or video chat) interview and on-site coding project.

item.title: Release Engineer at Zillow (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
Our current Zillow release processes and frameworks have supported a weekly Major Release schedule, frequent Hot Fixes, and oversight and management of IT network and infrastructure changes. We need a strong, experienced Release engineer to help build on our successes and help support our growing services and product offerings.  We look to increase release rates and provide more options for product teams and operations teams to get their changes and updates as quickly and as safely as possible, in support of Operational and Business needs. If you are highly motivated, a quick learner and desire to make big contributions, then we encourage you to apply.

  • Keep and maintain release stats and trend data




  • Be able to summarize and evaluate key site metrics and provide guidance and direction for release and follow-on stability




Requirements:

  • A technical degree preferred




  • At least 3 years experience with Unix/Linux system




  • Strong communication skills




  • Self-starter with solid analytical and problem solving skills.




  • Work in a fast paced, business critical areas

item.title: Senior Network Engineer at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:


Bloomberg's R&D Network Design & Information Security (NDIS) group is responsible for the design, architecture, development and security of Bloomberg's internal and client-facing global networks, security, and cloud infrastructures. The Core Network WAN Engineering team is the part of the NDIS Core Networks group that is focused on the architecture, development and escalated support of the global WAN infrastructure.


Bloomberg's private WAN is a sophisticated carrier-grade multi-vendor network that leverages technologies such as MPLS, MPBGP, LDP, RSVP, MVPN, etc. The private WAN currently connects 14,000+ customer sites via 100+ global POP sites using 20,000+ CE network devices and 800+ core network devices.


The Core Network WAN Engineering team is seeking a dynamic, talented and experienced network engineer who thrives on being "in the trenches". The successful candidate must possess extensive programming experience in network automation, provisioning & performance management. The candidate is also expected to possess expert networking knowledge, experience, creativity and capability to work in a complex and fast paced network technology environment. The candidate will work closely with network operation groups to provide technical assistance and guidance. The candidate will also work directly with vendors to drive feature enhancements that are necessary to meet business needs. Ability to drive relevant strategic solutions in a complex environment is highly desirable.

item.title: Software Engineer at Lyst (London, UK)
item.description:
Lyst are looking for software engineers who enjoy writing python to work on the huge technical challenges that come with building the world’s leading fashion commerce site.


As a software engineer you will ensure that the platform continues to over exceed shoppers expectations, helping us to constantly release new features and improve functionality. You will work in a product-led cross-discipline team on everything from helping to choose the best tools and frameworks to working with design and product exciting new features. You will have a huge chance to influence the way code, culture and product are built at Lyst.


At the heart of Lyst is a huge data aggregator that lists millions of fashion products from hundreds of retailers. On top of this we build systems that help people discover and follow their favourite fashion brands, ensuring that all of our users are inspired and happy throughout their shopping experience.


As a software engineer at Lyst some of the thing you will be working on:



  • Building real products that fix real world problems, predominantly in a Python based technology stack.

  • The huge challenges that come from working with a database with over 9 million products and a spider architecture performing 3.8 million updates a day.

  • Exposure to product specific teams fixing problems like; Shopping personalisation, Universal Checkout System, Marketing automation technology, PaaS, Our own Data Analytics platform, a new search function and personalisation etc

  • Fixing the interesting problems we face in the best way possible; we are not constricted to tool sets and languages. If you find a solution to a problem that will work better, we use your idea. Best idea wins.

  • Our universal checkout system that allows our users to find any item of clothing from any retailer on our platform, in stock, in their size and ready to buy.

  • Our internal and external REST API’s

  • Creating a development platform, tools and pipeline that is effective and easy to iterate with.

  • Building your own brand and skills. Lyst is a company that will encourage and support you to get involved in the wider community. Events like FOSDEM, PyCon, JS London are regular occurrences on our calendar.

  • Creating better solutions for everything we do, from our culture to the code. This is your company, own it.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Craneware (Edinburgh, UK)
item.description:
Craneware is creating a new dynamic platform for its suite of healthcare applications. The new platform will run in the cloud and provide a very rich application environment. We are aiming to be on the cutting edge of web applications. Use of novel techniques to handle large data sets as well as utilising the latest in UI design to bring our applications to our users through a number of different devices including mobile. As part of the development team, you will be responsible for creating this platform as well as building a set of rich applications within it.


We develop our solutions within a SCRUM process. We use C# to build micro services, HTML5, CSS, AngularJS and JavaScript to provide a rich UI. The platform is based on the Microsoft Azure cloud platform utilising their scalable architecture for SQL as well as the new DocumentDB JSON database.


If you have any skills in these technologies and want to join a team of dedicated passionate developers then this is for you.

item.title: Sr. Software Engineer, Automation at Rapid7 (El Segundo, CA)
item.description:
Rapid7 is looking for a Software Development Engineer in Test to join the engineering team in our offices in El Segundo, CA. This team is focused on expanding Rapid7’s existing products and creating new product lines. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of shipping enterprise-class software to a large installed customer base.


Candidates must be able to quickly ramp up, learn our product suite and immediately set to transforming product stories into a functional test suite developed in Cucumber, specifically identifying key high risk quality targets. Prior experience in the security, networking and/or data analytics space is a plus. Candidates must have the ability to quickly grasp Rapid7’s current product designs, become proficient with Rapid7’s products, and become knowledgeable in company tools and technologies. This is an extremely hands-on, technical role. 


Using our current suite of framework tools, along with introducing appropriate new solutions to creatively build a world class verification automation framework, we expect out-of-the-box thinking from candidates as with all engineers. This SDET is a key member of the core Engineering team and will be responsible for creating a reliable, scalable test toolset approach for assigned product coverage, as well as contributing to the improvement of our release framework. The ideal candidate has a solid track record of day-to-day test automation framework development in Ruby or similar and contributing on verification strategy and risk mitigation improvements.


The Software Engineer is a key member of the CORE Engineering team and will be responsible for creating a reliable, scalable tools and test framework to help maintain and ensure stability and quality of our product.


We are an agile company with weekly(!) product releases. Great environment and attitude. As part of a scrum team you will be interacting with PM/Support/Customers to help us build the right things for our customers.


Responsibilities:



  • Enable the team to meet release based and SLA-bound release requirements

  • Test Extend and improve upon existing framework automation

  • Design, develop and refine Cucumber automation classes and code strategy for the automation framework

  • Analyze epics being developed and create succinct tools coverage as well as identify the areas for regression coverage

  • Develop reusable automated regression verification frameworks to improve test framework scope

  • Work to document, analyze and investigate issues found during test execution and present findings to help provide solutions

  • Work with all key groups to insure functional and non-functional requirements are tracked and converted into test components for continuous automation coverage

  • Drive towards delivery of those commitments throughout the iteration and raise risks early

  • Identify the risks and appropriate testing to validate coverage, and develop test plans and test cases

  • Be open to learning new technologies and new problem domains.

item.title: Senior Cloud Development Engineer (RESTful web services, Azure, Amazon AWS) at AppSense (Halton, UK)
item.description:
