You will know how to build a site from scratch, apply best practices for providing multi-lingual support, incorporate theme / skin support, obey good design standards (i.e. making use of templates to prevent duplicate work, diligently make use of style-sheets and so on) and work to current accepted web standards. You will also have experience of website/application setup and deployment.

item.title: Back End Developer at SMTP, Inc. (Gainesville, FL)
item.description:
SharpSpring is looking for an experienced, and innovative Back End Developer to join our team in Gainesville, FL. If you are interested in joining a growing, dynamic and successful Tech company where your work makes a significant impact on the entire organization, then we want to talk to you!

The Company

SharpSpring is a cloud-based marketing automation provider offering a next-generation marketing automation solution rivaling the industries top platforms in terms of features, functionality and performance. SharpSpring is one of the most flexible platforms on the market, offering native or 3rd party CRM integration, fully integrated call tracking, universal CMS compatibility, in addition to integration with hundreds of applications. With SharpSpring, see every lead that comes in, whether by phone or form, and compare all data side by side to get a full picture of end-to-end ROI. SharpSpring is usually less than 1/3 the cost of other competitors, yet powerful enough to be trusted by hundreds of agencies and thousands of businesses around the world. In 2014, SharpSpring was acquired by SMTP, Inc - a publicly traded company on the NASDAQ (SMTP).

The Opportunity

The Back End Developer will work in a dynamic, fast-paced environment using the latest open source technologies for software development. You will work with our experienced Development, Design and QA teams to produce and maintain the highest quality of software products. You will be part of a team that is changing the face of an industry and producing an application that is used by thousands of clients. This position allows you a huge complex product to work on where you can take ownership of your back end kingdom!

The Responsibilities

  • 2+ years experience as a Back End Developer (working with Java, C#, PHP, Python)
  • Working on complex data problems
  • Design, development, and maintenance of code
  • Experience with Big Data (Hadoop exp . a plus)
  • API development and Feature Development
  • Writing code and running appropriate diagnostic tests to proactively solve potential issues
  • Identify and solve problems creatively and efficiently
  • Design, communicate, and implement solutions effectively
  • Test orientated development

The Person

  • 2-5 years of experience as a Back End Developer
  • Effective communication, decision-making, and problem solving skills
  • Professional development experience, either through a full-time job, internship or personal projects
  • Solid understanding of back end technologies
  • Familiarity with responsive web design techniques
  • Experience building and or designing web applications
  • Familiarity with PHP
  • Experience with Backbone, Ember . js and/or AMD

The SharpSpring Culture and Perks

As a team, we want to differentiate ourselves by hard work, disciplined execution, friendly service, a commitment to solving our customers' problems, and to demonstrate that we can accomplish more than others with a fraction of their resources.

Our company culture is based on the belief that our people are our #1 asset:

  • We empower you to make decisions and get things done without all of the bureaucracy!
  • We ensure communication across the organization, including actively soliciting your feedback
  • We are committed to our team's personal development at all levels of the organization
  • We offer competitive salaries and company bonus programs
  • We offer health and dental insurance for full-time employees
  • We offer a paid holidays and PTO to our full-time employees
  • We strive to reward team members who operate as "business owners" with stock option grants in our firm, creating a strong team-oriented dynamic across the entire company

About SMTP, Inc.

SMTP is a NASDAQ-listed provider of email services that is growing rapidly on a global basis. The company's easy-to-use and highly affordable SharpSpring marketing automation platform is empowering the next generation digital marketers with tools once reserved for large enterprises. The company's long history as one of the early pioneers of SMTP delivery services provides a solid backbone for the company's growth, which will be supported by its global operations. Its recent acquisition of GraphicMail provides a global footprint and both email and mobile functionality for a wide range of business users. Its profitable operation and access to the public markets for capital positions it well for both organic growth and synergistic acquisitions. Learn more about us and our subsidiaries at: www.smtp.com

item.title: Senior Full Stack Engineer at Triggr Health (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
What does this role entail? You’ll be responsible for defining, building, and supporting a platform that reaches people when they are most at-risk and empowers them through the extraordinarily challenging recovery journey. It is an incredibly exciting role as you will be working with cutting-edge technology on a number of products that span: consumer and enterprise; mobile and desktop; external and internal; user-driven and automated; and practical and academic areas. The challenges you will face are new and exciting and will require you to think holistically about how the platform interacts with an incredibly diverse set of stakeholders.


More specifically, we are building apps on both Android and iOS, a customer-facing web application, a robust web services API, machine learning-driven analytics, and large-scale data processing. As a full-stack engineer, you must be hyper-focused on how the product impacts every patient, provider, and team member.


You will need to understand when trade-offs are necessary: we are growing very quickly, but quality is of critical importance given our mission. You will continuously iterate on our products in order to improve the long-term outcomes of the patients in our program. You will also be integral to forming and developing our culture in addition to helping hire all-star teammates to make Triggr Health an awesome place to work! Most importantly, you must have a strong desire to be a part of a mission-driven company and believe that with the right team, technology, and values, anything is possible.


This position requires someone who understands and embraces the fact that the “user” is a real person with a severe health condition. The work we are doing is incredibly exciting because the impact we can have is massive, but it also requires extra care and increased responsibility to ensure every decision we make reflects this understanding.

item.title: Full Stack JavaScript Developer at New Visions for Public Schools (New York, NY)
item.description:
New Visions for Public Schools is looking for a Full Stack Developer to join our CloudLab Team, whose role will be to provide technical leadership around the analysis, design,development, testing, implementation and  integration of secure REST APIs and service-oriented web applications in both client and server-side Javascript frameworks (Angular JS, Node JS, Hapi) with backends in both MongoDb and Postgres.  The New Visions CloudLab Team designs, builds and maintains web applications that respond to educator needs and supports school leaders in effectively integrating data and technology. This team’s work is integral to New Visions’ direct support to nearly 200 public NYC high  schools in modernizing their tech  infrastructure to improve the responsiveness and quality of operations, instruction and student support. The problems we are solving are challenging and interesting and affect urban schools everywhere.  We are looking for an engineer excited about public service and the prospect of joining a fun and growing team in an open and transparent, collaborative, supportive, and diverse environment. 


Essential Job Functions



  • Leadership, Vision, and Communication

  • Help lead the New Visions CloudLab in its evolution from a leading non-profit edtech laboratory to a software development operation that employs smart practices and technologies to create scalable solutions for schools around the world.

  • Play a visionary role in the design and communication of a software architecture that will leverage modern Javascript frameworks to allow the optimum blend of flexibility, security, and scale.

  • Play a leadership role on a team of four engineers in adopting continuous integration and test driven development techniques and best practices to improve the stability of both our existing and future tools.

  • Provide ongoing guidance as we explore and wrestle with the inevitable trade-offs between  scalability vs. flexibility, complexity vs. user capacity, utilities vs. out of the box solutions, etc.

  • Play, teach, and learn with us in search of the most agile and sustainable ways to organize the fun that is our work.


Software Design and Development



  • Work directly with the School Tools and Systems Development team on discovery, specification, implementation, user-feedback, and iteration of applications that gain adoption and improve schools by winning hearts and minds.

  • Collaborate with relevant New Visions staff within iterative design cycles that are coupled to data coaching and school-facing relationships that ground product development in the careful qualitative appraisal and optimization of user-experience, as well as rigorous analysis of resultant usage analytics and student performance data.

  • Develop secure REST APIs and service-oriented applications in both client and server-side Javascript frameworks (Angular JS, Node JS, Hapi) with backends in both MongoDb and Postgres

item.title: Software Engineer II at Lumeris Austin Texas (Austin, TX)
item.description:
Join Our Growing Team!


Lumeris™ provides the information technology, guidance, and operational services necessary for hospitals and health plans to transform their organizations into high-performing accountable delivery systems.


Our revolutionary technology platform for accountable care integrates data from disparate systems across the continuum of care, provides complete visibility into the clinical and financial performance of the enterprise, and delivers applications and information to key stakeholders at the point of thought. Lumeris also provides health care consulting and professional services that help organizations establish the necessary clinical and business processes, methodologies, and operational capacity to create their own successful accountable health care delivery systems.


The depth and breadth of our solutions — combined with the company’s extensive real-world experience in accountable care — make Lumeris the ideal partner for any health care organization seeking the significant benefits of a better connected, aligned, and informed accountable delivery system.


Lumeris is privately owned by Essence Group Holdings Corporation (EGHC) and backed by investors including Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers, Camden Partners, and Sandbox Industries.


Why Join Lumeris?


At Lumeris you will be part of team that is focused on solving a national healthcare problem.  And you will have the ability to contribute while working for a purpose. Our environment is fast-paced and change oriented and is focused on growth and employee engagement.  At Lumeris we believe talent is utilized best when given the opportunity to succeed.  That is why we have removed the boundaries that inhibit success and focus on fostering an environment that allows employees to utilize their talents.



  • Responsible for designing and developing the rich presentation layer based on technologies such as HTML5, JavaScript, CSS3, MVC, and ASP.NET

  • Responsible for designing, developing, and consuming Open API’s using REST and OAUTH 2

  • Responsible for designing and developing the middleware tier using C# and Microsoft .NET Framework

  • Responsible for designing and developing the data access layer that interfaces with RDBMS such as Microsoft SQL Server and no-SQL databases like MongoDB and Hadoop

  • The candidate will participate in all phases of the software development lifecycle from requirements gathering and design to coding and testing

  • Work with cross functional team members - such as Development Leads, Architects, Quality Engineers and DBAs - in a highly collaborative development environment

  • Work directly with partners on the integration of outside solutions into Lumeris’ application frameworks

  • Identify and implement industry best practices for software development; be able to introduce and train peer groups on these practices

  • Lead the way by developing company standards for software development

  • Work with and lead, at a project level, the local and offshore staff responsible for the research and development efforts

  • Continually build the skills of colleagues through mentoring and training

item.title: Software Developer Perl (m/f) at the "Start-up of the year 2015" at SavingGlobal GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description: You develop customizations of the ticketing system OTRS and other Perl applications including testing and bug fixing. Moreover you are participating in data base development in SQL. As a developer you actively participate in an agile development process („Scrum“).

item.title: DevOps Engineer at Namely (New York, NY)
item.description:
Do you live and breathe availability, reliability and operability?  Does the opportunity to improve application deployments, infrastructure automation and monitoring solutions sound like your kind of challenge?  Can you balance system uptime and operational standards with organizational agility and speed?


Namely is looking for a skilled DevOps Engineer to contribute ideas, innovation, solutions and code to our product.

item.title: Android Developer at PicMonkey (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
We got our eyes peeled for an Android engineer who wants to work here in the Emerald City on our app. Creating a flawless next-generation Android experience will make us happy, make you happy, and most importantly make our users happy.



We can’t wait to hear from you. You gotta be:



Hella experienced with Android distributions on consumer electronics products


Excited about innovating new products


Skilled at proactive outward communication and technical leadership


Fearless of new challenges


Out of this world at data analysis and debugging

item.title: Software Engineer, Python - really strong team, big scale (30+ servers) at Growbots (Warsaw, Poland)
item.description:
Growbots Inc. – a Warsaw startup made with enthusiasm. We’re a part of 500 Startups – one of the best accelerators in the US. At Growbots we’re building A.I. for sales with the ultimate goal of automating the entire sales development process. The things we believe in are automation and the infinite power of machine learning, which has to change the world of sales and we are eager to speed this up!


Currently we have development team responsible for the system. Our plan for next step is to divide responsibilities for 2-3 development teams, including R&D team, which will be responsible for creating proof of concepts of new features, testing new algorithms on our data and generally improve effectiveness using broadly defined machine learning techniques.


Your role


We are looking for a talented Software Engineer with strong skills to join our Dev Team. You will be responsible for creating and improving backend part of our product. Your role includes planning, designing, coding, testing, deploying, code-reviewing, debugging, etc. - but not in boring way - you will have real influence on the shape of the developed solutions. You will be part of great Team, working with other nice, experienced programmers who are ready to help. We expect that you will bring also great value to our company - experience, skills, proactivity.

item.title: Python Engineer at Mirantis, Inc. (Pozna, Polska)
item.description:
If you’re an ambitious Python Software Engineer and thrive on working on tough, real-world problems, you want to work here. We are building a data center management product (FUEL) which can become the standard choice of a simple but powerful OpenStack deployment tool. We want you to bring ideas of how it should look and implement it. With the tool presently used to deploy OpenStack at the moment, we have an ambitious roadmap which includes live upgrades, network devices management, SDN devices integration and many more.

This is a permanent position in Mirantis' office in Poznan, Poland.

Ask us about great benefits, swag bags, compensation and more!

item.title: ROM Engineering Manager at OnePlus (Shenzhen, China)
item.description:
• Grow and build a world class engineering team to evolve OxygenOS as the core software product

  • Drive engineering innovation and foster a culture that encourages new ideas and experiments but is ultimately result and impact driven

  • Work with product and marketing to align engineering strategy with the business goals of the company

  • Build 3rd party relationships to create a network of engineering partners and supporters

  • Manage the day to day execution of the engineering team along with the tech lead

item.title: iOS Developer (Swift/Objective-C) - permanent/freelance at Creasoft AG (Mauren, Liechtenstein) (allows remote)
item.description:
Key Responsibilities:



  • Development of new iOS App (iPhone / iPad)

  • Maintainance and development of new features for existing apps

  • Conversion of existing apps to Swift

  • Development of solution concepts for complex problems

  • Support and documentation of  developed apps

  • Evaluation of new technologies


We offer:



  • team-oriented workplace

  • flexible timetables

  • pleasant working atmosphere

  • interesting fields of work

item.title: Web Developer for a Meaningful Mission at KLAS Enterprises (Orem, UT)
item.description:
We are a market research firm dedicated to improving healthcare by providing transparency around healthcare technology performance. Our web developers create internal and external web applications that help us do this. We are passionate about our mission and seek coding professionals who are just as passionate, and want their work to have meaning.


We want a great team player and a great developer. We seek a sharp individual with a strong internal drive and an insatiable curiosity to learn.


Qualifications:



  • Strong HTML, CSS, jQuery, Javascript

  • Hunger for knowledge

  • A pleasure to work with

  • Computer Science degree, or current enrollment to achieve such


Note: we currently code in ASP.


Great pay. Full benefits, including 401K, health, dental, life, vision, HSA, PTO, paid vacation, a casual, caring working environment with a meaningful mission.


EOE


Local candidates preferred


Resumes must be accompanied by a cover letter.  Apply at http://www.klasresearch.com/about-us/careers

item.title: Senior .Net Software Engineer at Utilant, LLC (Buffalo, NY)
item.description: Development is our product.  The developers at Utilant like using the state of the art technology available here.  They are responsible for building, testing, debugging and troubleshooting software programs for database, applications, tools, networks to support business initiatives and customer needs.  Working in an Agile/Scrum environment, candidates will implement and maintain business applications using the skills listed.

item.title: Senior Node.js Developer at Vertisense (Albany, NY)
item.description:
Reporting to the Director of Product Software, you will develop, test, debug, document, and implement Node.js applications utilizing a MongoDB database. We are a small team so flexibility is essential. This is a unique opportunity to enter an established startup at the ground floor while leveraging off an already market successful consumer retail product into a new and fresh market space.


The Role:
• Develop, test, debug, document, and implement Node.js applications
• Create high quality prototypes
• Utilize and contribute to best practices
• Maximize code reuse

item.title: Senior SQL Server Developer at Aperia Solutions (Dallas, TX)
item.description: Join Aperia Solutions, a leader in data management and business intelligence processing. Aperia has been providing business intelligence solutions for more than a decade. The company's management has extensive experience in finance, business consulting, rapid growth and governance as well as business intelligence, the company's core function.

item.title: Web Application Developer - Berlin Nightlife Startup 55k at Abend AG (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description: Abend.net is a small Berlin based startup in the Nightlife area. Last year we started Abend.net as a service for event advertisement which exceeded expectations and continues to be our main business. Now we are building an app for event discovery based on the data we use to target event advertisement. Abend.net is a young team working in the heart of Kreuzberg in an innovative interesting market. Since our team is still small, you will be able to make your own decisions and build and grow the product with us together.

item.title: Salesforce Administrator/Developer at Graphic Products (Beaverton, OR)
item.description: Graphic Products is seeking a Salesforce Administrator/Developer to join our Team.

item.title: Mobile Application Developer (Android) at Google (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Mobile Application Developers have a penchant for solving complex and interesting problems. Pushing the boundaries of current mobile platforms, you will perform technological feats under constrained environments and will be presented with exciting challenges in native or mobile application development. Our Mobile Application Developers work on many projects that carry varying responsibilities. As an Android Developer, you will develop applications primarily in Java and using the Android SDK. You might design and develop open-source Android applications that are part of the Android Open Source Project or closed-source Google applications that are the interface to Google services on Android.



Responsibilities


  • Develop Android mobile applications in Java.

item.title: Seeking Java Engineers to Make Healthcare Smarter at Audacious Inquiry (Catonsville, MD)
item.description:
Join Ai and become part of a team developing applications that are changing healthcare across the country.  Seriously!  Our engineers design and develop solutions that improve healthcare outcomes and enable healthcare professionals to do their jobs more efficiently and effectively.  If you are looking for a career with room for advancement and professional growth, in a fun and collaborative environment, that also makes a difference to your community, look no further.

JOB DUTIES



  • Support the development of health data exchange infrastructure 

  • Design and develop innovative solutions that solve tough challenges in the industry

  • Maintain high quality of work products

  • Communicate effectively with business partners and clients when needed

item.title: Polyglot / Artisan Engineer at LShift Ltd (London, UK)
item.description:
Fantastic opportunities available for skilled Software Engineers to join LShift in our London Office. Be a part of the most interesting technical team around!


Our outlook is moulded around the principle of recruiting only candidates who combine breadth and depth of outlook and experience. We do not recruit people to slot into a particular technical role, but all-rounders familiar with a broad range of operating environments, programming languages, etc., combined with a high level of software engineering expertise.

item.title: C++ Experienced Software Developer at think-cell Software GmbH (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
We are looking for smart, creative developers with a solid theoretical background. You should be able to look at a problem from the user's perspective, discuss abstract concepts with fellow developers, as well as produce an elegant implementation. Developers we have hired in the past mostly hold an exceptional master's degree in computer science or even a doctorate.


At think-cell, we like flat hierarchies. You will work largely independently and will be responsible for the whole range of activities when implementing a new feature. We expect each of our developers to do architecture, design, implementation, customer feedback and bug fixing,  rather than splitting these activities between several people. We thus minimize communication losses and put everyone in control of their own work. Your ideas are welcome, even if they mean that we have to change a lot of code to make things better.


We have published several scientific articles in the areas of Artificial Intelligence and Computer Graphics and we will encourage you to do the same. We sponsor visits to conferences and have close connections to universities and research institutes in the U.S. and Germany.


think-cell encourages a healthy work-life balance. We do not work at night or on weekends, and support our staff's families with a full-time company nanny. She is available for free when children are sick, or if you just feel like spending an evening out.


We pay very competitive salaries, and offer our developers EUR 120,000 annually following one year of employment. If necessary, we will go out of our way to help you relocate to Berlin, and will do what we can to help you acquire a work permit.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Autoloop (Clearwater, FL) (allows remote)
item.description:
Work from home for a fun, successful, profitable company!


We are looking for .NET software engineers to join our team and help us serve our continuously growing customer base. 


We give our engineers interesting projects to work on, lots of autonomy to make good coding decisions, and we try to keep meetings to an absolute minimum.


This is a telecommute position (unless you live in the Tampa Bay area), so you will be interacting with the team using IM, email, phone and video chat. 


We are only considering senior level candidates who are self-motivated and can be productive without someone standing over their shoulder.

item.title: Software Engineer, Firmware at Cisco Meraki (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
The firmware team (wireless and switching & appliance) develops the software that runs on our networking gear. We focus on simplicity over bell and whistles, and leverage data from thousands of networks around the world to continuously improve the performance and stability of our products.


Because our devices are managed from the cloud, customers are able to deploy firmware upgrades to their networks with just a few clicks. This means that we can develop new features, iterate on existing features, and fix bugs far more quickly than most of our competitors.


Example projects and tasks for the firmware team include:



  • Implementing a scalable, distributed wireless roaming feature to seamlessly hand off client connections between access points in large campus deployments.

  • Developing fast and accurate deep packet inspection features so network administrators can see what applications are being used on their network and use that to inform decisions about network policies.

  • Implementing controlled delay queuing to help counteract "buffer bloat".

  • Analyzing data collected from thousands of networks to improve channel selection, airtime fairness, and bit-rate selection for wireless clients.

  • Implementing dynamic routing protocols such as OSPF with enough flexibility to support our customers' use cases while keeping the configuration interface easy to understand.

  • Implementing VRRP-based high-availability features so our appliances and switches can be deployed in redundant pairs.

  • Virtualizing our security appliance firmware, and then building out a testbed of thousands of virtual appliances (each with simulated clients behind them) for scale testing our products.

item.title: OCaml server-side developer at Ahrefs Research (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Ahrefs Research is looking for backend developer with deep understanding of operating systems, networks and taste for simple and efficient architectural designs. Our backend is implemented mostly in OCaml and some C++, as such proficiency in OCaml is very much appreciated, otherwise a strong inclination to intensively learn OCaml in a short term will be required. Understanding of functional programming in general and/or experience with other FP languages (F#,Haskell,Scala,Scheme,etc) will help a lot. Knowledge of C++ is a plus.



The ideal candidate is expected to:



  • Independently deal with and investigate bugs, schedule tasks and dig code

  • Make argumented technical choice and take responsibility for it

  • Understand the whole technology stack at all levels : from network and userspace code to OS internals and hardware

  • Handle full development cycle of a single component, i.e. formalize task, write code and tests, setup and support production (devops)

  • Approach problems with practical mindset and suppress perfectionism when time is a priority


These requirements stem naturally from our approach to development with fast feedback cycle, highly-focused personal areas of responsibility and strong tendency to vertical component splitting.

item.title: DevOps Engineer - Computer Vision Startup NYC (Series B) at Curalate (New York, NY)
item.description:
Curalate is looking for talented DevOps engineers to join our team.  Our technical team is deep in the trenches -- tackling some of the gnarliest problems out there at the intersection of computer vision and big data -- and we're looking for a few good DevOps engineers to build and scale our infrastructure to make it all possible.


Responsibilities:


You'll be expected to dive into our stack and toolkit, and start shipping code on day one. We're not hiring code monkeys; you'll be given substantial ownership, and we'll expect you to contribute ideas as well as code. Specific responsibilities include:



  • Continuously monitor and improve our infrastructure for performance, stability, scalability, and security

  • Develop and improve the build and deployment pipeline

  • Plan service capacity

  • Develop and test disaster recovery scenarios

  • Assist with infrastructure planning and implementation

  • Implement security best practices, from OS-level patches to organizational methods

item.title: Assistant Vice President, Application Developer Consultant, at State Street (Boston, MA)
item.description:
This role is part of/in support of the Office of Regulatory Initiatives (ORI); ORI was created to manage complex enterprise risk issues, often spanning multiple functions and businesses. ORI is focused on the areas of Capital Planning and Stress Testing; AML; Liquidity; Credit Risk Management; Legal and Compliance Reputational Risk Management; Interest Rate Risk, Volcker Rule, IT.

This position is for a Senior Developer working on multiple Risk and Regulatory related initiatives. The position requires a strong background in application development, a good understanding of leading IT technologies in particular J2EE, RDBMS and Web Development. The person in this role will be completely hands-on and will work with cross-functional teams. The work will require a candidate to be competent in all aspects of the software development lifecycle. 

The candidate must be able to work independently with moderate input from his/her manager. The candidate must be able to multi-task in a faced paced environment while producing detailed and accurate output. The candidate must be energetic, eager to learn and embrace change.

item.title: API/Backend Developer - Mobile Apps at Avvo, Inc. (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
We’re looking for great software developers to help us connect people with the legal help they need.


As an API / Backend Developer, you’ll build fast, easy-to-use APIs to help our Mobile team ship remarkable apps. You’ll bridge between our iOS, web, and platform teams, and help us unlock new ways to bring our data to other apps and devices.


About the Team:



  • We mostly run on Rails, but have brought in technologies like Go, Angular.js, Scala, and Sinatra. We’re open to using the right technologies for what we build.

  • We iterate quickly, and ship multiple times a day.

  • We work in small teams with product managers and designers, and help shape the products we’ll be building from day 1.

  • We have a strong tradition of supporting open source. Projects like resque_scheduler, robut, resque_unit, and jsonapiclient were all extracted from our codebase, and we’ve contributed several patches back to Rails.


Why Avvo?


Right now, you have an opportunity to join the team while it’s still on the small side, and grow your career faster than you would at almost any other company. You’ll be able to help shape our dev organization and define our culture.


Companies in our position are rare, and joining a company like ours will be one of the most memorable parts of your life.

item.title: Infrastructure Architect at Exaptive (Oklahoma City, OK)
item.description:
Exaptive, Inc is an MIT affiliated, fast-growing software startup that has offices in Oklahoma City, Boston and Vancouver, Canada. We are now expanding our Oklahoma City team. 

We are looking for an infrastructure architect that has experience designing complex web-application architectures, is familiar with a wide variety of technologies, and knows how to pick the right technology for the job. Exaptive is more than just a data analytics platform. It's a complete ecosystem for data science - that means it is comprised of a bunch of different pieces that all have to work together. There is the web-based development environment, the Xap Store, and the Cognitive Network. Each component introduces its own set of infrastructure requirements. In addition, we have a consulting branch of the business which sometimes needs infrastructure design decisions in response to unique custom client requirements. 

This position will be based in downtown OKC, but with the opportunity for travel to Exaptive's Boston and Vancouver locations. The position will have the opportunity to evolve into a role in which the person has an equity-stake in the company. The right person will be excited about the dynamic and fast-paced (aka stressful) environment of a startup and view that as a benefit, not a drawback. The startup environment is not for everyone, but for the person who is looking for that sort of life experience, the opportunity to help build something from the ground up where individual contributions make immediate and substantial impacts on the company as a whole can be extremely rewarding. 

Those interested can find out more about the company, and view some demo videos of our software in actionon our website: www.exaptive.com. We were featured on the front page of the Business Innovation section of The Boston Globe (http://www.boston.com/business/technology/innoeco/2013/12/cambridge-based_exaptive_wants.html) and in Oklahoma City's The Journal Record (http://www.i2e.org/news/innovators-exaptive-inc/). Our Founder and CEO, Dave King, has been invited internationally to present our work. You can see a video of a presentation he recently gave to the Oklahoma Venture Forum about Exaptive's big-picture vision on our website. 

If you don't currently live in Oklahoma City, you should check out what this up-and-coming city has to offer: a burgeoning tech startup and creative sector, the largest food truck event in the nation, olympic rowing facilities, and a cost of living that can't be beat. For the right candidate we'll pay relocation costs.

item.title: Sr. Site Reliability Engineer at TubeMogul (Emeryville, CA)
item.description:
We are seeking a Senior Site Reliability Engineer to help with the building and operation of our Real Time Analytics Platform. The operations team leverages some of the most cutting edge technology to simplify an otherwise complex environment.

Candidates should have a passion for building infrastructure for high-performance, "Big Data" systems. In this role, you will leverage open-source tools like Zookeeper, Hadoop, HBase, Hive, and Couchbase.  Candidates will at least be familiar with the technologies we are using but may not have had the opportunity to acquire deep experience in previous job settings. However, you should have a true passion for systems engineering that is apparent in your past work.


Responsibilities:



  • Build tools to ease provisioning and scaling of TubeMogul Analytics infrastructure

  • Monitor and improve service performance and stability

  • Continuously extend and improve infrastructure components to handle growth

  • Investigate failures and offer suggestions for future improvement

  • Work closely with development teams to ensure that platforms are designed with "operability" in mind

  • Assist our software engineering team to ensure proper monitoring and metrics are being built into the applications before going to production

item.title: Software Engineer in Test at Spanning by EMC (Austin, TX)
item.description:
Our collaborative and iterative development approach has us testing all the time to avoid the last minute crunch. In order to do this we use lots of tools and test data to ensure that we can efficiently do functional, regression, and integration testing as part of the daily development process. The full team is involved in testing, but we need a mastermind to coordinate this effort for each engineering project that is running, playing a material development role on each project.  


This is a core engineering position where you will write production code. You are also responsible for ensuring that each feature can be built, tested, and deployed (along with our DevOps team) in a reliable and repeatable manner.  


Automation is a key part of this effort, but we also know that we need to be smart about what we test, when we test, and how we test. Very often the best results come from a well-informed user doing something "clever" with our app. We are looking for engineers that share these ideals and can help us take our test and development technology to the next level.

item.title: AngularJS Front End Developer at Essence (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Company:



Essence is a global digital agency and the world’s largest independent buyer of digital media. We blend data science, objective media and captivating experiences to build valuable connections between brands and consumers. Clients include Google, HP, Method, and Barclays. The agency is more than 480 people strong, manages over $700MM in media spend and deploys campaigns in 71 markets via offices in London, New York, San Francisco, Seattle, Singapore and Tokyo. Visit essencedigital.com for more information, and follow us on Twitter at @essencedigital.



The Role:



Essence is looking for an experienced Javascript developer to work on our flagship product Olive, which in its current incarnation processes over $500MM in media spend a year. You would be joining a tight knit development team of developers, QA automation and a product manager to solve complex technical problems while building and maintaining our key software applications.



Some of the things we'd like you to do:




  • Write clean, well-designed and reusable Javascript

  • Write code that scales well and is easily maintainable by other developers

  • Lead efforts to optimize app performance and remove bottlenecks and memory leaks

item.title: Lead Android Developer (f/m) at DaWanda GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Your Responsibilities:



  • Build up and lead a team of Android Developers

  • Developing Apps for Android phones by collaborating with product managers, designers and user experience teams

  • Specification of Restful APIs to connect our Apps with our backend (Ruby)

  • Write High Quality Code by Unit-, System- & Integrationtesting

  • Help driving the architecture and technology choices that enable a world-class user experience

  • Utilize various tools or frameworks to deliver rapid iterations of software features

  • Raise the bar on quality, consistency, maintainability, efficiency and all the other things that make great Apps great

  • Help define engineering best practices and provide technical mentorship to your team

item.title: Software Engineering Manager at Amazon (Dallas, TX)
item.description:
Why are Software Engineers important at Amazon?



At Amazon, we hire the best minds in technology to innovate and build for the benefit of our customers. That intense focus on customers is why we are one of the world’s most beloved brands – it’s part of our company DNA.



Our challenges are big - impacting millions of Consumers, Sellers, Content Creators, and Developers & Enterprises through countless products – and we are searching for a certain kind of person who is excited by the idea of owning; people who like to build new platforms, features and services from scratch, developers who can manage the ambiguity and pace of a company whose ship cycles are measured in weeks, not years.

We speak multiple languages, working on multiple platforms to solve immensely complex challenges in large-scale computing by using your skills in data structures, algorithms, and object oriented programming. We have a variety of teams to choose from; our opportunities are broader than you might think. You could find yourself working on a small development team in one of our many organizations: Advertising, Amazon Customer Service, Amazon Web Services, Business & Corporate Development, Digital Entertainment, eCommerce Platform, Fulfillment and Operations, Global Corporate Teams, Amazon Devices, Retail, Search and Discovery Technology, Seller Services, or Amazon Subsidiaries.
Amazon is a place where builders build.



What are examples of work that Software Engineers are doing at Amazon?

· Powered companies from Netflix to NASA: Amazon Web Services has provided companies of all sizes with an infrastructure platform in the cloud that powers hundreds of thousands of businesses in 190 countries around the world. Here at AWS, you’ll experience unparalleled ownership and impact on our product development, and be empowered to innovate and deliver.



· Built the Amazon Devices experience: We have gone beyond Kindle, our best-selling e-reader to our powerhouse Fire tablets, built for work and play with our Fire OS operating system. For streaming media lovers, we have created Amazon Fire TV and Fire TV Stick with voice search, massive video selection, and gaming. Exploring new solutions with products such as Amazon Echo, a new category of device designed around your voice with far-field voice recognition, and Amazon Dash, a handheld scanner to help you order groceries from Amazon Fresh.



· We help users find what they want: Amazon Search and Discovery helps hundreds of millions of shoppers spending tens of billions of dollars annually find what they want, get what they need, and discover what they'll love. We are innovators who love to experiment and are obsessed with letting customers tell us what works. We are obsessed with automation, and leverage technologies and massive amounts of data and machine learning to delight our customers. Work on Prime Air, Prime Now, or other customer solutions to help us define the future.

· We help users find what they want: Amazon Search and Discovery helps hundreds of millions of shoppers spending tens of billions of dollars annually find what they want, get what they need, and discover what they'll love. We are innovators who love to experiment and are obsessed with letting customers tell us what works. We are obsessed with automation, and leverage technologies and massive amounts of data and machine learning to delight our customers. Work on Prime Air, Prime Now, or other customer solutions to help us define the future.

item.title: Software Engineer at Amazon (Dallas, TX)
item.description:
Why are Software Engineers important at Amazon?
At Amazon, we hire the best minds in technology to innovate and build for the benefit of our customers. That intense focus on customers is why we are one of the world’s most beloved brands – it’s part of our company DNA.

Our challenges are big - impacting millions of Consumers, Sellers, Content Creators, and Developers & Enterprises through countless products – and we are searching for a certain kind of person who is excited by the idea of owning; people who like to build new platforms, features and services from scratch, developers who can manage the ambiguity and pace of a company whose ship cycles are measured in weeks, not years.

We speak multiple languages, working on multiple platforms to solve immensely complex challenges in large-scale computing by using your skills in data structures, algorithms, and object oriented programming. We have a variety of teams to choose from; our opportunities are broader than you might think. You could find yourself working on a small development team in one of our many organizations: Advertising, Amazon Customer Service, Amazon Web Services, Business & Corporate Development, Digital Entertainment, eCommerce Platform, Fulfillment and Operations, Global Corporate Teams, Amazon Devices, Retail, Search and Discovery Technology, Seller Services, or Amazon Subsidiaries.
Amazon is a place where builders build.


What are examples of work that Software Engineers are doing at Amazon?


· Powered companies from Netflix to NASA: Amazon Web Services has provided companies of all sizes with an infrastructure platform in the cloud that powers hundreds of thousands of businesses in 190 countries around the world. Here at AWS, you’ll experience unparalleled ownership and impact on our product development, and be empowered to innovate and deliver.



· Built the Amazon Devices experience: We have gone beyond Kindle, our best-selling e-reader to our powerhouse Fire tablets, built for work and play with our Fire OS operating system. For streaming media lovers, we have created Amazon Fire TV and Fire TV Stick with voice search, massive video selection, and gaming. Exploring new solutions with products such as Amazon Echo, a new category of device designed around your voice with far-field voice recognition, and Amazon Dash, a handheld scanner to help you order groceries from Amazon Fresh.



· We help users find what they want: Amazon Search and Discovery helps hundreds of millions of shoppers spending tens of billions of dollars annually find what they want, get what they need, and discover what they'll love. We are innovators who love to experiment and are obsessed with letting customers tell us what works. We are obsessed with automation, and leverage technologies and massive amounts of data and machine learning to delight our customers. Work on Prime Air, Prime Now, or other customer solutions to help us define the future.

item.title: Sr. Software Engineer - Java at Chewy.com (Fort Lauderdale, FL)
item.description:
The Overview:


As an engineer on our Ecommerce Systems team, you will deliver solutions and features for the leading online pet retailer in the United States. You will lead a team that is responsible for the vision, strategy, product roadmap, and development of Chewy’s core Ecommerce Platform which consists of customer management, order and shipment management, returns management, catalog management, competitive pricing tools, search and personalization services, and operational analytics.  You will have significant influence over the vision, features, and design of this critical platform. Working with other technology teams, you and your team will design and build interfaces that integrate with vendor & supply chain systems, fulfillment systems, and financial systems. This is a high-profile position that will have exposure across the entire business.


You will write simple and sustainable code that reflects a constant understanding of the business impacts. This is a terrific opportunity to join a thriving startup and have a significant role in its success. There is a tremendous opportunity to grow professionally and to be a part of a dynamic and successful team.

item.title: Application Engineer at Exaptive (Oklahoma City, OK)
item.description:
Exaptive, Inc is an MIT affiliated, fast-growing software startup that has offices in Oklahoma City, Boston and Vancouver, Canada. We are now expanding our Oklahoma City team. 


We are looking for a talented individual to be a key technical evangelist about Exaptive, educating the user community and customers in writing, presentations, and short videos.  He or she will support the sales process through demos, technical training sessions, proposals, and proofs of concept to identify customer needs, design solutions, and communicate Exaptive’s unique value.  This role is the bridge between us and our community, communicating our story to our community and representing that community in shaping our company’s direction.


We will provide intensive training during which you will create top notch documentation and video tutorials for our users – written and video.  The role will evolve according to the dynamic needs of a startup and to your talents and professional desires.           


This position will be based in downtown OKC, but with the opportunity for travel to other Exaptive and customer locations. The right person will be excited about the dynamic and fast-paced (aka stressful) environment of a startup and view that as an opportunity to excel. The startup environment is not for everyone, but offers the opportunity to help build something from the ground up where individual contributions make immediate and substantial impacts on the company as a whole can be extremely rewarding. 



Those interested can find out more about the company, and view some demo videos of our software in actionon our website: www.exaptive.com. We were featured on the front page of the Business Innovation section of The Boston Globe (http://www.boston.com/business/technology/innoeco/2013/12/cambridge-based_exaptive_wants.html) and in Oklahoma City's The Journal Record (http://www.i2e.org/news/innovators-exaptive-inc/). We were also recently named a Gartner Cool Vendor (http://blogs.gartner.com/michael-shanler/cool-vendors-in-life-science/).  Our Founder and CEO, Dave King, has been invited internationally to present our work. You can see a video of a presentation he recently gave to the Oklahoma Venture Forum about Exaptive's big-picture vision on our website. 

If you don't currently live in Oklahoma City, you should check out what this up-and-coming city has to offer: a burgeoning tech startup and creative sector, the largest food truck event in the nation, olympic rowing facilities, and a cost of living that can't be beat. For the right candidate we'll pay relocation expenses.

item.title: Senior Software Developer .NET at AutoAlert (Irvine, CA)
item.description:
Listed as one of the Fastest Growing Private Companies by the Orange County Business Journal and Winner of the Best Places to Work two years in a row, AutoAlert is the automotive industry's leading data-mining and lead generation platform providing innovative software, direct marketing and training solutions that have been implemented in over 2,300 dealerships in the United States and Canada.


The Senior Software Developer. NET will be responsible for contributing to an enterprise level web application and supporting applications using ASP.NET MVC, ASP.NET Web API, C#.NET, LINQ to Entity Framework, and SQL Server. You will participate as a member of a scrum team, working closely with peers, in an agile environment.


What you'll be doing:



  • Build products from the ground up and scale out our existing products

  • Design and develop client-server modules, components, and integration end-points

  • Maintain a high level of code integrity by writing clean and testable code

  • Build reusable and scalable code using established design patterns

  • Collaborate with other team members and product stakeholders

  • Be a Key Player in the growth of our company and your career!


What we offer:



  • Work with cutting edge technologies and our super bright Engineers!

  • Highly Competitive Compensation Package!

  • Flexible Hours!

  • Medical, Dental, Vision, Paid Time Off!

  • 401k with Company Match!

  • Career Growth Opportunities!

  • Actually seeing the results of your work and not getting lost in a big company’s sea of developers!

item.title: Intermediate - Senior Software Engineer at Shift Health (Toronto, ON, Canada)
item.description:
Located in downtown Toronto, our developers enjoy a flexible work environment (wear what you want, dog friendly, work from home days, free Friday beers), alongside an empathetic, intelligent team that holds themselves up to high standards. We offer healthcare benefits, bottomless coffee, an all-expenses-paid development conference, and additional ongoing support for professional development. You’ll work in a financially stable but young company where your efforts will have great social, business, and technological impact.


-----------------------------------------


General Skills:



  • work directly with Development Manager to establish transparency in day to day workflow

  • take responsibility for the implementation of product plans from initial stages to launch

  • actively participate in all parts of scrum (daily standup, sprint planning, retrospective, backlog refinement, scoping, point estimates)

  • mentor junior developers, any previous instruction experience a plus

  • strong communication skills both oral and written, team player, sense of humor


Technical skills:



  • a conscientious developer, both in personality and work

  • very familiar with all parts of the Rails ecosystem (rvm, bundler, rspec, capybara, etc.)

  • be able to debug issues both in the application and in external dependencies

  • enough familiarity with CompSci concepts to participate in architecting new parts of the system, both in Rails backend and in Angular front end

  • very familiar with command line tools as well as sysadmin automation tools (capistrano, pallet, or ansible)

  • experience with systems and data security

  • desire and ability to scale a product from ideation to enterprise-scale


-----------------------------------------


Part of the selection process will be collaborative problem solving (involving one or more of coding, devops, or overall design of a feature). Shift Health is an equal opportunity employer and we encourage qualified individuals of all backgrounds to apply. Salary is commensurate with experience.

item.title: Senior Javascript Developer at Atlassian (Sydney, Australia)
item.description: Do you want to be at the front of the curve and the last stop before customers? As a Front End Developer, you’ll be directly impacting the customer experience through the implementation of new features and functionalities into our products. You’ll typically work in two ways, either as part of a fast moving and product driven team delivering features with focus on user experience, or cross-product where you’ll focus on new improvements to our software that enables all users to benefit. Either way, you’ll never be bored and you'll always be challenged (And you are probably the type that likes it this way).

item.title: Full Stack Development Engineer at Groupon International (, )
item.description:
Groupon are seeking experienced full stack developers to work in our Dublin office to design and build high-scale, web and mobile e-commerce applications that run non-stop around the globe. We work in small, independent and collaborative teams to architect massively scalable and reliable systems.  As part of our Dublin technology team, you'll use a variety of technologies and development practices to build pioneering local commerce applications used by hundreds of millions of people.

You'd be a great fit for this position if you're comfortable working with a small team, rapidly iterating a multi-component software stack and taking the initiative to add great new features that we haven't even dreamed up yet. Come help us build and power our rapidly growing international e-commerce platform!


Awesome things you will be doing!


You will work on our Ruby on Rail and Node.js e-commerce platform (similar architecture to Groupon I-tier) while delivering superior mobile and desktop user experiences.


We are producing high quality cross-browser and cross-platform code as we maintain high quality and test coverage while adding new functionality. 


We certainly work in an agile environment so we would like you to research and champion new innovative open-source technologies and frameworks and because you will be an awesome candidate we know you will embrace mentoring junior developers on technical issues and modern web development best practices.


No country is the same and we, the local extensions team, know this better than most.  Most of our time we spend touching multiple code bases to provide that one feature a country can't live without.  If you're interested in touching many code bases or get bored from spending forever on the same project, this position is made for you.

We traverse the links from frontend to backend, sometimes multiple backends.  We're exposed to lots of different code bases, encountering most languages under the sun, usually in code, but sometimes in speech too.  Would you like to be a part of us?

item.title: Senior Systems Engineer at Sauce Labs Inc (San Francisco, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Sauce Labs provides the world's largest automation cloud for testing web and native/hybrid mobile applications. Founded by the original creator of Selenium, Sauce Labs helps companies accelerate software development cycles, improve application quality and deploy with confidence across 500+ browser / OS platforms. Join us in making the world a better place for continuous integration and software development. We’re building a next generation infrastructure as a service platform.


We’re looking for Senior Systems Engineer to join our Ops Team. This role will be responsible for the successful operations and scaling of the infrastructure and software that powers Sauce Labs and launches over 10 million VMs a month.


Responsibilities:




  • Write tools and scripts to provide automation and self service solutions for ourselves and other teams




  • Design new systems to support production services




  • Install, configure and debug hardware and systems in our data center;




  • Creatively solve scale challenges regarding a rapidly expanding cloud environment;




  • Work with real hardware - high density Cisco UCS B-series blades and C-series rack-mount servers, Nexus networking (10Gb+ core network), storage (NAS and SAN), Mac-in-a-datacenter, custom appliances for mobile devices, load balancers, and beyond;




  • Help improve monitoring and identify key performance metrics;




  • Proactive R&D - discovering and implementing new tools, emerging technology, etc.;




  • Disaster recovery design, implementation, and maintenance;




  • Create NOC runbooks, procedures, documentation, and diagrams of the environments you manage;




  • Troubleshooting and resolution of server/network issues;




  • Help maintain hardware in Sauce’s colocation facilities;




  • Help build out new data centers around the globe;




  • Participation in 24x7 on-call rotation.




Here are a couple of examples of the kind of projects you might work on:




  • Optimize hardware and configuration for improving hypervisor performance.




  • Automating and migrating a system configuration to our UCS platform for faster production scaling.




  • Building and optimizing a logstash cluster for our development team to monitor and analyze production system usage.




We have a lot of big projects and decisions that need to be made, and in this role you would be a key part of that process. Sound like fun? Here’s what we’re looking for:


Our Ideal Candidate:




  • 3+ years recent experience working as a Linux administrator/engineer at scale (hundreds of systems) and designing/deploying ‘highly available’ solutions;






  • 2+ years of recent professional experience designing, developing, and operating Configuration Management solutions such as Chef, Puppet, Salt (preferred), or Ansible (preferred) at scale;




  • Solid experience in Linux tuning, profiling, and monitoring;




  • Strong skills in at least one language: Python (preferred), Ruby, Bash.




Bonus points for:




  • Experience deploying/managing KVM-Qemu and LXC




  • Solid understanding of cloud/networking/distributed computing environment concepts; including TCP/ IP connections, firewalls, VLANs, etc.




  • Experience and understanding of contemporary metrics, monitors, and logging solutions especially statsD, Graphite, ELK, Splunk, Nagios, etc.




  • Provisioning and automation with Cisco Unified Computing System Manager




  • Highly organized, able to multi-task, able to work individually, as well as within a team, and across teams;




  • Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written across all user levels;




  • Deployment automation in physical and virtual environments (PXE, Cobbler, MAAS (preferred));




  • Working knowledge of load balancing technologies (hard/soft);




  • Proven experience collaborating in a cross functional team environment;




  • Familiarity with software engineering practices, including n-tier architecture, configuration management, development methodologies (e.g. agile, waterfall, spiral, prototyping), etc.




Notes:



  • This role can be based in either South Bay or in San Francisco. Some travel to South Bay or SF is required.

  • Relocation available.

item.title: Full Stack .NET Web Developer at Frontpoint (Vienna, VA)
item.description:
Are you seeking the freedom to creatively solve interesting problems while also engineering something that genuinely makes a difference? Join the company that brought technological advancement to the home security industry!


We’re looking for a full stack .NET Web Developer to join our awesome development team.This is a fast paced, enterprise scale, B2C environment. Our developers build software for all components of the organization. This involves heavy front-end web development for systems that are both internally and externally facing, integration with back-end third party APIs, analytical services, & tons of data. We have awesome tools at our disposal like the latest Visual Studio, Resharper, the RedGate SQL Bundle, top-notch hardware setups.  We use the latest versions of all our tools and do our best to keep up with the rapid evolution of javascript and other front-end frameworks.


 If you like a start-up culture without the start-up risk, you’ll love working at Frontpoint! 


Responsibilities:



  • Write tons of code across the full stack – front end Web UI, middle tier service layer, and back end database

  • Perform analysis of requirements and design

  • Create and execute unit tests and perform basic systems testing

  • Participate in peer code reviews and technical meetings

  • Mentor lower-level engineers in coding practices and process

  • Work in an Agile Scrum team process, collaborating closely with fellow developers, DBAs, QA, team leads, and stakeholders

  • Troubleshoot and support system and application problems

item.title: Be a hero in helping us solve complex Big Data problems! at kCura (Portland, OR)
item.description:
The Sr. Software Engineer (Portland) is responsible for delivering results for the Product Development department by:


• Contributing to an Agile team that solves complex challenges and builds working software


• Rapidly producing high quality code • Being a dependable and highly skilled development resource for peers


The Sr. Software Engineer performs the following functions, in addition to others, in the administration of their position:


• Documents and demonstrates solutions by developing documentation, flowcharts, layouts, diagrams, charts, code comments and clear code.


• Prepares and installs solutions by determining and designing system specifications, standards, and programming.


• Improves operations by conducting systems analysis, recommending changes in policies and procedures.


• Encourages pair programming and collaborative design


• Thinks out loud- Consistently communicates ideas to others


• Provides development expertise to team members  through education and review


• Always open to new ideas and encourages innovative practices amongst peers


• Works collaboratively with QA professionals to encourage defect prevention over detection


• May be required to handle technical support calls after hours about two times a year. If Client Services is working on a ticket and they are not able to solve an urgent issue, they will reach out to the level I developer to assist to get the issue resolved.


In addition to the above responsibilities, the Senior Software Engineer is expected to display professionalism in the following ways:


• Maintain an attitude of commitment through outward display of willingness


• Practice positive interactions - lean on encouragement in place of judgment


• Impress responsibility on others by displaying ownership in tasks


• Act in the best interest of the overall team

item.title: Product Marketing Manager - Mobile at New Relic (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
We are looking for a Product Marketing Manager to join our Product Marketing team, leading outbound product marketing activities specifically for our New Relic Mobile product, used by thousands of developers to ensure the performance of literally hundreds of millions of mobile app instances. If you’re looking to make an impact in mobile, this is a great way to do it!


In this role you will be the “CMO of the product”, owning product & competitive positioning, sales enablement, market & competitive analysis, product launches, customer development, and more for New Relic Mobile. What makes product marketing at New Relic different is that we provide product marketers with an exceptionally broad, experienced team of marketing colleagues as a foundation to do the some of the best work of your career.

item.title: C# Developer at Best Lawyers (Aiken, SC)
item.description:
Best Lawyers is seeking a C# Developer for a new interactive legal platform, built on the foundation of our 35 years as the most respected legal peer review network. The primary role will be to develop and support an API infrastructure for this initiative. The developer will also be challenged to maintain, improve, and create new features in an ever-changing environment while ensuring stability and site performance.


We are seeking a passionate developer looking to join a strong team. We need a proud problem solver, constant learner, and a continuous contributor to the team IQ level.

item.title: Lead PHP Developer/Architect at Guidepoint (New York, NY)
item.description:
Guidepoint is seeking a Lead PHP Developer with heavy Microsoft SQL Server experience to join its Engineering team. Our Engineering team is a highly collaborative organization consisting of engineers with the highest levels of technical depth, programming skill and a passion for quality.


An ideal candidate is expected to absorb an immense amount of business logic and have a curious mind for process flows to data models and code interaction. Must have prior experience successfully leading a team of 4-12 developers for at least one year. Imperative that candidate can unblock fellow developers and weigh-in daily while getting own User Stories completed.

item.title: Web Developer at Garena Online Private Limited (Singapore)
item.description:
Description:


The web developer would be someone with strong experience in web and server side technologies. This is a fast-paced position that requires a high degree of energy and focus without compromising quality.


Responsibilities:



  • Write server-side Python code as well as client-side Javascript/HTML/CSS code that powers the whole web user workflow

  • Build new features and fix bugs

  • Build reusable code and libraries for future use

  • Optimization of the application for maximum speed and scalability

  • Implementation of security and data protection

  • Write high-quality, clean, maintainable code using engineering best practices (unit testing, source control, continuous integration, automation, design patterns, etc.)

  • Collaborate with other software engineers, product managers, user experience designer, and operations engineers to build new products with web technologies

item.title: Senior Java Developer at Quotient, Inc. (Bethesda, MD)
item.description:
Why THIS job?


Your work will be seen by medical researchers all over the world as you work for Quotient on site with the National Institute of Health and it’s Departments, Library, and Research Centers designing and updating their websites, databases and creating new online, interactive tools.


Quotient, established in 1999, is a small business providing a range of technical expertise to include web design and development, program and project management and information technology solutions and support to government and private industry. Quotient is dedicated to providing the highest quality and most cost-effective solutions to our clients. Quotient has a solid track record based on timely completion of contract requirements and superior work quality. Quotient’s core capabilities include: web and enterprise content management, web design and development, application design, development and maintenance, cybersecurity, systems engineering, and project management. 


Since our inception, Quotient has served defense and civilian Federal Government clients, growing steadily in both the number of contracts and the scope of our business enterprise.  


We have an opportunity in Bethesda, MD for a JEE Developer (7 + years of experience necessary).  This is a permanent position that offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package.



  1. Strong JEE application full life cycle development experience.  Proficient in JEE and all aspects of Object Oriented Application Development and Object Oriented Programming

  2. Strong Analysis experience including Rational Unified Process (RUP), Domain Modeling, Usecases, Data Patterns, etc.

  3. Ability to provide development guidelines utilizing design skills including Infrastructure and Feature definition, Componentization, Object Oriented Design using UML

  4. Ability to participate in code reviews, assist with project plans and resource allocation.

  5. Programming in Java, proficient skills in JEE components such as: EJB, JNDI, Servlets, JSP.  Experience in Spring, Hibernate, Ant/Maven.  Knowledge and experience with SQL, Javascript.

  6. Understanding of web services technologies.

  7. Relational Data Base knowledge/experiences such as Oracle database. Demonstrated experiences in understanding and writing complex queries, a good understanding of stored procedures, best practices in programming for relational databases.

  8. Ability to work in Agile environment.

  9. Experiences in Unix platform, Linux, Window 7, etc.

  10. Experience with tools such as Eclipse, Visio, Toad, Jira, Git

  11. Ability to understand/pick up business domain knowledge within a short time period. Good verbal communication. Good writing skills such as writing systems or application documentation, etc.  Ability to multi-task in the software development life cycle

  12. Good team player and is willing to work with domain people (non-IT people) as well as developers and team leader.

item.title: Technical Principal at ThoughtWorks (Manchester, UK)
item.description:
ThoughtWorks is synonymous with innovation. We’re a diverse community of bright and passionate individuals striving to have a positive impact on the world. We’re dedicated to the art of software delivery, by keeping it lightweight, agile and open-source. Our clients are organisations with ambitious missions, where we deliver complex enterprise systems to help them solve their toughest business problems. As a Principal Consultant at ThoughtWorks you have total responsibility for technical delivery on a client engagement so you are likely to have extensive experience.


As a Principal Consultant, here’s what you can do at ThoughtWorks: 



  • Disrupt, Lead and Innovate.

  • Take the needs and challenges of a client and formulate the technical roadmap and technology solution that will support their business strategies and goals.

  • Provide Technical leadership across all areas of the enterprise, to ensure delivery of exceptional technical solutions

  • Formulate and articulate the technical and political implication of real world solutions

  • Orchestrate the management of technology scope and risks

  • Mentor on approach and execution of solutions, coach on technologies and establishing a team wide comprehension of solution capabilities and direction

  • Ensure technical expectations of deliverables are met

  • Drive ThoughtWorks’ Thought-Leadership on engineering and architectural practices and standards

  • Be an inspiration of innovation to the client

  • Become a trusted and valued partner of the client CIO/CTO and team

  • Exploit opportunities for networking and relationship building that arise out of delivery activities

  • Creates and supports sales activities

  • Maintaining strong expertise and knowledge of current and emerging technologies and products

  • Code! We don’t subscribe to the “post-technical” ivory tower leadership style



We work almost exclusively on customer site providing a mix of delivery and consulting services, so you’ll be flexible about travel. 



We offer amazing benefits from the day you start including private medical insurance, travel insurance, income protection, critical illness, life assurance, pension scheme, child care vouchers, personal development budget, 25 days holiday and a ride2work scheme.



To apply please submit your CV and tell us why you want to join ThoughtWorks. One of our recruiters will be in touch.


At ThoughtWorks we promote diversity in all its forms and reject discrimination and inequality. We proudly, passionately and actively strive to make both ThoughtWorks and our industry more reflective and inclusive of the society that we serve

item.title: Sr Web Developer (JavaScript, Node.js, HTML) at GISbiz Inc (Nashville, TN)
item.description:
GISbiz is looking for an experienced developer to code web applications and supporting scripts and tools. Someone who has helped design and implement large, highly scalable web platforms for thousands of users is a huge plus.

Required: Someone dedicated to principals of good software development and user experiences. Must grow modern web development and tools including Git, HTML5, and Node.js.

GISbiz has a tightly knit team of sales and development pros releasing new websites and applications on a regular basis. Our software is rich in data visualizations, business rules and workflows, integration with other enterprise systems, and interactive maps. You will be responsible for coding the database procedures, web APIs, HTML interfaces, and administrative scripts and tools for our projects. You must have some experience in all these application tiers, with an expertise in the web APIs and HTML/JavaScript front end.



Qualifications



  • A history of implementing successful web applications and APIs.

  • A love for keeping up on trends in web technologies.

  • Thorough understanding of JavaScript -- not just a 'working knowledge' but the ability to judge JavaScript code quality and push our team towards best practices.

  • Understanding of backend data systems, especially SQL and some Windows/Linux administration. (You will not be hired as a systems admin or database admin, but you must be able to write proper SQL and have a good grasp on networks and operating systems.)


Additional Qualifications



  • GIS experience is a major plus.

  • Experience with PostgreSQL and PostGIS is a major plus.

  • Esri ArcGIS experience is a plus.

  • Experience with Amazon Web Services: EC2, S3, SNS, SES, VPC, Route 53, CloudFront, and/or Elastic Beanstalk is a plus.

  • Experience in .NET and C# is a plus.

  • History of contributing pull requests to open source projects is a plus.

  • Previous work with a multi-national, geographically distributed team is a plus.

  • Understanding of the Agile/Scrum development process is a plus.


Responsibilities



  • Code. Write lots of lots of high quality code!

  • Participate in the Agile/Scrum process, design sessions, and code reviews as needed.

  • Implement delightful, consistent user experiences for web applications.

  • Prioritize work and execute on ideas to meet these goals.



Please submit your GitHub, BitBucket, CodePlex, SourceForge, and/or StackOverflow usernames along with your resume. People who love to write code tend to get involved in these online programming communities, but we are open to other ways you have expressed a passion in the work you do.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - Mars Science Laboratory (MSL) at Jet Propulsion Laboratory (Pasadena, CA)
item.description:
Jet Propulsion Laboratory


Requisition ID 2015-5361
Posted Date 8/19/2015
Discipline Description Engineering Applications Software Engineering
Scheduled Hours 40
Hiring Organization 397G - DATA SERVICES
Education Bachelor's
Travel No
Clearance Options None
Job Locations US-CA-Pasadena
Category Software and Computing Systems
Career Level Level 3
Relocation Eligibility Yes
Minimum Years of Experience 6
Work Authorization U.S. Citizen or Permanent Resident
Clearance Status None

Overview:


Do you excel in an environment that values exploration and discovery? We have a universe of opportunities waiting for you!




The Jet Propulsion Laboratory (JPL) is NASA’s lead center for robotic exploration of the solar system. Our core competency is the end-to-end implementation of unprecedented robotic space missions to study Earth, the Solar System, and the Universe.




JPL, located in Pasadena, California, has a casual, campus-like environment situated on 177 acres in the foothills of the San Gabriel Mountains and offers a work environment unlike any other: we inspire passion, foster innovation, build collaboration, and reward excellence.





We are proud to be part of NASA and Caltech, as we explore the universe and make history through new discoveries.




We aim to do things never done before and to go places few can go. We dare mighty things…do you?




Responsibilities:


You will be a Software Engineer and member of the Data Services Group (397G) reporting to the Group Supervisor and will contribute to the software planning systems of the Mars Science Laboratory (MSL).
