You will utilize domain-specific engineering expertise to understand the needs of the customer, translate needs into requirements, develop prototype applications, iterate with customers and then deliver quality applications. Involved in entire life-cycle of system, including planning, development, deployment and maintenance. Responsible for understanding and meeting software operational and engineering requirements.

item.title: We would Love to Find a Great Front End Web Interface Developer! at SocialFlow Inc. (New York, NY)
item.description:
Create dynamic and compelling tools and visual dashboards so the most recognized news, media, retail, and publisher brands in the world can get the most out of their social media efforts.


We utilize the emerging best practices and standards for quality software development.


We use github for workflow; topic branches + pull requests. Management is lean and meetings are short.


We have a web service based architecture which empowers front-end engineering to develop truly real-time, dynamic content, without waiting around for a backend team to build the other end of each feature.


Organizationally we attempt to develop cross functional teams. If you want to also work on the controllers or schema, that is encouraged, but not required.


We need developers that have an eye for UX, and can innovate rapidly on top social media APIs. We currently work with Twitter (Official Partner for Ad Tech & Engagement and Publishing), Facebook (Official Marketing Partner for Ad Tech and Community Management), Google (Integrated Partner), Pinterest (Official Partner), LinkedIn and G+ with more to come.


SocialFlow is a great place to work where you can feel proud knowing many of the most recognized brand names in the world are using the products you have helped to create.

item.title: Software Engineering Manager at Amazon (Boston, MA)
item.description:
Why are Software Engineers important at Amazon?



At Amazon, we hire the best minds in technology to innovate and build for the benefit of our customers. That intense focus on customers is why we are one of the world’s most beloved brands – it’s part of our company DNA.



Our challenges are big - impacting millions of Consumers, Sellers, Content Creators, and Developers & Enterprises through countless products – and we are searching for a certain kind of person who is excited by the idea of owning; people who like to build new platforms, features and services from scratch, developers who can manage the ambiguity and pace of a company whose ship cycles are measured in weeks, not years.

We speak multiple languages, working on multiple platforms to solve immensely complex challenges in large-scale computing by using your skills in data structures, algorithms, and object oriented programming. We have a variety of teams to choose from; our opportunities are broader than you might think. You could find yourself working on a small development team in one of our many organizations: Advertising, Amazon Customer Service, Amazon Web Services, Business & Corporate Development, Digital Entertainment, eCommerce Platform, Fulfillment and Operations, Global Corporate Teams, Amazon Devices, Retail, Search and Discovery Technology, Seller Services, or Amazon Subsidiaries.
Amazon is a place where builders build.



What are examples of work that Software Engineers are doing at Amazon?

· Powered companies from Netflix to NASA: Amazon Web Services has provided companies of all sizes with an infrastructure platform in the cloud that powers hundreds of thousands of businesses in 190 countries around the world. Here at AWS, you’ll experience unparalleled ownership and impact on our product development, and be empowered to innovate and deliver.



· Built the Amazon Devices experience: We have gone beyond Kindle, our best-selling e-reader to our powerhouse Fire tablets, built for work and play with our Fire OS operating system. For streaming media lovers, we have created Amazon Fire TV and Fire TV Stick with voice search, massive video selection, and gaming. Exploring new solutions with products such as Amazon Echo, a new category of device designed around your voice with far-field voice recognition, and Amazon Dash, a handheld scanner to help you order groceries from Amazon Fresh.



· We help users find what they want: Amazon Search and Discovery helps hundreds of millions of shoppers spending tens of billions of dollars annually find what they want, get what they need, and discover what they'll love. We are innovators who love to experiment and are obsessed with letting customers tell us what works. We are obsessed with automation, and leverage technologies and massive amounts of data and machine learning to delight our customers. Work on Prime Air, Prime Now, or other customer solutions to help us define the future.

item.title: Front-end Developer at Solita Oy (Helsinki, Finland)
item.description:
Innostutko modernin front-end kehityksen haasteista? Haluaisitko osaksi työyhteisöä, jossa voit sparrailla osaavien kollegoiden kanssa ja vaikuttaa työsi sisältöön? Etsimme nyt uutta kollegaa Helsinkiin.


Is this like a gibberish to you? We work with Finnish public sector and both national and international companies. Our working language is Finnish and we expect all our employees to use Finnish as their work language. If Finnish language is not your strongest asset, you can take a peek at our developer's blog http://dev.solita.fi/.


-----------


Kaikki mikä voi, digitalisoituu. Toimimme digitalisoituvan maailman matkaoppaana asiakkaillemme. Etsimme nyt sisällönhallinnan projekteihin visiostamme innostuvaa selaimen salojen selättäjää


Front-end Developer


Verkkopalveluiden näkyvien osien sulava ja käytettävä toteutus ovat sinulle sydäntä lähellä. Hyödynnät moderneja teknologioita rakentaessasi käyttäjän ja asiakkaiden tarpeet huomioivia käyttöliittymiä. Pääasiallisesti tulet työskentelemään EPiServer CMS:n parissa Helsingin viihtyisällä toimistollamme.


Meillä intohimosi laadukkaaseen kädenjälkeen jakavat front-end-tiimiläisten lisäksi osaavat back end -toteuttajat, käyttökokemussuunnittelijat, graafikot sekä projektipäälliköt. Työskentelette ja opitte yhdessä tiimeinä asiakkaan ja kehitystyön pulssia tarkasti seuraten. Arjessa kanssasi sparrailee projektitiimin lisäksi leppoisa, intohimoinen ja ammattitaitoinen 19 hengen front-end-tiimimme.


Tunnistat itsesi seuraavista:


* Responsiivisuus mobile first -ajatusmallilla on sinulle tuttua


* Ymmärrät miten ja miksi kehität selainyhteensopivia toteutuksia


* Tehokas tyylien toteutus preprosessoituna CSS:nä on arkeasi


* Työhaastattelussa voimme pohdiskella AngularJS:n tulevaisuutta yhdessä


* Tekeleesi ovat optimoituja niin selaimen, kuin hakukoneiden näkökulmasta


Arvostamme haluasi oppia ja kehittyä, sekä auttaa muita kehittymään. Ei huolta mikäli EPiServer-alusta ei ole sinulle tuttu. Meille se on. Jaamme osaamisemme ja kokemuksemme mielellämme kanssasi.


Kysy lisää tiimipäällikkö Juha Höyssältä puh. 040-755 8039 maanantaisin klo 12-13.


Suomen 6. paras työpaikka


Solitalainen devausyhteisö tarjoilee suomalaiseen digitalisaatioon jäätävää osaamista, sillä jopa kolme neljästä kehittäjistämme on ohjelmoinut työkseen jo yli kuuden vuoden ajan. Melkein puolet kehittäjistämme tekee pääasiallisesti full-stack –hommia, joka kahdeksas keskittyy arkkitehtuurisuunnitteluun ja kokoaikaisia fronttikoodaajia on melkein joka kymmenes kehittäjistä. Solitalainen kädenjälki näkyy monessa suomalaiselle tutussa palvelussa, kuten Oikeusministeriön Kansalaisaloite-palvelussa ja Liikenneviraston Veturipäätteessä.


Projektien lisäksi meillä opiskellaan tekkiasioita työajalla kollegoiden järjestämien tietoiskujen sekä erilaisten koulutusten kautta. Jatkuva oppiminen ja uteliaisuus vievät meitä eteenpäin. Kehittymismahdollisuuksia riittää niin paljon kuin rohkeutta löytyy. Tutustu Jessen avoimen lähdekoodin projektiin suositussa devaajien blogissamme dev.solita.fi.


Työhommien ulkopuolella kokoonnumme Arduino-säätäjien Skunk Works –kerhoon, järjestämme änäriturnauksia, potkimme futista Pirkka-hallissa, suunnistamme Jukolan metsissä, heilumme heimofestareilla ja kiitämme kollegaa shampanjalla.


Hakuohjeet


Haluamme kuulla sinusta. Lähetä meille vapaamuotoinen hakemuskirjeesi otsikolla ”Front-end Developer, Helsinki” osoitteeseen rekry(at)solita.fi sunnuntaihin 11.10. mennessä. Voit liittää mukaan taidonnäytteesi portfolion tai koodinäytteiden muodossa (esim. GitHubista/BitBucketista).


Aloitamme haastattelut jo hakuajalla ja vastaamme kaikille viimeistään viikon kuluessa haun päättymisestä. Haastattelukierroksia järjestetään kaksi, jonka jälkeen olemme valmiita rekrytointipäätöksen tekoon.

item.title: Backend Engineer at Nimble Collective (Palo Alto, CA)
item.description:
Do you love animation? Do you want to use your coding super powers to change the animation world? Then this is an opportunity of a lifetime.


The animation landscape is ripe for disruption and we want you to be the catalyst. We have the technology to change everything about creating. But we need talented, prolific and endlessly creative engineers to join us in blazing this new trail! Come with us on our journey to enable millions of creators to manifest their visions for billions of eyeballs!


Nimble Collective seeks a motivated deadline driven, flexible and positive individual focused on developing our backend service-based architecture. You will be instrumental in designing the services that control the flow of data in an animation pipeline, working closely with our pipeline and frontend engineers. Understanding of Computer Generated Imagery process is a bonus.

item.title: Senior software engineer - equity + market salary at Ice.com (Palo Alto, CA)
item.description:
About us:

Retail Growth Fund acquired the Ice.com domain in 2014 to launch the best place for women to discover and purchase jewelry. We don't take any inventory because we're a marketplace - which means our capital goes towards building IP and acquiring/retaining users. 

A few things that make us interesting:

  • The jewelry industry is a fragmented, $80B market (in the US alone), growing at 5%+ annually, that software has yet to disrupt. 
  • You will be joining an awesome team led by Brandon Proctor and Justin Yoshimura (3x exits). 
  • We are extremely data driven and technology/software is in our DNA. You won't be a second class citizen here, guaranteed. 
  • We don't have time for assholes or politics. 
  • Competitive compensation package including equity in a high growth VC backed start-up (Crosslink, Maveron, Quest, Polaris). Salary/equity is determined based on a sliding scale: if you would like a higher salary, we can issue you less equity, and vice versa. 
  • Small (12 person), growing, and agile team. 
  • $1k gift card to dog food our own marketplace sellers! 

What we'd like to see:

  • True, full-stack engineers with extensive experience in Python/Django or Java. (Django is a key part of our stack but we use some Java). 
  • Strong foundation in computer science, with competencies in data structures, algorithms, databases, software design and dev ops.
  • Work experience with relational databases and SQL.
  • Experience with agile development process in collaborative environment.
  • BS in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or Physics OR 4 years of relevant work experience.
  • Good understanding of performance tradeoffs.

Bonus Points:

  • We are currently using Magento, an open source e-commerce platform built in Zend PHP - yuck), but we are building a new, badass e-commerce platform (Django, Java, Node.js and integrating it with Netsuite's order management tools (no need to re-invent the entire wheel, after all). Related experience is a plus.
  • MS or PhD
  • if you have an awesome Github repo, open source contributions, or a cool project you can demo, please cut to the front of the line...

Responsibilities:

As a member of our small but seriously talented engineering team, you will play a key role in both shaping and building our technologies. Your scope will be broad, ranging from user-facing features to server-side components and libraries. We are looking for a generalist who enjoys learning and working with different technologies. And of course you will be expected to commit code on your first day. 

*This job description is not meant to be an all-inclusive list of duties and responsibilities, but constitutes a general definition of the position's scope and function in the company.

item.title: QA Tester at IceMobile Agency B.V. (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Because of our bold ambitions we are looking for a QA/Tester to help us change food retail with innovative digital solutions. We want our products to help and reward people shopping and inspire them to enjoy food everyday.


Position: 


We are looking for an ambitious and highly motivated QA/Tester who, together with a team of highly talented and experienced designer and developers, will work in the development of the most advanced digital applications.


In doing so we expect you to proactively contribute to;



  • Deliver high quality apps to our costumers

  • Executing, Innovating and Improving test design/ideas

  • Reviewing specifications, designing, and test plans

  • Automate tests where it’s applicable

  • Ironing out any bugs and improving the quality of our product

item.title: Senior Front End Developer at Crossover (São Paulo, Brazil) (allows remote)
item.description:
Ready to make $60,000 USD and eager to join a network of the most talented remote workers in the world? If so, this role is for you. Work for Crossover, and you’ll earn the most competitive wages on the market, collaborate with the most skilled teams in your field, and work for the most elite companies in the world. Sound too good to be true? Take a closer look...



What to Expect as a Senior Front-end Web Developer at Crossover


Join Crossover and you’ll be given the responsibility of combining the art of design with the art of programming. You will be implementing, iterating or even completely revamping the front-end code of a number of applications to be based on today’s modern JS frameworks. You should have an unrelenting drive for quality, with a passion for responsive UIs with tight animations. You will work closely with a global team of developers in utilizing the best-in-practice architecture, tools, and design patterns in web development. And most importantly, you will be expected to demonstrate a deep understanding on how to build custom web applications (including animations) by leveraging backend REST services through the use of data driven JS frameworks.



Compensation


At Crossover, you’ll earn extremely competitive wages while enjoying the flexibility of working from virtually anywhere on the face of the earth:




  • Salary: 30 USD/hr




  • Position type: Full time (40 hours per week)




  • Location: Global

item.title: Jobba med världsunik teknologi inom 3D kartor at Vricon Systems AB (Linköping, Sweden)
item.description:
Vricon is in an expansive phase and now we are looking for 3D developers to Vricons visual production tools for 3D maps and the team working on application development and product customization.


As a developer you will work with everything from 3D visualization, algorithms for 3D meshes for data management in GIS databases. In the team, you are jointly responsible for the final product. On Vricon development cycles are short, and you are working with large part of the code. This means you get a varied and eventful work. 


You can also get to work with application development and product adaptation to Vricons customers. A large part of this service means working with the GUI and feature development. In some cases, you can also act as technical sales support where you will be the expert on what is possible to do. Therefore it is important that you understand what the customer wants and be able to develop features along it.


Then Vricon has a number of vacancies at the moment, there are great opportunities to adapt the work to suit your experience and interests.

item.title: C# Developer at Best Lawyers (New York, NY)
item.description:
Best Lawyers is seeking a C# Developer for a new interactive legal platform, built on the foundation of our 35 years as the most respected legal peer review network. The primary role will be to develop and support an API infrastructure for this initiative. The developer will also be challenged to maintain, improve, and create new features in an ever-changing environment while ensuring stability and site performance.


We are seeking a passionate developer looking to join a strong team. We need a proud problem solver, constant learner, and a continuous contributor to the team IQ level.

item.title: Technical Product Manager at Author it (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
Author-it has been an industry-leading provider of content authoring tools for more than 16 years. With our focus on SaaS solutions for the Life Sciences content lifecycle, we’re growing by leaps and bounds. But we also know we can do more, better. This is where you come in.



We’re looking for a smart, detail-oriented, and technical Product or Program Manager who will contribute to the next stage of evolving Author-it products and services. You’ll work on projects that span the Product Management and Engineering organizations, including front-end development, platform/API development, and QA, with vendor management opportunities for outsource projects.



As a Technical Product manager, you’ll work closely with functional leads to dive deep and solve both customer pain points and complex SaaS challenges (performance, scale, extensibility, security, and more). Our customer-centric philosophy extends across everything we do, whether you’re defining new UI with the UX Designer or optimizing our web services API with the Software Architect.



There’s interesting and exciting work ahead, and you can be a part of it.



Key responsibilities



  • Collect, assess, and prioritize customer requirements for future versions of Author-it products and services.

  • Collaborate with platform/API developers and infrastructure engineers to ensure the security, scalability, and extensibility of the Author-it Cloud service.

  • Collaborate with other PM team members to define the user experience for Author-it products and services.

  • Define the business and functional requirements for enhancements to Author-it products and services (Alternatively, write the user stories or scenarios.)

  • Create specifications and other planning artifacts for product enhancements and new features.

  • Work with developers and infrastructure engineers to ensure the security, scalability, and extensibility of all solutions proposed in specifications you create.

  • Collaborate with Scrum Masters and Technical Project Managers on project management tasks related to Engineering efforts, including both in-house development and outsourced (vendor) projects.

  • Work with the Interaction Designer to validate user experience designs through both ad hoc and formal usability testing, such as “card sort” affinity exercises and A/B testing.

  • Identify sources of user/customer data, such as usage metrics and community feedback, and then analyze the data with team members to provide recommendations for improvement to new or existing product behaviors.

item.title: Mobile Engineer at Triggr Health (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
You’ll be responsible for defining, building, and supporting a platform that reaches people when they are most at-risk and empowers them through the extraordinarily challenging recovery journey. It is an incredibly exciting role as you will be working with cutting-edge technology on a number of products that span: consumer and enterprise; mobile and desktop; external and internal; user-driven and automated; and practical and academic areas. The challenges you will face are new and exciting and will require you to think holistically about how the platform interacts with an incredibly diverse set of stakeholders.


More specifically, we are building apps on both Android and iOS, a customer-facing web application, a robust web services API, machine learning-driven analytics, and large-scale data processing. As a mobile engineer, you will be working on both platforms in addition to working in the API layer.


You must be hyper-focused on how the product impacts every patient, provider, and team member. You will need to understand when trade-offs are necessary: we are growing very quickly, but quality is of critical importance given our mission. You will continuously iterate on our products in order to improve the long-term outcomes of the patients in our program. You will also be integral to forming and developing our culture in addition to helping hire all-star teammates to make Triggr Health an awesome place to work! Most importantly, you must have a strong desire to be a part of a mission-driven company and believe that with the right team, technology, and values, anything is possible.


This position requires someone who understands and embraces the fact that the “user” is a real person with a severe health condition. The work we are doing is incredibly exciting because the impact we can have is massive, but it also requires extra care and increased responsibility to ensure every decision we make reflects this understanding.

item.title: Principal Web Services Developer - Spring and REST at Fidelity (Raleigh, NC)
item.description:
The Strategic Investments Product and Data (SIPD) Team is seeking a skilled Principal Software Engineer / Developer to play a key role designing, developing and maintaining JEE-based web applications. 
SIPD is a shared services provider of technology platforms and product solutions designed to drive successful business outcomes across many of the firm’s most critical areas of growth.  A fast-growing team of more than 900 associates located throughout the United States, China, India and Ireland, ours is a culture that is committed to innovation, supportive of continuous learning, focused on building teams and relationships and one that places a high value on maintaining an environment of trust and transparency.


Primary Responsibilities



  • Focus strong technical leadership experience to ensure software product development is delivered on time and of the highest quality.

  • Foster teamwork and a spirit of collaboration among team members and business partners while conveying a sense of urgency and responsiveness to meet business needs.

  • Contribute to or write concise and clear technical specifications based on analysis of complex business requirements

  • Drive product delivery through building innovative web services utilizing Continuous Integration (CI) and Continuous Deployment (CD), supporting your solution from Development through to Production.

  • Analyze, describe and model new and existing business and technology processes with a primary focus on how these processes manipulate and use the data

  • Coordinate multiple development work streams through integration and ensures architecture is scalable and extensible

  • Own technical delivery for OOD and development of the most complex components of the application

  • Define, maintain and support Java development environment and best practices using tool such as Stash, Maven, Jenkins,Sonar, uDeploy and other Open Source tools

  • Play a key role in resolving technical roadblocks involving multiple technologies

  • Continually improve quality of development team deliverables

  • Ensure code reviews, unit testing and integration testing is completed efficiently and effectively

  • Help coordinate the delivery of technical components across internal/external technical teams.

  • Provide technical leadership and mentoring to more junior team members of the team

  • Contribute to process-improvement initiatives in an effort to maximize velocity for the product team

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - Front End at Tillster, Inc. (San Diego, CA)
item.description:
Senior Software Engineer - Front End

We are looking for Front End Developers WITH A MINIMUM 5+ years experience to drive our new product initiatives in web-based ordering and payments. You will get to be part of a technology playground offering a fun, collaborative, and fast paced environment where ownership, problem solving, and teamwork are rewarded. Everyone on the team (from the greenest developer to the CTO) writes robust, maintainable, and scalable code every day.

item.title: PHP Developer at LeaseWeb Technologies (Amsterdam Zuid-Oost, Netherlands)
item.description:
As a PHP developer you design, construct and support our systems written in PHP. Your responsibilities can vary from simple maintenance to very complex tasks in one of our innovative (Research and Implementation) projects. Automation and software development is an integral part of our business, we expect you to be able to give assistance to non-technical colleagues and collaborate with other departments as well.


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dr2xso8CUTQ


Our international team at LeaseWeb Technologies is working on tackling all of our scalability and automation challenges. Our department consists of around 70 techies, all of them are working in smaller teams. Each of the scrum teams is responsible for a different area of our software landscape that ranges from datacenter automation, product research & development (CDN, Cloud, Object Storage) to frontend implementations for our websites and customer portal.

item.title: Principal UI Software Engineer at clypd (Somerville, MA)
item.description:
You will be learning all aspects of the system and contributing to them. You will work with the rest of the engineering and product teams to deliver quickly and fluidly using Agile methodologies. You will use Continuous Integration and Test Driven Development techniques to build rock-solid code.
 

Skills and experience:

Achieved at least a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering
10+ years of experience
Willingness to learn and improve your web stack skills: front end, back end or both
For front end: experience or interest in building interactive user experiences with modern HTML5 and JavaScript, and comfortable working with the services that drive them
Previous use of MV* frameworks on the client (AngularJS, Ember, ...) and/or server side (Rails, Django, Grails, ...) a huge plus
Excitement about startups and working with a small (but quickly expanding) Agile team
Communication is key; our work is heavily team-oriented, and we are looking for someone who is comfortable participating and contributing to the team
Passion for delivering quality code and products. Code reviews and automated tests are an integral part of our development process. We are always looking for new ways to improve.

Our stack:

Ruby on Rails, React, JQuery, RSpec/Capybara
Go
Docker
PostgreSQL/RDS, Redis
AWS

Perks and benefits:

Competitive compensation and stock options
Comprehensive benefits package (Health, Dental, Vision, Long-term and Short-term disability, 401(k), cell phone subsidy, commuter safety subsidy)
Unlimited paid time off  - take the time you need to operate at peak performance
Learning culture that includes weekly Lunch and Learns and a formal mentor program
Amazing office space in Davis Square, one of the hottest neighborhoods in Somerville
Open and relaxed office layout, including standing desks, walking desks, and a choice of comfortable seating
Macbook and Thunderbolt display
Three rotating beer taps, iced tea and iced coffee on tap, wine bar, tea bar, and more
Game room with darts, foosball, Xbox One, PS4, and more
Fun team outings and celebrations, an annual company outing and holiday party

Who we are:

clypd is a leading player in one of the hottest emerging markets of programmatic TV, disrupting the $74 billion television industry. We are on a mission to change television advertising, to make it more efficient and effective for TV media companies, consumers, and advertisers. We've built an advertising technology platform to empower media companies with programmatic strategies. Our sales platform delivers workflow automation, data-enhanced decisioning and provides media partners with tools to manage their sales efforts.

We are looking for awesome people to join a growing and fun team. We aim to create an environment that is open and transparent, collaborative, supportive, and diverse. We are looking for engineers who want to learn about the latest technologies to craft scalable and maintainable code. The problems we are solving are challenging and interesting and we want your help.

item.title: Tech Lead & Rails Software Engineer (relocation assistance available) at Ikayzo (Honolulu, HI)
item.description:
Looking for a career with a world class dev team solving problems in big data, renewable energy and fintech?


Relocation Assistance Available - see details below


Ikayzo, a Honolulu and Tokyo-based boutique software development and interactive design agency, is looking for an experienced Rails engineer and tech lead. In this role he/she will be responsible for designing and implementing applications for customers ranging from web startups to energy companies and global banks.


Successful applicants will have a history of being major contributors and leads for successful software projects.


Job Description
This position entails hands on work and leadership roles in software architecture, implementation, deployment management, development of best operational practices, testing and documentation of non-trivial systems with massive scalability requirements. We are looking for motivated individuals who do not require step-by-step directions and can work cohesively with our team.


Successful applicants will have a proven track record with non-trivial Ruby on Rails projects, be comfortable with agile development methodologies, have a solid grounding in OO software architecture / design patterns and be comfortable with the Rails technology stack from front to back. Most importantly, we are looking for developers who are passionate about their craft. Our interviews are rigorous, so only serious developers with the requisite skills need apply.


Notes
We will pay relocation expenses of up to $2,000 as well as provide general assistance settling in (locating a place to live, etc.) for the right out-of-state candidate. Unfortunately we currently cannot sponsor visas. We aren't accepting resumes from recruiters for this position. We are looking for core team members in Honolulu. We aren't looking for remote developers at this time.

item.title: Badly Dressed Front End Developer at eFinancialCareers (London, UK)
item.description:
In a Nutshell


We are looking for an experienced Front End Developer that also has a creative flair. If you know your way around JavaScript, HTML and CSS and  like to make websites that rock – well … say no more. Welcome aboard!


This is an exciting opportunity to join a global career platform and help develop your own skills.


The Role


This is a new, hugely exciting role and an excellent chance to join an ambitious team with access to content, data and technology that can have a massive impact on the financial services industry.


eFinancialCareers, a Dice Holdings Inc. (DHI) company, is the world’s leading financial services careers website, and the place to go for financial careers and talent. eFinancialCareers provides finance professionals with the latest job opportunities, career information and invaluable industry insights they need to maximise their potential.


As a Front End Developer you will be expected to review and understand upcoming product feature requirements and provide front-end estimates for them. On occasions you will also be required to create proof of concept for any new idea, features, frameworks and methodologies.


Overtime we will expect this role to help advise on new technologies and strategies – the only constant is change!


Key Skills:



  • Extensive OO JavaScript knowledge and experience

  • Advanced CSS5 & HTML5 skills

  • Experience with JS frameworks such as Backbone and Angular JS

  • Experience in working with jQuery, AJAX and JSON data

  • Experience working alongside W3C guidelines & validation and coding for accessibility

  • Advanced knowledge of JavaScript and DOM manipulation with unobtrusive coding in mind

  • Good understanding of cross-browser issues

  • A thorough understanding of front-end performance


What You Can Expect


When you become a team member, you join a company that values their loyal and enthusiastic employees by providing them a competitive salary, great benefits, including generous paid time off, wellness program, fitness club reimbursement, tuition reimbursement, and more.


There’s a reason why we have such great talent retention – our work environment. If you like working at a company where individual contribution matters and is recognized, where you can have both autonomy and support to achieve your goals and where creativity and accomplishment are rewarded, then come talk to us! 


If you feel you could make a difference and want to become part of one of the UK’s biggest Job Boards, there really couldn't be a more exciting time to join us!


Location: Liverpool St/Old St, London.


Remuneration: very competitive base salary / 10% Bonus / Pension / 25 Days Holiday / Healthcare

item.title: Software Engineering Manager at Amazon (Austin, TX)
item.description:
Why are Software Engineers important at Amazon?



At Amazon, we hire the best minds in technology to innovate and build for the benefit of our customers. That intense focus on customers is why we are one of the world’s most beloved brands – it’s part of our company DNA.



Our challenges are big - impacting millions of Consumers, Sellers, Content Creators, and Developers & Enterprises through countless products – and we are searching for a certain kind of person who is excited by the idea of owning; people who like to build new platforms, features and services from scratch, developers who can manage the ambiguity and pace of a company whose ship cycles are measured in weeks, not years.

We speak multiple languages, working on multiple platforms to solve immensely complex challenges in large-scale computing by using your skills in data structures, algorithms, and object oriented programming. We have a variety of teams to choose from; our opportunities are broader than you might think. You could find yourself working on a small development team in one of our many organizations: Advertising, Amazon Customer Service, Amazon Web Services, Business & Corporate Development, Digital Entertainment, eCommerce Platform, Fulfillment and Operations, Global Corporate Teams, Amazon Devices, Retail, Search and Discovery Technology, Seller Services, or Amazon Subsidiaries.
Amazon is a place where builders build.



What are examples of work that Software Engineers are doing at Amazon?

· Powered companies from Netflix to NASA: Amazon Web Services has provided companies of all sizes with an infrastructure platform in the cloud that powers hundreds of thousands of businesses in 190 countries around the world. Here at AWS, you’ll experience unparalleled ownership and impact on our product development, and be empowered to innovate and deliver.



· Built the Amazon Devices experience: We have gone beyond Kindle, our best-selling e-reader to our powerhouse Fire tablets, built for work and play with our Fire OS operating system. For streaming media lovers, we have created Amazon Fire TV and Fire TV Stick with voice search, massive video selection, and gaming. Exploring new solutions with products such as Amazon Echo, a new category of device designed around your voice with far-field voice recognition, and Amazon Dash, a handheld scanner to help you order groceries from Amazon Fresh.



· We help users find what they want: Amazon Search and Discovery helps hundreds of millions of shoppers spending tens of billions of dollars annually find what they want, get what they need, and discover what they'll love. We are innovators who love to experiment and are obsessed with letting customers tell us what works. We are obsessed with automation, and leverage technologies and massive amounts of data and machine learning to delight our customers. Work on Prime Air, Prime Now, or other customer solutions to help us define the future.

item.title: Software Engineer at Amazon (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
Why are Software Engineers important at Amazon?
At Amazon, we hire the best minds in technology to innovate and build for the benefit of our customers. That intense focus on customers is why we are one of the world’s most beloved brands – it’s part of our company DNA.

Our challenges are big - impacting millions of Consumers, Sellers, Content Creators, and Developers & Enterprises through countless products – and we are searching for a certain kind of person who is excited by the idea of owning; people who like to build new platforms, features and services from scratch, developers who can manage the ambiguity and pace of a company whose ship cycles are measured in weeks, not years.

We speak multiple languages, working on multiple platforms to solve immensely complex challenges in large-scale computing by using your skills in data structures, algorithms, and object oriented programming. We have a variety of teams to choose from; our opportunities are broader than you might think. You could find yourself working on a small development team in one of our many organizations: Advertising, Amazon Customer Service, Amazon Web Services, Business & Corporate Development, Digital Entertainment, eCommerce Platform, Fulfillment and Operations, Global Corporate Teams, Amazon Devices, Retail, Search and Discovery Technology, Seller Services, or Amazon Subsidiaries.
Amazon is a place where builders build.


What are examples of work that Software Engineers are doing at Amazon?


· Powered companies from Netflix to NASA: Amazon Web Services has provided companies of all sizes with an infrastructure platform in the cloud that powers hundreds of thousands of businesses in 190 countries around the world. Here at AWS, you’ll experience unparalleled ownership and impact on our product development, and be empowered to innovate and deliver.



· Built the Amazon Devices experience: We have gone beyond Kindle, our best-selling e-reader to our powerhouse Fire tablets, built for work and play with our Fire OS operating system. For streaming media lovers, we have created Amazon Fire TV and Fire TV Stick with voice search, massive video selection, and gaming. Exploring new solutions with products such as Amazon Echo, a new category of device designed around your voice with far-field voice recognition, and Amazon Dash, a handheld scanner to help you order groceries from Amazon Fresh.



· We help users find what they want: Amazon Search and Discovery helps hundreds of millions of shoppers spending tens of billions of dollars annually find what they want, get what they need, and discover what they'll love. We are innovators who love to experiment and are obsessed with letting customers tell us what works. We are obsessed with automation, and leverage technologies and massive amounts of data and machine learning to delight our customers. Work on Prime Air, Prime Now, or other customer solutions to help us define the future.

item.title: Sr. Java Developer at ADP (Pasadena, CA)
item.description:
POSITION SUMMARY


At ADP, innovation is a core value that is now foundational to all parts of the business. Our collaborative environment is designed for collocated teams to work, live and play together focused on delivering products that solve BIG customer problems.


With ADP building a startup culture in Pasadena, we are able to accelerate new products focused on Customer Driven Design, Data Visualization, Social, Mobile and Digital Payments. In Pasadena we are building a culture driven by "LeanStartup" principles with co-located teams, empowered to make decisions and fail fast along the way. Our goal for the Pasadena Innovation Center is to have small teams with development, design and product focused on BIG customers problems with simple elegant solutions our customers will LOVE.


RESPONSIBILITIES:



  • Participate in planning, development and testing of key features

  • Perform design, code, and unit test software on a predefined schedule using technologies, techniques, and tools to ensure high quality, performance, and reliability, at varying levels of complexity.

  • Following department coding standards, write well documented programs that perform effectively and efficiently.

  • Performs system analysis and design in accordance with established procedures and policies. Provides accurate estimate of time needed to complete work.

  • Will develop test automation scripts with Selenium, Java, CA LISA, SOAPUI and other tools

  • Provides support for specification, design, testing, deployment, documentation and production.

item.title: Front End Web Developer - C#, .Net, MVC, Oracle, SQL Server at NCCI Holdings, Inc. (Boca Raton, FL)
item.description:
Job Purpose:
Participates in analysis and design of computer application systems, and provides coding, testing, documentation and implementation support for application development software initiatives driven by business needs. Performs specific well-defined assignments as part of a project team or works independently on small enhancements and production support assignments. Completes all assignments through close interaction and management oversight.

Major Duties:
Design/Programming (VB.Net, C#, MVC, ASP, PL/SQL, Java, Object Oriented Programming, Oracle, SQL Server, Unix)
• Works under supervision to design program specifications, compile and write documentation, code and test small enhancements and production support fixes, and implement system components in accordance with standards and procedures.
• Responsible for unit testing components and supporting DEV and QA testing.
• Participates in providing implementation plans and supports migrations through the various environments.
• Prepares and maintains technical system documentation for system support and other needs.

Analysis
• Participates in analyzing business needs and detailed design of system components, including input, process, and output requirements, and data and system flows through close interaction with supervision.
• Identifies root cause of problems, provides options for resolution and documents outcome of analysis.
• Performs system maintenance services as required by business demands.
• Troubleshoots minor production problems.

Relationships
• Interacts in technical design meetings with a more senior technical person to understand business and design requirements of proposed assignments.
• Provides support in a matrix-management fashion to other areas as needed.
• May interact directly with the business community to clarify requirements and resolve system issues.

Project Management
• Provides input into the development estimates for planning purposes
• Provides project status and accurate time reporting

Leadership
• Shares knowledge with other technical peers

item.title: Quality Assurance Developer at Ontoit Holdings Ltd (London, UK)
item.description:
Ontoit is looking for an energetic and proactive Quality Assurance Developer responsible for developing automated test suites for the entirety of Ontoit's semantic search engine platform. In this critical and exciting phase of Ontoit's growth, you will be an integral contributor in forming the future of our company.

At Ontoit, we work in various fields of computer science, including machine learning, natural language processing, graph technologies, knowledge representation (ontologies), distributed systems, and web applications. The core technologies that we use include, but is not limited to, Apache Storm, Neo4J, CoreNLP, Apache Spark, Apache Cassandra and Java Spring. As a Quality Assurance Developer, you will be developing automated test suites for the development in these various fields. In conjunction with the CEO and key team members you will be involved in driving the design of automated test systems, creating test cases, and responsible for developing high quality test code for challenging algorithmic back end development.

The compensation for this role also includes significant equity options, all depending on the experience and skill level of the successful applicant.

item.title: Spring, RESTful, SOA Web Services Developer at Fidelity (Durham, NC)
item.description:
As Fidelity continues to expand its suite of product offerings and platforms in our managed accounts space we are hiring more web services developers to apply technical expertise to product delivery.


Fidelity’s Strategic Investment Products and Data (SIPD) group is a shared services provider of technology platforms and product solutions designed to drive successful business outcomes across many of the firm’s most critical areas of growth.  A fast-growing team of more than 900 associates located throughout the United States, China, India and Ireland, ours is a culture that is committed to innovation, supportive of continuous learning, focused on building teams and relationships and one that places a high value on maintaining an environment of trust and transparency.
Primary Responsibilities



  • Day to day responsibilities require significant lean and agile software development experience running team meetings, scrum iterations, AGILE projects in a fast paced financial analytics environment.

  • Be able to focus strong technical experience and project management skills to ensure software product development is delivered on time and of the highest quality.

  • Foster teamwork and a spirit of collaboration among team members and business partners while conveying a sense of urgency and responsiveness to meet business needs.

  • Contribute to or write concise and clear technical specifications based on analysis of complex business requirements

  • Driving product delivery through building innovative web services utilizing Continuous Integration (CI) and Continuous Deployment (CD), supporting your solution from Development through to Production.

  • Analyzing, describing, and modeling new and existing business and technology processes with a primary focus on how these processes manipulate and use the data

  • Responsible for coordinating multiple development work streams through integration and ensures architecture is scalable and extensible

  • Capable of completing OOD and development of the most complex components of the application

  • Define, maintain and support Java development environment and best practices such as Maven, Sonar, and other Open Source tools

  • Plays a key role in resolving technical roadblocks involving multiple technologies

  • Continually improve quality of development team deliverables

  • Ensures code reviews, unit testing and integration testing is completed efficiently and effectively

  • Help coordinate the delivery of technical components across internal/external technical teams.

  • Provide technical leadership to more junior team members of the team

  • Contribute to process-improvement initiatives in an effort to maximize velocity for the product team

item.title: Devops Engineer at Rally Health, Inc. (San Francisco, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
DevOps Engineers at Rally Health work incredibly close with our engineering and product teams to help design, implement, and scale our predominantly Scala and MongoDB based architecture. We are obsessively focused on maintaining high availability for all of the services we manage, while also implementing the infrastructure solutions that our product teams need in order to succeed.


If you have implemented and supported a cutting edge public cloud environment on top of: AWS, MongoDB, CDN, ELB; deployed and managed environment using Chef; and have excellent analytical skills, and a taste for good engineering. WE WANT YOU!  


You will have opportunities to combine your technical ability, strategic thinking and detail-oriented execution in a fast-paced, dynamic, entrepreneurial environment at Rally Health. Your work will contribute to the design and management of serious infrastructure that is servicing large amounts of data and traffic, work with an outstanding engineering team, and employ state-of-the-art tools and techniques.


Responsibilities: 





  • Build and maintain a highly fault tolerant infrastructure on public cloud

  • Build and document cutting-edge automation tools to improve capacity and velocity for software engineers and production operations

  • Collaborate with our development team to implement and evolve solutions for a wide array of challenging projects

  • Improve provisioning, automation, configuration, integration, deployment and release processes

  • Mentor, train and develop team members for career progression and learning

  • Participate in 7x24 on-call rotation

item.title: Lead Full Stack Developer at Cupris Health (London, UK)
item.description:
Cupris Health is working to transform healthcare provision in the NHS and developing markets. We need a lead developer who can deliver our ambitious pipeline of products to realise our vision of a seamlessly connected healthcare system that provides beautiful, smart tools for doctors to give better care to patients closer to home.


You’ll have complete ownership of the stack, developing new functionality, integrating with complex healthcare processes, and working on machine learning algorithms to assist in the diagnosis of patient conditions. Your work will define the company’s growth and ultimate success. 


You will be an early member of our rapidly growing team, passionate about improving healthcare delivery in the UK and globally.


You will have the freedom to choose the stack, but the existing stack consists of: iOS app in Objective C, backend in Ruby on Rails, hosted on Heroku and AWS.

item.title: Software Developer at U.S. News & World Report (Washington, DC)
item.description:
U.S. News & World Report is looking for an experienced Software Developer with an interest in building dynamic, data-driven products to join a growing developer team for one of the globe’s most trusted brands.  For 80 years, U.S. News & World Report has built a strong and profitable business by providing research and ratings that help individuals and families make important life decisions.  While the platform has evolved, what hasn’t changed is our commitment to providing our readers with the highest quality products.


The developers at U.S. News have a great deal of independence and a minimum of overhead.  You'll get to experiment with interesting technology and see your work enter production regularly.


The key things we’re looking for in a new hire are excellent problem solving abilities as well as the technical skills to work with relational databases such as MySQL, write legible code, familiarity with languages such as Python, and strong oral and written communication skills. We are seeking someone with excellent project management skills and an interest in taking the lead on projects.


We have a diverse environment, with Windows, Linux, and Mac OS X machines living side-by-side.  The majority of our work is in developing and maintaining applications on Python web frameworks, specifically Django, although we also maintain some applications in .NET.


Our applications support just about every aspect of company operations, including content management for the usnews.com website, data ranking products such as Best Cars and Trucks and Best Vacations, and other applications.  Developers typically see applications through from beginning to end, working directly with project owners to gather business requirements, front-end engineers to make sure the UI is functional and fast, and the systems team to ensure stress-free deployments.


We offer a casual work environment.  Our offices are in the Georgetown neighborhood of Washington, D.C.

item.title: Technical Support Lead at Vena Solutions Inc. (Toronto, ON, Canada)
item.description:
About the Role


Lead the support team and build a strong feedback loop between the product development and customer support teams to ensure that customer success. Use customer feedback to improve the product, and technical feedback to improve our customer service. You will be the voice of our customers internally, bringing product feedback and technical issues to the engineering team, and using your deep understanding of our customers to influence the prioritization of product improvements.


You will also communicate product and technical updates to the customer success team, so that they can expertly resolve any issues.


The Technical Support Lead will work with internal teams including Professional Services, Quality Assurance, and Product Development as required in order to completely resolve customer issues.



Responsibilities



  • Prioritize and escalate highly impacting issues

  • Manage / coordinate critical communications

  • Ability to manage and resolve customer issues

  • Manage customers’ expectations and experience in a way that results in high customer satisfaction

  • Develop and maintain technical expertise in assigned areas of product functionality and utilize that expertise effectively to help customers / partners

  • Create knowledge base materials dedicated towards operational efficiency while also empowering and enabling the Customer / Partner Community

  • Research, document, and escalate cases according to procedure

  • Review support cases for technical and troubleshooting accuracy

  • Ensure client requests are acknowledged and resolved within service level agreement times

  • Provide a superior client experience by providing timely updates and problem resolution

  • Identify and document opportunities for improvement based on client suggestions

  • Work closely with Product Development and the Quality Assurance teams to move issues through the software release process

  • Actively participate in job related training

  • Define and describe technical best practices

item.title: C++ (Senior) Developer for the SAP HANA database team Job at SAP SE (Walldorf, Deutschland)
item.description:
COMPANY DESCRIPTION

SAP is the global market leader for business software and thus contributes a considerable part of the world's economic power grid. At SAP you get your chance to put your ideas into action with maximum impact.The SAP HANA in-memory database is the basis for new, ground-breaking SAP applications and is widely agreed to be a highly valuable asset in the SAP software portfolio. In-memory computing is made possible through recent technology advances in main memory, multi-core processing, and data management. It leverages technology innovation to establish real-time analysis of business data and combines both transactions and analytics to improve existing business processes with a dramatic increase in performance. The SAP HANA in-memory database as basis for the in-memory computing shows enormous promise as a key driver for SAP market of the future. The development of the SAP HANA in-memory database is distributed over all continents. You will be part of the development team in Walldorf with more than 100 exceptionally talented and motivated colleagues. We live code development in a flexible and agile way. You will be part of small and self-organized groups of developer.

EXPECTATIONS AND TASKS

We seek for developers with strong focus in C++ system or application programming. The main task of the job is to drive and implement development topic as part of a development team inside the core of the SAP HANA in-memory database. You can expect to work on some of the following tasks:
- Write meticulous software implementations in classical main memory database areas such as compression algorithms, distribution algorithms or query processing as well as in domain specific extensions like processing of geo spatial information, graph processing, hierarchical information processing or database programming languages
- Write basic regression tests for your own code using different programming languages (e.g. C++, Python, SQL) and testing frameworks (e.g. Google C++ Testing Framework)
- Do code reviews and code audits to spot opportunities for improvements with respect to usability, testability, supportability, or potential performance penalties

WORK EXPERIENCE

Working experience in software development.

EDUCATION AND QUALIFICATION / SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES

We are looking for candidates who are committed to a technology career path. Your set of application documents should contain a cover letter and CV, copies of the obtained degrees and references. Required skills
- Strong C++ programming skills
- University degree in computer science or related technical discipline
- Basic knowledge on relational database management systems
- Excellent German and English both spoken and written
- Willingness to analyze and debug complex problems
- Good communication skills Preferred skills
- Experience in Administration, Programming or Profiling on Linux
- Knowledge of code-analysis tools e.g. Valgrind, Intel Amplifier, Cppchecker
- Experience with continuous integration concepts and tools e.g. Git, Gerrit
- Python or Shell-Scripting programming skills
- Working experience in the area of system or application programming with C++
- Expertise with architecture of relational database management systems101014132

item.title: Senior Software Developer at ThoughtWorks (Melbourne, Australia)
item.description:
ThoughtWorks is hunting for talented developers who know how to create great code to join us in Melbourne. 

Being a consultancy, our teams work on a huge variety of projects. You could be helping shape the digital strategy of a retail giant, building a new mobile platform for a bank, creating an app to support an awareness campaign for Indigenous Australians or helping the science community locate meteorites that have fallen to earth.  All of this whilst building quadcopters or robotic arms in your spare time.


Examples of some of our current projects:




  • Mobile applications including native Android and iOS for telco, retailers, banking clients as well as less traditional science and indigenous communities 

  • HTML5 rich web applications using AngularJS and NodeJS

  • Large scale distributed systems with big data using technologies like Storm, Hadoop, Elastic and Cassandra

  • Functional programming languages like Scala and Clojure for heavy data processing projects



We're a big believer in diversity.  We build software for a wide variety of people so we think that a wide variety of people should build our software.  We abhor and reject discrimination and inequality, and promote diversity in all its forms. We proudly, passionately and actively strive to make both ThoughtWorks and our industry more reflective and inclusive of the society that we serve.  As long as you're an opinionated, disruptive thinker, we'd like to hear from you.


We don't do bureaucracy, or hierarchy but you do get lots of autonomy and we actively encourage you to experiment with new technologies without limitation. 


In addition to all this, we have some great extra benefits including a generous training budget and one of the best parental leave packages in Australia.


As a general rule of thumb our languages and technical environments range across Java, Ruby, Scala, Clojure, C#, Python, iOS, Android and Javascript. Do you have 5+ years' commercial experience in any of these languages?  Are you a proud code geek looking for a home? Do you get a buzz out of helping others get their geek on? We'd love to talk to you!


To apply or find out more, use the links and we will be in touch soon.

item.title: Developer at Big Rock Brewery- Calgary location (Calgary, AB, Canada)
item.description:
Big Rock Brewery: Overview | LinkedIn









POSITION SUMMARY:
Reporting to the IT Manager, the Developer is responsible for the bulk of Big Rock’s programming and web design needs. The Developer will also be the backup for the IT Manager and will be expected to know basic network management in a Windows Active Directory environment. Desktop support is also required.
JOB FUNCTIONS:

SECONDARY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Windows Server 2008 or higher administration

Oversee all aspects of Big Rock’s website, including security, customer data collection, troubleshooting, updating and working with Marketing to ensure that we maximize our visitor’s experience when visiting the site
Any additional I.T. and technology related tasks as assigned.

item.title: Systems Engineer at ROBLOX (San Mateo, CA)
item.description:
About the Job
Become a member of an elite technical team advancing the infrastructure of ROBLOX, the largest indie game development platform in the world with more than 17 million unique active users. We are ranked #1 among kids entertainment sites in the U.S. for the number of daily visitors, total minutes, total page views, total visits, and average length of visits by ComScore. Each month we have more than 4.4 million active users and more than 70 million hours of engagement. Our users have created more than 15 million games and have played 2 billion hours since 2008.

As a Data Center Ops Engineer, your duties will include, but are not limited to:



  • Maintain a 99.9% SLA for a 24/7/365 production environment

  • Triage, troubleshoot, and solve production issues caused by failures in hardware, configuration, networking, vendor outages, and continuous software upgrades

  • Quickly resolve complex problems encountered during the installation and operation of our applications, to ensure negligible impact on players and internal operations

  • Prioritize and multitask daily responsibilities, while being flexible enough to respond to emergent high-priority issues

  • Design, deploy and configure servers and complex firewall environments

  • Assist in implementing disaster recovery procedures and system failover efforts

  • Collaborate with highly skilled and driven colleagues in a dynamic, agile environment

  • Collect, document and help manage vendor-related services

  • Manage systems and develop contingency plans

  • Participate in on-call rotations


Our infrastructure management system is highly automated, enabling engineers to interact with thousands of servers across multiple environments in parallel via the command line. Our application space includes database scalability, caching, message queuing, wide-table search, recommendations, user ratings, services for mobile devices, gaming cloud management, and virtualization. We live in both the cloud and traditional data center environments.


Perks & Benefits:



  • Robust medical, dental and vision insurance

  • 401k

  • Flexible time-off

  • Wellness reimbursement

  • Free onsite parking & other commuter benefits

  • Free catered lunches & a fully stocked kitchen with unlimited snacks!

  • Chance to work with a top-notch team on cool and unique projects!


ROBLOX does not accept unsolicited resumes from 3rd party recruiters.

item.title: Software Engineer - NLP Developer at Ontoit Holdings Ltd (London, UK)
item.description:
Ontoit is looking for an energetic and proactive Software Engineer responsible for developing the core of Ontoit's semantic search engine platform. In this critical and exciting phase of Ontoit's growth, you will be an integral contributor in forming the future of our company.


At Ontoit, we work in various fields of computer science, including machine learning, natural language processing, graph technologies, knowledge representation (ontologies), distributed systems, and web applications. The core technologies that we use include, but is not limited to, Apache Storm, Neo4J, CoreNLP, Apache Spark, Apache Cassandra and Java Spring. As an NLP Developer, you will be involved in the development of our Natural Language Processing system component. In conjunction with the CEO and key team members you will be involved in driving the design and technical specifications of the system and responsible for developing high quality code for challenging algorithmic back end development.


The compensation for this position will be in the range of £30-40,000 per annum plus potentially equity options, all depending on the experience and skill level of the successful applicant.


Ontoit will accept applications for this position until 18th of September, 2015.

item.title: Senior Java Engineer for Disruptive Insurance Startup at Goji (Boston, MA)
item.description:
Insurance is a complex product that everyone needs but few understand. At Goji, our mission is to deliver something that consumers aren’t getting anywhere else – clarity and peace of mind. In a market that bombards consumers with gimmicky ways to save, we provide consumers an easy way to comparison shop top brands and purchase insurance that best fits their needs. By combining human expertise with smart technology, Goji has helped over 700,000 people make better, more informed decisions. As a result, we have grown quickly to become one of the largest independent, online insurance agencies in the country.


Job Summary:


Our vision is to integrate the fractured value chain from consumers to insurance carriers by building cutting-edge applications (e.g. Expedia or Charles Schwab for insurance). Thus, technology and data are at the core of what differentiates us in a large industry that is ripe for disruption. Here are a few of the ambitious projects we are working on:



  • A responsive SaaS application for our sales process that integrates a robust predictive dialer, a dynamic customer relationship management system, and an end-to-end insurance buying platform

  • Real-time lead buying platform based on rigorous data analytics

  • Integrating with carrier partners to transact policies completely on our platform

  • Customer facing portal to purchase, view and manage policies


The Goji development team is led by folks who have leveraged their backgrounds in computer science, math and engineering to build and scale multiple technology companies. We strongly believe that empowered people are the key to building a great company, and our development process focuses on iteratively improving our product as well as ourselves as individuals and as a team. We are looking to add a Senior Engineer who can be a core member of our team and work on every part of the stack to accelerate product development. So if you share our ambition and want to help shape the technology that will make it happen, then join our team!

item.title: Senior Software Engineer (.NET) - IoT/Cleantech Company at Syncromatics (Los Angeles, CA)
item.description:
Tagline: Make Transit Work


Come help us build the next generation of technology for the transportation industry!


Syncromatics is a leading provider of Intelligent Transportation Systems (ITS) serving transit agencies, universities and private operators across the country.  We collect GPS and other sensor data from buses, shuttles, trolleys and other moving vehicles and then transport it via cellular networks to our back-end systems for real-time aggregation, analytics, alerting and reporting.  All of this information is used by dispatchers, transit planners and the riding public to make transit systems more accessible to riders, and run more efficiently for operators.


Location: Downtown Los Angeles, CA (DTLA)


Syncromatics is headquartered in the PacMutual building, located adjacent to Pershing Square and easily accessible via the 7th St/Metro Center and Pershing Square Metro stations.  Many of our employees take advantage of public transportation.  Employees who choose to drive are made fun of for excessively loving their cars and paying for parking.  The Pershing Square/Bunker Hill area is a thriving, revitalized area of downtown Los Angeles with limitless restaurants, coffee shops, gyms, shopping and other amenities.  Our building alone houses Water Grill, Tender Greens, Starbucks, Earthbar, two amazing French cafes (Le Pain Quotidien and Pitchoun), a sandwich shop, a crepe place, Verizon, FedEx and a high-end boutique fashion store that never has any customers.  Did we mention that a Whole Foods is going in a few blocks away where you'll be able to overspend on lunch every day? The Kogi taco truck also sets up shop nearby every Friday!


The Role:


In addition to being able to consume vast quantities of food, we're looking for a strong .NET generalist eager to work in an environment with a diverse ecosystem of applications:  web apps and services, native mobile apps, high-level embedded apps, network programming, the Actor Model (Akka.net), messaging systems, relational databases, etc.  We don't expect incoming engineers to have experience/expertise in all of these areas but we seek those who are looking to learn new things and have confidence in their own ability to get up to speed quickly.


Problems you will tackle:



  • Building a highly-available, distributed system using messaging systems and the actor model

  • Reporting on large amounts of event, log and time-series data

  • Building out scalable RESTful APIs for both internal and external consumption

  • Building real-time, web-socket based user interfaces


Our Engineering Culture



  • We pride ourselves on being connected with the growing open-source community in the .NET world.

  • TDD, continuous integration, frequent deployments.

  • ChatOps - in addition to being the control center for deploying apps, our chat rooms give us insight into our system health, Kanban process and where people are eating lunch.


Benefits:



  • Generous Health and Dental Benefits, 401k plan, bonus plan. Parking stipend, or if you take public transportation, we'll cover the entire pass (including Metrolink)!

  • kegerator, ping pong, caffeinated beverages, snacks, you know, standard issue stuff…

item.title: Graduate Developer - Reboot the classroom at Sparx (Exeter, UK)
item.description:
As a Graduate Developer at Sparx, you’ll be an integral part of the team from day one, forming the heart of our technical expertise and potential.


You’ll be joining our team of games and software developers, supporting the development of the technical framework of the Sparx system. If software is your thing, you’ll be writing tablet native code (we currently work on iPads) to run the Sparx resource. You’ll get to see software you’ve helped program go live in a classroom the next day. Then you’ll be diving straight back in to making it better, getting into the detail, zooming out to look at the bigger picture, solving each problem and trying out the next idea. If gaming is more your thing, you’ll be supporting the designing, programming and testing of high quality games for a variety of subjects. The games you help create will need to get under the skin of what makes students tick and, working closely with the expert team around you, uncover exactly what is going to help them overcome each obstacle in understanding that they face.


Things happen at breakneck speed at Sparx and you’ll need to think creatively to help the team get from A to B. Our work is ever evolving so you’ll have plenty of opportunities to make your mark and take on increasing responsibility as time goes on.

item.title: Back-end Developer at Carpages.ca (Autopath Technologies Inc.) (Mississauga, ON, Canada)
item.description:
Summary:


We are looking for an experienced developer to assist with the development of new and existing web-based products. This person will be focused on the Architecture, Prototyping, Developing, and Testing our applications.


You are the ideal candidate if you have built substantial projects that you can reference as examples. Merely following instructions is not enough. We need people who build things. You have experience building adaptive and responsive websites working in a team environment with other developers at varying levels of skill. You will be responsible for the design and build of new features and enhancement of existing features within our symfony+Doctrine framework. Practically, this includes designing normalized data models (Doctrine), optimizing corresponding database tables (MySQL), and working together with front-end developers as the controller/view is implemented (Symfony). The resulting product should be visually and functionally finished, ready for testing.


Technical Skills



  • Expert knowledge of LAMP stack, specifically MySQL and PHP

  • Expert in a PHP framework (Symfony, Code Igniter, Zend, etc.)

  • Proficient in profiling and optimizing code and queries for large, traffic-intense sites

  • Extensive experience with automated testing frameworks and BDD/TDD methodologies

  • Strong understanding of service-oriented architecture and developing APIs

  • Strong understanding of MVC, ORM, and data modeling

  • Solid command of source control concepts and tools 


Soft Skills



  • Strong verbal and written communication skills

  • Strong knowledge of software design patterns principles

  • Attention to detail and thorough

  • Self-starter who can work with a team to accomplish business objectives


Character and Personality


You are a person who is trustworthy, detail oriented, teachable and able to accept constructive criticism, and self-motivated.


Responsibilities



  • Good Application Design - An intrinsic sense and knowledge of how to put things together “the right way”, and having a desire to develop with excellence and use of best practices.

  • Meeting Business Objectives - Not allowing your desire for excellence in application design to trump meeting the business objectives in functionality or timelines. Knowing how to balance these two ideals.

  • Rapid Prototyping - Prove, disprove, or improve on ideas quickly by creating implementations that can be tested by real users and iterated upon.

  • Testing - Implement TDD/BDD testing standards that can benefit the entire team and ensure seamless production rollouts in the long term.


Is that you!? Get in touch! We’d love to know more about you! Send in your resume, portfolio, or your favourite GitHub contribution.

item.title: Senior Full Stack Web Engineer at ROBLOX (San Mateo, CA)
item.description:
Help us build the world’s best user generated gaming platform, supporting integrated desktop and mobile gameplay. We have a viral gaming directory, a massive virtual goods catalog, and an engaged social network. We also have a broad technology stack, including best-of-breed open-source components, a high-speed C# back-end, SQL and NoSQL data stores, and cloud services (both Amazon and our own proprietary cloud).


ROBLOX does not accept unsolicited resumes from 3rd party recruiters.

item.title: Software Developer for dynamic startup, latest web technologies at MindLink Software (London, UK)
item.description:
You will work with our kick-ass core development team to design, develop and deliver our high-quality full-stack solutions in JavaScript and C#.


Want to build high-quality mobile applications? You will, with MindLink targeting all major mobile operating systems (iOS, Android, BlackBerry 10) we use hybrid technology (cordova) to deliver a native experience with a highly shared code base.


Excited by developing and using your own APIs? MindLink has a core RESTful API that can be used to develop integrating components - you will help shape that API and use it for fun and useful side projects. Think hooking into GitHub, JIRA or the London Underground.


Love the latest technologies? We are passionate about using the latest technologies to deliver even better applications. The latest advancements in ECMAScript and .Net are readily brought in to make code more readable, more efficient and more modern.


Want to improve your JavaScript or .Net knowledge? You can, MindLink is full of bright engineers who you will work with closely developing across the full MindLink stack.


Care deeply about performance? We do too! Whether it's improving the user experience or optimising protocols to minimise data transfer there is always a way to get a little more performance.


Want to take on the next big challenge? MindLink is making professional chat easy, elegant and powerful. Innovating what once was stale and integrating into the lives of millions of professionals in companies around the globe.


Think you have the skill, ideas and playful determination to join our team? You could be part of research and development or the fast-paced agile product release team.

item.title: Senior .NET Developer at Excelian (London, UK)

Excelian are looking for Server Side C# Developers who will be an enthusiastic and disciplined technologist, with experience across multiple projects, able to take on a variety of development roles in fast paced financial markets projects.


You should be someone who keeps abreast of the key technology trends in their field and who is keen to contribute to the community of technologists across the company, as well as mentoring more junior developers. In particular, you must be delivery focussed, adaptable, pragmatic yet thorough and able to analyse requirements.


We need you to contribute to the design of elements of code and applications, implement best practice and have experience of working in a variety of methodologies, including Agile and Waterfall. Fundamentally we are looking for someone who is more than just a developer who has a consultancy mind-set, can write enterprise quality code at the same time as contributing to the client and Excelian.


 As a server side developer, the candidate will be responsible for:



  • Designing and implementing database schema, i.e. tables, stored procedures, functions, keys, indices, etc in SQL Server 2005/2008

  • Implementing interfaces/apis to expose access methods to database in Data Access Layer, Business Logic Layer, etc

  • Designing and building WCF, Windows Service components to fulfill the business process flow

  • Coordinating with Front-End UI developers and BAs to ensure smooth and seamless delivery

  • Writing Unit Tests to ensure desired code coverage (>80%)

  • Implementing automated regression test framework using Fitnesse

Our products are completely API driven which allows for an incredible amount of flexibility and creativity around the ecosystem we build. We love experimenting with new technologies and doing mash-ups with our APIs and would expect you to be imaginative with them also.


We consider design and usability to be paramount for the success of our product -- both, for our front-end app and our APIs. You're expected to be creative and throw in you're own "special sauce" into our products -- whether it's beautiful animations or fun easter eggs, you'll have the freedom to make the product "yours".

We are seeking a full-time Node.js/Web developer to join our fast growing bioinformatics team.

Full-time Node.js/UI Web Developer



You'll be building web applications to enable our customers and enable our team members. You'll be building custom interfaces, work queues, weekly reports, dashboards, and integrating with several in-bound/out-bound interfaces. Nice to have:
