Must be willing to take a remote programming test as part of the application process. No independent contractors and no free-lancers.

item.title: Software Engineer at Noom (New York, NY)
item.description:
You


Noom is looking for an awesome Software Engineer who's a true team player and passionate about engineering, with tons of programming experience (doesn't matter if it was at Apple or in your mom’s basement) and excellent communication skills. A CS background or degree usually helps a lot, but is not a strict requirement if you really know your stuff.


Our Tech


At our core, we are a team of great engineers from world-class companies, so we take our tech very seriously. We work to improve our tools and approaches every day -- whether pushing the envelope with automated unit-tests or writing a super-optimized data analysis framework. We don't over-engineer and also don't under-engineer -- just the right tool for the job.


We take great pride in our code because we all want to innovate quickly. We build everything from Android software to C++ image recognition, from web UI to pedometer data analysis. Our apps operate off-line, and we have built lots of client-side infrastructure to lazily load and sync data with the server. This allows us to keep the server side relatively simple while still serving millions of users: Spring/Flask, Spring MVC, mySQL/Mongo.


We run Hadoop-based machine learning to find out what makes people stick to habits, create online clustering algorithms to match people to their ideal support group, serve millions of users with many terabytes of data, and tackle many difficult challenges every day. Because we are small dev team (17 strong), working at Noom gives you the unique opportunity to both use what we have created and build many more foundational technologies.  


Our Culture


We have worked hard to build an awesome company culture, stealing a bit from Google (many of us are ex-Googlers) and improving on it to become one of Crain’s “Best Places to Work in NYC 2013”  


Our tech team works with a ton of interesting Noomers and advisers, including our in-house psychologist as well as fitness experts, physicians and researchers.  We test our prototypes on sample users, averaging 2 user-tests a day, so you’ll be able to see how real people react to your work and iterate.  So unlike most tech companies, you’ll interact with a diverse network of people.  After all, we are team of problem solvers, always interested in learning and growing.


If you’re worried about being pigeonholed, fear not.  You’ll get to choose a mission (usually for 4 - 6 months) and work on the projects you’re interested in. We also have frequent company-wide hackathons. Everyone on the team is a generalist -- we explore new frameworks, and learn them quickly. We like to learn.


We are now ready to double the size of our engineering team with some incredible engineers (read on below!).


Our Company


Noom, Inc. is a mobile solutions company focused on preventative health.


Noom's research-backed products help people achieve real, positive outcomes. Noom was awarded a grant from the National Institutes of Health (NIH) and was also recently selected as one of seven healthcare startups chosen to participate in the 2014 New York Digital Health Accelerator (NYDHA).


Noom's apps boast more than 32 million installs worldwide and its flagship app Noom Coach for Android has been the #1 top grossing Health and Fitness App since 2012 in the Google Play Store. Noom has offices in New York City, Berlin, Seoul and Tokyo.


But we need your help -- read on if you think you’ve got the stuff.


Our Products


At Noom we tackle some of the world’s biggest problems -- obesity, diabetes and heart disease.  We believe the best way to do this is by focusing on nutrition (TechCrunch) and fitness (GigaOm).  More than just counting calories, our mobile software applications offer intelligent, scientifically-backed, customized nutrition- and exercise-coaching designed to impact habits and behavior.  


Our flagship app, Noom Weight Loss Coach, has been the #1 top grossing health & fitness application since 2012.  It achieves the best outcomes in the industry with over 10 pounds lost per paid member.  How, you ask?  Great question!  It has:


* A coaching engine that generates personalized daily tasks & realtime motivational feedback;


* The world’s most accurate food database, crowd-sourced by users & instantly searchable;


* Virtual support groups created using automated clustering technology and tracked using scalable management tools.


* A focus on simplicity and friendliness, to make all of the above easy to use


* Many more features focused around guidance & motivation for our users


Our Benefits


If you want to learn how a startup really works on the inside, then Noom is the place for you. We have an incredible amount of transparency, with weekly all-company TGIFs where the wine and the information both flow freely (much to our legal counsel’s dismay).  Because you’ll have equity in the company and have to make many decisions in your work, it’s important for you to know what’s going on.  


We have an amazing chef (we love her!) who prepares gourmet lunches every day for all employees (along with afternoon smoothies and random breakfasts and dinners), a lively office with frequent visitors, and a dedicated team who work hard and play hard, with frequent offsites (beach, anyone?) and team outings (from shuffleboard to wine tasting).  We also have more cakes than is probably healthy (welcome cakes, birthday cakes, goodbye cakes and cakes just because -- no joke).


Plus health insurance (100% paid by Noom) and a 401(k). We also have a $200 wellness budget, which you can spend on everything from triathlon registration fees to massages.

item.title: System Administrator at Old Mission Capital, LLC (Chicago, IL)

item.title: Lead-utvecklare för Offerta.se at Offerta AB (Stockholm, Sweden)
item.description:
Vi söker efter en Lead-utvecklare för att komplettera och förstärka vårt produkutvecklingsteam. Vi bygger allt från webbsajten Offerta.se, mobilappar, externa integrationer och API:er, till vårt interna affärssystem och andra verksamhetsstöd.


Som Lead .NET-utvecklare kommer du att hjälpa till att utveckla Sveriges modernaste och mest avancerade teknikplattform för tjänsteförmedling. Du kommer att vara en viktig del med mycket ansvar i ett starkt team av backend- och frontendutvecklare som alla är yrkesstolta experter på sina respektive områden.


Teamet har ett viktigt ansvar för att både utveckla ny, men också förfina existerande funktionalitet, med balansering av behoven mellan avdelningarna internt på Offerta AB, samt externt mot tjänstköpare och tjänsteleverantörer på Offerta.se.


Vi strävar alltid efter att hålla befintlig teknologi uppdaterad och att använda ny teknologi där det underlättar vår uppgift att leverera den bästa möjliga teknikplattformen, både kortsiktigt och långsiktigt.

item.title: Android Senior Software Engineer at Netflix (Los Gatos, CA)
item.description:
Netflix is the leading video streaming service globally and the Netflix Android app is one of the most widely used and highly rated mobile applications. We work hard to constantly improve the performance, features, and quality of the app as we expand our coverage to 150+ countries in 2016.


Our Android innovation team is currently leading development of new products and features for all mobile clients at Netflix. Examples of current and upcoming projects include:



  • redesign of the app for phones to provide easier and more personalized browsing of content

  • improved, more informative second-screen experience for Chromecast

  • dedicated experience for kids on tablets


Each client team also controls the code for its endpoint, which allows for the ideal amount of customization and control in transferring data across the wire. We make an effort to be flexible and up-to-date with our tools and processes, and are always working to reduce developer friction.


We'd love for you to join our team of senior engineers and take on this unique opportunity to delight millions of users each day!

You have a strong work ethic and consider yourself a top producer of robust, clear and efficient code. You are a problem solver, and are comfortable finding/creating and implementing solutions.


Reporting to the Director of Product Software, you will develop, test, debug, document, and implement iOS applications. We are a small team so flexibility is essential. This is a unique opportunity to enter an established startup at the ground floor while leveraging off an already market successful consumer retail product into a new and fresh market space.


The Role:
• Develop, test, debug, document, and implement iOS applications
• Create high quality prototypes
• Utilize and contribute to best practices

item.title: iOS Software Engineer, Mobile Applications at Google (Mountain View, CA)
item.description:
At Google, we care deeply about our iOS users, and we develop for iOS as enthusiastically as we do for Android. We strive to enable users on any platform to access Google products and services — from mainstays like Maps, Search, and YouTube to cutting-edge projects like Translate, Photos, and Google Now — in the best possible way. And we solve problems at Google's unique scale, bringing large data to small devices and crafting elegant user experiences.


As an iOS software engineer, you’ll get to work on products that help millions of people around the world, and collaborate with other passionate mobile developers to bring the most delightful and useful services and apps to life. You should be comfortable with Objective-C and have extensive knowledge of iOS development techniques and practices.


Responsibilities



  • Design and implement new user-facing features in Google’s large, complex mobile applications.

  • Build the libraries and frameworks that support authentication, copresence, and cutting-edge network protocols.

  • Optimize mobile applications on the iOS platform.

  • Develop prototypes quickly.

item.title: Frontend Developer for Startup in Berlin (m/f) at Whitewall GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description: You are developing and maintaining an e-commerce shop (Magento) for a lifestyle nutrition brand. With your knowledge and the ability to learn quickly, you are responsible for the entire frontend concept (website and shop). You are the technical driver of a young health company and ensure that all IT-processes are clean and scalable. Additionally, you support our managing team by managing our website and give them technical advice in regard to tracking technologies and data management (SQL). You will think outside the box and solve complicated problems.

item.title: Head of Content at Cloud Academy Inc. (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
We educate the world on cloud technologies and believe that cloud is a major revolution for all the industries worldwide. We help people and companies in 140+ countries understanding cloud technologies, build software and infrastructures in a better way and make it a concrete part of their career. Our training approach is practical, vendor-independent and globally accessible. In a multi-platform cloud world we discovered how difficult and confusing is understanding and following cloud technologies for companies and professionals to make them part of their teams and strategies. 


Head of Content at Cloud Academy


We are looking for a real leader, passionate about technology, training and skills development. You find yourself very comfortable working with engineers, editors, content managers and technical leaders. You will mainly lead our content operations but you will need to apply your technical knowledge and experience to help our product team and to help scaling our operations.


As Head of Content you are the leader of our content organization: your biggest goal is building a strong team of passionate engineers and subject experts and lead them to create state-of-the-art educational training for people and companies in 200+ countries worldwide. In this role you build our content strategy including defining the right processes and define learning paths within a broad set of products like Courses, Labs and Quizzes. 


What you will do at Cloud Academy as Head of Content



  • Content strategy. Create, organize and manage our content strategy for our training. Today we work with a product composed of video courses, laboratories (proprietary technology) and quizzes (proprietary technology). 

  • Content team. Hire and manage a team of engineers and content professionals that will create and manage our content and work with you to define our roadmap

  • Content process. Create and optimize the best content creation process for our business to allow Cloud Academy to scale with the number of courses, labs and quizzes produced. You will work with our tech team on our technology, Content Engine, to optimize its efficiency. 

  • Define learning paths and curriculum. Work with subject experts in your team to define learning paths and curriculum for our training, both for individuals and enterprise

  • Work with Sales, Marketing and Tech. Work with tech, sales and marketing to align the company on our content strategy, study the best technical solutions to improve our processes and measure results and retention of our customers within our content. 

  • Data-driven approach: you will work with our engineers to study our metrics, understand what are the most important KPIs for our customers' success and iterate on your strategy. 


Cloud technologies and DevOps focus for our training strategy


Are you an AWS, Azure or Google Cloud expert, excited about DevOps and the revolution in the IT industry? Did you spend the last 5 years working in the infrastructure/ cloud industry or building technology? 


Great! We are looking for you! You will build your team looking at people that can help you executing the content strategy, improving our content creation process and scale our content to satisfy our increasing number of customers in the enterprise and consumer world. As a vendor-independent provider our vision bring us to deal with different cloud technologies from the most known vendors and in the ecosystem. Our customers look at us to understand and implement that technologies in their business. 


You are excited by e-learning and career development and love to empower people with new skills, experimenting with engineers and experts the best way to deliver and acquire them. 


Scale and manage our training content at a global level


You are passionate about data-driven strategies. You will regularly work with our tech team to analyze results and numbers related to our training product, both for B2C and B2B and you will make decisions based on data, trends and customers' feedback. You will create the right team of e-learning experts and subject experts to assist you in the process. 


You will report to the CEO with an assigned budget to manage all the content operations company-wide. Cloud Academy offers a very competitive salary, bonuses and stocks. 


This position is full-time and it is based in San Francisco/Bay Area

item.title: Software Engineer at Google (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
Google aspires to be an organization that reflects the globally diverse audience that our products and technology serve. We believe that in addition to hiring the best talent, a diversity of perspectives, ideas and cultures leads to the creation of better products and services.


Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how millions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our ambitions reach far beyond just Search. Our products need to handle information at the the scale of the web. We're looking for ideas from every area of computer science, including information retrieval, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking, security, data compression, and user interface design; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you work on a small team and can switch teams and projects as our fast-paced business grows and evolves. We need our engineers to be versatile and passionate to tackle new problems as we continue to push technology forward. 



Responsibilities


  • Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve software.

  • Manage individual project priorities, deadlines and deliverables.

item.title: C++ Developer (Remote Administrator) Prague, Czech Republic at ESET (Prague, Czech Republic)
item.description:
What does working as C++ Developer entail?


C++ developers working on ESET Remote Administrator are involved in developing server-side software, which enables administrators to manage and configure ESET security products deployed on individual devices.


To give you a little taste, a typical task for a C++ developer working in our team can be as follows: “Please propose and implement a new network protocol, data replication between servers and new functionality in the user web interface. Please do it with a high degree of effectiveness because our server system has to be able to handle tens to hundreds of thousands of endpoints.”

item.title: Senior Software Developer at Rackspace, the #1 managed cloud company (Windcrest, TX)
item.description:
Do you believe in the power of Open Source? Does contributing to the Open Source community WHILE working making you happier than an engineer who just found the ultimate gif? Is collaboration a key component to what makes you tick? If you answered yes to any/all of these, then you really need to be a Software Developer at Rackspace.


With the largest OpenStack public cloud in the business and our commitment to build the best private cloud offering in the industry, the life of a dev at the Rack can be different but don’t worry we will help match your skills, passions and birthday wishes with the right opportunity. Here’s a preview to get you started:


Private Cloud:
Rackspace has some of the most notable upstream OpenStack contributors on the planet. Duh…we co-founded the thing so of course we do and you will have the opportunity to do the same. Private cloud devs literally pound out Python code from all over the globe in one of our offices or from the comfort of their own home if they have shown superior abilities, yet don’t worry we have the tools to keep you connected when you need to be. These teams manage, scale and optimize every aspect of the customer’s environment including a little Ops work so be ready to own it like it’s your own little baby.


Public Cloud:
The largest OpenStack public cloud in the world just obviously means huge, large-scale, highly distributed customer environments that extend to many of our 10+ global data centers. Python, Ruby, PHP you name it. Teams are made up of specialists for each but they dabble in everything. Swiss Army code knives are just how we roll. This squad pulls in other devs from other business units, infrastructure engineers and quality engineering all to get the job done. No one fails alone because they are never left alone. Even as they push the bounds of big data or whatever comes out next they learn together and win together.


What are you waiting for? Click that apply button, get a chance to talk with one of our talent specialists and get ready to jump on in to the best adventure you’ve ever had.


Still not convinced? See what the Rackspace teams are doing for our customers. Rokkan Story

From the data curation and training of machine learning systems to the preparation of robust and battle-tested object oriented code, the work of a machine learning R&D role at AlchemyAPI is always exciting.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - Python at StorageCraft Technology Corporation (Draper, UT)
item.description:
This is an exciting opportunity for a talented and enthusiastic software engineer who wants to make a difference within a successful, growing company. StorageCraft is looking for a Software Engineer to work on a range of in-house projects. The job provides a degree of freedom that you will not find in larger companies; you will be able to work using multiple software languages and operating systems and help shape the complete design from the ground up. If you are an enthusiastic coder that is looking for a job that makes use of your critical thinking and creativity, then this is it.


DUTIES
You will work within a small, friendly software engineering team and work on a number of critical products and projects. There is always a wide variety of problems that need to be solved so you will be expected to learn and adapt quickly, providing the best solution for each problem. Ideally you are detail-oriented, self-motivated, a problem solver and work well in a fast moving, dynamic work environment.


Minimum Qualifications:



  •  3-5+ years of experience of writing good quality code in C++, C#, Java or similar

  •  Proven experience of writing scripts in Python, batch, Perl and other languages

  •  Solid understanding of coding concepts including object orientated design

  •  Proven experience of both Windows and Linux

  •  Knowledge of various development methodologies including Agile

  •  Knowledge of building and compiling products developed in multiple languages

  •  Knowledge of application deployment technology and installers, including the MSI model and related technology (e.g. Installshield, WiX, NSIS etc.).

  •  Willing and able to learn quickly and work within a team


Knowledge of any of the following is an advantage:



  •  Django 

  •  Virtualization technology 

  •  Experience with complex application build systems and installers

  •  Windows and Linux command line options and utilities

  •  Experience with any test automation frameworks and methodologies

  •  Backup technology, including block-level backups and the VSS framework

  •  SQL database experience

  •  SQL Alchemy

  •  Linux development experience


Education:
Associates or Bachelors Degree in Computer Science or related field or equivalent experience preferred.


EOE/Minorities/Females/Vet/DisabilityThis

item.title: Software Engineer at Soylent (Los Angeles, CA)
item.description:
The Software Engineer Position


Soylent’s engineers build software to help get Soylent into customers hands as quickly and easily as possible. You’ll be tasked with creating tools to help with many aspects of e-commerce companies that operate at our scale. Projects in our pipeline include creating a robust order management system, integrating various data sources from 3rd party services into our backend databases, improving our internal business intelligence reporting tools, implementing processes to make our operating teams more effective, growing our e-commerce management tooling, and more.


We try to be as language agnostic as possible, choosing to work with the best tools and languages for the job (Although we really like Python and JavaScript). Scaling to meet consumer demand for Soylent will require engineers with knowledge in diverse areas such as building out our internal dev-ops tools or working closely with UX designers and frontend engineers to create great software experiences.


Responsibilities



  • Design and develop software with high level scripting languages like Python, JavaScript, etc.

  • Integrating with existing databases and APIs for payments and shipping

  • Building internal APIs for use by our frontend clients

  • Selecting frameworks, packages, and services 

  • Securing the data and privacy of all of our customers

  • Site analytics and usability testing

  • Working closely with UX designers, frontend developers, and 3rd parties

  • Building out our internal Postgres databases

  • Building devops and QA tools to increase internal development speed, reliability and efficiency

  • Ownership of projects that interest you

item.title: Sr Site Reliability Engineer at OpenX (Pasadena, CA)
item.description:
Would you like to work on one of the world’s hottest advertising technology platforms? Do you revel in the challenge of managing web-scale services and their underlying infrastructure, including thousands of globally distributed servers? Do you enjoy combining your software engineering, networking, and systems administration experience and expertise to build highly available, reliable, secure, and performant services? Are you passionate about DevOps?


OpenX, a leading provider of digital and mobile advertising technology, seeks a Sr Site Reliability Engineer to join our Application Engineering team responsible for the operability and support of OpenX systems and services. OpenX serves hundreds of thousands of requests per second from thousands of servers across a worldwide datacenter footprint.


You will take a proactive approach to maintain and improve service uptime and you will scale our systems for continued rapid growth. You will take part in the design of our services and be an active participant in the software development lifecycle, partnering with software engineers and product to deliver a world-class service. Additionally, you will handle planned or unplanned maintenance events and will execute a consistent software release process.


You ideally have experience with large-scale management of thousands of physical servers. You have excellent communication skills that enable you to collaborate with varying disciplines, both technical and non-technical. You are a self-starter, able to self-manage with minimal supervision, and have demonstrated the ability to lead groups to the right decision.


Developing for and supporting our infrastructure presents many interesting technical challenges. We especially desire candidates with a passion for open-source software and an interest in the latest system architecture trends, for example: OpenStack, Docker, CoreOS, Dais, Flynn, or other container-based or PaaS solutions.

item.title: Senior Java Software Developer with NOSQL & Cassandra Experience at BlackRock (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Aladdin Product Group develops and supports every facet of BlackRock’s information systems needs. Our global teams perform a wide variety of activities from maintaining system stability to growing the features and functionality of our state-of the-art trading and asset management platform, Aladdin. The breadth of our responsibilities calls for a diverse range of expertise.


The Aladdin Product Group, Business Operation Systems team provides technology solutions to support investment accounting, performance measurement, cash, asset reconciliation, Derivatives & Client Reporting. The team is responsible for a suite of applications including performance calculation, client and adhoc reporting systems, reconciliation and report publication tools. We innovate incrementally and focus on high level of client service through responsiveness and accuracy.


In this role you will be designing, implementing and supporting highly available, real-time, event driven solutions across the systems infrastructure of Business Operations functions in Aladdin.



  • Involvement in full SDLC in accounting, performance measurement, reconciliation and client reporting areas

  • Engineer and implement highly available storage and distribution systems using NoSQL technologies.

  • Implement new business logic into existing financial systems and services , specifically in the client reporting and accounting infrastructure applications and databases, to meet business and customer requirements, working closely with end-users, client operations staff, and other Aladdin development teams

  • Work on service-oriented architecture projects in JavaContribute to core Aladdin® library code used by hundreds of developers across the globe

  • Provide ideas for process enhancements that will result in development projects

  • Research and analyze the suitability of relational DB, NoSQL databases, and Big Data clusters, into various projects

  • Understand and refine business and functional requirements

  • Establish relationships with operations teams and streamline existing workflows to be more efficient and operationally independent.

  • Implement enhancements and perform maintenance in existing business operations applications, working closely with the client support teams to address issues that are escalated for resolution

  • Providing support for technical and/or operational issues encountered by our partners in business operations

item.title: Pre Sales Technical Evangelist at Openmind Networks Inc (Mountain View, CA)
item.description:
Are you a smart, creative, people-oriented engineer? Are you passionate about the software developer community? If so, we’d love to meet you!


Golgi is a cloud service for connectivity and data transport that decreases time to market in delivering IoT Solutions. Developers define their service using Thrift and use Golgi to generate type-safe APIs specific to their needs. Golgi significantly cuts development time and allows the developer to concentrate on adding value to their app or device.



You will be a passionate evangelist for Golgi (http://golgi.io) as well as a champion for developer interests within Openmind Networks. This is a position for engineers who love being out in the wild working with developers around innovative technology.
You will help build and foster the community and help extend the technical direction around the product by being the lead Developer Advocate for Golgi.


Your responsibilities will include the following:


- Educate prospective clients by assessing customers’ needs and recommending solutions that optimize value for both the customer and Golgi - Create momentum and drive the success of Golgi through your interactions with third party developers


- Hands-on coding with developers on-site; 1st line technical support for developers


- Evangelize Golgi by participating in technical presentations on conference panels, at user groups, on social media/blogs/forums, at meetups, through technical articles, etc.


- Generate sample content (demo applications/snippets), tutorials and technical documentation using a variety of development languages and platforms; Publish open-source projects that allow developers, partners and customers to quickly understand and utilize our SDK


- Advocate for developers internally and influence the technical direction and roadmap for Golgi. Work cross-functionally with Engineering, Business Development, and Marketing

item.title: Application Support Engineer - Tier 2 at Remedy Partners Inc. (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Remedy Production Support team seeks a Tier 2 Application Support Engineer. In this role, you will help support Remedy System’s growing user base for our enterprise technology platform and Episode Connect: an innovative care coordination platform used by Remedy Partners and hospitals across the country to manage patients in bundled payment episodes.



Key Responsibilities:


•Use available tools, resources to resolve user tickets – ranging from account requests to database inquiries


•Help build tools to assist team in day-to-day support operations


•Work on group and firm-wide projects collaborating with various teams


•Mentor junior team members in best practice support methods

item.title: UX Designer at Windsor Circle, Inc (Durham, NC)
item.description:
You’re a seasoned product designer who’s eager to own the overall design for new and existing product innovations to support our 9 Pillars of Retention Automation framework.  Your breadth and prior experience gives you the confidence that you can go the distance from early concept sketches to detailed interaction designs and visual assets in order to make the Windsor Circle experience enjoyable and natural for users.


You’re excited to work across desktop, tablet, and mobile platforms to craft an overall experience that truly fits into the lives of customers.  You like working hands-on and side by side with a small team of people dedicated to making a successful product and company.  Finally, you’re confident in your design abilities but also flexible enough to make necessary adjustments based on market feedback, usage metrics, and the natural bumps inherent to an agile development process.  


Responsibilities:




  • Design highly usable and delightful user interfaces, experiences, and visuals week in and week out as part of a product team; owning both UX and visual design responsibilities




  • Develop conceptual diagrams, wireframes, visual mockups, click-throughs, or simple prototypes as needed to communicate ideas to the team and validate them with users




  • Continually refine and improve user-centered designs based on product goals, customer feedback, product metrics, and user research results




  • Assist in developing and maintaining detailed user-interface guidelines, design patterns, and style guides




  • Partner with product development teams to build enjoyable experiences; review designs with product managers and developers to spot difficulties, review new features as they are built to spot implementation gaps and identify future UX improvements




  • Present design work to large audiences at all levels within the company and lead constructive feedback discussions

item.title: Information Security Engineer Ethical Hacker at Time Inc. (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Job


The Information Security Engineer (Application Security) will join a team of other Information Security professionals reporting directly to the Global Manager - Application Security. The position will have primary responsibility for managing security architecture reviews, vulnerability assessments and penetration testing. The Information Security Engineer will be part of a team providing state-of-the-art technical expertise and support to clients, IT management and staff in risk assessment and the implementation of appropriate data security procedures and products.


You Will:



  • Collaborate with the Information Security staff in the evaluation of risks and threats, development, implementation, communication, operation, monitoring and maintenance of the IT security policies and procedures which promote a secure and uninterrupted operation of all IT systems

  • Identify emerging vulnerabilities, evaluates associated risks and threats and provides countermeasures where necessary

  • Monitor developments within application security and ensure internal policies, procedures, tools and awareness programs reflect current security methods such as those published by OWASP, WASC, etc.

  • Serve as a point of contact with business clients and consult with infrastructure and software development teams to design proper security architecture

  • Act as security liaisons with software developers globally

  • Conduct security architecture reviews for new development (web, digital, mobile) and modifications to existing ones

  • Conduct internal and oversee external penetration tests

  • Design and implement Secure SDLC program (policies, methodologies and tools) across the company globally

  • Execute formalized Information Security programs and processes, such as vulnerability management, event monitoring, data loss prevention, and incident response

  • Evaluate, implement and support information security related technology

  • Respond to information security alerts and analyze events for appropriate action

  • Conduct security awareness training for software developers

item.title: Jr. Network Engineer at Augmedix (San Francisco, CA)
item.description: A successful Network Engineer will have a proven record of engineering and implementation of network infrastructure, a strong sense of commitment, is highly business-oriented and skilled at delivering robust system solutions. You will collaborate with peers to deliver consistent world class network services for Augmedix and our customers. You will contribute to the global system architecture by ensuring a consistent standardization of the systems. This is a cross functional opportunity and will involve both networking and systems engineering. You will report to the Head of Network Engineering and act in the capacity of technical lead to other technical support staff.

item.title: DevOps Engineer at Syrinx Consulting Corporation (Boston, MA)
item.description:
Job Type: Contract or Contract-to-Hire


Over the past few years, the development and operations landscape has changed dramatically. The DevOps movement has shortened release cycles, increased automation, and created new tool chains to support an elastic, software-defined "modern infrastructure". These changes expand the threat surface for many organizations. Managing permissions for and distribution of critical secrets (e.g., SSH keys, SSL certificates, and API access tokens) is essential to protecting organizational and customer information. 



We are currently looking for Cloud Platform / DevOps Engineers to innovate upon the way our partners deploy, test, and develop their industry-leading software.



Our local partners include: a Cambridge based university, an educational technology firm, and an app analytics company.



These organizations are challenged to keep up with the demand of change requests to IT systems and services. The problem is the current workload, what is referred to as a “keeping the lights on” (KTLO) focus. This creates a backlog of projects that slows down innovation. We’re currently helping our customer with the Upskilling, Retooling, and Restructuring of their teams as they focus on a number of strategic initiatives that Advance Agility for DLCs and Administrative Units, Enable the IT Community, and Advance Business Process Excellence. Engineers within these organizations are solving problems in distributed computing, infrastructure automation, big data, and data visualization. Their rapid growth challenges them to continually evolve how they manage their infrastructure as they roll out new application services.



Here are some of the engineers we are currently looking for:



Cloud Platform - IaaS Engineer:


- Extensive experience with at least one of the following Cloud APIs : OpenStack, vCloud Air, vSphere, or AWS


- Strong Ruby or Python scripting experience


- Software-defined networking experience 



Cloud Platform - Automation Engineer:


- Extensive experience working with Puppet (modules, roles, profiles); ideally automating OS 


- Redhat Enterprise Linux v6 or greater administration, tuning, life-cycle management


- Strong Ruby or Python scripting experience



Cloud Platform - Operations


-Must have Linux Systems Admin. Puppet configuarion. Apache. SSL administrator


-VMware and VMsphere is a plus/ Comfort level with coding


-Systems Admin background is ideal. Must have great comm skills


Cloud Platforms - Identity & Access Management
-Looking for experience implementing the following authentication protocols (with preferred implementations in parentheses): Kerberos/GSSAPI (MIT, Heimdal, AD), SAML (Shibboleth), OAuth, OpenID
-Requires working knowledge of two or more programming languages: C or C++ and one or more of Python, Java, Perl, or PL/SQL
- Solid understanding of UNIX concepts and standard UNIX APIs


Cloud Platforms – Implementation
-Pilot testing for new on premise and Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) applications.
-Working understanding of public cloud platforms, both infrastructure as a service (Amazon AWS) and platform as a service, i.e. Heroku, preferred.
-Experience supporting RESTful web APIs.
-Experience supporting SOAP-based APIs.
-Experience supporting SAML and OAuth2 authentication protocols.


Requirements



  • Manage our deployments, testing, and continuous integration infrastructure

  • Develop and maintain the infrastructure automation

  • 4+ years of experience running production web systems

  • Strong knowledge of Unix/Linux based systems

  • Experience working with cloud providers such as AWS or Azure

  • Ability to learn quickly and work independently

  • An understanding of OS and distributed systems concepts

  • Mastery of some of these software tools including git, Chef, Ruby, Ubuntu Linux, Amazon EC2, Munin, Monit, Jenkins, and MongoDB


You Might Be A Good Fit If You…



  • Have automated systems using Chef

  • Have automated web server and database deployments

  • Would rather automate than perform the same action manually many times

  • Are proficient in Ruby

  • Are proficient with GNU/Linux, particularly Ubuntu and CentOS

  • Are self directed and can identify areas for improvement in the infrastructure

  • Are obsessed with high-availability

  • Believe in DevOps

  • Understand how to tweak Linux for performance

  • Understand operating systems and storage technologies like LVM, RAID, and file systems

  • Are proficient in a virtualized cloud environment

  • Enjoy reading about DevOps practices

item.title: Full Stack Web Developer at Crowdcomfort (Boston, MA)
item.description:
This is your opportunity to join an exciting startup, which was named to the top 5 startups in Boston by MassTLC, at the right time in our growth story. We are simply looking for smart and talented developers who are up for a unique challenge that involves iOT, Indoor Positioning, Real-time Notification and many more.


At CrowdComfort, we improve building operations while improving improving customer satisfaction. We achieve this by unlocking the human sensor network through a number of easy to use mobile apps and reporting platforms. At CrowdComfort you will dive in bleeding edge technologies which will challenge you and help you build products that truly change the way people interact with buildings. 


If you are not afraid to dive head first into new technologies and technical concepts please apply


Responsibilities:



  • Lead the development team and build cohesion to ensure smooth progress of development activities across all platforms and all assets (Web App, Android and iOS)

  • Own all REST interfaces

  • Own the data structures used by all assets

  • Ensure all assets are in optimal and independent development tracks

  • Work closely with the PM and UX team to build high quality apps to fit the ultimate vision of CrowdComfort

  • Perform code reviews and document development and data structure guidelines

  • Troubleshoot and debug issues

  • Provide client and implementation support where needed

  • Manage the AWS environment

  • Follow and adhere to a release schedule


Qualifications:



  • Five years in multi-platform mobile development

  • Two years experience developing RESTful APIs

  • Preferably 2 years of experience launching SaaS solutions with mobile and reporting components

  • At least 1 year of working in a completely hosted environment, preferably on AWS

  • Reasonable familiarity with enterprise security standards in particular OWASP top 10

  • Strong background in secure server-side and client-side development

item.title: Principal Software Engineer (Service Owner - myBBC ID) at BBC (London, UK)
item.description:
myBBC is a new and high profile programme designed to make the BBC online experience feel personal and relevant to our audience, encouraging them to view, listen to, or play with our content; be that content they know and love, or content we help them discover. It’s basically about content!


As Tony Hall, Director General of the BBC, said; “it's the start of a real transformation – the myBBC revolution. How to reinvent public service broadcasting through data. But we will always be doing it in a BBC way – not telling you what customers like you bought, but what citizens like you would love to watch and need to know.”


Sounds exciting, eh?


So, what will you do on a daily basis, to help make a difference to the delivery and continuous development of the myBBC product? Glad you asked…


Service owners play a key role in our engineering function providing whole life technical ownership of our development. Working closely with Product Leads the Service Owners you’ll ensure that development is consistent with our world class quality values and total cost of ownership concerns.


You will initially work with our 3rd party supplier to establish this new service, whilst concurrently recruiting and forming the longer term team that will further develop and support the IDL.


You’ll also:



  • Support product management with stakeholder engagement, evangelizing the benefits of the service

  • Own and drive technical service innovation, while delivering end to end engineering excellence

  • Ensure the compliance of delivered product with functional and non-functional requirements

  • Manage/oversee a mutli-disciplinary scrum team(s)

  • Manage releases and the service transition to live

  • Oversee the full operational lifecycle, including sunset as applicable


You’ll also keep up to date with developments in the field that may be advantageous to your own delivery. As well as help and coach other team members as you see fit.

item.title: Logistics and Operations Software Engineer at Good Eggs (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
What we’re building:


The Good Eggs operations and logistics team builds the platform that empowers our entire supply chain, from the tools that help our producers know what and when to make products, to the software and hardware that manages the flow of food through our warehouse and delivery network. Our systems go beyond the screen, and include mobile and hardware platforms that help our associates deliver food faster than anyone else in the industry.


How you can help:


We're looking for engineers who are interested in a multidisciplinary engineering environment, and who are excited by building high-scale software that interfaces with equipment and displays on the floor. As an engineer on our team, you'll be responsible for the architecture, design, development, and testing of new tools and equipment we are developing to streamline the process.


How we work:


We run a mature Agile engineering process complete with test-driven development, pair programming and continuous deployment of features throughout the day. Our core platform is built on Node.js, MongoDB, AngularJS, and CoffeeScript. We're in the process of expanding into new domains, including iOS application development and software that runs on embedded devices in our hub (IoT). Don't worry if you haven't done it all: we are happy to train the right person to work in this environment.

item.title: Software Engineer at Amazon (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Why are Software Engineers important at Amazon?
At Amazon, we hire the best minds in technology to innovate and build for the benefit of our customers. That intense focus on customers is why we are one of the world’s most beloved brands – it’s part of our company DNA.

Our challenges are big - impacting millions of Consumers, Sellers, Content Creators, and Developers & Enterprises through countless products – and we are searching for a certain kind of person who is excited by the idea of owning; people who like to build new platforms, features and services from scratch, developers who can manage the ambiguity and pace of a company whose ship cycles are measured in weeks, not years.

We speak multiple languages, working on multiple platforms to solve immensely complex challenges in large-scale computing by using your skills in data structures, algorithms, and object oriented programming. We have a variety of teams to choose from; our opportunities are broader than you might think. You could find yourself working on a small development team in one of our many organizations: Advertising, Amazon Customer Service, Amazon Web Services, Business & Corporate Development, Digital Entertainment, eCommerce Platform, Fulfillment and Operations, Global Corporate Teams, Amazon Devices, Retail, Search and Discovery Technology, Seller Services, or Amazon Subsidiaries.
Amazon is a place where builders build.


What are examples of work that Software Engineers are doing at Amazon?


· Powered companies from Netflix to NASA: Amazon Web Services has provided companies of all sizes with an infrastructure platform in the cloud that powers hundreds of thousands of businesses in 190 countries around the world. Here at AWS, you’ll experience unparalleled ownership and impact on our product development, and be empowered to innovate and deliver.



· Built the Amazon Devices experience: We have gone beyond Kindle, our best-selling e-reader to our powerhouse Fire tablets, built for work and play with our Fire OS operating system. For streaming media lovers, we have created Amazon Fire TV and Fire TV Stick with voice search, massive video selection, and gaming. Exploring new solutions with products such as Amazon Echo, a new category of device designed around your voice with far-field voice recognition, and Amazon Dash, a handheld scanner to help you order groceries from Amazon Fresh.



· We help users find what they want: Amazon Search and Discovery helps hundreds of millions of shoppers spending tens of billions of dollars annually find what they want, get what they need, and discover what they'll love. We are innovators who love to experiment and are obsessed with letting customers tell us what works. We are obsessed with automation, and leverage technologies and massive amounts of data and machine learning to delight our customers. Work on Prime Air, Prime Now, or other customer solutions to help us define the future.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Sorenson Media (Draper, UT)
item.description:
We are looking for a team player.  We are not looking for a rock star or ninja.  We succeed as a team.  We are looking for a self-driven, world-class software engineer seeking excellence to contribute to the design and development of a varied and sophisticated application—the glue in a system to ingest, process, store, and deliver large amounts of data.


Our team is a high-functioning, agile team strictly adhering to the scrum process. We are self-organized and peer-based. We prioritize technical debt, technical improvements, and bugs—not just features. We highly value testing. We work on concise stories with unambiguous acceptance criteria.  Our executives understand the impact of mid-sprint interruptions and allow us to focus on producing world-class technical solutions.


You will be collaborating closely with data engineers and video engineers to ensure that the system satisfies requirements and is robust and scalable.  You will have significant influence in deciding which technologies are chosen throughout the system.  We are confident you will find satisfaction working with our team to bring innovative technologies to fruition.

item.title: Technical Principal at ThoughtWorks (London, UK)
item.description:
ThoughtWorks is synonymous with innovation. We’re a diverse community of bright and passionate individuals striving to have a positive impact on the world. We’re dedicated to the art of software delivery, by keeping it lightweight, agile and open-source. Our clients are organisations with ambitious missions, where we deliver complex enterprise systems to help them solve their toughest business problems. As a Principal Consultant at ThoughtWorks you have total responsibility for technical delivery on a client engagement so you are likely to have extensive experience.


As a Principal Consultant, here’s what you can do at ThoughtWorks: 



  • Disrupt, Lead and Innovate.

  • Take the needs and challenges of a client and formulate the technical roadmap and technology solution that will support their business strategies and goals.

  • Provide Technical leadership across all areas of the enterprise, to ensure delivery of exceptional technical solutions

  • Formulate and articulate the technical and political implication of real world solutions

  • Orchestrate the management of technology scope and risks

  • Mentor on approach and execution of solutions, coach on technologies and establishing a team wide comprehension of solution capabilities and direction

  • Ensure technical expectations of deliverables are met

  • Drive ThoughtWorks’ Thought-Leadership on engineering and architectural practices and standards

  • Be an inspiration of innovation to the client

  • Become a trusted and valued partner of the client CIO/CTO and team

  • Exploit opportunities for networking and relationship building that arise out of delivery activities

  • Creates and supports sales activities

  • Maintaining strong expertise and knowledge of current and emerging technologies and products

  • Code! We don’t subscribe to the “post-technical” ivory tower leadership style



We work almost exclusively on customer site providing a mix of delivery and consulting services, so you’ll be flexible about travel. 



We offer amazing benefits from the day you start including private medical insurance, travel insurance, income protection, critical illness, life assurance, pension scheme, child care vouchers, personal development budget, 25 days holiday and a ride2work scheme.



To apply please submit your CV and tell us why you want to join ThoughtWorks. One of our recruiters will be in touch.


At ThoughtWorks we promote diversity in all its forms and reject discrimination and inequality. We proudly, passionately and actively strive to make both ThoughtWorks and our industry more reflective and inclusive of the society that we serve

item.title: Senior Database Developer (Oracle PL/SQL) at Fidelity (Cary, NC)
item.description:
Fidelity Charitable (FC) - http://www.fidelitycharitable.org - is an independent 501(c)(3) public charity that administers a donor-advised fund.  Donors to Fidelity Charitable (FC) benefit from an immediate tax deduction and the ability to support their favorite charities on a flexible timetable.  Since 1991, Fidelity Charitable has introduced tens of thousands of donors to the benefits — and increased charitable impact — of using a donor-advised fund to meet their philanthropic goals.  To date, donors have recommended more than $14 billion in grants to over 160,000 nonprofit organizations, making Fidelity Charitable one of America's leading public charities. Primary Responsibilities



  • Understand business needs & processes, design, document, develop, and implement Oracle (PL/SQL), Informatica applications in a dynamic financial services environment. 

  • Lead distributed development teams across US, Ireland. Ability to be hands-on when needed.

  • Contribute to or write concise and clear technical systems design documents based on the analysis of complex business requirements

  • Monitor progress, work quality and risk of the projects; escalate situations needing management attention

  • Take ownership of the technology deliverables and provide leadership needed to complete a project of the highest quality, on time and within budget

  • Share written and spoken information in a way that is understood by those needing the information: able to tell the story with different audiences [business, technology, stake holders etc.].

  • Work closely with other partnering teams.

item.title: Engineering Manager, .NET at New Relic (Portland, OR)
item.description:
Our .NET Agent team is looking for someone with a passion for building amazing software that makes developers’ lives easier. Our team needs a caring creator to help grow and support our whip-smart agent engineers. Our agent powers New Relic’s software analytics products used to monitor thousands of applications. Programming agents is fun, challenging, rewarding, and kinda crazy.  We're passionate about wowing our users with visibility they never thought possible. 


As the manager of the team you'd be focused on creating the collaborative, creative, and purpose-filled environment, which makes these innovations possible. You will provide the technical leadership to help define and deliver New Relic’s products for Microsoft .NET users around the world. For us, technical leadership includes talking directly with customers and building connections with developer communities that our customers rely on to build their web apps, as well as managing the design, scope, direction, features, and quality within our .NET Agent.


To fast track your cover letter please tell us about a time you introduced positive change to your team, and why you want to join our fun dynamic company.

item.title: Cloud Systems Engineer at mParticle (Boca Raton, FL) (allows remote)
item.description:
We are looking for a skilled Cloud Systems Engineer who will be responsible for supporting our growing application infrastructure. The candidate will be responsible for maintaining strict production SLAs of a custom distributed application running on AWS cloud infrastructure, monitoring, alerting, incident management, SOP, capacity planning, change management, security, and overall platform stability and improvement.
 
The ideal candidate will have a deep technical understanding of Linux operating systems and at least an intermediate understanding of Windows operating systems, strong experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS), advanced scripting skills, experience with variety of monitoring solutions, deep understanding of network communications and excellent troubleshooting skills.


Finally, we are seeking someone who wants to be a major contributor in a small, dynamic work environment, loves a challenge, and has a strong balance of technical and people skills.
 
The Cloud Systems Engineer will be responsible for:



  • Maintain, monitor, and improve the performance and availability of the 24x7 production environment including networks, servers, databases, etc.

  • Participate in on-call rotation and provide hands-on support during emergencies, outages, and service transitions.

  • Define and monitor compliance to production environment SLAs.

  • Participate in creating long-term and short term strategies for scaling the production environment.

  • Adhere to a comprehensive incident management program including problem management.

  • Generate KPIs for service availability, uptime, and adherence to SOPs, and SLAs.

item.title: Looking for New Talent! C++ (Associate) Developer for the SAP HANA database team at SAP SE (Walldorf, Deutschland)
item.description:
COMPANY DESCRIPTION

SAP is the global market leader for business software and thus contributes a considerable part of the world's economic power grid. At SAP you get your chance to put your ideas into action with maximum impact.The SAP HANA in-memory database is the basis for new, ground-breaking SAP applications and is widely agreed to be a highly valuable asset in the SAP software portfolio. In-memory computing is made possible through recent technology advances in main memory, multi-core processing, and data management. It leverages technology innovation to establish real-time analysis of business data and combines both transactions and analytics to improve existing business processes with a dramatic increase in performance. The SAP HANA in-memory database as basis for the in-memory computing shows enormous promise as a key driver for SAP market of the future. The development of the SAP HANA in-memory database is distributed over all continents. You will be part of the development team in Walldorf with more than 100 exceptionally talented and motivated colleagues. We live code development in a flexible and agile way. You will be part of small and self-organized groups of developer.

EXPECTATIONS AND TASKS

We seek for developers with strong focus in C++ system or application programming. The main task of the job is to drive and implement development topic as part of a development team inside the core of the SAP HANA in-memory database. You can expect to work on some of the following tasks:
- Write meticulous software implementations in classical main memory database areas such as compression algorithms, distribution algorithms or query processing as well as in domain specific extensions like processing of geo spatial information, graph processing, hierarchical information processing or database programming languages
- Write basic regression tests for your own code using different programming languages (e.g. C++, Python, SQL) and testing frameworks (e.g. Google C++ Testing Framework)
- Do code reviews and code audits to spot opportunities for improvements with respect to usability, testability, supportability, or potential performance penalties

WORK EXPERIENCE

- 0 - 2 years
- We are looking for candidates who are committed to a technology career path. Your set of application documents should contain a cover letter and CV, copies of the obtained degrees and references

EDUCATION AND QUALIFICATION / SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES

Required skills:
- Strong C++ programming skills
- University degree in computer science or related technical discipline
- Basic knowledge on relational database management systems
- Excellent German and English both spoken and written
- Willingness to analyze and debug complex problems
- Good communication skills Preferred skills:
- Experience in Administration, Programming or Profiling on Linux
- Knowledge of code-analysis tools e.g. Valgrind, Intel Amplifier, Cppchecker
- Experience with continuous integration concepts and tools e.g. Git, Gerrit
- Python or Shell-Scripting programming skills
- Working experience in the area of system or application programming with C++ (eg. internship or working student experience)
- Knowledge in architecture of relational database management systems101014132

item.title: Lead/Senior .NET Developer (Full Stack) at Frontpoint (Vienna, VA)
item.description:
Are you seeking the freedom to creatively solve interesting problems while also engineering something that genuinely makes a difference? Join the company that brought technological advancement to the home security industry!


We’re looking for a Lead/Senior .NET web developer to join our rapidly growing development team. This is a fast paced, enterprise scale, B2C environment. Our developers build software for all components of the organization. This involves heavy front-end web development for systems that are both internally and externally facing, integration with back-end third party APIs, analytical services, & tons of data. We use the latest versions of all our tools and do our best to keep up with the rapid evolution of JavaScript and other front-end frameworks. If you like a start-up culture without the start-up risk, you’ll love working at Frontpoint!


Responsibilities



  • Perform & lead development of complex software applications

  • Write tons of code across the full stack – front end Web UI, middle tier service layer, and back end database

  • Perform analysis of requirements and design

  • Create and execute unit tests and perform basic systems testing

  • Participate in peer code reviews and technical meetings

  • Mentor engineers in coding practices and process

  • Work in an Agile Scrum team process, collaborating closely with fellow developers, DBAs, QA, team leads, and stakeholders

  • Troubleshoot and support system and application problems

item.title: Software Development Engineer at Amazon (Dublin, Ireland)
item.description:
At Amazon Web Services, we run one of the largest networks in the world. We are taking all the industry trends and blending them into the critical foundation of utility computing: the network. Our goal is to become the infrastructure platform for the world and our team will make the bones of the platform “the network”, work flawlessly. Not only supporting Amazon.com at the global level, but amazing global companies. (http://aws.amazon.com/solutions/case-studies/all/).



Amazon Networking is looking for senior software engineers to build a platform to manage thousands of network devices; providing significantly improved control, visibility and predictability for Amazon’s global network. Our goal is to eliminate human intervention and errors from network engineering, network build and device management by building tools and systems to successfully manage thousands of heterogeneous devices in dozens of data centers across the world.



ROLE

You are interested in being part of a high-bar team with global responsibility for network automation software used across all of Amazon’s businesses. You are interested in solving difficult software problems at massive scale. You want to talk to customers directly and design solutions that solve their problems through innovation and automation. You understand how to build software in a continuous integration and continuous deployment environment. You are interested in working autonomously and owning your own code from requirements to launch and for supporting it in the field. You enjoy solving challenging problems and working in a fast-paced, flexible, collaborative team environment.

· Strong customer orientation with ability to work directly with customer/product owner to define requirements and the associated acceptance criteria for user stories.

· Excellent software development skills, preferably in Python or Perl with Java, C/C++, Ruby acceptable as a substitute.

· Experience working in an Agile/Scrum development team with solid understand of the principles of continuous integration (CI), continuous deployment and test driven development (TDD).

· Excellent problem solving and troubleshooting skills with the ability to apply design patterns to common software problems and define dimensions of a solution including robustness, scale and maintainability.

· Strong communications skills both written and verbal are required for this role. The ability to present complex ideas in a convincing and understandable manner are a key requirement.

· Demonstrated ability to work in a team environment and as part of a cross-functional team with the ability to influence others as a senior technical contributor.

· Ability to mentor more junior software developers in best practice with demonstrated capability to maintain architectural vision and software quality during the implementation cycle.

· Knowledge of and previous development experience in a Linux or UNIX environment with a good understanding of networking concepts.

· 5+ years of industry experience in core product development, building production quality software.

· A solid grounding in Computer Science fundamentals, data structures, algorithms and deftness at object-oriented design and systems architecture: a bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science (or equivalent) is required.



· Certified Scrum Master Certification is a plus.

· Familiarity with networking protocols (OSPF, BGP, HSRP/GLBP, IPSEC/VPNs, DNS, HTTP).

· Familiarity with SOA design principles include orchestration and RESTful Interface definition.

item.title: Software Engineer - Java Back End Development at Tillster, Inc. (San Diego, CA)
item.description:
Software Engineer - Java Backend Development (Mid to Senior level) 



RELOCATION ASSISTANCE AVAILABLE


RIGHT TO WORK IN US REQUIRED.  WILL TRANSFER EXISTING H1-B



We are a successful and well-funded growth company in beautiful, sunny, San Diego, CA with sub-offices in Los Angeles and Alpharetta, GA. Due to continued company growth we are looking to hire some key Java Developers to join our growing team. You will have 5+ years or more of overall Java Engineering experience to join our Enterprise Ordering Systems group. You’ll be engaged in hands-on coding, managing process, procedure and projects.

item.title: Software Engineering Manager at Amazon (Atlanta, GA)

item.title: Software Engineer at Amazon (Austin, TX)
item.description:
Why are Software Engineers important at Amazon?
At Amazon, we hire the best minds in technology to innovate and build for the benefit of our customers. That intense focus on customers is why we are one of the world’s most beloved brands – it’s part of our company DNA.

Our challenges are big - impacting millions of Consumers, Sellers, Content Creators, and Developers & Enterprises through countless products – and we are searching for a certain kind of person who is excited by the idea of owning; people who like to build new platforms, features and services from scratch, developers who can manage the ambiguity and pace of a company whose ship cycles are measured in weeks, not years.

We speak multiple languages, working on multiple platforms to solve immensely complex challenges in large-scale computing by using your skills in data structures, algorithms, and object oriented programming. We have a variety of teams to choose from; our opportunities are broader than you might think. You could find yourself working on a small development team in one of our many organizations: Advertising, Amazon Customer Service, Amazon Web Services, Business & Corporate Development, Digital Entertainment, eCommerce Platform, Fulfillment and Operations, Global Corporate Teams, Amazon Devices, Retail, Search and Discovery Technology, Seller Services, or Amazon Subsidiaries.
Amazon is a place where builders build.


What are examples of work that Software Engineers are doing at Amazon?


· Powered companies from Netflix to NASA: Amazon Web Services has provided companies of all sizes with an infrastructure platform in the cloud that powers hundreds of thousands of businesses in 190 countries around the world. Here at AWS, you’ll experience unparalleled ownership and impact on our product development, and be empowered to innovate and deliver.



· Built the Amazon Devices experience: We have gone beyond Kindle, our best-selling e-reader to our powerhouse Fire tablets, built for work and play with our Fire OS operating system. For streaming media lovers, we have created Amazon Fire TV and Fire TV Stick with voice search, massive video selection, and gaming. Exploring new solutions with products such as Amazon Echo, a new category of device designed around your voice with far-field voice recognition, and Amazon Dash, a handheld scanner to help you order groceries from Amazon Fresh.



· We help users find what they want: Amazon Search and Discovery helps hundreds of millions of shoppers spending tens of billions of dollars annually find what they want, get what they need, and discover what they'll love. We are innovators who love to experiment and are obsessed with letting customers tell us what works. We are obsessed with automation, and leverage technologies and massive amounts of data and machine learning to delight our customers. Work on Prime Air, Prime Now, or other customer solutions to help us define the future.

item.title: Senior Test Automation Engineer - Atlanta / Alpharetta at Intelligrated Software (Alpharetta, GA)
item.description:
This position will be responsible for the development and support of automation applications. Responsible for applying expertise in tools and methodologies to develop the requirements, procedures and guidelines for the automation testing efforts of all Intelligrated software applications prior to deployment to ensure they are performing according to specifications and are free of errors. This includes defining the automation test plan and strategy, testing environment, scenarios, creating/modifying scripts and data required, executing tests, and reporting on findings. Also responsible for organizing the resources necessary to prepare and execute tests and reporting back to the development team on issues to be addressed as required. This may include automation of testing processes, and the identification and management of testing tools and standards.  In addition this person will:



  • Work with development to ensure their code and the test automation code will interact efficiently together

  • Be responsible and accountable for one or more of the major components of the test automation framework; this will include the design, development, delivery, maintenance and evolution of these components

  • Develop and maintain test script requirements

  • Review broken scripts for suites and resolves/fixes them

  • Identifies vulnerabilities in automated testing and defines and manages plans to mitigate risk

  • Deliver project assignments on time, within budget and with high quality

  • Participate in the automation feasibility analysis for new systems/applications

  • Propose the acquisition of new testing tools to management

  • Participate in the Agile software development cycle, including meetings, iterative development, estimations and design sessions

  • Create the automation test plan for a project, conceiving of the testing strategy and approach

  • Be responsible for the creation of all project level automation test plans, detailed test plan, or phase level plans such as component, system, integration or user acceptance test plan
